            Associate Account Executive



         Login to apply
    
















Associate Account Executive
Salt Lake City, UT 


This entry level opportunity as an Associate Account Executive will work to effectively develop a multi-state territory through cold calling prospects, developing a solid sales pipeline and closing sales deals.
Responsibilities include:

Lead generation and qualification
Fielding, qualifying and closing inbound sale inquires
Prospecting and telephone marketing for new prospect clients
Creating, tracking, closing and reporting results of sales opportunities in yCRM
Learn and master company software product offerings
Conducting online presentations and product demonstrations
Communicating via phone and email correspondence with prospective clients
Nurturing sales opportunities through the entire sales cycle to close
Providing information and generating interest in conference participation and other related events
Managing weekly/monthly activity to support sales goals
Work effectively with other teams that support the sales process and client satisfaction 

This position will require the following background and skills: 

Bachelor’s degree
Ability to do high volume cold calls and develop leads
Ability to generate a sales pipeline and close sales
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Superior phone skills
Technical aptitude and the ability to successfully demonstrate software
Ability to show product features and benefits
High level of professionalism and ethics
Ability to manage multiple priorities in a fast paced environment
A background in software sales, web ads sales, accounting systems, or experience in the property management industry highly desirable but not required

 *eo 



         Login to apply

By continuing to browse this site you agree to our use of cookies. You can find out more about which cookies we are using or switch them off in settings.
 

 
Accept

 


















 

 Privacy Overview


 Strictly Necessary Cookies


 3rd Party Cookies




 








Privacy Overview

This website uses cookies so that we can provide you with the best user experience possible. Cookie information is stored in your browser and performs functions such as recognising you when you return to our website and helping our team to understand which sections of the website you find most interesting and useful.
You can adjust all of your cookie settings by navigating the tabs on the left hand side.



 
Strictly Necessary Cookies

Strictly necessary cookies must be enabled at all times in order to login and apply to openings.



disable









If you disable this cookie, we will not be able to save your preferences and you will not be able to login to apply for openings. This means that every time you visit this website you will need to enable or disable cookies again.







3rd Party Cookies

This website uses Google Analytics to collect anonymous information such as the number of visitors to the site, and the most popular pages.
Keeping this cookie enabled helps us to improve our website.



disable









Please enable Strictly Necessary Cookies first so that we can save your preferences!

If you’re ready to take on a fresh challenge, grow your career and contribute to making the world a safer place, Raytheon is ready to help you achieve your goals. Join our team and get the opportunity and support to find purpose, thrive and succeed.





Notice: Please be aware of suspicious recruiting emails and text messages that attempt to collect your confidential information. Raytheon conducts all electronic correspondence using e-mail addresses that end in “Raytheon.com”, “Raytheon.co.uk”, “Raytheon.com.au” or “brassring.com”. To report fraud please go to: https://www.ic3.gov.











Sr Systems Administrator II
Pasadena, California


Apply





Overview
Responsibilities
Success Profile
Rewards
Trending




Overview

What does it take to make the world a safer place? It takes delivering innovative technology and collaborating with some of the finest talent in the engineering field. Whether you’re a software engineer or a mechanical engineer, at Raytheon you’ll grow a varied and rewarding career. And you’ll be supported with a comprehensive and competitive benefits package that promotes work/life. If you’re ready to take on today’s big challenges, discover a world of opportunity at Raytheon.

America’s Best Large Employers by Forbes
Career & Development Opportunities
Full-time
Entry, Mid, Senior level




Back to Job Navigation (Overview)


Responsibilities


Overview:  Raytheon Pasadena is looking for a for a software engineer who has experience in Big Data to work on exciting projects with our JPL/NASA customer.Description:  The successful candidate will help to design, build and maintain our automated data workflows/pipelines and introduce industry's leading technologies. Responsibilities include, but are not limited to: The opportunity to play an integral part in developing system capabilities in all phases of the development life cycle Assisting in system development Assisting in enforcement of data governance and provenance policies, and procedures Assisting in writing of quality standards and supporting documentationSecurity Clearance:  Clearance is not required for this positionNo Visa SponsorshipEducation / Work Experience: Bachelors' degree or higher in Computer Science and minimum of 6 years of experienceRequired Skills: 3 years developing on Python, Java, C++ or object oriented programmingKnowledge of Configuration Management Tool (e.g Git, SVN)Experience with large data setsExperience in database design, development and data modeling.Excellent understanding of the formal software engineering processDesired Skills:  Exposure to Amazon Web Services (AWS) such as EC2, Lambda, EMR, Route53, Jenkins, Docker, HadoopNoSQL: AWS DynamoDB, Cassandra, MongoDBUnderstanding of network protocols, e.g., TCP/UDP.Familiarity with RESTful APIsExperience practicing Agile methodologiesHighly motivated, able to work in a fast-paced environment as part of a larger teamWork Location:The successful candidate will be required to work in Pasadena CA.This position requires a U.S. Person who is eligible to obtain any required Export Authorization. 150589
Business Unit Profile
                        
                        Raytheon Intelligence, Information and Services delivers innovative technology to make the world a safer place. Our expertise in cyber, analytics and automation allow us to reach beyond what others think is possible to underpin national security and give our global customers unique solutions to solve the most pressing modern challenges -- from the cyber domain to automated operations, and from intelligent transportation and training solutions to creating clear insight from large volumes of data. IIS operates at nearly 550 sites in 80 countries, and is headquartered in Dulles, Virginia. The business area generated $6.2 billion in 2018 revenues. As a global business, our leaders must have the ability to understand, embrace and operate in a multicultural world -- in the marketplace and the workplace. We strive to hire people who reflect our communities and embrace diversity and inclusion to advance our culture, develop our employees, and grow our business.
Relocation Eligible 
                        
                        No
Clearance Type 
                        
                        None / Not Required
Expertise 
                        

                                
                            Aerospace/Aeronautical EngineeringAtmospheric/Space ScienceCloud ComputingComputer ScienceComputer/Management Information SystemsData ScienceInformation and Knowledge SystemsSoftware EngineeringSystems Engineering
                        
                        

Type Of Job 
                        
                        Full Time

Work Location 
                        
 
                            
                            CA - Pasadena
                        
Raytheon is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, age, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected Veteran status.

Back to Job Navigation (Success)


Quote



Felicia Jackson is regional vice president of RAYVETS, Raytheon's employee group for veterans and those who support them. After 24 years in the Air Force, she started a new career at Raytheon. "I wanted to go where people would support me," she told us.









Rewards




401(k) / Retirement Plans
Employer Matching, if you elect to enroll company matches up to 3%.



Work / Life Balance
Raytheon supports a variety of flexible work arrangements including compressed work weeks, flextime, job sharing, 9/80, reduced hours and telecommuting.



Career Development
At Raytheon, we foster an inclusive culture of professional development. We support a variety of developmental opportunities including: Mentoring programs, Skills Development, Leadership Development, Rotational job assignments, and Continuous Improvement, all of which contribute to advancement of our employee’s capabilities.



Paid Time Off
Accrue paid time off monthly. Receive 10-12 holidays per year with some locations shutting down the week between Christmas and New Year’s Day.



Relocation Assistance
Select technical positions are eligible for relocation packages. See specific job description for eligibility requirements.



Parental Leave
Raytheon offers all eligible employees up to three weeks paid parental leave for the birth or adoption of a child (separate from paid maternity leave or Family & Medical Leave Act).

            Accounts Receivable Analyst



         Login to apply
    
















Accounts Receivable Analyst
Austin, TX 


Reporting to the Finance Manager, the Accounts Receivable Analyst is responsible for managing an assigned portfolio of accounts.  This includes collections duties, analysis, and relationship management.  Direct interaction with internal departments is a key function of this position.  To be successful in this position, this individual needs to have a positive attitude, a team player mentality, and be able to work with a diverse group of customers and staff.
Responsibilities

Manage open receivables within assigned portfolio in support of department DSO goal
Soft, collaborative collections approach on past due receivables
Review overpayments and resolve as necessary with the client
Responsible for customer account reconciliation
Establish both internal and external relationships
Ability to work across multiple platforms aligned with receivables
Other duties as assigned, or as may become required of the position

Requirements

Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Accounting or similar field of study
3+ years Accounts Receivable and/or general accounting experience
Excellent interpersonal skills
Ability to adapt to consistent and evolving change
Advanced proficiency with Microsoft Office software, especially Excel
Strong time management skills and the ability to multitask
Analytical and problem- solving skills
Organizational skills
Attention to detail and accuracy
Effective communication skills; both written and verbal

Regular attendance and a regular work schedule is an essential function of this job


*ft
  



         Login to apply

By continuing to browse this site you agree to our use of cookies. You can find out more about which cookies we are using or switch them off in settings.
 

 
Accept

 


















 

 Privacy Overview


 Strictly Necessary Cookies


 3rd Party Cookies




 








Privacy Overview

This website uses cookies so that we can provide you with the best user experience possible. Cookie information is stored in your browser and performs functions such as recognising you when you return to our website and helping our team to understand which sections of the website you find most interesting and useful.
You can adjust all of your cookie settings by navigating the tabs on the left hand side.



 
Strictly Necessary Cookies

Strictly necessary cookies must be enabled at all times in order to login and apply to openings.



disable









If you disable this cookie, we will not be able to save your preferences and you will not be able to login to apply for openings. This means that every time you visit this website you will need to enable or disable cookies again.







3rd Party Cookies

This website uses Google Analytics to collect anonymous information such as the number of visitors to the site, and the most popular pages.
Keeping this cookie enabled helps us to improve our website.



disable









Please enable Strictly Necessary Cookies first so that we can save your preferences!

            Help Desk Specialist



         Login to apply
    
















Help Desk Specialist
Atlanta, GA 


As an IT Helpdesk Specialist you will be responsible for:

Responding to requests for technical assistance in person, via phone, or electronically
Installing software and updating hardware
Diagnosing and resolving technical hardware and software issues
Researching questions using available information resources
Advising users on appropriate actions
Following standard helpdesk procedures
Logging all helpdesk interactions
Administering helpdesk software
Re-directing problems to the appropriate resource 

The ideal candidate will possess the following skills and abilities:

3-5 years  of experience
Proficiency in Windows 7, Windows 8 and Microsoft Office
Basic Network Troubleshooting skills
PC Imaging
Familiar with mobile device (phone/tablet) setup and use
Excellent customer service skills
Ability to work outside normal business hours if required to include evenings and weekends

*lw        



         Login to apply

            Intern, Associate Technical Account Manager



         Login to apply
    
















Intern, Associate Technical Account Manager
Long Island, NY 


The Client Service Department’s internship program provides students with an introduction to real-world business practices through challenging tasks and fun activities.
Interns will be responsible for learning and executing the following:

Test and reproduce program/database issues – understand, identify, reproduce client reported issues and propose resolution
Create and maintain issues logs – enter and update client issues logs and cases through resolution
Report Writing – edit and/or create SQL, Crystal, and SSRS reports
Financial Tie Outs – understand and identify client reported issues and propose resolution
Quality Assurance – participate in ad hoc testing sessions to identify and report program bugs
Training – provide program application training to clients
Documentation – document client issues, resolution steps, processes, and training materials

Requirements for this internship are as follows:

Junior or Senior level status
Minimum GPA of 3.0
Current major in Business, Economics with an Accounting focus, Mathematics, Statistics and Computer Science
Ability to work a minimum of 15 hours per week
Client-centered commitment and focus
Ability to meet critical deadlines and prioritize multiple tasks in a fast-paced environment
Collegial, team-oriented disposition with the desire and ability to establish cooperative working relationships with employees at all levels within Yardi, outside of Yardi, and with clients
Ability to learn new concepts and Yardi programs
Ability to focus and deliver on tasks and goals without distraction
Ability to communicate effectively, cooperatively and persuasively (written and verbal communication)
Ability to treat all employees and clients with respect and dignity

                                                                                                                        *bd

Privacy Overview

This website uses cookies so that we can provide you with the best user experience possible. Cookie information is stored in your browser and performs functions such as recognising you when you return to our website and helping our team to understand which sections of the website you find most interesting and useful.
You can adjust all of your cookie settings by navigating the tabs on the left hand side.



 
Strictly Necessary Cookies

Strictly necessary cookies must be enabled at all times in order to login and apply to openings.



disable









If you disable this cookie, we will not be able to save your preferences and you will not be able to login to apply for openings. This means that every time you visit this website you will need to enable or disable cookies again.







3rd Party Cookies

This website uses Google Analytics to collect anonymous information such as the number of visitors to the site, and the most popular pages.
Keeping this cookie enabled helps us to improve our website.

            Intern



         Login to apply
    
















Intern
New York, NY 


The publishing team’s internship program provides students with an introduction to real-world business journalism. Students will gain published clips, professional experience and training in business-to-business journalism and will develop an understanding of how an editorial office works.
 
Responsibilites 

Writing daily news stories for Commercial Property Executive and Multi-Housing News on deadline
Writing features or trend stories as needed
Getting quotes and talking with high-level industry executives
Copy editing and proofreading
Working with the editors
Tracking down images and data
Participating in weekly editorial meetings
Covering industry events
Helping with special projects

 
Requirements 

Major in English, Journalism or Communications
Ability to meet deadlines and prioritize tasks
Detail oriented
Good writing and editing skills
Confidence to talk to industry executives and public relation member
Ability to work with multiple people on the team and across Yardi
Ability to communicate effectively and cooperatively
Familiarity with AP Style
Familiarity with WordPress a bonus

cl

            Sales Support Specialist



         Login to apply
    
















Sales Support Specialist
Santa Barbara, CA 


Under general supervision, the Sales Support Specialist is responsible for back-office support for the sales department. Responsibilities include creating and administering moderate to complex contracts that establish or renew business relationships with clients; updating contracts; working with the accounting and legal departments; updating information within the internal CRM system; providing customer support to internal departments and external clients.
 
Responsibilities

Assists in interpreting contracts, including contracts, license agreements, addenda, statements of work, and partnering agreements
Fields requests via the Sales Support queue for requests entered by clients and other departments requiring drafting, support, and/or other sales-related needs
Assists in setting up and correcting Sales Opportunity data within the CRM system
Maintains communication through the shared Sales Admin Outlook inbox for clients and intra- and interdepartmental teams
Provides back-up for answering sales 800 number calls
Drafts and reviews contracts and addenda for Yardi products using prescribed templates and guidelines
Reviews and analyzes contract content for appropriate terms, including legal and payment terms, to ensure compliance with appropriate laws, regulations, and corporate policies. Works with sales and legal to establish and/or monitor acceptable deviations in standard terms and conditions. Ensures proper approval and tracking of non-standard terms and conditions
Manages the approval/signing/processing of legal documents
Handles high-pressure contract deadlines with professionalism and collaboration
Completes license file audits to ensure accuracy of licenses/services provided to clients

Requirements

Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent experience
One plus (1+) years of contract or legal/sales support experience
Basic math skills (e.g., calculate fees, prorate credits)
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, including via phone
Solid grammar, spelling, and composition skills
High attention to detail and strong organizational skills
Ability to provide great customer service
Ability to read and interpret legal documents
Must be a motivated and an enthusiastic team player
Ability to meet critical deadlines and prioritize multiple tasks with frequent interruptions in a fast-paced environment
Ability to think critically to discern and understand legal and technological terminology
Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite is desired
Experience in legal/sales contracting and office administration highly desirable

*em

 Privacy Overview

Privacy Overview

This website uses cookies so that we can provide you with the best user experience possible. Cookie information is stored in your browser and performs functions such as recognising you when you return to our website and helping our team to understand which sections of the website you find most interesting and useful.
You can adjust all of your cookie settings by navigating the tabs on the left hand side.



 
Strictly Necessary Cookies

Strictly necessary cookies must be enabled at all times in order to login and apply to openings.



disable









If you disable this cookie, we will not be able to save your preferences and you will not be able to login to apply for openings. This means that every time you visit this website you will need to enable or disable cookies again.







3rd Party Cookies

This website uses Google Analytics to collect anonymous information such as the number of visitors to the site, and the most popular pages.
Keeping this cookie enabled helps us to improve our website.



disable









Please enable Strictly Necessary Cookies first so that we can save your preferences!












Enable All

Referral Development Manager  (99631) - CO - Inogen, Inc. Jobs








 














Home
Jobs




Referral Development Manager  (99631) - CO

Toggle navigation








Referral Development Manager  (99631) 

JobsLogin 












 RDM Sales CO, USA Full Time 



Email Me Similar Jobs Email Me This Job



ABOUT INOGEN Inogen was founded in 2001 to improve quality of life and increase freedom and independence for oxygen therapy users. Inogen is innovation in oxygen therapy. The Inogen mission is to improve freedom and independence for oxygen therapy patients through innovative products and services. Inogen is a manufacturer and Accredited Homecare Provider.
Inogen is focused on quality care, continuous improvement, and outstanding customer satisfaction. We are a stable, USA based company dedicated to providing an exciting and rewarding career to our employees. We completed a successful Initial Public Offering on the NASDAQ in 2014 and have demonstrated substantial growth over the last five years. Our work environment is casual yet high performing, and we are looking for seriously talented, motivated, and fast-paced professionals to join our team.
JOB DESCRIPTION 
The Referral Development Manager (RDM) calls on physicians and discharge planners, winning patient referrals for Inogen. Works to increase marketplace adoption of Inogen products, while exceeding customer expectations and providing a consistently high level of service. The RDM is an Inogen product and clinical applications expert and operates in close collaboration with other Referral Development Managers and the National Sales Director to achieve corporate sales objectives.
Key Competencies:
Procure new oxygen patient referrals to meet/exceed sales targets.
Represent/promote Inogen product and services to referral community.
Meet/exceed monthly sales call targets.
Deliver/set up equipment when necessary.
Keep detailed records of all sales activities and customer interactions.
Provide/execute territory sales plan, including strategic and tactical approaches that will result in successful outcomes.
Maintain regular and punctual attendance. 
Comply with all company policies and procedures. 
Assist with any other duties as assigned.
Do you possess these abilities?
Excellent presentation skills required.
Oxygen referral experience with proven track record required.
Must be a self-starter and deliver results with limited oversight.
Experience working with the 65+ demographic a plus.
Proven track record of successful team participation is required.
Successful experience in identifying new referral opportunities desired.
Must have strong work ethic.
Excellent oral and written communication skills required. 
Attention to detail is required. 
Effective conflict resolution. 
Analytical & problem-solving skills & ability to multi task. 
Solutions-oriented problem solver. 
Excellent planning, communication and organizational skills.
Requirements:
Associate degree in Sales, Technical, Business, Clinical, or related field of study, preferred. 
Clinical background/licensure (RT, RN), preferred.
2-3 years medical referral sales experience, required. 
Basic knowledge/proficiency in Microsoft Office, required.
A combination of training, education and experience that is equivalent to the qualifications listed above and that provides the required knowledge, skills, and abilities.
 
WHY INOGEN Inogen is a dynamic company that is not only focused on quality care of patients, but is also committed to being a top employer.  Each of Inogen' s offices have a casual culture that supports employees being responsible and developing professionals.
We offer competitive salaries and a robust benefit package:
Employee Stock Purchase Plan 401 (K) plan available for all employees Health, dental, vision insurance Flexible spending accounts and wellness discount program Life Insurance Long Term Disability Robust paid time off and 8 paid holidays Employee Assistance Program
See the Inogen Team in action:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dKoTMeJf5J4
 
Inogen Where we go to work hard to positively impact people's lives
 
Inogen is an equal opportunity employer.  We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other legally protected characteristics. The EEO is the Law poster and its supplement are available here: http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/ofccpost.htm; http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/OFCCP_EEO_Supplement_Final_JRF_QA_508c.pdf.  The pay transparency policy is available here: http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/pdf/EO13665_PrescribedNondiscriminationPostingLanguage_JRFQA508c.pdf. 
Inogen is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities.  If you need a reasonable accommodation because of a disability for any part of the employment process, please send an e-mail to recruiting@inogen.net or call (972) 616-5668 and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information.
 
 

Inogen, Inc.
https://inogen.applicantpro.com

If you’re ready to take on a fresh challenge, grow your career and contribute to making the world a safer place, Raytheon is ready to help you achieve your goals. Join our team and get the opportunity and support to find purpose, thrive and succeed.





Notice: Please be aware of suspicious recruiting emails and text messages that attempt to collect your confidential information. Raytheon conducts all electronic correspondence using e-mail addresses that end in “Raytheon.com”, “Raytheon.co.uk”, “Raytheon.com.au” or “brassring.com”. To report fraud please go to: https://www.ic3.gov.











Principle Network Engineer
Dulles, Virginia


Apply





Overview
Responsibilities
Success Profile
Rewards
Trending




Overview

What does it take to make the world a safer place? It takes delivering innovative technology and collaborating with some of the finest talent in the engineering field. Whether you’re a software engineer or a mechanical engineer, at Raytheon you’ll grow a varied and rewarding career. And you’ll be supported with a comprehensive and competitive benefits package that promotes work/life. If you’re ready to take on today’s big challenges, discover a world of opportunity at Raytheon.

America’s Best Large Employers by Forbes
Career & Development Opportunities
Full-time
Entry, Mid, Senior level




Back to Job Navigation (Overview)


Responsibilities


Are you looking for an engineering career that is challenging and satisfying? Then join our Raytheon team of engineers solving problems that make the world a safer place and help to secure our great nation! Come support those who provide us with all the freedoms we enjoy.We offer great benefits that include medical, dental, vision, 401K match, flexible work schedule - just to name a few.  Click here to view a brief video and learn more: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qvbCgKpkEdsRaytheon Intelligence, Information and Services (IIS) delivers innovative technology to make the world a safer place. Our expertise in cyber, analytics and automation allow us to reach beyond what others think is possible to underpin national security and give our global customers unique solutions to solve the most pressing modern challenges -- from the cyber domain to automated operations, and from intelligent transportation solutions to creating clear insight from large volumes of data. IIS operates at nearly 550 sites in 80 countries, including a large presence in Dulles, VA. As a global business, our leaders must have the ability to understand, embrace and operate in a multicultural world -- in the marketplace and the workplace. We strive to hire people who reflect our communities and embrace diversity and inclusion to advance our culture, develop our employees, and grow our business.Job Description:The Raytheon IIS Hardware and Infrastructure Engineering (HW&I) team has a professional opening for a Principal Network Engineer. This position will perform network and infrastructure engineering tasks pertaining to LAN/data center system design, development, implementation, integration, and troubleshooting activities. The qualified individual should possess knowledge and experience with network technologies, services, operations, and security. The ability to obtain a US Government TS/SCI security clearance is required for this position (US citizenship required).Note: Candidates with a current TS/SCI Security Clearance or higher are eligible for up to a $40,000 sign on bonus if the clearance is confirmed and the candidate is hired by RaytheonRaytheon is seeking a Principal Network Engineer actively designing and troubleshooting corporate or cloud networks who feeds off the challenge of rolling up their sleeves to tackle meaningful problems each and every day, is a passionate and collaborative problem-solver who seeks and gives candid feedback, and values the chance to make an important impact.At least 8+ years of experience in leading network design, implementation and administrationStrong understanding of layer 2 technologies: VLAN segmentation, VLAN tagging, 802.1x authenticationStrong understanding of network routing (BGP, OSPF) and switching protocols, Cisco hardware routers and switches, hands on experience with Cisco Nexus switches.Deep knowledge of TCP/IP,  DNS, IPSec, GRE tunnels, multicasting and traffic balancing techniques.Expert knowledge of firewalls technologies including use of VPNsExperience with Load Balancers, F5 preferredDeep understanding of network security systems, intrusion detection systems and protocols including ISE, ACE, ACS, VPN, GRE, IPSEC, IKE, TACACS, RADIUS, ACLs, 802.1xAdvanced knowledge of DNS and DHCP and Microsoft AD infrastructureExperience in building/troubleshooting IPSec tunnels; understanding of IKEv1 vsIKEv2Strong communicator with the ability to work effectively across multiple business and engineering teamsExtensive background in planning and crafting projects and analyzing existing network systems and procedures for efficiency and effectivenessStrong analytical skills for interpreting business requirements and translating them into technical specificationsAdjust quickly to changing priorities and make quick decisions with limited informationHigh level of motivation, self-starter, ability to demonstrate effective project management and completion of complex network tasks with little guidanceExcellent time management skillsHighly valued skill sets:Experience in Python/Shell scriptingExperience with cloud technologies like AWSFamiliarity with systems configuration management, orchestration, and infrastructure as code with tools such as Ansible and/or TerraformCisco Unified Call ManagerSolar Winds suite of management productsMulticast & QoS protocolsCCIE or JNCIEEducation: Requires a degree in Science, Technology, Engineering or Mathematics (STEM) and 8 years of related work experience. 150708
Business Unit Profile
                        
                        Raytheon Intelligence, Information and Services delivers innovative technology to make the world a safer place. Our expertise in cyber, analytics and automation allow us to reach beyond what others think is possible to underpin national security and give our global customers unique solutions to solve the most pressing modern challenges -- from the cyber domain to automated operations, and from intelligent transportation and training solutions to creating clear insight from large volumes of data. IIS operates at nearly 550 sites in 80 countries, and is headquartered in Dulles, Virginia. The business area generated $6.2 billion in 2018 revenues. As a global business, our leaders must have the ability to understand, embrace and operate in a multicultural world -- in the marketplace and the workplace. We strive to hire people who reflect our communities and embrace diversity and inclusion to advance our culture, develop our employees, and grow our business.

Quote



Felicia Jackson is regional vice president of RAYVETS, Raytheon's employee group for veterans and those who support them. After 24 years in the Air Force, she started a new career at Raytheon. "I wanted to go where people would support me," she told us.









Rewards




401(k) / Retirement Plans
Employer Matching, if you elect to enroll company matches up to 3%.



Work / Life Balance
Raytheon supports a variety of flexible work arrangements including compressed work weeks, flextime, job sharing, 9/80, reduced hours and telecommuting.



Career Development
At Raytheon, we foster an inclusive culture of professional development. We support a variety of developmental opportunities including: Mentoring programs, Skills Development, Leadership Development, Rotational job assignments, and Continuous Improvement, all of which contribute to advancement of our employee’s capabilities.



Paid Time Off
Accrue paid time off monthly. Receive 10-12 holidays per year with some locations shutting down the week between Christmas and New Year’s Day.



Relocation Assistance
Select technical positions are eligible for relocation packages. See specific job description for eligibility requirements.



Parental Leave
Raytheon offers all eligible employees up to three weeks paid parental leave for the birth or adoption of a child (separate from paid maternity leave or Family & Medical Leave Act).

            Associate Technical Account Manager



         Login to apply
    
















Associate Technical Account Manager
Colorado Springs, CO 


The Associate Technical Account Manager is responsible for ensuring client satisfaction for assigned portfolios at a community and corporate contact level.  This role is responsible for training, support, problem solving, overseeing monthly production, and promoting additional services to clients as applicable.
Responsibilities

Training properties and clients on Yardi’s utility billing tool.
Ongoing support and follow-up with the community as well as the regional/corporate level to ensure the success of the billing program. 
Act as project manager for clients on all issue resolution and special project items, to include: regular interaction with other departments to coordinate resolution for clients.
Perform portfolio analysis of key performance indicators (KPIs) for their portfolios to determine areas of improvement to help ensure billing accuracy and increase revenues.  Analysis used to identify issues with properties and possible add-on services.
Ensures that each community and regional/corporate contact in their portfolios is satisfied with the billing program via the review and analysis of KPIs coupled with regular communications on findings with clients.
Assist portfolios to increase their performance (i.e. training on user interface(s), utilization of available reporting and functions, move ins/move outs, late notices).
Responsible for working with and supporting the Implementation Team to ensure the quality and consistency of the setup of their clients/properties within the billing system.
Responsible for owner/management changeover as well as cancellation processes for accounts within their portfolio.
Assist in coordinating and ensuring quality of all customized corporate reports. Responsible for sending to client and providing assistance with analysis.
Responsible for providing and coordinating Interdepartmental support concerning client issues and EDI implementations.
Responsible for assisting the Field Operation’s Department in ensuring a high level of performance with regards to the maintenance of systems within a portfolio.
Responsible for overseeing the monthly billing for assigned communities, entering cases and escalating client issues as appropriate.
Works closely with Legal when necessary to address client needs and concerns.

 
Requirements

High school diploma or equivalent
BA or BS preferred
Minimum of 3 years of experience in a fast-paced customer service environment, preferably in a technical, property management or other industry related field
PC literate: MS Excel, Word, PowerPoint and Outlook a must
Excellent command of the English language, i.e. grammar and vocabulary
Excellent presentation skills; presentation design preferred
Training experience an asset
Superb communication skills both verbally and in writing required
Familiarity with accounting and billing principles required
First-rate problem-solving skills and diplomacy essential
Strong detailed orientation and excellent organizational skills
Ability to work effectively in a high quality, deadline driven environment
Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to work effectively with a team
Regional/Property Management experience preferred
Yardi Voyager experience preferred

*ad        



         Login to apply

By continuing to browse this site you agree to our use of cookies. You can find out more about which cookies we are using or switch them off in settings.

 Privacy Overview

 3rd Party Cookies




 








Privacy Overview

This website uses cookies so that we can provide you with the best user experience possible. Cookie information is stored in your browser and performs functions such as recognising you when you return to our website and helping our team to understand which sections of the website you find most interesting and useful.
You can adjust all of your cookie settings by navigating the tabs on the left hand side.



 
Strictly Necessary Cookies

Strictly necessary cookies must be enabled at all times in order to login and apply to openings.



disable









If you disable this cookie, we will not be able to save your preferences and you will not be able to login to apply for openings. This means that every time you visit this website you will need to enable or disable cookies again.







3rd Party Cookies

This website uses Google Analytics to collect anonymous information such as the number of visitors to the site, and the most popular pages.
Keeping this cookie enabled helps us to improve our website.



disable









Please enable Strictly Necessary Cookies first so that we can save your preferences!

            Associate Technical Account Manager



         Login to apply
    
















Associate Technical Account Manager
Raleigh, NC 


Associate Technical Account Managers at Yardi will provide consultative, implementation and technical support to a group of assigned Yardi clients in order to manage business operations and financial accounting functions in Yardi’s Voyager software. 
Responsibilities

Implements the Yardi suite of software products by assisting clients with system implementation, training, and technical support
Researches, analyzes and resolves software issues
Supports software product customization based on client requirements
Performs data mapping and conversions
Performs system and business process reviews and other service reviews and makes recommendations on best practices
Works on a regular basis with Yardi internal resource teams to include: training, conversion, sales and development 

Requirements

Bachelor’s degree in Economics, Business, Math, Statistics or Information Management preferred
Experience setting and managing client expectations
Superior verbal and written communication skills
Project Management, Accounting, or Property Management experience/background
Solid Proficiency in MS Office Suite and Outlook
Knowledge in three of the following areas: Property Management, Accounting, Microsoft Windows, Technical Support, SQL, HTML/ASP
Prior experience with property management software or real estate software highly desirable
Prior experience with Yardi software highly desirable
Regular attendance and a regular work schedule is an essential function of this job.

By continuing to browse this site you agree to our use of cookies. You can find out more about which cookies we are using or switch them off in settings.
 

 
Accept

 


















 

 Privacy Overview


 Strictly Necessary Cookies


 3rd Party Cookies




 








Privacy Overview

This website uses cookies so that we can provide you with the best user experience possible. Cookie information is stored in your browser and performs functions such as recognising you when you return to our website and helping our team to understand which sections of the website you find most interesting and useful.
You can adjust all of your cookie settings by navigating the tabs on the left hand side.



 
Strictly Necessary Cookies

Strictly necessary cookies must be enabled at all times in order to login and apply to openings.



disable









If you disable this cookie, we will not be able to save your preferences and you will not be able to login to apply for openings. This means that every time you visit this website you will need to enable or disable cookies again.







3rd Party Cookies

This website uses Google Analytics to collect anonymous information such as the number of visitors to the site, and the most popular pages.
Keeping this cookie enabled helps us to improve our website.



disable









Please enable Strictly Necessary Cookies first so that we can save your preferences!












Enable All
Save Changes

            Help Desk Specialist



         Login to apply
    
















Help Desk Specialist
Raleigh, NC 


As an IT Helpdesk Specialist you will be responsible for:

Responding to requests for technical assistance in person, via phone, or electronically
Installing software and updating hardware
Diagnosing and resolving technical hardware and software issues
Researching questions using available information resources
Advising users on appropriate actions
Following standard helpdesk procedures
Logging all helpdesk interactions
Administering helpdesk software
Re-directing problems to the appropriate resource

  The ideal candidate will possess the following skills and abilities:

3-5 years  of experience
Proficiency in Windows 7, Windows 8 and Microsoft Office
Basic Network Troubleshooting skills
PC Imaging
Familiar with mobile device (phone/tablet) setup and use
Excellent customer service skills
Ability to work outside normal business hours if required to include evenings and weekends

If you’re ready to take on a fresh challenge, grow your career and contribute to making the world a safer place, Raytheon is ready to help you achieve your goals. Join our team and get the opportunity and support to find purpose, thrive and succeed.





Notice: Please be aware of suspicious recruiting emails and text messages that attempt to collect your confidential information. Raytheon conducts all electronic correspondence using e-mail addresses that end in “Raytheon.com”, “Raytheon.co.uk”, “Raytheon.com.au” or “brassring.com”. To report fraud please go to: https://www.ic3.gov.











Sr Systems Engineer II
Dulles, Virginia


Apply





Overview
Responsibilities
Success Profile
Rewards
Trending




Overview

What does it take to make the world a safer place? It takes delivering innovative technology and collaborating with some of the finest talent in the engineering field. Whether you’re a software engineer or a mechanical engineer, at Raytheon you’ll grow a varied and rewarding career. And you’ll be supported with a comprehensive and competitive benefits package that promotes work/life. If you’re ready to take on today’s big challenges, discover a world of opportunity at Raytheon.

America’s Best Large Employers by Forbes
Career & Development Opportunities
Full-time
Entry, Mid, Senior level




Back to Job Navigation (Overview)


Responsibilities


The Raytheon Intelligence, Information and Services (IIS) Systems Engineering and Integration Team (SEIT) is the central focus for concept development, trade studies, systems architecture development, and systems integration and test activities for customized engineering services and products. We develop solutions to solve customer needs as well as plan future capabilities and technology roadmaps.  The Raytheon Intelligence Information and Services (IIS) C2, Space, and Intelligence (CSI) solutions team is seeking a Sr. Systems Engineer for programs to modernize and maintain satellite ground segments.As a Sr.Systems Engineer, your duties will include but not be limited to the following:Perform system engineering analyses including trade studies, use case development, requirements definition and derivation, interface definition, and requirement validation and verification.Provide technical direction and clarification of requirements to software development teams, and test personnel. Support definition of operations concepts and procedure planning/ development, interfacing with personnel from other organizations.Attend technical interchange meetings with the team members and other program personnel. Provide status on assigned Integrated Master Schedule (IMS) tasks. Provide document review and resolves technical systems engineering and integration issues. Support ECP efforts as required. This position requires an Active TS/SCI clearance w/ CI Poly.Validated TS/SCI clearances are eligible for sign-on bonus amounts up to $40,000.Required Skills:6+ years demonstrated engineering experience with proven track record.Active TS/SCI clearance with CI PolyExperience in at least one of the following system engineering areas: architecture development, operations concept development, requirements definition and derivation, functional analysis, interface definition, and verification & validation for large software systemsExperience with Agile development and the Atlassian tool suite (JIRA, Test Rail, Confluence)Enthusiastic & energetic performer able to work in a dynamic, fast-paced, & high visibility environmentSelf-motivated and capable of performing tasks with minimal oversightTeam player incorporating a team based success philosophyExperience with systems engineering principles and activitiesDesired Skills:Experience working software and system development on Intelligence Community programsFamiliarity of satellite communication principlesEducation Requirements:BS/MS or PhD in Engineering, Science, or Mathematics, or similar STEM degree.This position requires either a U.S. Person or a Non-U.S. Person who is eligible to obtain any required Export Authorization.IISVA092419 148095
Business Unit Profile
                        
                        Raytheon Intelligence, Information and Services delivers innovative technology to make the world a safer place. Our expertise in cyber, analytics and automation allow us to reach beyond what others think is possible to underpin national security and give our global customers unique solutions to solve the most pressing modern challenges -- from the cyber domain to automated operations, and from intelligent transportation and training solutions to creating clear insight from large volumes of data. IIS operates at nearly 550 sites in 80 countries, and is headquartered in Dulles, Virginia. The business area generated $6.2 billion in 2018 revenues. As a global business, our leaders must have the ability to understand, embrace and operate in a multicultural world -- in the marketplace and the workplace. We strive to hire people who reflect our communities and embrace diversity and inclusion to advance our culture, develop our employees, and grow our business.
Relocation Eligible 
                        
                        Yes
Clearance Type 
                        
                        TS/SCI with CI Poly - Current
Expertise 
                        

                                
                            AlgorithmsCloud ComputingComputer EngineeringComputer ScienceComputer/Management Information SystemsConfiguration ManagementCyber JobsData NetworkingData ScienceEngineering TechnologyGeneral EngineeringGeneral ManagementInformation and Knowledge SystemsIntegration & Test EngineeringSensor SystemsSoftware EngineeringSystems EngineeringTechnicalTest Engineering
                        
                        

Type Of Job 
                        
                        Full Time

Work Location 
                        
 
                            
                            VA - Dulles
                        
Raytheon is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, age, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected Veteran status.

Quote



Felicia Jackson is regional vice president of RAYVETS, Raytheon's employee group for veterans and those who support them. After 24 years in the Air Force, she started a new career at Raytheon. "I wanted to go where people would support me," she told us.









Rewards




401(k) / Retirement Plans
Employer Matching, if you elect to enroll company matches up to 3%.



Work / Life Balance
Raytheon supports a variety of flexible work arrangements including compressed work weeks, flextime, job sharing, 9/80, reduced hours and telecommuting.



Career Development
At Raytheon, we foster an inclusive culture of professional development. We support a variety of developmental opportunities including: Mentoring programs, Skills Development, Leadership Development, Rotational job assignments, and Continuous Improvement, all of which contribute to advancement of our employee’s capabilities.



Paid Time Off
Accrue paid time off monthly. Receive 10-12 holidays per year with some locations shutting down the week between Christmas and New Year’s Day.



Relocation Assistance
Select technical positions are eligible for relocation packages. See specific job description for eligibility requirements.



Parental Leave
Raytheon offers all eligible employees up to three weeks paid parental leave for the birth or adoption of a child (separate from paid maternity leave or Family & Medical Leave Act).

Sign-on Bonus up to $40K - APEX O&M Scrum Master
Aurora, Colorado

Raytheon delivers innovative technology to make the world a safer place. Our expertise in cyber, analytics and automation allow us to reach beyond what others think is possible to underpin national security and give our global customers unique solutions to solve the most pressing modern challenges -- from the cyber domain to automated operations, and from intelligent transportation solutions to creating clear insight from large volumes of data. Our leaders must have the ability to understand, embrace and operate in a multicultural world -- in the marketplace and the workplace. We strive to hire people who reflect our communities and embrace diversity and inclusion to advance our culture, develop our employees, and grow our business.

Full-time
Entry to Senior level

Raytheon: Bright Future in Aurora







Raytheon Secures Every Side of Cyber




Back to Job Navigation (Trending)


Rewards




401(k) / Retirement Plans
Employer Matching, if you elect to enroll company matches up to 3%.



Work / Life Balance
Raytheon appreciates work/life balance. Employees can work 9 hours a day every week and received every other Friday off, as long as departmental/manager approval is obtained. Accrued paid time off monthly and paid holiday time.



Career Development
At Raytheon, we foster an inclusive culture of professional development. We support a variety of developmental opportunities including: Mentoring programs, Skills Development, Leadership Development, Rotational job assignments, and Continuous Improvement, all of which contribute to advancement of our employee’s capabilities.



Paid Time Off
Accrue paid time off monthly. Receive 12 holidays per year including the week between Christmas and New Year’s Day.



Relocation Assistance
Select technical positions are eligible for relocation packages. See specific job description for eligibility requirements.



Parental Leave
Raytheon offers all eligible employees up to three weeks paid parental leave for the birth or adoption of a child (separate from paid maternity leave or Family & Medical Leave Act).



Back to Job Navigation (Rewards)



Responsibilities


Would you like to work in a collaborative environment at a state of the art facility in Colorado? Then join our Raytheon team of engineers solving problems that make the world a safer place and help to secure our great nation! Come support those who provide us with all the freedoms we enjoy.Our facility in Aurora, CO offers amenities that create work and life balance. On site we have a 24/7 fitness facility, health center, cafeteria, collaboration rooms and dynamic break areas for easy conversation and socialization. Additionally, employee appreciation lunches, bonus opportunities, and great benefits that include medical, dental, vision, 401K match, flexible work schedule - just to name a few.  Click here to view a brief video and learn more: https://youtu.be/YNuZN0vyzHgThis position is eligible for a sign on bonus of up to $40k for a candidate with a current TS/SCI with Poly that can be verified and hired at Raytheon.Job Description:Reporting to the APEX O&M IPT Lead, this position facilitates the effort for the O&M development team.  This is a critical position and plays a key role in the success of the software defect work off and software deployments on the program.  This role works closely with the IPT Leadership, the IPT Tech Lead, Product Owner, and development team, to de-conflict IPT Development priorities, resolve cross-IPT issues, lead the sprint planning and facilitate cross-team/cross-discipline coordination and communication. This position acts for the IPT Leadership in coordination with the Product Owner to plan and execute the software sprints and builds in support of the IMS.Responsibilities: Guide the IPT Agile teams on how to use Agile/Scrum practices and values to deliver high quality software; Familiarity with common Agile practices, service-oriented environments, and better development practices  Knowledge and/or experience with widely successful Agile techniques; Understand backlog tracking, burndown metrics, velocity, and task definitionMust be able to ensure Agile/Scrum concepts and principles are adhered to, must be able to be a voice of reason and authorityConduct/Lead quarterly increment planning and develop increment metrics; Understand incremental delivery and the value of metricsMust be able to lead component team Scrum Members to self-organization Plan regular software builds/deliveries in support of parallel program schedulesWith the Product Owner, provide input to the Program Build Plan and deconflict with the program delivery PlanWork with IPT Tech Lead and Product Owners to define the Increment and Build Plan prioritiesConduct and Publish Lessons Learned from each Sprint/IncrementExcellent communication and mentoring skills; Must be able to communicate well with teamsEngages with other Scrum Masters, Product Owners and IPT Leadership as required to ensure that all relevant inputs to the Product Backlog have been collected and prioritizedResponsible for ensuring feature story completion and ensures user stories meet the acceptance criteriaMust be able to notice differences and issues, prioritize and assign program resources to resolutionKeep management informed of impacts and solution paths for ongoing issuesMust be able to facilitate discussion and facilitate alternatives or different approachesUnderstand basic fundamentals of agile software development processes and proceduresUnderstand other processes and methodologies and can speak intelligently about them and leverage other techniques to provide value to a team/enterpriseUnderstand the value of commitments to delivery made by a development teamWork with the SW CPT Lead to report Agile Development Metrics An excellent communicator/facilitator who can relate to the technical team and facilitate effective and efficient meetingsDrive team to closure to meet sprint/increment commitmentsACTIVE TS/SCI CLEARANCE REQUIREDRequired Skills:4+ years of experience working with Agile practices4+ years of experience working in the software development industry2-4+ years of experience as a SW Program / Task ManagerAbility to lead / manage tasks over a large group of engineers (10+) and coordinate issues/priorities across disciplinesAbility to mentor junior engineersStrong written and verbal communication skillsCurrent in the technologies, methodologies, processes and tools used in the software industry with a demonstrated track record of deploying these on programs.Experience with Application Lifecycle Management applications Record of High Performance and proven/well-developed problem-solving skillsCan engage stakeholders in critical discussions and building consensusDesired Skills:CSM (Certified Scrum Master) / CSPO (Certified Scrum Product Owner)Experience working on a program using a Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe)Experience dealing with Information Assurance and Cyber Security requirements.Required Education (including Major):Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Aerospace Engineering, Physics, Math.   151322

If you’re ready to take on a fresh challenge, grow your career and contribute to making the world a safer place, Raytheon is ready to help you achieve your goals. Join our team and get the opportunity and support to find purpose, thrive and succeed.





Notice: Please be aware of suspicious recruiting emails and text messages that attempt to collect your confidential information. Raytheon conducts all electronic correspondence using e-mail addresses that end in “Raytheon.com”, “Raytheon.co.uk”, “Raytheon.com.au” or “brassring.com”. To report fraud please go to: https://www.ic3.gov.











Sr Systems Engineer I
Dulles, Virginia


Apply





Overview
Responsibilities
Success Profile
Rewards
Trending




Overview

What does it take to make the world a safer place? It takes delivering innovative technology and collaborating with some of the finest talent in the engineering field. Whether you’re a software engineer or a mechanical engineer, at Raytheon you’ll grow a varied and rewarding career. And you’ll be supported with a comprehensive and competitive benefits package that promotes work/life. If you’re ready to take on today’s big challenges, discover a world of opportunity at Raytheon.

America’s Best Large Employers by Forbes
Career & Development Opportunities
Full-time
Entry, Mid, Senior level




Back to Job Navigation (Overview)


Responsibilities


Are you looking for an engineering career that is challenging and satisfying? Then join our Raytheon team of engineers solving problems that make the world a safer place and help to secure our great nation! Come support those who provide us with all the freedoms we enjoy.We offer great benefits that include medical, dental, vision, 401K match, flexible work schedule - just to name a few.  Click here to view a brief video and learn more: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qvbCgKpkEdsRaytheon Intelligence, Information and Services (IIS) delivers innovative technology to make the world a safer place. Our expertise in cyber, analytics and automation allow us to reach beyond what others think is possible to underpin national security and give our global customers unique solutions to solve the most pressing modern challenges -- from the cyber domain to automated operations, and from intelligent transportation solutions to creating clear insight from large volumes of data. IIS operates at nearly 550 sites in 80 countries, including a large presence in Dulles, VA. As a global business, our leaders must have the ability to understand, embrace and operate in a multicultural world -- in the marketplace and the workplace. We strive to hire people who reflect our communities and embrace diversity and inclusion to advance our culture, develop our employees, and grow our business.Job Description:The Raytheon IIS Hardware and Infrastructure Engineering (HW&I) team has a professional opening for a Systems Engineer. This position will perform network and infrastructure engineering tasks pertaining to LAN/data center system design, development, implementation, integration, and troubleshooting activities. The qualified individual should possess knowledge and experience with network technologies, services, operations, and security. The ability to obtain a US Government TS/SCI security clearance is required for this position (US citizenship required).This position is eligible for a Sign on Bonus of up to $40k for a candidate with a current verifiable TS/SCI clearance that is hired by RaytheonRequired Skills:Raytheon is seeking a Systems Engineer who feeds off the challenge of rolling up their sleeves to tackle meaningful problems each and every day, is a passionate and collaborative problem-solver who seeks and gives candid feedback, and values the chance to make an important impact.  4+ years of progressively responsible experience in design, implementation and administration for hardware and systems portfolios.Strong experience building, maintaining, managing and monitoring servers running LinuxKnowledge and experience  of Application and Security protocols, such as Solarwinds, HBSS, Certificates & Tokens, RSA, McAfee SIEM, McAfee SIEM, McAfee IPS/IDS, Rubrik Host Backup System, SAN storage, and Active DirectoryExperience in working with highly hardened/secure environmentsKnowledge of the concepts and techniques of server architectures, hardware, and software.Working knowledge of TCP/IP,  DNS, IPSec, GRE tunnels, multicasting and traffic balancing techniques.Practical understanding of Internet routing, BGP, OSPF, Tunneling, Ethernet switching, Linux, and related networking technologiesStrong communicator with the ability to work effectively across multiple business and engineering teamsAdjust quickly to changing priorities and make quick decisions with limited informationHigh level of motivation, self-starter, ability to demonstrate effective project management and completion of complex network tasks with little guidanceExcellent time management skillsHighly valued skill sets:Experience in Python/Shell scriptingFamiliarity with systems configuration management, orchestration, and infrastructure as code with tools such as Ansible and/or TerraformExperience with VMWare or KVMExperience with public cloud offeringsExperience as a system administrator for a Splunk cluster, or similar SIEM platformInstall, configure, and maintain a SANInstall, configure, and maintain Active DirectoryEducation: Requires a degree in Science, Technology, Engineering or Mathematics (STEM) and 4 years of related work experience. 150827
Business Unit Profile
                        
                        Raytheon Intelligence, Information and Services delivers innovative technology to make the world a safer place. Our expertise in cyber, analytics and automation allow us to reach beyond what others think is possible to underpin national security and give our global customers unique solutions to solve the most pressing modern challenges -- from the cyber domain to automated operations, and from intelligent transportation and training solutions to creating clear insight from large volumes of data. IIS operates at nearly 550 sites in 80 countries, and is headquartered in Dulles, Virginia. The business area generated $6.2 billion in 2018 revenues. As a global business, our leaders must have the ability to understand, embrace and operate in a multicultural world -- in the marketplace and the workplace. We strive to hire people who reflect our communities and embrace diversity and inclusion to advance our culture, develop our employees, and grow our business.

Quote



Felicia Jackson is regional vice president of RAYVETS, Raytheon's employee group for veterans and those who support them. After 24 years in the Air Force, she started a new career at Raytheon. "I wanted to go where people would support me," she told us.









Rewards




401(k) / Retirement Plans
Employer Matching, if you elect to enroll company matches up to 3%.



Work / Life Balance
Raytheon supports a variety of flexible work arrangements including compressed work weeks, flextime, job sharing, 9/80, reduced hours and telecommuting.



Career Development
At Raytheon, we foster an inclusive culture of professional development. We support a variety of developmental opportunities including: Mentoring programs, Skills Development, Leadership Development, Rotational job assignments, and Continuous Improvement, all of which contribute to advancement of our employee’s capabilities.



Paid Time Off
Accrue paid time off monthly. Receive 10-12 holidays per year with some locations shutting down the week between Christmas and New Year’s Day.



Relocation Assistance
Select technical positions are eligible for relocation packages. See specific job description for eligibility requirements.



Parental Leave
Raytheon offers all eligible employees up to three weeks paid parental leave for the birth or adoption of a child (separate from paid maternity leave or Family & Medical Leave Act).

Scientist I - Relation Extraction
Apply
Requisition ID 149212BR Date updated 09/26/2019
Are you an experienced, passionate pioneer in technology – who is versatile, displays leadership qualities and is enthusiastic about tackling new problems? Do you enjoy creating experiments, prototyping implementations or designing new learning algorithms?  If so, then BBN is the place for you.Who we areFor more than 70 years, scientists and engineers in diverse disciplines at BBN have collaborated to solve real-world problems through research, exploration, development and prototyping. We partner with the best technical talent in academia and industry to challenge the status quo, pioneer new technologies, and create transformative solutions.   Our Analytics & Machine Intelligence team has the expertise to apply deep knowledge of machine learning approaches and other artificial intelligence techniques, learned and refined in human language technologies, to myriad problems faced by our current and future customers.  We are seeking creative and talented Natural Language Processing researchers to join us in our research and development efforts. We combine deep knowledge of linguistic structures with state-of-the-art statistical approaches to find critical patterns in language to help in translation, event extraction, and profile generation. We apply this knowledge in challenging tasks: finding and summarizing key information in multi-lingual corpora, understanding the relations between world events, predicting future events, and forming multiple interpretations of real-world situations. What you will do •Design and implement experiments to test new hypotheses regarding ◦Information Extraction◦Cross-lingual NLP◦Cross-lingual Information Retrieval◦Machine Translation◦Abstractive Summarization◦Automatic Knowledge Base Construction◦Ontology Grounding•Test new methods against a variety of challenging datasets•Participate in collaborative evaluations that test our implementations on new data•Write and present conference papers about your work at peer-reviewed venuesWhat you will gain  •Experience with cutting-edge research and prototype development•A deeper understanding of language structure and usage in a variety of domains, including social media and formal contexts•Familiarity with state-of-the-art machine learning techniques and programming packages•Opportunities to propose new ideas and solutions to challenging scientific and technological problems•Empowerment to satisfy your scientific curiosity and entrepreneurial drive•Flexibility to work on the schedule that fits your lifestyle and needs•A dedicated office where you can design your ideal working environment and express your own personalityWhat you need  •BS with 6+ years, or MS with 4+ years, or PhD with 0-3 years•Degrees in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Computational Linguistics, Electrical Engineering, and other related fields are all welcome•One or more publications in natural language processing or human language technologies.•Proven ability to carry out a research project from idea to design, implementation, testing, and publication.•Familiarity with state-of-the-art techniques used in addressing NLP challenges.•Excellent written and oral communication skills, and a willingness to work closely with customers and partners.•Comfortable supporting research codebases written in Python or Java.•Experience working on code collaboratively, including use of tools such as git and issue tracking. Additional Skills that make you an ideal candidate •Strong communicator with demonstrated ability to address customer needs in a dynamic environment•Participation in research regarding cross-lingual or non-English natural language data.•Background in probability, statistics, or machine learning•Strong programming skills, e.g. system design and implementation•Project experience with reinforcement learning•Previous participation on government research programs, such as LORELEI, MATERIAL, or AIDA.•Eligibility for a security clearance (NOT REQUIRED)•We also welcome applications from non-U.S. persons.Why UsAt BBN you will find an exciting, collaborative environment that offers the opportunity to contribute to revolutionary research that solves important problems. Career growth is encouraged through support for on-site training, mentoring, 100% tuition program, publications and participating in leading research conferences. If you have a growth mindset and you thrive under pressure, Come Join Our Team!  We offer outstanding benefits that include flexible work schedules, a 5% 401k company match, a 5% Retirement Contribution plan, performance based incentive plans, an onsite gym (in Cambridge), paid parental leave, paid time off, and all kinds of employee discounts. 149212
Business Unit Profile
            Raytheon Space and Airborne Systems (SAS) builds radars and other sensors for aircraft, spacecraft and ships. The business also provides communications and electronic warfare solutions and performs research in areas ranging from linguistics to quantum computing. SAS is headquartered in McKinney, Texas USA. As a global business, our leaders must have the ability to understand, embrace and operate in a multicultural world -- in the marketplace and the workplace. We strive to hire people who reflect our communities and embrace diversity and inclusion to advance our culture, develop our employees, and grow our business.Raytheon is headquartered in Waltham, Massachusetts. Follow us on Twitter.

Relocation Eligible 
            Yes

Clearance Type 
            None / Not Required

Expertise 
 
              Artificial IntelligenceComputer ScienceData ScienceMachine LearningNatural Language ProcessingResearch & Development

Work on interesting projects and enjoy plenty of recognition
Whether you’re just starting out on your career journey or a experienced professional, it’s important that you feel recognized and rewarded for your contributions.
Raytheon is proud to offer a comprehensive and competitive benefits package to you, your spouse and your eligible children. In addition to protecting you and your family's health and well-being, we offer important income and work/life benefits to meet your needs. Learn More





Turn unique thinking into one-of-a-kind solutions
Diversity. Every company likes to talk about it, but few have embraced it with quite the same commitment as we have here at Raytheon. As a result, diversity has become a competitive imperative and an integral part of our business model, particularly as we continue to grow internationally. Learn More








Work as one to make a difference to millions
Here at Raytheon, we innovate across all domains: from land and sea to air, space, and cyberspace.It’s innovation made possible by a strong internal culture and a vision that’s shared by Raytheon employees across the globe – a vision of one global team creating trusted, innovative solutions to make the world a safer place. Patient Technical Services Advocate (93352) - Goleta, CA - Inogen, Inc. Jobs








 














Home
Jobs




Patient Technical Services Advocate (93352) - Goleta, CA

Toggle navigation








Patient Technical Services Advocate (93352) 

JobsLogin 












 Customer Care Center Goleta, CA, USA Full Time 



Email Me Similar Jobs Email Me This Job



ABOUT INOGEN Inogen was founded in 2001 to improve quality of life and increase freedom and independence for oxygen therapy users. Inogen is innovation in oxygen therapy. The Inogen mission is to improve freedom and independence for oxygen therapy patients through innovative products and services. Inogen is a manufacturer and Accredited Homecare Provider.
Inogen is focused on quality care, continuous improvement, and outstanding customer satisfaction. We are a stable, USAbased company dedicated to providing an exciting and rewarding career to our employees. We completed a successful Initial Public Offering on the NASDAQ in 2014 and have demonstrated substantial growth over the last five years. Our work environment is casual yet highperforming, and we are looking for seriously talented, motivated, and fast-paced professionals to join our team.
JOB DESCRIPTION The Patient Technical Services Advocate provides support and service to our respiratory patients that have purchased products directly from Inogen or have enrolled in Inogen's home respiratory therapy services.  This position provides the highest level of customer service to internal/external customers and serves as the front line contact for incoming inquiries, customer questions and sales requests.
Key Competencies:
Troubleshoots and provides Account Overview with Patients
Acts as an information source for customers and intercompany in the area of product and service
Provide sales support for field sales representatives and DTP sales representatives
Maintains product knowledge to keep abreast of updates and changes by continued product training
Do you possess these abilities?
Excellent verbal and written communication skills required
Strong organization skills and attention to detail are required
Ability to take initiative and follow through on multiple open tasks
Must have proven track record of successful team participation, as well as ability to work independently and self-start
Requirements:
Associate's or Bachelor's degree preferred, or the equivalent combination of education, training, and experience that provides the required knowledge, skills, and abilities
3+ years related customer service preferred
 
WHY INOGEN Inogen is a dynamic company that is not only focused on quality care of patients, but is also committed to being a top employer. Each of Inogen's offices has a casual culture that supports employees being responsible and developing professionals.
Inogen – Where we go to work hard to positively impact people's lives
See the Inogen team in action:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dKoTMeJf5J4#t=23
 
Inogen is an equal opportunity employer.  We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other legally protected characteristics. The EEO is the Law poster and its supplement are available here: http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/ofccpost.htm; http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/OFCCP_EEO_Supplement_Final_JRF_QA_508c.pdf.  The pay transparency policy is available here: http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/pdf/EO13665_PrescribedNondiscriminationPostingLanguage_JRFQA508c.pdf. 
Inogen is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities.  If you need a reasonable accommodation because of a disability for any part of the employment process, please send an e-mail to recruiting@inogen.net or call (972) 616-5668 and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information.
