If you’re ready to take on a fresh challenge, grow your career and contribute to making the world a safer place, Raytheon is ready to help you achieve your goals. Join our team and get the opportunity and support to find purpose, thrive and succeed.





Notice: Please be aware of suspicious recruiting emails and text messages that attempt to collect your confidential information. Raytheon conducts all electronic correspondence using e-mail addresses that end in “Raytheon.com”, “Raytheon.co.uk”, “Raytheon.com.au” or “brassring.com”. To report fraud please go to: https://www.ic3.gov.











Sr Systems Engineer II
Dulles, Virginia


Apply





Overview
Responsibilities
Success Profile
Rewards
Trending




Overview

What does it take to make the world a safer place? It takes delivering innovative technology and collaborating with some of the finest talent in the engineering field. Whether you’re a software engineer or a mechanical engineer, at Raytheon you’ll grow a varied and rewarding career. And you’ll be supported with a comprehensive and competitive benefits package that promotes work/life. If you’re ready to take on today’s big challenges, discover a world of opportunity at Raytheon.

America’s Best Large Employers by Forbes
Career & Development Opportunities
Full-time
Entry, Mid, Senior level




Back to Job Navigation (Overview)


Responsibilities


Raytheon Intelligence, Information and Services (IIS) is currently seeking a Systems Engineer in support of several Systems Engineering programs and efforts. The Systems Engineering applicant will participate in Systems Engineering development efforts.  This position involves working in a team environment with responsibilities in all phases of Systems development including concept development, requirements, functional analysis, design reviews, implementation, test, verification, validation and transition. Multiple positions are available with multiple skill sets.Validated TS/SCI clearances are eligible for sign-on bonus amounts up to $40,000.Clearance Requirements:  Current TS/SCI Level security clearance.Location: Dulles, VAResponsibilities include, but are not limited to: Perform life cycle systems engineering and test activities in support of on-going programs.  Work with external industry and Govt. stakeholders in the resolution of engineering systems issues.Develop and maintain requirements for systems and subsystemsPrepare for and conduct design reviewsWork in an IPT in the development of defense equipment and products.Develop Test strategies and proceduresWork within and coordinate systems engineering activities across the customer, supplier and internal IPT.Required Skills:6+ years demonstrated experience in systems engineering, software engineering or related engineering disciplineKnowledge of the following systems engineering functions:CONOPS developmentrequirements development and managementarchitecturesystem designinterface definition and controlintegration and test to include test planning and procedure developmentDemonstrated understanding of the systems engineering lifecycle in support of software development, avionics systems development or sustainment activitiesExcellent written and oral communication skillsExperience with Microsoft Office suite of tools, particularly Excel, Project, and PowerPointCurrent TS/SCI level security clearanceDesired Skills:Experience with requirements management using DOORS or similar requirements management toolKnowledge of software development lifecycle models (waterfall and Agile) and program lifecycle modesAbility to the identify, manage, and mitigate technical riskExperience with automated test tools/ script developmentEducation Requirements:Requires a degree in Science, Technology, Engineering or Mathematics (STEM) and minimum of 6 years prior relevant experience.This position requires either a U.S. Person or a Non-U.S. Person who is eligible to obtain any required Export Authorization.IISVA092419 150849
Business Unit Profile
                        
                        Raytheon Intelligence, Information and Services delivers innovative technology to make the world a safer place. Our expertise in cyber, analytics and automation allow us to reach beyond what others think is possible to underpin national security and give our global customers unique solutions to solve the most pressing modern challenges -- from the cyber domain to automated operations, and from intelligent transportation and training solutions to creating clear insight from large volumes of data. IIS operates at nearly 550 sites in 80 countries, and is headquartered in Dulles, Virginia. The business area generated $6.2 billion in 2018 revenues. As a global business, our leaders must have the ability to understand, embrace and operate in a multicultural world -- in the marketplace and the workplace. We strive to hire people who reflect our communities and embrace diversity and inclusion to advance our culture, develop our employees, and grow our business.
Relocation Eligible 
                        
                        Yes
Clearance Type 
                        
                        TS/SCI - Current
Expertise 
                        

                                
                            AlgorithmsCloud ComputingComputer EngineeringComputer ScienceConfiguration ManagementData ScienceEngineering TechnologyGeneral EngineeringGeneral ManagementIntegration & Test EngineeringSensor SystemsSoftware EngineeringSystems EngineeringTechnicalTest Engineering
                        
                        

Type Of Job

Work Location 
                        
 
                            
                            VA - Dulles
                        
Raytheon is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, age, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected Veteran status.

Back to Job Navigation (Success)


Quote



Felicia Jackson is regional vice president of RAYVETS, Raytheon's employee group for veterans and those who support them. After 24 years in the Air Force, she started a new career at Raytheon. "I wanted to go where people would support me," she told us.









Rewards




401(k) / Retirement Plans
Employer Matching, if you elect to enroll company matches up to 3%.



Work / Life Balance
Raytheon supports a variety of flexible work arrangements including compressed work weeks, flextime, job sharing, 9/80, reduced hours and telecommuting.



Career Development
At Raytheon, we foster an inclusive culture of professional development. We support a variety of developmental opportunities including: Mentoring programs, Skills Development, Leadership Development, Rotational job assignments, and Continuous Improvement, all of which contribute to advancement of our employee’s capabilities.



Paid Time Off
Accrue paid time off monthly. Receive 10-12 holidays per year with some locations shutting down the week between Christmas and New Year’s Day.



Relocation Assistance
Select technical positions are eligible for relocation packages. See specific job description for eligibility requirements.



Parental Leave
Raytheon offers all eligible employees up to three weeks paid parental leave for the birth or adoption of a child (separate from paid maternity leave or Family & Medical Leave Act).

            Account Executive



         Login to apply
    
















Account Executive
Dallas, TX 


The Account Executive, Inside Sales will work to effectively develop a multi-state territory, successfully acquire new accounts, develop and manage a well-balanced sales pipeline and meet monthly/annual sales goals.
 
Responsibilities 

Lead generation and qualification
Fielding, qualifying and closing inbound sale inquires
Prospecting and telephone marketing for new prospect clients
Creating, tracking, closing and reporting results of sales opportunities in yCRM
Learn and master company software product offerings
Conducting online presentations and product demonstrations
Communicating via phone and email correspondence with prospective clients
Nurturing sales opportunities through the entire sales cycle to close
Providing information and generating interest in conference participation and other related events
Managing weekly/monthly activity to support sales goals
Work effectively with other teams that support the sales process and client satisfaction  

 
Requirements

Bachelor’s degree in Business, Accounting or related degree
1-3 years of inside sales experience
Prior understanding of the full sales cycle (lead generation, qualifying leads, prospecting, cold calling, relationship management, and closing)
Demonstrated experience meeting or exceeding sales goals
Ability to cold call and develop leads
Ability to generate a sales pipeline and close sales
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Superior phone skills
Technical aptitude and the ability to successfully demonstrate software
Ability to show product features and benefits
High level of professionalism and ethics
Ability to manage multiple priorities in a fast paced environment
A background in software sales, web ads sales, accounting systems, or experience in the property management industry highly desirable

 *cl

By continuing to browse this site you agree to our use of cookies. You can find out more about which cookies we are using or switch them off in settings.
 

 
Accept

 


















 

 Privacy Overview


 Strictly Necessary Cookies


 3rd Party Cookies




 








Privacy Overview

This website uses cookies so that we can provide you with the best user experience possible. Cookie information is stored in your browser and performs functions such as recognising you when you return to our website and helping our team to understand which sections of the website you find most interesting and useful.
You can adjust all of your cookie settings by navigating the tabs on the left hand side.



 
Strictly Necessary Cookies

Strictly necessary cookies must be enabled at all times in order to login and apply to openings.



disable









If you disable this cookie, we will not be able to save your preferences and you will not be able to login to apply for openings. This means that every time you visit this website you will need to enable or disable cookies again.







3rd Party Cookies

This website uses Google Analytics to collect anonymous information such as the number of visitors to the site, and the most popular pages.
Keeping this cookie enabled helps us to improve our website.



disable









Please enable Strictly Necessary Cookies first so that we can save your preferences!












Enable All
Save Changes

If you’re ready to take on a fresh challenge, grow your career and contribute to making the world a safer place, Raytheon is ready to help you achieve your goals. Join our team and get the opportunity and support to find purpose, thrive and succeed.

Systems-Software Engineer – Agile Design
State College, Pennsylvania


Apply





Overview
Responsibilities
Success Profile
Rewards
Trending




Overview

What does it take to make the world a safer place? It takes delivering innovative technology and collaborating with some of the finest talent in the engineering field. Whether you’re a software engineer or a mechanical engineer, at Raytheon you’ll grow a varied and rewarding career. And you’ll be supported with a comprehensive and competitive benefits package that promotes work/life. If you’re ready to take on today’s big challenges, discover a world of opportunity at Raytheon.

America’s Best Large Employers by Forbes
Career & Development Opportunities
Full-time
Entry, Mid, Senior level




Back to Job Navigation (Overview)


Responsibilities


National Defense, Cloud Technologies, Agile Development, DevOps, Big Data, Teamwork … Opportunities at Raytheon span the full product development lifecycle, including new capability development as well as sustainment and enhancement of existing deployed systems. Raytheon Intelligence, Information and Services (IIS) in State College, PA is seeking talented Systems-Software Engineers to support classified programs that develop and enhance integrated sensor, signal processing, complex analytics, and big data systems for Intelligence Community customers.  The successful candidate has excellent written and verbal communication skills, works effectively in a team environment, and is flexible & adaptable to respond to customer mission needs.  Come join Raytheon's team of engineers solving problems that make the world a safer place and help to secure our great nation!  Come support those who provide us with all the freedoms we enjoy.  Click here to view a brief video and learn more about Raytheon: https://youtu.be/8B-k34faFAE.About State College, PAState College is a college town, dominated economically and demographically by the presence of the University Park main campus of The Pennsylvania State University, one of the ten largest public universities in the United States. State College provides access to many cultural and athletic activities & events, and yet is only minutes away from rural Pennsylvania country-side. Many Raytheon State College employees enjoy a commute of 15 minutes or less! Click here to view a brief video and learn more about Raytheon State College:  https://youtu.be/f299m09q0FsCompensation & BenefitsWhile benefits may vary based on business unit, location and/or union status, Raytheon employees receive comprehensive benefits as part of a competitive compensation package. Health and wellness plans are available for you and your eligible children. Other benefits include insurance, education assistance, income protection, investment/retirement and work/life programs.Clearance RequirementsThis position requires eligibility to obtain a TS/SCI security clearance.  A current, active TS/SCI or DoD-TS security clearance is highly preferred, and includes a sign-on bonus.   U.S. citizenship is required.This position is eligible for a Sign on Bonus up to $40k for a candidate with a current TS/SCI that can be verified and hired at Raytheon. Required Skills: 4+ years of relevant work experienceFamiliarity with engineering processes and techniquesAbility to work effectively on multi-discipline engineering teamsStrong interpersonal, communications, organization, and planning skillsCommitment to quality customer service and on-schedule task completionsAbility to manage time and resources to meet deadlinesProficiency with Microsoft OfficeExperience with Agile DevelopmentFamiliarity with Continuous Integration and Deployment environmentsAbility to generate technical documentation (DoDAF, ICDs, Test Plans & Procedures, etc.)Experience conducting technical research, documenting and presenting resultsDesired Skills: Active TS/SCI or DoD-TS security clearanceExperience with software development on Linux platformsExperience with system-level requirements analysis, system design, trade studies, and/or system integration & verificationCoursework and/or experience in Systems Engineering, Software Engineering, Infrastructure Engineering and/or Security Engineering.CompTlA Security+ certificationEducation Requirements: This position requires a 4-year bachelor's degree in Science, Technology, Engineering or Mathematics (STEM).This position requires either a U.S. Person or a Non-U.S. Person who is eligible to obtain any required Export Authorization. 150425
Business Unit Profile
                        
                        Raytheon Intelligence, Information and Services delivers innovative technology to make the world a safer place. Our expertise in cyber, analytics and automation allow us to reach beyond what others think is possible to underpin national security and give our global customers unique solutions to solve the most pressing modern challenges -- from the cyber domain to automated operations, and from intelligent transportation and training solutions to creating clear insight from large volumes of data. IIS operates at nearly 550 sites in 80 countries, and is headquartered in Dulles, Virginia. The business area generated $6.2 billion in 2018 revenues. As a global business, our leaders must have the ability to understand, embrace and operate in a multicultural world -- in the marketplace and the workplace. We strive to hire people who reflect our communities and embrace diversity and inclusion to advance our culture, develop our employees, and grow our business.

401(k) / Retirement Plans

Work / Life Balance
Raytheon supports a variety of flexible work arrangements including compressed work weeks, flextime, job sharing, 9/80, reduced hours and telecommuting.



Career Development
At Raytheon, we foster an inclusive culture of professional development. We support a variety of developmental opportunities including: Mentoring programs, Skills Development, Leadership Development, Rotational job assignments, and Continuous Improvement, all of which contribute to advancement of our employee’s capabilities.



Paid Time Off
Accrue paid time off monthly. Receive 10-12 holidays per year with some locations shutting down the week between Christmas and New Year’s Day.



Relocation Assistance
Select technical positions are eligible for relocation packages. See specific job description for eligibility requirements.



Parental Leave
Raytheon offers all eligible employees up to three weeks paid parental leave for the birth or adoption of a child (separate from paid maternity leave or Family & Medical Leave Act).

Overview

Raytheon delivers innovative technology to make the world a safer place. Our expertise in cyber, analytics and automation allow us to reach beyond what others think is possible to underpin national security and give our global customers unique solutions to solve the most pressing modern challenges -- from the cyber domain to automated operations, and from intelligent transportation solutions to creating clear insight from large volumes of data. Our leaders must have the ability to understand, embrace and operate in a multicultural world -- in the marketplace and the workplace. We strive to hire people who reflect our communities and embrace diversity and inclusion to advance our culture, develop our employees, and grow our business.

Full-time
Entry to Senior level

Glassdoor 2017 Best Places to Interview: Candidate's Choice

Rewards




401(k) / Retirement Plans
Employer Matching, if you elect to enroll company matches up to 3%.



Work / Life Balance
Raytheon appreciates work/life balance. Employees can work 9 hours a day every week and received every other Friday off, as long as departmental/manager approval is obtained. Accrued paid time off monthly and paid holiday time.



Career Development
At Raytheon, we foster an inclusive culture of professional development. We support a variety of developmental opportunities including: Mentoring programs, Skills Development, Leadership Development, Rotational job assignments, and Continuous Improvement, all of which contribute to advancement of our employee’s capabilities.



Paid Time Off
Accrue paid time off monthly. Receive 12 holidays per year including the week between Christmas and New Year’s Day.



Relocation Assistance

Parental Leave

Back to Job Navigation (Rewards)



Responsibilities


Would you like to work in a collaborative environment at a state of the art facility in Colorado? Then join our Raytheon team of engineers solving problems that make the world a safer place and help to secure our great nation! Come support those who provide us with all the freedoms we enjoy.Our facility in Aurora, CO offers amenities that create work and life balance. On site we have a 24/7 fitness facility, health center, cafeteria, collaboration rooms and dynamic break areas for easy conversation and socialization. Additionally, employee appreciation lunches, bonus opportunities, and great benefits that include medical, dental, vision, 401K match, flexible work schedule - just to name a few.  Click here to view a brief video and learn more: https://youtu.be/YNuZN0vyzHgGround Hardware Development Engineer for the JPSS program. Perform Hardware/Electrical Engineering design, analysis and testing of electronics and RF subsystems. Represent Hardware Engineering in development and evaluation of system architectures, designs, and interfaces that meet system specifications. Prepare and present hardware specifications and design analysis in program reviews. Participate in Trade Studies and Vendor/Product selection. Participate in engineering discipline process development and deployment on programs. Insure organizational processes are followed and create program specific work instructions when necessary. Support may also include working with other organizations, coordinating common and efficient cross-factory environments (both hardware and software), tools, process, and methods.Key responsibilities for the qualified candidate include:Responsible for assisting in trouble shooting the Space to Ground Interface, including RF equipment and antennasResponsible for working with team members to resolve operational issues in an urgent mannerResponsible to create design documentation, perform reviews with team members and vendors, and follow program and corporate processResponsible to work with the team to create System Operating ProceduresRequired Skills:BS degree in Electrical Engineering specializing in RF and Communications fieldsExperience with RF/Baseband and signal processing design, development, and hardware testingExperience with preparing statements that convey the fundamental characteristics of the design objective, creating and presenting reportsExperience with writing and reviewing manuals, procedures, plans, specifications, engineering drawings and notebooks General knowledge of communication protocols, digital signal processing, RF signal types and levelsGeneral knowledge of common information system (computer) hardware interfaces Must be proficient with Microsoft Office applications such as Word, Excel, and Power PointMust be familiar with Satellite Ground Station facilities and operationsPeriodic travel required to support upgrades at Ground Stations in CONUS and OCONUSU.S. Citizenship status is required. No clearance needed but needs to have ability to obtain a Common Access Card (CAC) to access government systems.Desired SkillsExperience with VHDL, FPGA design and coding, firmware and embedded softwareExperience with analyzing system parameters to ensure requirements are met using analytical toolsExperience with MATLAB Experience with performing trade studies, recommending solutions and identifying potential vendors Experience with developing bill of material required to produce product and initiate the purchasing process and monitor progress Experience with collecting and reporting time and material estimates based on requirements.Required EducationRequires a degree in Science Technology Engineering or Math (STEM) with emphasis in RF design and a minimum of 4+ years of experience 151387

Senior Buyer  (86800) - Richardson, TX - Inogen, Inc. Jobs

Jobs




Senior Buyer  (86800) - Richardson, TX

Toggle navigation








Senior Buyer  (86800) 

JobsLogin 












 Operations Richardson, TX, USA Full Time 



Email Me Similar Jobs Email Me This Job



ABOUT INOGEN Inogen was founded in 2001 to improve quality of life and increase freedom and independence for oxygen therapy users. Inogen is innovation in oxygen therapy. The Inogen mission is to improve freedom and independence for oxygen therapy patients through innovative products and services. Inogen is a manufacturer and Accredited Homecare Provider.
Inogen is focused on quality care, continuous improvement, and outstanding customer satisfaction. We are a stable, USA based company dedicated to providing an exciting and rewarding career to our employees. We completed a successful Initial Public Offering on the NASDAQ in 2014 and have demonstrated substantial growth over the last five years. Our work environment is casual yet high performing, and we are looking for seriously talented, motivated, and fast-paced professionals to join our team.
JOB DESCRIPTION 
Coordinates activities involved with procuring goods and services such as modules, components, floorstock, equipment, tools, parts, and supplies for the organization.  Responsible for source selection and procurement functions directly associated with the Company's needs for indirect materials and services, fixed assets and tooling, and select production materials and services.  These products and services are to be secured at cost quality, and delivery competitive levels consistent with Company policy and performance standards.  The position is further responsible for the timely planning, scheduling of receipt and inventory control of the products and services as assigned consistent with MRP requirements or as appropriately concluded with a requisitioner.
Key Competencies:
Negotiates with vendors for all materials, supplies, equipment and services used by the Company.
Coordinates with Supply Chain organization on approving new suppliers.
Supports production plan with accurate, on time delivery of necessary materials using MRP. 
Establish and maintain effective supplier relationships and identify alternate sources for material.
Work closely with production on all scheduling issues. 
Resolve general problems with suppliers (i.e. - receiving errors, invoicing problems, etc.)
Ensure inventory accuracy at local facility through cycle counting and transaction verification
Assist with any other duties as assigned.
Monitor supplier performance / work with QA to certify suppliers.
Negotiates blanket purchase orders when appropriate and monitors cost during the time period.
Tracks supplier performance related to defined quality metrics (and helps to define those metrics.)
Actively interfaces with client service, engineering and quality.
Actively participates in MRB meetings.
Actively participates in ISO audit recertification process.
Lead and participate in cost reduction projects.
Facilitate technical discussions between engineering and suppliers.
 
 
Do you possess these abilities?
Must have strong work ethic.
Excellent oral and written communication skills required. 
MRP implementation experience.
MRP systems knowledge required (Preferably with Excel / Alliance and/or Great Plains.)
ISO 9000 skills recommended.
Attention to detail is required. 
Effective conflict resolution. 
Analytical & problem-solving skills & ability to multitask. 
Solutions-oriented problem solver. 
Excellent planning, communication and organizational skills. 
Ability to effectively interface with different departments within the company.
Requirements:
Operates at a task + project level for select projects which are specifically assigned to them.
Associates degree in Business Management, Industrial Management, Logistics, or related technical discipline, required.
5-10 years of experience in purchasing and inventory management, required. Preferably in medical device manufacturing. 
3 years' experience in production material planning, required.
APICs certification Supply Chain Professional, preferred. 
Intermediate knowledge/proficiency in Microsoft Office, required.
Advanced Excel skills, required. 
MRP Systems experience, required. Preferably with Alliance and/or Great Plains, preferred. 
A combination of training, education and experience that is equivalent to the qualifications listed above and that provides the required knowledge, skills, and abilities.
WHY INOGEN Inogen is a dynamic company that is not only focused on quality care of patients, but is also committed to being a top employer.  Each of Inogen' s offices have a casual culture that supports employees being responsible and developing professionals.
We offer competitive salaries and a robust benefit package:
Employee Stock Purchase Plan 401 (K) plan available for all employees Health, dental, vision insurance Flexible spending accounts and wellness discount program Life Insurance Long Term Disability Robust paid time off and 8 paid holidays Employee Assistance Program
See the Inogen Team in action:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dKoTMeJf5J4
 
Inogen Where we go to work hard to positively impact people's lives
 
Inogen is an equal opportunity employer.  We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other legally protected characteristics. The EEO is the Law poster and its supplement are available here: http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/ofccpost.htm; http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/OFCCP_EEO_Supplement_Final_JRF_QA_508c.pdf.  The pay transparency policy is available here: http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/pdf/EO13665_PrescribedNondiscriminationPostingLanguage_JRFQA508c.pdf. 
Inogen is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities.  If you need a reasonable accommodation because of a disability for any part of the employment process, please send an e-mail to recruiting@inogen.net or call (972) 616-5668 and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information.

Backend Web Engineer

Share it:








































Backend Web Engineer

Department:
              Platforms and  Infrastructure
            
Location:
              Boston, Santa Barbara, Seattle
            

Req#:
              5666
            

At Sonos, we're passionate about creating the finest HiFi audio experiences in the world for our customers.  From installation to listening to sharing, the customer experience is everything.  Keeping the music playing is what the Customer Care team is all about, and the engineering branch of the customer care team enables us to keep it playing loud. Come help us build out the next generation platform for the Sonos customer care experience.  You'll have a direct impact on the business, advancing a major component of our core strategy.  You’ll be making it easy for people to use our products, to help them when there is a problem, and remain connected to the community they love.




About You


More than a candidate that checks every box, we’re looking for people who are excited to work, learn, and grow at Sonos—no matter their background or how they identify. If that’s you, we hope you’ll apply for this role.
You want to be part of a team.
You come with new ideas and a unique point of view. You look forward to collaborating with a diverse team of individuals. You assume everyone’s best intentions, welcome a healthy debate, and embrace differing opinions. You eagerly seek and give help. Transparency tops your list of values, and you proactively contribute to a culture of respect and inclusion.
You enjoy a challenge.
Inquisitive and focused, you see every challenge as an opportunity. You’re ambitious and comfortable making mistakes because you learn from them and bounce back quickly. You would rather create the future than wait for it. You prioritize long-term value over short-term objectives.
You love to listen.
You approach every interaction with curiosity and a desire to understand. You want to make a positive impact in the world. You’re passionate about culture and know the power that music, film, podcasts, games, and stories have to bring people together.


What You’ll Do 

Responsibilities: You build, test, harden and scale web experiences built with proven JavaScript frameworks that help our care team support their customers.You know the power of the application is often in the API, and you’ve built RESTful APIs that power fantastic web experiences.  You’ve got skills in NoSQL document databases like Mongo or DynamoDB.You write clear, reliable, maintainable code with an understanding of web standards and best practices.You have extremely strong technical aptitude, and keep up-to-date on the current technologies.

Skills You’ll Need

Qualifications: • A minimum of 3+ years of professional software development experience.• BS in Computer Science or related field.• Programming with a modern Javascript framework (Vue, React, Angular, etc.). • You know how source control works and you can’t live without it, you are test-first, and you know that going fast means getting things right at the start.• Proven ability to get projects out the door with high quality, on tight timelines. • Experienced with DynamoDB, MongoDB or another NoSQL database. Desired Qualifications:• Web or product design experience.• Must have experience building RESTful API’s with with Node.js and ES6 or Typescript.• A background or understanding of physical networking or hardware design and service would add significant value.• Process or manufacturing engineering experience in a customer electronics environment.

More About Sonos


Sonos is a sound experience company. We pioneered multiroom wireless audio, made it sound amazing, and changed the way people listen, making it effortless for them to enjoy what they want, where they want, how they want.
Today we continue empowering listeners by developing new technologies, thoughtfully designing products, expanding our software platform, and crafting brilliant sound experiences while participating in a culture that values respect, transparency, collaboration, and ownership.
Together we’re working to positively impact the world and inspire everyone to listen better—because listening brings people together, builds understanding, drives change, and makes us happier.
Notice to European Job Applicants: Information you submit as a part of your job application will be used in accordance with Sonos EU Job Applicant Privacy Notice.
Notice to U.S. Job Applicants: Sonos is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other legally protected characteristics.
Follow the links to review the EEO is the Law poster and its supplement. The pay transparency policy is available here. Sonos is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities. If you need a reasonable accommodation because of a disability for any part of the employment process, please send an e-mail to accommodations@sonos.com and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information.

If you’re ready to take on a fresh challenge, grow your career and contribute to making the world a safer place, Raytheon is ready to help you achieve your goals. Join our team and get the opportunity and support to find purpose, thrive and succeed.





Notice: Please be aware of suspicious recruiting emails and text messages that attempt to collect your confidential information. Raytheon conducts all electronic correspondence using e-mail addresses that end in “Raytheon.com”, “Raytheon.co.uk”, “Raytheon.com.au” or “brassring.com”. To report fraud please go to: https://www.ic3.gov.











Sr Principal Systems Engr
Aurora, Colorado

Overview

Raytheon delivers innovative technology to make the world a safer place. Our expertise in cyber, analytics and automation allow us to reach beyond what others think is possible to underpin national security and give our global customers unique solutions to solve the most pressing modern challenges -- from the cyber domain to automated operations, and from intelligent transportation solutions to creating clear insight from large volumes of data. Our leaders must have the ability to understand, embrace and operate in a multicultural world -- in the marketplace and the workplace. We strive to hire people who reflect our communities and embrace diversity and inclusion to advance our culture, develop our employees, and grow our business.

Full-time
Entry to Senior level

Glassdoor 2017 Best Places to Interview: Candidate's Choice

Back to Job Navigation (Trending)


Rewards




401(k) / Retirement Plans
Employer Matching, if you elect to enroll company matches up to 3%.



Work / Life Balance
Raytheon appreciates work/life balance. Employees can work 9 hours a day every week and received every other Friday off, as long as departmental/manager approval is obtained. Accrued paid time off monthly and paid holiday time.



Career Development
At Raytheon, we foster an inclusive culture of professional development. We support a variety of developmental opportunities including: Mentoring programs, Skills Development, Leadership Development, Rotational job assignments, and Continuous Improvement, all of which contribute to advancement of our employee’s capabilities.



Paid Time Off
Accrue paid time off monthly. Receive 12 holidays per year including the week between Christmas and New Year’s Day.



Relocation Assistance
Select technical positions are eligible for relocation packages. See specific job description for eligibility requirements.



Parental Leave
Raytheon offers all eligible employees up to three weeks paid parental leave for the birth or adoption of a child (separate from paid maternity leave or Family & Medical Leave Act).



Back to Job Navigation (Rewards)



Responsibilities


Would you like to work in a collaborative environment at a state of the art facility in Colorado? Then join our Intelligence, Information and Services (IIS) team of smart people solving problems that make the world a safer place and help to secure our great nation! Come support those who provide us with all the freedoms we enjoy. Our facility in Aurora, CO offers amenities that create work and life balance. On site we have a 24/7 fitness facility, health center, cafeteria, collaboration rooms and dynamic break areas for easy conversation and socialization. Additionally, employee appreciation lunches, bonus opportunities, and great benefits that include medical, dental, vision, 401K match, flexible work schedules, are just a few of the reasons people come to work atIntelligence, Information and Services (IIS)! Click here to view a brief video and learn more: https://youtu.be/YNuZN0vyzHgIntelligence, Information and Services (IIS) is seeking a Senior Principal Systems Engineer with experience in design, development, integration and sustainment of satellite ground systems including a broad knowledge of ground architectures, concept of operations, requirements and operations.  Candidate must possess influential leadership skills to guide teams composed of program technical experts. The candidate will help lead both sustainment, training, and future evolution of the current operational ground segment.Responsibilities:Provide technical impact assessments to customer Requests For Change (RFCs)Develop and effectively present briefing material to senior Intelligence, Information and Services (IIS) leaders and customerManage schedules and changes to ensure personnel have up to date and accurate informationSupport the development of capacity based capability and integration into currently deployed ground segmentLead team on projects producing upgrades, as directed by the Government.Analyze new and complex project related problems and create innovative solutions involving scheduling, methodology, and external support.Support Government customer to establish long- and short-range plans and objectives for release production, including candidate change prioritization and selection, systems integration and other related activities.Support the Government’s risk management processes, including risk identification and mitigation.Prepare and maintain SDRLs, as required.Interact with external community on requests for pursuit development, platform advocacy and contractual improvements, as well as CONOPs and requirements for future changes in conjunction with program leadership.Oversee plans, process development, and compliance IAW with Customer direction and the SOW.Ensure accurate flow-down of Systems Engineering Approach and Integration, Verification and Validation approach across the IPT.Perform systems engineering activities in support of on-going programs Work with external industry and Govt. stakeholders in the resolution of engineering systems issuesDevelop and maintain requirements for systems and subsystemsPrepare for and conduct design reviewsWork within and coordinate systems engineering activities across the customer, supplier and internal IPTClearance Requirement:  Must be a US Citizens with a current/active TS/SCI w/CI poly.This position is eligible for a Sign on Bonus up to $40K for a candidate with a current TS/SCI that can be verified and hired at Intelligence, Information and Services (IIS).Required Skills: Active Top Secret/SCI w/ CI Poly Level security clearanceBachelor degree and at least Ten (10+) years demonstrated experience in systems engineering, software engineering or related engineering discipline;Experience with following systems engineering functions:       -CONOPS development       -Requirements development and management       -Architecture       -System design       -Interface definition and control       -Integration and test to include test planning and procedure development6+ years of engineering management experience with demonstrated engineering leadership Demonstrated self-starter – proactive in determining goals and objectives and pursuing the necessary course of action. Demonstrated ability to establish and maintain good working relationship with all levels of the organization, including government customers, contractors, and program PMO/IPTs/CPTs;Demonstrated understanding of the systems engineering lifecycle in support of software development, avionics systems development or sustainment activities;Excellent written and oral communication skills;Experience with Microsoft Office suite of tools, particularly Excel, Project, and PowerPoint;Desired Skills:Demonstrated experience working directly with the customerProfessionally represent Intelligence, Information and Services (IIS) in external forums and customer reviewsOperate with minimal oversight and direction by managementExperience with requirements management using DOORS or similar requirements management toolKnowledge of software development lifecycle models (waterfall and Agile) and program lifecycle modesAbility to the identify, manage, and mitigate technical riskDemonstrated ability to successfully lead/managed a multi-disciplinary project/team Six Sigma Certification Program Management Leadership Level 6 certifiedEducation Requirements:Requires a degree in Science, Technology, Engineering or Mathematics (STEM) and a minimum of 10+ years relevant experience This position requires a U.S. Person who is eligible to obtain any required Export Authorization  152834

Senior Business Systems Analyst

Department:
              Platforms and  Infrastructure
            
Location:
              Santa Barbara, Seattle
            

Req#:
              5663
            

The Senior Business Systems Analyst (BSA) works closely with business partners to gain in-depth understanding of processes, services and context in which the business operates.  The BSA is responsible for implementing current and future business requirements through systems capabilities. The primary focus of this role will be on systems and processes related to service contracts, recurring billing (subscriptions) and revenue.  The ideal candidate will have a robust blend of systems, process and project management experience combined with a track record of delivering successful implementations of processes and platforms.   




About You


More than a candidate that checks every box, we’re looking for people who are excited to work, learn, and grow at Sonos—no matter their background or how they identify. If that’s you, we hope you’ll apply for this role.
You want to be part of a team.
You come with new ideas and a unique point of view. You look forward to collaborating with a diverse team of individuals. You assume everyone’s best intentions, welcome a healthy debate, and embrace differing opinions. You eagerly seek and give help. Transparency tops your list of values, and you proactively contribute to a culture of respect and inclusion.
You enjoy a challenge.
Inquisitive and focused, you see every challenge as an opportunity. You’re ambitious and comfortable making mistakes because you learn from them and bounce back quickly. You would rather create the future than wait for it. You prioritize long-term value over short-term objectives.
You love to listen.
You approach every interaction with curiosity and a desire to understand. You want to make a positive impact in the world. You’re passionate about culture and know the power that music, film, podcasts, games, and stories have to bring people together.


What You’ll Do 

Responsibilities:Work with business partners to understand and design end to end business processes.Define and implement systems to optimally support business processes.Lead projects, manage scope; oversee schedules to ensure on-target project deliveryIdentify, create and facilitate process design changes by conducting business and systems process analysis and design at a complex levelCollaborate with developers to implement custom requirements or integrationsProvide necessary guidance to testers during QA processElicit and clearly document business and systems requirementsUnderstand and negotiate needs and expectations of multiple stakeholdersManage implementations of new systems capabilities and processesSupport system conversions, upgrades, enhancements

Skills You’ll Need

Qualifications:Must have experience working with recurring revenue systems, including but not limited to B2B or B2C subscription modelsMust have experience working on large scale projects as well as handling day-to-day operational requests from the businessStrong project management skills and ability to successfully manage across functionsMust have excellent communications skills and be able to build strong relationshipsProficiency with SQL, Business and Office Applications suitesAble to work with ambiguity and help drive a path forward5-10 years of direct experience as a BSA with increasing scope and complexityPreferred Experience:Experience with recurring billing/revenue modelsPrior direct experience with contract managementPrior experience with ERP or CRM systems

More About Sonos


Sonos is a sound experience company. We pioneered multiroom wireless audio, made it sound amazing, and changed the way people listen, making it effortless for them to enjoy what they want, where they want, how they want.
Today we continue empowering listeners by developing new technologies, thoughtfully designing products, expanding our software platform, and crafting brilliant sound experiences while participating in a culture that values respect, transparency, collaboration, and ownership.
Together we’re working to positively impact the world and inspire everyone to listen better—because listening brings people together, builds understanding, drives change, and makes us happier.
Notice to European Job Applicants: Information you submit as a part of your job application will be used in accordance with Sonos EU Job Applicant Privacy Notice.
Notice to U.S. Job Applicants: Sonos is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other legally protected characteristics.
Follow the links to review the EEO is the Law poster and its supplement. The pay transparency policy is available here. Sonos is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities. If you need a reasonable accommodation because of a disability for any part of the employment process, please send an e-mail to accommodations@sonos.com and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information.

            Intern



         Login to apply
    
















Intern
Santa Ana, CA 


The Energy Management Intern will be a part of Yardi’s growing commercial segment performing analysis to recommend more efficient and sustainable ways to operate businesses with Yardi Energy products related to conservation, analytics, benchmarking, billing, and payment. They will partner with Engineers to identify energy efficient strategies, generate savings models, maintain reporting systems, review client data to identify gaps and errors, and suggest system improvements for future development.
Interns will be responsible for learning and executing the following:

Support operations team in researching electrical utility programs to establish a schedule of specific capabilities, pricing and incentive programs
Support implementation in analyzing fault diagnostics alerts for false positives and nuisance triggers
Support Energy Engineers in data mining and preparation for analysis
Perform high-level calculations, trend analysis, and quality control on all utility types
Enlist support from management and peers to address complex client requests and resolve complex issues

 
Requirements for this internship are as follows:

Senior level status or recent graduate
Minimum GPA of 3.0
Current major in Mechanical or Electrical Engineering
Desire to work and make a contribution in the Energy sector
Ability to work a minimum of 32 hours per week
Ability to meet critical deadlines and prioritize multiple tasks in a fast-paced environment
Collegial, team-oriented disposition with the desire and ability to establish cooperative working relationships with employees at all levels within Yardi, outside of Yardi, and with clients.
Ability to learn new concepts and Yardi programs
Ability to focus and deliver on tasks and goals without distraction
Ability to communicate effectively, cooperatively and persuasively (written and verbal communication)

*ad

By continuing to browse this site you agree to our use of cookies. You can find out more about which cookies we are using or switch them off in settings.
 

 
Accept

 


















 

 Privacy Overview


 Strictly Necessary Cookies


 3rd Party Cookies




 








Privacy Overview

This website uses cookies so that we can provide you with the best user experience possible. Cookie information is stored in your browser and performs functions such as recognising you when you return to our website and helping our team to understand which sections of the website you find most interesting and useful.
You can adjust all of your cookie settings by navigating the tabs on the left hand side.



 
Strictly Necessary Cookies

Strictly necessary cookies must be enabled at all times in order to login and apply to openings.



disable









If you disable this cookie, we will not be able to save your preferences and you will not be able to login to apply for openings. This means that every time you visit this website you will need to enable or disable cookies again.







3rd Party Cookies

This website uses Google Analytics to collect anonymous information such as the number of visitors to the site, and the most popular pages.
Keeping this cookie enabled helps us to improve our website.



disable









Please enable Strictly Necessary Cookies first so that we can save your preferences!












Enable All
Save Changes

 











 



 
Senior Accountant (63912) - Goleta, CA - Inogen, Inc. Jobs








 














Home
Jobs




Senior Accountant (63912) - Goleta, CA

Toggle navigation








Senior Accountant (63912) 

JobsLogin 












 Finance & Accounting Goleta, CA, USA Full Time 



Email Me Similar Jobs Email Me This Job



ABOUT INOGEN Inogen was founded in 2001 to improve quality of life and increase freedom and independence for oxygen therapy users. Inogen is innovation in oxygen therapy. The Inogen mission is to improve freedom and independence for oxygen therapy patients through innovative products and services. Inogen is a manufacturer and Accredited Homecare Provider.
Inogen is focused on quality care, continuous improvement, and outstanding customer satisfaction. We are a stable, USA based company dedicated to providing an exciting and rewarding career to our employees. We completed a successful Initial Public Offering on the NASDAQ in 2014 and have demonstrated substantial growth over the last five years. Our work environment is casual yet high performing, and we are looking for seriously talented, motivated, and fast-paced professionals to join our team.
JOB DESCRIPTION 
Supports Accounting department with account analysis, various reconciliations, and monthly close duties.  
Key Competencies:
Perform variety of month-end closing procedures including preparation of account reconciliations and related journal entries.
Review lower level Accountants' work.
Analyze financial statement accounts, identify unusual trends or erroneous entries, and verify accuracy of transactions and balances.
Evaluate and maintain asset and liability accounts.
Develop and implement procedures to streamline month-end close and other finance activities.
Research issues that flow through to the general ledger from subledgers and systems and interact with other departments as needed to resolve the root cause of any problems.
Ensure compliance with accounting policies and procedures across all departments.
Offer/initiate/implement recommendations for improved efficiencies or stronger internal controls.
Assist with various projects that are assigned to the Finance Department.
Do you possess these abilities?
Solid accounting knowledge including GAAP.
Strong analytical skills needed for assessing current processes and initiating/executing recommendations for minimizing costs and creating efficiencies.
Ability to take direction and communicate effectively with employees at all level of organization.
Experience with financial accounting software and MRP/ERP systems is a plus.
Solid knowledge of Microsoft Excel and other Microsoft Office applications.
Experience with Oracle EBS is a plus.
Work Conditions:
Office Environment
Requirements:
CPA preferred.
7+ years of experience in the field or related area.
4-year bachelor's degree in Accounting, Finance, or related field of study.
Consideration given to equivalent combinations.
 
WHY INOGEN Inogen is a dynamic company that is not only focused on quality care of patients, but is also committed to being a top employer.  Each of Inogen' s offices have a casual culture that supports employees being responsible and developing professionals.
We offer competitive salaries and a robust benefit package:
Employee Stock Purchase Plan 401 (K) plan available for all employees Health, dental, vision insurance Flexible spending accounts and wellness discount program Life Insurance Long Term Disability Robust paid time off and 8 paid holidays Employee Assistance Program
See the Inogen Team in action:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dKoTMeJf5J4
 
Inogen Where we go to work hard to positively impact people's lives
 
Inogen is an equal opportunity employer.  We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other legally protected characteristics. The EEO is the Law poster and its supplement are available here: http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/ofccpost.htm; http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/OFCCP_EEO_Supplement_Final_JRF_QA_508c.pdf.  The pay transparency policy is available here: http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/pdf/EO13665_PrescribedNondiscriminationPostingLanguage_JRFQA508c.pdf. 
Inogen is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities.  If you need a reasonable accommodation because of a disability for any part of the employment process, please send an e-mail to recruiting@inogen.net or call (972) 616-5668 and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information.
 
 

Inogen, Inc.
https://inogen.applicantpro.com

Entry Level Systems Software Test Engineer

Overview

Raytheon delivers innovative technology to make the world a safer place. Our expertise in cyber, analytics and automation allow us to reach beyond what others think is possible to underpin national security and give our global customers unique solutions to solve the most pressing modern challenges -- from the cyber domain to automated operations, and from intelligent transportation solutions to creating clear insight from large volumes of data. Our leaders must have the ability to understand, embrace and operate in a multicultural world -- in the marketplace and the workplace. We strive to hire people who reflect our communities and embrace diversity and inclusion to advance our culture, develop our employees, and grow our business.

Full-time
Entry to Senior level

Glassdoor 2017 Best Places to Interview: Candidate's Choice

Rewards




401(k) / Retirement Plans
Employer Matching, if you elect to enroll company matches up to 3%.



Work / Life Balance
Raytheon appreciates work/life balance. Employees can work 9 hours a day every week and received every other Friday off, as long as departmental/manager approval is obtained. Accrued paid time off monthly and paid holiday time.



Career Development
At Raytheon, we foster an inclusive culture of professional development. We support a variety of developmental opportunities including: Mentoring programs, Skills Development, Leadership Development, Rotational job assignments, and Continuous Improvement, all of which contribute to advancement of our employee’s capabilities.



Paid Time Off
Accrue paid time off monthly. Receive 12 holidays per year including the week between Christmas and New Year’s Day.



Relocation Assistance
Select technical positions are eligible for relocation packages. See specific job description for eligibility requirements.



Parental Leave
Raytheon offers all eligible employees up to three weeks paid parental leave for the birth or adoption of a child (separate from paid maternity leave or Family & Medical Leave Act).



Back to Job Navigation (Rewards)



Responsibilities


Raytheon Information Intelligence Systems (IIS) site in Aurora, Colorado has many exciting programs currently under development in the Navigation Weather and Services (NWS) and the C2, Space and Intelligence (CSI)product lines. A few of the currently active programs in the NWS area include: The Space and Weather Systems Raytheon team, responsible for full life cycle engineering on state-of-the-art environmental, commercial, and sensing systems for government and commercial applications. These projects include Joint Polar Satellite Systems (JPSS), James Webb Space Telescope (JWST), Earth Observation Systems (EOS), and other exciting programs. And in 2010, RTN was awarded the GPS advanced operational control segment (GPS OCX) for the United States Air Force to develop their next generation ground control system for flying and managing the legacy and next generation GPS satellite fleet!  The C2, Space and Intelligence (CSI)Raytheon team is responsible for full life cycle engineering for government and commercial applications. CSI opportunities are primarily on classified programs that support the intelligence community.  Capabilities include ground systems for GEOINT and SIGINT systems, large-scale data processing and exploitation storage architectures and high performance data handling and processing systems. Additionally, CSI provides expertise in large-scale systems development, integration and deployment of high-performance SIGINT and GEOINT systems, missions and resource management, information management, visualization, knowledge discovery and advanced analytics. Look for yourself and evaluate the many exciting opportunities available on the Raytheon IEO team - a highly successful organization using state of the art technology and focused on a 100% mission success.This position is for an entry level Systems Software Test Engineer with the technical and communication skills needed to support ongoing and emerging programs in our Aurora, CO office. The candidate will support requirement analysis and hierarchical decomposition, development of system architecture and assist in the planning and coordination of system delivery to customer/user site.Key responsibilities for the qualified candidate include:Correction and update of documents, contribute to presentations, support design reviews, support customer requests for information and recommend appropriate configuration, equipment and software changes to satisfy requests and system integration and test support.Candidates must be professional, self-starters and possess a positive attitude.Willingness to learn program/organizational processes and procedures and be willing to recommend improvements to both.Security Clearance & Other Requirements:Qualified applicants will be subject to a security investigation and must meet the requirements to obtain and maintain a TS/SCI government security clearance. Except in rare circumstances, only U.S. citizens are eligible for a security clearance. Required Skills:Comprehends and can utilize the Systems Development Process through system design, integration and testingCompleted software development coursework and can apply basic conceptsCompleted and thoroughly understands coursework in basic systems engineering/systems architecture design theory & process, requirements analysis development, tractability and verificationExperience in Windows and/or LinuxExperience with Java skill setDesired Skills:Computer Science and Software Engineering backgroundsPrevious internship experienceCoursework on technical writing, modern application architectures or methodologiesGood oral and written communication skillsAbility to work in a team environmentRequired Education:Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Systems/Software Engineering or a closely related STEM field. This position requires either a U.S. Person or a Non-U.S. Person who is eligible to obtain any required Export Authorization. 151202

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, age, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected Veteran status.

Reimbursement Advocate  I (95801) - Richardson, TX - Inogen, Inc. Jobs








 














Home
Jobs




Reimbursement Advocate  I (95801) - Richardson, TX

Toggle navigation








Reimbursement Advocate  I (95801) 

JobsLogin 












 Billing Richardson, TX, USA Full Time 



Email Me Similar Jobs Email Me This Job



ABOUT INOGEN Inogen was founded in 2001 to improve quality of life and increase freedom and independence for oxygen therapy users. Inogen is innovation in oxygen therapy. The Inogen mission is to improve freedom and independence for oxygen therapy patients through innovative products and services. Inogen is a manufacturer and Accredited Homecare Provider.
Inogen is focused on quality care, continuous improvement, and outstanding customer satisfaction. We are a stable, USA based company dedicated to providing an exciting and rewarding career to our employees. We completed a successful Initial Public Offering on the NASDAQ in 2014 and have demonstrated substantial growth over the last five years. Our work environment is casual yet high performing, and we are looking for seriously talented, motivated, and fast-paced professionals to join our team.
JOB DESCRIPTION 
Reimbursement Advocate will work with Medicare, Medicaid, Commercial Insurance companies and customers to ensure medical claims are submitted timely, processed, and paid accurately. This includes working payor rejections and denials, obtaining qualifying documentation and authorizations, providing high level customer support, RUL's, updating patient file within all billing systems as required, and following all applicable compliance and regulatory processes, payor guidelines, and Inogen policies and procedures. 
Key Competencies:
Collect payments for outstanding open accounts receivable balances.
Works with Medicare, Medicaid, Commercial Insurance, and Private Pay to ensure medical claims are being processed timely and paid accurately. 
Must meet/exceed daily/weekly production & quality KPI standards.
Ensures all billing systems are updated timely with patient demographics, payer information, and notated appropriately. 
Analyzes payer claim rejections & denials to help determine root cause and prevention of future rejections & denials from reoccurring. 
Gathers, prepares, and submits required information and/or documentation to appeal claim denials.
Uses appropriate write off reason code(s) for writing off balances that are deemed uncollectable.
Responsible for assisting our patients, doctors, customers, and coworkers with billing inquiries at the highest-level support possible. This includes logging into phone queue and updating statuses appropriately. 
Ensures the billing of all claims via electronic or paper to Medicare, Medicaid, and Commercial Insurance payers are being submitted accurately and timely in accordance with Inogen's policy. 
Ensures RUL (Reasonable Usable Lifetime) patients exiting the monthly cap period are in a billable status. 
Responsible for working NME's (New Medicare Eligibility), Payor Changes, Pending Pick-ups, and Stop patients timely. Verifies and evaluates insurance benefits to determine the policy's compatibility with Inogen's services.
Ensures the timely procurement of all required documentation and obtain authorizations in order to prevent future denials.
Ensures that appropriate medical records are maintained according to HIPPA guidelines.
Ensures Inogen's compliance with all state and federal regulations.
Maintain regular and punctual attendance. 
Comply with all company policies and procedures. 
Assist with any other duties as assigned. 
Do you possess these abilities?
A comprehensive understanding of Medicare, Medicaid, and/or Commercial Insurance program rules as it pertains to DME billing.
Ability to take direction and communicate effectively with customers and employees at all level of organization.
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced and dynamically changing organization.
Must have strong work ethic.
Excellent oral and written communication skills required. 
Attention to detail is required. 
Effective conflict resolution. 
Ability to maintain confidentiality and exercise extreme discretion. 
Solutions-oriented problem solver. 
Excellent planning, communication and organizational skills. 
 
Requirements:
Operates at a task level.
Substantial supervision required.
High School diploma or equivalent, required 
0-2 years of Medicare, Medicaid and/or Commercial Insurance experience, required. 
1-year experience in oxygen or HME billing, preferred. 
Basic knowledge/proficiency in Microsoft Office, Oracle, Brightree, Salesforce and New Voice Media, preferred. 
A combination of training, education and experience that is equivalent to the qualifications listed above and that provides the required knowledge, skills, and abilities.
WHY INOGEN Inogen is a dynamic company that is not only focused on quality care of patients, but is also committed to being a top employer.  Each of Inogen' s offices have a casual culture that supports employees being responsible and developing professionals.
We offer competitive salaries and a robust benefit package:
Employee Stock Purchase Plan 401 (K) plan available for all employees Health, dental, vision insurance Flexible spending accounts and wellness discount program Life Insurance Long Term Disability Robust paid time off and 8 paid holidays Employee Assistance Program
See the Inogen Team in action:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dKoTMeJf5J4
 
Inogen Where we go to work hard to positively impact people's lives
 
Inogen is an equal opportunity employer.  We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other legally protected characteristics. The EEO is the Law poster and its supplement are available here: http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/ofccpost.htm; http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/OFCCP_EEO_Supplement_Final_JRF_QA_508c.pdf.  The pay transparency policy is available here: http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/pdf/EO13665_PrescribedNondiscriminationPostingLanguage_JRFQA508c.pdf. 
Inogen is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities.  If you need a reasonable accommodation because of a disability for any part of the employment process, please send an e-mail to recruiting@inogen.net or call (972) 616-5668 and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information.
 
 

Inogen, Inc.
https://inogen.applicantpro.com

Sr Systems Engineer I - Human Factors Engineer
Dulles, Virginia, Richardson, Texas, Aurora, Colorado, Indianapolis, Indiana

Overview

Raytheon delivers innovative technology to make the world a safer place. Our expertise in cyber, analytics and automation allow us to reach beyond what others think is possible to underpin national security and give our global customers unique solutions to solve the most pressing modern challenges -- from the cyber domain to automated operations, and from intelligent transportation solutions to creating clear insight from large volumes of data. Our leaders must have the ability to understand, embrace and operate in a multicultural world -- in the marketplace and the workplace. We strive to hire people who reflect our communities and embrace diversity and inclusion to advance our culture, develop our employees, and grow our business.

Full-time
Entry to Senior level

Rewards

Work / Life Balance

Back to Job Navigation (Rewards)



Responsibilities


Are you looking for an engineering career that is challenging and satisfying? Then join our Raytheon team of engineers solving problems that make the world a safer place and help to secure our great nation! Come support those who provide us with all the freedoms we enjoy.We offer great benefits that include medical, dental, vision, 401K match, flexible work schedule - just to name a few.  Click here to view a brief video and learn more: https://youtu.be/YNuZN0vyzHgRaytheon is looking for a talented Human Factors Engineer to join our Specialty Engineering team.  Specialty Engineering is part of Systems Engineering that complements the technical activities required to deliver a project. It deals with engineering that influence the systems’ design and architecture in terms of performance, safety, usability, reliability, maintainability, availability, supportability, testability, and cost consideration throughout the lifecycle of the product. Specialty Engineering applies methods, standards, and techniques to provide clarification of system requirements to software, hardware, and test personnel to ensure design and architecture considerations are appropriately allocated to the system and horizontally integrated across the development teams. The Specialty Engineering function supports systems engineering activities including trade studies, use case development, requirements definition and derivation, interface definition, and requirement validation and verification. As such, all Specialty Engineers interface with the other Specialty disciplines and logistics engineering functions to ensure integration and continuity in the design and development process.Must be a U.S. Citizen with the ability to obtain and maintain a DoD Top Secret Security ClearanceThe Specialty Team is looking for candidates with experience in this Specialty area:•  Human Factors Engineering/User Experience (UX)As a member of the Specialty Engineering Team, expect a dynamic and demanding environment that values discipline, adherence to processes, and adding value to our customers through our respective disciplines (Human Factors Engineering, System Safety, Reliability Engineering).This position is to support the preliminary and detailed design phases for programs within the Raytheon IIS portfolio that include the following businesses; Cyber and Special Missions (CSM), C2, Space and Intelligence (CSI), Navigation and Modernization Solutions (NMS) and Global Training Solutions (GTS). This position serves as a member of the Raytheon IIS Specialty Engineering Team and supports various programs within a matrix management assignment as directed. Deliverables include, but not limited to, program plans, technical reports, schedules, basis of estimates for new pursuits, and analyses as required to substantiate architectural/design decisions and trade studies.Required Skills: Experience with  Human Factors Engineering practices as derived from MIL-STD-46855APractical understanding and application ofMIL-STD-1472MIL-STD-1474ISO 9241-110/210Ability to produce DoD required documentation consistent with appropriate Data Item Description (DID) , such as:HEPPHSIPPHEDAD-O/MHESARU.S. Citizen with the ability to obtain and maintain a DoD Top Secret Security ClearanceDesired Skills: Current DoD TS/SCI Security Clearance User Experience (UX) and User Interface Design and ability to apply standards and process requirementsMIL-STD-1472MIL-STD-2525JSSG-2010NASA-STD-3000FAA-STD-001MIL-STD-1787AFI 63-112Section 508 Interface AssessabilityUsability Testing (SUS/ScoreCard)Workstation/Facilities DesignAutoCADJack Human ModelingDoD Assessability CriteriaMIL-STD-516 Air Worthiness CriteriaDO-178 Software considerations in Airborne Systems and Equipment CertificationHuman Systems IntegrationSAE 6906Human Performance Modeling/Workload AnalysisExpertise working with Satellite and/or unmanned ground stations, A/C avionics modernization, intelligence communities, FAA, other governmental agenciesEducation Requirements: Bachelor’s Degree in Science, Technology, Engineering, Mathematics, or related STEM degree with minimum of 4 years of relevant experienceMaster’s Degree / PHD in Science, Technology, Engineering, Mathematics, or related STEM degree with minimum of 2 years of relevant experienceThis position requires either a U.S. Person or a Non-U.S. Person who is eligible to obtain any required Export Authorization. 149766
                

                    
                 
                           Raytheon is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, age, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected Veteran status.

If you’re ready to take on a fresh challenge, grow your career and contribute to making the world a safer place, Raytheon is ready to help you achieve your goals. Join our team and get the opportunity and support to find purpose, thrive and succeed.





Notice: Please be aware of suspicious recruiting emails and text messages that attempt to collect your confidential information. Raytheon conducts all electronic correspondence using e-mail addresses that end in “Raytheon.com”, “Raytheon.co.uk”, “Raytheon.com.au” or “brassring.com”. To report fraud please go to: https://www.ic3.gov.











Principal Mechanical Engr - PD Lead
Aurora, Colorado


Apply





Overview
Success Profile

Responsibilities




Overview

Raytheon delivers innovative technology to make the world a safer place. Our expertise in cyber, analytics and automation allow us to reach beyond what others think is possible to underpin national security and give our global customers unique solutions to solve the most pressing modern challenges -- from the cyber domain to automated operations, and from intelligent transportation solutions to creating clear insight from large volumes of data. Our leaders must have the ability to understand, embrace and operate in a multicultural world -- in the marketplace and the workplace. We strive to hire people who reflect our communities and embrace diversity and inclusion to advance our culture, develop our employees, and grow our business.

Full-time
Entry to Senior level

Glassdoor 2017 Best Places to Interview: Candidate's Choice
