Back to Job Navigation (Trending)


Rewards




401(k) / Retirement Plans
Employer Matching, if you elect to enroll company matches up to 3%.



Work / Life Balance
Raytheon appreciates work/life balance. Employees can work 9 hours a day every week and received every other Friday off, as long as departmental/manager approval is obtained. Accrued paid time off monthly and paid holiday time.



Career Development
At Raytheon, we foster an inclusive culture of professional development. We support a variety of developmental opportunities including: Mentoring programs, Skills Development, Leadership Development, Rotational job assignments, and Continuous Improvement, all of which contribute to advancement of our employee’s capabilities.



Paid Time Off
Accrue paid time off monthly. Receive 12 holidays per year including the week between Christmas and New Year’s Day.



Relocation Assistance
Select technical positions are eligible for relocation packages. See specific job description for eligibility requirements.



Parental Leave
Raytheon offers all eligible employees up to three weeks paid parental leave for the birth or adoption of a child (separate from paid maternity leave or Family & Medical Leave Act).



Back to Job Navigation (Rewards)



Responsibilities


Would you like to work in a collaborative environment at a state of the art facility in Colorado? Then join our team of engineers solving problems that make the world a safer place and help to secure our great nation! Come support those who provide us with all the freedoms we enjoy. Our facility in Aurora, CO offers amenities that create work and life balance. On site we have a 24/7 fitness facility, health center, cafeteria, collaboration rooms and dynamic break areas for easy conversation and socialization. Additionally, employee appreciation lunches, bonus opportunities, and great benefits that include medical, dental, vision, 401K match, flexible work schedule - just to name a few.  Click here to view a brief video and learn more: https://youtu.be/YNuZN0vyzHgThe candidate will join the IIS Hardware and Infrastructure Engineering (HW&I) team. Responsibilities include acting as the Team’s Technical lead and supporting the detail design solutions utilizing Drawing Packages such as CREO and AutoCAD for the system infrastructure (network, storage, and computing) for new and revised systems. The position will be a “working lead” role which require some team mentorship and will act as the Point of Contact (POC) to program and organizational leadership for the detail design artifacts to be generated which include drawings using computer assisted design (CAD) systems to prepare design layouts, detail and assembly drawings, and electrical schematics, wiring diagrams, parts list and other related documentation in conformance to appropriate program and/or military specifications.  The candidate may have to prepare specifications, drawings, procedures and related engineering change orders. U.S. Citizenship is required, as the candidate will need the ability to obtain a DOD Secret Security Clearance.Required Skills: • Working lead position that Provides team mentorship and technical guidance on CAD products produced. • Familiarity with CAD modeling tools, such as CREO (Pro/Engineer) and AutoCAD, and related drawing standards• Has strong hands-on familiarity with 2D and 3D drawing types• Strong technical background with high technical aptitude• Strong verbal and written communications and interpersonal skills when working with team members and customers• Self-starter, with the ability to work independently• Has performed Drawing Checker tasks for Design and documentation accuracy to drawing standards• Experience applying and interpreting Geometric Dimensioning and Tolerancing (ANSI Y14.5)• Experience performing tolerance analyses on individual parts and assemblies• Design experience with defense-related products, familiar with common industry and military standards-6 years of related work experienceDesired Skills: • Basic engineering principles as they apply to hardware assemblies• Familiarity with Military and Commercial Drawing Standards, including ASME-Y14.100• Experience in developing Interface Control Drawings, Cable Assembly Drawings, Wiring Diagrams, Installation Drawings, and Rack Elevation Drawings• Knowledge of engineering process documentation (EPIC, ISO and/or CMMI)• Knowledge of configuration management processEducation Requirements: Requires a degree in Science, Technology, Engineering or Mathematics (STEM) and 8+ years of related experience. 151579
                

                    
                 
                           Raytheon is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, age, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected Veteran status.

            Senior Account Executive



         Login to apply
    
















Senior Account Executive
Raleigh, NC 


The Senior Account Executive is responsible for selling Yardi solutions and developing new business and strong prospect relationships within the assigned territory. The Senior Account Executive executes full sales cycles from lead-generation to closing, meets individual sales goals, participates in relevant marketing events, and completes regular product certifications and performance reports.
 
Responsibilities

Heavy prospecting and identifying new sales opportunities for a designated territory
Utilizes extensive knowledge of Yardi products, industry, and competition to present value propositions to clients and/or prospects to develop a sufficient pipeline and meet individual sales goals
Researches, calls, and qualifies each account in assigned territory
Identifies and develops strong relationships with all key decision makers and develops a deep understanding of the business needs for every prospect or client assigned
Conducts in-person or web meetings each month with executive level leadership to deliver roadshow or product demonstrations at the frequency and standard required
Executes full sales cycles, including lead-generation; discovery and goal-setting; pricing, packaging, and positioning; RFP management; contract negotiating; licensing files and closing
Utilizes internal CRM diligently, entering new prospects, recording all client activities, sales opportunities, and forecasts per training guidelines
Participates in marketing events to promote Yardi Systems and our products/services
Reviews individual account and pipeline reports weekly, performance reports monthly, and meets with management monthly to verify proper execution of sales strategy within the assigned territory
Completes annual certifications for assigned products per training guidelines
Expands product knowledge and demonstration skills by presenting solutions to prospects


** This position requires up to 50% of travel **
Requirements

Bachelor’s Degree or commensurate experience
Five plus (5+) years of successful sales experience
Thorough understanding of sales cycle management principles such as lead-generation; discovery and qualification; pricing, packaging, and positioning; proposal development; contract negotiation; and closure
Demonstrated record of generating sales results in the technology / software industry
Extensive presentation and demonstration experience
Strong proven experience using Client Relationship Management (CRM) tools to track and manage prospect/client activity
Yardi domain experience a plus
Industry expertise in property management (multifamily and investment management)
Educational background or experience with accounting principles
Ability to think and act strategically by visualizing new possibilities, challenging assumptions, and recommending the implementation of new ideas or strategies desired
Excellent skills to interface with all levels within the client organization to include individual properties, large portfolios, and other senior leadership and large to mid-sized companies
Excellent skills to effectively execute sales strategies using a consultative approach and relationship building techniques
Initiative and motivation to succeed
Proactive, engaging personality
Ability to understand technical products
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Commitment to utilize corporate sales tools and complete ongoing training
High responsiveness with proven client-centered commitment and focus
Proven strong ability to meet critical deadlines and prioritize multiple tasks in a fast-paced environment
Regular attendance and a regular work schedule is an essential function of this job

*cl 



         Login to apply

Privacy Statement

By continuing to browse this site you agree to our use of cookies. You can find out more about which cookies we are using or switch them off in settings.
 

 
Accept

 


















 

 Privacy Overview


 Strictly Necessary Cookies


 3rd Party Cookies




 








Privacy Overview

This website uses cookies so that we can provide you with the best user experience possible. Cookie information is stored in your browser and performs functions such as recognising you when you return to our website and helping our team to understand which sections of the website you find most interesting and useful.
You can adjust all of your cookie settings by navigating the tabs on the left hand side.



 
Strictly Necessary Cookies

Strictly necessary cookies must be enabled at all times in order to login and apply to openings.



disable









If you disable this cookie, we will not be able to save your preferences and you will not be able to login to apply for openings. This means that every time you visit this website you will need to enable or disable cookies again.







3rd Party Cookies

This website uses Google Analytics to collect anonymous information such as the number of visitors to the site, and the most popular pages.
Keeping this cookie enabled helps us to improve our website.



disable









Please enable Strictly Necessary Cookies first so that we can save your preferences!

Save Changes

            Technical Analyst



         Login to apply
    
















Technical Analyst
Long Island, NY 


Under minimal direction the Technical Analyst performs complex and sophisticated systems analyses to assist new and existing clients with the management of application systems, hardware, and system functional specifications for the use of Yardi software products. The Technical Analyst identifies application issues, customizes software products to client specifications, and serves as an escalation resource.
ESSENTIAL RESPONSIBILITIES

Consults and provides technical direction to users
Assists and supports users with understanding Yardi functional design, configuring Yardi software, and meeting client operational needs
Works collaboratively with clients to identify and define application issues
Evaluates procedures and processes for product use and prepares/evaluates alternative workflow solutions
Creates applications and customizations as needed to implement identified customer solutions
Documents, tests, and creates or modifies computer programs to improve Yardi product functionality
Serves as an escalation resource for complex application systems problems and sophisticated client requests
Validates and documents solution effectiveness through program and quality assurance testing
Collaborates internally with analysts, designers, programmers, sales teams, and marketing teams with a focus on meeting client needs and maintaining high-level customer service standards
Monitors technical advancements, regulations, and best practices relevant to clients in the application of Yardi products
Performs special projects related to department training and client support as well as other duties as assigned

EDUCATION/QUALIFICATIONS/EXPERIENCE

Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Sciences or equivalent

Two (2) years in a software support, analytics, or services role
Advanced knowledge in all the following areas: Microsoft operating and network system operation, Relational databases, and SQL/Oracle language 



DESIRED EDUCATION/QUALIFICATIONS/EXPERIENCE

Experience with HTML/Cloud Services
Understanding of property management industry and best practices
Project management experience
Working knowledge of accounting practices

REQUIRED SKILLS/ABILITIES

Proficiency in SQL
Strong technical computer and database management skills
Excellent independent decision-making and problem-solving skills
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Client-centered commitment and focus
Ability to meet critical deadlines and prioritize multiple tasks in a fast-paced environment
Collegial, team-oriented disposition with the desire and ability to establish cooperative working relationships with employees at all levels within Yardi, outside of Yardi, and with customers
Basic understanding of Yardi’s Voyager software
Basic understanding of the Cafe platform and associated ancillary products

DESIRED SKILLS/ABILITIES

Understanding of property management industry and best practices
Working knowledge of accounting practices
Understanding of project management principles
Understanding of networks and peripherals
Experience with HTML
Understanding of Cloud Services
Understanding of Development
Understanding of network configuration and associated peripherals
Ability to efficiently communicate highly technical topics or solutions to a non-technical audience

WORKING ENVIRONMENT/PHYSICAL DEMANDS 

Ability to work at assigned office location
Schedule flexibility to support superlative customer service in response to client needs
Attend meetings and perform tasks for long periods of time on a computer and on the telephone
Regular attendance and a regular work schedule are essential functions of this job

 *bd

Patient Benefits Advocate  (97094) - Richardson, TX - Inogen, Inc. Jobs








 














Home
Jobs




Patient Benefits Advocate  (97094) - Richardson, TX

Toggle navigation








Patient Benefits Advocate  (97094) 

JobsLogin 












 Billing Richardson, TX, USA Full Time 



Email Me Similar Jobs Email Me This Job



ABOUT INOGEN Inogen was founded in 2001 to improve quality of life and increase freedom and independence for oxygen therapy users. Inogen is innovation in oxygen therapy. The Inogen mission is to improve freedom and independence for oxygen therapy patients through innovative products and services. Inogen is a manufacturer and Accredited Homecare Provider.
Inogen is focused on quality care, continuous improvement, and outstanding customer satisfaction. We are a stable, USAbased company dedicated to providing an exciting and rewarding career to our employees. We completed a successful Initial Public Offering on the NASDAQ in 2014 and have demonstrated substantial growth over the last five years. Our work environment is casual yet highperforming, and we are looking for seriously talented, motivated, and fast-paced professionals to join our team.
JOB DESCRIPTION The Patient Benefits Advocate works withing the Benefits Management Business Unit and is the key stakeholder for verifying insurance coverage for potential new patients (both switch-out and new referrals). This position works Prior Authorization requests and verification rechecks. The successful person will meet or exceed daily/weekly goals and carry out Inogen's values.
Our Billing team is focused on continuous improvement so we welcome deep thinkers who analyze the root cause and recommend corrective action.
Are you a go-getter, energetic, and persuasive individual that enjoys problem solving?  Have you spent 1-3 years in the healthcare billing arena?  If that is you, let us know!
Key Competencies:
Excellent customer service skills, analytical and problem solving skills, close attention to detail
A complete understanding of Medicare and Private insurance program rules is preferred
Experience in a successful verification of all Medical Insurances is preferred
Experience in operating appropriate computer hardware and billing software is preferred
Qualifications:
Bachelor degree preferred
3 years of experience in Oxygen or HME billing
3 years of experience in working with Hospice organizations and full working knowledge of Oxygen Medical documentation requirements
Experience with Oracle preferred
All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, pregnancy, marital status, national origin, citizenship status, disability, military status, genetic predisposition or carrier status or any other legally protected characteristic.
 
WHY INOGEN Inogen is a dynamic company that is not only focused on quality care of patients, but is also committed to being a top employer.  Each of Inogen's offices has a casual culture that supports employees being responsible and developing professionals.
 
We offer competitive salaries and a robust benefit package:
• Employee Stock Purchase Plan • 401 (K) plan available for all employees • Health, dental, vision insurance • Flexible spending accounts and wellness discount program • Life Insurance • Long Term Disability • Robust paid time off and 8 paid holidays • Employee Assistance Program
 
Inogen – Where we go to work hard to positively impact people's lives
 
See the Inogen Team in action:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dKoTMeJf5J4#t=23
 
Inogen is an equal opportunity employer.  We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other legally protected characteristics. The EEO is the Law poster and its supplement are available here: http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/ofccpost.htm; http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/OFCCP_EEO_Supplement_Final_JRF_QA_508c.pdf.  The pay transparency policy is available here: http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/pdf/EO13665_PrescribedNondiscriminationPostingLanguage_JRFQA508c.pdf. 
Inogen is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities.  If you need a reasonable accommodation because of a disability for any part of the employment process, please send an e-mail to recruiting@inogen.net or call (972) 616-5668 and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information.

            Associate Technical Account Manager



         Login to apply
    
















Associate Technical Account Manager
Santa Ana, CA 


Associate Technical Account Managers at Yardi will provide consultative, implementation and technical support to a group of assigned Yardi clients in order to manage business operations and financial accounting functions in Yardi’s Voyager software.
Responsibilities

Implements the Yardi suite of software products by assisting clients with system implementation, training, and technical support
Researches, analyzes and resolves software issues
Supports software product customization based on client requirements
Performs data mapping and conversions
Performs system and business process reviews and other service reviews and makes recommendations on best practices
Works on a regular basis with Yardi internal resource teams to include: training, conversion, sales and development

Requirements

Bachelor’s degree in Economics, Business, Math, Statistics or Information Management preferred
Experience setting and managing client expectations
Superior verbal and written communication skills
Project Management, Accounting, or Property Management experience/background
Solid Proficiency in MS Office Suite and Outlook
Knowledge in three of the following areas: Property Management, Accounting, Microsoft Windows, Technical Support, SQL, HTML/ASP
Prior experience with property management software or real estate software highly desirable
Prior experience with Yardi software highly desirable
Regular attendance and a regular work schedule is an essential function of this job.

 Privacy Overview

 3rd Party Cookies




 








Privacy Overview

This website uses cookies so that we can provide you with the best user experience possible. Cookie information is stored in your browser and performs functions such as recognising you when you return to our website and helping our team to understand which sections of the website you find most interesting and useful.
You can adjust all of your cookie settings by navigating the tabs on the left hand side.



 
Strictly Necessary Cookies

Strictly necessary cookies must be enabled at all times in order to login and apply to openings.



disable









If you disable this cookie, we will not be able to save your preferences and you will not be able to login to apply for openings. This means that every time you visit this website you will need to enable or disable cookies again.







3rd Party Cookies

This website uses Google Analytics to collect anonymous information such as the number of visitors to the site, and the most popular pages.
Keeping this cookie enabled helps us to improve our website.



disable









Please enable Strictly Necessary Cookies first so that we can save your preferences!

If you’re ready to take on a fresh challenge, grow your career and contribute to making the world a safer place, Raytheon is ready to help you achieve your goals. Join our team and get the opportunity and support to find purpose, thrive and succeed.





Notice: Please be aware of suspicious recruiting emails and text messages that attempt to collect your confidential information. Raytheon conducts all electronic correspondence using e-mail addresses that end in “Raytheon.com”, “Raytheon.co.uk”, “Raytheon.com.au” or “brassring.com”. To report fraud please go to: https://www.ic3.gov.











Data Engineer
Dulles, Virginia, Richardson, Texas, State College, Pennsylvania, Boston, Massachusetts


Apply





Overview
Responsibilities
Success Profile
Rewards
Trending




Overview

What does it take to make the world a safer place? It takes delivering innovative technology and collaborating with some of the finest talent in the engineering field. Whether you’re a software engineer or a mechanical engineer, at Raytheon you’ll grow a varied and rewarding career. And you’ll be supported with a comprehensive and competitive benefits package that promotes work/life. If you’re ready to take on today’s big challenges, discover a world of opportunity at Raytheon.

America’s Best Large Employers by Forbes
Career & Development Opportunities
Full-time
Entry, Mid, Senior level




Back to Job Navigation (Overview)


Responsibilities


The Raytheon Intelligence, Information and Services (IIS) Capabilities and Technologies (C&T) group leads interdisciplinary applied research and development (R&D) for all of IIS. R&D ranges from concept development, trade studies, and rapid prototyping for customized engineering products and services. We develop solutions to solve customer needs as well as plan future capabilities and technology roadmaps.Raytheon is looking to fill a several data engineering positions in Boston, MA or Dulles, VA. The candidate will join a small, agile group of engineers focused on applying state of the art data science (DS), data engineering (DE), and artificial intelligence (AI) approaches to a variety of customer problems. Modern DS/DE/AI approaches are inherently interdisciplinary, integrating concepts from Computer Science, statistics, and math among other fields.  Therefore, the candidate must have both technical depth in data engineering combined with interdisciplinary breadth to integrate concepts from other fields.  Raytheon is looking for data engineers who will be able to work with software development teams and data scientists to develop data pipeline architectures capable of handling complex data sets quickly and securely as well as to productize data science solutions. The ideal candidate will be able to advise product teams as the best practices in handling large and complex data sets and help data scientists convert proof of concept solutions into fast and efficient production-ready systems.Typical tasks may include:Work with product teams and data scientists to improve the efficiency and speed of computational modelsCreate and maintain data pipeline architectures to automate the processing of large and complex data setsTransform complex analytical models into fast, scalable, and production-ready solutionsStand-up and maintain and update data processing infrastructuresWork with product teams and data scientists to develop a wide variety of data productsRequirements:8 years of related experienceHighly proficient in SQL to include schema design, database definition, and advanced queriesExperience with MPP data architectures such as Kafka, Spark, or HadoopExperience with scripting languages for automating repetitive tasksExperience building optimizing data pipelines, architectures, and data setsAbility to and experience with creating automated data pipelines for complex systemsExtensive Linux server management backgroundAbility to work with product teams, data scientists, and other stakeholders as well asAssist product teams with data-related technical issues and support their data infrastructureExperience in managing a variety of Amazon Web Services products.Excellent verbal and written communications skills along with the ability to present technical data and approaches to both technical and non-technical audiencesExperience in working with NoSQL databasesBackground designing and developing dashboards and other data productsU.S. Citizen and have the ability to obtain a U.S. Security ClearanceDesired Skills:Directly applicable experience and familiarity with the Air Force and or Air Operating CentersRequired Education (including Major):B.S. in Computer Science, Data Science, Math, or similar quantitative focused degree. Advanced degree preferred.IISAOC 151778
Business Unit Profile
                        
                        Intelligence, Information and Services delivers innovative technology to make the world a safer place. Our expertise in cyber, analytics and automation allow us to reach beyond what others think is possible to underpin national security and give our global customers unique solutions to solve the most pressing modern challenges -- from the cyber domain to automated operations, and from intelligent transportation and training solutions to creating clear insight from large volumes of data. IIS operates at nearly 550 sites in 80 countries, and is headquartered in Dulles, Virginia. The business area generated $6.2 billion in 2018 revenues. As a global business, our leaders must have the ability to understand, embrace and operate in a multicultural world -- in the marketplace and the workplace. We strive to hire people who reflect our communities and embrace diversity and inclusion to advance our culture, develop our employees, and grow our business.
Relocation Eligible 
                        
                        Yes
Clearance Type

Quote



Felicia Jackson is regional vice president of RAYVETS, Raytheon's employee group for veterans and those who support them. After 24 years in the Air Force, she started a new career at Raytheon. "I wanted to go where people would support me," she told us.









Rewards




401(k) / Retirement Plans
Employer Matching, if you elect to enroll company matches up to 3%.



Work / Life Balance
Raytheon supports a variety of flexible work arrangements including compressed work weeks, flextime, job sharing, 9/80, reduced hours and telecommuting.



Career Development
At Raytheon, we foster an inclusive culture of professional development. We support a variety of developmental opportunities including: Mentoring programs, Skills Development, Leadership Development, Rotational job assignments, and Continuous Improvement, all of which contribute to advancement of our employee’s capabilities.



Paid Time Off
Accrue paid time off monthly. Receive 10-12 holidays per year with some locations shutting down the week between Christmas and New Year’s Day.



Relocation Assistance
Select technical positions are eligible for relocation packages. See specific job description for eligibility requirements.



Parental Leave
Raytheon offers all eligible employees up to three weeks paid parental leave for the birth or adoption of a child (separate from paid maternity leave or Family & Medical Leave Act).

Sonos | Fixed Asset Accountant Santa Barbara CA

English
                                                










Sonos






Login

Returning Candidate?
Log back in!







                      Apply for this job online


Share it:








































Fixed Asset Accountant

Department:
              Finance
            
Location:
              Santa Barbara
            

Req#:
              5749
            

As a Fixed Asset Accountant on the Sonos Corporate Accounting team, your primary responsibility will be the accounting for global fixed assets. You will be the “go-to” person for all things fixed assets and will interact with colleagues across all regions (Americas, EMEA, APAC), as well as various cross-functional departments to continuously improve the quality and efficiency of our fixed asset process. In addition to fixed assets, you will be responsible for a variety of GL functions, including but not limited to preparing journal entries, maintaining balance sheet schedules and ledgers, performing account reconciliations, and assisting in the global monthly close process. The Fixed Asset Accountant will play a key role in the accounting organization around SOX compliance, process improvement, and standardization of processes globally. 




About You


More than a candidate that checks every box, we’re looking for people who are excited to work, learn, and grow at Sonos—no matter their background or how they identify. If that’s you, we hope you’ll apply for this role.
You want to be part of a team.
You come with new ideas and a unique point of view. You look forward to collaborating with a diverse team of individuals. You assume everyone’s best intentions, welcome a healthy debate, and embrace differing opinions. You eagerly seek and give help. Transparency tops your list of values, and you proactively contribute to a culture of respect and inclusion.
You enjoy a challenge.
Inquisitive and focused, you see every challenge as an opportunity. You’re ambitious and comfortable making mistakes because you learn from them and bounce back quickly. You would rather create the future than wait for it. You prioritize long-term value over short-term objectives.
You love to listen.
You approach every interaction with curiosity and a desire to understand. You want to make a positive impact in the world. You’re passionate about culture and know the power that music, film, podcasts, games, and stories have to bring people together.


What You’ll Do 

Maintain fixed asset reconciliations (gross fixed assets, accruals, WIP, and accumulated depreciation) within BlacklinePrepare global fixed asset roll forward and project reports to be distributed to global financeImprove and develop analysis reports to help analyze balance sheet and income statement account variancesAssist in the implementation of a new ERP and become fixed assets system superuser Implement fixed asset tagging and physical counts for Sonos fixed assets and conduct annual reviews of fixed asset impairment Coordinate with business partners to ensure proper transfer or disposal of assetsAssist the FP&A team on forecasted depreciation schedules and other ad hoc requestsPrepare annual/quarterly property tax filings and coordinate property tax auditsPrepare schedules for external audit team on annual filings and quarterly reviewsWork cross-functionally with the Tax team to provide accurate and timely data for tax filingsPerform reconciliation of other balance sheet accounts including, but not limited to, deferred rent, capital leases, asset retirement obligations, notes payable, and accrued interestDevelop, document, and maintain standard operating policies and procedures to ensure compliance with company policy, SOX, and US GAAPParticipate in or lead special projects for management and other financial functions with the department as required

Skills You’ll Need

Basic Requirements:Bachelor’s degree in accounting, finance, mathematics, or other related areas 2-5+ years of corporate accounting and/or public accounting experience OR equivalent combination of education and experienceProficiency in Excel and aptitude with other similar systemsExperience with SAP and/or Blackline, other related softwareProven project management and process improvement experiencePreferred Requirements:CPA preferredIntellectual curiosity and creativity Excellent attention to detail and the ability to prioritize High integrity, self-aware, humble, low ego Strong communication and interpersonal skills 

More About Sonos


Sonos is a sound experience company. We pioneered multiroom wireless audio, made it sound amazing, and changed the way people listen, making it effortless for them to enjoy what they want, where they want, how they want.
Today we continue empowering listeners by developing new technologies, thoughtfully designing products, expanding our software platform, and crafting brilliant sound experiences while participating in a culture that values respect, transparency, collaboration, and ownership.
Together we’re working to positively impact the world and inspire everyone to listen better—because listening brings people together, builds understanding, drives change, and makes us happier.
Notice to European Job Applicants: Information you submit as a part of your job application will be used in accordance with Sonos EU Job Applicant Privacy Notice.
Notice to U.S. Job Applicants: Sonos is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other legally protected characteristics.
Follow the links to review the EEO is the Law poster and its supplement. The pay transparency policy is available here. Sonos is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities. If you need a reasonable accommodation because of a disability for any part of the employment process, please send an e-mail to accommodations@sonos.com and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information.

            Security Analyst



         Login to apply
    
















Security Analyst
Santa Barbara, CA 


The Security Analyst will plan and execute security measures to protect computer networks and systems.
Responsibilities

Conduct threat analysis, application penetration, network penetration, and network assessments to determine threat and risk factors
Research and implement security technology solutions that provide value and reduce risk
Answer client questionnaires and concerns within a timely fashion
Develop risk mitigation strategies
Develop internal and/or external documentation
Review threat data from various sources and initiate application or network changes
Utilize understanding of attack signatures, tactics, techniques and procedures associated with advanced threats

Requirements

Relevant experience includes working with Security solutions and technologies, information/cyber/network security, vulnerability analysis, penetration testing, computer forensics or related experience
Solid understanding of Cyber Security methodologies a plus
Working knowledge of analyzing, responding, and remediating network intrusions, web app, and server attacks a plus
Understanding of common vulnerability analysis techniques and cyber security threat vectors a plus
Degree in Information Technology, Information Security, or Computer Science preferred
Regular attendance and a regular work schedule is an essential function of this job.

*sa
 
  



         Login to apply

Privacy Overview

This website uses cookies so that we can provide you with the best user experience possible. Cookie information is stored in your browser and performs functions such as recognising you when you return to our website and helping our team to understand which sections of the website you find most interesting and useful.
You can adjust all of your cookie settings by navigating the tabs on the left hand side.



 
Strictly Necessary Cookies

Strictly necessary cookies must be enabled at all times in order to login and apply to openings.



disable









If you disable this cookie, we will not be able to save your preferences and you will not be able to login to apply for openings. This means that every time you visit this website you will need to enable or disable cookies again.







3rd Party Cookies

This website uses Google Analytics to collect anonymous information such as the number of visitors to the site, and the most popular pages.
Keeping this cookie enabled helps us to improve our website.



disable









Please enable Strictly Necessary Cookies first so that we can save your preferences!

Sales Development Representative




								Sales Team
							
							     | 
							

										Santa Barbara
									
																									,
																									
										California
									

								 | 
							
								0097965
							




Apply now
	
	

    




Sales Development Representative - (0097965) As a CJ Sales Development Representative (SDR), you are an “A Player” and are the master of building Sales Qualified Leads within your geographic territory.  The SDR is a key part of selling products and services that help drive online and offline referrals that drive qualified actions. SDRs creatively leverage outbound calls, emails, social and other direct response media to help marketers maximize their revenue. The ideal candidate has high integrity, a proven track record of professionalism, loves the thrill of the hunt, and excels in building and growing a pipeline of business. They also have experience navigating through organizations, doing deep discovery and selling to multiple decision makers.You will be the front line of the sales process and spend your days prospecting into businesses with a digital footprint across all marketing verticals (retail, financial services, travel, etc.).  You are comfortable being uncomfortable with a ‘can do-will do’ attitude.  You will be measured by your seamless handoff of qualified leads to the sales team and additionally compensated on closed business.  Strong organizational and follow-up skills, a competitive, friendly, numbers-driven personality will thrive here at CJ. SDR Responsibilities will include:Generate new business opportunities to fuel CJ Affiliate’s pipeline in North America through identification and proper qualification of business opportunities and qualified leadsOutbound prospect to companies via cold calls (80+/day), emails, social and other direct response mediaUtilize advertising industry knowledge to research & develop accounts, identify key players, generate interest, and identify compelling eventsConducting high-level discovery and educational conversations with Senior Executives (C-Level, VP/Director) in target accountsPrepare executive summaries to turn your Business Development Managers into gurus ahead of their callsCollaborate with and leverage teammates (Management and Business Development Managers) to develop targeted lists, communication strategies, and messaging to drive opportunitiesLearn and maintain in-depth knowledge of CJ Affiliate’s product and services offerings, unique value propositions in contrast to CJ competitive setManage, track, and report on all activities and results using SalesforceExceed monthly/quarterly quotas for Sales Qualified Leads (SQLs) Requirements:An A player that desires to be around other A playersHighly dependable, high energy, self-starter, with a positive attitude.Crazy organized, positive, optimistic and coachable‘Hunter’ mentality in seeking out new businessStrong writing skillsCold-calling experience preferredA track record of successful, credible achievementsPassionate about humankind, technology, business, and winningBenefits:Be an integral part of a fun and high performing teamLearn from management that cares about your successLong runway for sales career as part of a global companyBase plus commission (no cap on closed business!)  Why CJ Affiliate? CJ Affiliate is the leader in Affiliate Marketing. We take pride in our innovative technology, comprehensive data solutions and our people. We equip our teams with advanced tools, training and career development opportunities all to provide cutting edge solutions, strategies and support to deliver high quality results for our clients. We work in an energetic, results-oriented, collaborative, team environment that recognizes exceptional performance. As we evolve and grow as a business, so do you.Great People, Deserve Great BenefitsWe know that we have some of the brightest and most talented associates in the world, and we believe in rewarding them accordingly. If you work here, expect competitive pay, comprehensive health coverage, and endless opportunities to advance your career.About UsEpsilon® is an all-encompassing global marketing innovator. We provide unrivaled data intelligence and customer insights, world-class technology including loyalty, email and CRM platforms and data-driven creative, activation and execution. Epsilon’s digital media arm, Conversant, is a leader in personalized digital advertising and insights through its proprietary technology and trove of consumer marketing data, delivering digital marketing with unprecedented scale, accuracy and reach through personalized media programs. Together, we bring personalized marketing to consumers across offline and online channels, at moments of interest that help drive business growth for brands. Epsilon employs over 8,000 associates in 70 offices worldwide. For more information, visit www.epsilon.com and follow us on Twitter @EpsilonMktg.Epsilon is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Epsilon’s policy is not to discriminate against any applicant or employee based on actual or perceived race, color creed, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, marital status, medical condition as defined by applicable state law, genetic information, disability, military service and veteran status, pregnancy, childbirth and related medical conditions, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state, or local laws and ordinances.             Senior Risk Analyst



         Login to apply
    
















Senior Risk Analyst
Santa Barbara, CA 


The Senior Risk Analyst will be responsible for overseeing payment processing, loss prevention and will set transaction risk parameters, guidelines and program policies.    Responsibilities 

Monitoring payment transactions and will be responsible for fraud and loss prevention
Will assist Yardi payments team with setting transaction risk parameters, guidelines and program policies
Will work in collaboration with a variety of Yardi teams to include Legal, Payment Operations and Programming
Monitoring daily, monthly, and quarterly payment transaction metrics to identify any problematic trends or issues
Reviewing and managing daily risk alerts in the system
Reviewing transaction batches for suspicious activity
Will investigate potential fraudulent activity and work to mitigate losses
Will communicate with clients and request additional information regarding fraudulent activity reviews
Will assist with production and distribution of fraud reporting using advanced data analytics
Generating and providing the Payments management team with regular reports and analysis 

Requirements

Bachelors degree in Business Administration or related area
3+ years of experience in risk and fraud management
Advanced knowledge of NACHA Operating Rules and Card Brand Product and Service Rules
MS Office Suite proficiency
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Ability to work independently while effectively managing deliverables
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
Experience manipulating large data sets in SQL or equivalent and drawing actional insights from data
Comfort level working with a variety of teams and business units across the US
A wide range of expertise with risk systems, fraud prevention or payment processing highly desirable

Privacy Overview

This website uses cookies so that we can provide you with the best user experience possible. Cookie information is stored in your browser and performs functions such as recognising you when you return to our website and helping our team to understand which sections of the website you find most interesting and useful.
You can adjust all of your cookie settings by navigating the tabs on the left hand side.



 
Strictly Necessary Cookies

Strictly necessary cookies must be enabled at all times in order to login and apply to openings.



disable









If you disable this cookie, we will not be able to save your preferences and you will not be able to login to apply for openings. This means that every time you visit this website you will need to enable or disable cookies again.







3rd Party Cookies

This website uses Google Analytics to collect anonymous information such as the number of visitors to the site, and the most popular pages.
Keeping this cookie enabled helps us to improve our website.



disable









Please enable Strictly Necessary Cookies first so that we can save your preferences!

If you’re ready to take on a fresh challenge, grow your career and contribute to making the world a safer place, Raytheon is ready to help you achieve your goals. Join our team and get the opportunity and support to find purpose, thrive and succeed.





Notice: Please be aware of suspicious recruiting emails and text messages that attempt to collect your confidential information. Sr Systems Engineer I - Reliability, Availability, Maintainability, Testability (RAM-T) Engineer
Dulles, Virginia, Richardson, Texas, Aurora, Colorado, Indianapolis, Indiana, Marlborough, Massachusetts

Overview

Raytheon delivers innovative technology to make the world a safer place. Our expertise in cyber, analytics and automation allow us to reach beyond what others think is possible to underpin national security and give our global customers unique solutions to solve the most pressing modern challenges -- from the cyber domain to automated operations, and from intelligent transportation solutions to creating clear insight from large volumes of data. Our leaders must have the ability to understand, embrace and operate in a multicultural world -- in the marketplace and the workplace. We strive to hire people who reflect our communities and embrace diversity and inclusion to advance our culture, develop our employees, and grow our business.

Full-time
Entry to Senior level

Glassdoor 2017 Best Places to Interview: Candidate's Choice

Rewards




401(k) / Retirement Plans
Employer Matching, if you elect to enroll company matches up to 3%.



Work / Life Balance
Raytheon appreciates work/life balance. Employees can work 9 hours a day every week and received every other Friday off, as long as departmental/manager approval is obtained. Accrued paid time off monthly and paid holiday time.



Career Development
At Raytheon, we foster an inclusive culture of professional development. We support a variety of developmental opportunities including: Mentoring programs, Skills Development, Leadership Development, Rotational job assignments, and Continuous Improvement, all of which contribute to advancement of our employee’s capabilities.



Paid Time Off
Accrue paid time off monthly. Receive 12 holidays per year including the week between Christmas and New Year’s Day.



Relocation Assistance
Select technical positions are eligible for relocation packages. See specific job description for eligibility requirements.



Parental Leave
Raytheon offers all eligible employees up to three weeks paid parental leave for the birth or adoption of a child (separate from paid maternity leave or Family & Medical Leave Act).



Back to Job Navigation (Rewards)



Responsibilities


Are you looking for an engineering career that is challenging and satisfying? Then join our Raytheon team of engineers solving problems that make the world a safer place and help to secure our great nation! Come support those who provide us with all the freedoms we enjoy.We offer great benefits that include medical, dental, vision, 401K match, flexible work schedule - just to name a few.  Click here to view a brief video and learn more: https://youtu.be/YNuZN0vyzHgRaytheon is looking for a talented Reliability, Availability, Maintainability, and Testability (RAM-T) Engineer to join our Specialty Engineering team.  Specialty Engineering is part of Systems Engineering that complements the technical activities required to deliver a project. It deals with engineering that influence the systems’ design and architecture in terms of performance, safety, usability, reliability, availability, maintainability, testability, supportability, and cost consideration throughout the lifecycle of the product. Specialty Engineering applies methods, standards, and techniques to provide clarification of system requirements to software, hardware, and test personnel to ensure design and architecture considerations are appropriately allocated to the system and horizontally integrated across the development teams. The Specialty Engineering function supports systems engineering activities including trade studies, use case development, requirements definition and derivation, interface definition, and requirement validation and verification. As such, all Specialty Engineers interface with the other Specialty disciplines and logistics engineering functions to ensure integration and continuity in the design and development process.Must be a U.S. Citizen with the ability to obtain and maintain a DoD Top Secret Security ClearanceThe Specialty Team is looking for candidates with experience in this Specialty area:Reliability, Availability, Maintainability, Testability (RAM-T) EngineerAs a member of the Specialty Engineering Team, expect a dynamic and demanding environment that values discipline, adherence to processes, and adding value to our customers through our respective disciplines (Human Factors Engineering, System Safety, RAM-T Engineering).RAM-T Engineering offers a broad spectrum of skill and knowledge challenges across the IIS mission areas. This position is to support the preliminary and detailed design phases for programs within the Raytheon IIS portfolio that include the following businesses; Cyber and Special Missions (CSM), C2, Space and Intelligence (CSI), Navigation and Modernization Solutions (NMS) and Global Training Solutions (GTS). This position serves as a member of the Raytheon IIS Specialty Engineering Team and supports various programs within a matrix management assignment as directed. Deliverables include, but not limited to, program plans, technical reports, schedules, basis of estimates for new pursuits, and analyses as required to substantiate architectural/design decisions and trade studies.The RAM-T Engineer provides an early assessment of system performance allowing for tradeoffs of system architecture options, improving the design and eliminating undesirable features of early design concepts. Analyses and trade studies influence the System Architecture and CONOPS development, requirements definition, technical proposal inputs, test planning, subcontractor controls, etc. Design influence by the RAM-T Engineer contributes to technical performance measures, quantitative requirements, and qualitative system attributes (e.g. Mean-Time-Between-Failure (MTBF), Mean-Time-To-Repair (MTTR), Operational Availability (Ao), built-in-test (BIT) features, health/status monitoring, fault/failure detection, isolation, and identification, etc.).The RAM-T Engineer assists and/or supports design verification (including FMECA, redundancy tradeoff analysis, and six-sigma performance analysis). The RAM-T Engineer facilitates analysis and documentation of test, production, and field failures utilizing a closed loop FRACAS process. The RAM-T Engineer produces DoD and customer required documentation such as Program Plans, Test Plans, Predictions, and Reports. RAM-T Engineering offers a broad spectrum of skill and knowledge challenges across the IIS mission areas.Required Skills: Experience in statistical theory and modelingExposure to reliability modeling and prediction experience in accordance with MIL-HDBK-217, MIL-STD-690, MIL-STD-756, ANSI-GEIA-STD-009, or equivalent industry standards or practices.Exposure to reliability engineering, design, and management practices in accordance with MIL-HDBK-338, MIL-STD-1543, MIL-STD-189, MIL-STD-781, MIL-STD-785, or equivalent industry standards or practices.Ability to produce DoD required documentation, such as program plans, reports, analyses, white papers, procedures, design direction/guidelines, etc.U.S. Citizen with the ability to obtain and maintain a DoD Top Secret Security ClearanceDesired Skills: Current DoD TS/SCI Security Clearance RAM-T Engineering experience applying standards and process requirementsTestability and Fault Management experienceExperience with Software Reliability and Cloud Environment ModelingExpertise working with Satellite and/or unmanned ground stations, A/C avionics modernization, intelligence communities, FAA, other governmental agencies.Reliability test methods, screening, and assurance in accordance with MIL-HDBK-344, MIL-HDBK-781, MIL-STD-2164, MIL-STD-790 or equivalent industry standards or practices.Experience with FRACAS in accordance with MIL-STD-2155 or equivalent industry standards or practices.Experience with Reliasoft or equivalent reliability modeling toolExperience with DOORS or equivalent requirements management toolExperience with SYSML, SML, Rational, or equivalent architecture modeling and model-based systems engineering (MBSE) toolsEducation Requirements: Bachelor’s Degree in Science, Technology, Engineering, Mathematics, or related STEM degree with minimum of 4 years of relevant experienceMaster’s Degree / PHD in Science, Technology, Engineering, Mathematics, or related STEM degree with minimum of 2 years of relevant experienceThis position requires either a U.S. Person or a Non-U.S. Person who is eligible to obtain any required Export Authorization. 149772

            Energy Benchmarking Analyst



         Login to apply
    
















Energy Benchmarking Analyst
Colorado Springs, CO 


The Energy Benchmarking Analyst will be a part of Yardi’s growing residential and commercial segments performing analysis to recommend more efficient and sustainable ways to operate businesses with Yardi Energy products related to conservation, analytics, and benchmarking. They will identify energy efficient strategies, generate savings models, and maintain data consistency within reporting systems. The Energy Benchmarking Analyst may assist Sales in the review of potential energy client opportunities and in the development of preliminary proposals.   
Responsibilities 

Facilitate understanding of energy benchmarking programs for clients and within teams
Coordinate interdepartmental support concerning issues, implementations, system design and testing of new system functionality to meet client requirements of the future
Act as project manager for special projects to include implementation of Energy STAR services and energy audits and issue resolutions with minimal supervision
Provide input for new product features to allow clients to increase efficiency
Analyze utility and building data to recommend energy conservation measures (ECM)
Identify areas to reduce costs of maintenance and operations
Perform high-level calculations, trend analysis, and quality control on all utility types
Audit data for errors in multiple Yardi Energy systems, review reports and identify incorrect utility data, and create analysis reports
Prepare energy savings models using analysis tools (E2 Insight, Energy+ etc.)
Assists manager in supervising subcontractors and consultants to ensure the quality of work is consistent with the requirements of the job
Generate post installation measurement and verification reports
Enlist support from management and peers to address complex client requests and resolve complex issues 

Requirements

Possess a BA/BS degree (or equivalent experience)
Excellent client communication and relationship management skills
Intermediate Excel skills
Ability to train clients
Strong analytical and documentation skills required, including a thorough understanding of how to interpret customer business needs and document solutions
Ability to manage multiple priorities and complete tasks on time
Ability to travel (<10% of the time)
Functional understanding of building control systems, and energy efficiency strategies
Familiarity with utility rate structures, utility bills, and usage patterns
Familiarity with utility rebate and incentive programs and applications
LEED AP Certification is desired
Certified Energy Manager (CEM) or Certified Energy Auditor (CEA) is desired
Regular attendance and work schedule is an essential function of this job 

 
                                                                                                     *ad 



         Login to apply

Privacy Overview

This website uses cookies so that we can provide you with the best user experience possible. Cookie information is stored in your browser and performs functions such as recognising you when you return to our website and helping our team to understand which sections of the website you find most interesting and useful.
You can adjust all of your cookie settings by navigating the tabs on the left hand side.



 
Strictly Necessary Cookies

Strictly necessary cookies must be enabled at all times in order to login and apply to openings.



disable









If you disable this cookie, we will not be able to save your preferences and you will not be able to login to apply for openings. This means that every time you visit this website you will need to enable or disable cookies again.







3rd Party Cookies

This website uses Google Analytics to collect anonymous information such as the number of visitors to the site, and the most popular pages.
Keeping this cookie enabled helps us to improve our website.



disable









Please enable Strictly Necessary Cookies first so that we can save your preferences!

            Associate Technical Account Manager



         Login to apply
    
















Associate Technical Account Manager
Santa Ana, CA 


Associate Technical Account Managers at Yardi will provide consultative, implementation and technical support to a group of assigned Yardi clients in order to manage business operations and financial accounting functions in Yardi’s Voyager software.
Responsibilities

Implements the Yardi suite of software products by assisting clients with system implementation, training, and technical support
Researches, analyzes and resolves software issues
Supports software product customization based on client requirements
Performs data mapping and conversions
Performs system and business process reviews and other service reviews and makes recommendations on best practices
Works on a regular basis with Yardi internal resource teams to include: training, conversion, sales and development

Requirements

Bachelor’s degree in Economics, Business, Math, Statistics or Information Management preferred
Experience setting and managing client expectations
Superior verbal and written communication skills
Project Management, Accounting, or Property Management experience/background
Solid Proficiency in MS Office Suite and Outlook
Knowledge in three of the following areas: Property Management, Accounting, Microsoft Windows, Technical Support, SQL, HTML/ASP
Prior experience with property management software or real estate software highly desirable
Prior experience with Yardi software highly desirable
Regular attendance and a regular work schedule is an essential function of this job.

By continuing to browse this site you agree to our use of cookies. You can find out more about which cookies we are using or switch them off in settings.
 

 
Accept

 


















 

 Privacy Overview


 Strictly Necessary Cookies


 3rd Party Cookies




 








Privacy Overview

This website uses cookies so that we can provide you with the best user experience possible. Cookie information is stored in your browser and performs functions such as recognising you when you return to our website and helping our team to understand which sections of the website you find most interesting and useful.
You can adjust all of your cookie settings by navigating the tabs on the left hand side.



 
Strictly Necessary Cookies

Strictly necessary cookies must be enabled at all times in order to login and apply to openings.



disable









If you disable this cookie, we will not be able to save your preferences and you will not be able to login to apply for openings. This means that every time you visit this website you will need to enable or disable cookies again.







3rd Party Cookies

This website uses Google Analytics to collect anonymous information such as the number of visitors to the site, and the most popular pages.
Keeping this cookie enabled helps us to improve our website.



disable









Please enable Strictly Necessary Cookies first so that we can save your preferences!












Enable All
Save Changes

If you’re ready to take on a fresh challenge, grow your career and contribute to making the world a safer place, Raytheon is ready to help you achieve your goals. Join our team and get the opportunity and support to find purpose, thrive and succeed.





Notice: Please be aware of suspicious recruiting emails and text messages that attempt to collect your confidential information. Raytheon conducts all electronic correspondence using e-mail addresses that end in “Raytheon.com”, “Raytheon.co.uk”, “Raytheon.com.au” or “brassring.com”. To report fraud please go to: https://www.ic3.gov.











Sr Systems Engineer I - Systems Safety Engineer
Dulles, Virginia, Richardson, Texas, Aurora, Colorado, Indianapolis, Indiana, Marlborough, Massachusetts


Apply





Overview
Success Profile
Trending
Rewards
Responsibilities




Overview

Raytheon delivers innovative technology to make the world a safer place. Our expertise in cyber, analytics and automation allow us to reach beyond what others think is possible to underpin national security and give our global customers unique solutions to solve the most pressing modern challenges -- from the cyber domain to automated operations, and from intelligent transportation solutions to creating clear insight from large volumes of data. Our leaders must have the ability to understand, embrace and operate in a multicultural world -- in the marketplace and the workplace. We strive to hire people who reflect our communities and embrace diversity and inclusion to advance our culture, develop our employees, and grow our business.

Full-time
Entry to Senior level

Glassdoor 2017 Best Places to Interview: Candidate's Choice

Rewards




401(k) / Retirement Plans
Employer Matching, if you elect to enroll company matches up to 3%.



Work / Life Balance
Raytheon appreciates work/life balance. Employees can work 9 hours a day every week and received every other Friday off, as long as departmental/manager approval is obtained. Accrued paid time off monthly and paid holiday time.



Career Development
At Raytheon, we foster an inclusive culture of professional development. We support a variety of developmental opportunities including: Mentoring programs, Skills Development, Leadership Development, Rotational job assignments, and Continuous Improvement, all of which contribute to advancement of our employee’s capabilities.



Paid Time Off
Accrue paid time off monthly. Receive 12 holidays per year including the week between Christmas and New Year’s Day.



Relocation Assistance
Select technical positions are eligible for relocation packages. See specific job description for eligibility requirements.



Parental Leave
Raytheon offers all eligible employees up to three weeks paid parental leave for the birth or adoption of a child (separate from paid maternity leave or Family & Medical Leave Act).



Back to Job Navigation (Rewards)



Responsibilities


Are you looking for an engineering career that is challenging and satisfying? Then join our Raytheon team of engineers solving problems that make the world a safer place and help to secure our great nation! Come support those who provide us with all the freedoms we enjoy.We offer great benefits that include medical, dental, vision, 401K match, flexible work schedule - just to name a few.  Click here to view a brief video and learn more: https://youtu.be/YNuZN0vyzHgRaytheon is looking for a talented Systems SafetyEngineer to join our Specialty Engineering team.  Specialty Engineering is part of Systems Engineering that complements the technical activities required to deliver a project. It deals with engineering that influence the systems’ design and architecture in terms of performance, safety, usability, reliability, maintainability, availability, supportability, testability, and cost consideration throughout the lifecycle of the product. Specialty Engineering applies methods, standards, and techniques to provide clarification of system requirements to software, hardware, and test personnel to ensure design and architecture considerations are appropriately allocated to the system and horizontally integrated across the development teams. The Specialty Engineering function supports systems engineering activities including trade studies, use case development, requirements definition and derivation, interface definition, and requirement validation and verification. As such, all Specialty Engineers interface with the other Specialty disciplines and logistics engineering functions to ensure integration and continuity in the design and development process.Must be a U.S. Citizen with the ability to obtain and maintain a DoD Top Secret Security ClearanceThe Specialty Team is looking for candidates with experience in this Specialty area:•  System Safety EngineerAs a member of the Specialty Engineering Team, expect a dynamic and demanding environment that values discipline, adherence to processes, and adding value to our customers through our respective disciplines (Human Factors Engineering, System Safety, Reliability Engineering).This position is to support the preliminary and detailed design phases for programs within the Raytheon IIS portfolio that include the following businesses; Cyber and Special Missions (CSM), C2, Space and Intelligence (CSI), Navigation and Modernization Solutions (NMS) and Global Training Solutions (GTS). This position serves as a member of the Raytheon IIS Specialty Engineering Team and supports various programs within a matrix management assignment as directed. Deliverables include, but not limited to, program plans, technical reports, schedules, basis of estimates for new pursuits, and analyses as required to substantiate architectural/design decisions and trade studies.Required Skills: Experience with System Safety Engineering practices as derived from MIL-STD-882U.S. Citizen with the ability to obtain and maintain a DoD Top Secret Security ClearancePractical understanding and application of:MIL-STD-1472MIL-STD-1474Ability to produce DoD required documentation, such as:Safety Engineering Analysis ReportFailure Mode Effects and Criticality ReportSafety Assessment ReportEngineering Change Proposal System Safety ReportWaiver or Deviation System Safety Report (WDSSR)System Safety Program Progress ReportHealth Hazard Assessment ReportRadiation Hazard Control ProceduresSafety Studies ReportSafety Studies PlanMishap Risk Assessment ReportSystem Safety Program PlanDesired Skills: Current DoD TS/SCI Security Clearance Expertise working with Satellite and/or unmanned ground stations, A/C avionics modernization, intelligence communities, FAA, other governmental agencies.System Safety Engineering ability to apply standards and process requirementsMIL-STD-882DO-178MIL-STD-516 Air Worthiness CriteriaDO-178 Software considerations in Airborne Systems and Equipment CertificationHuman Systems IntegrationSAE 6906Education Requirements: Bachelor’s Degree in Science, Technology, Engineering, Mathematics, or related STEM degree with minimum of 4 years of relevant experienceMaster’s Degree / PHD in Science, Technology, Engineering, Mathematics, or related STEM degree with minimum of 2 years of relevant experienceThis position requires either a U.S. Person or a Non-U.S. Person who is eligible to obtain any required Export Authorization. 149923
                

                    
                 
                           Raytheon is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, age, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected Veteran status.

            Real Estate Market Researcher I



         Login to apply
    
















Real Estate Market Researcher I
Scottsdale, AZ 


The Real Estate Market Researcher I is responsible for obtaining, verifying and adding commercial real estate property information into the Yardi Matrix database. Researcher will have specific guidelines of information to gather pertaining to a market. Research could include, but are not limited to, new developments, apartment communities, tenant information, rental rate and lease terms.
 
Responsibilities

Comprehension of Yardi Matrix procedures and definitions, including data entry for all commercial asset classes.
Outbound calls to gather accurate information.
Usage of creative problem solving techniques and ability to think outside of the box in order to obtain information objectives.
Ability to build and maintain a rapport with prospective callers in order to continue future relationships.
Internet researching to identify potential call leads and gather possible targeted information.

Requirements

High School diploma. College degree optional.
One plus years of relevant work experience
High volume outbound calling experience.
Strong attention to detail and ability to multi-task in a fast paced environment.
Excellent Internet navigation skills.
Strong verbal/written communication skills.
Strong data entry and typing skills.
Ability to accept direction, follow instruction and receive constructive feedback; positive attitude.
Strong proficiency in Microsoft Office.
Ability to work at a tactical level while maintaining a clear understanding of the broad view.
Ability to work independently, manage time effectively and prioritize work tasks.
Attend meetings and perform tasks for long periods of time on a computer and on the telephone.
Regular attendance and a regular work schedule is an essential function of this job.
Experience in the Real Estate field desired, i.e. property management, financial services, real estate appraisal, sales.
Call surveys or other call center experience preferred.

*bd

            Associate Technical Account Manager



         Login to apply
    
















Associate Technical Account Manager
Long Island, NY 


Associate Technical Account Managers at Yardi will provide consultative, implementation and technical support to a group of assigned Yardi clients in order to manage business operations and financial accounting functions in Yardi’s Voyager software.
Responsibilities

Implements the Yardi suite of software products by assisting clients with system implementation, training, and technical support
Researches, analyzes and resolves software issues
Supports software product customization based on client requirements
Performs data mapping and conversions
Performs system and business process reviews and other service reviews and makes recommendations on best practices
Works on a regular basis with Yardi internal resource teams to include: training, conversion, sales and development

Requirements

Bachelor’s degree in Economics, Business, Math, Statistics or Information Management preferred
Experience setting and managing client expectations
Superior verbal and written communication skills
Project Management, Accounting, or Property Management experience/background
Solid Proficiency in MS Office Suite and Outlook
Knowledge in three of the following areas: Property Management, Accounting, Microsoft Windows, Technical Support, SQL, HTML/ASP
Prior experience with property management software or real estate software highly desirable
Prior experience with Yardi software highly desirable
Regular attendance and a regular work schedule is an essential function of this job

                                                                                              *bd

If you’re ready to take on a fresh challenge, grow your career and contribute to making the world a safer place, Raytheon is ready to help you achieve your goals. Join our team and get the opportunity and support to find purpose, thrive and succeed.





Notice: Please be aware of suspicious recruiting emails and text messages that attempt to collect your confidential information. Raytheon conducts all electronic correspondence using e-mail addresses that end in “Raytheon.com”, “Raytheon.co.uk”, “Raytheon.com.au” or “brassring.com”. Sr Multi-Disciplined Eng II
Aurora, Colorado

Overview

Raytheon delivers innovative technology to make the world a safer place. Our expertise in cyber, analytics and automation allow us to reach beyond what others think is possible to underpin national security and give our global customers unique solutions to solve the most pressing modern challenges -- from the cyber domain to automated operations, and from intelligent transportation solutions to creating clear insight from large volumes of data. Our leaders must have the ability to understand, embrace and operate in a multicultural world -- in the marketplace and the workplace. We strive to hire people who reflect our communities and embrace diversity and inclusion to advance our culture, develop our employees, and grow our business.

Full-time
Entry to Senior level

Glassdoor 2017 Best Places to Interview: Candidate's Choice
