Rewards




401(k) / Retirement Plans
Employer Matching, if you elect to enroll company matches up to 3%.



Work / Life Balance
Raytheon appreciates work/life balance. Employees can work 9 hours a day every week and received every other Friday off, as long as departmental/manager approval is obtained. Accrued paid time off monthly and paid holiday time.



Career Development
At Raytheon, we foster an inclusive culture of professional development. We support a variety of developmental opportunities including: Mentoring programs, Skills Development, Leadership Development, Rotational job assignments, and Continuous Improvement, all of which contribute to advancement of our employee’s capabilities.



Paid Time Off
Accrue paid time off monthly. Receive 12 holidays per year including the week between Christmas and New Year’s Day.



Relocation Assistance
Select technical positions are eligible for relocation packages. See specific job description for eligibility requirements.



Parental Leave
Raytheon offers all eligible employees up to three weeks paid parental leave for the birth or adoption of a child (separate from paid maternity leave or Family & Medical Leave Act).



Back to Job Navigation (Rewards)



Responsibilities


Would you like to work in a collaborative environment at a state of the art facility in Colorado? Then join our team of engineers solving problems that make the world a safer place and help to secure our great nation! Come support those who provide us with all the freedoms we enjoy.Our facility in Aurora, CO offers amenities that create work and life balance. On site we have a 24/7 fitness facility, health center, cafeteria, collaboration rooms and dynamic break areas for easy conversation and socialization. Additionally, we provide employee appreciation lunches, bonus opportunities, and great benefits that include medical, dental, vision, 401K match, flexible work schedule - just to name a few.  Click here to view a brief video and learn more: https://youtu.be/YNuZN0vyzHgJob Description:The Sr. Multi-Disciplined Engineer I is responsible for maintaining the hardware development and maintenance activities for the Program’s Front End Processor (FEP) hardware subsystem and associated Engineering Documentation and will participate in day-to-day hardware maintenance activities, which include but are not limited to:Maintain cognizance of FEP Hardware.Hardware retrofit and installation.Parts sparing and obsolescence.Run FEP hardware / software diagnostic tools.Troubleshoot electronic components to module level.Work closely with FEP engineering team to help resolve system issues. Support maintenance & test activities for the factory and customer locations. (Requires some travel).The FEP Maintainer analyzes System parameters to insure system requirements are met using analytical tools. Supports architecture development and future system enhancements based on requirements including interface definition, parts selection with consideration given to environmental variables, safety, site constraints and lessons learned. Prepares statements that convey the fundamental characteristics of the design objective as necessary. Writes and reviews manuals, procedures, plans, specifications, engineering drawings and notebooks. Reports time and material estimates based on requirements. Communicates technical information to an audience. Assists in the integration of hardware and software elements into a subsystem. Assists in the verification of hardware and software requirements as they apply to the subsystem. Analyzes electrical loading, grounding configuration and supply power requirements. Analyzes thermal loading and environmental attributes.  Follows organizational processes and creates program specific work instructions when necessary.Required Skills:General knowledge with Front-End Processor Subsystem Broad knowledge of software, operating systems, hardware, and networkingFamiliar with spacecraft command and telemetry processingFamiliar with Linux commands and software installation Experience with software and hardware configuration management principles and systemsExcellent troubleshooting skills, able to isolate problems with command and telemetry flows, including distinguishing between hardware and software problemsHistory with COMSEC handling and key loading Must be willing to travel occasionally to customer facilities (in the continental US).U.S. Citizenship and existing or able to obtain a DOD Secret ClearanceDesired Skills: Baseband Subsystem KnowledgeFPGA Development / ToolsPrinted Circuit Board ToolsSystem Test Equipment Development (Test System Development)Antenna Subsystem KnowledgeComputer and Network Subsystem KnowledgeRadio Frequency Subsystem KnowledgeRequired Education:Requires a Degree in Science Technology Engineering or Math (STEM) with emphasis in electrical engineering and 6+ years of relatable experience 151945

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, age, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected Veteran status.

            Quality Assurance Specialist



         Login to apply
    
















Quality Assurance Specialist
Boise, ID 


Under general direction, the Quality Assurance Specialist evaluates and tests new enhancements and bug fixes to verify that the program functions according to user requirements and design specifications and that it conforms to established standards.  The QA Specialist debugs software products through the use of systematic tests to develop, apply, and maintain quality standards for company products.  
ESSENTIAL RESPONSIBILITIES

Develops, modifies, and executes software test plans, automated scripts and programs for testing.  Analyzes and writes test standards and procedures.  Analyzes test results to ensure existing functionality and recommends corrective action.  Provides feedback in preparation of technical appraisals of programming languages, systems, and computation software.  Consults with development engineers in the resolution of problems.  Coordinates necessary testing resources to meet deadlines.
Maintains documentation of test results to assist in debugging and modification of software.  Ensures quality computer integration into the overall functions of scientific computation, data acquisition, and processing.
Tests software products and reports the results to developers via the internal CRM (Customer Relationship Management).  Creates detailed TRs (program issues) using quality writing skills and provides Development with the necessary information to resolve bug fixes.  Follows established quality assurance procedures and contributes to the continual improvement of those procedures.  Performs unit testing on his/her defect resolutions to ensure accuracy, integrity, interoperability and completeness to achieve desired results.  Analyzes and documents reasons for test failures, and revises/debugs assigned programs and/or procedures as necessary.
Leverages test results to improve or create new test plans. Updates and maintains new test environments with data appropriate to execute the plans.
Tracks software problems and verifies they have been corrected.  Documents, maintains and monitors/reports metrics.   Participates in the creation and inspection of quality assurance documents.  For software releases, may also prepare release documentation for both internal and external presentation.
Enhances knowledge of tools, processes, procedures, and resources necessary to support quality assurance activities.
Performs special projects related to department training and company initiatives, participates in department organization meetings, and other activities as assigned by supervisor.   
Adheres to Department policies, procedures and standards in the development and implementation of software. 

EDUCATION/QUALIFICATIONS/EXPERIENCE

Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent experience
At least two (2) years of software domain(s) experience and/or quality assurance experience with working knowledge of quality testing tools and systems. 

REQUIRED SKILLS/ABILITIES

Ability to diagnose, report, track and effectively communicate quality issues for several projects concurrently
Ability to work at both detailed and conceptual levels
Excellent analytical and decision making skills
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Ability to work independently in a fast-paced development environment
Collegial, team-oriented disposition with the desire and ability to establish cooperative working relationships with employees at all levels within Yardi, outside of Yardi, and with clients 

DESIRED SKILLS/ABILITIES

Understanding of property management industry
Knowledge of TSQL  

WORKING ENVIRONMENT/PHYSICAL DEMANDS

Ability to work at assigned office location
Schedule flexibility to work with remote teams
Attend meetings and perform tasks for long periods of time on a computer and on the telephone
Regular attendance and a regular work schedule is an essential function of this job

                                                                                                   *lm

By continuing to browse this site you agree to our use of cookies. You can find out more about which cookies we are using or switch them off in settings.

 Privacy Overview


 Strictly Necessary Cookies


 3rd Party Cookies




 








Privacy Overview

This website uses cookies so that we can provide you with the best user experience possible. Cookie information is stored in your browser and performs functions such as recognising you when you return to our website and helping our team to understand which sections of the website you find most interesting and useful.
You can adjust all of your cookie settings by navigating the tabs on the left hand side.



 
Strictly Necessary Cookies

Strictly necessary cookies must be enabled at all times in order to login and apply to openings.



disable









If you disable this cookie, we will not be able to save your preferences and you will not be able to login to apply for openings. This means that every time you visit this website you will need to enable or disable cookies again.







3rd Party Cookies

This website uses Google Analytics to collect anonymous information such as the number of visitors to the site, and the most popular pages.
Keeping this cookie enabled helps us to improve our website.



disable









Please enable Strictly Necessary Cookies first so that we can save your preferences!

Save Changes

            Senior Voice and Data Technician



         Login to apply
    
















Senior Voice and Data Technician
Miami, FL 


The Senior Voice and Data Technician is responsible for a variety of activities, but most importantly, assessing and troubleshooting the network infrastructure of our customers for all our features including our telephony service
 
Responsibilities 

Provides hands-on technical assistance to Deployment Engineers and customers.
Identifies network design issues and provides feedback and suggestions for resolution.
Contribute to the improvement of network tools and systems used to support a variety of deployment tasks.
Triage, analyze, and provide operational support in troubleshooting system configuration, hardware/software, firmware, and network related issues, while collaborating with appropriate internal teams.
Responsible for staying updated on current Telecommunications, UC, Contact Centre, VoIP technologies and industry trends.
Performing all duties while maintaining a positive attitude and commitment to strong customer service.

 
 
Rquirements

Organization and planning; ability to understand and determine priorities, effectively manage time and develop work plans in order to accomplish tasks and/or projects.
Judgment and decision making; ability to apply general rules to specific problems to produce answers that make sense.
Innovation and creativity; ability to generate and translate ideas, and adapt to change
Teamwork; effectively participate and contribute as a member of a work group; ability to lead or follow others as appropriate in order to most effectively accomplish the goal or task at hand.
Communication; ability to clearly organize and effectively convey information
Bachelor's degree in Information Systems or Network Engineering equivalent and an understanding of related activities as would normally be acquired from a minimum of (8) eight years of increasingly responsible related work experience in the assigned function preferred.
Proven record of designing, troubleshooting, operating and improving
Complex national large enterprise networks.
Large regional, national, or international carrier-grade SIP VoIP networks.
Large regional, national, or international Internet backbone or IP service provider access networks * Expertise in TCP/IP networking (including LAN, WAN and WLAN).
Savvy understanding of telephony, network, and routing protocols - SIP, T1, PRO, RTP, RTCP, DNS, DHCP, DSCP, BGP, OSPF, EIGRP.
Expertise in SIP & VoIP systems.
Must have recent hands-on technical experience conducting troubleshooting to solve installation and break/fix issues associated with Voice and/or Video over IP products and integrating these components within heterogeneous network environments involving legacy PBX systems and the PSTN.
Must have experience reviewing Ethernet packet captures (e.g. tcpdump, Ethereal, Wireshark), studying network traffic flows and reading interface statistics to identify network connectivity and performance problems affecting Voice over IP communications.
Experience modifying firewall rule sets and/or effectively communicating firewall rule changes to ensure multimedia applications are capable of successfully traversing across firewalls is a plus.
Able to create and modify security policies on routers, switches, and firewalls.

 A thorough understanding and hands-on working knowledge of carrier-grade VoIP infrastructure, specifically:

Significant hosted PBXs platforms.
End point devices (Polycom, Cisco SPA and ATA, etc.) * Strong hands-on working knowledge of Redhat Linux firewall configuration, and cisco as well as allied switches.

*sa
  



         Login to apply

DTP Patient Qualification Representative  (86910) - Cleveland, OH - Inogen, Inc. Jobs








 














Home
Jobs




DTP Patient Qualification Representative  (86910) - Cleveland, OH

Toggle navigation








DTP Patient Qualification Representative  (86910) 

JobsLogin 












 Sales Cleveland, OH, USA Full Time 



Email Me Similar Jobs Email Me This Job



ABOUT INOGEN Inogen was founded in 2001 to improve quality of life and increase freedom and independence for oxygen therapy users. Inogen is innovation in oxygen therapy. The Inogen mission is to improve freedom and independence for oxygen therapy patients through innovative products and services. Inogen is a manufacturer and Accredited Homecare Provider.
Inogen is focused on quality care, continuous improvement, and outstanding customer satisfaction. We are a stable, USA based company dedicated to providing an exciting and rewarding career to our employees. We completed a successful Initial Public Offering on the NASDAQ in 2014 and have demonstrated substantial growth over the last five years. Our work environment is casual yet high performing, and we are looking for seriously talented, motivated, and fast-paced professionals to join our team.
JOB DESCRIPTION 
The DTP Patient Qualification Representative will be responsible for contacting digital leads, qualifying them and handing them off to existing Inogen resources to continue with the sales cycle. This role will assist in increasing the contact rate to ensure the quality of customer engagement when connected with a member do the sales team.
Key Competencies:
Conduct the minimum agreed upon inbound/outbound calls to potential patients that have expressed interested via the lead generation process.
Responsible for verification of postal address, oxygen therapy status and interest in Inogen products/services. 
Ensure compliance with all DTP related scripting when conducting call activity to qualifying potential leads. 
Hand off qualified leads to Customer Development Representatives for final sale of Inogen project(s). 
Utilize CRM (Salesforce) to document conversations and disposition of leads for appropriate next steps.
Work in partnership with DTP reps to continually improve qualifying techniques.
Assist with any other duties as assigned.
Do you possess these abilities?
Must have strong work ethic.
Excellent oral and written communication skills. 
Attention to detail. 
Possess a natural sales ability to help move customers forward in a sales cycle.
Exceptional consultative phone skills, including the ability to clearly articulate, influence, overcome objections while remaining resilient.
Ability to work with 65+ year demographic over the phone showing empathy and enthusiasm to help.
Strong time management and organizational skills, to manage call and follow-up activity.
Goal-oriented, results-driven with a high level of initiative and a sense of urgency.
Requirements:
High School diploma or equivalent, required. 
0-2 years Inside business development or inside sales experience, preferred. 
Basic knowledge/proficiency in Microsoft Office, required.
Basic knowledge/proficiency in SalesForce or another CRM, required
A combination of training, education and experience that is equivalent to the qualifications listed above and that provides the required knowledge, skills, and abilities.
 
WHY INOGEN Inogen is a dynamic company that is not only focused on quality care of patients, but is also committed to being a top employer.  Each of Inogen' s offices have a casual culture that supports employees being responsible and developing professionals.
We offer competitive salaries and a robust benefit package:
Employee Stock Purchase Plan 401 (K) plan available for all employees Health, dental, vision insurance Flexible spending accounts and wellness discount program Life Insurance Long Term Disability Robust paid time off and 8 paid holidays Employee Assistance Program
See the Inogen Team in action:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dKoTMeJf5J4
 
Inogen Where we go to work hard to positively impact people's lives
 
Inogen is an equal opportunity employer.  We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other legally protected characteristics. The EEO is the Law poster and its supplement are available here: http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/ofccpost.htm; http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/OFCCP_EEO_Supplement_Final_JRF_QA_508c.pdf.  The pay transparency policy is available here: http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/pdf/EO13665_PrescribedNondiscriminationPostingLanguage_JRFQA508c.pdf. 
Inogen is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities.  If you need a reasonable accommodation because of a disability for any part of the employment process, please send an e-mail to recruiting@inogen.net or call (972) 616-5668 and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information.
 
 

Inogen, Inc.
https://inogen.applicantpro.com

DevOps Build Automation Lead
Dulles, Virginia


Apply





Overview
Responsibilities
Success Profile
Rewards
Trending




Overview

What does it take to make the world a safer place? It takes delivering innovative technology and collaborating with some of the finest talent in the engineering field. Whether you’re a software engineer or a mechanical engineer, at Raytheon you’ll grow a varied and rewarding career. And you’ll be supported with a comprehensive and competitive benefits package that promotes work/life. If you’re ready to take on today’s big challenges, discover a world of opportunity at Raytheon.

America’s Best Large Employers by Forbes
Career & Development Opportunities

Responsibilities


Are you looking for an engineering career that is challenging and satisfying? Then join our Raytheon team of engineers solving problems that make the world a safer place and help to secure our great nation! Come support those who provide us with all the freedoms we enjoy.We offer great benefits that include medical, dental, vision, 401K match, flexible work schedule - just to name a few.  Click here to view a brief video and learn more: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qvbCgKpkEdsRaytheon Intelligence, Information and Services (IIS) delivers innovative technology to make the world a safer place. Our expertise in cyber, analytics and automation allow us to reach beyond what others think is possible to underpin national security and give our global customers unique solutions to solve the most pressing modern challenges -- from the cyber domain to automated operations, and from intelligent transportation solutions to creating clear insight from large volumes of data. IIS operates at nearly 550 sites in 80 countries, including a large presence in Dulles, VA. As a global business, our leaders must have the ability to understand, embrace and operate in a multicultural world -- in the marketplace and the workplace. We strive to hire people who reflect our communities and embrace diversity and inclusion to advance our culture, develop our employees, and grow our business.Job Description:The Raytheon IIS Hardware and Infrastructure Engineering (HW&I) team has a professional opening for a DevOps Build Automation Lead.  This role will be responsible for directing activities associated with development and implementation of automated infrastructure service builds for various development compute environments.  The qualified candidate will champion our Infrastructure as Code (IaC) tools and process to provide the capability to rapidly deploy and configure cloud resources and virtual machines in repeatable fashion.  The ability to obtain maintain a US Government Top Secret/SCI security clearance is required for this position (US citizenship required).This position is eligible for a Sign on Bonus of up to $40k for a candidate with a current verifiable TS/SCI clearance that is hired by Raytheon Required Skills:Experience architecting build automation solutions for system buildsExperience leading teams developing automation scriptsExperience installing, configuring, and administrating Linux systemsExperience with scripting languages such as Python, Go or bashExperience with deployment/configuration management tools (e.g. Ansible, Puppet, Chef)Experience with AWS or Azure or Oracle Cloud or equivalent technologies (e.g. EC2, EBS, RDS, Elasticache, Kinesis)Experience with different service models (e.g. IaaS, PaaS, SaaS) hosted in cloud environmentsAbility to obtain and maintain a US Government TS/SCI security clearanceDesired Skills:Experience with DevOps CI/CD software release tools (e.g. Jenkins, Travis, gitlab)Experience with container technology and microservices (Docker, Kubernetes or Istio)Existing US Government TS/SCI security clearanceEducation: Requires a degree in Science, Technology, Engineering or Mathematics (STEM) and 10 years of related work experience. 150381
Business Unit Profile
                        
                        Raytheon Intelligence, Information and Services delivers innovative technology to make the world a safer place. Our expertise in cyber, analytics and automation allow us to reach beyond what others think is possible to underpin national security and give our global customers unique solutions to solve the most pressing modern challenges -- from the cyber domain to automated operations, and from intelligent transportation and training solutions to creating clear insight from large volumes of data. IIS operates at nearly 550 sites in 80 countries, and is headquartered in Dulles, Virginia. The business area generated $6.2 billion in 2018 revenues. As a global business, our leaders must have the ability to understand, embrace and operate in a multicultural world -- in the marketplace and the workplace. We strive to hire people who reflect our communities and embrace diversity and inclusion to advance our culture, develop our employees, and grow our business.

401(k) / Retirement Plans

Work / Life Balance
Raytheon supports a variety of flexible work arrangements including compressed work weeks, flextime, job sharing, 9/80, reduced hours and telecommuting.



Career Development
At Raytheon, we foster an inclusive culture of professional development. We support a variety of developmental opportunities including: Mentoring programs, Skills Development, Leadership Development, Rotational job assignments, and Continuous Improvement, all of which contribute to advancement of our employee’s capabilities.



Paid Time Off
Accrue paid time off monthly. Receive 10-12 holidays per year with some locations shutting down the week between Christmas and New Year’s Day.



Relocation Assistance
Select technical positions are eligible for relocation packages. See specific job description for eligibility requirements.



Parental Leave
Raytheon offers all eligible employees up to three weeks paid parental leave for the birth or adoption of a child (separate from paid maternity leave or Family & Medical Leave Act).

If you’re ready to take on a fresh challenge, grow your career and contribute to making the world a safer place, Raytheon is ready to help you achieve your goals. Join our team and get the opportunity and support to find purpose, thrive and succeed.





Notice: Please be aware of suspicious recruiting emails and text messages that attempt to collect your confidential information. Raytheon conducts all electronic correspondence using e-mail addresses that end in “Raytheon.com”, “Raytheon.co.uk”, “Raytheon.com.au” or “brassring.com”. To report fraud please go to: https://www.ic3.gov.











Sr. Cyber Engineer I
Largo, Florida


Apply





Overview
Responsibilities
Success Profile
Rewards
Trending




Overview

What does it take to make the world a safer place? It takes delivering innovative technology and collaborating with some of the finest talent in the engineering field. Whether you’re a software engineer or a field engineer, at Raytheon you’ll grow a varied and rewarding career. And you’ll be supported with a comprehensive and competitive benefits package that promotes work/life. If you’re ready to take on today’s big challenges, discover a world of opportunity at Raytheon.

America’s Best Large Employers by Forbes
Career & Development Opportunities
Full-time
Entry, Mid, Senior level




Back to Job Navigation (Overview)


Responsibilities


Raytheon Intelligence, Information and Services (IIS) is currently seeking a Cyber Engineer that is a key contributor in the implementation of cyber engineering activities. This engineer will be involved throughout the full lifecycle of the development program including CONOPs development, requirements development, architecture, design, integration, test, and certification of products.  This engineer will support the ongoing business process activities such as metrics collection and analysis, program tailoring, and process documentation updates and deployment.Raytheon is a technology and innovation leader specializing in defense, security and civil markets throughout the world. Our latest company video is about our people, our technology, our vision, and the values we hold dear at Raytheon. Click here to view: https://youtu.be/qvbCgKpkEdsClearance Requirement:U.S. CITIZEN with the ability to obtain a TS/SCI clearance with CI PolyHires with Active TS/SCI, or higher, clearances are eligible for a sign-on bonus of "up to" $40,000.00Required Skills:• Experience developing cyber security solutions, Security Authorization requirements, and security policy and emerging cyber security technologies for Department of Defense (DoD) or similar federal agency• Experience implementing compliance with security requirements (i.e. Risk Management Framework, STIGs)• Familiarity with systems engineering process, sprint SW process, and products developed for network systems• Assessment of existing products to determine vulnerabilities and develop strategies for improving• Strong computer, Windows Operating Systems, Linux, and TCP/IP network troubleshooting abilities• Experience integrating and/or using any of the following applications or similar solutions: Cloud and Virtualization technologies• Working knowledge of IT infrastructure• Prior experience in a Security Operations Center• Experience with systems engineering at all development levels of a complex system (Program Execution)• Capable of developing technical solutions following the assessment of complex customer needs (Program Execution)• Ability to manage time and resources in order to meet assigned deadlines (Program Execution)• Internal and external experience conducting technical reviews with customers (Communication)• Excellent written and oral communication skills, including presentation skills and negotiation (Communication)Desired Skills and Certifications:• DOORs and requirements management experience• Project skills including cost, schedule, supplier management, risk, and opportunity assessment• Knowledge in network design and implementation• Demonstrated ability in IT vulnerability analysis and corrective actions• Experience with the usage of Public Key Infrastructure (PKI) in system development• Experience and knowledge in developing systems and configuring security postures• Experience performing Static and Dynamic Code Analysis• Experience with DevOps/DevSecOps     • Automation (Puppet, Ansible, Chef)     • Infrastructure-as-Code• Current IAM Level 1 or greater cybersecurity certification per DoD 8570.01-Manual• CISSP certification• Experience with Agile Development and the Atlassian tool suite (JIRA, Test Rail, Confluence) and/or Team Foundation Server• Experience performing penetration tests, malware analysis, forensics analysis, and security assessments• Active TS/SCI clearance with CI Poly• Current/Active US PassportEducation Requirements:4 years with a BA/BS degree in Science, Technology, Engineering or Math; or 2 years with a MA/MS in Science, Technology, Engineering or MathIISBonus 151254
Business Unit Profile
Raytheon Intelligence, Information and Services delivers innovative technology to make the world a safer place. Our expertise in cyber, analytics and automation allow us to reach beyond what others think is possible to underpin national security and give our global customers unique solutions to solve the most pressing modern challenges -- from the cyber domain to automated operations, and from intelligent transportation and training solutions to creating clear insight from large volumes of data. IIS operates at nearly 550 sites in 80 countries, and is headquartered in Dulles, Virginia. The business area generated $6.2 billion in 2018 revenues. As a global business, our leaders must have the ability to understand, embrace and operate in a multicultural world -- in the marketplace and the workplace. We strive to hire people who reflect our communities and embrace diversity and inclusion to advance our culture, develop our employees, and grow our business.

Quote



I joined Raytheon in 2016 and I’m proud to work here. My company makes some pretty amazing things, including missile defense, using data to predict the weather, and securing our GPS system. My company also works with artificial intelligence, machine learning and other innovative solutions. I’m proud to work for an organization that allows me the flexibility to be a STEM volunteer and help inspire our future generation.

Student Loan Repayment Contribution
Through the 401(k), called the Raytheon Savings and Investment Plan, the company will make a dollar for dollar contribution for amounts employees spend repaying their student loans, up to their maximum match percentage.

Patient Intake Advocate  (96547) - Richardson, TX - Inogen, Inc. Jobs








 














Home
Jobs




Patient Intake Advocate  (96547) - Richardson, TX

Toggle navigation








Patient Intake Advocate  (96547) 

JobsLogin 












 Patient Intake Richardson, TX, USA Full Time 



Email Me Similar Jobs Email Me This Job



ABOUT INOGEN Inogen was founded in 2001 to improve quality of life and increase freedom and independence for oxygen therapy users. Inogen is innovation in oxygen therapy. The Inogen mission is to improve freedom and independence for oxygen therapy patients through innovative products and services. Inogen is a manufacturer and Accredited Homecare Provider.
Inogen is focused on quality care, continuous improvement, and outstanding customer satisfaction. We are a stable, USA based company dedicated to providing an exciting and rewarding career to our employees. We completed a successful Initial Public Offering on the NASDAQ in 2014 and have demonstrated substantial growth over the last five years. Our work environment is casual yet high performing, and we are looking for seriously talented, motivated, and fast-paced professionals to join our team.
JOB DESCRIPTION 
The Patient Intake Advocate works within the Patient Intake Business Unit and is the key individual responsible for receiving and submitting orders, while ensuring they follow all applicable accreditation, compliance/regulatory processes, Inogen policy, and Payor guidelines. This includes a completion of the appropriate patient file within database systems, review of medical documentation, procuring payment information, and obtaining patient supplied documents.
Key Competencies:
Professionally handle high volume of incoming/outgoing calls for rental orders and insurance referrals from internal and external sources to gather information for the patient onboarding process 
Responsible for validating information gathered by Customer Development Representative - DTP and communicating or resolving any deficits to include but not limited to: patient demographics, insurance information, verification of benefits, and validation that patient meets Inogen patient onboarding guidelines
Have a basic understanding of payor specific guidelines in order to facilitate the patient onboarding of profitable new rental patients
Responsible for communicating expectations and timeframes to new patients 
Responsible for informing patient and /or referral source where it has been identified that the patient does not meet Inogen patient onboarding guidelines
Responsible for obtaining patient paperwork packet and auto-pay information for future process, as applicable, following all regulations and guidelines.
Ensures Inogen's compliance with all state and federal regulations.
Ensures that all patient documents are executed in accordance with HIPAA guidelines.
Maintain regular and punctual attendance. 
Comply with all company policies and procedures. 
Assist with any other duties as assigned.
Do you possess these abilities?
Excellent verbal and written communication skills required.
Must possess good time management skills, with the ability to prioritize and multi-task.
Must be detail-oriented and analytical to ensure documentation is being assessed properly. 
Experience with CRM platforms, preferably Salesforce, Oracle, and/or Brightree preferred.
Work experience or knowledge of the healthcare industry, preferably specific to Medicare or prescription guidelines.
Requirements:
High School diploma or equivalent, required. 
0-1 years of experience reviewing documentation for Medicare Oxygen/DME Billing, Insurance Billing, or prescription requirements, required. 
Experience working with Medical Sales personnel, preferred
Intermediate knowledge/proficiency in Microsoft Office, Salesforce, Oracle, and/or Brightree, preferred. 
A combination of training, education and experience that is equivalent to the qualifications listed above and that provides the required knowledge, skills, and abilities.
 
WHY INOGEN Inogen is a dynamic company that is not only focused on quality care of patients, but is also committed to being a top employer.  Each of Inogen' s offices have a casual culture that supports employees being responsible and developing professionals.
We offer competitive salaries and a robust benefit package:
Employee Stock Purchase Plan 401 (K) plan available for all employees Health, dental, vision insurance Flexible spending accounts and wellness discount program Life Insurance Long Term Disability Robust paid time off and 8 paid holidays Employee Assistance Program
See the Inogen Team in action:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dKoTMeJf5J4
 
Inogen Where we go to work hard to positively impact people's lives
 
Inogen is an equal opportunity employer.  We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other legally protected characteristics. The EEO is the Law poster and its supplement are available here: http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/ofccpost.htm; http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/OFCCP_EEO_Supplement_Final_JRF_QA_508c.pdf.  The pay transparency policy is available here: http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/pdf/EO13665_PrescribedNondiscriminationPostingLanguage_JRFQA508c.pdf. 
Inogen is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities.  If you need a reasonable accommodation because of a disability for any part of the employment process, please send an e-mail to recruiting@inogen.net or call (972) 616-5668 and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information.
 
 

Inogen, Inc.
https://inogen.applicantpro.com

If you’re ready to take on a fresh challenge, grow your career and contribute to making the world a safer place, Raytheon is ready to help you achieve your goals. Join our team and get the opportunity and support to find purpose, thrive and succeed.





Notice: Please be aware of suspicious recruiting emails and text messages that attempt to collect your confidential information. Raytheon conducts all electronic correspondence using e-mail addresses that end in “Raytheon.com”, “Raytheon.co.uk”, “Raytheon.com.au” or “brassring.com”. To report fraud please go to: https://www.ic3.gov.











Cyber  Engineer II
Indianapolis, Indiana


Apply





Overview
Responsibilities
Success Profile
Rewards
Trending




Overview

What does it take to make the world a safer place? It takes delivering innovative technology and collaborating with some of the finest talent in the engineering field. Whether you’re a software engineer or a mechanical engineer, at Raytheon you’ll grow a varied and rewarding career. And you’ll be supported with a comprehensive and competitive benefits package that promotes work/life. If you’re ready to take on today’s big challenges, discover a world of opportunity at Raytheon.

America’s Best Large Employers by Forbes
Career & Development Opportunities
Full-time
Entry, Mid, Senior level




Back to Job Navigation (Overview)


Responsibilities


Raytheon is a technology and innovation leader specializing in defense, security and civil markets throughout the world.  Our latest company video is about our people, our technology, our vision, and the values we hold dear at Raytheon. Click here to view: https://youtu.be/qvbCgKpkEdsIf this is interesting then join our Raytheon team of smart people solving problems that make the world a safer place and help to secure our great nation! Come support those who provide us with all the freedoms we enjoy. Our facility in Indianapolis, IN offers amenities that create work and life balance. The Indianapolis site is a 973,000 square foot facility that actually began building bombsights during WWII.  On site, we have a cafeteria plus a fun space with a pool table, foosball and ping-pong. Additionally, employee appreciation lunches, achievement award opportunities, flexible work schedules and great benefits that include medical, dental, vision, and 401K match are just a few of the reasons people come to work at Raytheon!Raytheon Intelligence, Information and Services (IIS) is currently seeking a Cyber Engineer to be a key contributor in the implementation of cyber engineering into DoD platform based products.  This position will be involved throughout the full lifecycle of the development program including proposal, Concept of Operations (CONOPs) development, requirements development, architecture, design, integration, test, and certification of products.  Minimal travel (up to 15%) will be required to support testing at customer sites as well as various activities during the development phase.Required Skills: Experience with implementing embedded Cybersecurity Solutions, Security Authorization requirements, vulnerability assessments, threat mitigation, and emerging Cybersecurity technologiesProduct development experience, to include: architecture, requirements, design, integration, and testingCurrent or ability to obtain in 3 months IAT level 2 or greater cybersecurity certification per DoD 8570.01; such as: Security+, CySA+, etc.Compliance implementation with security requirements (i.e. Risk Management Framework and other A&A processes)Agile development experience with embedded and networked systemsSystems Engineering experience working with complex embedded systems or equivalent capabilityCapable of developing technical solutions following the assessment of complex customer needsExperience in participating in technical reviews with both internal and external customersDesired Skills: Project management experience including cost, schedule, supplier management, risk, and opportunity assessmentKnowledge in developing systems and configuring security postures with real time operating systems (RTOS), such as: VxWorks, Green Hills Integrity, etc. Experience with firmware development languages (e.g. VHDL design, VeriLog, etc.) Experience with software design and implementationImplementation of Anti-Tamper solutions in Embedded products and systemsExperience working on DoD programsAbility to accurately size cyber engineering efforts and execute this taskingEducation Requirements: Bachelor’s Degree in Science, Technology, Engineering or Math with 2 years of relevant experience Master’s Degree  in Science, Technology, Engineering or MathThis position requires either a U.S. Person or a Non-U.S. Person who is eligible to obtain any required Export Authorization. 152209
Business Unit Profile
                        
                        Intelligence, Information and Services delivers innovative technology to make the world a safer place. Our expertise in cyber, analytics and automation allow us to reach beyond what others think is possible to underpin national security and give our global customers unique solutions to solve the most pressing modern challenges -- from the cyber domain to automated operations, and from intelligent transportation and training solutions to creating clear insight from large volumes of data. IIS operates at nearly 550 sites in 80 countries, and is headquartered in Dulles, Virginia. The business area generated $6.2 billion in 2018 revenues. As a global business, our leaders must have the ability to understand, embrace and operate in a multicultural world -- in the marketplace and the workplace. We strive to hire people who reflect our communities and embrace diversity and inclusion to advance our culture, develop our employees, and grow our business.
Relocation Eligible 
                        
                        Yes
Clearance Type 
                        
                        TS/SCI

Back to Job Navigation (Success)


Quote



Felicia Jackson is regional vice president of RAYVETS, Raytheon's employee group for veterans and those who support them. After 24 years in the Air Force, she started a new career at Raytheon. "I wanted to go where people would support me," she told us.









Rewards




401(k) / Retirement Plans
Employer Matching, if you elect to enroll company matches up to 3%.



Work / Life Balance
Raytheon supports a variety of flexible work arrangements including compressed work weeks, flextime, job sharing, 9/80, reduced hours and telecommuting.



Career Development
At Raytheon, we foster an inclusive culture of professional development. We support a variety of developmental opportunities including: Mentoring programs, Skills Development, Leadership Development, Rotational job assignments, and Continuous Improvement, all of which contribute to advancement of our employee’s capabilities.



Paid Time Off
Accrue paid time off monthly. Receive 10-12 holidays per year with some locations shutting down the week between Christmas and New Year’s Day.



Relocation Assistance
Select technical positions are eligible for relocation packages. See specific job description for eligibility requirements.



Parental Leave
Raytheon offers all eligible employees up to three weeks paid parental leave for the birth or adoption of a child (separate from paid maternity leave or Family & Medical Leave Act).

            Cloud Support Specialist I



         Login to apply
    
















Cloud Support Specialist I
Santa Barbara, CA 


Providing Level 1 & 2 environmental and technical support to Yardi Systems SaaS customers as part of the 24x7x365 Cloud Services team.  The Cloud Support specialist is responsible for supporting the Yardi Cloud and will work as part of a global team and liaise with customer contacts and relevant internal teams to ensure requests are actioned and technical issues are resolved in a timely fashion.
Duties/Responsibilities  

Configuring, supporting, and troubleshooting Yardi Cloud environments.
Installing and configuring Yardi SaaS products.
Providing phone based Level 1 & 2 environmental support for Yardi customers.
Monitoring and responding to system alerts.
Maintaining and improving documentation.
Working on an international team and liaise with global counterparts as required.
Participating in an enterprise 24x7x365 support environment with weekend and on call work required.

 Qualifications

Exposure to SaaS technologies; IIS, server virtualization, SQL, PowerShell.
A passion for technology and strong problem solving skills.
Ability to learn new software and troubleshoot processes quickly.
Good analytical, organizational skills and attention to detail.
Good written and spoken communication skills.
Strong sense of customer service.
Must enjoy being part of a team and enjoy dealing with people.

 Requirements

Former IT experience and training. Experience with Windows Server, Internet Information Services (IIS) and SQL preferred but not essential.
Relevant IT qualifications preferred but not essential.
Proven customer service experience.
Dependable attendance record.

By continuing to browse this site you agree to our use of cookies. You can find out more about which cookies we are using or switch them off in settings.

 Privacy Overview


 Strictly Necessary Cookies


 3rd Party Cookies




 








Privacy Overview

This website uses cookies so that we can provide you with the best user experience possible. Cookie information is stored in your browser and performs functions such as recognising you when you return to our website and helping our team to understand which sections of the website you find most interesting and useful.
You can adjust all of your cookie settings by navigating the tabs on the left hand side.



 
Strictly Necessary Cookies

Strictly necessary cookies must be enabled at all times in order to login and apply to openings.



disable









If you disable this cookie, we will not be able to save your preferences and you will not be able to login to apply for openings. This means that every time you visit this website you will need to enable or disable cookies again.







3rd Party Cookies

This website uses Google Analytics to collect anonymous information such as the number of visitors to the site, and the most popular pages.
Keeping this cookie enabled helps us to improve our website.



disable









Please enable Strictly Necessary Cookies first so that we can save your preferences!

IT Business Analyst - Finance (84218) - Goleta, CA - Inogen, Inc. Jobs








 














Home
Jobs




IT Business Analyst - Finance (84218) - Goleta, CA

Toggle navigation








IT Business Analyst - Finance (84218) 

JobsLogin 












 IT Goleta, CA, USA Full Time 



Email Me Similar Jobs Email Me This Job



ABOUT INOGEN Inogen was founded in 2001 to improve quality of life and increase freedom and independence for oxygen therapy users. Inogen is innovation in oxygen therapy. The Inogen mission is to improve freedom and independence for oxygen therapy patients through innovative products and services. Inogen is a manufacturer and Accredited Homecare Provider.
Inogen is focused on quality care, continuous improvement, and outstanding customer satisfaction. We are a stable, USA based company dedicated to providing an exciting and rewarding career to our employees. We completed a successful Initial Public Offering on the NASDAQ in 2014 and have demonstrated substantial growth over the last five years. Our work environment is casual yet high performing, and we are looking for seriously talented, motivated, and fast-paced professionals to join our team.
JOB DESCRIPTION 
As a member of the IT Business Analysis team, the IT Business Analyst will be a key finance functional resource supporting Inogen Oracle EBS system. Working under the direction of the Manager of Business Analysis, the Business Analyst will work closely with Business Stakeholders to develop business processes, collect business requirements, create technical designs, lead projects to implement the solutions and provide ongoing business system support.
Key Competencies:
Be the primary functional Analyst for the Inogen business systems, including: Oracle eBusiness Suite R12 and other enterprise-scale applications
Adept at determining requirements by interviewing business stakeholders, reviewing documentation and facilitating working sessions. 
Adept at creating business process models based on the requirements 
Adept at mapping industry trends and best practices to the Inogen's unique requirements and processes to determine applicable fit. 
Capable of defining, architecting and re-engineering business processes. 
Able to present proposed solutions to business stakeholders and management via whiteboard and PowerPoint. Translate Inogen business requirements into technical designs
Develop business reports, interfaces and module enhancements using Oracle & 3rd party development tools
Perform unit, integrated and functional tests and resolve issues found during testing
Troubleshoot and debug applications systems, reports and interfaces
Support & assist end users in the use of the Inogen business applications
Seek assistance from, and lead teams of application system vendor-partners to resolve support issues 
Work directly with Oracle Customer Support to resolve issues.
Do you possess these abilities?
Possess strong communication and training skills and be able to communicate technical information to non-technical users (Required)
Deep and broad working experience with using and configuring within Oracle eBusiness Suite R12.1.3, specifically in the following modules: 1. General Ledger including the Financial Statement Generator and Web ADI 2. Receivables 3. Payables 4. Fixed Assets 5. Cash Management 6. Advanced Collections 7. Asset tracking 8. Incentive Compensation 8) Purchasing (Required)
5 years of working Knowledge of corporate accounting best practices and processes and translating the processes into functional and technical system requirements (Required) 
Experience with configuring within Oracle eBusiness Suite R12.1.3, in the following modules: Depot Repair, Install base, Service Contracts, Asset Tracking, Inventory, Order Management, Advanced Pricing & Discrete Manufacturing.  (Desired)
5 years of experience with developing solution designs from business requirements (Required)
Excellent oral and written communication skills (Required)
Keen attention to detail (Required)
Outstanding teamwork skills (Required)
A great desire to learn new skills and technologies (Required)
5 years of experience leading project teams of in-house and vendor partner technical resources (Required)
Experience in medical device manufacturing business processes, specifically in asset tracking, inventory, and SKU management (Desired)
Knowledge in Business Intelligence, Oracle Reports, Discoverer, Master Data Management and EDI (Desired)
Requirements:
A Bachelor's degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Accounting, Finance or equivalent
5+ years finance functional support in design and test experience with Oracle eBusiness Suite, Reports, APIs and interfaces
 
WHY INOGEN Inogen is a dynamic company that is not only focused on quality care of patients, but is also committed to being a top employer.  Each of Inogen' s offices have a casual culture that supports employees being responsible and developing professionals.
We offer competitive salaries and a robust benefit package:
Employee Stock Purchase Plan 401 (K) plan available for all employees Health, dental, vision insurance Flexible spending accounts and wellness discount program Life Insurance Long Term Disability Robust paid time off and 8 paid holidays Employee Assistance Program
See the Inogen Team in action:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dKoTMeJf5J4
 
Inogen Where we go to work hard to positively impact people's lives
 
Inogen is an equal opportunity employer.  We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other legally protected characteristics. The EEO is the Law poster and its supplement are available here: http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/ofccpost.htm; http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/OFCCP_EEO_Supplement_Final_JRF_QA_508c.pdf.  The pay transparency policy is available here: http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/pdf/EO13665_PrescribedNondiscriminationPostingLanguage_JRFQA508c.pdf. 
Inogen is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities.  If you need a reasonable accommodation because of a disability for any part of the employment process, please send an e-mail to recruiting@inogen.net or call (972) 616-5668 and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information.
 
 

Inogen, Inc.
https://inogen.applicantpro.com

            Associate Technical Account Manager



         Login to apply
    
















Associate Technical Account Manager
Toronto, ON 


Associate Technical Account Managers at Yardi will provide consultative, implementation and technical support to a group of assigned Yardi clients in order to manage business operations and financial accounting functions in Yardi’s Voyager software.
Responsibilities

Implements the Yardi suite of software products by assisting clients with system implementation, training, and technical support
Researches, analyzes and resolves software issues
Supports software product customization based on client requirements
Performs data mapping and conversions
Performs system and business process reviews and other service reviews and makes recommendations on best practices
Works on a regular basis with Yardi internal resource teams to include: training, conversion, sales and development

Requirements

Bachelor’s degree in Economics, Business, Math, Statistics or Information Management preferred
Experience setting and managing client expectations
Superior verbal and written communication skills
Project Management, Accounting, or Property Management experience/background
Solid Proficiency in MS Office Suite and Outlook
Knowledge in three of the following areas: Property Management, Accounting, Microsoft Windows, Technical Support, SQL, HTML/ASP
Prior experience with property management software or real estate software highly desirable
Prior experience with Yardi software highly desirable
Regular attendance and a regular work schedule is an essential function of this job.

Although we review each application submitted for this position, due to the large number of applications we receive, only candidates under consideration will be contacted.
Yardi is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to inclusive, barrier-free recruitment and selection processes. If contacted for an employment opportunity, please advise if you require accommodation at any stage of the recruitment process.*ft 



         Login to apply

If you’re ready to take on a fresh challenge, grow your career and contribute to making the world a safer place, Raytheon is ready to help you achieve your goals. Join our team and get the opportunity and support to find purpose, thrive and succeed.





Notice: Please be aware of suspicious recruiting emails and text messages that attempt to collect your confidential information. Raytheon conducts all electronic correspondence using e-mail addresses that end in “Raytheon.com”, “Raytheon.co.uk”, “Raytheon.com.au” or “brassring.com”. To report fraud please go to: https://www.ic3.gov.











Sr Systems Engineer I - Infrastructure Deployment

Overview

Raytheon delivers innovative technology to make the world a safer place. Our expertise in cyber, analytics and automation allow us to reach beyond what others think is possible to underpin national security and give our global customers unique solutions to solve the most pressing modern challenges -- from the cyber domain to automated operations, and from intelligent transportation solutions to creating clear insight from large volumes of data. Our leaders must have the ability to understand, embrace and operate in a multicultural world -- in the marketplace and the workplace. We strive to hire people who reflect our communities and embrace diversity and inclusion to advance our culture, develop our employees, and grow our business.

Full-time
Entry to Senior level

Glassdoor 2017 Best Places to Interview: Candidate's Choice

Rewards




401(k) / Retirement Plans
Employer Matching, if you elect to enroll company matches up to 3%.



Work / Life Balance
Raytheon appreciates work/life balance. Employees can work 9 hours a day every week and received every other Friday off, as long as departmental/manager approval is obtained. Accrued paid time off monthly and paid holiday time.



Career Development
At Raytheon, we foster an inclusive culture of professional development. We support a variety of developmental opportunities including: Mentoring programs, Skills Development, Leadership Development, Rotational job assignments, and Continuous Improvement, all of which contribute to advancement of our employee’s capabilities.



Paid Time Off
Accrue paid time off monthly. Receive 12 holidays per year including the week between Christmas and New Year’s Day.



Relocation Assistance
Select technical positions are eligible for relocation packages. See specific job description for eligibility requirements.



Parental Leave
Raytheon offers all eligible employees up to three weeks paid parental leave for the birth or adoption of a child (separate from paid maternity leave or Family & Medical Leave Act).



Back to Job Navigation (Rewards)



Responsibilities


Would you like to work in a collaborative environment at a state of the art facility in Colorado? Then join our Raytheon team of engineers solving problems that make the world a safer place and help to secure our great nation! Come support those who provide us with all the freedoms we enjoy.Our facility in Aurora, CO offers amenities that create work and life balance. On site we have a 24/7 fitness facility, health center, cafeteria, collaboration rooms and dynamic break areas for easy conversation and socialization. Additionally, employee appreciation lunches, bonus opportunities, and great benefits that include medical, dental, vision, 401K match, flexible work schedule - just to name a few.  Click here to view a brief video and learn more: https://youtu.be/YNuZN0vyzHgJob Description:Raytheon IIS is seeking a Deployment Engineer who will be responsible for calculating and maintaining metrics related to platform releases and defect reporting as well as exercising CM controls to maintain and protect the baseline of a complex system. This system will be an operational system, currently in development. The candidate would monitor and assist in planning the work of others, coordinate fixes (Discrepancy Reports), working with a team to coordinate releases/upgrades. The overall project consists of several complex computer environments that form the backbone for the operational deployment of a critical, strategic national asset. The responsibilities of a design engineer include representing the service across the team. This position may require some on call support and overtime as well as limited (<10%) travel as required for installation and troubleshooting support. A Secret DoD security clearance is required.  US Citizenship is required.Candidate’s responsibilities would be: Maintaining baseline (COTS & O/S) configurations in multiple server environments, as well as centrally managing the deployment of patches or rebuilds of various components (COTS) of the systemCoordinate and review the delivery of fixes through the program’s discrepancy resolution process. Communicate with management risks and any issues involving performance, availability, or security.Plan for future improvements and fixes while ensuring that any changes follow the Project’s change management processes.Required skills:Experience with complex computer systems.Experience with the architecture or design of Infrastructure Service Software: either O/S installation and configuration (Lunix, Windows, ESXi) or COTS installation and configuration (e.g., monitoring, logging, scanning, Cyber, etc.).Ability to prepare and present status, plans, and risks to managementGeneral working knowledge of networks, storage, and virtualizationUnderstanding of Change Management processes - Version Control of software and applications using ClearCase and familiarity with DR’s, CR’s, and IR’s written with ClearQuestThe ability to effectively plan their own work and the work of othersDesired Skills:Background in COTS product InstallationExperience with automation tools such as Chef, Puppet, Ansible, SaltStack, Fabric or similar products for O/S builds, software installation and configurationExperience with DISA STIGsExperience with Windows and/or Linux System AdministrationExperience in matching system requirements (specific user or VM requirements) to compute capabilities (RAM, single-threaded speed, total throughput) and the knowledge and ability to select specific types of compute servers to meet those requirements.Working knowledge of networks, storage, and virtualizationExperience with: firmware/drivers/troubleshooting/prototyping for non-Virtualized systems/issuesBackground in Systems Operations environment supporting complex environment deployment and management activitiesExperience with virtualization tools and cloud computing, either private (VMware, OpenStack) or public (AWS) Systems integration experienceEducation Requirements: Requires a degree in Science, Technology, Engineering or Mathematics (STEM) and 4+ years of related work experience  150082

  and technical marketing staff.Click here for information on applying.
