Sr Multi-Disciplined Eng II
Apply
Requisition ID 149534BR Date updated 10/24/2019
Raytheon Intelligence, Information & Services (IIS) is currently seeking a Data Analytics Engineer (Sr Multi-Disciplined Engineer II) reporting to the Engineering Business Analytics Department Manager. The duties of this position require leveraging your skills to innovate, build, and maintain well-managed data analysis and metrics management solutions to tackle business problems.Duties:Turn analytic insights into actionable results that enhance the effectiveness, efficiency, and/or bottom line for the businessCommunicate technical information in a way that business users understand easilyProvide data driven insights and visualizations Work with the Engineering leadership to affect change to ensure analytics tools, processes and metrics are effectively used to assess new and ongoing program(s)Recommend and implement enhancements that standardize and streamline processes, assure data quality and reliability, and reduce processing time to meet internal and external customer expectationsInterface with multiple echelons of the IIS business, functions, mission areas, and programsThis position will require the candidate to obtain and maintain an SSBI Security Clearance.  Existing clearance strongly preferred.Required Skills:Minimum 6+ years of experience in data analytics or similar roleAbility to communicate complex technical information in a concise and easy to understand format (verbal, written, and visual)Demonstrated experience collecting, analyzing, and reporting program performance metricsAbility to conduct root cause analysisKnowledge of predictive analyticsDemonstrated experience with cross-functional collaboration and influence, must be cooperative, flexible and able to work well with othersAbility to influence and communicate with cross functional teams for knowledge sharingDesired Skills: Experience with SQL, R, Python, or other programming languageFamiliarity with Artificial Intelligence or Machine LearningExperience with Microsoft Power BI or other data visualization software toolsFamiliarity with Agile, Scrum, and/or Lean Kanban developmentRaytheon 6 Sigma Certification or industry equivalentExisting SSBI or TS/SCI ClearanceRequired Education (including Major): Minimum Bachelor’s Degree in Science, Technology, Engineering, or Mathematics.  149534
Business Unit Profile
            Raytheon Intelligence, Information and Services delivers innovative technology to make the world a safer place. Our expertise in cyber, analytics and automation allow us to reach beyond what others think is possible to underpin national security and give our global customers unique solutions to solve the most pressing modern challenges -- from the cyber domain to automated operations, and from intelligent transportation and training solutions to creating clear insight from large volumes of data. IIS operates at nearly 550 sites in 80 countries, and is headquartered in Dulles, Virginia. The business area generated $6.2 billion in 2018 revenues. As a global business, our leaders must have the ability to understand, embrace and operate in a multicultural world -- in the marketplace and the workplace. We strive to hire people who reflect our communities and embrace diversity and inclusion to advance our culture, develop our employees, and grow our business.

Relocation Eligible 
            No

Clearance Type 
            SSBI

Expertise 
 
              Data Science
                
            

Type Of Job 
            Full Time


Work Location 
 
              TX - RichardsonVA - Dulles

Related Content




Work on interesting projects and enjoy plenty of recognition
Whether you’re just starting out on your career journey or a experienced professional, it’s important that you feel recognized and rewarded for your contributions.
Raytheon is proud to offer a comprehensive and competitive benefits package to you, your spouse and your eligible children. In addition to protecting you and your family's health and well-being, we offer important income and work/life benefits to meet your needs. Learn More





Turn unique thinking into one-of-a-kind solutions
Diversity. Every company likes to talk about it, but few have embraced it with quite the same commitment as we have here at Raytheon. As a result, diversity has become a competitive imperative and an integral part of our business model, particularly as we continue to grow internationally. Learn More








Work as one to make a difference to millions
Here at Raytheon, we innovate across all domains: from land and sea to air, space, and cyberspace.It’s innovation made possible by a strong internal culture and a vision that’s shared by Raytheon employees across the globe – a vision of one global team creating trusted, innovative solutions to make the world a safer place. Learn More

Referral Development Manager  (91951) - Houston, TX - Inogen, Inc. Jobs








 














Home
Jobs




Referral Development Manager  (91951) - Houston, TX

Toggle navigation








Referral Development Manager  (91951) 

JobsLogin 












 RDM Sales Houston, TX, USA Full Time 



Email Me Similar Jobs Email Me This Job



ABOUT INOGEN Inogen was founded in 2001 to improve quality of life and increase freedom and independence for oxygen therapy users. Inogen is innovation in oxygen therapy. The Inogen mission is to improve freedom and independence for oxygen therapy patients through innovative products and services. Inogen is a manufacturer and Accredited Homecare Provider.
Inogen is focused on quality care, continuous improvement, and outstanding customer satisfaction. We are a stable, USA based company dedicated to providing an exciting and rewarding career to our employees. We completed a successful Initial Public Offering on the NASDAQ in 2014 and have demonstrated substantial growth over the last five years. Our work environment is casual yet high performing, and we are looking for seriously talented, motivated, and fast-paced professionals to join our team.
JOB DESCRIPTION 
The Referral Development Manager (RDM) calls on physicians and discharge planners, winning patient referrals for Inogen. Works to increase marketplace adoption of Inogen products, while exceeding customer expectations and providing a consistently high level of service. The RDM is an Inogen product and clinical applications expert and operates in close collaboration with other Referral Development Managers and the National Sales Director to achieve corporate sales objectives.
Key Competencies:
Procure new oxygen patient referrals to meet/exceed sales targets.
Represent/promote Inogen product and services to referral community.
Meet/exceed monthly sales call targets.
Deliver/set up equipment when necessary.
Keep detailed records of all sales activities and customer interactions.
Provide/execute territory sales plan, including strategic and tactical approaches that will result in successful outcomes.
Maintain regular and punctual attendance. 
Comply with all company policies and procedures. 
Assist with any other duties as assigned. 
Do you possess these abilities?
Excellent presentation skills required.
Oxygen referral experience with proven track record required.
Must be a self-starter and deliver results with limited oversight.
Experience working with the 65+ demographic a plus.
Proven track record of successful team participation is required.
Successful experience in identifying new referral opportunities desired.
Must have strong work ethic.
Excellent oral and written communication skills required. 
Attention to detail is required. 
Effective conflict resolution. 
Analytical & problem-solving skills & ability to multi task. 
Solutions-oriented problem solver. 
Excellent planning, communication and organizational skills. Requirements:
Bachelor's degree in Sales, Technical, Business, Clinical, or related field of study, required.  
Clinical background/licensure (RT, RN), preferred.
3-5 years medical referral sales experience, required. 
Basic knowledge/proficiency in Microsoft Office, required.
A combination of training, education and experience that is equivalent to the qualifications listed above and that provides the required knowledge, skills, and abilities.
WHY INOGEN Inogen is a dynamic company that is not only focused on quality care of patients, but is also committed to being a top employer.  Each of Inogen' s offices have a casual culture that supports employees being responsible and developing professionals.
We offer competitive salaries and a robust benefit package:
Employee Stock Purchase Plan 401 (K) plan available for all employees Health, dental, vision insurance Flexible spending accounts and wellness discount program Life Insurance Long Term Disability Robust paid time off and 8 paid holidays Employee Assistance Program
See the Inogen Team in action:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dKoTMeJf5J4
 
Inogen Where we go to work hard to positively impact people's lives
 
Inogen is an equal opportunity employer.  We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other legally protected characteristics. The EEO is the Law poster and its supplement are available here: http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/ofccpost.htm; http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/OFCCP_EEO_Supplement_Final_JRF_QA_508c.pdf.  The pay transparency policy is available here: http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/pdf/EO13665_PrescribedNondiscriminationPostingLanguage_JRFQA508c.pdf. 
Inogen is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities.  If you need a reasonable accommodation because of a disability for any part of the employment process, please send an e-mail to recruiting@inogen.net or call (972) 616-5668 and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information.
 
 

Inogen, Inc.

            Account Executive



         Login to apply
    
















Account Executive
Dallas, TX 


The Account Executive for Multifamily will be responsible for developing and cultivating a regional territory and selling Yardi’s products and services to prospects and existing clients within the residential real estate property management industry.  This is an outside sales position requiring software sales experience in the real estate space.
Responsibilities 

Heavy prospecting and identifying new sales opportunities for a designated territory
Managing sales activities to support business plans and revenue goals
Cultivating and managing professional relationships with prospects and existing clients at the senior level
Becoming familiar with all product solutions, the competitive climate, and promoting company products in the marketplace
Conducting online and onsite presentations to demonstrate Yardi’s product offerings
Developing and executing outbound call and email campaigns
Participating and networking at industry events and tradeshows
Meeting or exceeding monthly, quarterly and annual revenue goals
Maintaining accurate account information and forecasting details through a CRM system
Establishing a strong sales pipeline, sales forecasts and updating accounts to support revenue growth
Identifying client needs by introducing and up-selling Yardi ancillary tools/products to potentially increase client revenue opportunities.
Assisting with the development and implementation of marketing materials and programs
Participating in regular sales meetings to report on the status of all opportunities in the sales pipeline and new acquisitions to the pipeline

**This position will require up to 50% travel**
Requirements

Bachelor’s degree of equivalent experience
3+years of successful sales experience managing and developing a sales territory
Solid knowledge base in sales and ability to apply basic sales principles (i.e. lead generation, opportunity qualification, proposal development, account management and closure)
Ability to effectively execute sales strategies using a consultative approach and relationship building techniques
Ability to interface with all levels within the client organization to include individual properties, large portfolios and other senior leadership in mid-sized to large companies
Strong ,engaging presentation skills and ability to demonstrate product value
Ability to develop and maintain solid client relationships
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Ability to internally motivate, work interdependently, and also work effectively with a team
Ability to understand and demonstrate technical products
Prior experience entering data into a CRM system to support up to date client contact and information
Proven track record of achieving or exceeding sales goals
Prior background in software sales, property management or accounting systems desirable

*cl

You can adjust all of your cookie settings by navigating the tabs on the left hand side.

            Associate Account Executive



         Login to apply
    
















Associate Account Executive
Long Island, NY 


This entry level opportunity as an Associate Account Executive will work to effectively develop a multi-state territory through cold calling prospects, developing a solid sales pipeline and closing sales deals.
Responsibilities include:

Lead generation and qualification
Fielding, qualifying and closing inbound sale inquires
Prospecting and telephone marketing for new prospect clients
Creating, tracking, closing and reporting results of sales opportunities in yCRM
Learn and master company software product offerings
Conducting online presentations and product demonstrations
Communicating via phone and email correspondence with prospective clients
Nurturing sales opportunities through the entire sales cycle to close
Providing information and generating interest in conference participation and other related events
Managing weekly/monthly activity to support sales goals
Work effectively with other teams that support the sales process and client satisfaction 

This position will require the following background and skills: 

Bachelor’s degree
Ability to do high volume cold calls and develop leads
Ability to generate a sales pipeline and close sales
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Superior phone skills
Technical aptitude and the ability to successfully demonstrate software
Ability to show product features and benefits
High level of professionalism and ethics
Ability to manage multiple priorities in a fast paced environment
A background in software sales, web ads sales, accounting systems, or experience in the property management industry highly desirable but not required

            HR Generalist



         Login to apply
    
















HR Generalist
Atlanta, GA 


The Human Resources Generalist is responsible for performing Human Resources (HR) duties on a professional level and will work closely with senior HR management in supporting the organization. The HR Generalist will perform activities within multiple functional areas, including, but not limited to: HRIS administration and reporting; onboarding, training, benefits administration, wellness and health and other employee engagement events. 
Responsibilities

Works closely with HR management in providing HR support for the organization.
Maintains employee-related databases to ensure employee changes are accurately captured in HR Voyager, and maintains documentation of approved changes.
Conducts new-employee orientation.
Collaborates with recruitment teams and conducts recruitment planning meetings when staff is identified. Reviews resumes for candidates in assigned locations when necessary and may participate in interview panel and recruitment procedures necessary to hire a superior workforce.
Ensures new hire documents are complete and available for audit when necessary.
Prepares periodic reports for management, as necessary or requested.
Provides customer service, in-person, email, and by telephone.
Follows established approaches, policies, and procedures.
Responsible for other projects/duties, as assigned.

 
Requirements

Bachelor's degree in Human Resources, Organizational Development, Business or Public Administration, English Communications, or related field.
2+ years Human Resources experience in a generalist role
Proficiency in MS Office Suite.
Excellent verbal, written, and presentation communication skills.
Strong organizational skills.
Ability to multi-task in a deadline driven environment
Customer service oriented and ability to work as team member.
Experience appropriately handling confidential and sensitive information.
Experience utilizing HRIS systems desired
Understanding of employment law and policies desired
Regular attendance and a regular work schedule is an essential function of this job

            Energy Management Analyst



         Login to apply
    
















Energy Management Analyst
Atlanta, GA 


The Energy Management Analyst will be a part of Yardi’s growing commercial segment performing analysis to recommend more efficient and sustainable ways to operate businesses with Yardi Energy products related to conservation, analytics, benchmarking, billing, and payment. They will identify energy efficient strategies, generate savings models, maintain reporting systems, review client data to identify gaps and errors, and suggest system improvements for future development. The Energy Management Analyst may assist Sales in the review of potential energy client opportunities and in the development of preliminary proposals. 
 
Responsibilities

Facilitate understanding of expense management and utility billing program for clients and within teams
Coordinate interdepartmental support concerning issues, implementations, system design and testing of new system functionality to meet client requirements of the future
Act as project manager for special project items and issue resolutions with minimal supervision to include implementation of Energy STAR services and energy audits
Design new product features to allow clients to increase cost recovery and efficiency
Analyze utility and building data to recommend energy conservation measures (ECM)
Identify areas to reduce costs of maintenance and operations
Perform high-level calculations, trend analysis, and quality control on all utility types
Conduct and assists with in-depth surveys to identify energy inefficiencies within a facility or across client portfolio and use information to recommend and propose efficiency strategies
Prepare energy savings models using analysis tools (E2 Insight, Energy+ etc.)
Generate proposal requests based on approved projects from the installation team
Assists manager in supervising subcontractors and consultants to ensure the quality of work is consistent with the requirements of the job
Generate post installation of measurement & verification reports
Provide savings calculations and sequence summaries to support the development of sales proposals
Enlist support from management and peers to address complex client requests and resolve complex issues

 
 **Up to 20% travel required**
 
Requirements

Possess a BA/BS degree (or equivalent experience)
Excellent client communication and relationship management
Intermediate Excel skills
Ability to train clients
Strong analytical and documentation skills required, including a thorough understanding of how to interpret customer business needs and document solutions
Ability to manage multiple priorities and complete tasks on time
Strong technical understanding of control systems, and energy efficiency strategies
Familiarity with utility rate structures, utility bills, and usage patterns
Familiarity with utility rebate and incentive programs and applications
LEED AP Certification is desired
Certified Energy Manager (CEM) or Certified Energy Auditor (CEA) is desired
Regular attendance and work schedule is an essential function of this job

*ad
  



         Login to apply

Apply now
	
	

    




Global Account Manager- LATAM focus - (0103143) Global Account Manager
Publisher Development
Position Location- Westborough, MA, Santa Barbara, CA, New York City or Chicago
Are
you interested in working for a company that combines the industry’s best
marketing technologies, predictive data and innovative client services to
deliver greater impact and meet the needs of global brands? Would
you like to play a key role working closely with executive leaders as we expand
our reach, products, content and delivery- nationally and globally? Make a difference working
for a global leader in the Ad Tech space that is part of a Fortune 500 company.
 
A
Global Account Manager is an internal advocate for global market on Advertiser
Development, Sales, and Product. They provide account management for publisher
and partnerships within their assigned markets.
 
 
Do these things interest you? You will:
Create and execute publisher revenue
growth strategies to reach designated goals with generating new advertiser
relationships and increased CJ fees for an assigned portfolio of top performing
global publishers.Diversify advertiser programs by showcasing
publisher value proposition, joining advertiser calls to communicate and
demonstrate value of opportunity, and getting new publishers live with these
advertisers.Train & educate portfolio of clients
through presentations, calls and webinars, and face to face meetings.Gather and analyze publisher client goals
to understand priorities and objectives. 
Respond and educate on relevant CJ innovations to solve and/or enhance
their goals.  Collect feedback, assess
with Director, and coordinate with supporting departments (Product, NQ, Data
Science etc.) on global publisher technical and business model needs.Support Product stakeholder leads for
assigned projects by gathering publisher feedback, sharing and collaborating
with publisher team, and assisting in executing tasks to fulfill global
publisher adoption objectives.
What we look for:
3 years Account
Management experience required and Bachelor’s degree preferredHighly motivated results
driven individual with a demonstrated ability to work collaboratively within
diverse organization and diverse global clients.Experience with or
working knowledge of LATAM.Excellent communication
skills in working with a variety of global customer needs.Spoken and written Spanish and Portuguese required.
  Why CJ Affiliate? CJ Affiliate is the leader in Affiliate Marketing.  We take pride in our innovative technology, comprehensive data solutions and our people.  We equip our teams with advanced tools, training and career development opportunities all to provide cutting edge solutions, strategies and support to deliver high quality results for our clients. We work in an energetic, results-oriented, collaborative, team environment that recognizes exceptional performance. As we evolve and grow as a business, so do you.            Great People, Deserve Great BenefitsWe know that we have some of the brightest and most talented associates in the world, and we believe in rewarding them accordingly. If you work here, expect competitive pay, comprehensive health coverage, and endless opportunities to advance your career.About UsEpsilon® is an all-encompassing global marketing innovator. We provide unrivaled data intelligence and customer insights, world-class technology including loyalty, email and CRM platforms and data-driven creative, activation and execution. Epsilon’s digital media arm, Conversant, is a leader in personalized digital advertising and insights through its proprietary technology and trove of consumer marketing data, delivering digital marketing with unprecedented scale, accuracy and reach through personalized media programs. Together, we bring personalized marketing to consumers across offline and online channels, at moments of interest that help drive business growth for brands. Epsilon employs over 8,000 associates in 70 offices worldwide. For more information, visit www.epsilon.com and follow us on Twitter @EpsilonMktg.Epsilon is an Equal Opportunity Employer.  Epsilon’s policy is not to discriminate against any applicant or employee based on actual or perceived race, color creed, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, marital status, medical condition as defined by applicable state law, genetic information, disability, military service and veteran status, pregnancy, childbirth and related medical conditions, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state, or local laws and ordinances.  Epsilon also prohibits harassment of applicants and employees based on any of these protected categories.Epsilon will provide accommodations to applicants needing accommodations to complete the application process.

 Primary Location: USA - United States-3110 - New York-50187 - New York-L2-New York, NY - CNVROther Locations: USA - United States-3079 - California-50035 - Santa Barbara-K8-Santa Barbara, USA - United States-3095 - Massachusetts-50127 - Worcester-L3-Westborough - CNVR, USA - United States-3090 - Illinois-50082 - Chicago-L5-Chicago, IL - CNVRWork Locations: L2-New York, NY - CNVR   New York 10017Job: Account ManagementOrganization: EpsilonSchedule: RegularJob Type: Full-timeJob Posting: Dec 6, 2019, 8:49:00 AMDivision: CJ AffiliateRI: DT

About The Publisher Development Team

						The Publisher Development team has developed the largest, most diverse and productive network of the best affiliates in the world. Our passion for strategically supporting publishers provides CJ advertisers extended reach and the opportunity to increase sales by finding and working with more partners that are right for their brand and business.

            Associate Web Designer



         Login to apply
    
















Associate Web Designer
Oxnard, CA 


Under immediate supervision, the Associate Web Designer is responsible for supporting the maintenance and ongoing design of websites. The Associate Web Designer assists in creating web page layout and online content, user interface graphics, icons, color schemes, content and infrastructure for new product releases and new web-hosted product offerings. Focused on look and functionality of our websites, the Associate Web Designer works with client specifications to define markups and create style-sheets for complex, information-rich web applications. Additionally, may assist in performing web usability testing.
Responsibilities

Translates informational or marketing content into a functional website design
Partners with marketing and development staff on style and approach for projects
Creates design elements, comps, templates, and implements finished solutions
Ensures that all design elements, templates and finished solutions work within a variety of browser types and different devices along with the constraints set by development and design
Designs websites that are easy to access and visually effective
Writes Web pages in a combination of codes such as JavaScript, HTML, and CSS
Maintains and provides ongoing design of websites
Tests websites for functionality
Works directly with clients and or services teams to deliver website designs or modifications

Requirements

Bachelor’s degree in Web Design, Art or related field or equivalent academic and work experience
One to two years of experience in Web-based graphic design or web interface design desired
Knowledge of HTML Web technologies and applications
Familiarity with backend/CMS application
Experience with HTML5
Proficiency in the Adobe Creative Suite
Excellent troubleshooting skills
Self-motivated, disciplined, and able to work effectively as part of a team
Ability to learn new technologies
Written communication skills
Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite
High attention to detail and strong organizational skills
Proficiency in HTML5, CSS3 desired
Experience in JavaScript/jQuery, Bootstrap Front-end framework or similar tools for creating websites and web applications desired

 Privacy Overview

 3rd Party Cookies




 








Privacy Overview

This website uses cookies so that we can provide you with the best user experience possible. Cookie information is stored in your browser and performs functions such as recognising you when you return to our website and helping our team to understand which sections of the website you find most interesting and useful.
You can adjust all of your cookie settings by navigating the tabs on the left hand side.



 
Strictly Necessary Cookies

Strictly necessary cookies must be enabled at all times in order to login and apply to openings.



disable









If you disable this cookie, we will not be able to save your preferences and you will not be able to login to apply for openings. This means that every time you visit this website you will need to enable or disable cookies again.







3rd Party Cookies

This website uses Google Analytics to collect anonymous information such as the number of visitors to the site, and the most popular pages.
Keeping this cookie enabled helps us to improve our website.



disable









Please enable Strictly Necessary Cookies first so that we can save your preferences!

            Associate Technical Account Manager



         Login to apply
    
















Associate Technical Account Manager
Austin, TX 


As part of the team, the Associate Technical Account Manager will support our clients during the implementation and ongoing use of our products. Because this is a new team, each team member will also contribute to the structure and processes of the team. This is an ideal entry-level role for a smart, driven individual who is interested in driving the direction of a growing team.
Responsibilities

Implements the Yardi suite of software products by assisting clients with system implementation, training, and technical support
Researches, analyzes and resolves software issues
Supports software product customization based on client requirements
Performs data mapping and conversions
Performs system and business process reviews and other service reviews and makes recommendations on best practices
Works on a regular basis with Yardi internal resource teams to include: training, conversion, sales and development

Requirements

Bachelor’s degree in Economics, Business, Math, Statistics or Information Management preferred
Experience setting and managing client expectations
Superior verbal and written communication skills
Project Management, Accounting, or Property Management experience/background
Solid Proficiency in MS Office Suite and Outlook
Knowledge in three of the following areas: Property Management, Accounting, Microsoft Windows, Technical Support, SQL, HTML/ASP
Prior experience with property management software or real estate software highly desirable
Prior experience with Yardi software highly desirable
Highly organized, with ability to track, manage and follow through on a variety of tasks during the typical day/week
Tenacious about understanding the root of client issues and providing resolutions
Highly motivated to excel and grow professionally
Regular attendance and a regular work schedule is an essential function of this job

            Software Development Engineer II



         Login to apply
    
















Software Development Engineer II
Milton Keynes, United Kingdom 


Under general supervision, the Software Development Engineer II designs, develops, debugs, tests and implements small to medium software enhancements.  Responsibilities include correcting defects in existing applications and reports; documenting defect resolutions; and presenting implementation details.
Responsibilities

Modifies and maintains existing applications to established standards, specifications and approved changes.  Performs maintenance programming for existing versions.  Uses corporate approved CRM systems to track cases, defects and resolutions.  Presents implementation details to small internal groups.  Uses corporate approved integrated development environment (e.g., Visual Studios, Eclipse). 
Performs and initiates unit testing of enhancements with the internal groups to ensure accuracy, integrity, interoperability and completeness to achieve desired results.  Analyzes and documents reasons for test failure, and revises/debugs assigned programs and/or procedures as necessary. 
Uses corporate approved sourced control applications (e.g., Microsoft Team Foundations) to maintain code changes. 
Uses corporate approved reporting tools, (e.g., SSRS, Crystal Report Writer, Microsoft Office or Adobe Acrobat) to create or modify reports.
Learns and demonstrates in depth knowledge of a single domain.  Understands application and uses standards.  Expands technical and industry expertise.  
Adhere to Department policies, procedures and standards in the development and implementation of software.

 
Requirements

Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree in Computer/Engineering Science or equivalent experience
Two (2) to five (5) years of experience using VB.NET or SQL (or equivalent programming tools) in an application development environment
Independent problem solving and analysis skills
Clear, effective verbal and written communication skills
Good time management skills
Ability to meet critical deadlines and prioritize multiple tasks in a fast-paced environment
Collegial, team-oriented disposition with the desire and ability to establish cooperative working relationships with employees at all levels within Yardi, outside of Yardi, and with clients
Familiarity with one of the following computer programming language (VB.NET, Java, Java Script, C#) is desired
Experience with relationship databases (SQL Server, Oracle) is desired
Experience with accounting systems is desired
Experience with Web applications is desired
Understanding of property management industry is desired
Regular attendance and a regular work schedule is an essential function of this job

If you’re ready to take on a fresh challenge, grow your career and contribute to making the world a safer place, Raytheon is ready to help you achieve your goals. Join our team and get the opportunity and support to find purpose, thrive and succeed.





Notice: Please be aware of suspicious recruiting emails and text messages that attempt to collect your confidential information. Raytheon conducts all electronic correspondence using e-mail addresses that end in “Raytheon.com”, “Raytheon.co.uk”, “Raytheon.com.au” or “brassring.com”. To report fraud please go to: https://www.ic3.gov.











Senior Enterprise Architect
Dulles, Virginia


Apply





Overview
Responsibilities
Success Profile
Rewards
Trending




Overview

What does it take to make the world a safer place? It takes delivering innovative technology and collaborating with some of the finest talent in the engineering field. Whether you’re a software engineer or a mechanical engineer, at Raytheon you’ll grow a varied and rewarding career. And you’ll be supported with a comprehensive and competitive benefits package that promotes work/life. If you’re ready to take on today’s big challenges, discover a world of opportunity at Raytheon.

America’s Best Large Employers by Forbes
Career & Development Opportunities
Full-time
Entry, Mid, Senior level




Back to Job Navigation (Overview)


Responsibilities


Are you looking for an engineering career that is challenging and satisfying? Then join our Raytheon team of engineers solving problems that make the world a safer place and help to secure our great nation! Come support those who provide us with all the freedoms we enjoy.We offer great benefits that include medical, dental, vision, 401K match, flexible work schedule - just to name a few.  Click here to view a brief video and learn more: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qvbCgKpkEdsRaytheon Intelligence, Information and Services (IIS) delivers innovative technology to make the world a safer place. Our expertise in cyber, analytics and automation allow us to reach beyond what others think is possible to underpin national security and give our global customers unique solutions to solve the most pressing modern challenges -- from the cyber domain to automated operations, and from intelligent transportation solutions to creating clear insight from large volumes of data. IIS operates at nearly 550 sites in 80 countries, including a large presence in Dulles, VA. As a global business, our leaders must have the ability to understand, embrace and operate in a multicultural world -- in the marketplace and the workplace. We strive to hire people who reflect our communities and embrace diversity and inclusion to advance our culture, develop our employees, and grow our business.This position is eligible for a Sign on Bonus of up to $40k for a candidate with a current verifiable TS/SCI clearance that is hired by Raytheon Job Description:Raytheon is supporting a U.S. Government customer on a large mission critical development and sustainment program to design, build, deliver, and operate a network operations environment including introducing new cyber capabilities to address emerging threats.  Raytheon Cybersecurity and Special Missions (CSM) is seeking a Sr. Enterprise Architect with AWS expertise to collaborate with the Customer’s SE&I team to assess & develop architectures and requirements, to develop derived requirements and systems engineering artifacts, and to guide Agile scrum teams in the development of advanced cybersecurity capabilities.  Responsibilities Include:- Developing advanced, leading-edge, cloud-oriented architectures that provide new cybersecurity capabilities to a major U.S. Government customer- Partnering with the Chief Engineer to lead the Agile development teams in the development, integration, and testing of associated cybersecurity architectures and capabilities- Collaborating with Agile Scrum teams as a key contributor responsible for the system design and implementation of advanced cybersecurity capabilities- Interfacing directly with the Customer, stakeholders, and end-users regarding capability architectures, requirements, use cases, and stories to derive, develop and decompose next-cycle updates and specifications- Conducting trade studies to determine improvements to system capabilities (hardware, software, architecture, automated deployments, training).Required Skills:- Must be a US Citizen- Must be able to obtain a TS/SCI clearance- Must be able to obtain DHS Suitability- 10+ years of directly relevant systems engineering and architecture experience including allocation of hardware and software requirements, architecture development, development of use cases and stories, interface definition development, and systems integration & test- Strong understanding of system architecture principles- Ability to lead teams on large and small scale system architecture activities- Strong experience with Amazon Web Services (AWS) platform capabilities, including excellent understanding of the Amazon Web Services (AWS) Well-Architected Framework- Experience with virtualized cloud environments (preferably VMware VSphere)- Proven success working within a large, multi-disciplined, matrixed, multi-company team- Significant experience working in an Agile development environment- Experience with and excellent technical understanding of cybersecurity including attack-mitigation techniques and cybersecurity architectures- Experience with industry standard technology frameworks and methods- Experience with requirements management and tools (DOORS preferred)- Strong experience with Systems Engineering Lifecycle (SELC) processes and practices, Change Management (CM) practices, requirements management, traceability, and associated tools.Desired Skills:- Strong experience or in-depth knowledge of Microsoft’s Azure cloud services- Experience with Architecture Tradeoff Analysis Method (ATAM) or other architecture evaluation methods- Experience and/or familiarity with architectural views including operational, technical standards, and system/services views and business, data, applications, and technology architectures using applicable standards (e.g., DODAF, FEAF)- Experience with Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe) or similar framework- Experience and/or familiarity with software and system lifecycle methodologies, (e.g., ISO, CMMI, ITIL, Agile, SAFe)- DevSecOps or DevOps experience- Experience and/or familiarity with the Risk Management Framework (RMF) and/or security and privacy controls (NIST 800-37 and NIST 800-53)- DHS experience.Desired Certifications:- DoD 8570.1 IAT Level II- AWS Certified Solution Architect- SAFe certifications (SA, SP, SSM/SASM, POPM, SPD, ASE, or SPC)- CISSP Information Systems Security Architecture Professional (CISSIP-ISSAP)- TOGAF Architecture Certification- Certified Systems Engineering Professional (CSEP) or similarEducation: Requires a degree in Science, Technology, Engineering or Mathematics (STEM) and 10 years of related work experience. 150676
Business Unit Profile
                        
                        Raytheon Intelligence, Information and Services delivers innovative technology to make the world a safer place. Our expertise in cyber, analytics and automation allow us to reach beyond what others think is possible to underpin national security and give our global customers unique solutions to solve the most pressing modern challenges -- from the cyber domain to automated operations, and from intelligent transportation and training solutions to creating clear insight from large volumes of data. IIS operates at nearly 550 sites in 80 countries, and is headquartered in Dulles, Virginia. The business area generated $6.2 billion in 2018 revenues. As a global business, our leaders must have the ability to understand, embrace and operate in a multicultural world -- in the marketplace and the workplace. We strive to hire people who reflect our communities and embrace diversity and inclusion to advance our culture, develop our employees, and grow our business.
Relocation Eligible 
                        
                        Yes
Clearance Type 
                        
                        TS/SCI
Expertise 
                        

                                
                            AlgorithmsArtificial IntelligenceCloud ComputingComputer EngineeringComputer ScienceComputer/Management Information SystemsCyber JobsData NetworkingData ScienceEngineering TechnologyGeneral EngineeringHardware EngineeringInformation and Knowledge SystemsNetwork Communications ResearchReliability EngineerSoftware EngineeringSystems EngineeringTechnicalTest Engineering

                            VA - Dulles
                        
Raytheon is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, age, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected Veteran status.

Back to Job Navigation (Success)


Quote



Felicia Jackson is regional vice president of RAYVETS, Raytheon's employee group for veterans and those who support them. After 24 years in the Air Force, she started a new career at Raytheon. "I wanted to go where people would support me," she told us.









Rewards




401(k) / Retirement Plans
Employer Matching, if you elect to enroll company matches up to 3%.



Work / Life Balance
Raytheon supports a variety of flexible work arrangements including compressed work weeks, flextime, job sharing, 9/80, reduced hours and telecommuting.



Career Development
At Raytheon, we foster an inclusive culture of professional development. We support a variety of developmental opportunities including: Mentoring programs, Skills Development, Leadership Development, Rotational job assignments, and Continuous Improvement, all of which contribute to advancement of our employee’s capabilities.



Paid Time Off
Accrue paid time off monthly. Receive 10-12 holidays per year with some locations shutting down the week between Christmas and New Year’s Day.



Relocation Assistance
Select technical positions are eligible for relocation packages. See specific job description for eligibility requirements.



Parental Leave
Raytheon offers all eligible employees up to three weeks paid parental leave for the birth or adoption of a child (separate from paid maternity leave or Family & Medical Leave Act).

            Account Executive



         Login to apply
    
















Account Executive
Dallas, TX 


The Account Executive for Commercial will be responsible for developing and cultivating a regional territory and selling Yardi’s products and services to prospects and existing clients within the residential real estate property management industry.  This is an outside sales position requiring software sales experience in the commercial real estate space.
 
The Account Executive for Commercial will be responsible for the following duties and responsibilities:

Heavy prospecting and identifying new sales opportunities for a designated territory
Managing sales activities to support business plans and revenue goals
Cultivating and managing professional relationships with prospects and existing clients at the senior level
Becoming familiar with all product solutions, the competitive climate, and promoting company products in the marketplace
Conducting online and onsite presentations to demonstrate Yardi’s product offerings
Developing and executing outbound call and email campaigns
Participating and networking at industry events and tradeshows
Meeting or exceeding monthly, quarterly and annual revenue goals
Maintaining accurate account information and forecasting details through a CRM system
Establishing a strong sales pipeline, sales forecasts and updating accounts to support revenue growth
Identifying client needs by introducing and up-selling Yardi ancillary tools/products to potentially increase client revenue opportunities.
Assisting with the development and implementation of marketing materials and programs
Participating in regular sales meetings to report on the status of all opportunities in the sales pipeline and new acquisitions to the pipeline

This position will require the following background and experience:

Bachelor’s degree of equivalent experience
3+years of successful sales experience managing and developing a sales territory
Solid knowledge base in sales and ability to apply basic sales principles (i.e. lead generation, opportunity qualification, proposal development, account management and closure)
Ability to effectively execute sales strategies using a consultative approach and relationship building techniques
Ability to interface with all levels within the client organization to include individual properties, large portfolios and other senior leadership in large to mid-sized companies
Strong ,engaging presentation skills and ability to demonstrate product value
Ability to develop and maintain solid client relationships
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Ability to internally motivate, work interdependently, and also work effectively with a team
Ability to understand and demonstrate technical products
Prior experience entering data into a CRM system to support up to date client contact and information
Proven track record of achieving or exceeding sales goals
Prior background in software sales, property management or accounting systems desirable

*cl        



         Login to apply

Corporate Website
Privacy Statement
Legal











By continuing to browse this site you agree to our use of cookies. You can find out more about which cookies we are using or switch them off in settings.
 

 
Accept

 


















 

 Privacy Overview


 Strictly Necessary Cookies


 3rd Party Cookies




 








Privacy Overview

This website uses cookies so that we can provide you with the best user experience possible. Cookie information is stored in your browser and performs functions such as recognising you when you return to our website and helping our team to understand which sections of the website you find most interesting and useful.
You can adjust all of your cookie settings by navigating the tabs on the left hand side.



 
Strictly Necessary Cookies

Strictly necessary cookies must be enabled at all times in order to login and apply to openings.



disable









If you disable this cookie, we will not be able to save your preferences and you will not be able to login to apply for openings. This means that every time you visit this website you will need to enable or disable cookies again.







3rd Party Cookies

This website uses Google Analytics to collect anonymous information such as the number of visitors to the site, and the most popular pages.
Keeping this cookie enabled helps us to improve our website.



disable









Please enable Strictly Necessary Cookies first so that we can save your preferences!












Enable All
Save Changes

            Associate Account Manager



         Login to apply
    
















Associate Account Manager
Waltham, MA 


As an Associate Account Manager, you will be responsible for the implementation, training and monitoring of our real estate management software, supporting real estate property management executives and staff.   Responsibilities
 • Acting as the customer's primary point of contact at ScreeningWorks Pro • Monitoring the performance of your assigned accounts, and working with clients to create policies, procedures and work flows.  • Responsible for the creation and delivery of quarterly/monthly account performance reports and analysis • Provide recommendations to improve client property performance • Drive resolution for all issues related to client requests • Coordinate meetings with client executives and other key partnership members  • Work closely with Customer Support Representatives and other internal staff for monitoring and assisting with user issues. • Understand client configuration and work with IT/Development as it relates to new product releases.  Requirements
 The ideal candidate will have the following character attributes:  • 1-5+ years of client management experience  • Familiar with software interfaces • Strong analytical skills • Strong written and oral skills  • Strong leadership skills with the ability to work as a part of the Client Services team • Ability to perform multiple tasks ranging from project management, training and problem solving • Highly ethical and disciplined professionalism  • Team player who can motivate and encourage the best from others  • Must be able to demonstrate outstanding customer relationships  • Must have the ability to understand technical products  • Negligible travel required*ad

If you’re ready to take on a fresh challenge, grow your career and contribute to making the world a safer place, Raytheon is ready to help you achieve your goals. Join our team and get the opportunity and support to find purpose, thrive and succeed.





Notice: Please be aware of suspicious recruiting emails and text messages that attempt to collect your confidential information. Raytheon conducts all electronic correspondence using e-mail addresses that end in “Raytheon.com”, “Raytheon.co.uk”, “Raytheon.com.au” or “brassring.com”. To report fraud please go to: https://www.ic3.gov.











Software Systems Integration and Test Engineer
Dulles, Virginia


Apply





Overview
Responsibilities
Success Profile
Rewards
Trending




Overview

What does it take to make the world a safer place? It takes delivering innovative technology and collaborating with some of the finest talent in the engineering field. Whether you’re a software engineer or a mechanical engineer, at Raytheon you’ll grow a varied and rewarding career. And you’ll be supported with a comprehensive and competitive benefits package that promotes work/life. If you’re ready to take on today’s big challenges, discover a world of opportunity at Raytheon.

America’s Best Large Employers by Forbes
Career & Development Opportunities
Full-time
Entry, Mid, Senior level




Back to Job Navigation (Overview)


Responsibilities


Would you like to work in a collaborative environment at a state of the art facility in Dulles? Then join our Intelligence, Information and Services (IIS) team of smart people solving problems that make the world a safer place and help to secure our great nation! Come support those who provide us with all the freedoms we enjoy. Our facility in Dulles VA offers amenities that create work and life balance. The Dulles site includes 4 modern facilities with 3 industrial buildings. On site we have a fitness center plus a fun space with a pool table, foosball and video games. Additionally, employee appreciation lunches, bonus opportunities, and great benefits that include medical, dental, vision, 401K match, flexible work schedules, are just a few of the reasons people come to work at Intelligence, Information and Services (IIS)!We are a technology and innovation leader specializing in defense, security and civil markets throughout the world. Our latest company video is about our people, our technology, our vision, and the values we hold dear at Intelligence, Information and Services (IIS). Click here to view: https://youtu.be/qvbCgKpkEdsThe Intelligence, Information and Services (IIS) Systems Engineering and Integration Team (SEIT) is the central focus for concept development, trade studies, systems architecture development, and systems integration and test activities for customized engineering services and products. We develop solutions to solve customer needs as well as plan future capabilities and technology roadmaps.  The Intelligence Information and Services (IIS) C2, Space and Intelligence Solutions mission area is seeking a Systems Integration and Test Engineer for programs to modernize and maintain satellite ground segments.As a Software Systems Integration and Test Engineer your duties will include but not be limited to the following: Support the planning and conduct of Test activities; define test plans and sequences relative to complex software and hardware subsystems and resolves identified conflicting issues. Participate in a complex testing program; establish methods and techniques, plan tests, develop test requirements, write test procedures and reports, and conduct tests utilizing comprehensive knowledge of these complex subsystems. Participate in integration and test readiness reviews, design reviews, and audits of integration and test programs and facilities. Utilize broad knowledge in test engineering and apply understanding of principles of related engineering and software technology to ensure test validity and integrity.This position is eligible for a Sign on Bonus of up to 40k for a candidate with a current TS/SCI that can be verified and hired at Raytheon.Required Skills:Current/Active TS/SCI with CI Poly clearanceBachelor degree and at least 6+ years demonstrated engineering experience with proven track record.Integration engineering experience on a software development contractExperience preparing and executing Integration proceduresExperience with test script or automation developmentEnthusiastic & energetic performer able to work in a dynamic, fast-paced, & high visibility environmentSelf-motivated and capable of performing tasks with minimal oversightExperience with systems engineering principles and activitiesDesired Skills:Experience working in a Satellite Ground System development or operations environment Experience with ground station satellite domains (command and telemetry, or mission planning) Scripting (Python, Perl, CECIL) Experience in an Agile or DevOps development environment. Proficiency with Windows and Linux operating system Experience with Java or C++Education Requirements:BS in Engineering, Science, or Mathematics, or equivalent education and 6+ years of related work experience.This position requires a U.S. Person who is eligible to obtain any required Export Authorization  152838
Business Unit Profile
                        
                        Intelligence, Information and Services delivers innovative technology to make the world a safer place. Our expertise in cyber, analytics and automation allow us to reach beyond what others think is possible to underpin national security and give our global customers unique solutions to solve the most pressing modern challenges -- from the cyber domain to automated operations, and from intelligent transportation and training solutions to creating clear insight from large volumes of data. IIS operates at nearly 550 sites in 80 countries, and is headquartered in Dulles, Virginia. The business area generated $6.2 billion in 2018 revenues. As a global business, our leaders must have the ability to understand, embrace and operate in a multicultural world -- in the marketplace and the workplace. We strive to hire people who reflect our communities and embrace diversity and inclusion to advance our culture, develop our employees, and grow our business.
Relocation Eligible 
                        
                        No
Clearance Type 
                        
                        TS/SCI with CI Poly - Current
Expertise 
                        

                                
                            Computer EngineeringComputer ScienceData NetworkingData ScienceEngineering TechnologyGeneral EngineeringIntegration & Test EngineeringSoftware EngineeringSystems EngineeringTechnicalTest Engineering
                        
                        

Type Of Job 
                        
                        Full Time

Work Location 
                        
 
                            
                            VA - Dulles
                        
Raytheon is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, age, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected Veteran status.

Back to Job Navigation (Success)


Quote



Felicia Jackson is regional vice president of RAYVETS, Raytheon's employee group for veterans and those who support them. After 24 years in the Air Force, she started a new career at Raytheon. "I wanted to go where people would support me," she told us.









Rewards




401(k) / Retirement Plans
Employer Matching, if you elect to enroll company matches up to 3%.



Work / Life Balance
Raytheon supports a variety of flexible work arrangements including compressed work weeks, flextime, job sharing, 9/80, reduced hours and telecommuting.



Career Development
At Raytheon, we foster an inclusive culture of professional development. We support a variety of developmental opportunities including: Mentoring programs, Skills Development, Leadership Development, Rotational job assignments, and Continuous Improvement, all of which contribute to advancement of our employee’s capabilities.



Paid Time Off
Accrue paid time off monthly. Receive 10-12 holidays per year with some locations shutting down the week between Christmas and New Year’s Day.



Relocation Assistance
Select technical positions are eligible for relocation packages. See specific job description for eligibility requirements.



Parental Leave
Raytheon offers all eligible employees up to three weeks paid parental leave for the birth or adoption of a child (separate from paid maternity leave or Family & Medical Leave Act).

Principal Software Integration Systems Engineer
Aurora, Colorado


Apply





Overview
Responsibilities
Success Profile
Rewards
Trending




Overview

What does it take to make the world a safer place? It takes delivering innovative technology and collaborating with some of the finest talent in the engineering field. Whether you’re a software engineer or a field engineer, at Raytheon you’ll grow a varied and rewarding career. And you’ll be supported with a comprehensive and competitive benefits package that promotes work/life. If you’re ready to take on today’s big challenges, discover a world of opportunity at Raytheon.

America’s Best Large Employers by Forbes
Career & Development Opportunities
Full-time
Entry, Mid, Senior level




Back to Job Navigation (Overview)


Responsibilities


Would you like to work in a collaborative environment at a state of the art facility in Colorado? Then join our Raytheon team of engineers solving problems that make the world a safer place and help to secure our great nation! Come support those who provide us with all the freedoms we enjoy.Our facility in Aurora, CO offers amenities that create work and life balance. On site we have a 24/7 fitness facility, health center, cafeteria, collaboration rooms and dynamic break areas for easy conversation and socialization. Additionally, employee appreciation lunches, bonus opportunities, and great benefits that include medical, dental, vision, 401K match, flexible work schedule - just to name a few.  Click here to view a brief video and learn more: https://youtu.be/YNuZN0vyzHgRaytheon is seeking a Software Integration Systems Engineer for programs in our C2, Space and Intelligence Solutions mission area in Aurora, Colorado.As a Software Integration Systems Engineer,  your duties will include but not be limited to the following: Lead the planning and conduct of integration activities; defining integration plans and sequences relative to complex software and hardware subsystems and resolve conflicting issues.  Participate in a complex integration program; establish methods and techniques, write integration procedures and reports, and conduct integration utilizing comprehensive knowledge of complex subsystems. Lead integration and test readiness reviews, design reviews, and audits of integration and test programs and facilities. Utilize broad knowledge in integration engineering and apply understanding of principles of related engineering and software technology. Clearance Requirement:  Must be a US Citizens with a current /active Secret clearance with the ability to obtain and maintain a TS/SCI clearance.This position is eligible for a Sign on Bonus of 20k for a candidate with a current TS/SCI that can be verified and hired at Raytheon.Required Skills: Current SECRET clearance.8+ years demonstrated engineering experience with proven track recordIntegration engineering experience on a software development contractExperience preparing and executing Integration proceduresExperience with test script or automation developmentEnthusiastic & energetic performer able to work in a dynamic, fast-paced, & high visibility environmentSelf-motivated and capable of performing tasks with minimal oversightExperience with systems engineering principles and activitiesDesired Skills: Current SSBI, or active TS/SCI security clearanceExperience working in a Satellite Ground System development or operations environmentExperience with ground station satellite domains (command and telemetry, flight dynamics or mission planning)Scripting (Python, Perl, CECIL)Experience in an Agile or DevOps development environmentProficiency with Windows and Linux operating systemExperience with Java or C++Education Requirements: B.S./M.S./PhD in a STEM degree.  Aerospace Engineering, Systems Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, Mechanical Engineering, Physics, Math or other STEM degree.  This position requires either a U.S. Person or a Non-U.S. Person who is eligible to obtain any required Export Authorization.COSECONETWORKIISBONUS#SEITjobs 148994
Business Unit Profile
                        
                        Raytheon Intelligence, Information and Services delivers innovative technology to make the world a safer place. Our expertise in cyber, analytics and automation allow us to reach beyond what others think is possible to underpin national security and give our global customers unique solutions to solve the most pressing modern challenges -- from the cyber domain to automated operations, and from intelligent transportation and training solutions to creating clear insight from large volumes of data. IIS operates at nearly 550 sites in 80 countries, and is headquartered in Dulles, Virginia. The business area generated $6.2 billion in 2018 revenues. As a global business, our leaders must have the ability to understand, embrace and operate in a multicultural world -- in the marketplace and the workplace. We strive to hire people who reflect our communities and embrace diversity and inclusion to advance our culture, develop our employees, and grow our business.

Quote



I joined Raytheon in 2016 and I’m proud to work here. My company makes some pretty amazing things, including missile defense, using data to predict the weather, and securing our GPS system. My company also works with artificial intelligence, machine learning and other innovative solutions. I’m proud to work for an organization that allows me the flexibility to be a STEM volunteer and help inspire our future generation.









Rewards




401(k) / Retirement Plans
Employer Matching, if you elect to enroll company matches up to 3%.



Work / Life Balance
Raytheon supports a variety of flexible work arrangements including compressed work weeks, flextime, job sharing, 9/80, reduced hours and telecommuting.



Career Development
At Raytheon, we foster an inclusive culture of professional development. We support a variety of developmental opportunities including: Mentoring programs, Skills Development, Leadership Development, Rotational job assignments, and Continuous Improvement, all of which contribute to advancement of our employee’s capabilities.



Paid Time Off
Accrue paid time off monthly. Receive 10-12 holidays per year with some locations shutting down the week between Christmas and New Year’s Day.



Relocation Assistance
Select technical positions are eligible for relocation packages. See specific job description for eligibility requirements.



Parental Leave
Raytheon offers all eligible employees up to three weeks paid parental leave for the birth or adoption of a child (separate from paid maternity leave or Family & Medical Leave Act).



Sign-On Bonus
Qualified cleared engineers can receive an up to $40K sign-on bonus when they join our Engineering Team!



Student Loan Repayment Contribution
Through the 401(k), called the Raytheon Savings and Investment Plan, the company will make a dollar for dollar contribution for amounts employees spend repaying their student loans, up to their maximum match percentage.

Regulatory Affairs Manager  (98087) - Goleta, CA - Inogen, Inc. Jobs








 














Home
Jobs




Regulatory Affairs Manager  (98087) - Goleta, CA

Toggle navigation








Regulatory Affairs Manager  (98087) 

JobsLogin 












 RA/QA Goleta, CA, USA Full Time 



Email Me Similar Jobs Email Me This Job



ABOUT INOGEN Inogen was founded in 2001 to improve quality of life and increase freedom and independence for oxygen therapy users. Inogen is innovation in oxygen therapy. The Inogen mission is to improve freedom and independence for oxygen therapy patients through innovative products and services. Inogen is a manufacturer and Accredited Homecare Provider.
Inogen is focused on quality care, continuous improvement, and outstanding customer satisfaction. We are a stable, USA based company dedicated to providing an exciting and rewarding career to our employees. We completed a successful Initial Public Offering on the NASDAQ in 2014 and have demonstrated substantial growth over the last five years. Our work environment is casual yet high performing, and we are looking for seriously talented, motivated, and fast-paced professionals to join our team.
JOB DESCRIPTION 
The Regulatory Affairs Manager is responsible for global product and operational compliance related to Class-2 (and accessory) medical device design, manufacture and sales; obtaining regulatory approvals; and establishing and maintaining quality and environmental management systems in keeping with business objectives.
Key Competencies:
Obtain and manage all necessary domestic and international regulatory registrations, product clearances/ approvals, certifications.
Maintain documentation needed to support FDA, ISO and EU/ international compliance, allowing for the sale of Inogen products in US, EU, Canadian and other international markets, as determined by business objectives.
Compile, submit, and monitor reports and responses to regulatory authorities.
Assist with coordinating inspections of Inogen, its subsidiaries, and contract manufacturers. 
Design, implement, and maintain an Internal Audit Program company-wide for a fully compliant Quality Management System (QMS) - including within its scope applicable accreditation and Home Medical Equipment (HME) for Durable Medical Equipment (HME) compliance provisions - and Environmental Management System (EMS). Grow program and provide support as additional sites/ operations are added subject to Inogen's QMS.
Lead and conduct or support second-party supplier audits, as needed.
Manage post market surveillance (PMS) and vigilance activities, including customer complaints/ adverse medical event reporting systems, clinical reports, etc.
Managing the Corrective and Preventive Action (CAPA) system.
Identify, manage and obtain relevant external standards and ensure changes to standards and new standards introduced are understood and integrated into device design.
Participate in product development activities, including evaluating and advising personnel on regulatory impact through product lifecycle stages, ensuring that regulatory standards are understood, that a design control system is in place, that design validation activities are conducted, and that a Design History File (DHF) is maintained to support regulatory submissions. 
Participate in the transfer of approved product design to Manufacturing to meet market introduction and other key milestone target dates, ensuring that a Device Master Record is in place (specifications, bill of materials, drawings, material specifications, labelling, etc.).
Participate in the development of manufacturing and inspection/ test procedures, including required validations for final product release.
Participate in risk management activities and in the development of risk files for company products to ensure compliance with standards and that output is incorporated into product design.
Participate in change control activities, such as design changes, manufacturing improvements, new supplier introductions, cost reduction initiatives, etc., ensuring that regulatory standards are understood.
Manage assigned staff in the day-today performance of their jobsand consultants. For direct reports, complete performance appraisals and identify and cultivate opportunities for their growth and development.
Provide mentorship to other Inogen employees and/or Regulatory Affairs staff, as appropriate.
Support key business relationships by providing regulatory expertise specific to contract manufacturing, private label arrangements, due diligence for possible acquisitions, etc.
Provide company-wide Quality Management System (QMS)and Environmental Management System (EMS) training and regulatory expertise, as needed.
Support Lean and Kaizen initiatives to introduce improvements throughout the quality management system.
Support Operations reporting and trending.
Maintain regular and punctual attendance. 
Comply with all company policies and procedures. 
Assist with any other duties as assigned.
Do you possess these abilities?
Knowledge of ISO, MDD/ MDR, and FDA regulations. 
Knowledge of DMEPOS accreditation requirements.
Experience with DMEPOS/ CMS. 
Ability to facilitate external/ internal audits required.
Attention to detail and process improvement understanding required.
Excellent skills with database systems and Excel with capability to compile data from various sources to produce useful reports for trending and verification required.
Familiarity with process improvement concepts (i.e., LEAN Six Sigma).
Capable of compiling data from various sources to produce useful reports and capable of trending and verifying process improvements.
Excellent management skills, both of individuals as well as projects.
Must have strong work ethic.
Excellent oral and written communication skills are required. 
Attention to detail is required. 
Must demonstrate effective conflict resolution. 
Analytical and problem-solving skills and ability to multitask are required. 
Must be solutions-oriented problem solver. 
Excellent planning, communication and organizational skills are required. 
Ability to effectively interface with different departments within the company is required.
Requirements:
Bachelor's Degree in a technical discipline required.
7-10 years of medical device Regulatory Affairs experience required. Experience in medical device Regulatory Affairs and at least one (1) of the following: product development, manufacturing engineering, quality assurance, or production management required.
Advanced knowledge of/ proficiency in Microsoft Office required. 
ISO 13485 (current edition) Lead Auditor Certification and/or ASQ CQA and/or ASQ CBA preferred.
Advanced knowledge of ISO 13485 required.
Advanced knowledge of ISO 14971 required. 
A combination of training, education and experience that is equivalent to the qualifications listed above and that provides the required knowledge, skills, and abilities.
 
WHY INOGEN Inogen is a dynamic company that is not only focused on quality care of patients, but is also committed to being a top employer.  Each of Inogen' s offices have a casual culture that supports employees being responsible and developing professionals.
We offer competitive salaries and a robust benefit package:
Employee Stock Purchase Plan 401 (K) plan available for all employees Health, dental, vision insurance Flexible spending accounts and wellness discount program Life Insurance Long Term Disability Robust paid time off and 8 paid holidays Employee Assistance Program
See the Inogen Team in action:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dKoTMeJf5J4
 
Inogen Where we go to work hard to positively impact people's lives
 
Inogen is an equal opportunity employer.  We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other legally protected characteristics. The EEO is the Law poster and its supplement are available here: http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/ofccpost.htm; http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/OFCCP_EEO_Supplement_Final_JRF_QA_508c.pdf.  The pay transparency policy is available here: http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/pdf/EO13665_PrescribedNondiscriminationPostingLanguage_JRFQA508c.pdf. 
Inogen is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities.  If you need a reasonable accommodation because of a disability for any part of the employment process, please send an e-mail to recruiting@inogen.net or call (972) 616-5668 and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information.
 
 

Inogen, Inc.

            Software Development Engineer I



         Login to apply
    
















Software Development Engineer I
Cleveland, OH 


Under immediate supervision, the Software Development Engineer I analyzes, modifies and debugs existing applications. Responsibilities also include testing, communicating and implementing defect resolutions.
Responsibilities

Modifies, implements, and maintains an existing application to established standards, specifications and approved changes
Performs maintenance programming for existing versions
Uses corporate approved CRM systems to track cases, defects and resolutions
Explains defect resolutions to the Team Leader
Uses corporate approved integrated development environment (e.g., Visual Studios, Eclipse) to implement defect resolutions
Performs unit testing on his/her defect resolutions to ensure accuracy, integrity, interoperability and completeness to achieve desired results
Analyzes and documents reasons for test failures, and revises/debugs assigned programs and/or procedures as necessary
Learns and increases knowledge of a single domain and best practices
Expands technical and industry expertise
Uses corporate approved sourced control applications (e.g., Microsoft Team Foundations) to maintain code changes
Adheres to Department policies, procedures and standards in the development and implementation of software

Requirements

Bachelor’s degree in Computer/Engineering Science or equivalent experience
Independent problem solving and analysis skills
Clear, effective verbal and written communication skills
Good time management skills
Ability to meet critical deadlines and prioritize multiple tasks in a fast-paced environment
Collegial, team-oriented disposition with the desire and ability to establish cooperative working relationships with employees at all levels within Yardi, outside Yardi and with clients
Regular attendance and a regular work schedule is an essential function of this job

 Privacy Overview


 Strictly Necessary Cookies


 3rd Party Cookies




 








Privacy Overview

This website uses cookies so that we can provide you with the best user experience possible. Cookie information is stored in your browser and performs functions such as recognising you when you return to our website and helping our team to understand which sections of the website you find most interesting and useful.
You can adjust all of your cookie settings by navigating the tabs on the left hand side.



 
Strictly Necessary Cookies

Strictly necessary cookies must be enabled at all times in order to login and apply to openings.



disable









If you disable this cookie, we will not be able to save your preferences and you will not be able to login to apply for openings. This means that every time you visit this website you will need to enable or disable cookies again.







3rd Party Cookies

This website uses Google Analytics to collect anonymous information such as the number of visitors to the site, and the most popular pages.
Keeping this cookie enabled helps us to improve our website.



disable









Please enable Strictly Necessary Cookies first so that we can save your preferences!












Enable All
Save Changes

Sales Operations Supervisor – DTP  (99743) - Cleveland, OH - Inogen, Inc. Jobs








 














Home
