Sales Operations Supervisor – DTP  (99743) - Cleveland, OH

Toggle navigation








Sales Operations Supervisor – DTP  (99743) 

JobsLogin 












 Sales Cleveland, OH, USA Full Time 



Email Me Similar Jobs Email Me This Job



ABOUT INOGEN Inogen was founded in 2001 to improve quality of life and increase freedom and independence for oxygen therapy users. Inogen is innovation in oxygen therapy. The Inogen mission is to improve freedom and independence for oxygen therapy patients through innovative products and services. Inogen is a manufacturer and Accredited Homecare Provider.
Inogen is focused on quality care, continuous improvement, and outstanding customer satisfaction. We are a stable, USA based company dedicated to providing an exciting and rewarding career to our employees. We completed a successful Initial Public Offering on the NASDAQ in 2014 and have demonstrated substantial growth over the last five years. Our work environment is casual yet high performing, and we are looking for seriously talented, motivated, and fast-paced professionals to join our team.
JOB DESCRIPTION 
The Sales Operations Supervisor will be responsible for compliance monitoring, timekeeping and coaching Patient Qualification Representatives (PQRs). The Sales Operations Supervisor will also act as a liaison between Sales-related departments and qualification team.
Key Competencies:
Coach assigned members of the qualification team to utilize best practice and successful patient contact techniques.
Monitor and approve timecards and timekeeping practices of assigned employees.
Monitor calls made by qualification team for regulatory compliance and Inogen standards.
Conduct regular "Listen-ins", "sit-ins" and other monitoring for training or improvement
 
Provide input into 90 Day and Annual Performance Review. May assist with interviewing as applicable.
Assist Manager with Reporting/KPI and Performance Management process.
Hire, manage, develop and train sales operations related professionals.
Maintain regular and punctual attendance.
Comply with all company policies and procedures.
Assist with any other duties as assigned.
 
Do you possess these abilities?
Must have strong work ethic.
Excellent oral and written communication skills required.
Attention to detail is required.
Solutions-oriented problem solver.
Proficiency with CRM and/or Lead Management systems.
Ability to mentor and motivate a large teams.
Must self-motivate and deliver results with limited oversight.
Must be motivated to achieve results meeting targets.
 
Requirements:
Associate degree in Business, English, Communications, or related field of study, required.
5 years sales/customer service experience, required.
1-2 years lead or supervisor experience, required.
Intermediate knowledge/proficiency in Microsoft Office, required.
A combination of training, education and experience that is equivalent to the qualifications listed above and that provides the required knowledge, skills, and abilities.
 
WHY INOGEN Inogen is a dynamic company that is not only focused on quality care of patients, but is also committed to being a top employer.  Each of Inogen' s offices have a casual culture that supports employees being responsible and developing professionals.
We offer competitive salaries and a robust benefit package:
Employee Stock Purchase Plan 401 (K) plan available for all employees Health, dental, vision insurance Flexible spending accounts and wellness discount program Life Insurance Long Term Disability Robust paid time off and 8 paid holidays Employee Assistance Program
See the Inogen Team in action:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dKoTMeJf5J4
 
Inogen Where we go to work hard to positively impact people's lives
 
Inogen is an equal opportunity employer.  We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other legally protected characteristics. The EEO is the Law poster and its supplement are available here: http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/ofccpost.htm; http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/OFCCP_EEO_Supplement_Final_JRF_QA_508c.pdf.  The pay transparency policy is available here: http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/pdf/EO13665_PrescribedNondiscriminationPostingLanguage_JRFQA508c.pdf. 
Inogen is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities.  If you need a reasonable accommodation because of a disability for any part of the employment process, please send an e-mail to recruiting@inogen.net or call (972) 616-5668 and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information.

If you’re ready to take on a fresh challenge, grow your career and contribute to making the world a safer place, Raytheon is ready to help you achieve your goals. Join our team and get the opportunity and support to find purpose, thrive and succeed.





Notice: Please be aware of suspicious recruiting emails and text messages that attempt to collect your confidential information. Raytheon conducts all electronic correspondence using e-mail addresses that end in “Raytheon.com”, “Raytheon.co.uk”, “Raytheon.com.au” or “brassring.com”. To report fraud please go to: https://www.ic3.gov.











Principal Mechanical Engr
Burlington, Massachusetts


Apply





Overview
Responsibilities
Success Profile
Rewards
Trending




Overview

What does it take to make the world a safer place? It takes delivering innovative technology and collaborating with some of the finest talent in the engineering field. Whether you’re a software engineer or a mechanical engineer, at Raytheon you’ll grow a varied and rewarding career. And you’ll be supported with a comprehensive and competitive benefits package that promotes work/life. If you’re ready to take on today’s big challenges, discover a world of opportunity at Raytheon.

America’s Best Large Employers by Forbes
Career & Development Opportunities
Full-time
Entry, Mid, Senior level




Back to Job Navigation (Overview)


Responsibilities


Are you looking for an engineering career that is challenging and satisfying? Then join our Raytheon team of engineers solving problems that make the world a safer place and help to secure our great nation! Come support those who provide us with all the freedoms we enjoy.We offer great benefits that include medical, dental, vision, 401K match, flexible work schedule - just to name a few.  Click here to view a brief video and learn more: https://youtu.be/YNuZN0vyzHgRaytheon Intelligence, Information, and Services (IIS) Hardware and Infrastructure Engineering Organization is currently seeking a Principal Mechanical Engineer for its Construction Engineering Group. This individual will provide technical expertise and leadership for the design and construction of mechanical systems. This Construction Engineering team has been tasked with designing and deploying systems around the world, and is composed of civil, electrical, and mechanical licensed professional engineers specializing in facility design for government customers in communications infrastructure environments. This group is tasked with site layout and design, facility design, systems transition, integration planning, construction management, systems installation, integration, optimization, and acceptance testing. The customer sites for these projects are typically government sites both in the continental United States (CONUS) and internationally (OCONUS) with agencies such as DoD, FAA, TSA or DHS. Typical facilities you will support will include data centers, command centers, sensor installations, satellite antenna complexes, radar installations, and TSA Screening equipment. As a Principal Mechanical Engineer, you will develop, plan, and design facility components including HVAC, piping, plumbing and fire protection systems.  Work products developed will include construction drawings and specifications, cost and quantity estimates, and mechanical analyses (heat loss/gain calculations, mechanical, critical power - fuel distribution systems, and structural).You should be familiar and experienced with the UFC, UFGS, IBC, ASME, ANSI, ASHRAE, and NFPA codes. You will be responsible for technical coordination, as well as cost and schedule performance of the project design.Additionally, you will provide direction and consultation on mechanical issues at various sites and be responsible for technical work performed by lower level engineers. You should be able to work effectively in a team setting. As a senior engineer, you will be expected to work with minimal technical direction and at a high level of independence in resolving technical problems and establishing the approach for a solution.Required Skills:  As a Principal Mechanical Engineer in this group you must have at least 8 years’ experience in HVAC, piping, plumbing, and fire protection design.  Your experience should include the development of data, drawings, and specifications to permit the detailed layout and construction of complex designs.  You should be proficient with AutoCAD software and have a working knowledge of MS Visio.  You should have a good understanding of building code requirements and construction practices, including new facility construction, upgrades of existing facilities, and other related construction work including electric systems.  You should have the ability to work effectively in a multi-task environment, and have good project management skills.  You must possess strong communication skills and be comfortable in performing presentations for customers. You must have the willingness and ability to travel 15-20% of the time to various construction sites at domestic and/or international locations. You must have the ability to obtain and maintain a US Government Secret security clearance (US citizenship required).Desired Skills:  Prior communications site design experience including data center design and/or prior federal government contract experience is desired.  A Professional Engineer license is highly desired as well. Required Education:  Requires a Bachelor’s degree in Mechanical Engineering and 8 years of related work experience. 144921
Business Unit Profile
                        
                        Raytheon Intelligence, Information and Services delivers innovative technology to make the world a safer place. Our expertise in cyber, analytics and automation allow us to reach beyond what others think is possible to underpin national security and give our global customers unique solutions to solve the most pressing modern challenges -- from the cyber domain to automated operations, and from intelligent transportation and training solutions to creating clear insight from large volumes of data. IIS operates at nearly 550 sites in 80 countries, and is headquartered in Dulles, Virginia. The business area generated $6.2 billion in 2018 revenues. As a global business, our leaders must have the ability to understand, embrace and operate in a multicultural world -- in the marketplace and the workplace. We strive to hire people who reflect our communities and embrace diversity and inclusion to advance our culture, develop our employees, and grow our business.

Rewards




401(k) / Retirement Plans
Employer Matching, if you elect to enroll company matches up to 3%.



Work / Life Balance
Raytheon supports a variety of flexible work arrangements including compressed work weeks, flextime, job sharing, 9/80, reduced hours and telecommuting.



Career Development
At Raytheon, we foster an inclusive culture of professional development. We support a variety of developmental opportunities including: Mentoring programs, Skills Development, Leadership Development, Rotational job assignments, and Continuous Improvement, all of which contribute to advancement of our employee’s capabilities.



Paid Time Off
Accrue paid time off monthly. Receive 10-12 holidays per year with some locations shutting down the week between Christmas and New Year’s Day.



Relocation Assistance
Select technical positions are eligible for relocation packages. See specific job description for eligibility requirements.



Parental Leave
Raytheon offers all eligible employees up to three weeks paid parental leave for the birth or adoption of a child (separate from paid maternity leave or Family & Medical Leave Act).

Overview

Raytheon delivers innovative technology to make the world a safer place. Our expertise in cyber, analytics and automation allow us to reach beyond what others think is possible to underpin national security and give our global customers unique solutions to solve the most pressing modern challenges -- from the cyber domain to automated operations, and from intelligent transportation solutions to creating clear insight from large volumes of data. Our leaders must have the ability to understand, embrace and operate in a multicultural world -- in the marketplace and the workplace. We strive to hire people who reflect our communities and embrace diversity and inclusion to advance our culture, develop our employees, and grow our business.

Full-time
Entry to Senior level

Rewards




401(k) / Retirement Plans
Employer Matching, if you elect to enroll company matches up to 3%.



Work / Life Balance
Raytheon appreciates work/life balance. Employees can work 9 hours a day every week and received every other Friday off, as long as departmental/manager approval is obtained. Accrued paid time off monthly and paid holiday time.



Career Development
At Raytheon, we foster an inclusive culture of professional development. We support a variety of developmental opportunities including: Mentoring programs, Skills Development, Leadership Development, Rotational job assignments, and Continuous Improvement, all of which contribute to advancement of our employee’s capabilities.



Paid Time Off

Parental Leave

Back to Job Navigation (Rewards)



Responsibilities


Are you looking for an engineering career that is challenging and satisfying? Then join our Raytheon team of engineers solving problems that make the world a safer place and help to secure our great nation! Come support those who provide us with all the freedoms we enjoy.We offer great benefits that include medical, dental, vision, 401K match, flexible work schedule - just to name a few.  Click here to view a brief video and learn more: https://youtu.be/YNuZN0vyzHgRaytheon is looking for a talented Human Factors Engineer to join our Specialty Engineering team.  Specialty Engineering is part of Systems Engineering that complements the technical activities required to deliver a project. It deals with engineering that influence the systems’ design and architecture in terms of performance, safety, usability, reliability, maintainability, availability, supportability, testability, and cost consideration throughout the lifecycle of the product. Specialty Engineering applies methods, standards, and techniques to provide clarification of system requirements to software, hardware, and test personnel to ensure design and architecture considerations are appropriately allocated to the system and horizontally integrated across the development teams. The Specialty Engineering function supports systems engineering activities including trade studies, use case development, requirements definition and derivation, interface definition, and requirement validation and verification. As such, all Specialty Engineers interface with the other Specialty disciplines and logistics engineering functions to ensure integration and continuity in the design and development process.Must be a U.S. Citizen with the ability to obtain and maintain a DoD Top Secret Security ClearanceThe Specialty Team is looking for candidates with experience in this Specialty area:•  Human Factors Engineering/User Experience (UX)As a member of the Specialty Engineering Team, expect a dynamic and demanding environment that values discipline, adherence to processes, and adding value to our customers through our respective disciplines (Human Factors Engineering, System Safety, Reliability Engineering).This position is to support the preliminary and detailed design phases for programs within the Raytheon IIS portfolio that include the following businesses; Cyber and Special Missions (CSM), C2, Space and Intelligence (CSI), Navigation and Modernization Solutions (NMS) and Global Training Solutions (GTS). This position serves as a member of the Raytheon IIS Specialty Engineering Team and supports various programs within a matrix management assignment as directed. Deliverables include, but not limited to, program plans, technical reports, schedules, basis of estimates for new pursuits, and analyses as required to substantiate architectural/design decisions and trade studies.Required Skills: Advanced experience with  Human Factors Engineering practices as derived from MIL-STD-46855APractical understanding and application ofMIL-STD-1472MIL-STD-1474ISO 9241-110/210Ability to produce DoD required documentation consistent with appropriate Data Item Description (DID) , such as:HEPPHSIPPHEDAD-O/MHESARU.S. Citizen with the ability to obtain and maintain a DoD Top Secret Security ClearanceDesired Skills: Current DoD TS/SCI Security Clearance Human Factors Engineering offers a broad spectrum of skill and knowledge challenges across the IIS mission areas. User Experience (UX) and User Interface Design and ability to apply standards and process requirementsMIL-STD-1472MIL-STD-2525JSSG-2010NASA-STD-3000FAA-STD-001MIL-STD-1787AFI 63-112Section 508 Interface AssessabilityUsability Testing (SUS/ScoreCard)Workstation/Facilities DesignAutoCADJack Human ModelingDoD Assessability CriteriaMIL-STD-516 Air Worthiness CriteriaDO-178 Software considerations in Airborne Systems and Equipment CertificationHuman Systems IntegrationSAE 6906Human Performance Modeling/Workload AnalysisExpertise working with Satellite and/or unmanned ground stations, A/C avionics modernization, intelligence communities, FAA, other governmental agencies.Education Requirements: Bachelor’s Degree in Science, Technology, Engineering, Mathematics, or related STEM degree with minimum of 8 years of relevant experienceMaster’s Degree / PHD in Science, Technology, Engineering, Mathematics, or related STEM degree with minimum of 6 years of relevant experienceThis position requires either a U.S. Person or a Non-U.S. Person who is eligible to obtain any required Export Authorization. 149771

If you’re ready to take on a fresh challenge, grow your career and contribute to making the world a safer place, Raytheon is ready to help you achieve your goals. Join our team and get the opportunity and support to find purpose, thrive and succeed.





Notice: Please be aware of suspicious recruiting emails and text messages that attempt to collect your confidential information. Raytheon conducts all electronic correspondence using e-mail addresses that end in “Raytheon.com”, “Raytheon.co.uk”, “Raytheon.com.au” or “brassring.com”. To report fraud please go to: https://www.ic3.gov.











Systems-Software Engineer – Cloud Design
State College, Pennsylvania


Apply





Overview
Responsibilities
Success Profile
Rewards
Trending




Overview

What does it take to make the world a safer place? It takes delivering innovative technology and collaborating with some of the finest talent in the engineering field. Whether you’re a software engineer or a mechanical engineer, at Raytheon you’ll grow a varied and rewarding career. And you’ll be supported with a comprehensive and competitive benefits package that promotes work/life. If you’re ready to take on today’s big challenges, discover a world of opportunity at Raytheon.

America’s Best Large Employers by Forbes
Career & Development Opportunities
Full-time
Entry, Mid, Senior level




Back to Job Navigation (Overview)


Responsibilities


National Defense, Cloud Technologies, Agile Development, DevOps, Big Data, Teamwork … Opportunities at Raytheon span the full product development lifecycle, including new capability development as well as sustainment and enhancement of existing deployed systems. Raytheon Intelligence, Information and Services (IIS) in State College, PA is seeking talented Systems-Software Engineers to support classified programs that develop and enhance integrated sensor, signal processing, complex analytics, and big data systems for Intelligence Community customers.  The successful candidate has excellent written and verbal communication skills, works effectively in a team environment, and is flexible & adaptable to respond to customer mission needs.  Come join Raytheon's team of engineers solving problems that make the world a safer place and help to secure our great nation! Come support those who provide us with all the freedoms we enjoy.  Click here to view a brief video and learn more about Raytheon: https://youtu.be/8B-k34faFAE.About State College, PAState College is a college town, dominated economically and demographically by the presence of the University Park main campus of The Pennsylvania State University, one of the ten largest public universities in the United States. State College provides access to many cultural and athletic activities & events, and yet is only minutes away from rural Pennsylvania country-side. Many Raytheon State College employees enjoy a commute of 15 minutes or less! Click here to view a brief video and learn more about Raytheon State College:  https://youtu.be/f299m09q0FsCompensation & BenefitsWhile benefits may vary based on business unit, location and/or union status, Raytheon employees receive comprehensive benefits as part of a competitive compensation package. Health and wellness plans are available for you and your eligible children. Other benefits include insurance, education assistance, income protection, investment/retirement and work/life programs.Clearance RequirementsThis position requires eligibility to obtain a TS/SCI security clearance. A current, active TS/SCI or DoD-TS security clearance is highly preferred, and includes a sign-on bonus. U.S. citizenship is required.This position is eligible for a Sign on Bonus up to $40k for a candidate with a current TS/SCI that can be verified and hired at Raytheon.Required Skills: 2+ years of relevant work experienceFamiliarity with engineering processes and techniquesStrong interpersonal, communications, organization, and planning skillsCommitment to quality customer service and on-schedule task completionsAbility to manage time and resources to meet deadlinesProficiency with Microsoft OfficeAbility to generate technical documentation (DoDAF, ICDs, Test Plans & Procedures, etc.)Familiarity with Amazon Web Services (AWS)Knowledge of monitoring, logging and management tools that integrate with AWSDesired Skills: Active TS/SCI or DoD-TS security clearanceAbility to work effectively on multi-discipline engineering teamsFamiliarity with Continuous Integration and Deployment environmentsExperience with Agile DevelopmentAmazon Web Services (AWS) certificationExperience with software development on Linux platformsExperience with system-level requirements analysis, system design, trade studies, and/or system integration & verificationExperience conducting technical research, documenting and presenting resultsCoursework and/or experience in Systems Engineering, Software Engineering, Infrastructure Engineering and/or Security Engineering.CompTlA Security+ certificationEducation Requirements: Requires a degree in Science, Technology, Engineering or Mathematics (STEM) and minimum of 2+ years of prior relevant experience, unless prohibited by local laws/regulations. 150536
Business Unit Profile
                        
                        Raytheon Intelligence, Information and Services delivers innovative technology to make the world a safer place. Our expertise in cyber, analytics and automation allow us to reach beyond what others think is possible to underpin national security and give our global customers unique solutions to solve the most pressing modern challenges -- from the cyber domain to automated operations, and from intelligent transportation and training solutions to creating clear insight from large volumes of data. IIS operates at nearly 550 sites in 80 countries, and is headquartered in Dulles, Virginia. The business area generated $6.2 billion in 2018 revenues. As a global business, our leaders must have the ability to understand, embrace and operate in a multicultural world -- in the marketplace and the workplace. We strive to hire people who reflect our communities and embrace diversity and inclusion to advance our culture, develop our employees, and grow our business.
Relocation Eligible 
                        
                        Yes
Clearance Type 
                        
                        TS/SCI

Raytheon is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, age, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected Veteran status.

Quote



Felicia Jackson is regional vice president of RAYVETS, Raytheon's employee group for veterans and those who support them. After 24 years in the Air Force, she started a new career at Raytheon. "I wanted to go where people would support me," she told us.









Rewards




401(k) / Retirement Plans
Employer Matching, if you elect to enroll company matches up to 3%.



Work / Life Balance
Raytheon supports a variety of flexible work arrangements including compressed work weeks, flextime, job sharing, 9/80, reduced hours and telecommuting.



Career Development
At Raytheon, we foster an inclusive culture of professional development. We support a variety of developmental opportunities including: Mentoring programs, Skills Development, Leadership Development, Rotational job assignments, and Continuous Improvement, all of which contribute to advancement of our employee’s capabilities.



Paid Time Off
Accrue paid time off monthly. Receive 10-12 holidays per year with some locations shutting down the week between Christmas and New Year’s Day.



Relocation Assistance
Select technical positions are eligible for relocation packages. See specific job description for eligibility requirements.



Parental Leave
Raytheon offers all eligible employees up to three weeks paid parental leave for the birth or adoption of a child (separate from paid maternity leave or Family & Medical Leave Act).

            Associate Account Executive



         Login to apply
    
















Associate Account Executive
Santa Barbara, CA 


This entry level opportunity as an Associate Account Executive will work to effectively develop a multi-state territory through cold calling prospects, developing a solid sales pipeline and closing sales deals.
Responsibilities

Lead generation and qualification
Fielding, qualifying and closing inbound sale inquires
Prospecting and telephone marketing for new prospect clients
Creating, tracking, closing and reporting results of sales opportunities in yCRM
Learn and master company software product offerings
Conducting online presentations and product demonstrations
Communicating via phone and email correspondence with prospective clients
Nurturing sales opportunities through the entire sales cycle to close
Providing information and generating interest in conference participation and other related events
Managing weekly/monthly activity to support sales goals
Work effectively with other teams that support the sales process and client satisfaction 

Requirements 

Bachelor’s degree
Ability to do high volume cold calls and develop leads
Ability to generate a sales pipeline and close sales
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Superior phone skills
Technical aptitude and the ability to successfully demonstrate software
Ability to show product features and benefits
High level of professionalism and ethics
Ability to manage multiple priorities in a fast paced environment
A background in software sales, web ads sales, accounting systems, or experience in the property management industry highly desirable but not required

 Privacy Overview


 Strictly Necessary Cookies


 3rd Party Cookies




 








Privacy Overview

This website uses cookies so that we can provide you with the best user experience possible. Cookie information is stored in your browser and performs functions such as recognising you when you return to our website and helping our team to understand which sections of the website you find most interesting and useful.
You can adjust all of your cookie settings by navigating the tabs on the left hand side.



 
Strictly Necessary Cookies

Strictly necessary cookies must be enabled at all times in order to login and apply to openings.



disable









If you disable this cookie, we will not be able to save your preferences and you will not be able to login to apply for openings. This means that every time you visit this website you will need to enable or disable cookies again.







3rd Party Cookies

This website uses Google Analytics to collect anonymous information such as the number of visitors to the site, and the most popular pages.
Keeping this cookie enabled helps us to improve our website.



disable









Please enable Strictly Necessary Cookies first so that we can save your preferences!

            Regional Marketing Specialist



         Login to apply
    
















Regional Marketing Specialist
Dallas, TX 


The Regional Marketing Specialist is responsible for successfully facilitating marketing programs and supporting sales efforts at the regional, MSA and when appropriate, account level. Regional marketing programs include regional trade association sponsorships and events, region- and account-focused emails and the customization of sales and marketing materials for specific regions or strategic accounts. This individual will work with cross-functional teams from Marketing, Sales and Services to execute regional marketing programs.
 
Responsibilities

Subscribe to local/regional trade organization email lists for newsletters, local event announcements, etc. and join local trade groups on social media (Facebook, LinkedIn, Twitter)
Proactively and regularly contact trade organizations to determine networking, sponsorship, and speaking opportunities
Secure and manage local/regional trade organization opportunities as identified, including trade shows, sponsorship entitlements, speaker placement, design/display requirements, swag, etc. (leveraging Trade Events team to coordinate)
Meet regularly with Regional Managers/Directors in Sales to adjust regional strategy based on competitive intelligence, product priority, account-level data
Assist Sales with client/prospect invitations and follow-up related to local/regional trade events, Market Updates, other Yardi corporate events
Understand competitive landscape and Yardi’s relative strengths and weaknesses to competitor products to promote Yardi products effectively (e.g., sell Breeze vs. Voyager when competing against AppFolio)
Serve as ambassador at local/regional events, delivering short company/product presentations as needed and as included in sponsorship entitlements; network at events and talk to prospects and clients about their needs and how Yardi can help them
Identify marketing opportunities based on account-level data and update email templates, collateral, etc. to be used by sales as targeted micro-marketing
Update product webinar marketing emails monthly with schedule and times (per regional time zone) and provide to Sales for targeted regional marketing based on account data
Customize Sales decks, leavebehinds, etc. as applicable for strategic client meetings
Identify and recommend thought leadership content to Sales for use in specific regions or with specific accounts and gain feedback from Sales regarding additional marketing and thought leadership materials needed and work with Corporate Marketing to develop

 
Requirements

Bachelor’s Degree in Marketing, Communications, Business, Finance, or equivalent relevant experience
Five plus (5+) years in marketing, sales or equivalent experience interacting with customers
Experience in business to business (B2B) marketing
Experience in ERP systems
Yardi domain experience is a plus
Knowledge of real estate industry and Yardi’s competitors plus
Excellent interpersonal and relationship management skills
Strong research and analytical skills
Proficiency in Microsoft Office, Excel and PowerPoint
Experience with CRM
Experience with event marketing
Proven collaboration skills within a dynamic team
Proven ability to meet critical deadlines and prioritize multiple tasks in a fast-paced environment
Proven ability to manage projects with multiple touch points
Strong organizational and time management skills
Proven excellent written and verbal communication skills
Good public speaking skills
Excellent attention to detail and accuracy in execution of work and tasks
Ability to work independently as well in collaboration with others
Proven client-centered commitment and focus
Collegial, team-oriented disposition with the desire and ability to establish cooperative professional relationships with employees at all levels within Yardi, outside of Yardi, and with clients
Ability to think and act strategically by visualizing new possibilities, challenging assumptions, and recommending the implementation of new ideas or strategies desired
Regular attendance and a regular work schedule are essential functions of this job

            Quality Assurance Specialist



         Login to apply
    
















Quality Assurance Specialist
Santa Barbara, CA 


The Quality Assurance Specialist will be responsible for reviewing software requirements, creating test cases and ensuring functionality. 
Responsibilities 

Reviewing builds and loads in testing and validation software
Running comparisons reports to ensure the quality of the software
Collaborating with the documentation team regarding changes and ensuring that text is accurate
Participating in overall discussion plans for products to understand the overall intent and business purpose of the software
Functioning as a Subject Matter Expert (SME) on Yardi software
Executing a test plans, reviewing software and providing final sign off 

Requirements 

Bachelor’s degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science or other related degree
Previous experience performing software testing
Knowledge of Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC)
Strong analytical and critical thinking skills
Ability to troubleshoot and resolve issues
Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to work in a collaborative environment
Experience with MS SQL or Oracle highly desirable
Regular attendance and a regular work schedule is an essential function of this job

            Instructional Designer I



         Login to apply
    
















Instructional Designer I
Boise, ID 


The Instructional Designer I helps create eLearning courses and course components as well as video and audio training assets. Key functions include developing basic courses by defining learning objectives, compiling information, writing original content, polishing design elements, and finalizing projects in a variety of media. The Instructional Designer I is responsible for knowing and adhering to Yardi’s internal design standards for basic projects, utilizing basic editing and design skills and seeking and incorporating feedback from reviewers.
 
Responsibilities 

Demonstrates basic proficiency with standard in-platform authoring tools
Develops basic courses by defining learning objectives, developing exercises, and writing effective assessments that facilitate learner retention
Creates content and obtains, analyzes, and incorporates constructive feedback from a variety of reviewers including industry experts, clients, and Yardi management
Selects, suggests, and incorporates visual components for incorporation in courses
Incorporates basic user engagement strategies within a course to maximize retention
Performs basic course or video adjustments including linking files, adding video/audio to a page, archiving files, inserting closed captioning scripts, uploading SCORM files, applying templates, or transferring content to a page
Creates video and audio assets using basic recording and capture techniques
Reviews externally produced training content, divides content into logical sections, and develops basic online courses that adhere to Yardi release standards
Provides appropriate documentation to Development to request software enhancements
Regularly reviews content produced by other team members and provides constructive feedback
Maintains appropriate project management documentation

 
Requirements 

High School Diploma or GED
Bachelor’s Degree in any of the following: Teaching, Instructional Design, Communications, Marketing, Technical Writing, Graphic Design, Multimedia highly desirable
Up to two (2) years of experience in video production, audio/music editing, graphic design, web design, script writing, animation, or gamification
Up to two (2) years of experience with Yardi’s software and service offerings, including Yardi eLearning, or other corporate tools
Basic familiarity with audio tools such as Adobe Audition and Audacity
Basic familiarity with image editing software such as Adobe Photoshop and Illustrator
Basic familiarity with screen capture and editing technology such as Camtasia and Adobe Premiere or Captivate
Ability to learn and develop basic video and audio editing skills
Ability to prioritize and execute tasks on time within a fast-paced environment
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Ability to research, develop, and edit training content that adheres to basic instructional design standards highly desirable
Ability to test, identify, and document software issues highly desirable

*sa        



         Login to apply

Systems-Software Engineer – Cloud Design
State College, Pennsylvania


Apply

Overview

What does it take to make the world a safer place? It takes delivering innovative technology and collaborating with some of the finest talent in the engineering field. Whether you’re a software engineer or a mechanical engineer, at Raytheon you’ll grow a varied and rewarding career. And you’ll be supported with a comprehensive and competitive benefits package that promotes work/life. If you’re ready to take on today’s big challenges, discover a world of opportunity at Raytheon.

America’s Best Large Employers by Forbes
Career & Development Opportunities
Full-time
Entry, Mid, Senior level




Back to Job Navigation (Overview)


Responsibilities


National Defense, Cloud Technologies, Agile Development, DevOps, Big Data, Teamwork … Opportunities at Raytheon span the full product development lifecycle, including new capability development as well as sustainment and enhancement of existing deployed systems.Raytheon Intelligence, Information and Services (IIS) in State College, PA is seeking talented Systems-Software Engineers to support classified programs that develop and enhance integrated sensor, signal processing, complex analytics, and big data systems for Intelligence Community customers.  The successful candidate has excellent written and verbal communication skills, works effectively in a team environment, and is flexible & adaptable to respond to customer mission needs.  Come join Raytheon's team of engineers solving problems that make the world a safer place and help to secure our great nation!  Come support those who provide us with all the freedoms we enjoy.  Click here to view a brief video and learn more about Raytheon: https://youtu.be/8B-k34faFAE.About State College, PAState College is a college town, dominated economically and demographically by the presence of the University Park main campus of The Pennsylvania State University, one of the ten largest public universities in the United States. State College provides access to many cultural and athletic activities & events, and yet is only minutes away from rural Pennsylvania country-side. Many Raytheon State College employees enjoy a commute of 15 minutes or less! Click here to view a brief video and learn more about Raytheon State College:  https://youtu.be/f299m09q0FsCompensation & BenefitsWhile benefits may vary based on business unit, location and/or union status, Raytheon employees receive comprehensive benefits as part of a competitive compensation package. Health and wellness plans are available for you and your eligible children. Other benefits include insurance, education assistance, income protection, investment/retirement and work/life programs.Clearance RequirementsThis position requires eligibility to obtain a TS/SCI security clearance.  A current, active TS/SCI or DoD-TS security clearance is highly preferred, and includes a sign-on bonus. U.S. citizenship is required.This position is eligible for a Sign on Bonus up to $40k for a candidate with a current TS/SCI that can be verified and hired at Raytheon. Required Skills: 4+ years of relevant work experienceFamiliarity with engineering processes and techniquesAbility to work effectively on multi-discipline engineering teamsStrong interpersonal, communications, organization, and planning skillsCommitment to quality customer service and on-schedule task completionsAbility to manage time and resources to meet deadlinesProficiency with Microsoft OfficeFamiliarity with Continuous Integration and Deployment environmentsAbility to generate technical documentation (DoDAF, ICDs, Test Plans & Procedures, etc.)Experience conducting technical research, documenting and presenting resultsExperience with Amazon Web Services (AWS)Knowledge of monitoring, logging and management tools that integrate with AWSExperience with Agile DevelopmentFamiliarity with Continuous Integration and Deployment environmentsDesired Skills: Active TS/SCI or DoD-TS security clearanceAmazon Web Services (AWS) certificationExperience with software development on Linux platformsExperience with system-level requirements analysis, system design, trade studies, and/or system integration & verificationCoursework and/or experience in Systems Engineering, Software Engineering, Infrastructure Engineering and/or Security Engineering.CompTlA Security+ certificationEducation Requirements: This position requires a 4-year bachelor's degree in Science, Technology, Engineering or Mathematics (STEM).This position requires either a U.S. Person or a Non-U.S. Person who is eligible to obtain any required Export Authorization. 150432
Business Unit Profile
                        
                        Raytheon Intelligence, Information and Services delivers innovative technology to make the world a safer place. Our expertise in cyber, analytics and automation allow us to reach beyond what others think is possible to underpin national security and give our global customers unique solutions to solve the most pressing modern challenges -- from the cyber domain to automated operations, and from intelligent transportation and training solutions to creating clear insight from large volumes of data. IIS operates at nearly 550 sites in 80 countries, and is headquartered in Dulles, Virginia. The business area generated $6.2 billion in 2018 revenues. As a global business, our leaders must have the ability to understand, embrace and operate in a multicultural world -- in the marketplace and the workplace. We strive to hire people who reflect our communities and embrace diversity and inclusion to advance our culture, develop our employees, and grow our business.

Quote



Felicia Jackson is regional vice president of RAYVETS, Raytheon's employee group for veterans and those who support them. After 24 years in the Air Force, she started a new career at Raytheon. "I wanted to go where people would support me," she told us.









Rewards




401(k) / Retirement Plans
Employer Matching, if you elect to enroll company matches up to 3%.



Work / Life Balance
Raytheon supports a variety of flexible work arrangements including compressed work weeks, flextime, job sharing, 9/80, reduced hours and telecommuting.



Career Development
At Raytheon, we foster an inclusive culture of professional development. We support a variety of developmental opportunities including: Mentoring programs, Skills Development, Leadership Development, Rotational job assignments, and Continuous Improvement, all of which contribute to advancement of our employee’s capabilities.



Paid Time Off
Accrue paid time off monthly. Receive 10-12 holidays per year with some locations shutting down the week between Christmas and New Year’s Day.



Relocation Assistance
Select technical positions are eligible for relocation packages. See specific job description for eligibility requirements.



Parental Leave
Raytheon offers all eligible employees up to three weeks paid parental leave for the birth or adoption of a child (separate from paid maternity leave or Family & Medical Leave Act).

What does it take to make the world a safer place? It takes delivering innovative technology and collaborating with some of the finest talent in the engineering field. Whether you’re a software engineer or a mechanical engineer, at Raytheon you’ll grow a varied and rewarding career. And you’ll be supported with a comprehensive and competitive benefits package that promotes work/life. If you’re ready to take on today’s big challenges, discover a world of opportunity at Raytheon.

America’s Best Large Employers by Forbes

Back to Job Navigation (Overview)


Responsibilities


Are you looking for an engineering career that is challenging and satisfying? Then join our Raytheon team of engineers solving problems that make the world a safer place and help to secure our great nation! Come support those who provide us with all the freedoms we enjoy.We offer great benefits that include medical, dental, vision, 401K match, flexible work schedule - just to name a few.  Click here to view a brief video and learn more: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qvbCgKpkEdsRaytheon Intelligence, Information and Services (IIS) delivers innovative technology to make the world a safer place. Our expertise in cyber, analytics and automation allow us to reach beyond what others think is possible to underpin national security and give our global customers unique solutions to solve the most pressing modern challenges -- from the cyber domain to automated operations, and from intelligent transportation solutions to creating clear insight from large volumes of data. IIS operates at nearly 550 sites in 80 countries, including a large presence in Dulles, VA. As a global business, our leaders must have the ability to understand, embrace and operate in a multicultural world -- in the marketplace and the workplace. We strive to hire people who reflect our communities and embrace diversity and inclusion to advance our culture, develop our employees, and grow our business.Job Description:The Raytheon IIS Hardware and Infrastructure Engineering (HW&I) team has a professional opening for a Sr Network Infrastructure Engineer.  This position will perform network and infrastructure engineering tasks pertaining to LAN/data center system design, development, implementation, integration, and troubleshooting activities.  The qualified individual should possess knowledge and experience with network technologies, services, operations, and security.  Must have the ability to obtain and maintain a US Government Secret security clearance.Required Skills:Strong understanding of network technologies, services, security, and managementExperience with data center LAN design, implementation, diagnostics, performance, and managementExperience with implementation and configuration of Cisco products (Catalyst, Nexus, and Firepower)Experience with fiber channel storage SAN configurationFamiliarity with private cloud virtualization and virtual networks in Vmware environmentsAbility to perform system administration tasks on Linux and Windows platformsSkills in creation of data center solution documentation, including artifacts done using Microsoft VisioAbility to provide technical direction to a team of junior personnelAbility to multi-task and adjust priorities on the flyExperience in a customer-facing roleWillingness to travel, including internationallyMust have the ability to obtain and maintain a US Government Secret security clearanceDesired Skills:Understanding of network management and monitoring toolsetsFamiliarity with HPE switches and storage arraysExperience hardening network elements to US Government IA compliance standardsExposure to OWL data diode hardwareExisting US Government Secret security clearanceEducation Requirements:Requires BS in STEM and 6 years related experience 146844
Business Unit Profile
                        
                        Raytheon Intelligence, Information and Services delivers innovative technology to make the world a safer place. Our expertise in cyber, analytics and automation allow us to reach beyond what others think is possible to underpin national security and give our global customers unique solutions to solve the most pressing modern challenges -- from the cyber domain to automated operations, and from intelligent transportation and training solutions to creating clear insight from large volumes of data. IIS operates at nearly 550 sites in 80 countries, and is headquartered in Dulles, Virginia. The business area generated $6.2 billion in 2018 revenues. As a global business, our leaders must have the ability to understand, embrace and operate in a multicultural world -- in the marketplace and the workplace. We strive to hire people who reflect our communities and embrace diversity and inclusion to advance our culture, develop our employees, and grow our business.

            Account Manager



         Login to apply
    
















Account Manager
Waltham, MA 


As an Account Manager, you will be responsible for the implementation, training and monitoring of our real estate management software, supporting real estate property management executives and staff.   Responsibilities include: • Acting as the customer's primary point of contact at ScreeningWorks Pro • Monitoring the performance of your assigned accounts, and working with clients to create policies, procedures and work flows.  • Responsible for the creation and delivery of quarterly/monthly account performance reports and analysis • Provide recommendations to improve client property performance • Drive resolution for all issues related to client requests • Coordinate meetings with client executives and other key partnership members  • Work closely with Customer Support Representatives and other internal staff for monitoring and assisting with user issues. • Understand client configuration and work with IT/Development as it relates to new product releases.  Qualifications The ideal candidate will have the following character attributes:  • 2-5+ years of client management experience  • Familiar with software interfaces • Strong analytical skills • Strong written and oral skills  • Strong leadership skills with the ability to work as a part of the Client Services team • Ability to perform multiple tasks ranging from project management, training and problem solving • Highly ethical and disciplined professionalism  • Team player who can motivate and encourage the best from others  • Must be able to demonstrate outstanding customer relationships  • Must have the ability to understand technical products  • Negligible travel required *ad

Corporate Website
Privacy Statement
Legal











By continuing to browse this site you agree to our use of cookies. You can find out more about which cookies we are using or switch them off in settings.
 

 
Accept

 


















 

 Privacy Overview


 Strictly Necessary Cookies


 3rd Party Cookies




 








Privacy Overview

This website uses cookies so that we can provide you with the best user experience possible. Cookie information is stored in your browser and performs functions such as recognising you when you return to our website and helping our team to understand which sections of the website you find most interesting and useful.
You can adjust all of your cookie settings by navigating the tabs on the left hand side.



 
Strictly Necessary Cookies

Strictly necessary cookies must be enabled at all times in order to login and apply to openings.



disable









If you disable this cookie, we will not be able to save your preferences and you will not be able to login to apply for openings. This means that every time you visit this website you will need to enable or disable cookies again.







3rd Party Cookies

This website uses Google Analytics to collect anonymous information such as the number of visitors to the site, and the most popular pages.
Keeping this cookie enabled helps us to improve our website.



disable









Please enable Strictly Necessary Cookies first so that we can save your preferences!












Enable All
Save Changes

            Help Desk Specialist



         Login to apply
    
















Help Desk Specialist
Denver, CO 


As an IT Helpdesk Specialist you will be responsible for:

Responding to requests for technical assistance in person, via phone, or electronically
Installing software and updating hardware
Diagnosing and resolving technical hardware and software issues
Researching questions using available information resources
Advising users on appropriate actions
Following standard helpdesk procedures
Logging all helpdesk interactions
Administering helpdesk software
Re-directing problems to the appropriate resource

 
The ideal candidate will possess the following skills and abilities:

3-5 years  of experience
Proficiency in Windows 7, Windows 8 and Microsoft Office
Basic Network Troubleshooting skills
PC Imaging
Familiar with mobile device (phone/tablet) setup and use
Excellent customer service skills
Ability to work outside normal business hours if required to include evenings and weekends

 *sa

Strictly necessary cookies must be enabled at all times in order to login and apply to openings.

If you disable this cookie, we will not be able to save your preferences and you will not be able to login to apply for openings. This means that every time you visit this website you will need to enable or disable cookies again.







3rd Party Cookies

This website uses Google Analytics to collect anonymous information such as the number of visitors to the site, and the most popular pages.
Keeping this cookie enabled helps us to improve our website.



disable









Please enable Strictly Necessary Cookies first so that we can save your preferences!

            Event Coordinator



         Login to apply
    
















Event Coordinator
Santa Barbara, CA 


Under general supervision, the Event Coordinator is responsible for assisting in planning Yardi events from inception to completion by coordinating logistics, sourcing materials, and communicating with decision-makers for timely execution. The Event Coordinator may focus on either Yardi corporate events including large scale conferences and forums, or a higher volume of smaller tradeshow events.
Responsibilities 

Assists with event logistics such as booking activities, dinners, and meetings in association with the Yardi Advanced Solutions Conference (YASC) and forums.
Maintains inventory of supplies & materials in Yardi offices and places orders with vendors to prepare for each event.
Processes vendor payments and handles corporate credit card reconciliation.
Oversees printing of any in house materials for each event.
Oversees shipping of materials from Yardi offices for each event.
Maintains conference staff schedule documents.
Maintains production schedule for each event.
Maintains Executive Briefing profile sheets for each meeting.
Serves as events application lead for YASC
Follows up with sales representatives that have attended events to ensure all event leads are submitted to corporate in the proposed timeframe.
Participates in database cleanup and maintenance and acquires event attendee lists to verify information and prepare for future sales and marketing efforts.
Supports the Marketing department with monthly meeting organization, corporate credit card reconciliation, budget entry, marketing spreadsheet management, and other administrative tasks.
Provides marketing event information to new Sales employees and notifies Marketing management of events that need to be re-staffed when employees leave the company.
Assists the on-site Yardi merchandising store by reviewing and fulfilling orders, maintaining and tracking inventory, and ordering promotional items for conferences.
Serves as a back-up for webinar coordination by planning logistics, scheduling webinars and presenters, and distributing follow-up surveys.
Updates master Top Pipeline deals spreadsheet monthly and cross-references to ensure they are invited to special events.

 
Requirements 

Two plus (2+) years of experience in event planning.
Proficiency with MS Word, Excel, Outlook, CRM systems, Outlook, and SharePoint.
Bachelor’s degree in Communications, Marketing, Hospitality, or related field is desired
One plus (1+) years of experience in the hospitality industry is desired
Strong organizational skills and high attention to detail.
Strong written and verbal communication skills.
Ability to multitask and adapt to changing priorities.
Regular attendance and a regular work schedule are essential functions of this job.

*jb

Client Support Specialist




								Support Operations Team

																									,

								0105152

Client Support Specialist - (0105152) Location: Santa Barbara, CADo you want to work in a fun, smart, and energetic environment where you will be challenged, rewarded AND inspired? Come work with top performers at CJ Affiliate to make a real difference in how top brands run their businesses. We are the world’s leading affiliate marketing network - we transform digital marketing with the help of big data and business intelligence. We help advertisers drive more sales and expand their reach … and we want to hear from you!Client Support Specialists play a key role in supporting CJ’s advertisers and publishers. Client Support helps advertisers and publishers with a wide range of CJ account basics and troubleshooting, from the basics of affiliate, to day-to-day management requirements, to advanced topics like reporting. Additionally, Client Support works with our Publisher Development team to assist with high priority issues and identify clients with high management potential. Client Support Specialists are subject matter experts on CJ matters, providing best in class support for prioritized clients.Do these things interest you? You will:Become a subject matter expert in many things CJThe basics of the CJ user interfacesKey processes for day-to-day management and success for affiliate programsNew CJ product and documentation offerings to share with clientsProvide best in class support to managed clients through their account teams via internal support systems and to CJ’s advertiser and publisher bases through online and phone channels.Provide troubleshooting assistance for a variety of general and technical issues based on your subject matter expertise.Work on goals and projects that will enhance the client experience, such as automating team processes or enhancing documentation for clients.What we look for:Bachelor’s Degree from a four-year college or university.Strong customer service skills with at least 1-2 years of experience in a position that involves direct client interaction.Excellent phone, written, and interpersonal skills.Ability to collaborate on a teamStrong problem solving, analytical, and follow-through skills.  Why CJ Affiliate?CJ Affiliate is the leader in Affiliate Marketing.  We take pride in our innovative technology, comprehensive data solutions and our people.  We equip our teams with advanced tools, training and career development opportunities all to provide cutting edge solutions, strategies and support to deliver high quality results for our clients. We work in an energetic, results-oriented, collaborative, team environment that recognizes exceptional performance. As we evolve and grow as a business, so do you.         We offer comprehensive benefits including; competitive compensation, aggressive 401K match program, health and dental insurance, flexible time off, an Employee Stock purchase plan, fitness membership reimbursement, backup care program, flexible spending accounts, charitable donation matching and much, much more!  Our benefits are designed to care for you and your family – to keep you healthy - physically, emotionally, financially and socially. CJ Affiliate is a business unit within Conversant and Epsilon which is part of Alliance Data, a top performing Fortune 500 company also included in the S&P 500- NYSE: ADS. Conditions of EmploymentAll job offers are contingent upon successful completion of certain background checks which unless prohibited by applicable law may include criminal history checks, employment verification, education verification, drug screens, credit checks, DMV checks (for driving positions only) and fingerprinting. LI*DTReady to Work Hard, Play Hard and Make a difference? Apply now!Alliance Data is an Equal Employment Opportunity employerAlliance Data participates in E-Verify#support-operations Primary Location: USA - United States-3079 - California-50035 - Santa Barbara-K8-Santa BarbaraWork Locations: K8-Santa Barbara   Santa Barbara 93103Job: Account ManagementOrganization: EpsilonSchedule: RegularJob Type: Full-timeJob Posting: Nov 26, 2019, 1:51:31 PMDivision: CJ AffiliateRI: DT

            Consultant



         Login to apply
    
















Consultant
Boise, ID 


As a consultant, you will be responsible for executing successful ERP and EMR deployments and fostering strong client relationships. The position calls for strong project management skills, seasoned client management and client communication skills, and demonstrated knowledge of enterprise-wide software installations. Experience working within the accounting, technical, real estate, property management, or health care industries is highly desired.
Responsibilities

Implement the Yardi suite of software products
Execute project plans within time and budget constraints
Integrate client business processes into the Yardi application suite
Assist in the development of necessary reports to meet business requirements
Foster and grow client relationships through product adoption and revenue growth
Conduct annual best practice reviews with clients to ensure each client is receiving best possible products and support for their business model
Provide additional support to sales team by identifying business development opportunities and assist with new product implementation

Requirements

Five-plus years of experience in a consulting capacity
Five-plus years of experience interacting with customers while managing projects on accounting, business process, property management, or real estate software
Demonstrated experience working with and implementing ERP or EMR systems (such as Oracle, PeopleSoft, JD Edwards) is highly desirable
Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Business, Real Estate, Computer Science or related field, or equivalent experience
Experience working in senior living is highly desirable
Advanced Excel skills
SQL experience
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Ability to manage multiple priorities in a deadline-driven environment
Strong organizational skills
Strong interpersonal skills
Regular attendance and a regular work schedule is an essential function of this job
Up to 80% Travel

If you’re ready to take on a fresh challenge, grow your career and contribute to making the world a safer place, Raytheon is ready to help you achieve your goals. Join our team and get the opportunity and support to find purpose, thrive and succeed.





Notice: Please be aware of suspicious recruiting emails and text messages that attempt to collect your confidential information. Raytheon conducts all electronic correspondence using e-mail addresses that end in “Raytheon.com”, “Raytheon.co.uk”, “Raytheon.com.au” or “brassring.com”. To report fraud please go to: https://www.ic3.gov.










Network or Communications Scientist Intern / Grad – Summer 2020
Apply
Requisition ID 146907BR Date updated 10/08/2019
At Raytheon BBN Technologies we invent new science by applying radical cross-discipline techniques to tangible prototype systems to prove concept viability. This is especially evident in our Networking and Communications Technologies group, located in Cambridge, Massachusetts, where scientists and engineers anticipate the future in very large and very small scale information exchange across wired, wireless, and undersea environments.We are seeking qualified and eager interns to become an integral part of this work. You will either join a project team that is designing, analyzing, and prototyping innovative data networking architectures or one that is prototyping novel cyber security solutions.For networking, you will contribute to creating new algorithms and paradigms in such diverse and critical areas as network infrastructure security, network understanding, energy conservation, content networking, mobility, efficient channel access, and networking within extremely harsh or hostile environments.For cyber security, you will contribute to one or more of these efforts: Understand past trends or develop new malware or usage; reverse engineer processes or software; research attack technologies; cyber physical security; cryptography; quantum computing security issuesWhat will you need?Student pursuing a MS or PhD degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering or related technical fieldDeep and driving curiosityUnderstanding of cyber security concepts, networking concepts, or radio communications systemsExperience in design, simulation, analysis, and/or implementationExperience programming in modern languagesAvailable to work 40 hours per week, summer 2019Additional Skills that would be AWESOME / BENEFICIALExperience with programming languages such as C, C++, or MATLAB Experience with scripting languages (Perl, Python, etc.)Experience with network simulation tools (ns2, ns3, or commercial tools)Experience with signal processing fundamentalsExperience in a Linux environmentExperience with embedded system developmentAbility to work in teamsExcellent written and verbal communicationsThis position requires either a U.S. Person or a Non-U.S. Person who is eligible to obtain any required Export Authorization. 146907
Business Unit Profile
Raytheon Space and Airborne Systems (SAS) builds radars and other sensors for aircraft, spacecraft and ships. The business also provides communications and electronic warfare solutions and performs research in areas ranging from linguistics to quantum computing. SAS is headquartered in McKinney, Texas USA. As a global business, our leaders must have the ability to understand, embrace and operate in a multicultural world -- in the marketplace and the workplace. We strive to hire people who reflect our communities and embrace diversity and inclusion to advance our culture, develop our employees, and grow our business.Raytheon is headquartered in Waltham, Massachusetts. Follow us on Twitter.

Talent Acquisition Coordinator




								Talent Acquisition Team
							
							     | 
							

										Santa Barbara
									
																									,
																									
										California
									

								 | 
							
								0104356
							




Apply now
	
	

    




Talent Acquisition Coordinator - (0104356) 
Job Summary: Under the general direction of the Director, Talent Acquisition the Talent Acquisition Coordinator is responsible for managing interview scheduling, candidate lead generation initiatives, applicant tracking, and interview-related correspondence.  The position will ensure that CJ Affiliate’s recruiting efforts are expedited and recruiting processes are efficient. Essential Functions and Responsibilities:
 
Arrange phone and in-person interviews between candidates and hiring managers and their teams.  Provide resolution to scheduling conflicts and ensure candidates have a smooth, efficient experience
Enter background checks into our third-party web-based system; must be proactive in contacting candidates directly to ensure the information on their application is correct; Following up on background check issues that arise
Develop relationships with internal teams and external teams to identify effective opportunities to deliver information to candidates, build Conversant recruitment brand and provide administrational support to recruiters
Thought leader and innovation driver for new ways to use data to understand hiring process, bottle necks, data leakage and overall best practices to engage top talent internally and externally
Recommend improvements to current best practices, processes and tools where applicable
Assistance with third party and 1099 vendor setup as needed
New hire onboarding 
Coordinate candidate travel through our online reservation system.
Develop relationships with hiring managers and hiring teams 
Perform additional tasks, projects and responsibilities as assigned. Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:
Ability to communicate clearly and effectively with all levels of employees and candidates both orally and in writing
Strong attention to detail and ability to maintain detail focus in fast-paced environment
Strong work ethic and problem-solving ability 
Aptitude for understanding
Solid understanding of recruitment processes and an aptitude for creating efficiencies 
Ability to anticipate future needs and project a sense of urgency and commitment to excellent customer service
Ability to work independently with minimal supervision and be team oriented
Ability to handle confidential recruitment and personnel documents
Ability to handle various tasks simultaneously in a very fast paced environment
Must have high energy, enthusiasm and a positive attitude
Prior experience with an HRIS and/or Applicant Tracking system preferred; aptitude for learning new online technology/systems a must
Outstanding communications skills, both verbal and written
Strong analytical skills
Excellent interpersonal skills & teamwork/ collaboration
Ability to organize, prioritize work and multi-task 
Requirements:
1+ years’ experience in a Recruiting or HR Coordinator role is desired
Bachelor’s degree is a plus but not required.
Proficiency in MS Office products: Word, Excel, PPT
Experience with PeopleSoft is preferred, but not required
Experience with Taleo is ideal, and experience with an ATS is strongly preferred#human-resources
#talent-acquisition   Why CJ Affiliate? CJ Affiliate is the leader in Affiliate Marketing.  We take pride in our innovative technology, comprehensive data solutions and our people.  We equip our teams with advanced tools, training and career development opportunities all to provide cutting edge solutions, strategies and support to deliver high quality results for our clients. We work in an energetic, results-oriented, collaborative, team environment that recognizes exceptional performance. As we evolve and grow as a business, so do you.           Conditions of EmploymentAll job offers are contingent upon successful completion of certain background checks which unless prohibited by applicable law may include criminal history checks, employment verification, education verification, drug screens, credit checks, DMV checks (for driving positions only) and fingerprinting. Great People, Deserve Great BenefitsWe know that we have some of the brightest and most talented associates in the world, and we believe in rewarding them accordingly.  If you work here, expect competitive pay, comprehensive health coverage, and endless opportunities to advance your career.  About UsEpsilon® is an all-encompassing global marketing innovator. We provide unrivaled data intelligence and customer insights, world-class technology including loyalty, email and CRM platforms and data-driven creative, activation and execution. Epsilon’s digital media arm, Conversant, is a leader in personalized digital advertising and insights through its proprietary technology and trove of consumer marketing data, delivering digital marketing with unprecedented scale, accuracy and reach through personalized media programs. Together, we bring personalized marketing to consumers across offline and online channels, at moments of interest that help drive business growth for brands.  Epsilon employs over 8,000 associates in 70 offices worldwide. For more information, visit www.epsilon.com and follow us on Twitter @EpsilonMktg. Epsilon provides equal employment opportunities without regard to race, color, religion, gender, age, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law. Epsilon is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Epsilon participates in E-Verify.Epsilon will provide accommodations to applicants needing accommodations to complete the application process.Any applicant offered employment will be required to establish that they are legally authorized to work in the United States for Epsilon.Epsilon will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal and credit histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of all applicable laws, including the City of Los Angeles’ Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring Ordinance. For San Francisco Bay Area:Epsilon will consider for employment-qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of San Francisco Police Code Sections 4901 - 4919, commonly referred to as the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance. #LI-AE Primary Location: USA - United States-3079 - California-50035 - Santa Barbara-K8-Santa BarbaraWork Locations: K8-Santa Barbara   Santa Barbara 93103Job: Human ResourcesOrganization: EpsilonSchedule: RegularJob Type: Full-timeJob Posting: Oct 24, 2019, 3:50:10 PMDivision: CJ AffiliateRI: AE

            Junior Account Executive



         Login to apply
    
















Junior Account Executive
Raleigh, NC 


The Junior Account Executive, Inside Sales will work to effectively develop a multi-state territory, successfully acquire new accounts, develop and manage a well-balanced sales pipeline and meet monthly/annual sales goals.
Responsibilities include:

Lead generation and qualification
Fielding, qualifying and closing inbound sale inquires
Prospecting and telephone marketing for new prospect clients
Creating, tracking, closing and reporting results of sales opportunities in yCRM
Learn and master company software product offerings
Conducting online presentations and product demonstrations
Communicating via phone and email correspondence with prospective clients
Nurturing sales opportunities through the entire sales cycle to close
Providing information and generating interest in conference participation and other related events
Managing weekly/monthly activity to support sales goals
Work effectively with other teams that support the sales process and client satisfaction

This position will require the following background and skills:

Bachelor’s degree in Business, Accounting or related degree
Ability to cold call and develop leads
Ability to generate a sales pipeline and close sales
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Superior phone skills
Technical aptitude and the ability to successfully demonstrate software
Ability to show product features and benefits
High level of professionalism and ethics
Ability to manage multiple priorities in a fast paced environment
A background in software sales, web ads sales, accounting systems, or experience in the property management industry highly desirable

 *cl

Privacy Overview

This website uses cookies so that we can provide you with the best user experience possible. Cookie information is stored in your browser and performs functions such as recognising you when you return to our website and helping our team to understand which sections of the website you find most interesting and useful.
You can adjust all of your cookie settings by navigating the tabs on the left hand side.



 
Strictly Necessary Cookies

Strictly necessary cookies must be enabled at all times in order to login and apply to openings.



disable









If you disable this cookie, we will not be able to save your preferences and you will not be able to login to apply for openings. This means that every time you visit this website you will need to enable or disable cookies again.







3rd Party Cookies

This website uses Google Analytics to collect anonymous information such as the number of visitors to the site, and the most popular pages.
Keeping this cookie enabled helps us to improve our website.

Please enable Strictly Necessary Cookies first so that we can save your preferences!
