            Software Development Engineer I



         Login to apply
    
















Software Development Engineer I
Toronto, ON 


Under immediate supervision, the Software Development Engineer I analyzes, modifies and debugs existing applications. Responsibilities also include testing, communicating and implementing defect resolutions.
Responsibilities

Modifies, implements, and maintains an existing application to established standards, specifications and approved changes
Performs maintenance programming for existing versions
Uses corporate approved CRM systems to track cases, defects and resolutions
Explains defect resolutions to the Team Leader
Uses corporate approved integrated development environment (e.g., Visual Studios, Eclipse) to implement defect resolutions
Performs unit testing on his/her defect resolutions to ensure accuracy, integrity, interoperability and completeness to achieve desired results
Analyzes and documents reasons for test failures, and revises/debugs assigned programs and/or procedures as necessary
Learns and increases knowledge of a single domain and best practices
Expands technical and industry expertise
Uses corporate approved sourced control applications (e.g., Microsoft Team Foundations) to maintain code changes
Adheres to Department policies, procedures and standards in the development and implementation of software

Requirements

Bachelor’s degree in Computer/Engineering Science or equivalent experience
Independent problem solving and analysis skills
Clear, effective verbal and written communication skills
Good time management skills
Ability to meet critical deadlines and prioritize multiple tasks in a fast-paced environment
Collegial, team-oriented disposition with the desire and ability to establish cooperative working relationships with employees at all levels within Yardi, outside Yardi and with clients
Regular attendance and a regular work schedule is an essential function of this job

If you are seeking an opportunity to join a winning team, work with the latest technologies and develop your career, then Yardi is the place for you.
Yardi is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to inclusive, barrier-free recruitment and selection processes. If contacted for an employment opportunity, please advise if you require accommodation at any stage of the recruitment process.

            Audience Development Specialist



         Login to apply
    
















Audience Development Specialist
New York, NY 


The Audience Development Specialist is the principal manager for content distribution across a varied list of internally produced editorial including monthly, quarterly and tri-annually produced market reports, two magazine brands, eight supporting newsletters and other products in planning. The Audience Development Specialist will perform a variety of editorial, operational and promotional tasks for the online marketing system for the Yardi Publishing Group.
Responsibilities

Works with content developers to direct how to position articles and assets for use in the Yardi Publishing site network, email newsletters and social promotions increasing the number of website visits
Initiates and maintains relationships with numerous media outlets and their websites by monitoring their content and making frequent contributions, links, etc. to increase Yardi Publishing website visibility and visits
Works with premium content creators – including magazine editors, event producers, app producers and product managers – to effectively repurpose content for distribution and promotion on the web and via email and social media
Plans, executes and optimizes daily email marketing campaigns using links, product reviews, embedded advertising and display advertising
Optimizes all daily portal content for search engines and manages audience engagement, subscription lists and add/delete tools and utilities
Coordinates advertising and marketing programs
Plans, executes and optimizes all website conversion architecture including Rapid Conversion Landing Pages, Floaters, OFIEs, OFINs and test links required to build new email subscriber relationships

Requirements

Bachelor’s Degree in interactive media, journalism, communications, marketing, creative writing or equivalent experience.
Three (3) years of relevant digital marketing experience with working knowledge of open source content management systems, search engine optimization, search engine marketing, google and other search engine analytics
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Goal driven with the ability to adapt to change and to new opportunities
Solid grammar, spelling and composition skills
Must be motivated and enthusiastic team player
Strong proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite
Ability to meet critical deadlines and prioritize multiple tasks in a fast-paced environment
High attention to detail and strong organizational skills

*jh

            Associate Technical Account Manager



         Login to apply
    
















Associate Technical Account Manager
Cleveland, OH 


The Associate Technical Account Manager assists clients with the Setup, Configuration and Operation of Automated pricing within Multi-family industry.
Responsibilities

Determines operational objectives by reviewing with client Asset goals and objectives
Conduct weekly calls with clients reviewing pricing performance and providing recommendations
Monitors project progress by tracking activity; resolving problems; publishing progress reports; recommending actions
Provides references for users by; providing help desk support; training users
Maintains user confidence and protects operations by keeping information confidential
Prepares technical reports by collecting, analyzing, and summarizing information and trends
Maintains professional and technical knowledge by attending educational workshops; reviewing professional publications; establishing personal networks; benchmarking state-of-the-art practices; participating in professional societies
Contributes to team effort by accomplishing related results as needed

Requirements

A strong record of professional success, including at least 3 years of client-facing experience
A minimum of 3 years of Property Management and/or Revenue Management in the Multifamily industry
Superior client-facing skills
Excellent written and verbal communication skills and comfortable in client environments
Strong client focus, excellent teamwork abilities, integrity, and relationship-building skills
Demonstrated track record of goal achievement
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent higher-level client management experience
Regular attendance and a regular work schedule is an essential function of this job

If you’re ready to take on a fresh challenge, grow your career and contribute to making the world a safer place, Raytheon is ready to help you achieve your goals. Join our team and get the opportunity and support to find purpose, thrive and succeed.





Notice: Please be aware of suspicious recruiting emails and text messages that attempt to collect your confidential information. Raytheon conducts all electronic correspondence using e-mail addresses that end in “Raytheon.com”, “Raytheon.co.uk”, “Raytheon.com.au” or “brassring.com”. To report fraud please go to: https://www.ic3.gov.











Sr. Systems Engineer II - System Safety Engineer
Dulles, Virginia, Richardson, Texas, Aurora, Colorado, Indianapolis, Indiana, Marlborough, Massachusetts


Apply





Overview
Success Profile
Trending
Rewards
Responsibilities




Overview

Raytheon delivers innovative technology to make the world a safer place. Our expertise in cyber, analytics and automation allow us to reach beyond what others think is possible to underpin national security and give our global customers unique solutions to solve the most pressing modern challenges -- from the cyber domain to automated operations, and from intelligent transportation solutions to creating clear insight from large volumes of data. Our leaders must have the ability to understand, embrace and operate in a multicultural world -- in the marketplace and the workplace. We strive to hire people who reflect our communities and embrace diversity and inclusion to advance our culture, develop our employees, and grow our business.

Full-time
Entry to Senior level

Glassdoor 2017 Best Places to Interview: Candidate's Choice


Back to Job Navigation (Overview)


Success Profile
What does it take to be successful at Raytheon? Check out these traits to see if you have the right mix.

Addtional Traits

Adaptable
Challenge status quo
Communication skills
Eager to learn
Emotional Intelligence
Influential
Innovative
Leadership traits
Problem solver
Team player


We hire people who want to make the world a safer place.
Back to Job Navigation (Success)


Quote

At Raytheon, I get to work with some of the smartest minds and coolest technologies on a daily basis. What more can I ask for?
– Shirali Patel 



Trending







Raytheon: Bright Future in Aurora







Raytheon Secures Every Side of Cyber




Back to Job Navigation (Trending)


Rewards




401(k) / Retirement Plans
Employer Matching, if you elect to enroll company matches up to 3%.



Work / Life Balance
Raytheon appreciates work/life balance. Employees can work 9 hours a day every week and received every other Friday off, as long as departmental/manager approval is obtained. Accrued paid time off monthly and paid holiday time.



Career Development
At Raytheon, we foster an inclusive culture of professional development. We support a variety of developmental opportunities including: Mentoring programs, Skills Development, Leadership Development, Rotational job assignments, and Continuous Improvement, all of which contribute to advancement of our employee’s capabilities.



Paid Time Off
Accrue paid time off monthly. Receive 12 holidays per year including the week between Christmas and New Year’s Day.



Relocation Assistance
Select technical positions are eligible for relocation packages. See specific job description for eligibility requirements.



Parental Leave
Raytheon offers all eligible employees up to three weeks paid parental leave for the birth or adoption of a child (separate from paid maternity leave or Family & Medical Leave Act).



Back to Job Navigation (Rewards)



Responsibilities


Are you looking for an engineering career that is challenging and satisfying? Then join our Raytheon team of engineers solving problems that make the world a safer place and help to secure our great nation! Come support those who provide us with all the freedoms we enjoy.We offer great benefits that include medical, dental, vision, 401K match, flexible work schedule - just to name a few.  Click here to view a brief video and learn more: https://youtu.be/YNuZN0vyzHgRaytheon is looking for a talented Systems SafetyEngineer to join our Specialty Engineering team.  Specialty Engineering is part of Systems Engineering that complements the technical activities required to deliver a project. It deals with engineering that influence the systems’ design and architecture in terms of performance, safety, usability, reliability, maintainability, availability, supportability, testability, and cost consideration throughout the lifecycle of the product. Specialty Engineering applies methods, standards, and techniques to provide clarification of system requirements to software, hardware, and test personnel to ensure design and architecture considerations are appropriately allocated to the system and horizontally integrated across the development teams. The Specialty Engineering function supports systems engineering activities including trade studies, use case development, requirements definition and derivation, interface definition, and requirement validation and verification. As such, all Specialty Engineers interface with the other Specialty disciplines and logistics engineering functions to ensure integration and continuity in the design and development process.Must be a U.S. Citizen with the ability to obtain and maintain a DoD Top Secret Security ClearanceThe Specialty Team is looking for candidates with experience in this Specialty area:•  System Safety EngineerAs a member of the Specialty Engineering Team, expect a dynamic and demanding environment that values discipline, adherence to processes, and adding value to our customers through our respective disciplines (Human Factors Engineering, System Safety, Reliability Engineering).This position is to support the preliminary and detailed design phases for programs within the Raytheon IIS portfolio that include the following businesses; Cyber and Special Missions (CSM), C2, Space and Intelligence (CSI), Navigation and Modernization Solutions (NMS) and Global Training Solutions (GTS). This position serves as a member of the Raytheon IIS Specialty Engineering Team and supports various programs within a matrix management assignment as directed. Deliverables include, but not limited to, program plans, technical reports, schedules, basis of estimates for new pursuits, and analyses as required to substantiate architectural/design decisions and trade studies.Required Skills: Experience with System Safety Engineering practices as derived from MIL-STD-882U.S. Citizen with the ability to obtain and maintain a DoD Top Secret Security ClearancePractical understanding and application of:MIL-STD-1472MIL-STD-1474Ability to produce DoD required documentation, such as:Safety Engineering Analysis ReportFailure Mode Effects and Criticality ReportSafety Assessment ReportEngineering Change Proposal System Safety ReportWaiver or Deviation System Safety Report (WDSSR)System Safety Program Progress ReportHealth Hazard Assessment ReportRadiation Hazard Control ProceduresSafety Studies ReportSafety Studies PlanMishap Risk Assessment ReportSystem Safety Program PlanDesired Skills: Current DoD TS/SCI Security Clearance Expertise working with Satellite and/or unmanned ground stations, A/C avionics modernization, intelligence communities, FAA, other governmental agencies.System Safety Engineering ability to apply standards and process requirementsMIL-STD-882DO-178MIL-STD-516 Air Worthiness CriteriaDO-178 Software considerations in Airborne Systems and Equipment CertificationHuman Systems IntegrationSAE 6906Education Requirements: Bachelor’s Degree in Science, Technology, Engineering, Mathematics, or related STEM degree with minimum of 6 years of relevant experienceMaster’s Degree / PHD in Science, Technology, Engineering, Mathematics, or related STEM degree with minimum of 4 years of relevant experienceThis position requires either a U.S. Person or a Non-U.S. Person who is eligible to obtain any required Export Authorization. 149924

Senior Reporting Accountant (Remote) - 85941 - Los Angeles, CA - Inogen, Inc. Jobs








 














Home
Jobs




Senior Reporting Accountant (Remote) - 85941 - Los Angeles, CA

Toggle navigation








Senior Reporting Accountant (Remote) - 85941 

JobsLogin 












 Finance & Accounting Los Angeles, CA, USA Full Time 



Email Me Similar Jobs Email Me This Job



ABOUT INOGEN Inogen was founded in 2001 to improve quality of life and increase freedom and independence for oxygen therapy users. Inogen is innovation in oxygen therapy. The Inogen mission is to improve freedom and independence for oxygen therapy patients through innovative products and services. Inogen is a manufacturer and Accredited Homecare Provider.
Inogen is focused on quality care, continuous improvement, and outstanding customer satisfaction. We are a stable, USA based company dedicated to providing an exciting and rewarding career to our employees. We completed a successful Initial Public Offering on the NASDAQ in 2014 and have demonstrated substantial growth over the last five years. Our work environment is casual yet high performing, and we are looking for seriously talented, motivated, and fast-paced professionals to join our team.
JOB DESCRIPTION 
In a remote capacity, the Reporting Accountant, Senior supports the Accounting and Finance Department leadership, promotes cross departmental process improvements, and performs and reviews monthly/quarterly/annual financial duties.  
Key Competencies:
Reconciliation of equity accounts.
Reconciliation of outstanding stock with the company's stock transfer agent. 
Prepare stock transfer letters and external brokerage transfer letters for exercises of stock options by employees to company's stock transfer agent. 
Reconcile payroll reports to stock administration system to ensure accurate reporting for W-2 and 1099's.
Prepare ASC 718 stock compensation expense from stock administration system monthly, quarterly and annually with reconciliation between periods. 
Bi-weekly reporting to payroll for inclusion of sales of stock on employees' paychecks. 
Prepare disclosure reports quarterly and annually for SEC reporting of equity plans in 10-Q, 10-K, and Proxy. 
Record journal entries for ESPP stock administration system for posting to employee accounts. 
Prepare termination reports from equity plans to be included in final paycheck when necessary to payroll. 
Maintain pre-clearance forms and ensure all covered employees have filled out proper documentation prior to transacting company stock. 
Maintain back-up support and tie-out binders for all SEC filings. 
Assist with obtaining proper schedules and support from finance and accounting when inclusion in SEC filings is required. 
Assist and set-up of black-up periods with the company's stock administration system and subsequent communication to relevant covered employees. 
Prepare weighted-average share calculation based on the shares outstanding during the quarterly and annual periods to reconcile with equity accounts. 
Assist in preparing dilution reports for equity plans for inclusion in weighted average share calculation. 
Reconcile stock compensation expense by department back to stock administration system reports. 
Assist in preparing report for excess tax benefit calculation for tax purposes on provision for ESPP & equity plans based on book to tax expense. 
Assist with employee relations regarding plan specifics and bi-annual enrollment periods. 
Prepare presentation slides regarding ESPP program and other employee correspondence when necessary. 
Recalculate and cross-check calculation of disqualifying dispositions for employee stock purchase plan and incentive stock options to ensure that withdrawals are properly included or excluded within the disqualifying disposition report for payroll reporting. 
Assist with preparation of all SEC filings (10-Q, 10-K, etc.) and press releases. 
Various other reconciliations and reporting items based on an as needed basis to include but not limited to commitment and contingencies, leases, loans, purchase obligations and other related accounts and activities. 
Maintain regular and punctual attendance. 
Comply with all company policies and procedures. 
Assist with any other duties as assigned. 
 
Do you possess these abilities?
Must possess a solid working knowledge of GAAP. 
Must have strong work ethic.
Excellent oral and written communication skills required. 
Attention to detail is required. 
Effective conflict resolution. 
Ability to maintain confidentiality and exercise extreme discretion. 
Ability to analyze and interpret company financial data & reporting. 
Maintain a high level of accuracy in preparing & reviewing bi-weekly payroll journal entries. 
Analytical & problem-solving skills & ability to multitask. 
Solutions-oriented problem solver. 
Excellent planning, communication and organizational skills. 
Ability to effectively interface with different departments within the company.
10% Travel. Must be able to travel to corporate office in Goleta, CA
Ability to work independently from home or off site.
Requirements:
Bachelor's degree in Finance, Accounting or related field of study, required. 
CPA, preferred
6+ years' experience in Accounting.
1-3 years' experience in Stock Administration, required. 
Advanced knowledge/proficiency in Microsoft Office, financial accounting software and MRP/ERP Systems, required.
A combination of training, education and experience that is equivalent to the qualifications listed above and that provides the required knowledge, skills, and abilities.
 
WHY INOGEN Inogen is a dynamic company that is not only focused on quality care of patients, but is also committed to being a top employer.  Each of Inogen' s offices have a casual culture that supports employees being responsible and developing professionals.
We offer competitive salaries and a robust benefit package:
Employee Stock Purchase Plan 401 (K) plan available for all employees Health, dental, vision insurance Flexible spending accounts and wellness discount program Life Insurance Long Term Disability Robust paid time off and 8 paid holidays Employee Assistance Program
See the Inogen Team in action:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dKoTMeJf5J4
 
Inogen Where we go to work hard to positively impact people's lives
 
Inogen is an equal opportunity employer.  We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other legally protected characteristics. The EEO is the Law poster and its supplement are available here: http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/ofccpost.htm; http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/OFCCP_EEO_Supplement_Final_JRF_QA_508c.pdf.  The pay transparency policy is available here: http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/pdf/EO13665_PrescribedNondiscriminationPostingLanguage_JRFQA508c.pdf. 
Inogen is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities.  If you need a reasonable accommodation because of a disability for any part of the employment process, please send an e-mail to recruiting@inogen.net or call (972) 616-5668 and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information.

Cyber  Engineer II
Huntsville, Alabama

Overview

What does it take to make the world a safer place? It takes delivering innovative technology and collaborating with some of the finest talent in the engineering field. Whether you’re a software engineer or a mechanical engineer, at Raytheon you’ll grow a varied and rewarding career. And you’ll be supported with a comprehensive and competitive benefits package that promotes work/life. If you’re ready to take on today’s big challenges, discover a world of opportunity at Raytheon.

America’s Best Large Employers by Forbes
Career & Development Opportunities
Full-time
Entry, Mid, Senior level




Back to Job Navigation (Overview)


Responsibilities


Raytheon is a technology and innovation leader specializing in defense, security and civil markets throughout the world.  Our latest company video is about our people, our technology, our vision, and the values we hold dear at Raytheon.  Click here to view: https://youtu.be/qvbCgKpkEdsIf this is interesting then join our Raytheon team of smart people solving problems that make the world a safer place and help to secure our great nation! Come support those who provide us with all the freedoms we enjoy. This tasking will be both at the Systems Simulation, Software and Integration (S3I) (on base) and at the Raytheon facility in Huntsville, AL.  We offer amenities that create work-life balance, including employee appreciation lunches, bonus opportunities, great benefits that include medical, dental, vision, and 401K match, and flexible work schedules.  These are just some of the many reasons people come to work at Raytheon!Raytheon Intelligence, Information and Services (IIS) is currently seeking a Cyber Engineer to be a key contributor in the implementation of cyber engineering into the Patriot program.  This position provides support, research and analysis of exceptionally complex problems, and processes relating to them. Thinks independently and demonstrates exceptional written and oral communications skills. Contributes to the development of new principles, concepts, and methodologies. Works on unusually complex technical problems and provides highly innovative and ingenious solutions. Recommends cybersecurity software tools or the assessment and implementation of an improved cybersecurity posture.  Development and assessment of product specific STIGs from applicable DISA SRGs. Works under consultative direction toward predetermined long-range goals and objectives. Determines and pursues courses of action necessary to obtain desired results.Clearance RequirementsUS Citizenship with an Active Secret Clearance and the eligibility to obtain a TS/SCI security clearanceRequired Skills: Analytical and problem solving skills for resolving security issuesKnowledge and understanding of DoD security regulations, DISA STIGsKnowledge of RMF processCurrent or ability to obtain in 3 months IAT level 2 or greater cybersecurity certification per DoD 8570.01; such as: Security+Experience in managing and configuring Nessus scanners based on notifications from the ACAS administratorsExperience in reviewing/submitting POA&Ms for past due Information Assurance Vulnerability Alerts/BulletinExperience in reviewing and providing recommendations for mitigation strategy implementations for proper safeguardsExperience in managing, disseminating, interpreting and tracking compliance with IAVM'sExperience in maintaining existing standard operational procedure (SOP) documentation and drafting new SOPs and other documentation as necessaryExperience in conducting vulnerability scans and providing reports for assigned PORsDesired Skills: Agile Execution ExperienceExperience with software design and implementationExperience with RSA implementation Network design and implementationExperience with direct interaction with DoD customersEducation Requirements: 2 years with a BS or BA in Engineering, Science, Mathematics or related STEM degree; or a MS/MA in Engineering, Science, Mathematics or related STEM degree 150882
Business Unit Profile
Raytheon Intelligence, Information and Services delivers innovative technology to make the world a safer place. Our expertise in cyber, analytics and automation allow us to reach beyond what others think is possible to underpin national security and give our global customers unique solutions to solve the most pressing modern challenges -- from the cyber domain to automated operations, and from intelligent transportation and training solutions to creating clear insight from large volumes of data. IIS operates at nearly 550 sites in 80 countries, and is headquartered in Dulles, Virginia. The business area generated $6.2 billion in 2018 revenues. As a global business, our leaders must have the ability to understand, embrace and operate in a multicultural world -- in the marketplace and the workplace. We strive to hire people who reflect our communities and embrace diversity and inclusion to advance our culture, develop our employees, and grow our business.

Quote



Felicia Jackson is regional vice president of RAYVETS, Raytheon's employee group for veterans and those who support them. After 24 years in the Air Force, she started a new career at Raytheon. "I wanted to go where people would support me," she told us.









Rewards




401(k) / Retirement Plans
Employer Matching, if you elect to enroll company matches up to 3%.



Work / Life Balance
Raytheon supports a variety of flexible work arrangements including compressed work weeks, flextime, job sharing, 9/80, reduced hours and telecommuting.



Career Development
At Raytheon, we foster an inclusive culture of professional development. We support a variety of developmental opportunities including: Mentoring programs, Skills Development, Leadership Development, Rotational job assignments, and Continuous Improvement, all of which contribute to advancement of our employee’s capabilities.



Paid Time Off
Accrue paid time off monthly. Receive 10-12 holidays per year with some locations shutting down the week between Christmas and New Year’s Day.



Relocation Assistance
Select technical positions are eligible for relocation packages. See specific job description for eligibility requirements.



Parental Leave
Raytheon offers all eligible employees up to three weeks paid parental leave for the birth or adoption of a child (separate from paid maternity leave or Family & Medical Leave Act).

            Associate Technical Account Manager



         Login to apply
    
















Associate Technical Account Manager
Long Island, NY 


Associate Technical Account Managers at Yardi will provide consultative, implementation and technical support to a group of assigned Yardi clients in order to manage business operations and financial accounting functions in Yardi’s Voyager software.
Responsibilities

Implements the Yardi suite of software products by assisting clients with system implementation, training, and technical support
Researches, analyzes and resolves software issues
Supports software product customization based on client requirements
Performs data mapping and conversions
Performs system and business process reviews and other service reviews and makes recommendations on best practices
Works on a regular basis with Yardi internal resource teams to include: training, conversion, sales and development

Requirements

Bachelor’s degree in Economics, Business, Math, Statistics or Information Management preferred
Experience setting and managing client expectations
Superior verbal and written communication skills
Project Management, Accounting, or Property Management experience/background
Solid Proficiency in MS Office Suite and Outlook
Knowledge in three of the following areas: Property Management, Accounting, Microsoft Windows, Technical Support, SQL, HTML/ASP
Prior experience with property management software or real estate software highly desirable
Prior experience with Yardi software highly desirable
Regular attendance and a regular work schedule is an essential function of this job

                                                                                              *bd

By continuing to browse this site you agree to our use of cookies. You can find out more about which cookies we are using or switch them off in settings.
 

 
Accept

 


















 

 Privacy Overview


 Strictly Necessary Cookies


 3rd Party Cookies




 








Privacy Overview

This website uses cookies so that we can provide you with the best user experience possible. Cookie information is stored in your browser and performs functions such as recognising you when you return to our website and helping our team to understand which sections of the website you find most interesting and useful.
You can adjust all of your cookie settings by navigating the tabs on the left hand side.



 
Strictly Necessary Cookies

Strictly necessary cookies must be enabled at all times in order to login and apply to openings.



disable









If you disable this cookie, we will not be able to save your preferences and you will not be able to login to apply for openings. This means that every time you visit this website you will need to enable or disable cookies again.







3rd Party Cookies

This website uses Google Analytics to collect anonymous information such as the number of visitors to the site, and the most popular pages.
Keeping this cookie enabled helps us to improve our website.



disable









Please enable Strictly Necessary Cookies first so that we can save your preferences!












Enable All
Save Changes

            Quality Assurance Specialist



         Login to apply
    
















Quality Assurance Specialist
Irving, TX 


The Quality Assurance Specialist will be responsible for reviewing software requirements, creating test cases and ensuring functionality.
Responsibilities

Reviewing builds and loads in testing and validation software
Running comparisons reports to ensure the quality of the software
Collaborating with the documentation team regarding changes and ensuring that text is accurate
Participating in overall discussion plans for products to understand the overall intent and business purpose of the software
Functioning as a Subject Matter Expert (SME) on Yardi software
Executing a test plans, reviewing software and providing final sign off

 
Requirements

Bachelor’s degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science or other related degree
Previous experience performing software testing
Knowledge of Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC)
Strong analytical and critical thinking skills
Ability to troubleshoot and resolve issues
Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to work in a collaborative environment
Experience with MS SQL or Oracle highly desirable
Regular attendance and a regular work schedule are essential functions of this job

Digital Electrical Engineer






























Skip to content






English
                                                










Sonos






Login





Menu

Login







Returning Candidate?
Log back in!







                      Apply for this job online


Share it:








































Digital Electrical Engineer

Department:
              Hardware
            
Location:
              Santa Barbara
            

Req#:
              5586
            

Our small team of electrical engineers create ground-up designs to drive the greatest wireless speakers in the world. We’re looking to grow our team to explore new technologies and new circuit designs. In our Boston and Santa Barbara offices we have fully stocked electronics labs, state-of-the-art anechoic chambers, isolated radio screening rooms, comfy listening rooms… and a passion for making great audio products! If you have the same passion for digital electronic design, you belong with us. We require a solid understanding of CPU design with an emphasis on high speed peripherals. You’ll be partnering with other digital, analog, and radio electrical engineers to create low noise circuit solutions. Those solutions will be combined with award winning mechanical and acoustic designs to fill homes with music throughout the world! Key Characteristics:Energetic, passionate, and thoroughAbility to use simulation/analysis tools and engineering judgment to close issuesStrong sense of ownership, able to execute on designs as well as explain design decisions to others Excellent time managementReady to join a team, continue learning, and contribute to our success




About You


More than a candidate that checks every box, we’re looking for people who are excited to work, learn, and grow at Sonos—no matter their background or how they identify. If that’s you, we hope you’ll apply for this role.
You want to be part of a team.
You come with new ideas and a unique point of view. You look forward to collaborating with a diverse team of individuals. You assume everyone’s best intentions, welcome a healthy debate, and embrace differing opinions. You eagerly seek and give help. Transparency tops your list of values, and you proactively contribute to a culture of respect and inclusion.
You enjoy a challenge.
Inquisitive and focused, you see every challenge as an opportunity. You’re ambitious and comfortable making mistakes because you learn from them and bounce back quickly. You would rather create the future than wait for it. You prioritize long-term value over short-term objectives.
You love to listen.
You approach every interaction with curiosity and a desire to understand. You want to make a positive impact in the world. You’re passionate about culture and know the power that music, film, podcasts, games, and stories have to bring people together.


What You’ll Do 

ResponsibilitiesParticipate in the development of ground breaking world class audio productsDesign CPU subsystems and other digital circuits Capture ORCAD schematics and guide PCB designers on optimum circuit layoutMeasure and test new designs; debug and improve those designs as necessaryPerform circuit simulation and electronic tests for signal integrity and impedance matchingWork cooperatively across disciplines in a fast-paced environmentEnhance the excellence of Sonos products through research and prototyping of new technologies

Skills You’ll Need

Basic QualificationsBS or MS degree in Electrical Engineering with a concentration in high speed digital designSolid understanding of the following digital designs: CPU, PCIe, SDIO, DDR, NAND Flash, USB, Ethernet, I2S, I2C,..Good knowledge of high performance ADC and DACBasic knowledge of switching regulatorsLab experience on independent and team design projectsExperience with circuit simulation softwareFamiliarity with oscilloscopes, logic analyzers and other electronic lab equipmentMust have excellent written and verbal communication skills 

More About Sonos


Sonos is a sound experience company. We pioneered multiroom wireless audio, made it sound amazing, and changed the way people listen, making it effortless for them to enjoy what they want, where they want, how they want.
Today we continue empowering listeners by developing new technologies, thoughtfully designing products, expanding our software platform, and crafting brilliant sound experiences while participating in a culture that values respect, transparency, collaboration, and ownership.
Together we’re working to positively impact the world and inspire everyone to listen better—because listening brings people together, builds understanding, drives change, and makes us happier.
Notice to European Job Applicants: Information you submit as a part of your job application will be used in accordance with Sonos EU Job Applicant Privacy Notice.
Notice to U.S. Job Applicants: Sonos is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other legally protected characteristics.
Follow the links to review the EEO is the Law poster and its supplement. The pay transparency policy is available here. Sonos is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities. If you need a reasonable accommodation because of a disability for any part of the employment process, please send an e-mail to accommodations@sonos.com and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information.

The Leader in IP Communication Technologies




Careers
D2 Technologies is seeking exceptional individuals to join our team to develop software that powers market leading devices for IP communications applications and markets.  











Home/
Products/mCuevPortvOpen LibraryReference Platforms
News/What's NewPress ReleasesPress CoveragePress KitEvents
Contact/





































 D2 Technologies is seeking exceptional individuals to join our team to develop software that powers market leading devices for IP communications applications and markets.  We are a privately owned company, headquartered in Santa Barbara, CA, USA. First established in 1993, D2 is known worldwide as a market and technology leader in VoIP software.Our benefits are designed to retain quality employees, including competitive salaries, 401K, paid leave, stock options, and health/dental insurance.  All positions are full-time and permanent, salary DOE. Email resume to jobs@d2tech



Field Applications EngineerLocation: Santa Barbara, CAEmployee Type: full-time, permanentManages Others: noRequired Travel: 20%Primary Responsibilities:Attend interop eventsRun tests, Analyze Results, Work with D2 Engineering to make patches and retestCustomer Technical Engagement (Pre-Sales Support)Building/installing/verification/customer support of demos and evalsTradeshow attendance, staffing and demo setupCustomer Technical Champion (Post-Sales Support)Primary contact for post-sales technical customer supportSupport escalation FAE to Engineering; monitor and facilitate even after escalationTroubleshooting and problem solvingWork closely with customer engineering to identify new customer requirementsQualifications / Experience:MS CS/CE/EE/ or BS CS/CE/EE with 2-5 years of cumulative experiencePrevious experience in software development and/or customer facing applications engineeringProgramming skills in Java and CVoIP/Video over IP experience Android Software EngineerLocation: Santa BarbaraEmployee Type: full-time, permanentManages Others: noRequired Travel: 10%Primary Responsibilities:Design and develop software for next generation (4G) communication applications on mobile devices.Develop for Android and embedded Linux via Java, C, C++Qualifications / Experience:MS CS/CE/EE/ or BS CS/CE/EEEntry level through 5 years of software development experience considered.Excellent programming skills in Java & C. Experience in C++ is a plus.Android development experience preferred.Working knowledge of Android Services, Activities and Content Providers a big plus!Ideal Candidate:The ideal candidate would have experience and/or knowledge of:IP Stack technology e.g. UDP, TCP, NAT, and IPSec.RTP, SIP, SDP, and XMPP protocols.Developing for ARM, x86, and MIPS processors. Embedded Software EngineerLocation: Santa Barbara, CAEmployee Type: full-time, permanentManages Others: noRequired Travel: 10%Primary Responsibilities:Design, develop, integrate, test, and debug software for new embedded communications products.Work with real time voice systems in embedded software environments.Qualifications / Experience:BS or MS degree in CS or EEExcellent C programming skillsExcellent embedded firmware and software debugging skillsFamiliar with IP, UDP, TCP, RTP, SIP, SDP, and XMPPFamiliar with ARM and MIPS processorsFamiliar with development on Linux operating systemEntry level through 5 years of experience in embedded systems developmentPossess strong written and verbal communication skills

If you’re ready to take on a fresh challenge, grow your career and contribute to making the world a safer place, Raytheon is ready to help you achieve your goals. Join our team and get the opportunity and support to find purpose, thrive and succeed.





Notice: Please be aware of suspicious recruiting emails and text messages that attempt to collect your confidential information. Raytheon conducts all electronic correspondence using e-mail addresses that end in “Raytheon.com”, “Raytheon.co.uk”, “Raytheon.com.au” or “brassring.com”. To report fraud please go to: https://www.ic3.gov.











Principal Systems Engineer – Simulators
Aurora, Colorado


Apply





Overview
Responsibilities
Success Profile
Rewards
Trending




Overview

What does it take to make the world a safer place? It takes delivering innovative technology and collaborating with some of the finest talent in the engineering field. Whether you’re a software engineer or a field engineer, at Raytheon you’ll grow a varied and rewarding career. And you’ll be supported with a comprehensive and competitive benefits package that promotes work/life. If you’re ready to take on today’s big challenges, discover a world of opportunity at Raytheon.

America’s Best Large Employers by Forbes
Career & Development Opportunities
Full-time
Entry, Mid, Senior level




Back to Job Navigation (Overview)


Responsibilities


Raytheon Intelligence, Information and Services is looking for Principal Systems Engineer - Simulators to join our Advanced Mission Solutions program team in Aurora, Colorado. Would you like to work in a collaborative environment at a state of the art facility in Colorado? Then join our Raytheon team of engineers solving problems that make the world a safer place and help to secure our great nation! Come support those who provide us with all the freedoms we enjoy.Our facility in Aurora, CO offers amenities that create work and life balance. On site we have a 24/7 fitness facility, health center, cafeteria, collaboration rooms and dynamic break areas for easy conversation and socialization. Additionally, employee appreciation lunches, bonus opportunities, and great benefits that include medical, dental, vision, 401K match, flexible work schedule - just to name a few.  Click here to view a brief video and learn more: https://youtu.be/YNuZN0vyzHgThe Principal Systems Engineer – Simulators will be a senior team member of a dynamic and multidiscipline development team within the Advanced Mission Solutions (AMS) program area.  Responsibilities will span the development life cycle to include development, qualification testing, fielding and customer support. The Principal Systems Engineer will be the technical expert on the software and hardware-based simulators working with our teammates to develop, manufacture and deploy these products. Tasks include development and maintenance of requirements, maintaining architectural models, chairing technical exchanges and working with teammates to resolve technical issues. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in systems engineering, the development of simulators and experience on multi-contractor teams.This position is eligible for a Sign on Bonus up to 40k for a candidate with a current TS/SCI and that can be verified and hired at Raytheon. Security Clearance: Must be a US Citizen and have an active TS/SCI or DoD TS clearanceRequired Skills:US Citizen with current/existing TS/SCI  or DoD TS security clearanceMinimum 8+ years of related systems engineering work experienceExperience with spacecraft command and controlExperience with DOORSExperience with Microsoft Office suite (e.g. Project, PowerPoint, Excel and Word)Experience establishing and maintaining good working relationships with all levels of the organization, including Government customer, program leadership, and support organizationsGood understanding of software and hardware development processes and their application to programsHigh level of integrity and strong work ethicStrong interpersonal skills and ability to work within a teamExcellent written and verbal communication skillsMust be willing and able to travel, as requiredDesired Skills:Experience with Sparx Enterprise ArchitectFamiliar with simulator development, integration and testFamiliar with digital signal processingExperience with agile design, development, and testing processesRequired Education (including Major):Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering, Science, or Mathematics (STEM).  Advance degree desirableIISBonus#cleared 147891
Business Unit Profile
                        
                        Raytheon Intelligence, Information and Services delivers innovative technology to make the world a safer place. Our expertise in cyber, analytics and automation allow us to reach beyond what others think is possible to underpin national security and give our global customers unique solutions to solve the most pressing modern challenges -- from the cyber domain to automated operations, and from intelligent transportation solutions to creating clear insight from large volumes of data. IIS operates at nearly 550 sites in 80 countries, and is headquartered in Dulles, Virginia. The business area generated $6.1 billion in 2017 revenues. As a global business, our leaders must have the ability to understand, embrace and operate in a multicultural world -- in the marketplace and the workplace. We strive to hire people who reflect our communities and embrace diversity and inclusion to advance our culture, develop our employees, and grow our business.
Relocation Eligible 
                        
                        Yes
Clearance Type 
                        
                        TS/SCI - Current
Expertise 
                        

                                
                            Aerospace/Aeronautical EngineeringAlgorithmsArtificial IntelligenceAtmospheric/Space ScienceComputer EngineeringComputer ScienceData ScienceEngineering TechnologyGeneral EngineeringHardware EngineeringMathematicsResearch & DevelopmentSoftware EngineeringSystems EngineeringTechnicalTest Engineering

Raytheon is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, age, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected Veteran status.

Success Profile
What does it take to be successful at Raytheon? Check out these traits to see if you have the right mix.

Back to Job Navigation (Success)


Quote



I joined Raytheon in 2016 and I’m proud to work here. My company makes some pretty amazing things, including missile defense, using data to predict the weather, and securing our GPS system. My company also works with artificial intelligence, machine learning and other innovative solutions. I’m proud to work for an organization that allows me the flexibility to be a STEM volunteer and help inspire our future generation.









Rewards




401(k) / Retirement Plans
Employer Matching, if you elect to enroll company matches up to 3%.



Work / Life Balance
Raytheon supports a variety of flexible work arrangements including compressed work weeks, flextime, job sharing, 9/80, reduced hours and telecommuting.



Career Development
At Raytheon, we foster an inclusive culture of professional development. We support a variety of developmental opportunities including: Mentoring programs, Skills Development, Leadership Development, Rotational job assignments, and Continuous Improvement, all of which contribute to advancement of our employee’s capabilities.



Paid Time Off
Accrue paid time off monthly. Receive 10-12 holidays per year with some locations shutting down the week between Christmas and New Year’s Day.



Relocation Assistance
Select technical positions are eligible for relocation packages. See specific job description for eligibility requirements.



Parental Leave
Raytheon offers all eligible employees up to three weeks paid parental leave for the birth or adoption of a child (separate from paid maternity leave or Family & Medical Leave Act).



Sign-On Bonus
Qualified cleared engineers can receive an up to $40K sign-on bonus when they join our Engineering Team!



Student Loan Repayment Contribution
Through the 401(k), called the Raytheon Savings and Investment Plan, the company will make a dollar for dollar contribution for amounts employees spend repaying their student loans, up to their maximum match percentage.

If you’re ready to take on a fresh challenge, grow your career and contribute to making the world a safer place, Raytheon is ready to help you achieve your goals. Join our team and get the opportunity and support to find purpose, thrive and succeed.





Notice: Please be aware of suspicious recruiting emails and text messages that attempt to collect your confidential information. Raytheon conducts all electronic correspondence using e-mail addresses that end in “Raytheon.com”, “Raytheon.co.uk”, “Raytheon.com.au” or “brassring.com”. To report fraud please go to: https://www.ic3.gov.











Sr Systems Engineer II
Colorado Springs, Colorado


Apply





Overview
Responsibilities
Success Profile
Rewards
Trending




Overview

What does it take to make the world a safer place? It takes delivering innovative technology and collaborating with some of the finest talent in the engineering field. Whether you’re a software engineer or a mechanical engineer, at Raytheon you’ll grow a varied and rewarding career. And you’ll be supported with a comprehensive and competitive benefits package that promotes work/life. If you’re ready to take on today’s big challenges, discover a world of opportunity at Raytheon.

America’s Best Large Employers by Forbes
Career & Development Opportunities
Full-time
Entry, Mid, Senior level




Back to Job Navigation (Overview)


Responsibilities


Would you like to work in a collaborative environment at an amazing company located in Colorado Springs, CO? Then join our Raytheon team of smart people solving problems that make the world a safer place and help to secure our great nation!  Come support those who provide us with all the freedoms we enjoy. Our company offers amenities that create work and life balance.   Enjoy employee appreciation lunches, bonus opportunities, and great benefits that include medical, dental, vision, 401K match, and flexible work schedules.  These are just a few of the reasons people come to work at Raytheon! Raytheon is a technology and innovation leader specializing in defense, security and civil markets throughout the world.  Our latest company video is about our people, our technology, our vision, and the values we hold dear at Raytheon.  Click here to view: https://youtu.be/qvbCgKpkEdsRaytheon Intelligence, Information and Services (IIS) is currently seeking a Sr Systems Engineer II in support of the North American Aerospace Defense Command (NORAD) Integrated Space Support Contract (NISSC) program. NISSC provides accurate, timely and unambiguous warning and attack assessment of Air, Missile and Space threats with daily visibility of National Command Authority leaders. This position involves working in a team environment supporting all phases of Systems Engineering development including concept development, requirements, functional analysis, design reviews, implementation, test, verification and validation. The Sr Systems Engineer II leverages multiple skill sets in areas such as Missile Defense, Radar and RF applications, embedded computing and networking.Clearance Requirements:US Citizen with the ability to obtain a Secret Level security clearanceResponsibilities and scope include:Perform systems engineering activities which may include CONOPs development, requirements development and management, systems architecture, system design, interface definition and control, integration and test to include test planning and procedure development in support of assigned programsWork with customers and represent the engineering technical viewpoint Develop, maintain and ensure compliance for system and subsystem requirementsProvide support and guidance to a cross-functional team throughout the lifecycle of a development programPrepare for and support both internal and customer design reviewsCommunicate effectively with the cross-functional engineering team Perform responsibilities independently with limited supervisionRequired Skills:Experience in systems, software or hardware engineering, providing demonstrable technical expertise & value to programs, commensurate with current grade and roleExcellent written and oral communication skillsExperience operating within an organization governed by company policies & proceduresExperience on teams who design, develop, integrate, and field systemsExperience supporting the development of technical baselines (requirements/architecture) and Engineering Change RequestsExperience applying technical standards, principles, theories, concepts and techniques to solve problemsExperience performing technical Analysis of Alternatives (AoA) and/or Trade Studies, performing Risk and opportunity analyses, and tracking and mitigating risksDesired Skills: Familiarity with the existing Integrated Tactical Warning/Attack Assessment (ITW/AA) aerospace defense Systems, and their policies and proceduresExperience in development, integration, and test of large scale complex Mainframe systemsExperience with the current NCMC-ITW/AA Legacy Space maintained systems that includes CMP, DECON, SDS, and SPADOCExperience with program metrics: development, financial, performanceExperience in capture management: creating/reviewing RFPs, SOWs, BOEs, tech volumes, proposalsExperience ensuring program progress via formal risk & opportunity managementExperience using DOORS, Rhapsody, MagicDraw, or other requirements management and system architecture toolsExperience mentoring engineers of all grade levelsFamiliarity with Raytheon company policies & proceduresActive Secret clearanceEducation Requirements: 6 years with BS/BA in Engineering, Science, Technology, Mathematics or related STEM degree; or 4 years with MS/MA in Engineering, Science, Technology or Mathematics or related  STEM degree. 150675
Business Unit Profile
Raytheon Intelligence, Information and Services delivers innovative technology to make the world a safer place. Our expertise in cyber, analytics and automation allow us to reach beyond what others think is possible to underpin national security and give our global customers unique solutions to solve the most pressing modern challenges -- from the cyber domain to automated operations, and from intelligent transportation and training solutions to creating clear insight from large volumes of data. IIS operates at nearly 550 sites in 80 countries, and is headquartered in Dulles, Virginia. The business area generated $6.2 billion in 2018 revenues. As a global business, our leaders must have the ability to understand, embrace and operate in a multicultural world -- in the marketplace and the workplace. We strive to hire people who reflect our communities and embrace diversity and inclusion to advance our culture, develop our employees, and grow our business.
Relocation Eligible 
                        
                        No

Raytheon is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, age, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected Veteran status.

Back to Job Navigation (Success)


Quote



Felicia Jackson is regional vice president of RAYVETS, Raytheon's employee group for veterans and those who support them. After 24 years in the Air Force, she started a new career at Raytheon. "I wanted to go where people would support me," she told us.









Rewards




401(k) / Retirement Plans
Employer Matching, if you elect to enroll company matches up to 3%.



Work / Life Balance
Raytheon supports a variety of flexible work arrangements including compressed work weeks, flextime, job sharing, 9/80, reduced hours and telecommuting.



Career Development
At Raytheon, we foster an inclusive culture of professional development. We support a variety of developmental opportunities including: Mentoring programs, Skills Development, Leadership Development, Rotational job assignments, and Continuous Improvement, all of which contribute to advancement of our employee’s capabilities.



Paid Time Off
Accrue paid time off monthly. Receive 10-12 holidays per year with some locations shutting down the week between Christmas and New Year’s Day.



Relocation Assistance
Select technical positions are eligible for relocation packages. See specific job description for eligibility requirements.



Parental Leave
Raytheon offers all eligible employees up to three weeks paid parental leave for the birth or adoption of a child (separate from paid maternity leave or Family & Medical Leave Act).

            Senior Account Executive



         Login to apply
    
















Senior Account Executive
Long Island, NY 


The Senior Account Executive, Commercial will be responsible for developing and cultivating a regional territory and selling Yardi’s products and services to prospects and existing clients within the residential real estate property management industry.  This is an outside sales position requiring software sales experience in the commercial real estate space.
The Senior Account Executive, Commercial will be responsible for the following duties and responsibilities:

Managing and cultivating relationships with prospects and existing clients at the senior level to support continued sales growth
Heavy prospecting and identifying new sales opportunities for a designated territory
Becoming familiar with all product solutions, the competitive climate, and promoting company products
Conducting online and onsite presentations to demonstrate Yardi’s product offerings
Developing and executing outbound call  and email campaigns
Participating and networking at industry events and tradeshows
Meeting or exceeding monthly, quarterly and annual revenue goals
Maintaining accurate account information and forecasting details through a CRM system
Establishing a strong sales pipeline, sales forecasts and updating accounts to support revenue growth
Identifying client needs by introducing and up-selling Yardi ancillary tools/products to potentially increase client revenue opportunities.
Assisting with the development and implementation of marketing materials and programs
Participating in regular sales meetings to report on the status of all opportunities in the sales pipeline and new acquisitions to the pipeline

 
**This position will require up to 50% travel**
This position will require the following background and experience:

Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience
3+years of successful sales experience managing and developing a sales territory
Solid knowledge base in sales and ability to apply basic sales principles (i.e. lead generation, opportunity qualification, proposal development, account management and closure)
Ability to effectively execute sales strategies using a consultative approach and relationship building techniques
Ability to interface with all levels within the client organization to include individual properties, large portfolios and other senior leadership in large to mid-sized companies
Strong ,engaging presentation skills and ability to demonstrate product value
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Ability to internally motivate, work interdependently, and also work effectively with a team
Ability to develop and maintain solid client relationships
Ability to understand and demonstrate technical products
Prior experience entering data into a CRM system to support up to date client contact and information
Proven track record of achieving or exceeding sales goals
Prior background in software sales, property management or accounting systems desirable

 
*cl 



         Login to apply

Corporate Website
Privacy Statement
Legal











By continuing to browse this site you agree to our use of cookies. You can find out more about which cookies we are using or switch them off in settings.
 

 
Accept

 


















 

 Privacy Overview


 Strictly Necessary Cookies


 3rd Party Cookies




 








Privacy Overview

This website uses cookies so that we can provide you with the best user experience possible. Cookie information is stored in your browser and performs functions such as recognising you when you return to our website and helping our team to understand which sections of the website you find most interesting and useful.
You can adjust all of your cookie settings by navigating the tabs on the left hand side.



 
Strictly Necessary Cookies

Strictly necessary cookies must be enabled at all times in order to login and apply to openings.



disable









If you disable this cookie, we will not be able to save your preferences and you will not be able to login to apply for openings. This means that every time you visit this website you will need to enable or disable cookies again.







3rd Party Cookies

This website uses Google Analytics to collect anonymous information such as the number of visitors to the site, and the most popular pages.
Keeping this cookie enabled helps us to improve our website.



disable









Please enable Strictly Necessary Cookies first so that we can save your preferences!












Enable All
Save Changes

            Clinical Specialist



         Login to apply
    
















Clinical Specialist
Boise, ID 


Under minimal direction, the Clinical Specialist provides pre-sale and software implementation support for Yardi EHR clients.  The Clinical Specialist works directly with Yardi clients, prospective clients, and Yardi staff via phone/web meetings, onsite visits, and industry conferences and facilitates training presentations.
ESSENTIAL RESPONSIBILITIES

Provides pre-sales support by leading detailed Yardi EHR software demos and participating in discussions with clinical staff at prospective clients.
Provides implementation support by assisting with clinical business analysis (such as translating clinical business practices into Yardi EHR software configuration), providing software best practices recommendations, and establishing relationships with key clinical staff at clients.
Provides ongoing account management support by assisting Yardi account managers and support staff with complex clinical support issues.
Assists with software development process by sharing clinical insight with development staff, providing specs, and participating in QA process.
Helps keep software in clinical compliance by staying informed about regulatory changes as well as trends in industry clinical best practices.
Analyzes complex data and presents to clients their outstanding issues list.
Acts as liaison between departments to develop complex software programs for EHR clients.
Leads projects to enhance EHR software development as well as documents and communicates changes to other team members.
Assists in preparing training manuals for the department.
Prepares and delivers training materials to internal Yardi teams and external clients as needed.

EDUCATION/QUALIFICATIONS/EXPERIENCE

Bachelor’s or Associate’s degree in Nursing or related or equivalent experience
Two (2) years minimum of training or software experience preferably with electronic health records or medication management systems, and/or nurses or experience with resident care in the senior living (or similar health care) industry

REQUIRED SKILLS/ABILITIES

Ability to travel up to 50% required
Ability and interest in learning new software tools
Excellent multi-tasking, organizational and analytical skills
Demonstrated ability to articulate issues and resolutions
Strong attention to detail, follow-through and excellent organization skills
Strong customer service orientation and ability to work as a member of a team
Strong sense of urgency, adaptability, flexibility and resourcefulness
Ability to exercise independent judgment and come up with creative solutions/processes
Proven ability to work in a fast paced, dynamic environment
Ability to appropriately handle confidential and sensitive information
Proficient in diplomacy skills, and tact
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Solid grammar, spelling and composition skills
Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite
Ability to work at assigned office location
Ability to travel up to 50% and facilitate meetings and presentations
Attends meetings and perform tasks for long periods of time on a computer and on the telephone

DESIRED SKILLS/ABILITIES 

Familiarity with Yardi applications
Experience with resident care in the senior living experience

*lm 



         Login to apply

 3rd Party Cookies




 








Privacy Overview

This website uses cookies so that we can provide you with the best user experience possible. Cookie information is stored in your browser and performs functions such as recognising you when you return to our website and helping our team to understand which sections of the website you find most interesting and useful.
You can adjust all of your cookie settings by navigating the tabs on the left hand side.



 
Strictly Necessary Cookies

Strictly necessary cookies must be enabled at all times in order to login and apply to openings.



disable









If you disable this cookie, we will not be able to save your preferences and you will not be able to login to apply for openings. This means that every time you visit this website you will need to enable or disable cookies again.







3rd Party Cookies

This website uses Google Analytics to collect anonymous information such as the number of visitors to the site, and the most popular pages.
Keeping this cookie enabled helps us to improve our website.

Please enable Strictly Necessary Cookies first so that we can save your preferences!

DevOps Build Automation Engineer
Dulles, Virginia


Apply





Overview
Responsibilities
Success Profile
Rewards
Trending




Overview

What does it take to make the world a safer place? It takes delivering innovative technology and collaborating with some of the finest talent in the engineering field. Whether you’re a software engineer or a mechanical engineer, at Raytheon you’ll grow a varied and rewarding career. And you’ll be supported with a comprehensive and competitive benefits package that promotes work/life. If you’re ready to take on today’s big challenges, discover a world of opportunity at Raytheon.

America’s Best Large Employers by Forbes
Career & Development Opportunities
Full-time
Entry, Mid, Senior level




Back to Job Navigation (Overview)


Responsibilities


Are you looking for an engineering career that is challenging and satisfying? Then join our Raytheon team of engineers solving problems that make the world a safer place and help to secure our great nation! Come support those who provide us with all the freedoms we enjoy.We offer great benefits that include medical, dental, vision, 401K match, flexible work schedule - just to name a few.  Click here to view a brief video and learn more: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qvbCgKpkEdsRaytheon Intelligence, Information and Services (IIS) delivers innovative technology to make the world a safer place. Our expertise in cyber, analytics and automation allow us to reach beyond what others think is possible to underpin national security and give our global customers unique solutions to solve the most pressing modern challenges -- from the cyber domain to automated operations, and from intelligent transportation solutions to creating clear insight from large volumes of data. IIS operates at nearly 550 sites in 80 countries, including a large presence in Dulles, VA. As a global business, our leaders must have the ability to understand, embrace and operate in a multicultural world -- in the marketplace and the workplace. We strive to hire people who reflect our communities and embrace diversity and inclusion to advance our culture, develop our employees, and grow our business.Job Description:The Raytheon IIS Hardware and Infrastructure Engineering (HW&I) team has a professional opening for a DevOps Build Automation Engineer.  This role will be responsible for development and implementation of automated infrastructure service builds for various development and operational compute environments.  The qualified candidate will champion our Infrastructure as Code (IaC) tools and process to provide the capability to rapidly deploy and configure cloud resources in repeatable fashion.  The ability to obtain a US Government Secret security clearance is required for this position (US citizenship required). Candidates with a current TS/SCI security clearance or higher are eligible for a $20,000 sign on bonus if the clearance is confirmed and the candidate is hired by RaytheonRequired Skills:Experience installing, configuring, and administrating Linux systemsExperience with scripting languages such as Python, Go or bashExperience with deployment/configuration management tools (e.g. Ansible, Puppet, Chef)Experience with AWS or Azure or Oracle Cloud or equivalent technologies (e.g. EC2, EBS, RDS, Elasticache, Kinesis)Experience with different service models (e.g. IaaS, PaaS, SaaS) hosted in cloud environmentsAbility to obtain and maintain a US Government Secret security clearanceDesired Skills:Experience with DevOps CI/CD software release tools (e.g. Jenkins, Travis, gitlab)Experience with container technology and microservices (Docker, Kubernetes or Istio)Existing US Government Secret security clearanceEducation: Requires a degree in Science, Technology, Engineering or Mathematics (STEM) and 4 years of related work experience. 148438
Business Unit Profile
                        
                        Raytheon Intelligence, Information and Services delivers innovative technology to make the world a safer place. Our expertise in cyber, analytics and automation allow us to reach beyond what others think is possible to underpin national security and give our global customers unique solutions to solve the most pressing modern challenges -- from the cyber domain to automated operations, and from intelligent transportation and training solutions to creating clear insight from large volumes of data. IIS operates at nearly 550 sites in 80 countries, and is headquartered in Dulles, Virginia. The business area generated $6.2 billion in 2018 revenues. As a global business, our leaders must have the ability to understand, embrace and operate in a multicultural world -- in the marketplace and the workplace. We strive to hire people who reflect our communities and embrace diversity and inclusion to advance our culture, develop our employees, and grow our business.

Rewards




401(k) / Retirement Plans
Employer Matching, if you elect to enroll company matches up to 3%.



Work / Life Balance
Raytheon supports a variety of flexible work arrangements including compressed work weeks, flextime, job sharing, 9/80, reduced hours and telecommuting.



Career Development
At Raytheon, we foster an inclusive culture of professional development. We support a variety of developmental opportunities including: Mentoring programs, Skills Development, Leadership Development, Rotational job assignments, and Continuous Improvement, all of which contribute to advancement of our employee’s capabilities.



Paid Time Off
Accrue paid time off monthly. Receive 10-12 holidays per year with some locations shutting down the week between Christmas and New Year’s Day.



Relocation Assistance
Select technical positions are eligible for relocation packages. See specific job description for eligibility requirements.



Parental Leave
Raytheon offers all eligible employees up to three weeks paid parental leave for the birth or adoption of a child (separate from paid maternity leave or Family & Medical Leave Act).

Overview

Raytheon delivers innovative technology to make the world a safer place. Our expertise in cyber, analytics and automation allow us to reach beyond what others think is possible to underpin national security and give our global customers unique solutions to solve the most pressing modern challenges -- from the cyber domain to automated operations, and from intelligent transportation solutions to creating clear insight from large volumes of data. Our leaders must have the ability to understand, embrace and operate in a multicultural world -- in the marketplace and the workplace. We strive to hire people who reflect our communities and embrace diversity and inclusion to advance our culture, develop our employees, and grow our business.

Full-time
Entry to Senior level

Work / Life Balance
Raytheon appreciates work/life balance. Employees can work 9 hours a day every week and received every other Friday off, as long as departmental/manager approval is obtained. Accrued paid time off monthly and paid holiday time.



Career Development
At Raytheon, we foster an inclusive culture of professional development.
