Back to Job Navigation (Rewards)



Responsibilities


Are you looking for an engineering career that is challenging and satisfying? Then join our Raytheon team of engineers solving problems that make the world a safer place and help to secure our great nation! Come support those who provide us with all the freedoms we enjoy.We offer great benefits that include medical, dental, vision, 401K match, flexible work schedule - just to name a few.  Click here to view a brief video and learn more: https://youtu.be/YNuZN0vyzHgRaytheon is looking for a talented Human Factors Engineer to join our Specialty Engineering team.  Specialty Engineering is part of Systems Engineering that complements the technical activities required to deliver a project. It deals with engineering that influence the systems’ design and architecture in terms of performance, safety, usability, reliability, maintainability, availability, supportability, testability, and cost consideration throughout the lifecycle of the product. Specialty Engineering applies methods, standards, and techniques to provide clarification of system requirements to software, hardware, and test personnel to ensure design and architecture considerations are appropriately allocated to the system and horizontally integrated across the development teams. The Specialty Engineering function supports systems engineering activities including trade studies, use case development, requirements definition and derivation, interface definition, and requirement validation and verification. As such, all Specialty Engineers interface with the other Specialty disciplines and logistics engineering functions to ensure integration and continuity in the design and development process.Must be a U.S. Citizen with the ability to obtain and maintain a DoD Top Secret Security ClearanceThe Specialty Team is looking for candidates with experience in this Specialty area:•  Human Factors Engineering/User Experience (UX)As a member of the Specialty Engineering Team, expect a dynamic and demanding environment that values discipline, adherence to processes, and adding value to our customers through our respective disciplines (Human Factors Engineering, System Safety, Reliability Engineering).This position is to support the preliminary and detailed design phases for programs within the Raytheon IIS portfolio that include the following businesses; Cyber and Special Missions (CSM), C2, Space and Intelligence (CSI), Navigation and Modernization Solutions (NMS) and Global Training Solutions (GTS). This position serves as a member of the Raytheon IIS Specialty Engineering Team and supports various programs within a matrix management assignment as directed. Deliverables include, but not limited to, program plans, technical reports, schedules, basis of estimates for new pursuits, and analyses as required to substantiate architectural/design decisions and trade studies.Required Skills: Experience with  Human Factors Engineering practices as derived from MIL-STD-46855APractical understanding and application ofMIL-STD-1472MIL-STD-1474ISO 9241-110/210Ability to produce DoD required documentation consistent with appropriate Data Item Description (DID), such as:HEPPHSIPPHEDAD-O/MHESARU.S. Citizen with the ability to obtain and maintain a DoD Top Secret Security ClearanceDesired Skills: Current DoD TS/SCI Security Clearance User Experience (UX) and User Interface Design and ability to apply standards and process requirementsMIL-STD-1472MIL-STD-2525JSSG-2010NASA-STD-3000FAA-STD-001MIL-STD-1787AFI 63-112Section 508 Interface AssessabilityUsability Testing (SUS/ScoreCard)Workstation/Facilities DesignAutoCADJack Human ModelingDoD Assessability CriteriaMIL-STD-516 Air Worthiness CriteriaDO-178 Software considerations in Airborne Systems and Equipment CertificationHuman Systems IntegrationSAE 6906Human Performance Modeling/Workload AnalysisExpertise working with Satellite and/or unmanned ground stations, A/C avionics modernization, intelligence communities, FAA, other governmental agenciesEducation Requirements:Bachelor’s Degree in Science, Technology, Engineering, Mathematics, or related STEM degree with minimum of 6 years of relevant experienceMaster’s Degree / PHD in Science, Technology, Engineering, Mathematics, or related STEM degree with minimum of 6 years of relevant experienceThis position requires either a U.S. Person or a Non-U.S. Person who is eligible to obtain any required Export Authorization. 149762

Referral Development Manager  (99630) - Austin, TX - Inogen, Inc. Jobs








 














Home
Jobs




Referral Development Manager  (99630) - Austin, TX

Toggle navigation








Referral Development Manager  (99630) 

JobsLogin 












 RDM Sales Austin, TX, USA Full Time 



Email Me Similar Jobs Email Me This Job



ABOUT INOGEN Inogen was founded in 2001 to improve quality of life and increase freedom and independence for oxygen therapy users. Inogen is innovation in oxygen therapy. The Inogen mission is to improve freedom and independence for oxygen therapy patients through innovative products and services. Inogen is a manufacturer and Accredited Homecare Provider.
Inogen is focused on quality care, continuous improvement, and outstanding customer satisfaction. We are a stable, USA based company dedicated to providing an exciting and rewarding career to our employees. We completed a successful Initial Public Offering on the NASDAQ in 2014 and have demonstrated substantial growth over the last five years. Our work environment is casual yet high performing, and we are looking for seriously talented, motivated, and fast-paced professionals to join our team.
JOB DESCRIPTION 
The Referral Development Manager (RDM) calls on physicians and discharge planners, winning patient referrals for Inogen. Works to increase marketplace adoption of Inogen products, while exceeding customer expectations and providing a consistently high level of service. The RDM is an Inogen product and clinical applications expert and operates in close collaboration with other Referral Development Managers and the National Sales Director to achieve corporate sales objectives.
Key Competencies:
Procure new oxygen patient referrals to meet/exceed sales targets.
Represent/promote Inogen product and services to referral community.
Meet/exceed monthly sales call targets.
Deliver/set up equipment when necessary.
Keep detailed records of all sales activities and customer interactions.
Provide/execute territory sales plan, including strategic and tactical approaches that will result in successful outcomes.
Maintain regular and punctual attendance. 
Comply with all company policies and procedures. 
Assist with any other duties as assigned.
Do you possess these abilities?
Excellent presentation skills required.
Oxygen referral experience with proven track record required.
Must be a self-starter and deliver results with limited oversight.
Experience working with the 65+ demographic a plus.
Proven track record of successful team participation is required.
Successful experience in identifying new referral opportunities desired.
Must have strong work ethic.
Excellent oral and written communication skills required. 
Attention to detail is required. 
Effective conflict resolution. 
Analytical & problem-solving skills & ability to multi task. 
Solutions-oriented problem solver. 
Excellent planning, communication and organizational skills.
Requirements:
Associate degree in Sales, Technical, Business, Clinical, or related field of study, preferred. 
Clinical background/licensure (RT, RN), preferred.
2-3 years medical referral sales experience, required. 
Basic knowledge/proficiency in Microsoft Office, required.
A combination of training, education and experience that is equivalent to the qualifications listed above and that provides the required knowledge, skills, and abilities.
 
WHY INOGEN Inogen is a dynamic company that is not only focused on quality care of patients, but is also committed to being a top employer.  Each of Inogen' s offices have a casual culture that supports employees being responsible and developing professionals.
We offer competitive salaries and a robust benefit package:
Employee Stock Purchase Plan 401 (K) plan available for all employees Health, dental, vision insurance Flexible spending accounts and wellness discount program Life Insurance Long Term Disability Robust paid time off and 8 paid holidays Employee Assistance Program
See the Inogen Team in action:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dKoTMeJf5J4
 
Inogen Where we go to work hard to positively impact people's lives
 
Inogen is an equal opportunity employer.  We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other legally protected characteristics. The EEO is the Law poster and its supplement are available here: http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/ofccpost.htm; http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/OFCCP_EEO_Supplement_Final_JRF_QA_508c.pdf.  The pay transparency policy is available here: http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/pdf/EO13665_PrescribedNondiscriminationPostingLanguage_JRFQA508c.pdf. 
Inogen is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities.  If you need a reasonable accommodation because of a disability for any part of the employment process, please send an e-mail to recruiting@inogen.net or call (972) 616-5668 and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information.
 
 

Inogen, Inc.
https://inogen.applicantpro.com

If you’re ready to take on a fresh challenge, grow your career and contribute to making the world a safer place, Raytheon is ready to help you achieve your goals. Join our team and get the opportunity and support to find purpose, thrive and succeed.

Sr LAN/WAN Technologist II
Virginia Beach, Virginia


Apply





Overview
Responsibilities
Success Profile
Rewards
Trending




Overview

What does it take to make the world a safer place? It takes delivering innovative technology and collaborating with some of the finest talent in the engineering field. Whether you’re a software engineer or a mechanical engineer, at Raytheon you’ll grow a varied and rewarding career. And you’ll be supported with a comprehensive and competitive benefits package that promotes work/life. If you’re ready to take on today’s big challenges, discover a world of opportunity at Raytheon.

America’s Best Large Employers by Forbes
Career & Development Opportunities
Full-time
Entry, Mid, Senior level




Back to Job Navigation (Overview)


Responsibilities


Maintains smooth operation of voice and data networks. Plans, evaluates, coordinates and performs installation and reconfiguration of hardware and software elements of data and voice communications. Maintains technical expertise in network and computer hardware and software interconnection and interfacing, such as routers, firewalls, switches, etc. Provides regular monitoring and network analysis regarding short- and long-range planning. Develops, tests and implements solutions that support current and future needs. Prepares and maintains appropriate network documentation. Required  Knowledge / Skills: 6+ years of experience with configuring, installing and troubleshooting Cisco switches, routers including Cisco ASA 55xx series firewalls including IPS modules for ASA.Knowledge of TCP/IP networks to include IP addressing and subnetting and experience with DNS and DHCP.Strong knowledge of Virtual LANs and trunking protocol, ACLs, IPSec tunnels their implementation.Strong operation experience with configuring/troubleshooting routers, switches, firewalls and VPNsExperience with SolarWinds (Network Performance Manager, Network Configurations Manager and IP Address Manager).Demonstrated ability to work in collaborative environment on complex technical problems, analyzing, evaluating and recommending best practice methods and processesExcellent oral communication skills, including ability to explain complex IT concepts and practices in non-technical terms.Desired Skills: Organization and task management skills and experience.Experience with software defined networking technologies.Experience with configuring 802.11 wireless networks.Familiarity with complete system development life cycle from requirements gathering to design, testing, implementation and configuration management Direct customer service experienceExperience with Microsoft VisioRequired Education (including Major): B.S. / B.A. in Computer Science, Information Systems, Information Technology, Computer Information Systems. Experience and professional certification such as: Security+, CCNA (routing/switching), Security +, Network+ and DoD 8570.1 certifications may qualify in lieu of degreeIISVA092419 138446
Business Unit Profile
                        
                        Raytheon Intelligence, Information and Services delivers innovative technology to make the world a safer place. Our expertise in cyber, analytics and automation allow us to reach beyond what others think is possible to underpin national security and give our global customers unique solutions to solve the most pressing modern challenges -- from the cyber domain to automated operations, and from intelligent transportation solutions to creating clear insight from large volumes of data. IIS operates at nearly 550 sites in 80 countries, and is headquartered in Dulles, Virginia. The business area generated $6.1 billion in 2017 revenues. As a global business, our leaders must have the ability to understand, embrace and operate in a multicultural world -- in the marketplace and the workplace. We strive to hire people who reflect our communities and embrace diversity and inclusion to advance our culture, develop our employees, and grow our business.

Quote



Felicia Jackson is regional vice president of RAYVETS, Raytheon's employee group for veterans and those who support them. After 24 years in the Air Force, she started a new career at Raytheon. "I wanted to go where people would support me," she told us.









Rewards




401(k) / Retirement Plans
Employer Matching, if you elect to enroll company matches up to 3%.



Work / Life Balance
Raytheon supports a variety of flexible work arrangements including compressed work weeks, flextime, job sharing, 9/80, reduced hours and telecommuting.



Career Development
At Raytheon, we foster an inclusive culture of professional development. We support a variety of developmental opportunities including: Mentoring programs, Skills Development, Leadership Development, Rotational job assignments, and Continuous Improvement, all of which contribute to advancement of our employee’s capabilities.



Paid Time Off
Accrue paid time off monthly. Receive 10-12 holidays per year with some locations shutting down the week between Christmas and New Year’s Day.



Relocation Assistance
Select technical positions are eligible for relocation packages. See specific job description for eligibility requirements.



Parental Leave
Raytheon offers all eligible employees up to three weeks paid parental leave for the birth or adoption of a child (separate from paid maternity leave or Family & Medical Leave Act).

Software Engineer II - JAVA
Apply
Requisition ID 143444BR Date updated 07/01/2019
U.S. Citizenship status is required as this position will need a U.S. Security Clearance within 1 year of start date.Raytheon BBN Technologies is one of Raytheon’s premier research and development centers. Our diverse research portfolio combines the best technologies to deliver innovative, custom solutions with real-world benefit.Located in Arlington, VA, our Information Exploitation group is seeking a Staff Scientist with software research interests.  Our world-class team works with a broad range of Government agencies to solve problems that are both technically challenging and have a real operational impact. The ideal candidate will have strong experience in Java development with some experience or interest in machine reasoning, semantic web technologies, data analytics, or artificial intelligence technologies.Our research work applies the above technologies to build both prototype and real operational systems.  You will be working on challenging problems including:• Producing sophisticated software in a fast-paced agile environment;• Developing mission-critical applications for deployment into global enterprise operations;• Optimizing software for knowledge representation, storage, and query systems for high performance.• Designing novel machine reasoning and learning algorithms and solutions to complex, open-ended intelligence problems.Required Education and Experience:• BS in Computer Science or equivalent discipline and 2 years of experience; or MS in Computer Science or equivalent discipline and 0 years of experience.• Proficiency in Java and the Java-based development ecosystem.• US citizenship is requiredDesired Skills and Education:• 2-3 years of related research experience in one of the technical areas mentioned above.• Experience with Web application development.• Familiarity with modern software configuration management tools such as Docker, Gradle, Ivy, etc.• Current US Government security clearance is desired.  143444
Business Unit Profile
Raytheon Space and Airborne Systems (SAS) builds radars and other sensors for aircraft, spacecraft and ships. The business also provides communications and electronic warfare solutions and performs research in areas ranging from linguistics to quantum computing. SAS is headquartered in McKinney, Texas USA. As a global business, our leaders must have the ability to understand, embrace and operate in a multicultural world -- in the marketplace and the workplace. We strive to hire people who reflect our communities and embrace diversity and inclusion to advance our culture, develop our employees, and grow our business.Raytheon is headquartered in Waltham, Massachusetts. Follow us on Twitter.

As a result, diversity has become a competitive imperative and an integral part of our business model, particularly as we continue to grow internationally. Learn More

Regulatory Affairs Specialist  (98031) - Richardson, TX - Inogen, Inc. Jobs








 














Home
Jobs




Regulatory Affairs Specialist  (98031) - Richardson, TX

Toggle navigation








Regulatory Affairs Specialist  (98031) 

JobsLogin 












 RA/QA Richardson, TX, USA Full Time 



Email Me Similar Jobs Email Me This Job



ABOUT INOGEN Inogen was founded in 2001 to improve quality of life and increase freedom and independence for oxygen therapy users. Inogen is innovation in oxygen therapy. The Inogen mission is to improve freedom and independence for oxygen therapy patients through innovative products and services. Inogen is a manufacturer and Accredited Homecare Provider.
Inogen is focused on quality care, continuous improvement, and outstanding customer satisfaction. We are a stable, USA based company dedicated to providing an exciting and rewarding career to our employees. We completed a successful Initial Public Offering on the NASDAQ in 2014 and have demonstrated substantial growth over the last five years. Our work environment is casual yet high performing, and we are looking for seriously talented, motivated, and fast-paced professionals to join our team.
JOB DESCRIPTION 
The Regulatory Affairs Specialist is responsible for global product and operational compliance related to Class-2 (and accessory) medical device design, manufacture and sales; obtaining regulatory approvals; and establishing and maintaining quality and environmental management systems in keeping with business objectives.
Key Competencies:
Participate in product development activities, including evaluating and advising personnel on regulatory impact through product lifecycle stages, ensuring that regulatory standards are understood, that a design control system is in place, that design validation activities are conducted, and that a Design History File (DHF) is maintained to support regulatory submissions. 
Participate in the transfer of approved product design to Manufacturing to meet market introduction and other key milestone target dates, ensuring that a Device Master Record is in place (specifications, bill of materials, drawings, material specifications, labelling, etc.).
Participate in the development of manufacturing and inspection/ test procedures, including required validations for final product release.
Participate in change control activities, such as design changes, manufacturing improvements, new supplier introductions, cost reduction initiatives, etc., ensuring that regulatory standards are understood.
Assist in obtaining regulatory registrations, product clearances/ approvals, certifications and with maintaining documentation needed to support ISO, FDA, and other regulatory compliance, allowing for the sale of Inogen products. 
Support key business relationships by providing regulatory expertise specific to contract manufacturing, private label arrangements, due diligence for possible acquisitions, etc.
Assist in compiling, submitting, and monitoring reports and responses to regulatory authorities. 
Support regulatory agency inspections and audits.
Participate in the Internal Audit Program as an internal auditor. 
Support the Supplier Audit Program as an auditor.
Support the Corrective and Preventive Action (CAPA) Program.
Support post market surveillance (PMS) activities, including customer complaint handling and regulatory analysis efforts to determine reportability.
Support the external standards management process by ensuring changes to standards and new standards introduced are understood and integrated into device design proactively.
Participate in company-wide quality management system training and provide Regulatory expertise.
Support Lean and Kaizen initiatives to introduce improvements throughout the quality management system.
Support Operations reporting and trending.
Maintain regular and punctual attendance. 
Comply with all company policies and procedures. 
Assist with any other duties as assigned. 
Limited sign off for Regulatory.
Lead Corrective and Preventive Action (CAPA) program facilitation efforts.
Lead international product registration efforts. 
 
Do you possess these abilities?
Knowledge of ISO, MDD/ MDR and FDA regulations.
Knowledge of DMEPOS accreditation requirements.
Knowledge of DMEPOS accreditation requirements.
Experience with DMEPOS/ CMS.
Experience in medical device Regulatory Affairs and at least one (1) of the following: product development, manufacturing engineering, quality assurance, or production management.
Ability to support external/ internal audits.
Attention to detail and process improvement capabilities.
Excellent skills with database systems and Excel with capability to compile data from various sources to produce useful reports for trending and verifying process improvements.
Familiarity with process improvement concepts (i.e., LEAN Six Sigma).
Must have strong work ethic.
Excellent oral and written communication skills are required. 
Attention to detail is required. 
Must demonstrate effective conflict resolution. 
Analytical and problem-solving skills and ability to multitask are required. 
Must be solutions-oriented problem solver. 
Excellent planning, communication and organizational skills are required. 
Ability to effectively interface with different departments within the company is required. 
Requirements:
Bachelor's Degree in a technical discipline required.
2-5 years of medical device Regulatory Affairs experience required; 1 year of QMS internal auditing experience required.
Intermediate knowledge of/ proficiency in Microsoft Office required.
ISO 13485 (current edition) Lead Auditor Certification and/or ASQ CQA and/or ASQ CBA preferred.
Intermediate knowledge of ISO 13485 preferred.
Intermediate knowledge of ISO 14971 preferred.
A combination of training, education and experience that is equivalent to the qualifications listed above and that provides the required knowledge, skills, and abilities.
WHY INOGEN Inogen is a dynamic company that is not only focused on quality care of patients, but is also committed to being a top employer.  Each of Inogen' s offices have a casual culture that supports employees being responsible and developing professionals.
We offer competitive salaries and a robust benefit package:
Employee Stock Purchase Plan 401 (K) plan available for all employees Health, dental, vision insurance Flexible spending accounts and wellness discount program Life Insurance Long Term Disability Robust paid time off and 8 paid holidays Employee Assistance Program
See the Inogen Team in action:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dKoTMeJf5J4
 
Inogen Where we go to work hard to positively impact people's lives
 
Inogen is an equal opportunity employer.  We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other legally protected characteristics. The EEO is the Law poster and its supplement are available here: http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/ofccpost.htm; http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/OFCCP_EEO_Supplement_Final_JRF_QA_508c.pdf.  The pay transparency policy is available here: http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/pdf/EO13665_PrescribedNondiscriminationPostingLanguage_JRFQA508c.pdf. 
Inogen is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities.  If you need a reasonable accommodation because of a disability for any part of the employment process, please send an e-mail to recruiting@inogen.net or call (972) 616-5668 and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information.
 
 

Inogen, Inc.

            Public Records Analyst I



         Login to apply
    
















Public Records Analyst I
Waltham, MA 


Under immediate supervision, the Public Records Analyst I performs tenant screening services for property owner/manager clients using multiple resources to screen an applicant’s public records history including criminal and civil courts data. 
Responsibilities 

Performs and processes applicant background searches for resident screening (e.g., criminal, civil, state and others) utilizing in-house applications and internet web sites.
Reviews, analyzes and filters variable record types and applies client criteria with high degree of accuracy and efficiency.
Records applicable screening results within designated system databases using departmental procedures.
Handles custom requests and manages any vendor related emails and correspondence specific to the custom process (i.e. Massachusetts CORI & Georgia GCIC searches).
Follows client specific procedures.
Communicates with other departments regarding search results and policy issues.
Performs other Public Records projects and tasks on an as needed basis.  

SCHEDULE: Tuesday – Saturday 10:00am – 6:30pm
*Training hours will be Monday – Friday 8:00am – 4:30 pm*
Requirements 

4 -year college degree or equivalent work experience where attention to detail and accuracy is paramount
Education in Criminal Justice preferred
Criminal court, police department, or probation department internships are a plus 
Exceptional attention to detail and accuracy
Ability to multitask and prioritize
Excellent data entry skills
Ability to retain information easily and consistently
Great written and verbal communication skills
Professional phone demeanor skills
Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite
Ability to work swiftly and accurately once trained
Ability to work well in a team environment as well as independently
Open to undertaking additional job responsibilities
Flexible and works harmoniously with others to get the job done
Knowledge of the criminal justice system, criminal records and landlord/tenant civil records desired
Two years of related experience to include exposure to research, record keeping, data entry and/or data integrity desired

                                                                                                               *ad

By continuing to browse this site you agree to our use of cookies. You can find out more about which cookies we are using or switch them off in settings.
 

 
Accept

 


















 

 Privacy Overview


 Strictly Necessary Cookies


 3rd Party Cookies




 








Privacy Overview

This website uses cookies so that we can provide you with the best user experience possible. Cookie information is stored in your browser and performs functions such as recognising you when you return to our website and helping our team to understand which sections of the website you find most interesting and useful.
You can adjust all of your cookie settings by navigating the tabs on the left hand side.



 
Strictly Necessary Cookies

Strictly necessary cookies must be enabled at all times in order to login and apply to openings.



disable









If you disable this cookie, we will not be able to save your preferences and you will not be able to login to apply for openings. This means that every time you visit this website you will need to enable or disable cookies again.







3rd Party Cookies

This website uses Google Analytics to collect anonymous information such as the number of visitors to the site, and the most popular pages.
Keeping this cookie enabled helps us to improve our website.



disable









Please enable Strictly Necessary Cookies first so that we can save your preferences!












Enable All
Save Changes

Graduate Software Intern - Summer 2020 Linked Data
Apply
Requisition ID 147037BR Date updated 08/27/2019
Who we are!Raytheon BBN Technologies is one of Raytheon’s premier research and development centers. Our diverse research portfolio combines the best technologies to deliver innovative, custom solutions with real-world benefit.Our Information Exploitation group is seeking upcoming and current graduate students for summer internship positions in its Arlington, VA office. The successful candidate will be self-motivated with an ability to work independently and as a member of a multi-disciplinary team solving complex technical challenges.BBN offers an exciting and collaborative work environment. If you enjoy working in a culture that emphasizes innovation, teamwork, and technical excellence in a collegial work environment that values creativity and initiative, we'd like to hear from you.What will you need?• Current Senior or Grad student pursuing a Master’s degree in Computer Science, Systems Engineering, Applied Mathematics, or Computer Engineering• Proficiency in Java and/or C++• Strong analytical skills• Excellent written/verbal communication skillsAdditional Skills that would be AWESOME / BENEFICIAL• Interest in Data Science or Linked Data• Familiarity with web application development, HTTP stack, SQL and/or SPARQL• US Government Security clearance may be required.  A willingness to apply and US citizenship are requiredThis position requires the eligibility to obtain a security clearance.  Except in rare circumstances, only U.S. citizens are eligible for a security clearance. 147037
Business Unit Profile
Raytheon Space and Airborne Systems (SAS) builds radars and other sensors for aircraft, spacecraft and ships. The business also provides communications and electronic warfare solutions and performs research in areas ranging from linguistics to quantum computing. SAS is headquartered in McKinney, Texas USA. As a global business, our leaders must have the ability to understand, embrace and operate in a multicultural world -- in the marketplace and the workplace. We strive to hire people who reflect our communities and embrace diversity and inclusion to advance our culture, develop our employees, and grow our business.Raytheon is headquartered in Waltham, Massachusetts. Follow us on Twitter.

Related Content




Work on interesting projects and enjoy plenty of recognition
Whether you’re just starting out on your career journey or a experienced professional, it’s important that you feel recognized and rewarded for your contributions.
Raytheon is proud to offer a comprehensive and competitive benefits package to you, your spouse and your eligible children. In addition to protecting you and your family's health and well-being, we offer important income and work/life benefits to meet your needs. Learn More





Turn unique thinking into one-of-a-kind solutions
Diversity. Every company likes to talk about it, but few have embraced it with quite the same commitment as we have here at Raytheon. As a result, diversity has become a competitive imperative and an integral part of our business model, particularly as we continue to grow internationally. Learn More








Work as one to make a difference to millions
Here at Raytheon, we innovate across all domains: from land and sea to air, space, and cyberspace.It’s innovation made possible by a strong internal culture and a vision that’s shared by Raytheon employees across the globe – a vision of one global team creating trusted, innovative solutions to make the world a safer place. If you’re ready to take on a fresh challenge, grow your career and contribute to making the world a safer place, Raytheon is ready to help you achieve your goals. Join our team and get the opportunity and support to find purpose, thrive and succeed.

Cloud Infrastructure Team Lead
Dulles, Virginia


Apply





Overview
Responsibilities
Success Profile
Rewards
Trending




Overview

What does it take to make the world a safer place? It takes delivering innovative technology and collaborating with some of the finest talent in the engineering field. Whether you’re a software engineer or a mechanical engineer, at Raytheon you’ll grow a varied and rewarding career. And you’ll be supported with a comprehensive and competitive benefits package that promotes work/life. If you’re ready to take on today’s big challenges, discover a world of opportunity at Raytheon.

America’s Best Large Employers by Forbes
Career & Development Opportunities
Full-time
Entry, Mid, Senior level




Back to Job Navigation (Overview)


Responsibilities


Would you like to work in a collaborative environment at a state of the art facility in Dulles? Then join our Intelligence, Information and Services (IIS) team of smart people solving problems that make the world a safer place and help to secure our great nation! Come support those who provide us with all the freedoms we enjoy. Our facility in Dulles VA offers amenities that create work and life balance. The Dulles site includes 4 modern facilities with 3 industrial buildings.  On site we have a fitness center plus a fun space with a pool table, foosball and video games. Additionally, employee appreciation lunches, bonus opportunities, and great benefits that include medical, dental, vision, 401K match, flexible work schedules, are just a few of the reasons people come to work at Raytheon!   The Intelligence, Information and Services (IIS) Hardware and Infrastructure (HW&I) Engineering team has an immediate professional opening for a Cloud Infrastructure Engineering Section Manager (SM). The individual is responsible for leading a team of 10-20 Electrical Engineers and work products through the systems lifecycle. The SM is expected to ensure work and work products assigned to their section are completed on time and on budget and continuously improve their ability to accomplish the assigned work. The SM is also expected to participate in proposals, roadmap development and growth of the products and section.This position is eligible for a Sign on Bonus of up to 40k for a candidate with a current TS/SCI that can be verified and hired at Raytheon.Other relevant responsibilities include:Demonstrate that the section is effectively executing work to deliver on-budget, on-time, correct, high-quality, complete work products, utilizing IPDS-based Engineering work packages and productivity measuresDemonstrate the development of staff to meet the needs of the Hardware and Infrastructure training planDemonstrate measurable Execution and Bidding productivity goals for every program on which the section has Engineering contentDirect line management activities for employees in the Section, including performance management, career development and resource allocationWork closely with program managers to ensure customer satisfaction Interface with customers and users to build relationships and develop roadmaps and product ideas for meeting their needsRapidly respond to customer RFIs and RFPs to shape customer acquisition strategiesParticipation in proposal processes to develop and review cost estimates/proposals packagesProvide leadership to integrated product teams (IPTs) with responsibility for the design development of one or more section products. Is a member of the next higher tier team which develops detailed program plans, statements of work (SOW), schedules, budgets, and Integrated Master Plans (IMP)/Integrated Master Schedules (IMS)Maintain a professional attitude, to serve as an example to the team, with team members, internal and external customersWork closely with the Department Manager in support of IIS goals/objectivesRequired Skills: Ability to provide technical direction to the HW&I team for design and implementation activities using COTS-based solutionsKnowledge of both traditional and private/public cloud infrastructure designsExperience adopting and implementing DevOps tools and processes (Infrastructure build automation, container orchestration, continuous integration pipelines)Skilled at leading and directing activities of direct report staffEVMS certificationProject management experienceExperience developing detailed infrastructure design artifactsAbility to obtain US Government TS/SCI Security Clearance and US Citizenship required (US citizenship required).Desired Skills: Very strong organizational and team development skillsExcellent oral and written communication skillsExperience developing and managing product line artifactsAn active DoD or federal agency TS/SCI clearanceEducation Requirements: Requires a degree in Science, Technology, Engineering or Mathematics (STEM) and 10 years of related work experienceThis position requires a U.S. Person who is eligible to obtain any required Export Authorization  152820
Business Unit Profile
                        
                        Intelligence, Information and Services delivers innovative technology to make the world a safer place. Our expertise in cyber, analytics and automation allow us to reach beyond what others think is possible to underpin national security and give our global customers unique solutions to solve the most pressing modern challenges -- from the cyber domain to automated operations, and from intelligent transportation and training solutions to creating clear insight from large volumes of data. IIS operates at nearly 550 sites in 80 countries, and is headquartered in Dulles, Virginia. The business area generated $6.2 billion in 2018 revenues. As a global business, our leaders must have the ability to understand, embrace and operate in a multicultural world -- in the marketplace and the workplace. We strive to hire people who reflect our communities and embrace diversity and inclusion to advance our culture, develop our employees, and grow our business.
Relocation Eligible 
                        
                        Yes
Clearance Type 
                        
                        TS/SCI
Expertise 
                        

                                
                            Aerospace/Aeronautical EngineeringAtmospheric/Space ScienceCloud ComputingComputer EngineeringComputer ScienceComputer/Management Information SystemsCyber JobsData NetworkingData ScienceEngineering TechnologyGeneral EngineeringHardware EngineeringInformation and Knowledge SystemsIntegration & Test EngineeringIntelligence AnalystOptics/Optical EngineeringReliability EngineerSoftware EngineeringSystems EngineeringTechnicalTest Engineering
                        
                        

Type Of Job 
                        
                        Full Time

Work Location 
                        
 
                            
                            VA - Dulles
                        
Raytheon is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, age, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected Veteran status.

Back to Job Navigation (Success)


Quote



Felicia Jackson is regional vice president of RAYVETS, Raytheon's employee group for veterans and those who support them. After 24 years in the Air Force, she started a new career at Raytheon. "I wanted to go where people would support me," she told us.









Rewards




401(k) / Retirement Plans
Employer Matching, if you elect to enroll company matches up to 3%.



Work / Life Balance
Raytheon supports a variety of flexible work arrangements including compressed work weeks, flextime, job sharing, 9/80, reduced hours and telecommuting.



Career Development
At Raytheon, we foster an inclusive culture of professional development. We support a variety of developmental opportunities including: Mentoring programs, Skills Development, Leadership Development, Rotational job assignments, and Continuous Improvement, all of which contribute to advancement of our employee’s capabilities.



Paid Time Off
Accrue paid time off monthly. Receive 10-12 holidays per year with some locations shutting down the week between Christmas and New Year’s Day.



Relocation Assistance
Select technical positions are eligible for relocation packages. See specific job description for eligibility requirements.



Parental Leave
Raytheon offers all eligible employees up to three weeks paid parental leave for the birth or adoption of a child (separate from paid maternity leave or Family & Medical Leave Act).

            Processing Clerk



         Login to apply
    
















Processing Clerk
Austin, TX 


This position extracts and batches mail received daily by performing the following duties.
Responsibilities

Sort mail by lockbox number
Open mail on Opex equipment or by hand
Batch / sort mail for each lockbox by type of batch
Separate correspondence from payments
Batch and scan files for transmission to clients
Perform Data Entry
Print reports
Complete various logs

Requirements

High School Diploma; one or two years related experience and / or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience
Prior data entry experience with keystrokes of at least 10,000 per hour
Ability to read and interpret procedure manuals
Ability to solve practical problems and deal with a variety of concrete variables in situations where only limited standardization exists
Ability to sit or stand for long periods of time
Knowledge of mail extraction equipment a plus

Privacy Overview

This website uses cookies so that we can provide you with the best user experience possible. Cookie information is stored in your browser and performs functions such as recognising you when you return to our website and helping our team to understand which sections of the website you find most interesting and useful.
You can adjust all of your cookie settings by navigating the tabs on the left hand side.



 
Strictly Necessary Cookies

Strictly necessary cookies must be enabled at all times in order to login and apply to openings.



disable









If you disable this cookie, we will not be able to save your preferences and you will not be able to login to apply for openings. This means that every time you visit this website you will need to enable or disable cookies again.







3rd Party Cookies

This website uses Google Analytics to collect anonymous information such as the number of visitors to the site, and the most popular pages.
Keeping this cookie enabled helps us to improve our website.



disable









Please enable Strictly Necessary Cookies first so that we can save your preferences!

If you’re ready to take on a fresh challenge, grow your career and contribute to making the world a safer place, Raytheon is ready to help you achieve your goals. Join our team and get the opportunity and support to find purpose, thrive and succeed.





Notice: Please be aware of suspicious recruiting emails and text messages that attempt to collect your confidential information. Raytheon conducts all electronic correspondence using e-mail addresses that end in “Raytheon.com”, “Raytheon.co.uk”, “Raytheon.com.au” or “brassring.com”. To report fraud please go to: https://www.ic3.gov.











Principal Systems Engineer - Systems Safety Engineer
Dulles, Virginia, Richardson, Texas, Aurora, Colorado, Indianapolis, Indiana, Marlborough, Massachusetts

Overview

Raytheon delivers innovative technology to make the world a safer place. Our expertise in cyber, analytics and automation allow us to reach beyond what others think is possible to underpin national security and give our global customers unique solutions to solve the most pressing modern challenges -- from the cyber domain to automated operations, and from intelligent transportation solutions to creating clear insight from large volumes of data. Our leaders must have the ability to understand, embrace and operate in a multicultural world -- in the marketplace and the workplace. We strive to hire people who reflect our communities and embrace diversity and inclusion to advance our culture, develop our employees, and grow our business.

Full-time
Entry to Senior level

Glassdoor 2017 Best Places to Interview: Candidate's Choice

Rewards




401(k) / Retirement Plans
Employer Matching, if you elect to enroll company matches up to 3%.



Work / Life Balance
Raytheon appreciates work/life balance. Employees can work 9 hours a day every week and received every other Friday off, as long as departmental/manager approval is obtained. Accrued paid time off monthly and paid holiday time.



Career Development
At Raytheon, we foster an inclusive culture of professional development. We support a variety of developmental opportunities including: Mentoring programs, Skills Development, Leadership Development, Rotational job assignments, and Continuous Improvement, all of which contribute to advancement of our employee’s capabilities.



Paid Time Off
Accrue paid time off monthly. Receive 12 holidays per year including the week between Christmas and New Year’s Day.



Relocation Assistance
Select technical positions are eligible for relocation packages. See specific job description for eligibility requirements.



Parental Leave
Raytheon offers all eligible employees up to three weeks paid parental leave for the birth or adoption of a child (separate from paid maternity leave or Family & Medical Leave Act).



Back to Job Navigation (Rewards)



Responsibilities


Are you looking for an engineering career that is challenging and satisfying? Then join our Raytheon team of engineers solving problems that make the world a safer place and help to secure our great nation! Come support those who provide us with all the freedoms we enjoy.We offer great benefits that include medical, dental, vision, 401K match, flexible work schedule - just to name a few.  Click here to view a brief video and learn more: https://youtu.be/YNuZN0vyzHgRaytheon is looking for a talented Systems SafetyEngineer to join our Specialty Engineering team.  Specialty Engineering is part of Systems Engineering that complements the technical activities required to deliver a project. It deals with engineering that influence the systems’ design and architecture in terms of performance, safety, usability, reliability, maintainability, availability, supportability, testability, and cost consideration throughout the lifecycle of the product. Specialty Engineering applies methods, standards, and techniques to provide clarification of system requirements to software, hardware, and test personnel to ensure design and architecture considerations are appropriately allocated to the system and horizontally integrated across the development teams. The Specialty Engineering function supports systems engineering activities including trade studies, use case development, requirements definition and derivation, interface definition, and requirement validation and verification. As such, all Specialty Engineers interface with the other Specialty disciplines and logistics engineering functions to ensure integration and continuity in the design and development process.Must be a U.S. Citizen with the ability to obtain and maintain a DoD Top Secret Security ClearanceThe Specialty Team is looking for candidates with experience in this Specialty area:•  System Safety EngineerAs a member of the Specialty Engineering Team, expect a dynamic and demanding environment that values discipline, adherence to processes, and adding value to our customers through our respective disciplines (Human Factors Engineering, System Safety, Reliability Engineering).This position is to support the preliminary and detailed design phases for programs within the Raytheon IIS portfolio that include the following businesses; Cyber and Special Missions (CSM), C2, Space and Intelligence (CSI), Navigation and Modernization Solutions (NMS) and Global Training Solutions (GTS). This position serves as a member of the Raytheon IIS Specialty Engineering Team and supports various programs within a matrix management assignment as directed. Deliverables include, but not limited to, program plans, technical reports, schedules, basis of estimates for new pursuits, and analyses as required to substantiate architectural/design decisions and trade studies.Required Skills: Experience with System Safety Engineering practices as derived from MIL-STD-882U.S. Citizen with the ability to obtain and maintain a DoD Top Secret Security ClearancePractical understanding and application of:MIL-STD-1472MIL-STD-1474Ability to produce DoD required documentation, such as:Safety Engineering Analysis ReportFailure Mode Effects and Criticality ReportSafety Assessment ReportEngineering Change Proposal System Safety ReportWaiver or Deviation System Safety Report (WDSSR)System Safety Program Progress ReportHealth Hazard Assessment ReportRadiation Hazard Control ProceduresSafety Studies ReportSafety Studies PlanMishap Risk Assessment ReportSystem Safety Program PlanDesired Skills: Current DoD TS/SCI Security Clearance Expertise working with Satellite and/or unmanned ground stations, A/C avionics modernization, intelligence communities, FAA, other governmental agencies.System Safety Engineering ability to apply standards and process requirementsMIL-STD-882DO-178MIL-STD-516 Air Worthiness CriteriaDO-178 Software considerations in Airborne Systems and Equipment CertificationHuman Systems IntegrationSAE 6906Education Requirements: Bachelor’s Degree in Science, Technology, Engineering, Mathematics, or related STEM degree with minimum of 8 years of relevant experienceMaster’s Degree / PHD in Science, Technology, Engineering, Mathematics, or related STEM degree with minimum of 6 years of relevant experienceThis position requires either a U.S. Person or a Non-U.S. Person who is eligible to obtain any required Export Authorization. 149927

            Senior Account Executive



         Login to apply
    
















Senior Account Executive
Santa Barbara, CA 


The Senior Account Executive, Commercial will be responsible for developing and cultivating a regional territory and selling Yardi’s products and services to prospects and existing clients within the residential real estate property management industry.  This is an outside sales position requiring software sales experience in the commercial real estate space.
The Senior Account Executive, Commercial will be responsible for the following duties and responsibilities:

Managing and cultivating relationships with prospects and existing clients at the senior level to support continued sales growth
Heavy prospecting and identifying new sales opportunities for a designated territory
Becoming familiar with all product solutions, the competitive climate, and promoting company products
Conducting online and onsite presentations to demonstrate Yardi’s product offerings
Developing and executing outbound call  and email campaigns
Participating and networking at industry events and tradeshows
Meeting or exceeding monthly, quarterly and annual revenue goals
Maintaining accurate account information and forecasting details through a CRM system
Establishing a strong sales pipeline, sales forecasts and updating accounts to support revenue growth
Identifying client needs by introducing and up-selling Yardi ancillary tools/products to potentially increase client revenue opportunities.
Assisting with the development and implementation of marketing materials and programs
Participating in regular sales meetings to report on the status of all opportunities in the sales pipeline and new acquisitions to the pipeline

This position will require the following background and experience:

Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience
3+years of successful sales experience managing and developing a sales territory
Solid knowledge base in sales and ability to apply basic sales principles (i.e. lead generation, opportunity qualification, proposal development, account management and closure)
Ability to effectively execute sales strategies using a consultative approach and relationship building techniques
Ability to interface with all levels within the client organization to include individual properties, large portfolios and other senior leadership in large to mid-sized companies
Strong ,engaging presentation skills and ability to demonstrate product value
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Ability to internally motivate, work interdependently, and also work effectively with a team
Ability to develop and maintain solid client relationships
Ability to understand and demonstrate technical products
Prior experience entering data into a CRM system to support up to date client contact and information
Proven track record of achieving or exceeding sales goals
Prior background in software sales, property management or accounting systems desirable

 *cl

Sonos | Senior Project Manager - Experience Planning

English
                                                










Sonos






Login

Returning Candidate?
Log back in!







                      Apply for this job online


Share it:








































Senior Project Manager - Experience Planning

Department:
              Hardware
            
Location:
              Santa Barbara
            

Req#:
              5466
            

At Sonos we are passionate about inspiring the world to listen better. Whether it’s a new release on Spotify, the latest edition of the Daily, or that award winning series on Netflix, we believe that when people listen better they live better. We strive to bring that mission to life by providing our customers with a best-in-class experience. The Experience Planning group plays a key role in this work, conducting explorations that progress our experience and differentiate Sonos’ products and services. If you are a passionate explorer with a desire to change the status quo, read on.Within Experience Planning (XP), the Portfolio Planning team brings a product management perspective to explorations.  Our goal is to drive awareness, understanding, and a point-of-view on new portfolio opportunities.  We work with partners in Experience Planning, HW and SW Product Management, Product Development, and Go To Market (GTM) to explore new opportunities and make recommendations on future products and experiences based on the desirability to the customer, feasibility of required technologies, and viability of the opportunity in terms of investment and return.This work is often loosely defined and ambiguous at the onset.  Its processes are therefore experimental, making them difficult to structure, and rarely with linear guidelines.  But without structure, there is chaos.  And with chaos comes waste.  That’s where you come in…




About You


More than a candidate that checks every box, we’re looking for people who are excited to work, learn, and grow at Sonos—no matter their background or how they identify. If that’s you, we hope you’ll apply for this role.
You want to be part of a team.
You come with new ideas and a unique point of view. You look forward to collaborating with a diverse team of individuals. You assume everyone’s best intentions, welcome a healthy debate, and embrace differing opinions. You eagerly seek and give help. Transparency tops your list of values, and you proactively contribute to a culture of respect and inclusion.
You enjoy a challenge.
Inquisitive and focused, you see every challenge as an opportunity. You’re ambitious and comfortable making mistakes because you learn from them and bounce back quickly. You would rather create the future than wait for it. You prioritize long-term value over short-term objectives.
You love to listen.
You approach every interaction with curiosity and a desire to understand. You want to make a positive impact in the world. You’re passionate about culture and know the power that music, film, podcasts, games, and stories have to bring people together.


What You’ll Do 

The Senior Project Manager - Experience Planning will provide structure and organization to the naturally evolving and often sporadic work of Experience Planning.  The incumbent must actively manage risks so that we can fail fast, fail smart, and focus our resources on increasing confidence and reducing uncertainty around future opportunities for Sonos.  In some capacities this will be management of programs.  In other capacities this will be operational management of unique efforts and initiatives (these are TBD as they come up over time).  And finally, this will involve creating and managing process and structure that act as connective tissue between experience planning functions and the organization at large.Some key aspects of your work include:Lead End to End, Edge to Edge new product explorations including planning, execution and managementActively manage exploration programs in a consistent way so that we can become more efficient and effective over time including program timelines, dependencies, co-management of research/design agencies, and planning/management of budgets and organizational resourcesManage exploration planning cycles which includes stakeholder coordination, stakeholders, scenario planning, dependency mapping, and key communicationsStructure and manage connections between Experience Planning and product group stakeholders (e.g. Advanced Technology & Product Management) in order to manage progression of new opportunities beyond exploration into development and to create a path for emerging technologies to drive new experience explorationsStructure and manage connections between XP & GTM to define and evolve intake and assessment mechanisms for new GTM activities (resources, timing, cost) and facilitate continuous cross-engagement to connect GTM initiatives to product requirements, and new product initiatives to commercial opportunitiesClose gaps and minimize overlaps between functions and work streams within XP and across adjacent groups within the companyCreate and implement plans and procedures that scaleForecast spend and manage the budgetManage relationships with partners/vendorsSet comprehensive goals for performance and success; evaluate performance by analyzing and interpreting data and metricsPlan, manage, and evolve company-wide Hackweek events in order to drive increased innovation and employee engagement

Skills You’ll Need

Qualifications:7+ years of overall industry experience in complex consumer product development5+ years experience in program management or similar roles planning and managing product development, exploration, innovation, and/or design programsCreative and/or Technical background, with BA/BS in Design or Engineering (or equivalent experience) Preferred Qualifications:Experience managing large cross-functional programs with multiple internal and external dependenciesExceptional verbal and written communication skills; you are an expert storyteller and presenter able to engage leaders and individual contributors alikeHigh attention to detail including ability to manage multiple, conflicting priorities simultaneouslyAbility to think strategically, execute creatively, and act decisivelyExperience working with, or managing external design, engineering, and research agenciesExperience working in an innovative, fast-paced environmentBusiness expertise with MBA or equivalent practical real-world experience is a plus

More About Sonos


Sonos is a sound experience company. We pioneered multiroom wireless audio, made it sound amazing, and changed the way people listen, making it effortless for them to enjoy what they want, where they want, how they want.
Today we continue empowering listeners by developing new technologies, thoughtfully designing products, expanding our software platform, and crafting brilliant sound experiences while participating in a culture that values respect, transparency, collaboration, and ownership.
Together we’re working to positively impact the world and inspire everyone to listen better—because listening brings people together, builds understanding, drives change, and makes us happier.
Notice to European Job Applicants: Information you submit as a part of your job application will be used in accordance with Sonos EU Job Applicant Privacy Notice.
Notice to U.S. Job Applicants: Sonos is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other legally protected characteristics.
Follow the links to review the EEO is the Law poster and its supplement. The pay transparency policy is available here. Sonos is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities. If you need a reasonable accommodation because of a disability for any part of the employment process, please send an e-mail to accommodations@sonos.com and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information.

If you’re ready to take on a fresh challenge, grow your career and contribute to making the world a safer place, Raytheon is ready to help you achieve your goals. Join our team and get the opportunity and support to find purpose, thrive and succeed.





Notice: Please be aware of suspicious recruiting emails and text messages that attempt to collect your confidential information. Sr Systems Engineer I - Network Engineer
Aurora, Colorado


Apply





Overview
Success Profile
Trending
Rewards
Responsibilities




Overview

Raytheon delivers innovative technology to make the world a safer place. Our expertise in cyber, analytics and automation allow us to reach beyond what others think is possible to underpin national security and give our global customers unique solutions to solve the most pressing modern challenges -- from the cyber domain to automated operations, and from intelligent transportation solutions to creating clear insight from large volumes of data. Our leaders must have the ability to understand, embrace and operate in a multicultural world -- in the marketplace and the workplace. We strive to hire people who reflect our communities and embrace diversity and inclusion to advance our culture, develop our employees, and grow our business.

Full-time
Entry to Senior level

Glassdoor 2017 Best Places to Interview: Candidate's Choice

Raytheon: Bright Future in Aurora







Raytheon Secures Every Side of Cyber




Back to Job Navigation (Trending)


Rewards




401(k) / Retirement Plans
Employer Matching, if you elect to enroll company matches up to 3%.



Work / Life Balance
Raytheon appreciates work/life balance. Employees can work 9 hours a day every week and received every other Friday off, as long as departmental/manager approval is obtained. Accrued paid time off monthly and paid holiday time.



Career Development
At Raytheon, we foster an inclusive culture of professional development. We support a variety of developmental opportunities including: Mentoring programs, Skills Development, Leadership Development, Rotational job assignments, and Continuous Improvement, all of which contribute to advancement of our employee’s capabilities.



Paid Time Off
Accrue paid time off monthly. Receive 12 holidays per year including the week between Christmas and New Year’s Day.



Relocation Assistance
Select technical positions are eligible for relocation packages. See specific job description for eligibility requirements.



Parental Leave
Raytheon offers all eligible employees up to three weeks paid parental leave for the birth or adoption of a child (separate from paid maternity leave or Family & Medical Leave Act).



Back to Job Navigation (Rewards)



Responsibilities


Job Description:  Would you like to work in a collaborative environment at a state of the art facility in Colorado? Then join our Raytheon team of engineers solving problems that make the world a safer place and help to secure our great nation! Come support those who provide us with all the freedoms we enjoy. Our facility in Aurora, CO offers amenities that create work and life balance. On site we have a 24/7 fitness facility, health center, cafeteria, collaboration rooms and dynamic break areas for easy conversation and socialization. Additionally, we provide employee appreciation lunches, bonus opportunities, and great benefits that include medical, dental, vision, 401K match, flexible work schedule - just to name a few.  Click here to view a brief video and learn more: https://youtu.be/YNuZN0vyzHgThe Raytheon Hardware and Infrastructure Engineering (HW&I) team has a professional Network Engineer opportunity available for the JPSS program. This position will perform network engineering tasks pertaining to detail design development, creating engineering design artifacts, hands on implementation and troubleshooting. Tasks include designing\\implementing switch, firewall, and router configurations. Individual should possess knowledge and experience with network technologies, services, operations, and associated security practices.Ability to obtain a CAC card and US Citizenship required.Required Skills:•4+ years of relevant experience directly related to network engineering design •In-depth understanding of network technologies and associated services, management, and security practices/techniques•Proven communicator with Leadership, Peers and Subordinates •Familiarity and ability to read, understand, and implement configurations fir the following:•Cisco Firepower firewall experience with Contexts, filters, SSL VPN•Cisco ISR Router experience with GRE and IP Sec tunnels as well as ACLs, OSPF, BGP, NATs, HSRP•Cisco ACS RADIUS, RSA two-factor authentication•Cisco LAN Core and Distribution switches, experience with ACL’s, routing, hardening and spanning tree implementations•Cisco Nexus experience with VPC•Cognizant of network topologies as well as understand necessary configuration details•Familiar with TCP, and secure protocols•Familiar with traffic shaping and TCP acceleration technologies•Experience with Data Center LAN design, Implementation, diagnostics, performance and management Desired Skills:  •Knowledge/experience with SAN implementations (iSCSI, Fiber Channel)•Knowledge/experience with VMware implementations•Knowledge/experience with Security Technical Implementation Guides (STIGs) and Center for Internet Security (CIS) Benchmarks•Network Certifications such as CCNP, CCNA•Experience with Configuration ManagementRequired Education (including Major):Requires a degree in Science, Technology, Engineering or Mathematics (STEM) and 4 years of related work experience  149812
                

                    
                 
                           Raytheon is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, age, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected Veteran status.

If you’re ready to take on a fresh challenge, grow your career and contribute to making the world a safer place, Raytheon is ready to help you achieve your goals. Join our team and get the opportunity and support to find purpose, thrive and succeed.

Manager III Systems Engineer
Indianapolis, Indiana


Apply





Overview
Responsibilities
Success Profile
Rewards
Trending




Overview

What does it take to make the world a safer place? It takes delivering innovative technology and collaborating with some of the finest talent in the engineering field. Whether you’re a software engineer or a mechanical engineer, at Raytheon you’ll grow a varied and rewarding career. And you’ll be supported with a comprehensive and competitive benefits package that promotes work/life. If you’re ready to take on today’s big challenges, discover a world of opportunity at Raytheon.

America’s Best Large Employers by Forbes
Career & Development Opportunities
Full-time
Entry, Mid, Senior level




Back to Job Navigation (Overview)


Responsibilities


Would you like to work in a collaborative environment creating trusted, innovative solutions for the warfighter?Then join our Raytheon team of smart people solving problems that make the world a safer place and help to secure our great nation! Come support those who provide us with all the freedoms we enjoy. We offer amenities that create work-life balance, including employee appreciation lunches, bonus opportunities, great benefits that include medical, dental, vision, and 401K match, and flexible work schedules.  These are just some of the many reasons people come to work at Raytheon!Raytheon Intelligence, Information and Services (IIS) is currently seeking a Systems Engineering Section Manager to support of our Navy Continuous Training Environment (NCTE) pursuit. This position will initially be located in Indianapolis, IN pre-award, performing planning and supporting pursuit tasks.  Post-award this position location will transition to the customer’s facility in Norfolk/Virginia Beach, VA.  This position involves working in a team environment with accountability for all phases of Systems Engineering development including concept development, architecture development, requirements development and allocation, functional analysis, design reviews, implementation, test, verification and validation.  The Section Manager must leverage multiple skill sets to oversee Raytheon’s associated development and operation activities of the Fleet Synthetic Training (FST) and Combatant Commander (COCOM) Live Virtual Constructive (LVC) exercises.  The Section Manager is responsible for leading a team of approximately 20+ systems engineers to develop and integrate new and enhanced architectures and capabilities within a large, complex networked training network that will provide robust, realistic and cost-effective training.  The Section Manager ensures work and work products assigned to their section are completed on time and on budget and continuously improves their ability to accomplish the assigned work.  The Section Manager participates in proposals, roadmap development and growth of the program and section. Clearance Requirements:  Ability to obtain a Secret Level security clearance; an active Secret or higher clearance a plus.Responsibilities and scope include:Demonstrate that the section is effectively executing work to deliver on-budget, on-time, correct, high-quality, complete work products, utilizing IPDS-based Engineering work packages and productivity measures.Demonstrate the development of staff to meet the needs of the Indianapolis SEIT Department staffing, training, and development plansDemonstrate measurable execution and bidding productivity goals for every program on which the section has engineering contentDirect line management activities for employees in the section, including performance management, career development and resource allocationOwn and be accountable all systems engineering lifecycle artifacts and tasks for the programs supported by the section.Work closely with program managers to ensure customer satisfaction and business alignment.Interface with customers and users to build relationships and develop roadmaps and product ideas for meeting their needs.Rapidly respond to customer Request for Information (RFI) and Request for Proposal (RFP) to shape customer acquisition strategiesParticipation in proposal processes to develop and review cost estimates and proposals packages.Participate as a member of the Indianapolis SEIT Leadership Team, flowing communication between the program and engineering departmentProvide leadership to Integrated Product Teams (IPTs) with responsibility for the development of one or more systems engineering products. Is a member of the next higher tier team which develops product requirements, detailed program plans, statements of work (SOW), schedules, budgets, and Integrated Master Plans (IMP)/Integrated Master Schedules (IMS).Maintain a professional attitude, to serve as an example to the team, with team members, internal and external customers.Work closely with the Indianapolis SEIT Department Manager in support of company goals and objectives.Required SkillsVery strong organizational and team development skillsStrong leadership skills and communication skills Proven ability to lead an engineering team through the system engineering lifecycle (SRR/PDR/CDR and final sell-off)Demonstrated knowledge of other related disciplines (e.g. Software Engineering, Hardware Engineering, Configuration Management, Mission Assurance)Experience briefing effectively to all levels of the organization, from peers to senior managementExperience in Agile developmentExperience with Office, Project, Visio, Windows, DOORS (Requirement Management) Desired Skills: Excellent oral and written communication skillsExperience managing staff (hiring, tasking, feedback, and/or discipline)Experience in capture management: creating/reviewing RFPs, SOWs, BOEs, tech volumes, proposalsExperience ensuring program progress via formal risk & opportunity managementExperience in DevOps culture and practice Experience in Model Based EngineeringActive SecretEducation Requirements: Bachelor's in Science, Technology, Engineering, and/or Mathematics (Preferred Majors: Systems, Aerospace, Electrical, Mechanical) and 10+ years of relevant experience - or Master’s in Science, Technology, Engineering, and/or Mathematics (Preferred Majors: Systems, Aerospace, Electrical, Mechanical) and 8+ years of relevant experienceThis position requires either a U.S. Person or a Non-U.S. Person who is eligible to obtain any required Export Authorization. 150535
Business Unit Profile
                        
                        Raytheon Intelligence, Information and Services delivers innovative technology to make the world a safer place. Our expertise in cyber, analytics and automation allow us to reach beyond what others think is possible to underpin national security and give our global customers unique solutions to solve the most pressing modern challenges -- from the cyber domain to automated operations, and from intelligent transportation and training solutions to creating clear insight from large volumes of data. IIS operates at nearly 550 sites in 80 countries, and is headquartered in Dulles, Virginia. The business area generated $6.2 billion in 2018 revenues. As a global business, our leaders must have the ability to understand, embrace and operate in a multicultural world -- in the marketplace and the workplace. We strive to hire people who reflect our communities and embrace diversity and inclusion to advance our culture, develop our employees, and grow our business.
Relocation Eligible 
                        
                        Yes
Clearance Type 
                        
                        Secret
Expertise 
                        

                                
                            Aerospace/Aeronautical EngineeringAlgorithmsComputer EngineeringComputer ScienceData NetworkingData ScienceEngineering TechnologyGeneral EngineeringSystems EngineeringTechnicalTest Engineering
                        
                        

Type Of Job 
                        
                        Full Time

Work Location 
                        
 
                            
                            IN - Indianapolis
                        
Raytheon is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, age, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected Veteran status.

Back to Job Navigation (Success)


Quote



Felicia Jackson is regional vice president of RAYVETS, Raytheon's employee group for veterans and those who support them. After 24 years in the Air Force, she started a new career at Raytheon. "I wanted to go where people would support me," she told us.









Rewards




401(k) / Retirement Plans
Employer Matching, if you elect to enroll company matches up to 3%.



Work / Life Balance
Raytheon supports a variety of flexible work arrangements including compressed work weeks, flextime, job sharing, 9/80, reduced hours and telecommuting.



Career Development
At Raytheon, we foster an inclusive culture of professional development. We support a variety of developmental opportunities including: Mentoring programs, Skills Development, Leadership Development, Rotational job assignments, and Continuous Improvement, all of which contribute to advancement of our employee’s capabilities.



Paid Time Off
Accrue paid time off monthly. Receive 10-12 holidays per year with some locations shutting down the week between Christmas and New Year’s Day.



Relocation Assistance
Select technical positions are eligible for relocation packages. See specific job description for eligibility requirements.



Parental Leave
Raytheon offers all eligible employees up to three weeks paid parental leave for the birth or adoption of a child (separate from paid maternity leave or Family & Medical Leave Act).
