If you’re ready to take on a fresh challenge, grow your career and contribute to making the world a safer place, Raytheon is ready to help you achieve your goals. Join our team and get the opportunity and support to find purpose, thrive and succeed.





Notice: Please be aware of suspicious recruiting emails and text messages that attempt to collect your confidential information. Raytheon conducts all electronic correspondence using e-mail addresses that end in “Raytheon.com”, “Raytheon.co.uk”, “Raytheon.com.au” or “brassring.com”. To report fraud please go to: https://www.ic3.gov.











Eng Logistics Specialist I-Tomahawk TOMIS Repair Administrator
Tucson, Arizona


Apply





Overview
Responsibilities
Success Profile
Rewards
Trending




Overview

What does it take to make the world a safer place? It takes delivering innovative technology and collaborating with some of the finest talent in the engineering field. Whether you’re a software engineer or a mechanical engineer, at Raytheon you’ll grow a varied and rewarding career. And you’ll be supported with a comprehensive and competitive benefits package that promotes work/life. If you’re ready to take on today’s big challenges, discover a world of opportunity at Raytheon.

America’s Best Large Employers by Forbes
Career & Development Opportunities
Full-time
Entry, Mid, Senior level




Back to Job Navigation (Overview)


Responsibilities


JOB DESCRIPTION: The Whole Life Systems Engineering (WLSE) Directorate is responsible for ensuring our products are Safe, Reliable, Maintainable, under configuration control and delivered on time.  WLSE consists of multiple disciplines that support engineering, our program offices and our customers.  WLSE disciplines participate in the total life cycle of our products from conception to deactivation.  WLSE’s charter is focused in two main areas; product support and technical data support.  In the product support area, the Departments include Reliability Engineering, System Safety, Mission Support and Lifecycle Engineering.  On the technical data side, the Departments are Hardware Configuration Management and Integrated Design Check (CM/IDC), Software Configuration Management (SWCM), and Data Management, Engineering Support and Execution (DEX).We are looking for an experienced leader to serve as the Tomahawk TOMIS Repair Administrator within the WLSE Mission Support Department, located in Tucson, AZ.The Repair Administrator is a subset of Sustainment Management that focuses heavily on asset repair activities and Government Furnished Property (GFP) accounting. The goal of this role is to support the Sustainment Management charter of carrying out product support strategies to achieve affordable operational readiness consistent with Warfighter objectives from the development, production, sustainment, and disposal of the entire system.Job Responsibilities: Maintain and update the Tomahawk Navy TOMIS database with configuration changes, missile/component status, location transfers, and other maintenance activitiesReport and communicate system status to upper managementSupport the Tomahawk Sustainment Manager as necessary to perform contractual requirementsAnalyze data from various databases (PRISM, CABS, TOMIS, etc.) in order to ensure systemic integrity and adequate reporting capabilitiesWork in cross-functional teams to support the factory in repairing hardware returned for Warranty or non-Warranty repair.Analyze, report and drive improvements to depot / program service metrics (turnaround times, availability reporting with Reliability U.S. Citizenship status is required as this position will need a U.S. Security Clearance within 1 year of start dateRequired Skills, Education, and Experience:US Citizenship is required.Bachelors of Science (or Bachelors of Arts) degree in: Engineering, Business Administration, Supply Chain management, Logistics, or related field.2+ years of (ILS) Integrated Logistics Support experience, executing ILS, depot, and, sustainment activitiesProficiency with computers and Microsoft Office productsDESIRED EDUCATION, EXPERIENCE, AND SKILLS: Existing DoD Secret clearanceCurrent or previous experience with factory / depot repair processesUS Navy Logistics experienceExtensive knowledge of PRISM, CABS and TOMISDemonstrated understanding of RMS products and processes including other WLSE disciplinesExcellent cross-boundary communication skills (verbal and written), organizational, and people skillsDemonstrated ability to work independently; a highly motivated self-starter, including ability for sound decision making and creative problem solvingResults driven and detail oriented work habitsEffective task management and time management skillsSome knowledge of Government contracts, specifications, and regulationsCheck us out on YouTube:Raytheon Company OverviewAre you ready to be remarkable with Raytheon?We Stand OutThis position requires the eligibility to obtain a security clearance.  Non-US citizens may not be eligible to obtain a security clearance.  The Defense Industrial Security Clearance Office (DISCO), an agency of the Department of Defense, handles and adjudicates the security clearance process.  Security clearance factors include, but are not limited to, allegiance to the US, foreign influence, foreign preference, criminal conduct, security violations and drug involvement.  Employment is contingent on other factors, including, but not limited to, background checks and drug screens.  Additional information can be found here: All About Security Clearances 151105
Business Unit Profile
                        
                        Raytheon Missile Systems (RMS) is the world leader in the design, development and production of missile systems for critical requirement including air-to-air, strike, surface Navy air defense, land combat missiles, guided projectiles, exoatmospheric kill vehicles, missile defense and directed energy weapons.  RMS is headquartered in Tucson, Arizona with over 11,000 employees operating at sites across the country and internationally.
Relocation Eligible 
                        
                        Yes

Quote



Felicia Jackson is regional vice president of RAYVETS, Raytheon's employee group for veterans and those who support them. After 24 years in the Air Force, she started a new career at Raytheon. "I wanted to go where people would support me," she told us.









Rewards




401(k) / Retirement Plans
Employer Matching, if you elect to enroll company matches up to 3%.



Work / Life Balance
Raytheon supports a variety of flexible work arrangements including compressed work weeks, flextime, job sharing, 9/80, reduced hours and telecommuting.



Career Development
At Raytheon, we foster an inclusive culture of professional development. We support a variety of developmental opportunities including: Mentoring programs, Skills Development, Leadership Development, Rotational job assignments, and Continuous Improvement, all of which contribute to advancement of our employee’s capabilities.



Paid Time Off
Accrue paid time off monthly. Receive 10-12 holidays per year with some locations shutting down the week between Christmas and New Year’s Day.



Relocation Assistance
Select technical positions are eligible for relocation packages. See specific job description for eligibility requirements.



Parental Leave
Raytheon offers all eligible employees up to three weeks paid parental leave for the birth or adoption of a child (separate from paid maternity leave or Family & Medical Leave Act).

            Associate Technical Account Manager



         Login to apply
    
















Associate Technical Account Manager
Atlanta, GA 


The Associate Technical Account Manager is responsible for ensuring client satisfaction for assigned portfolios at a community and corporate contact level.  This role is responsible for training, support, problem solving, overseeing monthly production, and promoting additional services to clients as applicable.
RESPONSIBILITIES

Training properties and clients on Yardi’s utility billing and utility expense management tools.
Ongoing support and follow-up with the community as well as the regional/corporate level to ensure the success of the billing and expense management programs. 
Act as project manager for clients on all issue resolution and special project items, to include: regular interaction with other departments to coordinate resolution for clients.
Perform portfolio analysis of key performance indicators (KPIs) for their portfolios to determine areas of improvement to help ensure service delivery accuracy and increase revenues.  Analysis used to identify issues with properties and possible add-on services.
Ensures that each community and regional/corporate contact in their portfolios is satisfied with the billing program via the review and analysis of KPIs coupled with regular communications on findings with clients.
Assist portfolios to increase their performance (i.e. training on user interface(s), utilization of available reporting and functions, move ins/move outs, late notices).
Responsible for working with and supporting the Implementation Team to ensure the quality and consistency of the setup of their clients/properties within the billing and expense management systems.
Responsible for owner/management changeover as well as cancellation processes for accounts within their portfolio.
Assist in coordinating and ensuring quality of all customized corporate reports. Responsible for sending to client and providing assistance with analysis.
Responsible for providing and coordinating Interdepartmental support concerning client issues and EDI implementations.
Responsible for assisting the Field Operation’s Department in ensuring a high level of performance with regards to the maintenance of systems within a portfolio.
Responsible for overseeing the monthly billing and expense management services for assigned communities, entering cases and escalating client issues as appropriate.
Works closely with Legal when necessary to address client needs and concerns. 

EDUCATION/ESSENTIAL SKILLS/ EXPERIENCE 

High school diploma or equivalent
BA or BS preferred
Minimum of 3 years of experience in a fast-paced customer service environment, preferably in a technical, property management or other industry related field
PC literate: MS Excel, Word, PowerPoint and Outlook a must
Excellent command of the English language, i.e. grammar and vocabulary
Excellent presentation skills; presentation design preferred
Training experience an asset
Superb communication skills both verbally and in writing required
First-rate problem-solving skills and diplomacy essential
Strong detailed orientation and excellent organizational skills
Ability to work effectively in a high quality, deadline driven environment
Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to work effectively with a team
Regional/Property Management experience preferred
Familiarity with accounting and utility billing principles preferred
Yardi Voyager experience preferred 

                                                                                             *lm

Privacy Overview

This website uses cookies so that we can provide you with the best user experience possible. Cookie information is stored in your browser and performs functions such as recognising you when you return to our website and helping our team to understand which sections of the website you find most interesting and useful.
You can adjust all of your cookie settings by navigating the tabs on the left hand side.



 
Strictly Necessary Cookies

Strictly necessary cookies must be enabled at all times in order to login and apply to openings.



disable









If you disable this cookie, we will not be able to save your preferences and you will not be able to login to apply for openings. This means that every time you visit this website you will need to enable or disable cookies again.







3rd Party Cookies

This website uses Google Analytics to collect anonymous information such as the number of visitors to the site, and the most popular pages.
Keeping this cookie enabled helps us to improve our website.



disable









Please enable Strictly Necessary Cookies first so that we can save your preferences!

Customer Experience Manager  (98596) - Richardson, TX - Inogen, Inc. Jobs








 














Home
Jobs




Customer Experience Manager  (98596) - Richardson, TX

Toggle navigation








Customer Experience Manager  (98596) 

JobsLogin 












 Customer Care Center Richardson, TX, USA Full Time 



Email Me Similar Jobs Email Me This Job



ABOUT INOGEN Inogen was founded in 2001 to improve quality of life and increase freedom and independence for oxygen therapy users. Inogen is innovation in oxygen therapy. The Inogen mission is to improve freedom and independence for oxygen therapy patients through innovative products and services. Inogen is a manufacturer and Accredited Homecare Provider.
Inogen is focused on quality care, continuous improvement, and outstanding customer satisfaction. We are a stable, USA based company dedicated to providing an exciting and rewarding career to our employees. We completed a successful Initial Public Offering on the NASDAQ in 2014 and have demonstrated substantial growth over the last five years. Our work environment is casual yet high performing, and we are looking for seriously talented, motivated, and fast-paced professionals to join our team.
JOB DESCRIPTION 
The Customer Care Manager oversees the daily functions of the Customer Care Center team(s) and initiatives. This role will have oversight of inbound telephone and omni channel service experience enquiries over internet, email, mail etc. that will help address the needs of the patients regarding inquiries, supply sales, replacement orders, returns, technical trouble shooting and repair orders. The Customer Care Manager will manage the Customer Care Center team(s) to ensure the needs of the customer are expeditiously and accurately addressed with emphasis on first time resolution. This role also have project management responsibilities in managing technology and process improvement initiatives that will promote customer experience and cost efficiency improvements. The role requires managing through cross functional needs and frequent executive communication.
Key Competencies:
Responsible for selection, hiring, training and development of departmental staff.
Ensures department staff has all necessary information needed to provide technical support to end-users for Inogen products.
Utilize key performance indicators to manage to budget responsibilities associated with Customer Care Center technical support functions.
Develop and maintain new-hire training materials, program and evaluation tools.
Utilize and lead workforce management tools and resources to ensure adequate and optimum staffing across service intervals and agent efficiency.
Manage automated phone systems, tracking volumes, after hours usage, scripting and workgroup management.
Manage and promote call quality initiatives to improve CSAT and agent quality scores.
Maintain and keep current all departmental scripting, training and comprehensive testing materials.
Capture and download data to fulfill departmental metric reporting.
Provide routine analysis on call volume and offline work fluctuations to appraise executives of trends in product quality deficiency and customer preference changes.
Manage CRM and workforce management tool utilization to improve first call resolution and reduce repeat calls.
Manage cross-functional feedback to advocate for the needs of the patients (voice of customer) and promote inter-departmental collaboration.
Manager customer experience initiatives and projects that drive continuous improvement for better service, automation and cost efficiency.
Multi-site management and 25% travel.
Maintain regular and punctual attendance. 
Comply with all company policies and procedures. 
Assist with any other duties as assigned.
 
Do you possess these abilities?
Demonstrate critical thinking, problem solving, decision making, sound judgement and assertiveness as needed.
Strong relationship building and interpersonal skills in working with internal and external customers.
Ability to work self-manage and work independently.
Ability to thrive in a dynamically changing organization.
Excellent management skills, both of individuals as well as projects.
Excellent oral and written communication skills required and ability to tailor those to the audience across front line reps all the way to an executive level audience.
Attention to detail is required.
Effective conflict resolution skills.
Excellent planning and organizational skills.
Ability to effectively interface with different departments within the company.
Ability to articulate and promote data driven decision making.
Requirements:
Bachelor's degree in Business, English, Communications or related field, required. 
7 years' experience of Customer Services, Call Center Management, required. 
2 years management experience, with a minimum of five direct reports, required. 
3 years of Omni-channel customer experience management, preferred.
5 years of healthcare customer service or technical support experience, preferred.
Advance knowledge/proficiency in workforce management tools (Avaya, CISCO, Monet, New Voice media) CRM automation (salesforce, oracle etc.) and intermediate proficiency with Microsoft office tools required.
A combination of training, education and experience that is equivalent to the qualifications listed above and that provides the required knowledge, skills, and abilities.
 
WHY INOGEN Inogen is a dynamic company that is not only focused on quality care of patients, but is also committed to being a top employer.  Each of Inogen' s offices have a casual culture that supports employees being responsible and developing professionals.
We offer competitive salaries and a robust benefit package:
Employee Stock Purchase Plan 401 (K) plan available for all employees Health, dental, vision insurance Flexible spending accounts and wellness discount program Life Insurance Long Term Disability Robust paid time off and 8 paid holidays Employee Assistance Program
See the Inogen Team in action:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dKoTMeJf5J4
 
Inogen Where we go to work hard to positively impact people's lives
 
Inogen is an equal opportunity employer.  We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other legally protected characteristics. The EEO is the Law poster and its supplement are available here: http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/ofccpost.htm; http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/OFCCP_EEO_Supplement_Final_JRF_QA_508c.pdf.  The pay transparency policy is available here: http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/pdf/EO13665_PrescribedNondiscriminationPostingLanguage_JRFQA508c.pdf. 
Inogen is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities.  If you need a reasonable accommodation because of a disability for any part of the employment process, please send an e-mail to recruiting@inogen.net or call (972) 616-5668 and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information.
 
 

Inogen, Inc.

            Associate Technical Account Manager



         Login to apply
    
















Associate Technical Account Manager
Long Island, NY 


Associate Technical Account Managers at Yardi will provide consultative, implementation and technical support to a group of assigned Yardi clients in order to manage business operations and financial accounting functions in Yardi’s Voyager software.
Responsibilities

Implements the Yardi suite of software products by assisting clients with system implementation, training, and technical support
Researches, analyzes and resolves software issues
Supports software product customization based on client requirements
Performs data mapping and conversions
Performs system and business process reviews and other service reviews and makes recommendations on best practices
Works on a regular basis with Yardi internal resource teams to include: training, conversion, sales and development

Requirements

Bachelor’s degree in Economics, Business, Math, Statistics or Information Management preferred
Experience setting and managing client expectations
Superior verbal and written communication skills
Project Management, Accounting, or Property Management experience/background
Solid Proficiency in MS Office Suite and Outlook
Knowledge in three of the following areas: Property Management, Accounting, Microsoft Windows, Technical Support, SQL, HTML/ASP
Prior experience with property management software or real estate software highly desirable
Prior experience with Yardi software highly desirable
Regular attendance and a regular work schedule is an essential function of this job

                                                                                              *bd

Privacy Overview

This website uses cookies so that we can provide you with the best user experience possible. Cookie information is stored in your browser and performs functions such as recognising you when you return to our website and helping our team to understand which sections of the website you find most interesting and useful.
You can adjust all of your cookie settings by navigating the tabs on the left hand side.



 
Strictly Necessary Cookies

Strictly necessary cookies must be enabled at all times in order to login and apply to openings.



disable









If you disable this cookie, we will not be able to save your preferences and you will not be able to login to apply for openings. This means that every time you visit this website you will need to enable or disable cookies again.







3rd Party Cookies

Keeping this cookie enabled helps us to improve our website.

If you’re ready to take on a fresh challenge, grow your career and contribute to making the world a safer place, Raytheon is ready to help you achieve your goals. Join our team and get the opportunity and support to find purpose, thrive and succeed.





Notice: Please be aware of suspicious recruiting emails and text messages that attempt to collect your confidential information. Raytheon conducts all electronic correspondence using e-mail addresses that end in “Raytheon.com”, “Raytheon.co.uk”, “Raytheon.com.au” or “brassring.com”. To report fraud please go to: https://www.ic3.gov.











Sr Multi-Disciplined Eng II
Indianapolis, Indiana


Apply





Overview
Responsibilities
Success Profile
Rewards
Trending




Overview

What does it take to make the world a safer place? It takes delivering innovative technology and collaborating with some of the finest talent in the engineering field. Whether you’re a software engineer or a mechanical engineer, at Raytheon you’ll grow a varied and rewarding career. And you’ll be supported with a comprehensive and competitive benefits package that promotes work/life. If you’re ready to take on today’s big challenges, discover a world of opportunity at Raytheon.

America’s Best Large Employers by Forbes
Career & Development Opportunities
Full-time
Entry, Mid, Senior level




Back to Job Navigation (Overview)


Responsibilities


Are you looking for an engineering career that is challenging and satisfying? Then join our Raytheon team of engineers solving problems that make the world a safer place and help to secure our great nation! Come support those who provide us with all the freedoms we enjoy.We offer great benefits that include medical, dental, vision, 401K match, flexible work schedule - just to name a few.  Click here to view a brief video and learn more: https://youtu.be/YNuZN0vyzHgRaytheon Intelligence, Information and Services (IIS) delivers innovative technology to make the world a safer place. Our expertise in cyber, analytics and automation allow us to reach beyond what others think is possible to underpin national security and give our global customers unique solutions to solve the most pressing modern challenges -- from the cyber domain to automated operations, and from intelligent transportation solutions to creating clear insight from large volumes of data. IIS operates at nearly 550 sites in 80 countries, including a large presence in Indianapolis, IN. As a global business, our leaders must have the ability to understand, embrace and operate in a multicultural world -- in the marketplace and the workplace. We strive to hire people who reflect our communities and embrace diversity and inclusion to advance our culture, develop our employees, and grow our business.At Raytheon engineers focus on technology, innovation and Mission Assurance for existing and evolving customer mission needs in the areas of Air, Land, Sea, Space and Cyber for all markets. The Hardware Engineering Technical Lead at Raytheon develops technical roadmaps, writes technical proposals, and works with business development as well as all engineering disciplines to support a broad range of technical areas such as situational awareness, communications, border surveillance products, avionics, munitions and electro-optic infra-red (EOIR). Sample programs include the F-16, F-18, CH-53 and HH-60 aircraft displays and upgrades, ground vehicle displays, bomb racks, V-22 Lab capability upgrades, as well as launchers and pods on multiple platforms. This HW Technical Lead will also provide technical leadership on integrated product teams (IPTs). This role involves the integration of many areas of knowledge and expertise to create and support complex systems and requires a broad based understanding of the different areas of design. In addition this role at times will encompass leading design reviews and working with manufacturing to ensure the best possible product is delivered to the war fighter.At Raytheon, Customer Success is Our Mission. US Citizenship is required due to the candidate needing to obtain and maintain a US Security Clearance.Required Skills:•Broad based technical background with the ability to lead complex technical programs•Excellent communication skills, both oral and written, with the ability to communicate with all levels of the organization•Technical leadership capabilities, includes the ability to lead the resolution of tough technical challenges•Ability to build teams with diverse skill sets, acting at highest level of their discipline•Ability maintain high performance in a highly dynamic, team based environment•Experience developing technology roadmaps•Experience working with the front end of the business; working with business development to capture new work•Proven experience leading front end of the business type programs•Experience developing proposals•Ability to obtain and maintain a US Government Secret Security Clearance US Citizenship required•Six (6) years of related experience requiredDesired Skills:•Advanced technical degree•Experience in proposal writing including cost estimation•Knowledge of design practices•Ability to assimilate inputs from multiple sources and derive design and operational requirements•Capability to apply robust design principlesRequired Education:Requires a degree in Science, Technology, Engineering or Mathematics (STEM) and six (6) years of related work experience.IISINDY 149724
Business Unit Profile
                        
                        Raytheon Intelligence, Information and Services delivers innovative technology to make the world a safer place. Our expertise in cyber, analytics and automation allow us to reach beyond what others think is possible to underpin national security and give our global customers unique solutions to solve the most pressing modern challenges -- from the cyber domain to automated operations, and from intelligent transportation solutions to creating clear insight from large volumes of data. IIS operates at nearly 550 sites in 80 countries, and is headquartered in Dulles, Virginia. The business area generated $6.1 billion in 2017 revenues. As a global business, our leaders must have the ability to understand, embrace and operate in a multicultural world -- in the marketplace and the workplace. We strive to hire people who reflect our communities and embrace diversity and inclusion to advance our culture, develop our employees, and grow our business.
Relocation Eligible

Raytheon is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, age, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected Veteran status.

Quote



Felicia Jackson is regional vice president of RAYVETS, Raytheon's employee group for veterans and those who support them. After 24 years in the Air Force, she started a new career at Raytheon. "I wanted to go where people would support me," she told us.









Rewards




401(k) / Retirement Plans
Employer Matching, if you elect to enroll company matches up to 3%.



Work / Life Balance
Raytheon supports a variety of flexible work arrangements including compressed work weeks, flextime, job sharing, 9/80, reduced hours and telecommuting.



Career Development
At Raytheon, we foster an inclusive culture of professional development. We support a variety of developmental opportunities including: Mentoring programs, Skills Development, Leadership Development, Rotational job assignments, and Continuous Improvement, all of which contribute to advancement of our employee’s capabilities.



Paid Time Off
Accrue paid time off monthly. Receive 10-12 holidays per year with some locations shutting down the week between Christmas and New Year’s Day.



Relocation Assistance
Select technical positions are eligible for relocation packages. See specific job description for eligibility requirements.



Parental Leave
Raytheon offers all eligible employees up to three weeks paid parental leave for the birth or adoption of a child (separate from paid maternity leave or Family & Medical Leave Act).

            Junior Account Executive



         Login to apply
    
















Junior Account Executive
Long Island, NY 


The Junior Account Executive, Inside Sales will work to effectively develop a multi-state territory, successfully acquire new accounts, develop and manage a well-balanced sales pipeline and meet monthly/annual sales goals.
Responsibilities 

Lead generation and qualification
Fielding, qualifying and closing inbound sale inquires
Prospecting and telephone marketing for new prospect clients
Creating, tracking, closing and reporting results of sales opportunities in yCRM
Learn and master company software product offerings
Conducting online presentations and product demonstrations
Communicating via phone and email correspondence with prospective clients
Nurturing sales opportunities through the entire sales cycle to close
Providing information and generating interest in conference participation and other related events
Managing weekly/monthly activity to support sales goals
Work effectively with other teams that support the sales process and client satisfaction

Requirement

Bachelor’s degree in Business, Accounting or related degree
Ability to cold call and develop leads
Ability to generate a sales pipeline and close sales
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Superior phone skills
Technical aptitude and the ability to successfully demonstrate software
Ability to show product features and benefits
High level of professionalism and ethics
Ability to manage multiple priorities in a fast paced environment
A background in software sales, web ads sales, accounting systems, or experience in the property management industry highly desirable

*bd

 Privacy Overview


 Strictly Necessary Cookies


 3rd Party Cookies




 








Privacy Overview

This website uses cookies so that we can provide you with the best user experience possible. Cookie information is stored in your browser and performs functions such as recognising you when you return to our website and helping our team to understand which sections of the website you find most interesting and useful.
You can adjust all of your cookie settings by navigating the tabs on the left hand side.



 
Strictly Necessary Cookies

Strictly necessary cookies must be enabled at all times in order to login and apply to openings.



disable









If you disable this cookie, we will not be able to save your preferences and you will not be able to login to apply for openings. This means that every time you visit this website you will need to enable or disable cookies again.







3rd Party Cookies

This website uses Google Analytics to collect anonymous information such as the number of visitors to the site, and the most popular pages.
Keeping this cookie enabled helps us to improve our website.



disable









Please enable Strictly Necessary Cookies first so that we can save your preferences!

            Associate Technical Account Manager



         Login to apply
    
















Associate Technical Account Manager
Oxnard, CA 


The Associate Technical Account Manager assists clients with the Setup, Configuration and Operation of Automated pricing within Multifamily industry.
Responsibilities 

Determines operational objectives by reviewing with client Asset goals and objectives
Conduct weekly calls with clients reviewing pricing performance and providing recommendations
Monitors project progress by tracking activity; resolving problems; publishing progress reports; recommending actions
Provides references for users by; providing help desk support; training users
Maintains user confidence and protects operations by keeping information confidential
Prepares technical reports by collecting, analyzing, and summarizing information and trends
Maintains professional and technical knowledge by attending educational workshops; reviewing professional publications; establishing personal networks; benchmarking state-of-the-art practices; participating in professional societies
Contributes to team effort by accomplishing related results as needed 

Requirements

A strong record of professional success, including at least 3 years of client-facing experience
A minimum of 3 years of Property Management and/or Revenue Management in the Multifamily industry (Preferred)
Superior client-facing skills
Excellent written and verbal communication skills and comfortable in client environments
Strong client focus, excellent teamwork abilities, integrity, and relationship-building skills
Demonstrated track record of goal achievement
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent higher-level client management experience

            Real Estate Market Analyst I



         Login to apply
    
















Real Estate Market Analyst I
Scottsdale, AZ 


The Real Estate Market Analyst I is responsible for acquiring, tracking, verifying commercial real estate property information into the Yardi Matrix database. Researcher will have specific guidelines of information to gather pertaining to a market. Research include, but are not limited to, new developments, apartment communities, distressed property status; ownership, and financial information on each commercial real estate property. 
Full-time work hours are 7am-4pm. 
Responsibilities

Comprehension of Yardi Matrix procedures and definitions, including data entry for all commercial asset classes.
Outbound calls to gather accurate information.
Usage of creative problem solving techniques and ability to think outside of the box in order to obtain information objectives.
Ability to build and maintain a rapport with prospective callers in order to continue future relationships.
Internet researching to identify potential call leads and gather possible targeted information. 

Requirements

High School diploma.  College degree optional.
One plus years of relevant work experience
High volume outbound calling experience.
Strong attention to detail and ability to multi-task in a fast paced environment.
Excellent Internet navigation skills.
Strong verbal/written communication skills.
Strong data entry and typing skills.
Ability to accept direction, follow instruction and receive constructive feedback; positive attitude.
Strong proficiency in Microsoft Office.
Ability to work at a tactical level while maintaining a clear understanding of the broad view.
Ability to work independently, manage time effectively and prioritize work tasks.
Attend meetings and perform tasks for long periods of time on a computer and on the telephone.
Regular attendance and a regular work schedule is an essential function of this job
Experience in the Real Estate field desired, i.e. property management, financial services, real estate appraisal, sales and construction.
Call surveys or other call center experience preferred.

                                                                                                   *bd

            Associate Technical Account Manager



         Login to apply
    
















Associate Technical Account Manager
Santa Barbara, CA 


Associate Technical Account Managers at Yardi will provide technical and implementation support to a group of assigned Yardi clients in order to help the clients manage business operations and financial accounting functions in Yardi’s Voyager software.
Responsibilities

Provide technical support, implementation support and online training to assist clients with system implementation
Researches, analyzes and provides resolution to software issues
Supports software product customization based on client requirements
Assists with data mapping and conversions
Performs system and business process reviews and other service reviews and makes recommendations on best practices
Works on a regular basis with Yardi internal resource teams to include: training, conversion, sales and development

Preferred Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree preferred
Experience setting and managing client expectations
Superior verbal and written communication skills
Solid proficiency with in MS Office Suite and Outlook
Background or experience in three of  the following areas: Property Management, Accounting, Project Management, Microsoft Windows, Technical Support, SQL, HTML/ ASP
Prior experience with Yardi or other property management software or real estate software highly desirable
Regular attendance and a regular work schedule is an essential function of this job

*eo

            Associate Account Executive



         Login to apply
    
















Associate Account Executive
Raleigh, NC 


          This entry level opportunity as an Associate Account Executive will work to effectively develop a multi-state territory through cold calling prospects, developing a solid sales pipeline and closing sales deals.Responsibilities include:• Lead generation and qualification• Fielding, qualifying and closing inbound sale inquires• Prospecting and telephone marketing for new prospect clients• Creating, tracking, closing and reporting results of sales opportunities in yCRM• Learn and master company software product offerings• Conducting online presentations and product demonstrations• Communicating via phone and email correspondence with prospective clients• Nurturing sales opportunities through the entire sales cycle to close• Providing information and generating interest in conference participation and other related events• Managing weekly/monthly activity to support sales goals• Work effectively with other teams that support the sales process and client satisfactionThis position will require the following background and skills:• Bachelor’s degree• Ability to do high volume cold calls and develop leads• Ability to generate a sales pipeline and close sales• Excellent verbal and written communication skills• Superior phone skills• Technical aptitude and the ability to successfully demonstrate software• Ability to show product features and benefits• High level of professionalism and ethics• Ability to manage multiple priorities in a fast paced environment• A background in software sales, web ads sales, accounting systems, or experience in the property management industry highly desirable but not required*cl

disable









If you disable this cookie, we will not be able to save your preferences and you will not be able to login to apply for openings. This means that every time you visit this website you will need to enable or disable cookies again.







3rd Party Cookies

This website uses Google Analytics to collect anonymous information such as the number of visitors to the site, and the most popular pages.
Keeping this cookie enabled helps us to improve our website.



disable









Please enable Strictly Necessary Cookies first so that we can save your preferences!

            Software Development Engineer I



         Login to apply
    
















Software Development Engineer I
Atlanta, GA 


Under immediate supervision, the Software Development Engineer I analyzes, modifies and debugs existing applications. Responsibilities also include testing, communicating and implementing defect resolutions.
Responsibilities

Modifies, implements, and maintains an existing application to established standards, specifications and approved changes
Performs maintenance programming for existing versions
Uses corporate approved CRM systems to track cases, defects and resolutions
Explains defect resolutions to the Team Leader
Uses corporate approved integrated development environment (e.g., Visual Studios, Eclipse) to implement defect resolutions
Performs unit testing on his/her defect resolutions to ensure accuracy, integrity, interoperability and completeness to achieve desired results
Analyzes and documents reasons for test failures, and revises/debugs assigned programs and/or procedures as necessary
Learns and increases knowledge of a single domain and best practices
Expands technical and industry expertise
Uses corporate approved sourced control applications (e.g., Microsoft Team Foundations) to maintain code changes
Adheres to Department policies, procedures and standards in the development and implementation of software

Requirements

Bachelor’s degree in Computer/Engineering Science or equivalent experience
Independent problem solving and analysis skills
Clear, effective verbal and written communication skills
Good time management skills
Ability to meet critical deadlines and prioritize multiple tasks in a fast-paced environment
Collegial, team-oriented disposition with the desire and ability to establish cooperative working relationships with employees at all levels within Yardi, outside Yardi and with clients
Regular attendance and a regular work schedule is an essential function of this job

*lw

            Associate Technical Account Manager



         Login to apply
    
















Associate Technical Account Manager
Dallas, TX 


Associate Technical Account Managers at Yardi will provide consultative, implementation and technical support to a group of assigned Yardi clients in order to manage business operations and financial accounting functions in Yardi’s Voyager software.
Responsibilities

Implements the Yardi suite of software products by assisting clients with system implementation, training, and technical support
Researches, analyzes and resolves software issues
Supports software product customization based on client requirements
Performs data mapping and conversions
Performs system and business process reviews and other service reviews and makes recommendations on best practices
Works on a regular basis with Yardi internal resource teams to include: training, conversion, sales and development

Requirements

Bachelor’s degree in Economics, Business, Math, Statistics or Information Management preferred
Experience setting and managing client expectations
Superior verbal and written communication skills
Project Management, Accounting, or Property Management experience/background
Solid Proficiency in MS Office Suite and Outlook
Knowledge in three of the following areas: Property Management, Accounting, Microsoft Windows, Technical Support, SQL, HTML/ASP
Prior experience with property management software or real estate software highly desirable
Prior experience with Yardi software highly desirable
Regular attendance and a regular work schedule is an essential function of this job

            Customer Service Agent



         Login to apply
    
















Customer Service Agent
Santa Ana, CA 


As a Customer Service Agent for our Insurance Division, you will be responsible for supporting policy holders with any questions on the policy, billing, and other purchases. You will also act as a liaison between our Insurance Division and the property management staff, regarding anything policy-related. We are seeking energetic and professional customer service professionals who want to join this high-volume support team! 
RESPONSIBILITIES:

Assumes responsibility for answering approximately 40 inbound calls per day
Provides customer service for policy holders in regards to policy questions, billing matters and policy purchases
Provide account support to management companies, their respective community onsite employees and insurance policy holders (residents)
Assists residents, management and leasing staff with any policy questions or concerns
Act as a liaison between the insurance division and management staff
Support Insurance Group with website maintenance
Perform special projects as assigned
Regular attendance and a regular work schedule is an essential function of this job  

EDUCATION:

**Insurance Agent License (Property & Casualty), Required**
High school diploma or equivalent required
Bachelor’s degree preferred  

SKILLS/ABILITIES:

Proficient typing skills.
Bilingual, Preferred
Good interpersonal and public relations skills.
Solid analytical, creative, and problem-solving abilities.
Project management skills and well organized.
Able to work well independently.
Able to assist, direct, and coordinate others

            Marketing Campaigns Specialist



         Login to apply
    
















Marketing Campaigns Specialist
Santa Barbara, CA 


The Marketing Campaigns Specialist for Investment Management (IM) is responsible for developing and continually managing marketing strategy and executing marketing activities related to Yardi’s Investment Management solutions. This individual will leverage their existing industry knowledge and collaborate with a variety of departments to develop corporate and external product marketing strategies. As the IM marketing expert, the Marketing Campaign Specialist will interact closely with Industry Principals, Sales Vice Presidents and key product stakeholders to learn Yardi’s IM product functionality, develop skills for doing product demonstrations and participate in all product development for managing new product(s) or features going to market with all necessary messaging and collateral.
 
Responsibilities

Collaborate with sales, product development and stakeholders to align and continually review and evolve sales and marketing strategy
Deliver annual marketing strategy and plan and contribute to sales strategy and plan for the assigned product/market
Understand client and prospect base and develop effective sales and marketing messages
Identify and develop strong calls to action to help generate leads and manage the prospect funnel for desired results
Leverage various systems to coordinate production and delivery of IM marketing collateral
Understand Yardi corporate culture, messaging and brand
Track and analyze effectiveness of IM marketing and content
Communicate and collaborate often and well with project and product stakeholders
Oversee marketing efforts (e.g., messaging, promos) and strategy related to IM-specific events

 
Requirements

Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Communications, or related field
A minimum of 3 years of marketing experience is required
Experience in commercial real estate and investment management is preferred
Experience in a business to business (B2B) marketing organization
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Excellent attention to detail, proof-reading and editing skills
Excellent project management skills and the ability to manage multiple, competing priorities
Excellent interpersonal and relationship management skills
Excellent organizational skills
Experience using marketing software (project management, CRM, website CMS) preferred
Strong research and analytical skills
Resourceful and creative problem-solver
Marketing- and sales-oriented outlook
Ability to work independently as well in collaboration with others
Determination and self-motivation
Positive and professional work attitude
Ability to work overtime if necessary to meet deadlines
Experience in enterprise software is ideal
Experience in the real estate industry is a plus
Proficient in Office 365, specifically Word, Excel and PowerPoint

*jh

            Help Desk Specialist



         Login to apply
    
















Help Desk Specialist
Waltham, MA 


As an IT Helpdesk Specialist, you will be responsible for:

Responding to requests for technical assistance in person, via phone, or electronically
Installing software and updating hardware
Diagnosing and resolving technical hardware and software issues
Researching questions using available information resources
Advising users on appropriate actions
Following standard helpdesk procedures
Logging all helpdesk interactions
Administering helpdesk software
Re-directing problems to the appropriate resource 

The ideal candidate will possess the following skills and abilities:

3-5 years  of experience
Proficiency in Windows 7, Windows 8 and Microsoft Office
Basic Network Troubleshooting skills
PC Imaging
Familiar with mobile device (phone/tablet) setup and use
Excellent customer service skills
Ability to work outside normal business hours if required to include evenings and weekends

            Consultant



         Login to apply
    
















Consultant
Santa Ana, CA 


          The Consultant manages and executes successful Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) deployments and fosters strong client relationships. The consultant provides high-level implementation, training, and professional services to a portfolio of assigned clients (including on-site visits as needed) to manage and utilize the business operation functions in Yardi software products.Responsibilities• Performs complex system and business process reviews and other service reviews (on-site as needed) to identify inefficient processes and makes sound recommendations for client productivity gains• Trains clients and manages continued software integrations, maintenance, and updates in collaboration with clients• Researches, analyzes, and resolves software functionality and reporting problems for clients• Uses positive influence with clients to effectively navigate sensitive client objections, communicate complex and/or sensitive messages, preemptively address potential client concerns, build sustaining alliances with clients, and influence positive outcomes through active counsel• Enlists support from management and peers to address complex client requests and resolve complex issues• Analyzes and interprets client operational needs and determines initial system configuration accordingly• Performs or assists with data mapping and conversion, user training, and other services to ensure successful software deployment• Determines and documents solutions and best practices to contribute to a solutions repository• Advises and institutes best practices relevant to clients in the application of Yardi products• Recognizes and refers opportunities to sell products/services to existing clients• Provides recommendations and informed direction to clients regarding ancillary products and services that align with client business and operational needs and goals• Collaborates internally with analysts, designers, programmers, sales teams, and marketing teams with a focus on meeting client needs and maintaining high-level customer service standards• Performs special projects related to department training and client support as well as other duties as assigned under supervision of Manager**This position requires up to 80% travel**Requirements• Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Finance, Math, or Computer/Engineering Sciences or other equivalent relevant experience in the property management industry• Five plus (5+) years of experience in software or business process consulting or equivalent consulting experience interacting with customers• Three (3) years of experience managing projects on accounting, business process, property management, or real estate software• Experience in ERP systems• Experience positively influencing clients, peers and management• Experience independently managing and resolving a variety client issues• Proven ability to manage projects with multiple touch points• Proven excellent written and verbal communication skills• Proven client-centered commitment and focus• Proven ability to meet critical deadlines and prioritize multiple tasks in a fast-paced environment• Collegial, team-oriented disposition with the desire and ability to establish cooperative working relationships with employees at all levels within Yardi, outside of Yardi, and with clients• Ability to think and act strategically by visualizing new possibilities, challenging assumptions, and recommending the implementation of new ideas or strategies desired• Yardi domain experience a plus• Knowledge of property management industry and Yardi’s competitors a plus• Regular attendance and a regular work schedule are essential functions of this job*bd

If you’re ready to take on a fresh challenge, grow your career and contribute to making the world a safer place, Raytheon is ready to help you achieve your goals. Join our team and get the opportunity and support to find purpose, thrive and succeed.





Notice: Please be aware of suspicious recruiting emails and text messages that attempt to collect your confidential information. Raytheon conducts all electronic correspondence using e-mail addresses that end in “Raytheon.com”, “Raytheon.co.uk”, “Raytheon.com.au” or “brassring.com”. To report fraud please go to: https://www.ic3.gov.











Sr Systems Engineer I
Fullerton, California


Apply





Overview
Responsibilities
Success Profile
Rewards
Trending




Overview

What does it take to make the world a safer place? It takes delivering innovative technology and collaborating with some of the finest talent in the engineering field. Whether you’re a software engineer or a mechanical engineer, at Raytheon you’ll grow a varied and rewarding career. And you’ll be supported with a comprehensive and competitive benefits package that promotes work/life. If you’re ready to take on today’s big challenges, discover a world of opportunity at Raytheon.

America’s Best Large Employers by Forbes
Career & Development Opportunities
Full-time
Entry, Mid, Senior level




Back to Job Navigation (Overview)


Responsibilities


Are you ready to take on a fresh challenge, grow your career and contribute to making the world a safer place? Raytheon is ready to help you achieve your goals. Join our Raytheon Air Traffic Systems engineering team and get the opportunity and support to find purpose, thrive and succeed.  We provide bonus opportunities, great benefits that include medical, dental, vision, 401k match, an award winning wellness program, access to walking trails, outdoor patio and a flexible work schedule - just to name a few.Raytheon Intelligence, Information and Services (IIS) in Fullerton, CA is seeking a qualified systems engineer to support the Joint Precision Approach and Landing System (JPALS) program.  This is an early career engineering position for an individual with educational and/or professional experience in the development of solutions to GPS Navigation Systems.  This individual will be required to run and test modeling and simulation of algorithmic models using Simulink and MATLAB.  The work is highly technical and the individual must be comfortable with documenting equations, derivation and generation of plots in MATLAB.  The individual must be comfortable with data and statistical analysis.The successful candidate must be able to work on individual tasks under limited supervision, or with a team to achieve operational targets and must have the ability to communicate and collaborate with parties within and outside of own job function.  Eventually the candidate may be responsible for helping to provide guidance, coaching and training to other employees within their job area.We are a technology and innovation leader specializing in defense, security and civil markets throughout the world. Our latest company video is about our people, our technology, our vision, and the values we hold dear at Raytheon. Click here to view: https://youtu.be/qvbCgKpkEdsRequired Skills:  Minimum 4 years’ experience working in a collaborative engineering environment (credit for experience will be considered with an advanced degree).Proficiency in MATLAB; code optimization and numerical stabilityExperience performing model driven design using Simulink and automatically generated codeUnderstanding of basic software development principles – configuration control, collaborative development, formal processesUnderstanding of algorithm descriptions, mathematical expressions and derivations, matrix manipulations, outlier analysis, and system level analysisExperience performing data analysis and problem solving (e.g. anomaly investigation)Demonstrable skills in written and oral communicationStrong computer skills, including proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite and SharePointMust be able to obtain and maintain a US DoD secret clearance. Desired Skills:  Experience in the systems engineering disciplineExperience working well in teams and multi-taskingExperience performing complex statistical analysis and/or mathematical modelingWillingness to travel and do field workEducation Requirements: Requires a degree in Science, Technology, Engineering or Mathematics (STEM) and minimum of 4 years of prior relevant experience.This position requires either a U.S. Person or a Non-U.S. Person who is eligible to obtain any required Export Authorization. 152225
Business Unit Profile
                        
                        Intelligence, Information and Services delivers innovative technology to make the world a safer place. Our expertise in cyber, analytics and automation allow us to reach beyond what others think is possible to underpin national security and give our global customers unique solutions to solve the most pressing modern challenges -- from the cyber domain to automated operations, and from intelligent transportation and training solutions to creating clear insight from large volumes of data. IIS operates at nearly 550 sites in 80 countries, and is headquartered in Dulles, Virginia. The business area generated $6.2 billion in 2018 revenues. As a global business, our leaders must have the ability to understand, embrace and operate in a multicultural world -- in the marketplace and the workplace. We strive to hire people who reflect our communities and embrace diversity and inclusion to advance our culture, develop our employees, and grow our business.
Relocation Eligible 
                        
                        Yes
Clearance Type 
                        
                        Secret
Expertise 
                        

                                
                            Aerospace/Aeronautical EngineeringAlgorithmsComputer EngineeringComputer ScienceData NetworkingData ScienceEngineering TechnologyGeneral EngineeringSystems EngineeringTechnical

                        Full Time

                            CA - Fullerton

Felicia Jackson is regional vice president of RAYVETS, Raytheon's employee group for veterans and those who support them. After 24 years in the Air Force, she started a new career at Raytheon. "I wanted to go where people would support me," she told us.









Rewards




401(k) / Retirement Plans
Employer Matching, if you elect to enroll company matches up to 3%.



Work / Life Balance
Raytheon supports a variety of flexible work arrangements including compressed work weeks, flextime, job sharing, 9/80, reduced hours and telecommuting.



Career Development
At Raytheon, we foster an inclusive culture of professional development. We support a variety of developmental opportunities including: Mentoring programs, Skills Development, Leadership Development, Rotational job assignments, and Continuous Improvement, all of which contribute to advancement of our employee’s capabilities.



Paid Time Off
Accrue paid time off monthly. Receive 10-12 holidays per year with some locations shutting down the week between Christmas and New Year’s Day.



Relocation Assistance
Select technical positions are eligible for relocation packages. See specific job description for eligibility requirements.



Parental Leave
Raytheon offers all eligible employees up to three weeks paid parental leave for the birth or adoption of a child (separate from paid maternity leave or Family & Medical Leave Act).

If you’re ready to take on a fresh challenge, grow your career and contribute to making the world a safer place, Raytheon is ready to help you achieve your goals. Join our team and get the opportunity and support to find purpose, thrive and succeed.





Notice: Please be aware of suspicious recruiting emails and text messages that attempt to collect your confidential information. Raytheon conducts all electronic correspondence using e-mail addresses that end in “Raytheon.com”, “Raytheon.co.uk”, “Raytheon.com.au” or “brassring.com”. To report fraud please go to: https://www.ic3.gov.











Systems-Software Engineer – Test Automation
State College, Pennsylvania


Apply





Overview
Responsibilities
Success Profile
Rewards
Trending




Overview

What does it take to make the world a safer place? It takes delivering innovative technology and collaborating with some of the finest talent in the engineering field. Whether you’re a software engineer or a mechanical engineer, at Raytheon you’ll grow a varied and rewarding career. And you’ll be supported with a comprehensive and competitive benefits package that promotes work/life. If you’re ready to take on today’s big challenges, discover a world of opportunity at Raytheon.

America’s Best Large Employers by Forbes
Career & Development Opportunities
Full-time
Entry, Mid, Senior level




Back to Job Navigation (Overview)


Responsibilities


National Defense, Cloud Technologies, Agile Development, DevOps, Big Data, Teamwork … Opportunities at Raytheon span the full product development lifecycle, including new capability development as well as sustainment and enhancement of existing deployed systems.Raytheon Intelligence, Information and Services (IIS) in State College, PA is seeking talented Systems-Software Engineers to support classified programs that develop and enhance integrated sensor, signal processing, complex analytics, and big data systems for Intelligence Community customers.  The successful candidate has excellent written and verbal communication skills, works effectively in a team environment, and is flexible & adaptable to respond to customer mission needs.  Come join Raytheon's team of engineers solving problems that make the world a safer place and help to secure our great nation!  Come support those who provide us with all the freedoms we enjoy.  Click here to view a brief video and learn more about Raytheon: https://youtu.be/8B-k34faFAE.About State College, PAState College is a college town, dominated economically and demographically by the presence of the University Park main campus of The Pennsylvania State University, one of the ten largest public universities in the United States. State College provides access to many cultural and athletic activities & events, and yet is only minutes away from rural Pennsylvania country-side. Many Raytheon State College employees enjoy a commute of 15 minutes or less! Click here to view a brief video and learn more about Raytheon State College:  https://youtu.be/f299m09q0FsCompensation & BenefitsWhile benefits may vary based on business unit, location and/or union status, Raytheon employees receive comprehensive benefits as part of a competitive compensation package. Health and wellness plans are available for you and your eligible children. Other benefits include insurance, education assistance, income protection, investment/retirement and work/life programs.Clearance RequirementsThis position requires eligibility to obtain a TS/SCI security clearance. A current, active TS/SCI or DoD-TS security clearance is highly preferred, and includes a sign-on bonus. U.S. citizenship is required.This position is eligible for a Sign on Bonus up to $40k for a candidate with a current TS/SCI that can be verified and hired at Raytheon. Required Skills: 6+ years of relevant work experienceFamiliarity with engineering processes and techniquesAbility to work effectively on multi-discipline engineering teamsStrong interpersonal, communications, organization, and planning skillsCommitment to quality customer service and on-schedule task completionsAbility to manage time and resources to meet deadlinesProficiency with Microsoft OfficeExperience with DevOps and Continuous IntegrationAbility to generate technical documentation (DoDAF, ICDs, Test Plans & Procedures, etc.)Experience conducting technical research, documenting and presenting resultsExperience with system-level requirements analysis, system design, trade studies, and/or system integration & verificationPassion for quality software, testability & test automationTest Automation experience with Cucumber, Selenium, Gherkin, Perl, Python, etc.Desired Skills: Active TS/SCI or DoD-TS security clearanceExperience with Amazon Web Services (AWS)Knowledge of monitoring, logging and management tools that integrate with AWSExperience with software development on Linux platformsCoursework and/or experience in Systems Engineering, Software Engineering, Infrastructure Engineering and/or Security Engineering.CompTlA Security+ certificationEducation Requirements: This position requires a 4-year bachelor's degree in Science, Technology, Engineering or Mathematics (STEM).This position requires either a U.S. Person or a Non-U.S. Person who is eligible to obtain any required Export Authorization. 150434
Business Unit Profile
                        
                        Raytheon Intelligence, Information and Services delivers innovative technology to make the world a safer place. Our expertise in cyber, analytics and automation allow us to reach beyond what others think is possible to underpin national security and give our global customers unique solutions to solve the most pressing modern challenges -- from the cyber domain to automated operations, and from intelligent transportation and training solutions to creating clear insight from large volumes of data. IIS operates at nearly 550 sites in 80 countries, and is headquartered in Dulles, Virginia. The business area generated $6.2 billion in 2018 revenues. As a global business, our leaders must have the ability to understand, embrace and operate in a multicultural world -- in the marketplace and the workplace. We strive to hire people who reflect our communities and embrace diversity and inclusion to advance our culture, develop our employees, and grow our business.

                        Yes

Sr. Cyber Engineer II (Training and Cyber Range IPT)
Dulles, Virginia


Apply





Overview
Responsibilities
Success Profile
Rewards
Trending




Overview

What does it take to make the world a safer place? It takes delivering innovative technology and collaborating with some of the finest talent in the engineering field. Whether you’re a software engineer or a field engineer, at Raytheon you’ll grow a varied and rewarding career. And you’ll be supported with a comprehensive and competitive benefits package that promotes work/life. If you’re ready to take on today’s big challenges, discover a world of opportunity at Raytheon.

America’s Best Large Employers by Forbes
Career & Development Opportunities
Full-time
Entry, Mid, Senior level




Back to Job Navigation (Overview)


Responsibilities


Would you like to work in a collaborative environment at a state of the art facility in Dulles? Then join our Intelligence, Information and Services (IIS) team of smart people solving problems that make the world a safer place and help to secure our great nation! Come support those who provide us with all the freedoms we enjoy. Our facility in Dulles VA offers amenities that create work and life balance. The Dulles site includes 4 modern facilities with 3 industrial buildings.  On site we have a fitness center plus a fun space with a pool table, foosball and video games. Additionally, employee appreciation lunches, bonus opportunities, and great benefits that include medical, dental, vision, 401K match, flexible work schedules, are just a few of the reasons people come to work at IIS!  If you have the technical knowledge in software engineering and system development (DevOps, Cloud, or Cybersecurity) and the desire to learn and grow in a company with over 60,000 global employees, then IIS is worth the time to explore. Intelligence, Information and Services (IIS) is currently seeking a Cyber Engineer that is a key contributor in the implementation of cyber engineering.  This engineer will be involved throughout the full lifecycle of the development program including CONOPs development, requirements development, architecture, design, integration, test, and certification of products.  Travel may be required to support certification at remote sites as well as various activities during the development phase (short durations; less than 30% of time).  This engineer will support the ongoing business process activities such as metrics collection and analysis, program tailoring, and process documentation updates and deployment.This position will be a direct lead or coordinate sections of High Level Design, Low Level Design, Integration, and Test of Labs for customer delivery.Clearance Requirements:Must be a U.S. CITIZEN with the ability to obtain a Secret security clearance Hires with an Active TS/SCI clearances are eligible for sign-on bonuses of "up to" $40,000.00Required Skills:• Experience in Cyber Range design and/or management• Technical Writing including development of Use Cases, SOPs, or WIs related to Range operational roles and tools/applications• Experience developing and implementing Range Scenarios• Experience configuring, integrating, and/or testing any of the following applications or similar solutions:      ◦ VMWare (vSphere, Horizon, ESXi)      ◦ Cisco CGR1000      ◦ Netscout TestStream Management/nGenius      ◦ Ixia BreakingPoint/PerfectStorm• Experience defining and implementing security requirements based on industry standards• Self-starter, thrives in a small team environment• Demonstrated ability to communicate verbally and in writing• Industry certifications in IT security, forensics, etc.Desired Skills:• Experience with MagicDraw• Experience with SysML modeling• Willingness to travel to the Middle East/North Africa (MENA) region• Experience with DevOps/DevSecOps; Automation (Puppet, Ansible, Chef); Infrastructure-as-Code• Operator or analyst functions such as Forensics, Malware, Penetration Testing, or Threat Hunting• Incident response and recovery experience• Experience configuring, integrating, and/or testing any of the following applications or similar solutions:      ◦ IBM SIEM (Qradar)      ◦ ForcePoint (CDS,SureView Insider Threat, DLP)      ◦ Cloudera (HortonWorks)      ◦ NetScout (Infinistream, Ngenius)      ◦ ThreatQuotient (ThreatQ)      ◦ Airwatch      ◦ Gemalto (SafeNet)Required Education:6 years with a BA/BS in Science, Technology, Engineering or Math; or 4 years with a MA/MS in Science, Technology, Engineering or MathIISBonus 151902
Business Unit Profile
Intelligence, Information and Services delivers innovative technology to make the world a safer place. Our expertise in cyber, analytics and automation allow us to reach beyond what others think is possible to underpin national security and give our global customers unique solutions to solve the most pressing modern challenges -- from the cyber domain to automated operations, and from intelligent transportation and training solutions to creating clear insight from large volumes of data. IIS operates at nearly 550 sites in 80 countries, and is headquartered in Dulles, Virginia. The business area generated $6.2 billion in 2018 revenues. As a global business, our leaders must have the ability to understand, embrace and operate in a multicultural world -- in the marketplace and the workplace. We strive to hire people who reflect our communities and embrace diversity and inclusion to advance our culture, develop our employees, and grow our business.

Quote



I joined Raytheon in 2016 and I’m proud to work here. My company makes some pretty amazing things, including missile defense, using data to predict the weather, and securing our GPS system. My company also works with artificial intelligence, machine learning and other innovative solutions. I’m proud to work for an organization that allows me the flexibility to be a STEM volunteer and help inspire our future generation.









Rewards




401(k) / Retirement Plans
Employer Matching, if you elect to enroll company matches up to 3%.



Work / Life Balance
Raytheon supports a variety of flexible work arrangements including compressed work weeks, flextime, job sharing, 9/80, reduced hours and telecommuting.



Career Development
At Raytheon, we foster an inclusive culture of professional development. We support a variety of developmental opportunities including: Mentoring programs, Skills Development, Leadership Development, Rotational job assignments, and Continuous Improvement, all of which contribute to advancement of our employee’s capabilities.



Paid Time Off
Accrue paid time off monthly. Receive 10-12 holidays per year with some locations shutting down the week between Christmas and New Year’s Day.



Relocation Assistance
Select technical positions are eligible for relocation packages. See specific job description for eligibility requirements.



Parental Leave
Raytheon offers all eligible employees up to three weeks paid parental leave for the birth or adoption of a child (separate from paid maternity leave or Family & Medical Leave Act).



Sign-On Bonus
Qualified cleared engineers can receive an up to $40K sign-on bonus when they join our Engineering Team!



Student Loan Repayment Contribution
Through the 401(k), called the Raytheon Savings and Investment Plan, the company will make a dollar for dollar contribution for amounts employees spend repaying their student loans, up to their maximum match percentage.
