Sr. Industrial Designer, Design Development

Department:
              Design and Creative
            
Location:
              Santa Barbara
            

Req#:
              5454
            

Sonos is seeking a senior level Designer to join it’s high-performing, collaborative Industrial Design team. The role of a Senior Designer in Design Development at Sonos requires balancing a deep sense of collaboration & communication, with an eye for design details, quality, and a desire to deliver the ‘right product’. This comes through working together with Design Management, Design Leads, and cross-functional engineering teams. In doing this, designers at Sonos are expected to embrace the company design team behaviors of Trust, Debate, and Accountability. 




About You


More than a candidate that checks every box, we’re looking for people who are excited to work, learn, and grow at Sonos—no matter their background or how they identify. If that’s you, we hope you’ll apply for this role.
You want to be part of a team.
You come with new ideas and a unique point of view. You look forward to collaborating with a diverse team of individuals. You assume everyone’s best intentions, welcome a healthy debate, and embrace differing opinions. You eagerly seek and give help. Transparency tops your list of values, and you proactively contribute to a culture of respect and inclusion.
You enjoy a challenge.
Inquisitive and focused, you see every challenge as an opportunity. You’re ambitious and comfortable making mistakes because you learn from them and bounce back quickly. You would rather create the future than wait for it. You prioritize long-term value over short-term objectives.
You love to listen.
You approach every interaction with curiosity and a desire to understand. You want to make a positive impact in the world. You’re passionate about culture and know the power that music, film, podcasts, games, and stories have to bring people together.


What You’ll Do 

As the Senior Designer in Design Development, you are expected to collaborate with team members within the design team to help deliver the highest quality design possible. Your role fundamentally provides 3D modeling expertise to help build, refine, and communicate great design solutions that uphold or improve the industrial design intent, and can work effectively with engineering needs. But your role is not limited to this. You should also be ready to contribute to early concept exploration, visualization, and presentations when needed. You will also be involved in defining, refining, and implementing best practices & processes within Design, and with partner teams in Engineering & Manufacturing. The aim of this is to maintain design quality throughout the product development process. Design Development is committed to delivering design for public launch that clearly reflects the original ideals of the design intent.Responsibilities:Apply your 3D modeling expertise and skills to help create, refine, and communicate great design solutions that uphold or improve the industrial design intent.Work across multiple programs to support the resolution of design intent from front-end exploration through detailed development.Interpret design intent in a way that expresses a high level of understanding of form, function, visual composition, and conceptual integrity.Contribute to early concept exploration, visualization, and presentations when needed.Ensure design data is well organized, maintained, tracked, and made easily accessible to team members

Skills You’ll Need

Basic Qualifications:BA or BS in Industrial Design or a BS in Mechanical Engineering, or other related Bachelor's Degree OR an equivalent combination of education and experienceMinimum 5-10 years of related professional experience in a corporate or consulting design team environment.Experience in designing, developing, and shipping retail products for worldwide markets, with a preferred focus in the area of consumer electronics & domestic appliances.Expert-level knowledge and skills in a 3D modeling software package(s).  Examples: Siemens NX, Catia, SolidWorks, Rhino, Alias, and etc.Proven ability to develop & resolve design concepts through sketches, mock-ups, & models; from 3D prints to full appearance models to early prototypes. Ability to create and evolve 3D design models, and data that achieve the highest level of design quality, and can be easily used & referenced by both other design team members, and the various engineering & other cross-functional teams involved.Experience interacting and effectively communicating with internal partners & 3rd party vendors throughout the design development processPreferred Qualifications:Able to create compelling visualizations using 3D rendering software such as KeyShot or similar.Expert-level knowledge and skills with Siemens NX, and Windchill (or other PLM software)Proficient in the use of 2D design software such as Adobe Creative Suite.Proficient understanding, and interest in general CMF development, and of current materials, manufacturing, & finishing processes and trends for consumer electronicsAbility to maintain aesthetic sensitivity from concept to manufacture without losing the spirit of the original design intentDemonstrated ability to translate trends and culture into compelling products.Experience in designing smart audio products. If not already proficient at it, demonstrate a willingness to learn Siemens NX as the primary 3D modeling tool while at Sonos

More About Sonos


Sonos is a sound experience company. We pioneered multiroom wireless audio, made it sound amazing, and changed the way people listen, making it effortless for them to enjoy what they want, where they want, how they want.
Today we continue empowering listeners by developing new technologies, thoughtfully designing products, expanding our software platform, and crafting brilliant sound experiences while participating in a culture that values respect, transparency, collaboration, and ownership.
Together we’re working to positively impact the world and inspire everyone to listen better—because listening brings people together, builds understanding, drives change, and makes us happier.
Notice to European Job Applicants: Information you submit as a part of your job application will be used in accordance with Sonos EU Job Applicant Privacy Notice.
Notice to U.S. Job Applicants: Sonos is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other legally protected characteristics.
Follow the links to review the EEO is the Law poster and its supplement. The pay transparency policy is available here. Sonos is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities. If you need a reasonable accommodation because of a disability for any part of the employment process, please send an e-mail to accommodations@sonos.com and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information.

Security Test Lead, Embedded Software

Share it:








































Security Test Lead, Embedded Software QA

Department:
              Software
            
Location:
              Boston, Santa Barbara, Seattle
            

Req#:
              5582
            

Sonos is on a mission to inspire the world to listen better. We’ve designed a seamless home music experience. Now we strive to empower listeners, everywhere. We focus on building easy to use systems but keeping things simple and bug free is not without challenges. The problems are complex, and the solutions must be elegant and simultaneously secure.     Sonos needs high-energy, innovative engineers to help fuel our rocketing success. We are setting new standards for the audio industry and reshaping the way consumers engage with music. As a Technical Lead for Quality in the Security group, you will work in a small, fast moving environment to test various security related SW features and API’s. Prospective candidate will help to design and lead test automation development on target and/or off target. This will require collaboration with your partners in Development and Quality to help define and execute the test strategies in order to deliver highly secure products. In addition, you will work with teams of industry-leading innovators across acoustics, mechanical engineering, software engineering, hardware engineering, and user experience. If you love music, solving challenging problems and delivering high-quality products, we want to talk with you!    




About You


More than a candidate that checks every box, we’re looking for people who are excited to work, learn, and grow at Sonos—no matter their background or how they identify. If that’s you, we hope you’ll apply for this role.
You want to be part of a team.
You come with new ideas and a unique point of view. You look forward to collaborating with a diverse team of individuals. You assume everyone’s best intentions, welcome a healthy debate, and embrace differing opinions. You eagerly seek and give help. Transparency tops your list of values, and you proactively contribute to a culture of respect and inclusion.
You enjoy a challenge.
Inquisitive and focused, you see every challenge as an opportunity. You’re ambitious and comfortable making mistakes because you learn from them and bounce back quickly. You would rather create the future than wait for it. You prioritize long-term value over short-term objectives.
You love to listen.
You approach every interaction with curiosity and a desire to understand. You want to make a positive impact in the world. You’re passionate about culture and know the power that music, film, podcasts, games, and stories have to bring people together.


What You’ll Do 

Collaborate with other members of the Product Development organization from a base in the Security Development Team to test deployed firmware, software features, web apps, APIs and mission critical cloud services with emphasis on embedded firmware security.Develop automation and manual test strategies for systems and applications in an effort to identify security flaws and validate functionality.Mentor junior engineers and help improve their deep understanding of Embedded and Application SecurityConduct and participate in design and code reviews.Conduct ethical hacking against the Sonos Wireless Speakers, SW Controllers and APIs to proactively identify potential security vulnerabilities and drive them to resolution.Champion security initiatives throughout the company. 

Skills You’ll Need

Basic Qualifications:Experience leading initiatives such as secure boot validation in embedded devices, secure coding, application security and penetration testing.Experience programming with of one or more of the following languages – Assembly, C/C++, Java, PythonStrong understanding of security exploits and vulnerabilitiesStrong understanding of secure programming principlesStrong understanding of symmetric and asymmetric cryptography, PKI and X.509 certificates.Preferred Qualifications:Strong fundamental knowledge of Linux kernel and user spaceStrong networking knowledge with expertise in troubleshooting and debuggingExperience with binary analysis tools (IDA Pro, WinDbg, etc.) 

More About Sonos


Sonos is a sound experience company. We pioneered multiroom wireless audio, made it sound amazing, and changed the way people listen, making it effortless for them to enjoy what they want, where they want, how they want.
Today we continue empowering listeners by developing new technologies, thoughtfully designing products, expanding our software platform, and crafting brilliant sound experiences while participating in a culture that values respect, transparency, collaboration, and ownership.
Together we’re working to positively impact the world and inspire everyone to listen better—because listening brings people together, builds understanding, drives change, and makes us happier.
Notice to European Job Applicants: Information you submit as a part of your job application will be used in accordance with Sonos EU Job Applicant Privacy Notice.
Notice to U.S. Job Applicants: Sonos is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other legally protected characteristics.
Follow the links to review the EEO is the Law poster and its supplement. The pay transparency policy is available here. Sonos is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities. If you need a reasonable accommodation because of a disability for any part of the employment process, please send an e-mail to accommodations@sonos.com and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information.

            Regional Marketing Specialist



         Login to apply
    
















Regional Marketing Specialist
Long Island, NY 


The Regional Marketing Specialist is responsible for successfully facilitating marketing programs and supporting sales efforts at the regional, MSA and when appropriate, account level. Regional marketing programs include regional trade association sponsorships and events, region- and account-focused emails and the customization of sales and marketing materials for specific regions or strategic accounts. This individual will work with cross-functional teams from Marketing, Sales and Services to execute regional marketing programs.
 
Responsibilities

Subscribe to local/regional trade organization email lists for newsletters, local event announcements, etc. and join local trade groups on social media (Facebook, LinkedIn, Twitter)
Proactively and regularly contact trade organizations to determine networking, sponsorship, and speaking opportunities
Secure and manage local/regional trade organization opportunities as identified, including trade shows, sponsorship entitlements, speaker placement, design/display requirements, swag, etc. (leveraging Trade Events team to coordinate)
Meet regularly with Regional Managers/Directors in Sales to adjust regional strategy based on competitive intelligence, product priority, account-level data
Assist Sales with client/prospect invitations and follow-up related to local/regional trade events, Market Updates, other Yardi corporate events
Understand competitive landscape and Yardi’s relative strengths and weaknesses to competitor products to promote Yardi products effectively (e.g., sell Breeze vs. Voyager when competing against AppFolio)
Serve as ambassador at local/regional events, delivering short company/product presentations as needed and as included in sponsorship entitlements; network at events and talk to prospects and clients about their needs and how Yardi can help them
Identify marketing opportunities based on account-level data and update email templates, collateral, etc. to be used by sales as targeted micro-marketing
Update product webinar marketing emails monthly with schedule and times (per regional time zone) and provide to Sales for targeted regional marketing based on account data
Customize Sales decks, leavebehinds, etc. as applicable for strategic client meetings
Identify and recommend thought leadership content to Sales for use in specific regions or with specific accounts and gain feedback from Sales regarding additional marketing and thought leadership materials needed and work with Corporate Marketing to develop

 
Requirements

Bachelor’s Degree in Marketing, Communications, Business, Finance, or equivalent relevant experience
Five plus (5+) years in marketing, sales or equivalent experience interacting with customers
Experience in business to business (B2B) marketing
Experience in ERP systems
Yardi domain experience is a plus
Knowledge of real estate industry and Yardi’s competitors plus
Excellent interpersonal and relationship management skills
Strong research and analytical skills
Proficiency in Microsoft Office, Excel and PowerPoint
Experience with CRM
Experience with event marketing
Proven collaboration skills within a dynamic team
Proven ability to meet critical deadlines and prioritize multiple tasks in a fast-paced environment
Proven ability to manage projects with multiple touch points
Strong organizational and time management skills
Proven excellent written and verbal communication skills
Good public speaking skills
Excellent attention to detail and accuracy in execution of work and tasks
Ability to work independently as well in collaboration with others
Proven client-centered commitment and focus
Collegial, team-oriented disposition with the desire and ability to establish cooperative professional relationships with employees at all levels within Yardi, outside of Yardi, and with clients
Ability to think and act strategically by visualizing new possibilities, challenging assumptions, and recommending the implementation of new ideas or strategies desired
Regular attendance and a regular work schedule are essential functions of this job

By continuing to browse this site you agree to our use of cookies. You can find out more about which cookies we are using or switch them off in settings.
 

 
Accept

 


















 

 Privacy Overview


 Strictly Necessary Cookies


 3rd Party Cookies




 








Privacy Overview

This website uses cookies so that we can provide you with the best user experience possible. Cookie information is stored in your browser and performs functions such as recognising you when you return to our website and helping our team to understand which sections of the website you find most interesting and useful.
You can adjust all of your cookie settings by navigating the tabs on the left hand side.



 
Strictly Necessary Cookies

Strictly necessary cookies must be enabled at all times in order to login and apply to openings.



disable









If you disable this cookie, we will not be able to save your preferences and you will not be able to login to apply for openings. This means that every time you visit this website you will need to enable or disable cookies again.







3rd Party Cookies

This website uses Google Analytics to collect anonymous information such as the number of visitors to the site, and the most popular pages.
Keeping this cookie enabled helps us to improve our website.



disable









Please enable Strictly Necessary Cookies first so that we can save your preferences!












Enable All
Save Changes

If you’re ready to take on a fresh challenge, grow your career and contribute to making the world a safer place, Raytheon is ready to help you achieve your goals. Join our team and get the opportunity and support to find purpose, thrive and succeed.





Notice: Please be aware of suspicious recruiting emails and text messages that attempt to collect your confidential information. Raytheon conducts all electronic correspondence using e-mail addresses that end in “Raytheon.com”, “Raytheon.co.uk”, “Raytheon.com.au” or “brassring.com”. To report fraud please go to: https://www.ic3.gov.











Systems Engineer II
Riverdale, Maryland


Apply





Overview
Responsibilities
Success Profile
Rewards
Trending




Overview

What does it take to make the world a safer place? It takes delivering innovative technology and collaborating with some of the finest talent in the engineering field. Whether you’re a software engineer or a mechanical engineer, at Raytheon you’ll grow a varied and rewarding career. And you’ll be supported with a comprehensive and competitive benefits package that promotes work/life. If you’re ready to take on today’s big challenges, discover a world of opportunity at Raytheon.

America’s Best Large Employers by Forbes
Career & Development Opportunities
Full-time
Entry, Mid, Senior level




Back to Job Navigation (Overview)


Responsibilities


Raytheon is a technology and innovation leader specializing in defense, security and civil markets throughout the world.  Our latest company video is about our people, our technology, our vision, and the values we hold dear at Raytheon.  Click here to view: https://youtu.be/qvbCgKpkEdsRaytheon is looking for a systems engineer with insatiable curiosity to join a high-performing team maintaining the Common Ground System (CGS) that manages a constellation of environmental satellites.  A continuous-learning mindset is required to develop an ever-improving understanding of how this evolving, geographically-distributed set of CGS subsystems are configured, communicate, and used by customer flight engineers and operators.  Team members must learn how the system works broadly then eventually specialize in one or more subsystems.  The successful candidate will have a knack for troubleshooting and be able to work cohesively with teammates, who depend on each other’s different skills and knowledge, to plan and execute successful workarounds for problems and contribute to the development of long-term solutions. As a member of the Deployment Team, the candidate will perform systems integration and testing of new software releases, deploy those releases into the operational system while protecting on-going spacecraft operations from disruption, and investigate CGS operations anomalies.  The successful candidate must be comfortable working side by side with the customer in a helpful, service-oriented manner.The candidate will support a wide variety of tasks in coordination with customer operations teams and the other Raytheon teams responsible for software development, hardware infrastructure, systems administration, security, configuration management, and quality assurance.  This work will be performed in an existing and dynamic operational environment demanding rapid response and flexibility.Required Skills: Strong understanding of the system engineering/development lifecycle2+ years of recent, hands-on experience performing systems integrationExperience creating test cases and test proceduresExperience with requirements analysis in regard to test strategy and test methodsExperience conducting hands-on system testsScripting experience with Perl or Python preferredAbility to work collaboratively in a team settingAbility to thrive in a dynamic operational environmentDesired Skills: Experience with spacecraft ground systemsProficiency with both Windows Server and Linux operating systemsFamiliarity with Agile lifecycle process including Scrum, Kanban, DevOps, Continuous Integration, and Test Driven Development MethodologiesExperience with Atlassian tool suite such as JIRA, Confluence, Bamboo, and BitbucketExperience with IBM DOORS or similar requirements management toolAdvanced MS Excel skillsExperience with automated test toolsEducation Requirements:Requires a degree in Science, Technology, Engineering or Mathematics (STEM) and minimum of 2+ years prior relevant experience.SECURITY CLEARANCE:Qualified applicants must be a U.S. Citizen, will be subject to a security investigation, and must be able to obtain a DOD Common Access Card (CAC) and pass a national agency check.This position requires either a U.S. Person or a Non-U.S. Person who is eligible to obtain any required Export Authorization. 149527
Business Unit Profile
                        
                        Raytheon Intelligence, Information and Services delivers innovative technology to make the world a safer place. Our expertise in cyber, analytics and automation allow us to reach beyond what others think is possible to underpin national security and give our global customers unique solutions to solve the most pressing modern challenges -- from the cyber domain to automated operations, and from intelligent transportation and training solutions to creating clear insight from large volumes of data. IIS operates at nearly 550 sites in 80 countries, and is headquartered in Dulles, Virginia. The business area generated $6.2 billion in 2018 revenues. As a global business, our leaders must have the ability to understand, embrace and operate in a multicultural world -- in the marketplace and the workplace. We strive to hire people who reflect our communities and embrace diversity and inclusion to advance our culture, develop our employees, and grow our business.
Relocation Eligible 
                        
                        Yes
Clearance Type 
                        
                        None / Not Required
Expertise 
                        

                                
                            Aerospace/Aeronautical EngineeringAlgorithmsComputer EngineeringComputer ScienceComputer/Management Information SystemsConfiguration ManagementData NetworkingData ScienceEngineering TechnologyGeneral EngineeringGeneral ManagementInformation and Knowledge SystemsIntegration & Test EngineeringSensor SystemsSoftware EngineeringSystems EngineeringTechnicalTest Engineering

Quote



Felicia Jackson is regional vice president of RAYVETS, Raytheon's employee group for veterans and those who support them. After 24 years in the Air Force, she started a new career at Raytheon. "I wanted to go where people would support me," she told us.









Rewards




401(k) / Retirement Plans
Employer Matching, if you elect to enroll company matches up to 3%.



Work / Life Balance
Raytheon supports a variety of flexible work arrangements including compressed work weeks, flextime, job sharing, 9/80, reduced hours and telecommuting.



Career Development
At Raytheon, we foster an inclusive culture of professional development. We support a variety of developmental opportunities including: Mentoring programs, Skills Development, Leadership Development, Rotational job assignments, and Continuous Improvement, all of which contribute to advancement of our employee’s capabilities.



Paid Time Off
Accrue paid time off monthly. Receive 10-12 holidays per year with some locations shutting down the week between Christmas and New Year’s Day.



Relocation Assistance
Select technical positions are eligible for relocation packages. See specific job description for eligibility requirements.



Parental Leave
Raytheon offers all eligible employees up to three weeks paid parental leave for the birth or adoption of a child (separate from paid maternity leave or Family & Medical Leave Act).

            Consultant



         Login to apply
    
















Consultant
Atlanta, GA 


The Consultant manages and executes successful Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) deployments and fosters strong client relationships. The consultant provides high-level implementation, training, and professional services to a portfolio of assigned clients (including on-site visits as needed) to manage and utilize the business operation functions in Yardi software products. 
Responsibilities

Performs complex system and business process reviews and other service reviews (on-site as needed) to identify inefficient processes and makes sound recommendations for client productivity gains
Trains clients and manages continued software integrations, maintenance, and updates in collaboration with clients
Researches, analyzes, and resolves software functionality and reporting problems for clients
Uses positive influence with clients to effectively navigate sensitive client objections, communicate complex and/or sensitive messages, preemptively address potential client concerns, build sustaining alliances with clients, and influence positive outcomes through active counsel
Enlists support from management and peers to address complex client requests and resolve complex issues
Analyzes and interprets client operational needs and determines initial system configuration accordingly
Performs or assists with data mapping and conversion, user training, and other services to ensure successful software deployment
Determines and documents solutions and best practices to contribute to a solutions repository
Advises and institutes best practices relevant to clients in the application of Yardi products
Recognizes and refers opportunities to sell products/services to existing clients
Provides recommendations and informed direction to clients regarding ancillary products and services that align with client business and operational needs and goals
Collaborates internally with analysts, designers, programmers, sales teams, and marketing teams with a focus on meeting client needs and maintaining high-level customer service standards
Performs special projects related to department training and client support as well as other duties as assigned under supervision of Manager

**This position requires up to 80% travel**
Requirements

Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Finance, Math, or Computer/Engineering Sciences or other equivalent relevant experience in the property management industry
Five plus (5+) years of experience in software or business process consulting or equivalent consulting experience interacting with customers
Three (3) years of experience managing projects on accounting, business process, property management, or real estate software
Experience in ERP systems
Experience positively influencing clients, peers and management
Experience independently managing and resolving a variety client issues
Proven ability to manage projects with multiple touch points
Proven excellent written and verbal communication skills
Proven client-centered commitment and focus
Proven ability to meet critical deadlines and prioritize multiple tasks in a fast-paced environment
Collegial, team-oriented disposition with the desire and ability to establish cooperative working relationships with employees at all levels within Yardi, outside of Yardi, and with clients
Ability to think and act strategically by visualizing new possibilities, challenging assumptions, and recommending the implementation of new ideas or strategies desired
Yardi domain experience a plus
Knowledge of property management industry and Yardi’s competitors a plus
Regular attendance and a regular work schedule are essential functions of this job

*bd

By continuing to browse this site you agree to our use of cookies. You can find out more about which cookies we are using or switch them off in settings.
 

 
Accept

 


















 

 Privacy Overview


 Strictly Necessary Cookies


 3rd Party Cookies




 








Privacy Overview

This website uses cookies so that we can provide you with the best user experience possible. Cookie information is stored in your browser and performs functions such as recognising you when you return to our website and helping our team to understand which sections of the website you find most interesting and useful.
You can adjust all of your cookie settings by navigating the tabs on the left hand side.



 
Strictly Necessary Cookies

Strictly necessary cookies must be enabled at all times in order to login and apply to openings.



disable









If you disable this cookie, we will not be able to save your preferences and you will not be able to login to apply for openings. This means that every time you visit this website you will need to enable or disable cookies again.







3rd Party Cookies

This website uses Google Analytics to collect anonymous information such as the number of visitors to the site, and the most popular pages.
Keeping this cookie enabled helps us to improve our website.



disable









Please enable Strictly Necessary Cookies first so that we can save your preferences!












Enable All
Save Changes

If you’re ready to take on a fresh challenge, grow your career and contribute to making the world a safer place, Raytheon is ready to help you achieve your goals. Join our team and get the opportunity and support to find purpose, thrive and succeed.





Notice: Please be aware of suspicious recruiting emails and text messages that attempt to collect your confidential information. Raytheon conducts all electronic correspondence using e-mail addresses that end in “Raytheon.com”, “Raytheon.co.uk”, “Raytheon.com.au” or “brassring.com”. To report fraud please go to: https://www.ic3.gov.











Principal Systems Engineer
Dulles, Virginia


Apply





Overview
Responsibilities
Success Profile
Rewards
Trending




Overview

What does it take to make the world a safer place? It takes delivering innovative technology and collaborating with some of the finest talent in the engineering field. Whether you’re a software engineer or a mechanical engineer, at Raytheon you’ll grow a varied and rewarding career. And you’ll be supported with a comprehensive and competitive benefits package that promotes work/life. If you’re ready to take on today’s big challenges, discover a world of opportunity at Raytheon.

America’s Best Large Employers by Forbes
Career & Development Opportunities
Full-time
Entry, Mid, Senior level




Back to Job Navigation (Overview)


Responsibilities


Raytheon Intelligence, Information and Services (IIS) is currently seeking a Systems Engineer in support of several Systems Engineering programs and efforts.   The Systems Engineering applicant will participate in Systems Engineering development efforts.  This position involves working in a team environment with responsibilities in all phases of Systems development including concept development, requirements, functional analysis, design reviews, implementation, test, verification, validation and system transition.  Multiple positions are available with multiple skills.Validated TS/SCI clearances are eligible for sign-on bonus amounts up to $40,000.Clearance Requirements:  Current TS/SCI security clearance.Location: Dulles, VAResponsibilities include, but are not limited to: Perform life cycle systems engineering and test activities in support of on-going programs.  Work with external industry and Govt. stakeholders in the resolution of engineering systems issues.Develop and maintain requirements for systems and subsystemsPrepare for and conduct design reviewsWork in an IPT in the development of defense equipment and products.Develop Test strategies and proceduresWork within and coordinate systems engineering activities across the customer, supplier and internal IPT.Required Skills:8+ years demonstrated experience in systems engineering, software engineering or related engineering disciplineKnowledge of the following systems engineering functions:  CONOPS development  requirements development and management,  architecture,  system design  interface definition and control  integration and test to include test planning and procedure developmentDemonstrated understanding of the systems engineering lifecycle in support of software development, avionics systems development or sustainment activitiesExcellent written and oral communication skillsExperience with Microsoft Office suite of tools, particularly Excel, Project, and PowerPointCurrent TS/SCI clearanceDesired Skills: Experience with requirements management using DOORS or similar requirements management toolKnowledge of software development lifecycle models (waterfall and Agile) and program lifecycle modesAbility to the identify, manage, and mitigate technical riskEducation Requirements:Requires a degree in Science, Technology, Engineering or Mathematics (STEM) and minimum of 8 years prior relevant experience.This position requires either a U.S. Person or a Non-U.S. Person who is eligible to obtain any required Export Authorization.IISVA092419 150852
Business Unit Profile
                        
                        Raytheon Intelligence, Information and Services delivers innovative technology to make the world a safer place. Our expertise in cyber, analytics and automation allow us to reach beyond what others think is possible to underpin national security and give our global customers unique solutions to solve the most pressing modern challenges -- from the cyber domain to automated operations, and from intelligent transportation and training solutions to creating clear insight from large volumes of data. IIS operates at nearly 550 sites in 80 countries, and is headquartered in Dulles, Virginia. The business area generated $6.2 billion in 2018 revenues. As a global business, our leaders must have the ability to understand, embrace and operate in a multicultural world -- in the marketplace and the workplace. We strive to hire people who reflect our communities and embrace diversity and inclusion to advance our culture, develop our employees, and grow our business.
Relocation Eligible 
                        
                        Yes
Clearance Type 
                        
                        TS/SCI - Current
Expertise 
                        

                                
                            Aerospace/Aeronautical EngineeringComputer EngineeringComputer ScienceData NetworkingData ScienceEngineering TechnologyGeneral EngineeringSoftware EngineeringSystems EngineeringTechnical

Felicia Jackson is regional vice president of RAYVETS, Raytheon's employee group for veterans and those who support them. After 24 years in the Air Force, she started a new career at Raytheon. "I wanted to go where people would support me," she told us.

Paid Time Off

Relocation Assistance

Parental Leave

            Regulatory Compliance Auditor



         Login to apply
    
















Regulatory Compliance Auditor
Atlanta, GA 


The Regulatory Compliance Auditor will be a member of our Legal Department and will be responsible for the following:

Reviewing and analyzing federal, state and local law
Reviewing proposed client agreements to ensure regulatory compliance
Contacting state and local government officials for confirmation of applicable regulations
Supporting sales and implementation staff with respect to applicable regulations
Maintaining verified compliance records for each jurisdiction
Providing general support to company’s in-house attorneys, including supporting various business units and legal functions

Requirements

Bachelor’s degree required
Clear and concise verbal and written communication skills
High attention to detail
Strong organizational skills
Ability to multi-task in a fast-paced environment
Ability to work in a process-driven environment
Proficiency in MS Office Suite
Ability and desire to master new areas of expertise
Paralegal experience desirable
Regular attendance and a regular work schedule is an essential function of this job

*cl        



         Login to apply

By continuing to browse this site you agree to our use of cookies. You can find out more about which cookies we are using or switch them off in settings.
 

 
Accept

 


















 

 Privacy Overview


 Strictly Necessary Cookies


 3rd Party Cookies




 








Privacy Overview

This website uses cookies so that we can provide you with the best user experience possible. Cookie information is stored in your browser and performs functions such as recognising you when you return to our website and helping our team to understand which sections of the website you find most interesting and useful.
You can adjust all of your cookie settings by navigating the tabs on the left hand side.



 
Strictly Necessary Cookies

Strictly necessary cookies must be enabled at all times in order to login and apply to openings.



disable









If you disable this cookie, we will not be able to save your preferences and you will not be able to login to apply for openings. This means that every time you visit this website you will need to enable or disable cookies again.







3rd Party Cookies

This website uses Google Analytics to collect anonymous information such as the number of visitors to the site, and the most popular pages.
Keeping this cookie enabled helps us to improve our website.



disable









Please enable Strictly Necessary Cookies first so that we can save your preferences!

If you’re ready to take on a fresh challenge, grow your career and contribute to making the world a safer place, Raytheon is ready to help you achieve your goals. Join our team and get the opportunity and support to find purpose, thrive and succeed.





Notice: Please be aware of suspicious recruiting emails and text messages that attempt to collect your confidential information. Raytheon conducts all electronic correspondence using e-mail addresses that end in “Raytheon.com”, “Raytheon.co.uk”, “Raytheon.com.au” or “brassring.com”. To report fraud please go to: https://www.ic3.gov.










Software Engineer - Java
Apply
Requisition ID 147046BR Date updated 08/27/2019
Who we are!Raytheon BBN Technologies is one of Raytheon’s premier research and development centers. Our diverse research portfolio combines the best technologies to deliver innovative, custom solutions with real-world benefit.Located in Arlington, VA, our Information Exploitation group is seeking a Staff Scientist with software research interests.  Our world-class team works with a broad range of Government agencies to solve problems that are both technically challenging and have a real operational impact. The ideal candidate will have strong experience in Java development with some experience or interest in machine reasoning, semantic web technologies, data analytics, or artificial intelligence technologies.Our research work applies the above technologies to build both prototype and real operational systems.  You will be working on challenging problems including:• Producing sophisticated software in a fast-paced agile environment;• Developing mission-critical applications for deployment into global enterprise operations;• Optimizing software for knowledge representation, storage, and query systems for high performance.• Designing novel machine reasoning and learning algorithms and solutions to complex, open-ended intelligence problems.What will you need?• BS in Computer Science or equivalent discipline and 2 years of experience; or MS in Computer Science or equivalent discipline and 0 years of experience.• Proficiency in Java and the Java-based development ecosystem.• Position may require some amount of overnight travel.• US citizenship and a willingness to apply for US Government security clearance is required.Additional Skills that would be AWESOME• Advanced degree preferred.• Experience with Web application development.• Familiarity with modern software configuration management tools such as Docker, Gradle, Ivy, etc.• Current US Government security clearance is desired.This position requires the eligibility to obtain a security clearance.  Except in rare circumstances, only U.S. citizens are eligible for a security clearance. 147046
Business Unit Profile
Raytheon Space and Airborne Systems (SAS) builds radars and other sensors for aircraft, spacecraft and ships. The business also provides communications and electronic warfare solutions and performs research in areas ranging from linguistics to quantum computing. SAS is headquartered in McKinney, Texas USA. As a global business, our leaders must have the ability to understand, embrace and operate in a multicultural world -- in the marketplace and the workplace. We strive to hire people who reflect our communities and embrace diversity and inclusion to advance our culture, develop our employees, and grow our business.Raytheon is headquartered in Waltham, Massachusetts. Follow us on Twitter.

Relocation Eligible 
            Yes

Clearance Type 
            None / Not Required

Expertise 
 
              Artificial IntelligenceComputer EngineeringComputer ScienceData ScienceResearch & Development

              VA - Rosslyn
            

Raytheon is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, age, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected Veteran status.

Work on interesting projects and enjoy plenty of recognition
Whether you’re just starting out on your career journey or a experienced professional, it’s important that you feel recognized and rewarded for your contributions.
Raytheon is proud to offer a comprehensive and competitive benefits package to you, your spouse and your eligible children. In addition to protecting you and your family's health and well-being, we offer important income and work/life benefits to meet your needs. Learn More





Turn unique thinking into one-of-a-kind solutions
Diversity. Every company likes to talk about it, but few have embraced it with quite the same commitment as we have here at Raytheon. As a result, diversity has become a competitive imperative and an integral part of our business model, particularly as we continue to grow internationally. Learn More








Work as one to make a difference to millions
Here at Raytheon, we innovate across all domains: from land and sea to air, space, and cyberspace.It’s innovation made possible by a strong internal culture and a vision that’s shared by Raytheon employees across the globe – a vision of one global team creating trusted, innovative solutions to make the world a safer place. Operations Associate I  (93998) - Richardson, TX - Inogen, Inc. Jobs








 














Home
Jobs




Operations Associate I  (93998) - Richardson, TX

Toggle navigation








Operations Associate I  (93998) 

JobsLogin 












 Operations Richardson, TX, USA Full Time 



Email Me Similar Jobs Email Me This Job



ABOUT INOGEN Inogen was founded in 2001 to improve quality of life and increase freedom and independence for oxygen therapy users. Inogen is innovation in oxygen therapy. The Inogen mission is to improve freedom and independence for oxygen therapy patients through innovative products and services. Inogen is a manufacturer and Accredited Homecare Provider.
Inogen is focused on quality care, continuous improvement, and outstanding customer satisfaction. We are a stable, USA based company dedicated to providing an exciting and rewarding career to our employees. We completed a successful Initial Public Offering on the NASDAQ in 2014 and have demonstrated substantial growth over the last five years. Our work environment is casual yet high performing, and we are looking for seriously talented, motivated, and fast-paced professionals to join our team.
JOB DESCRIPTION 
Perform one or more of the job duties associated with the preparation, assembly and packaging of oxygen concentrator and related products, including engineering prototypes, pre-production, and production assemblies.
Key Competencies:
Responsible for building and packaging of oxygen concentrators. May include prototype, inspection, modifications, upgrades and rework. 
Assemble and package oxygen concentrators in accordance with manufacturing documentation (assembly instructions, travelers, packaging instructions, configuration logs, etc.
Verifies accuracy of finished assemblies and packaging to provide quality output. 
Perform mechanical assemblies using a variety of hand tools (wrenches, drivers, sockets, etc.)
Work closely with Materials to ensure accurate materials management. 
Assist in maintaining strict configuration controls. 
Additional job duties as required and defined by Manufacturing Management. 
Assist with any other duties as assigned.
Do you possess these abilities?
Ability to work from written instructions, wiring diagrams, etc.
Experience working with a Bill of Materials and knowledge of configuration controls.
Assembly of electro-mechanical components with related tooling. 
Familiarity with ISO policies and procedures.
Familiarity with ESD procedure.
Manual dexterity, ability to work with small parts for extended amounts of time. 
Must have strong work ethic.
Excellent oral and written communication skills required. 
Excellent planning, communication and organizational skills. 
Ability to effectively interface with different departments within the company.
Requirements:
Operates at a task level.
Substantial supervision required.
High School diploma or equivalent, required.
0-2 years of experience in packaging/mechanical assembly or with a medical device manufacturer, required. 
A combination of training, education and experience that is equivalent to the qualifications listed above and that provides the required knowledge, skills, and abilities.
 
WHY INOGEN Inogen is a dynamic company that is not only focused on quality care of patients, but is also committed to being a top employer.  Each of Inogen' s offices have a casual culture that supports employees being responsible and developing professionals.
We offer competitive salaries and a robust benefit package:
Employee Stock Purchase Plan 401 (K) plan available for all employees Health, dental, vision insurance Flexible spending accounts and wellness discount program Life Insurance Long Term Disability Robust paid time off and 8 paid holidays Employee Assistance Program
See the Inogen Team in action:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dKoTMeJf5J4
 
Inogen Where we go to work hard to positively impact people's lives
 
Inogen is an equal opportunity employer.  We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other legally protected characteristics. The EEO is the Law poster and its supplement are available here: http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/ofccpost.htm; http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/OFCCP_EEO_Supplement_Final_JRF_QA_508c.pdf.  The pay transparency policy is available here: http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/pdf/EO13665_PrescribedNondiscriminationPostingLanguage_JRFQA508c.pdf. 
Inogen is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities.  If you need a reasonable accommodation because of a disability for any part of the employment process, please send an e-mail to recruiting@inogen.net or call (972) 616-5668 and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information.
 
 

Inogen, Inc.
https://inogen.applicantpro.com

Inside Medical Sales Representative - Goleta, CA (79524) - Goleta, CA - Inogen, Inc. Jobs








 














Home
Jobs




Inside Medical Sales Representative - Goleta, CA (79524) - Goleta, CA

Toggle navigation








Inside Medical Sales Representative - Goleta, CA (79524) 

JobsLogin 












 Sales Goleta, CA, USA Full Time 



Email Me Similar Jobs Email Me This Job



JOB DESCRIPTION This base + commission inside sales role is for professionals with a proven and consistent level of achievement who possess the drive to make unlimited income.  Our sales team is committed to being the best and strives to achieve personal sales objectives while collaborating toward corporate success.  Our ideal candidate is a self-starter with high energy, a persuasive communication style, and excellent follow through.
WHY INOGEN Inogen is a dynamic company that is not only focused on quality care of patients, but is also committed to being a top employer. Each of Inogen's offices has a casual culture that supports employees being responsible and developing professionals.
We offer competitive salaries and a robust benefit package:
Base + Uncapped Commission
Employee Stock Purchase Plan
Comprehensive Training Program
Seasoned first year target at $70k and top earners will exceed $100k
Health, dental & vision insurance
Insurance begins first day of month after hire
17 days of Paid time off and 8 paid holidays per year
401(K) plan available for all employees
Flexible spending accounts for health & childcare expenses
Life Insurance
Long Term Disability
Employee Assistance Program
ABOUT INOGEN Inogen was founded in 2001 to improve quality of life and increase freedom and independence for oxygen therapy users. Inogen is innovation in oxygen therapy. The Inogen mission is to improve freedom and independence for oxygen therapy patients through innovative products and services. Inogen is a manufacturer and Accredited Homecare Provider.
Inogen is focused on quality care, continuous improvement, and outstanding customer satisfaction. We are a stable, USAbased company dedicated to providing an exciting and rewarding career to our employees. We completed a successful Initial Public Offering on the NASDAQ in 2014 and have demonstrated substantial growth over the last five years. Our work environment is casual yet highperforming, and we are looking for seriously talented, motivated, and fast-paced professionals to join our team.
 
See the Inogen Team in action:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dKoTMeJf5J4
Key Competencies:
Make outgoing sales calls. Transition leads through first point of contact to ultimate sale of Inogen's oxygen concentrator products. Create strategic call plans to support sales activities.
Collaborate with Inogen personnel to transition secondary leads to DME provider partners
Promote Inogen within clinical and patient communities
Enter sales orders, process credit card payments and facilitate execution of leasing documents and pricing approvals as needed.
Impeccable phone etiquette required
Sales experience with 65+ demographic a plus
Must self-motivate and deliver results with limited oversight
Must be motivated to achieve results based upon earnings opportunity
Primary Responsibilities:
Manage a high volume of inbound/outbound calls to/from warm leads.
Provide exemplary consultative selling.
Accomplish or surpass targeted performance objectives on a consistent basis.
Execute the administrative process which includes paperwork flow, physician contacts, payment processing, and record documentation in CRM.
Qualifications:
BA in Business, English, Communications or related area desirable
3-5 years Sales/Customer Service background or relevant work experience required
Inogen is an equal opportunity employer.  We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other legally protected characteristics. The EEO is the Law poster and its supplement are available here: http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/ofccpost.htm;http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/OFCCP_EEO_Supplement_Final_JRF_QA_508c.pdf.  The pay transparency policy is available here:http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/pdf/EO13665_PrescribedNondiscriminationPostingLanguage_JRFQA508c.pdf.
Inogen is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities.  If you need a reasonable accommodation because of a disability for any part of the employment process, please send an e-mail to recruiting@inogen.net or call (972) 616-5668 and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information.

Inogen, Inc.
https://inogen.applicantpro.com

If you’re ready to take on a fresh challenge, grow your career and contribute to making the world a safer place, Raytheon is ready to help you achieve your goals. Join our team and get the opportunity and support to find purpose, thrive and succeed.





Notice: Please be aware of suspicious recruiting emails and text messages that attempt to collect your confidential information. Raytheon conducts all electronic correspondence using e-mail addresses that end in “Raytheon.com”, “Raytheon.co.uk”, “Raytheon.com.au” or “brassring.com”. Principal Software Systems Test Engineer
Aurora, Colorado


Apply





Overview
Responsibilities
Success Profile
Rewards
Trending




Overview

What does it take to make the world a safer place? It takes delivering innovative technology and collaborating with some of the finest talent in the engineering field. Whether you’re a software engineer or a field engineer, at Raytheon you’ll grow a varied and rewarding career. And you’ll be supported with a comprehensive and competitive benefits package that promotes work/life. If you’re ready to take on today’s big challenges, discover a world of opportunity at Raytheon.

America’s Best Large Employers by Forbes
Career & Development Opportunities
Full-time
Entry, Mid, Senior level




Back to Job Navigation (Overview)


Responsibilities


“Outside the box. Above the Earth. Beyond our wildest dreams. Our engineers are creating new possibilities in space.”Are you ready to take on a fresh challenge, grow your career and contribute to making the world a safer place, Raytheon is ready to help you achieve your goals. Join our team and get the opportunity and support to find purpose, thrive and succeed.   Click here to view a brief video and learn more about our Aurora Campus: https://youtu.be/YNuZN0vyzHghttps://youtu.be/YNuZN0vyzHgRaytheon is seeking a Software Systems Test Engineer for programs in our C2, Space and Intelligence Solutions mission area in Aurora, Colorado.As a Software Systems Test Engineeryour duties will include but not be limited to the following: Support the planning and conduct of Test activities; define test plans and sequences relative to complex software and hardware subsystems and resolves identified conflicting issues. Participate in a complex testing program; establish methods and techniques, plan tests, develop test requirements, write test procedures and reports, and conduct tests utilizing comprehensive knowledge of these complex subsystems. Participate in integration and test readiness reviews, design reviews, and audits of integration and test programs and facilities. Utilize broad knowledge in test engineering and apply understanding of principles of related engineering and software technology to ensure test validity and integrity. Lead teams in conducting tests, which include collaborating with others in establishing language, database, and computer simulation requirements and configuration management techniques. Clearance Requirement:  Must be a US Citizens with a current/active TS/SCIThis position is eligible for a Sign on Bonus of $40k for a candidate with a current TS/SCI that can be verified and hired at Raytheon.Required Skills: An active TS/SCI security clearance.Bachelor degree and 8+ years demonstrated engineering experience with proven track record.Test engineering experience on a software development contractExperience preparing and executing Test proceduresExperience with test script or automation developmentExperience utilizing discrepancy report systemsEnthusiastic & energetic performer able to work in a dynamic, fast-paced, & high visibility environmentSelf-motivated and capable of performing tasks with minimal oversightExperience with systems engineering principles and activitiesDesired Skills: Experience working in a Satellite Ground System development or operations environmentExperience with ground station satellite domains (command and telemetry, flight dynamics or mission planning)Test Automation (Eggplant, Cucumber, Gherkin)Education Requirements: Bachelor’s degree in Science, Technology, Engineering or Mathematics (STEM)This position requires either a U.S. Person who is eligible to obtain any required Export Authorization.#SESpaceColoradoIISBonusCOSECONETWORK 146071
Business Unit Profile
                        
                        Raytheon Intelligence, Information and Services delivers innovative technology to make the world a safer place. Our expertise in cyber, analytics and automation allow us to reach beyond what others think is possible to underpin national security and give our global customers unique solutions to solve the most pressing modern challenges -- from the cyber domain to automated operations, and from intelligent transportation and training solutions to creating clear insight from large volumes of data. IIS operates at nearly 550 sites in 80 countries, and is headquartered in Dulles, Virginia. The business area generated $6.2 billion in 2018 revenues. As a global business, our leaders must have the ability to understand, embrace and operate in a multicultural world -- in the marketplace and the workplace. We strive to hire people who reflect our communities and embrace diversity and inclusion to advance our culture, develop our employees, and grow our business.

Quote



I joined Raytheon in 2016 and I’m proud to work here. My company makes some pretty amazing things, including missile defense, using data to predict the weather, and securing our GPS system. My company also works with artificial intelligence, machine learning and other innovative solutions. I’m proud to work for an organization that allows me the flexibility to be a STEM volunteer and help inspire our future generation.









Rewards




401(k) / Retirement Plans
Employer Matching, if you elect to enroll company matches up to 3%.



Work / Life Balance
Raytheon supports a variety of flexible work arrangements including compressed work weeks, flextime, job sharing, 9/80, reduced hours and telecommuting.



Career Development
At Raytheon, we foster an inclusive culture of professional development. We support a variety of developmental opportunities including: Mentoring programs, Skills Development, Leadership Development, Rotational job assignments, and Continuous Improvement, all of which contribute to advancement of our employee’s capabilities.



Paid Time Off
Accrue paid time off monthly. Receive 10-12 holidays per year with some locations shutting down the week between Christmas and New Year’s Day.



Relocation Assistance
Select technical positions are eligible for relocation packages. See specific job description for eligibility requirements.



Parental Leave
Raytheon offers all eligible employees up to three weeks paid parental leave for the birth or adoption of a child (separate from paid maternity leave or Family & Medical Leave Act).



Sign-On Bonus
Qualified cleared engineers can receive an up to $40K sign-on bonus when they join our Engineering Team!



Student Loan Repayment Contribution
Through the 401(k), called the Raytheon Savings and Investment Plan, the company will make a dollar for dollar contribution for amounts employees spend repaying their student loans, up to their maximum match percentage.

If you’re ready to take on a fresh challenge, grow your career and contribute to making the world a safer place, Raytheon is ready to help you achieve your goals. Join our team and get the opportunity and support to find purpose, thrive and succeed.





Notice: Please be aware of suspicious recruiting emails and text messages that attempt to collect your confidential information. Raytheon conducts all electronic correspondence using e-mail addresses that end in “Raytheon.com”, “Raytheon.co.uk”, “Raytheon.com.au” or “brassring.com”. To report fraud please go to: https://www.ic3.gov.











Principal Systems Engineer – Advanced Signal Processor
Aurora, Colorado


Apply





Overview
Responsibilities
Success Profile
Rewards
Trending




Overview

What does it take to make the world a safer place? It takes delivering innovative technology and collaborating with some of the finest talent in the engineering field. Whether you’re a software engineer or a field engineer, at Raytheon you’ll grow a varied and rewarding career. And you’ll be supported with a comprehensive and competitive benefits package that promotes work/life. If you’re ready to take on today’s big challenges, discover a world of opportunity at Raytheon.

America’s Best Large Employers by Forbes
Career & Development Opportunities
Full-time
Entry, Mid, Senior level




Back to Job Navigation (Overview)


Responsibilities


Raytheon Intelligence, Information and Services is looking forPrincipal Systems Engineer – Advanced Signal Processor to join our Advanced Signal Processor program team in Aurora, Colorado. The Principal Systems Engineer – Advanced Signal Processor will be a senior team member of a dynamic and multidiscipline development team within the Advanced Mission Solutions (AMS) program area.  Responsibilities will span the development life cycle to include development, qualification testing, fielding and support of deployed systems. The Principal Systems Engineer will be the technical expert on the Advanced Signal Processor working with our teammates to develop, manufacture and deploy these units. Tasks include development and maintenance of requirements and ICDs, maintaining architectural models, chairing technical exchanges and working with teammates to resolve technical issues. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in systems engineering, the development of front-end processors and experience on multi-contractor teams.This position is eligible for a Sign on Bonus up to 40k for a candidate with a current TS/SCI and that can be verified and hired at Raytheon. Security Clearance: Must be a US Citizen and have an active TS/SCI or DoD TS clearance.Required Skills:US Citizen with current/existing TS/SCI  or DoD TS security clearanceMinimum 8+ years of related systems engineering work experienceExperience with hardware development, integration and test, especially of front-end processorsFamiliar with digital signal processingExperience with DOORSExperience with Microsoft Office suite (e.g. Project, PowerPoint, Excel and Word)Experience establishing and maintaining good working relationships with all levels of the organization, including Government customer, program leadership, and support organizationsGood understanding of hardware development processes and their application to programsHigh level of integrity and strong work ethicStrong interpersonal skills and ability to work within a teamExcellent written and verbal communication skillsMust be willing and able to travel, as requiredDesired Skills:Experience with Sparx Enterprise ArchitectExperience with spacecraft command and controlFamiliar with designing and implementing software-defined radiosExperience with agile design, development, and testing processesRequired Education (including Major):Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering, Science, or Mathematics (STEM).  Advance degree desirableIISBonusCONETWORKCOSE#cleared#DSPJOBS 147894
Business Unit Profile
                        
                        Raytheon Intelligence, Information and Services delivers innovative technology to make the world a safer place. Our expertise in cyber, analytics and automation allow us to reach beyond what others think is possible to underpin national security and give our global customers unique solutions to solve the most pressing modern challenges -- from the cyber domain to automated operations, and from intelligent transportation solutions to creating clear insight from large volumes of data. IIS operates at nearly 550 sites in 80 countries, and is headquartered in Dulles, Virginia. The business area generated $6.1 billion in 2017 revenues. As a global business, our leaders must have the ability to understand, embrace and operate in a multicultural world -- in the marketplace and the workplace. We strive to hire people who reflect our communities and embrace diversity and inclusion to advance our culture, develop our employees, and grow our business.

Reimbursement Advocate  I  (98098) - Richardson, TX - Inogen, Inc. Jobs








 














Home
Jobs




Reimbursement Advocate  I  (98098) - Richardson, TX

Toggle navigation








Reimbursement Advocate  I  (98098) 

JobsLogin 












 Billing Richardson, TX, USA Full Time 



Email Me Similar Jobs Email Me This Job



ABOUT INOGEN Inogen was founded in 2001 to improve quality of life and increase freedom and independence for oxygen therapy users. Inogen is innovation in oxygen therapy. The Inogen mission is to improve freedom and independence for oxygen therapy patients through innovative products and services. Inogen is a manufacturer and Accredited Homecare Provider.
Inogen is focused on quality care, continuous improvement, and outstanding customer satisfaction. We are a stable, USA based company dedicated to providing an exciting and rewarding career to our employees. We completed a successful Initial Public Offering on the NASDAQ in 2014 and have demonstrated substantial growth over the last five years. Our work environment is casual yet high performing, and we are looking for seriously talented, motivated, and fast-paced professionals to join our team.
JOB DESCRIPTION 
Reimbursement Advocate will work with Medicare, Medicaid, Commercial Insurance companies and customers to ensure medical claims are submitted timely, processed, and paid accurately. This includes working payor rejections and denials, obtaining qualifying documentation and authorizations, providing high level customer support, RUL's, updating patient file within all billing systems as required, and following all applicable compliance and regulatory processes, payor guidelines, and Inogen policies and procedures. 
Key Competencies:
Collect payments for outstanding open accounts receivable balances.
Works with Medicare, Medicaid, Commercial Insurance, and Private Pay to ensure medical claims are being processed timely and paid accurately. 
Must meet/exceed daily/weekly production & quality KPI standards.
Ensures all billing systems are updated timely with patient demographics, payer information, and notated appropriately. 
Analyzes payer claim rejections & denials to help determine root cause and prevention of future rejections & denials from reoccurring. 
Gathers, prepares, and submits required information and/or documentation to appeal claim denials.
Uses appropriate write off reason code(s) for writing off balances that are deemed uncollectable.
Responsible for assisting our patients, doctors, customers, and coworkers with billing inquiries at the highest-level support possible. This includes logging into phone queue and updating statuses appropriately. 
Ensures the billing of all claims via electronic or paper to Medicare, Medicaid, and Commercial Insurance payers are being submitted accurately and timely in accordance with Inogen's policy. 
Ensures RUL (Reasonable Usable Lifetime) patients exiting the monthly cap period are in a billable status. 
Responsible for working NME's (New Medicare Eligibility), Payor Changes, Pending Pick-ups, and Stop patients timely. Verifies and evaluates insurance benefits to determine the policy's compatibility with Inogen's services.
Ensures the timely procurement of all required documentation and obtain authorizations in order to prevent future denials.
Ensures that appropriate medical records are maintained according to HIPPA guidelines.
Ensures Inogen's compliance with all state and federal regulations.
Maintain regular and punctual attendance. 
Comply with all company policies and procedures. 
Assist with any other duties as assigned. 
Do you possess these abilities?
A comprehensive understanding of Medicare, Medicaid, and/or Commercial Insurance program rules as it pertains to DME billing.
Ability to take direction and communicate effectively with customers and employees at all level of organization.
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced and dynamically changing organization.
Must have strong work ethic.
Excellent oral and written communication skills required. 
Attention to detail is required. 
Effective conflict resolution. 
Ability to maintain confidentiality and exercise extreme discretion. 
Solutions-oriented problem solver. 
Excellent planning, communication and organizational skills. 
 
Requirements:
Operates at a task level.
Substantial supervision required.
High School diploma or equivalent, required 
0-2 years of Medicare, Medicaid and/or Commercial Insurance experience, required. 
1-year experience in oxygen or HME billing, preferred. 
Basic knowledge/proficiency in Microsoft Office, Oracle, Brightree, Salesforce and New Voice Media, preferred. 
A combination of training, education and experience that is equivalent to the qualifications listed above and that provides the required knowledge, skills, and abilities.
WHY INOGEN Inogen is a dynamic company that is not only focused on quality care of patients, but is also committed to being a top employer.  Each of Inogen' s offices have a casual culture that supports employees being responsible and developing professionals.
We offer competitive salaries and a robust benefit package:
Employee Stock Purchase Plan 401 (K) plan available for all employees Health, dental, vision insurance Flexible spending accounts and wellness discount program Life Insurance Long Term Disability Robust paid time off and 8 paid holidays Employee Assistance Program
See the Inogen Team in action:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dKoTMeJf5J4
 
Inogen Where we go to work hard to positively impact people's lives
 
Inogen is an equal opportunity employer.  We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other legally protected characteristics. The EEO is the Law poster and its supplement are available here: http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/ofccpost.htm; http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/OFCCP_EEO_Supplement_Final_JRF_QA_508c.pdf.  The pay transparency policy is available here: http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/pdf/EO13665_PrescribedNondiscriminationPostingLanguage_JRFQA508c.pdf. 
Inogen is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities.  If you need a reasonable accommodation because of a disability for any part of the employment process, please send an e-mail to recruiting@inogen.net or call (972) 616-5668 and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information.
 
 

Inogen, Inc.
https://inogen.applicantpro.com

If you’re ready to take on a fresh challenge, grow your career and contribute to making the world a safer place, Raytheon is ready to help you achieve your goals. Join our team and get the opportunity and support to find purpose, thrive and succeed.





Notice: Please be aware of suspicious recruiting emails and text messages that attempt to collect your confidential information. Software Integration Systems Engineer II
Aurora, Colorado

Overview

Raytheon delivers innovative technology to make the world a safer place. Our expertise in cyber, analytics and automation allow us to reach beyond what others think is possible to underpin national security and give our global customers unique solutions to solve the most pressing modern challenges -- from the cyber domain to automated operations, and from intelligent transportation solutions to creating clear insight from large volumes of data. Our leaders must have the ability to understand, embrace and operate in a multicultural world -- in the marketplace and the workplace. We strive to hire people who reflect our communities and embrace diversity and inclusion to advance our culture, develop our employees, and grow our business.

Full-time
Entry to Senior level

Glassdoor 2017 Best Places to Interview: Candidate's Choice

Rewards




401(k) / Retirement Plans
Employer Matching, if you elect to enroll company matches up to 3%.



Work / Life Balance
Raytheon appreciates work/life balance. Employees can work 9 hours a day every week and received every other Friday off, as long as departmental/manager approval is obtained. Accrued paid time off monthly and paid holiday time.



Career Development
At Raytheon, we foster an inclusive culture of professional development. We support a variety of developmental opportunities including: Mentoring programs, Skills Development, Leadership Development, Rotational job assignments, and Continuous Improvement, all of which contribute to advancement of our employee’s capabilities.



Paid Time Off
Accrue paid time off monthly. Receive 12 holidays per year including the week between Christmas and New Year’s Day.



Relocation Assistance
Select technical positions are eligible for relocation packages. See specific job description for eligibility requirements.



Parental Leave
Raytheon offers all eligible employees up to three weeks paid parental leave for the birth or adoption of a child (separate from paid maternity leave or Family & Medical Leave Act).



Back to Job Navigation (Rewards)



Responsibilities


Would you like to work in a collaborative environment at a state of the art facility in Colorado? Then join our Raytheon team of engineers solving problems that make the world a safer place and help to secure our great nation! Come support those who provide us with all the freedoms we enjoy.Our facility in Aurora, CO offers amenities that create work and life balance. On site we have a 24/7 fitness facility, health center, cafeteria, collaboration rooms and dynamic break areas for easy conversation and socialization. Additionally, employee appreciation lunches, bonus opportunities, and great benefits that include medical, dental, vision, 401K match, flexible work schedule - just to name a few.  Click here to view a brief video and learn more: https://youtu.be/YNuZN0vyzHgRaytheon is seeking a JuniorSoftware Integration Systems Engineer for programs in our C2, Space and Intelligence Solutions mission area in Aurora, Colorado.As a junior Software Integration Systems Engineer, your duties will include but not be limited to the following: Support the planning and conduct of integration activities; defining integration plans and sequences relative to complex software and hardware subsystems and resolve conflicting issues.  Participate in a complex integration program; establish methods and techniques, write integration procedures and reports, and conduct integration utilizing comprehensive knowledge of complex subsystems. Participate in integration and test readiness reviews, design reviews, and audits of integration and test programs and facilities.Utilize broad knowledge in integration engineering and apply understanding of principles of related engineering and software technology. Clearance Requirement:  Must be a US Citizens with a current /active Secret clearance with the ability to obtain and maintain a TS/SCI clearance.This position is eligible for a Sign on Bonus up to $40k for a candidate with a current TS/SCI that can be verified and hired at Raytheon.Required Skills: Current SECRET clearance.2+ years demonstrated engineering experience with proven record of accomplishment.Integration engineering experience on a software development contractEnthusiastic & energetic performer able to work in a dynamic, fast-paced, & high visibility environmentSelf-motivated and capable of performing tasks with minimal oversightExperience with systems engineering principles and activitiesDesired Skills: Current SSBI, or active TS/SCI security clearanceExperience preparing and executing Integration proceduresExperience with test script or automation developmentExperience working in a Satellite Ground System development or operations environmentExperience with ground station satellite domains (command and telemetry, flight dynamics or mission planning)Scripting (Python, Perl, CECIL)Experience in an Agile or DevOps development environment.Proficiency with Windows and Linux operating systemExperience with Java or C++Education Requirements: B.S./M.S./PhD in a STEM degree.  Aerospace Engineering, Systems Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, Mechanical Engineering, Physics, Math or other STEM degree.  This position requires either a U.S. Person or a Non-U.S. Person who is eligible to obtain any required Export Authorization. 148985
