Client Partnerships Manager




								Advertiser Development Team
							
							     | 
							

										Santa Barbara
									
																									,
																									
										California
									

								 | 
							
								0104750
							




Apply now
	
	

    




Client Partnerships Manager - (0104750) 
Location:Santa Barbara or Westlake Village, CADo you want to work in a fun, smart, and energetic environment where you will be challenged, rewarded AND inspired? Come work with top performers at CJ Affiliate to make a real difference in how top brands run their businesses. We are the world’s leading affiliate marketing network - we transform digital marketing with the help of big data and business intelligence.   We help advertisers drive more sales and expand their reach … and we want to hear from you
 
Client Partnerships Managers play a key role in support of CJ's advertisers. They are responsible for maintaining all publisher relationships of behalf of the advertiser and are responsible for creating and executing recruitment and optimization campaigns. They contribute to the development of an affiliate marketing strategy for each advertiser, and are directly responsible for ensuring the successful execution of that strategy, including managing Client Partnerships Associates in their tactical execution.
 
Do these things interest you? You will:
Recruit, manage and develop publisher relationships on behalf of advertisers, communicating expectations, sharing best practices, disseminating offers and promotions, and providing account updates to an advertiser's largest/most important publishers.
Participate in building and presenting the advertiser strategy presentations and quarterly business reviews of results.
Identify new sources of revenue on behalf of advertisers by extending reach through new publisher relationships or optimizing affiliate marketing campaign strategies.
Lead recruitment and optimization components of weekly client calls, documenting and disseminating assigned tasks across client and CJ account teams, and ensuring successful execution of assigned tasks.
Train and develop Client Partnerships Associates, as well as leading their efforts to successfully execute tactical components of affiliate marketing campaigns.
Identify opportunities to better optimize campaign results by interpreting standard and custom reports 
What we look for:
Bachelor's Degree and minimum of 2 years’ experience in the online marketing industry-ideally digital performance marketing.
Clear and effective communication and can convey complex results in a simple, clear manner, using solid business acumen, demonstrating a competent level command of digital marketing concepts.
Ability to influence/develop account strategies that leverage analysis and insights to contribute to meeting or exceeding advertiser objectives.
Ability to execute a variety of tasks within designated time frames, delivering exceptional quality results and are able to directly contribute to the formation of client campaigns and quarterly business results.
Results oriented problem solver
Proficient knowledge of the Microsoft suite of products including Windows, Word, Excel, and PowerPoint.
  

Why CJ Affiliate? 
CJ Affiliate is the leader in Affiliate Marketing.  We take pride in our innovative technology, comprehensive data solutions and our people.  We equip our teams with advanced tools, training and career development opportunities all to provide cutting edge solutions, strategies and support to deliver high quality results for our clients. We work in an energetic, results-oriented, collaborative, team environment that recognizes exceptional performance. As we evolve and grow as a business, so do you.        
 
Conditions
of Employment
All job offers are contingent upon
successful completion of certain background checks which unless prohibited by
applicable law may include criminal history checks, employment verification,
education verification, drug screens, credit checks, DMV checks (for driving
positions only) and fingerprinting.
 
Great
People, Deserve Great Benefits
We know that we have some of the
brightest and most talented associates in the world, and we believe in
rewarding them accordingly.  If you work
here, expect competitive pay, comprehensive health coverage, and endless
opportunities to advance your career.  
 
About
Us
Epsilon® is an all-encompassing global
marketing innovator. We provide unrivaled data intelligence and customer
insights, world-class technology including loyalty, email and CRM platforms and
data-driven creative, activation and execution. Epsilon’s digital media arm,
Conversant, is a leader in personalized digital advertising and insights
through its proprietary technology and trove of consumer marketing data,
delivering digital marketing with unprecedented scale, accuracy and reach
through personalized media programs. Together, we bring personalized marketing
to consumers across offline and online channels, at moments of interest that
help drive business growth for brands.  Epsilon employs over 8,000
associates in 70 offices worldwide. For more information, visit www.epsilon.com and follow us on Twitter @EpsilonMktg.
 
Epsilon provides equal employment
opportunities without regard to race, color, religion, gender, age, national
origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status or any
other characteristic protected by law.
 
Epsilon is an Equal Opportunity
Employer. Epsilon participates in E-Verify.
Epsilon will provide accommodations to
applicants needing accommodations to complete the application process.
Any applicant offered employment will be
required to establish that they are legally authorized to work in the United
States for Epsilon.
Epsilon will consider for employment
qualified applicants with criminal and credit histories in a manner consistent
with the requirements of all applicable laws, including the City of Los
Angeles’ Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring Ordinance.
 
For San Francisco Bay Area:
Epsilon will consider for employment-qualified
applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements
of San Francisco Police Code Sections 4901 - 4919, commonly referred to as the
San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance.

About The Advertiser Development Team

						Advertiser Development teams work closely with a portfolio of clients to understand their unique business objectives and maximize the effectiveness of their affiliate programs. Regular activities include creating and executing strategic growth plans, analyzing and applying data, recruiting new publishers and optimizing publisher relationships.

            Account Executive



         Login to apply
    
















Account Executive
Raleigh, NC 


Account Executive, Senior Living
The Account Executive, Senior Living will be responsible for developing and cultivating a regional territory and selling Yardi’s products and services to prospective and existing clients within the senior housing industry.  This is an outside sales position requiring software sales experience in the senior housing space.
The Account Executive, Senior Living will be responsible for the following duties and responsibilities:

Heavy prospecting and identifying new sales opportunities for a designated territory
Managing sales activities to support business plans and revenue goals
Cultivating and managing professional relationships with prospective and existing clients at the senior level
Becoming familiar with all product solutions, the competitive climate, and promoting company products in the marketplace
Conducting online and onsite presentations to demonstrate Yardi’s Senior Living product offerings
Developing and executing outbound call and email campaigns
Participating and networking at industry events and tradeshows
Meeting or exceeding monthly, quarterly and annual revenue goals
Maintaining accurate account information and forecasting details through a CRM system
Establishing a strong sales pipeline, sales forecasts and updating accounts to support revenue growth
Identifying client needs by introducing and up-selling Yardi ancillary tools/products to potentially increase client revenue opportunities.
Assisting with the development and implementation of marketing materials and programs
Participating in regular sales meetings to report on the status of all opportunities in the sales pipeline and new acquisitions to the pipeline

 
 This position will require the following background and experience:

Bachelor’s degree of equivalent experience
3+years of successful sales experience managing and developing a sales territory
Solid knowledge base in sales and ability to apply basic sales principles (i.e. lead generation, opportunity qualification, proposal development, account management and closure)
Ability to effectively execute sales strategies using a consultative approach and relationship building techniques
Ability to interface with all levels within the client organization to include individual properties, large portfolios and other senior leadership in large to mid-sized companies
Strong ,engaging presentation skills and ability to demonstrate product value
Ability to develop and maintain solid client relationships and effectively develop a sales territory
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Ability to internally motivate, work interdependently, and also work effectively with a team
Ability to understand and demonstrate technical products
Prior experience entering data into a CRM system to support up to date client contact and information
Proven track record of achieving or exceeding sales goals
Prior background in software sales, senior housing property management, or accounting systems desirable
Experience with using or selling CRM, eMAR, EHR or Senior Living related software
Require up to 50% travel**

*cl

By continuing to browse this site you agree to our use of cookies. You can find out more about which cookies we are using or switch them off in settings.
 

 
Accept

 


















 

 Privacy Overview


 Strictly Necessary Cookies


 3rd Party Cookies




 








Privacy Overview

This website uses cookies so that we can provide you with the best user experience possible. Cookie information is stored in your browser and performs functions such as recognising you when you return to our website and helping our team to understand which sections of the website you find most interesting and useful.
You can adjust all of your cookie settings by navigating the tabs on the left hand side.



 
Strictly Necessary Cookies

Strictly necessary cookies must be enabled at all times in order to login and apply to openings.



disable









If you disable this cookie, we will not be able to save your preferences and you will not be able to login to apply for openings. This means that every time you visit this website you will need to enable or disable cookies again.







3rd Party Cookies

This website uses Google Analytics to collect anonymous information such as the number of visitors to the site, and the most popular pages.
Keeping this cookie enabled helps us to improve our website.



disable









Please enable Strictly Necessary Cookies first so that we can save your preferences!












Enable All
Save Changes

If you’re ready to take on a fresh challenge, grow your career and contribute to making the world a safer place, Raytheon is ready to help you achieve your goals. Join our team and get the opportunity and support to find purpose, thrive and succeed.





Notice: Please be aware of suspicious recruiting emails and text messages that attempt to collect your confidential information. Sr Infrastructure Engineer I
Dulles, Virginia


Apply





Overview
Responsibilities
Success Profile
Rewards
Trending




Overview

What does it take to make the world a safer place? It takes delivering innovative technology and collaborating with some of the finest talent in the engineering field. Whether you’re a software engineer or a mechanical engineer, at Raytheon you’ll grow a varied and rewarding career. And you’ll be supported with a comprehensive and competitive benefits package that promotes work/life. If you’re ready to take on today’s big challenges, discover a world of opportunity at Raytheon.

America’s Best Large Employers by Forbes
Career & Development Opportunities
Full-time
Entry, Mid, Senior level




Back to Job Navigation (Overview)


Responsibilities


Raytheon is seeking a motivated Infrastructure Engineer to perform system administration, configuration and testing of a COTS product for a VoIP intercom system that is part of a command and control weapon system. The role also includes the Integration, Verification and Validation (IV&V) of an existing intercom system. The candidate should be knowledgeable of Windows 10 and Red Hat Linux operating systems administration as well as virtual machine management and configuration.  The candidate will work collaboratively with other engineering disciplines through all phases of development, test and delivery.Responsibilities will include:Apply communication, analytic and problem-solving skills to identify, communicate and resolve issues. Recommend integration solutions combining software and hardware systems Perform hardware computing device and cable plant installation Provide maintenance oversight of a development lab Excel as part of a small test team exercising feature level capability and coordination of customer selloff, and supporting the update process for operations manuals, work instructions, tools, and scripts.  Contribute to a team of systems engineers in accomplishment of engineering tasks in an iterative development environment. Attend technical interchange meetings with team members and multiple disciplines.Provide status on assigned tasks.Candidates with a current TS/SCI security clearance or higher are eligible for a $20,000 sign on bonus if the clearance is confirmed and the candidate is hired by RaytheonRequired Skills:Current and Active TS/SCI Security ClearanceUnderstanding of systems Information Assurance (IA) policiesSolid understanding of system testing methodologiesUnderstanding and experience in an (Scrum) Agile Engineering environmentProficiency with MS Office ApplicationsStrong communication skills, both oral and written.Must work well in a team environment and independently.Must exhibit good time management skills and independent decision making capability.Willingness and availability to travel domestically and internationally on short notice approximately 25% of the time.Security+ or CISSP active certificationDesired Skills:Experience supporting Intelligence and/or DoD customersUnderstanding of Assessment and Authorization (ICD 503) processes as they apply to communication systemsExperience with Network architectureExperience with process development and deploymentRequired Education (including Major):Requires a degree in Science, Technology, Engineering or Mathematics (STEM) and 4 years of related work experienceIISVA092419 145572
Business Unit Profile
                        
                        Raytheon Intelligence, Information and Services delivers innovative technology to make the world a safer place. Our expertise in cyber, analytics and automation allow us to reach beyond what others think is possible to underpin national security and give our global customers unique solutions to solve the most pressing modern challenges -- from the cyber domain to automated operations, and from intelligent transportation and training solutions to creating clear insight from large volumes of data. IIS operates at nearly 550 sites in 80 countries, and is headquartered in Dulles, Virginia. The business area generated $6.2 billion in 2018 revenues. As a global business, our leaders must have the ability to understand, embrace and operate in a multicultural world -- in the marketplace and the workplace. We strive to hire people who reflect our communities and embrace diversity and inclusion to advance our culture, develop our employees, and grow our business.
Relocation Eligible 
                        
                        Yes

Rewards




401(k) / Retirement Plans
Employer Matching, if you elect to enroll company matches up to 3%.



Work / Life Balance
Raytheon supports a variety of flexible work arrangements including compressed work weeks, flextime, job sharing, 9/80, reduced hours and telecommuting.



Career Development
At Raytheon, we foster an inclusive culture of professional development. We support a variety of developmental opportunities including: Mentoring programs, Skills Development, Leadership Development, Rotational job assignments, and Continuous Improvement, all of which contribute to advancement of our employee’s capabilities.



Paid Time Off
Accrue paid time off monthly. Receive 10-12 holidays per year with some locations shutting down the week between Christmas and New Year’s Day.



Relocation Assistance
Select technical positions are eligible for relocation packages. See specific job description for eligibility requirements.



Parental Leave
Raytheon offers all eligible employees up to three weeks paid parental leave for the birth or adoption of a child (separate from paid maternity leave or Family & Medical Leave Act).

            Technical Analyst



         Login to apply
    
















Technical Analyst
Long Island, NY 


Under minimal direction the Technical Analyst performs complex and sophisticated systems analyses to assist new and existing clients with the management of application systems, hardware, and system functional specifications for the use of Yardi software products. The Technical Analyst identifies application issues, customizes software products to client specifications, and serves as an escalation resource.
ESSENTIAL RESPONSIBILITIES

Consults and provides technical direction to users
Assists and supports users with understanding Yardi functional design, configuring Yardi software, and meeting client operational needs
Works collaboratively with clients to identify and define application issues
Evaluates procedures and processes for product use and prepares/evaluates alternative workflow solutions
Creates applications and customizations as needed to implement identified customer solutions
Documents, tests, and creates or modifies computer programs to improve Yardi product functionality
Serves as an escalation resource for complex application systems problems and sophisticated client requests
Validates and documents solution effectiveness through program and quality assurance testing
Collaborates internally with analysts, designers, programmers, sales teams, and marketing teams with a focus on meeting client needs and maintaining high-level customer service standards
Monitors technical advancements, regulations, and best practices relevant to clients in the application of Yardi products
Performs special projects related to department training and client support as well as other duties as assigned

EDUCATION/QUALIFICATIONS/EXPERIENCE

Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Sciences or equivalent

Two (2) years in a software support, analytics, or services role
Advanced knowledge in all the following areas: Microsoft operating and network system operation, Relational databases, and SQL/Oracle language 


DESIRED EDUCATION/QUALIFICATIONS/EXPERIENCE

Experience with HTML/Cloud Services
Understanding of property management industry and best practices
Project management experience
Working knowledge of accounting practices

REQUIRED SKILLS/ABILITIES

Proficiency in SQL
Strong technical computer and database management skills
Excellent independent decision-making and problem-solving skills
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Client-centered commitment and focus
Ability to meet critical deadlines and prioritize multiple tasks in a fast-paced environment
Collegial, team-oriented disposition with the desire and ability to establish cooperative working relationships with employees at all levels within Yardi, outside of Yardi, and with customers
Basic understanding of Yardi’s Voyager software
Basic understanding of the Cafe platform and associated ancillary products

DESIRED SKILLS/ABILITIES

Understanding of property management industry and best practices
Working knowledge of accounting practices
Understanding of project management principles
Understanding of networks and peripherals
Experience with HTML
Understanding of Cloud Services
Understanding of Development
Understanding of network configuration and associated peripherals
Ability to efficiently communicate highly technical topics or solutions to a non-technical audience

WORKING ENVIRONMENT/PHYSICAL DEMANDS

Ability to work at assigned office location
Schedule flexibility to support superlative customer service in response to client needs
Attend meetings and perform tasks for long periods of time on a computer and on the telephone
Regular attendance and a regular work schedule are essential functions of this job

By continuing to browse this site you agree to our use of cookies. You can find out more about which cookies we are using or switch them off in settings.
 

 
Accept

 


















 

 Privacy Overview


 Strictly Necessary Cookies


 3rd Party Cookies




 








Privacy Overview

This website uses cookies so that we can provide you with the best user experience possible. Cookie information is stored in your browser and performs functions such as recognising you when you return to our website and helping our team to understand which sections of the website you find most interesting and useful.
You can adjust all of your cookie settings by navigating the tabs on the left hand side.



 
Strictly Necessary Cookies

Strictly necessary cookies must be enabled at all times in order to login and apply to openings.



disable









If you disable this cookie, we will not be able to save your preferences and you will not be able to login to apply for openings. This means that every time you visit this website you will need to enable or disable cookies again.







3rd Party Cookies

This website uses Google Analytics to collect anonymous information such as the number of visitors to the site, and the most popular pages.
Keeping this cookie enabled helps us to improve our website.



disable









Please enable Strictly Necessary Cookies first so that we can save your preferences!












Enable All
Save Changes

If you’re ready to take on a fresh challenge, grow your career and contribute to making the world a safer place, Raytheon is ready to help you achieve your goals. Join our team and get the opportunity and support to find purpose, thrive and succeed.





Notice: Please be aware of suspicious recruiting emails and text messages that attempt to collect your confidential information. Raytheon conducts all electronic correspondence using e-mail addresses that end in “Raytheon.com”, “Raytheon.co.uk”, “Raytheon.com.au” or “brassring.com”. To report fraud please go to: https://www.ic3.gov.











Sr Systems Engineer II
Dulles, Virginia


Apply





Overview
Responsibilities
Success Profile
Rewards
Trending




Overview

What does it take to make the world a safer place? It takes delivering innovative technology and collaborating with some of the finest talent in the engineering field. Whether you’re a software engineer or a mechanical engineer, at Raytheon you’ll grow a varied and rewarding career. And you’ll be supported with a comprehensive and competitive benefits package that promotes work/life. If you’re ready to take on today’s big challenges, discover a world of opportunity at Raytheon.

America’s Best Large Employers by Forbes
Career & Development Opportunities
Full-time
Entry, Mid, Senior level




Back to Job Navigation (Overview)


Responsibilities


Would you like to work in a collaborative environment at a state of the art facility in Dulles? Then join our Intelligence, Information and Services (IIS) team of smart people solving problems that make the world a safer place and help to secure our great nation! Come support those who provide us with all the freedoms we enjoy. Our facility in Dulles VA offers amenities that create work and life balance. The Dulles site includes 4 modern facilities with 3 industrial buildings.  On site we have a fitness center plus a fun space with a pool table, foosball and video games. Additionally, employee appreciation lunches, bonus opportunities, and great benefits that include medical, dental, vision, 401K match, flexible work schedules, are just a few of the reasons people come to work at IIS!   Raytheon is seeking a motivated Systems Engineer (SE) to lead the configuration and testing of cyber and infrastructure of Unmanned Aerial Vehicle (UAV) ground control systems. The role involves managing small teams and providing technical guidance for the selection, configuration and test of Components Off the Shelf (COTS) and Free and Open Source Software (FOSS). The candidate should have experience applying controls and policies to system infrastructure and using incident and system monitoring tools. The candidate must have strong communication skills and work collaboratively with other engineering discipline leads through all phases of development, test and delivery. It would be beneficial if the candidate has experience with the Systems Engineering lifecycle including development of requirements, architecture and related documentation as well as testing and selloff.Raytheon is a technology and innovation leader specializing in defense, security and civil markets throughout the world.  Our latest company video is about our people, our technology, our vision, and the values we hold dear at Raytheon.  Click here to view: https://youtu.be/qvbCgKpkEdsResponsibilities will include:Manages Systems Engineering Infrastructure team’s technical scope and execution for all SE phases including design, integration, testing, and delivery supportLeads Integration and configuration of COTS, FOSS and custom softwareLeads tailoring, application, verification of Security Technical Implementation Guides (STIGs), Active Directory Group PoliciesApply clear communication, analytic and problem-solving skills to identify, communicate and resolve issues. Work with the other technical leads to administer and support the overall program.Required Skills: Existing DoD Secret ClearanceExperience processing NIST Special Publication (SP 800-53) controlsExperience evaluating and implementing STIGsExperience evaluating and implementing Active Directory Group PolicyFamiliar with syslog collection and Security Incident and Event Management (SIEM) toolsFamiliar with SNMP collection and system health and status monitoring tools (ex. Solarwinds)Familiar with network and system infrastructure and security (ex. NTP, Routers, switches, firewalls, PKI, two-factor authentication)Desired Skills: UAV or Aviation domain knowledgeSystems Administration ExperienceExperience with leading teams and performing EVMSExperience supporting DoD contractsEducation Requirements: Bachelor’s degree in Systems Engineering, Software Engineering, Computer Science or a related technical discipline.   Master’s Degree preferred. Master’s degree in System Engineering, Computer Science, or related discipline.Minimum of 6 years engineering experience This position requires either a U.S. Person or a Non-U.S. Person who is eligible to obtain any required Export Authorization. 152360
Business Unit Profile
                        
                        Intelligence, Information and Services delivers innovative technology to make the world a safer place. Our expertise in cyber, analytics and automation allow us to reach beyond what others think is possible to underpin national security and give our global customers unique solutions to solve the most pressing modern challenges -- from the cyber domain to automated operations, and from intelligent transportation and training solutions to creating clear insight from large volumes of data. IIS operates at nearly 550 sites in 80 countries, and is headquartered in Dulles, Virginia. The business area generated $6.2 billion in 2018 revenues. As a global business, our leaders must have the ability to understand, embrace and operate in a multicultural world -- in the marketplace and the workplace. We strive to hire people who reflect our communities and embrace diversity and inclusion to advance our culture, develop our employees, and grow our business.
Relocation Eligible 
                        
                        Yes
Clearance Type 
                        
                        Secret - Current

 Sign In 

 























            Regional Marketing Specialist



         Login to apply
    
















Regional Marketing Specialist
Raleigh, NC 


The Regional Marketing Specialist is responsible for successfully facilitating marketing programs and supporting sales efforts at the regional, MSA and when appropriate, account level. Regional marketing programs include regional trade association sponsorships and events, region- and account-focused emails and the customization of sales and marketing materials for specific regions or strategic accounts. This individual will work with cross-functional teams from Marketing, Sales and Services to execute regional marketing programs.
 
Responsibilities

Subscribe to local/regional trade organization email lists for newsletters, local event announcements, etc. and join local trade groups on social media (Facebook, LinkedIn, Twitter)
Proactively and regularly contact trade organizations to determine networking, sponsorship, and speaking opportunities
Secure and manage local/regional trade organization opportunities as identified, including trade shows, sponsorship entitlements, speaker placement, design/display requirements, swag, etc. (leveraging Trade Events team to coordinate)
Meet regularly with Regional Managers/Directors in Sales to adjust regional strategy based on competitive intelligence, product priority, account-level data
Assist Sales with client/prospect invitations and follow-up related to local/regional trade events, Market Updates, other Yardi corporate events
Understand competitive landscape and Yardi’s relative strengths and weaknesses to competitor products to promote Yardi products effectively (e.g., sell Breeze vs. Voyager when competing against AppFolio)
Serve as ambassador at local/regional events, delivering short company/product presentations as needed and as included in sponsorship entitlements; network at events and talk to prospects and clients about their needs and how Yardi can help them
Identify marketing opportunities based on account-level data and update email templates, collateral, etc. to be used by sales as targeted micro-marketing
Update product webinar marketing emails monthly with schedule and times (per regional time zone) and provide to Sales for targeted regional marketing based on account data
Customize Sales decks, leavebehinds, etc. as applicable for strategic client meetings
Identify and recommend thought leadership content to Sales for use in specific regions or with specific accounts and gain feedback from Sales regarding additional marketing and thought leadership materials needed and work with Corporate Marketing to develop

 
Requirements

Bachelor’s Degree in Marketing, Communications, Business, Finance, or equivalent relevant experience
Five plus (5+) years in marketing, sales or equivalent experience interacting with customers
Experience in business to business (B2B) marketing
Experience in ERP systems
Yardi domain experience is a plus
Knowledge of real estate industry and Yardi’s competitors plus
Excellent interpersonal and relationship management skills
Strong research and analytical skills
Proficiency in Microsoft Office, Excel and PowerPoint
Experience with CRM
Experience with event marketing
Proven collaboration skills within a dynamic team
Proven ability to meet critical deadlines and prioritize multiple tasks in a fast-paced environment
Proven ability to manage projects with multiple touch points
Strong organizational and time management skills
Proven excellent written and verbal communication skills
Good public speaking skills
Excellent attention to detail and accuracy in execution of work and tasks
Ability to work independently as well in collaboration with others
Proven client-centered commitment and focus
Collegial, team-oriented disposition with the desire and ability to establish cooperative professional relationships with employees at all levels within Yardi, outside of Yardi, and with clients
Ability to think and act strategically by visualizing new possibilities, challenging assumptions, and recommending the implementation of new ideas or strategies desired
Regular attendance and a regular work schedule are essential functions of this job

If you’re ready to take on a fresh challenge, grow your career and contribute to making the world a safer place, Raytheon is ready to help you achieve your goals. Join our team and get the opportunity and support to find purpose, thrive and succeed.





Notice: Please be aware of suspicious recruiting emails and text messages that attempt to collect your confidential information. Raytheon conducts all electronic correspondence using e-mail addresses that end in “Raytheon.com”, “Raytheon.co.uk”, “Raytheon.com.au” or “brassring.com”. To report fraud please go to: https://www.ic3.gov.











Sr Systems Engineer I
Dulles, Virginia


Apply

Responsibilities

Overview

What does it take to make the world a safer place? It takes delivering innovative technology and collaborating with some of the finest talent in the engineering field. Whether you’re a software engineer or a mechanical engineer, at Raytheon you’ll grow a varied and rewarding career. And you’ll be supported with a comprehensive and competitive benefits package that promotes work/life. If you’re ready to take on today’s big challenges, discover a world of opportunity at Raytheon.

America’s Best Large Employers by Forbes
Career & Development Opportunities
Full-time
Entry, Mid, Senior level




Back to Job Navigation (Overview)


Responsibilities


Raytheon Intelligence, Information and Services (IIS) is currently seeking a Systems Engineer in support of several Systems Engineering programs and efforts.   The Systems Engineering applicant will participate in Systems Engineering development efforts.  This position involves working in a team environment with responsibilities in all phases of Systems development including concept development, requirements, functional analysis, design reviews, implementation, test, verification, validation and transition.  Multiple positions are available with multiple skill sets.Validated TS/SCI clearances are eligible for sign-on bonus amounts up to $40,000.Clearance Requirements:  Current TS/SCILocation: Dulles, VAResponsibilities include, but are not limited to: Perform life cycle systems engineering and test activities in support of on-going programs.  Work with external industry and Govt. stakeholders in the resolution of engineering systems issues.Develop and maintain requirements for systems and subsystemsPrepare for and conduct design reviewsWork in an IPT in the development of defense equipment and products.Develop Test strategies and proceduresWork within and coordinate systems engineering activities across the customer, supplier and internal IPT.Required Skills:4+ years demonstrated experience in systems engineering, software engineering or related engineering disciplineKnowledge of the following systems engineering functions:CONOPS developmentrequirements development and managementarchitecturesystem designinterface definition and controlintegration and test to include test planning and procedure developmentDemonstrated understanding of the systems engineering lifecycle in support of software development, avionics systems development or sustainment activitiesExcellent written and oral communication skillsExperience with Microsoft Office suite of tools, particularly Excel, Project, and PowerPointCurrent TS/SCI clearanceDesired Skills: Experience with requirements management using DOORS or similar requirements management toolKnowledge of software development lifecycle models (waterfall and Agile) and program lifecycle modesAbility to the identify, manage, and mitigate technical riskExperience with automated test tools/ script developmentEducation Requirements:Requires a degree in Science, Technology, Engineering or Mathematics (STEM) and minimum of 4 years prior relevant experience.This position requires either a U.S. Person or a Non-U.S. Person who is eligible to obtain any required Export Authorization.IISVA092419 150850
Business Unit Profile
                        
                        Raytheon Intelligence, Information and Services delivers innovative technology to make the world a safer place. Our expertise in cyber, analytics and automation allow us to reach beyond what others think is possible to underpin national security and give our global customers unique solutions to solve the most pressing modern challenges -- from the cyber domain to automated operations, and from intelligent transportation and training solutions to creating clear insight from large volumes of data. IIS operates at nearly 550 sites in 80 countries, and is headquartered in Dulles, Virginia. The business area generated $6.2 billion in 2018 revenues. As a global business, our leaders must have the ability to understand, embrace and operate in a multicultural world -- in the marketplace and the workplace. We strive to hire people who reflect our communities and embrace diversity and inclusion to advance our culture, develop our employees, and grow our business.

Quote



Felicia Jackson is regional vice president of RAYVETS, Raytheon's employee group for veterans and those who support them. After 24 years in the Air Force, she started a new career at Raytheon. "I wanted to go where people would support me," she told us.









Rewards




401(k) / Retirement Plans
Employer Matching, if you elect to enroll company matches up to 3%.



Work / Life Balance
Raytheon supports a variety of flexible work arrangements including compressed work weeks, flextime, job sharing, 9/80, reduced hours and telecommuting.



Career Development
At Raytheon, we foster an inclusive culture of professional development. We support a variety of developmental opportunities including: Mentoring programs, Skills Development, Leadership Development, Rotational job assignments, and Continuous Improvement, all of which contribute to advancement of our employee’s capabilities.



Paid Time Off
Accrue paid time off monthly. Receive 10-12 holidays per year with some locations shutting down the week between Christmas and New Year’s Day.



Relocation Assistance
Select technical positions are eligible for relocation packages. See specific job description for eligibility requirements.



Parental Leave
Raytheon offers all eligible employees up to three weeks paid parental leave for the birth or adoption of a child (separate from paid maternity leave or Family & Medical Leave Act).

Patient Intake Supervisor   (97086) - Richardson, TX - Inogen, Inc. Jobs








 














Home
Jobs




Patient Intake Supervisor   (97086) - Richardson, TX

Toggle navigation








Patient Intake Supervisor   (97086) 

JobsLogin 












 Patient Intake Richardson, TX, USA Full Time 



Email Me Similar Jobs Email Me This Job



ABOUT INOGEN Inogen was founded in 2001 to improve quality of life and increase freedom and independence for oxygen therapy users. Inogen is innovation in oxygen therapy. The Inogen mission is to improve freedom and independence for oxygen therapy patients through innovative products and services. Inogen is a manufacturer and Accredited Homecare Provider.
Inogen is focused on quality care, continuous improvement, and outstanding customer satisfaction. We are a stable, USA based company dedicated to providing an exciting and rewarding career to our employees. We completed a successful Initial Public Offering on the NASDAQ in 2014 and have demonstrated substantial growth over the last five years. Our work environment is casual yet high performing, and we are looking for seriously talented, motivated, and fast-paced professionals to join our team.
JOB DESCRIPTION 
The Patient Intake Supervisor ensures all rental patients are successfully onboarded by supervising the patient intake team and reviewing onboarding activities. The Patient Intake Supervisor is the key individual for driving team productivity, training, improving medical documentation reviews and coaching on obtaining documentation timely while acquiring a complete patient file.
Key Competencies:
Supervises and drive productivity at the individual and team level. 
Leads the team members in achieving monthly team metrics and KPIs. 
Resolves disputes, escalations, and complex issues in an appropriate and timely manner. 
Ensure newly enrolled rental patients have a clear understanding of Inogen's rental program. 
Conducts on-going analysis for process improvements, improved efficiency, workflows, learning aids, policies and procedures to enhance the patient intake process. 
Ensure the procurement of all necessary paperwork for successful claims filing.
Ensure Inogen's compliance with all state and federal regulations.
Ensure that appropriate medical records are maintained according to HIPAA guidelines.
Consult with physician offices to answer questions and procure, medical records, CMN's and Rx's.
Meet business unit denial rate objectives.
Assists in managing systems (Salesforce, Oracle, telephony) & necessary improvements/links to other software's.
Maintain regular and punctual attendance. 
Comply with all company policies and procedures. 
Assist with any other duties as assigned.
Do you possess these abilities?
Excellent management skills, both of individuals as well as projects.
Must have strong work ethic.
Attention to detail is required. 
Effective conflict resolution. 
Analytical & problem-solving skills & ability to multi task. 
Solutions-oriented problem solver. 
Excellent planning, communication and organizational skills. 
Ability to effectively interface with different departments within the company. 
Comprehensive understanding of Medicare program rules.
Experience in successful submission of Medicare and other insurance claims.
Experience in operating appropriate computer hardware and CRM software is required.
Experience in consulting with physicians and hospital referral sources.
 
Requirements:
Associates degree in a technical discipline, required.
5 years of experience in insurance billing/oxygen or HME billing, required.
1-2 years' in a lead or supervisory role, required. 
Intermediate knowledge/proficiency Microsoft Office, Fastrack, Oracle, required. 
A combination of training, education and experience that is equivalent to the qualifications listed above and that provides the required knowledge, skills, and abilities.
 
WHY INOGEN Inogen is a dynamic company that is not only focused on quality care of patients, but is also committed to being a top employer.  Each of Inogen' s offices have a casual culture that supports employees being responsible and developing professionals.
We offer competitive salaries and a robust benefit package:
Employee Stock Purchase Plan 401 (K) plan available for all employees Health, dental, vision insurance Flexible spending accounts and wellness discount program Life Insurance Long Term Disability Robust paid time off and 8 paid holidays Employee Assistance Program
See the Inogen Team in action:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dKoTMeJf5J4
 
Inogen Where we go to work hard to positively impact people's lives
 
Inogen is an equal opportunity employer.  We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other legally protected characteristics. The EEO is the Law poster and its supplement are available here: http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/ofccpost.htm; http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/OFCCP_EEO_Supplement_Final_JRF_QA_508c.pdf.  The pay transparency policy is available here: http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/pdf/EO13665_PrescribedNondiscriminationPostingLanguage_JRFQA508c.pdf. 
Inogen is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities.  If you need a reasonable accommodation because of a disability for any part of the employment process, please send an e-mail to recruiting@inogen.net or call (972) 616-5668 and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information.
 
 

Inogen, Inc.
https://inogen.applicantpro.com

            Account Executive



         Login to apply
    
















Account Executive
Miami, FL 


The Account Executive is responsible for selling Yardi solutions and developing strong client relationships within the assigned territory.  We are looking for candidates with a high ambition and drive, who are looking to take control of their career, and are goal oriented. An ideal candidate should be focused on achieving targeted goals, and be willing to go the extra mile.  
 
ESSENTIAL RESPONSIBILITIES

Utilize extensive knowledge of Yardi products, industry, and competition to present value propositions to clients and/or prospects to develop a sufficient pipeline and meet individual sales goals.
Research, call and qualify each account in your assigned territory.
Identify and develop strong relationships with all key decision makers and develop a deep understanding of the business needs for every client/prospect assigned to you.
Conduct at least 10 in person (or web) meetings each month with executive level personnel to deliver roadshow or product demonstrations. 
Execute full sales cycles, including lead generation; discovery and goal setting; pricing, packaging, and positioning; RFP management; negotiating; and closing.
Utilize internal CRM diligently, recording all client activities, sales opportunities, and forecasts per training guidelines.  Complete annual certifications for assigned products per training guidelines.
Participate in marketing events to promote Yardi Systems and our products/services.
Review individual account and pipeline reports weekly, performance reports monthly, and meet with management monthly to verify proper execution of sales strategy within the assigned territory.
You are responsible for learning your assigned products and being proficient at demonstrating them.  You will be required to complete demo certifications on your respective products annually.  Thereafter, you should continue to expand your product knowledge and demonstration skills by presenting your solutions to your clients and/or prospects.

 
EDUCATION/QUALIFICATIONS/EXPERIENCE

Bachelor’s Degree or commensurate experience.
One plus (1+) years of successful sales experience.

REQUIRED SKILLS/ABILITIES

Sales cycle management principles such as lead generation; discovery and qualification; pricing, packaging, and positioning; proposal development; contract negotiation; and closure
Strong presentation and demonstration skills
Demonstrated record of generating sales results
Driven, self-starter motivated to succeed
Possess a proactive, engaging personality
Ability to understand technical products
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Commitment to utilize corporate sales tools and complete ongoing training
Highly responsive with proven client-centered commitment and focus
Proven strong ability to meet critical deadlines and prioritize multiple tasks in a fast-paced environment

 
DESIRED SKILLS/ABILITIES

Yardi domain experience
Industry expertise in property management and accounting principles
Ability to think and act strategically by visualizing new possibilities, challenging assumptions, and recommending the implementation of new ideas or strategies


WORKING ENVIRONMENT/PHYSICAL DEMANDS

Ability to work at assigned locations
Up to 50% travel required
Attend meetings and perform tasks for long periods of time on a computer and on the telephone
Regular attendance and a regular work schedule is an essential function of this job

The physical demands and work environment characteristics described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job.  Moderate Noise (example: cubicle environment, business office with printers/copiers, light traffic). Ability to lift 50lbs.
The employee is expected to adhere to all company policies and to act as a role model in adhering to all company policies.  This job description is intended to describe the general nature and level of work involved for this position.  It is not an exhaustive list of the responsibilities, duties and skills that are or may be required.*cl

 Privacy Overview


 Strictly Necessary Cookies


 3rd Party Cookies




 








Privacy Overview

This website uses cookies so that we can provide you with the best user experience possible. Cookie information is stored in your browser and performs functions such as recognising you when you return to our website and helping our team to understand which sections of the website you find most interesting and useful.
You can adjust all of your cookie settings by navigating the tabs on the left hand side.



 
Strictly Necessary Cookies

Strictly necessary cookies must be enabled at all times in order to login and apply to openings.



disable









If you disable this cookie, we will not be able to save your preferences and you will not be able to login to apply for openings. This means that every time you visit this website you will need to enable or disable cookies again.







3rd Party Cookies

This website uses Google Analytics to collect anonymous information such as the number of visitors to the site, and the most popular pages.
Keeping this cookie enabled helps us to improve our website.



disable









Please enable Strictly Necessary Cookies first so that we can save your preferences!












Enable All
Save Changes

Principal Digital Signal Processing (DSP) Engineer
Aurora, Colorado


Apply





Overview
Responsibilities
Success Profile
Rewards
Trending




Overview

What does it take to make the world a safer place? It takes delivering innovative technology and collaborating with some of the finest talent in the engineering field. Whether you’re a software engineer or a field engineer, at Raytheon you’ll grow a varied and rewarding career. And you’ll be supported with a comprehensive and competitive benefits package that promotes work/life. If you’re ready to take on today’s big challenges, discover a world of opportunity at Raytheon.

America’s Best Large Employers by Forbes
Career & Development Opportunities
Full-time
Entry, Mid, Senior level




Back to Job Navigation (Overview)


Responsibilities


               
                    Raytheon Intelligence, Information and Services is looking for Senior RF Signal Processing Engineer  to join our M2C System Engineering team in Aurora, Colorado. Would you like to work in a collaborative environment at a state of the art facility in Colorado? Then join our Raytheon team of engineers solving problems that make the world a safer place and help to secure our great nation! Come support those who provide us with all the freedoms we enjoy.Our facility in Aurora, CO offers amenities that create work and life balance. On site we have a 24/7 fitness facility, health center, cafeteria, collaboration rooms and dynamic break areas for easy conversation and socialization. Additionally, employee appreciation lunches, bonus opportunities, and great benefits that include medical, dental, vision, 401K match, flexible work schedule - just to name a few.  Click here to view a brief video and learn more: https://youtu.be/YNuZN0vyzHgThe Principal Digital Signal Processing (DSP) Engineer will be a team member of a dynamic and multidiscipline development team within the Advanced Mission Solutions (AMS) program area.  Responsibilities will span the development and fielding life cycle from initial concept definition through detailed design, development, and qualification testing and into fielding and customer support.  The team member will work on a small, tightly focused team to accomplish assigned tasking/milestones and work with the staff leadership to ensure adherence to budgets, plans, and schedules.  The ideal candidate will have experience with radio frequency (RF) communications links and systems, algorithm prototyping/modeling, waveform design, and software-defined radios.Clearance Requirement:  Must be a US Citizens with a current/active TS/SCI clearanceThis position is eligible for a Sign on Bonus up to 40k for a candidate with a current TS/SCI and that can be verified and hired at Raytheon. Required Experience, Knowledge and/or Skills: • Minimum 8+ years of related work experience• Experience with waveform design and application• Experience with signal modulation application• Familiar with communication links• Working knowledge using Matlab or X-MIDAS or related languages for algorithm prototyping and simulation• Working knowledge with software development in C/C++ or related languages• Understanding of software development processes and their application to programs• Must be a US Citizen and have an active TS/SCI              Desired Experience, Knowledge and/or Skills: • Working knowledge of spread spectrum communication signals and systems• Experience designing for and implementing algorithms on software-defined radios• Experience developing with Python and Java• Experience developing on Linux operating system• Experience developing with X-Midas• Experience developing with RedhawkEducation Requirements:B.S./M.S. in Engineering or Computer Science, Physics, Math, or related STEM degree CONETWORKIISSignalIISBonus#SignalProcessing#RF#cleared#DSP 145251
Business Unit Profile
                        
                        Raytheon Intelligence, Information and Services delivers innovative technology to make the world a safer place. Our expertise in cyber, analytics and automation allow us to reach beyond what others think is possible to underpin national security and give our global customers unique solutions to solve the most pressing modern challenges -- from the cyber domain to automated operations, and from intelligent transportation solutions to creating clear insight from large volumes of data. IIS operates at nearly 550 sites in 80 countries, and is headquartered in Dulles, Virginia. The business area generated $6.1 billion in 2017 revenues. As a global business, our leaders must have the ability to understand, embrace and operate in a multicultural world -- in the marketplace and the workplace. We strive to hire people who reflect our communities and embrace diversity and inclusion to advance our culture, develop our employees, and grow our business.

Quote



I joined Raytheon in 2016 and I’m proud to work here. My company makes some pretty amazing things, including missile defense, using data to predict the weather, and securing our GPS system. My company also works with artificial intelligence, machine learning and other innovative solutions. I’m proud to work for an organization that allows me the flexibility to be a STEM volunteer and help inspire our future generation.









Rewards




401(k) / Retirement Plans
Employer Matching, if you elect to enroll company matches up to 3%.



Work / Life Balance
Raytheon supports a variety of flexible work arrangements including compressed work weeks, flextime, job sharing, 9/80, reduced hours and telecommuting.



Career Development
At Raytheon, we foster an inclusive culture of professional development. We support a variety of developmental opportunities including: Mentoring programs, Skills Development, Leadership Development, Rotational job assignments, and Continuous Improvement, all of which contribute to advancement of our employee’s capabilities.



Paid Time Off
Accrue paid time off monthly. Receive 10-12 holidays per year with some locations shutting down the week between Christmas and New Year’s Day.



Relocation Assistance
Select technical positions are eligible for relocation packages. See specific job description for eligibility requirements.



Parental Leave
Raytheon offers all eligible employees up to three weeks paid parental leave for the birth or adoption of a child (separate from paid maternity leave or Family & Medical Leave Act).



Sign-On Bonus
Qualified cleared engineers can receive an up to $40K sign-on bonus when they join our Engineering Team!



Student Loan Repayment Contribution
Through the 401(k), called the Raytheon Savings and Investment Plan, the company will make a dollar for dollar contribution for amounts employees spend repaying their student loans, up to their maximum match percentage.

Email Developer, Global CRM

Department:
              Retail, Sales and Commercial
            
Location:
              Boston, Santa Barbara, Seattle
            

Req#:
              5612
            

Sonos is looking for an experienced Email Developer who will be responsible for the execution of marketing campaigns in email and in-app channels, using Salesforce Marketing Cloud (formerly ExactTarget) and Airship. The CRM charter has high visibility and support to succeed as we design, deploy and analyze programs to grow the value of customer relationships. This is the perfect role and environment for someone ready to make an immediate and significant contribution to an innovative global company.Reporting to the Senior Manager of CRM, the Email Developer is a seasoned email producer, responsible for the successful development of dynamic email templates, and deployment of outbound campaigns and communication programs. This role is technically driven, working in close partnership with CRM Campaign Managers, to develop and implement communications across both email and in app channels. The role includes producing and scheduling emails, segmentation, journey automation, list management, QC, optimization and performance monitoring.




About You


More than a candidate that checks every box, we’re looking for people who are excited to work, learn, and grow at Sonos—no matter their background or how they identify. If that’s you, we hope you’ll apply for this role.
You want to be part of a team.
You come with new ideas and a unique point of view. You look forward to collaborating with a diverse team of individuals. You assume everyone’s best intentions, welcome a healthy debate, and embrace differing opinions. You eagerly seek and give help. Transparency tops your list of values, and you proactively contribute to a culture of respect and inclusion.
You enjoy a challenge.
Inquisitive and focused, you see every challenge as an opportunity. You’re ambitious and comfortable making mistakes because you learn from them and bounce back quickly. You would rather create the future than wait for it. You prioritize long-term value over short-term objectives.
You love to listen.
You approach every interaction with curiosity and a desire to understand. You want to make a positive impact in the world. You’re passionate about culture and know the power that music, film, podcasts, games, and stories have to bring people together.


What You’ll Do 

Perform day-to-day email production activities including, but not limited to, email campaign development, testing, tagging, scheduling, deployment and monitoring of one-time, recurring, triggered and dynamic email campaignsDevelop HTML emails using HTML, CSS, and media queriesPulling and scripting elements to be used in dynamic email sendsCreate send definitions, data extensions, send interactions and filtersManage list segmentation, list QA, list cleansingHandle change requests and provide quick and efficient solutionsAdhere to quality assurance processes and standardsOversee proofing process across global stakeholders in LitmusCoordinate with campaign managers and design resources to procure creative assets.Manage production tasks and deliverable milestones in collaborative PM tool

Skills You’ll Need

Basic QualificationsBachelor’s degree or equivalent work experience4+ years in email developmentSalesforce Marketing Cloud (ExactTarget) and AMPscript experiencePreferred QualificationsKnowledge of multiple aspects of email marketing including dynamic program implementation, template coding, analysis, legislation, authentication and sender reputation systems, deliverability, and general industry trends and metrics.Extensive knowledge of scripting and applying business logic in emailExperienced in responsive email designExpertise in email development industry best practices and benchmarksAbility to quickly identify and address process and operational gaps Email development with a global brand, and localization experience a big plusStrong QA process experience is essentialPast experience with A/B testing and email optimizationAbility to work independently and prioritize workload to deliver on expected timelines

More About Sonos


Sonos is a sound experience company. We pioneered multiroom wireless audio, made it sound amazing, and changed the way people listen, making it effortless for them to enjoy what they want, where they want, how they want.
Today we continue empowering listeners by developing new technologies, thoughtfully designing products, expanding our software platform, and crafting brilliant sound experiences while participating in a culture that values respect, transparency, collaboration, and ownership.
Together we’re working to positively impact the world and inspire everyone to listen better—because listening brings people together, builds understanding, drives change, and makes us happier.
Notice to European Job Applicants: Information you submit as a part of your job application will be used in accordance with Sonos EU Job Applicant Privacy Notice.
Notice to U.S. Job Applicants: Sonos is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other legally protected characteristics.
Follow the links to review the EEO is the Law poster and its supplement. The pay transparency policy is available here. Sonos is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities. If you need a reasonable accommodation because of a disability for any part of the employment process, please send an e-mail to accommodations@sonos.com and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information.

Tier 4 Network Operational Support  (multiple openings)
Dulles, Virginia, Chantilly, Virginia, McLean, Virginia

Trending




Overview

What does it take to make the world a safer place? It takes delivering innovative technology and collaborating with some of the finest talent in the engineering field. Whether you’re a software engineer or a mechanical engineer, at Raytheon you’ll grow a varied and rewarding career. And you’ll be supported with a comprehensive and competitive benefits package that promotes work/life. If you’re ready to take on today’s big challenges, discover a world of opportunity at Raytheon.

America’s Best Large Employers by Forbes
Career & Development Opportunities
Full-time
Entry, Mid, Senior level




Back to Job Navigation (Overview)


Responsibilities


Looking for cleared professionals to bring innovation!Raytheon has an on-going need to provide Tier 4 network operational support of an existing Information Technology Enterprise (ITE), across a broad spectrum of agency organizations.  Looking for network professionals who understand the existing ITE and can create greater efficiencies and strengths through innovative networking and emerging technology in areas such as software defined networking (SDN) and software defined WAN (SD-WAN).* Network engineers* Software engineers* AWS/C2S experts* Network architects* Infrastructure services* Data Center network services Prefer a degree from accredited institute in a related discipline such as information systems, computer science, math, or engineering. In some cases, additional related experience may be substituted in lieu of a degree.  Must currently possess TS/SCI (FSP) clearance level.CLEARED CANDIDATES CURRENTLY PERFORMING THIS WORK WILL BE GIVEN PRIORITY CONSIDERATIONFor immediate consideration, SUBMIT YOUR RESUME HERE.Work locations include the Washington, DC metropolitan area, Dulles, VA and various other CONUS/OCONUS locations.Some of the positions may be contingent on contract award. 152982
Business Unit Profile
                        
                        Intelligence, Information and Services delivers innovative technology to make the world a safer place. Our expertise in cyber, analytics and automation allow us to reach beyond what others think is possible to underpin national security and give our global customers unique solutions to solve the most pressing modern challenges -- from the cyber domain to automated operations, and from intelligent transportation and training solutions to creating clear insight from large volumes of data. IIS operates at nearly 550 sites in 80 countries, and is headquartered in Dulles, Virginia. The business area generated $6.2 billion in 2018 revenues. As a global business, our leaders must have the ability to understand, embrace and operate in a multicultural world -- in the marketplace and the workplace. We strive to hire people who reflect our communities and embrace diversity and inclusion to advance our culture, develop our employees, and grow our business.

Patient Technical Services Advocate  (84692) - Goleta, CA - Inogen, Inc. Jobs








 














Home
Jobs




Patient Technical Services Advocate  (84692) - Goleta, CA

Toggle navigation








Patient Technical Services Advocate  (84692) 

JobsLogin 












 Customer Care Center Goleta, CA, USA Full Time 



Email Me Similar Jobs Email Me This Job



ABOUT INOGEN Inogen was founded in 2001 to improve quality of life and increase freedom and independence for oxygen therapy users. Inogen is innovation in oxygen therapy. The Inogen mission is to improve freedom and independence for oxygen therapy patients through innovative products and services. Inogen is a manufacturer and Accredited Homecare Provider.
Inogen is focused on quality care, continuous improvement, and outstanding customer satisfaction. We are a stable, USAbased company dedicated to providing an exciting and rewarding career to our employees. We completed a successful Initial Public Offering on the NASDAQ in 2014 and have demonstrated substantial growth over the last five years. Our work environment is casual yet highperforming, and we are looking for seriously talented, motivated, and fast-paced professionals to join our team.
JOB DESCRIPTION The Patient Technical Services Advocate provides support and service to our respiratory patients that have purchased products directly from Inogen or have enrolled in Inogen's home respiratory therapy services.  This position provides the highest level of customer service to internal/external customers and serves as the front line contact for incoming inquiries, customer questions and sales requests.
Key Competencies:
Troubleshoots and provides Account Overview with Patients
Acts as an information source for customers and intercompany in the area of product and service
Provide sales support for field sales representatives and DTP sales representatives
Maintains product knowledge to keep abreast of updates and changes by continued product training
Do you possess these abilities?
Excellent verbal and written communication skills required
Strong organization skills and attention to detail are required
Ability to take initiative and follow through on multiple open tasks
Must have proven track record of successful team participation, as well as ability to work independently and self-start
Requirements:
Associate's or Bachelor's degree preferred, or the equivalent combination of education, training, and experience that provides the required knowledge, skills, and abilities
3+ years related customer service preferred
 
WHY INOGEN Inogen is a dynamic company that is not only focused on quality care of patients, but is also committed to being a top employer. Each of Inogen's offices has a casual culture that supports employees being responsible and developing professionals.
Inogen – Where we go to work hard to positively impact people's lives
See the Inogen team in action:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dKoTMeJf5J4#t=23
 
Inogen is an equal opportunity employer.  We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other legally protected characteristics. The EEO is the Law poster and its supplement are available here: http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/ofccpost.htm; http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/OFCCP_EEO_Supplement_Final_JRF_QA_508c.pdf.  The pay transparency policy is available here: http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/pdf/EO13665_PrescribedNondiscriminationPostingLanguage_JRFQA508c.pdf. 
Inogen is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities.  If you need a reasonable accommodation because of a disability for any part of the employment process, please send an e-mail to recruiting@inogen.net or call (972) 616-5668 and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information.
 

Inogen, Inc.
https://inogen.applicantpro.com

If you’re ready to take on a fresh challenge, grow your career and contribute to making the world a safer place, Raytheon is ready to help you achieve your goals. Join our team and get the opportunity and support to find purpose, thrive and succeed.





Notice: Please be aware of suspicious recruiting emails and text messages that attempt to collect your confidential information. Raytheon conducts all electronic correspondence using e-mail addresses that end in “Raytheon.com”, “Raytheon.co.uk”, “Raytheon.com.au” or “brassring.com”. To report fraud please go to: https://www.ic3.gov.











Sr. Cyber Engineer II
Dulles, Virginia


Apply





Overview
Responsibilities
Success Profile
Rewards
Trending




Overview

What does it take to make the world a safer place? It takes delivering innovative technology and collaborating with some of the finest talent in the engineering field. Whether you’re a software engineer or a mechanical engineer, at Raytheon you’ll grow a varied and rewarding career. And you’ll be supported with a comprehensive and competitive benefits package that promotes work/life. If you’re ready to take on today’s big challenges, discover a world of opportunity at Raytheon.

America’s Best Large Employers by Forbes
Career & Development Opportunities
Full-time
Entry, Mid, Senior level




Back to Job Navigation (Overview)


Responsibilities


Would you like to work in a collaborative environment at a state of the art facility in Dulles? Then join our Intelligence, Information and Services (IIS) team of smart people solving problems that make the world a safer place and help to secure our great nation! Come support those who provide us with all the freedoms we enjoy. Our facility in Dulles VA offers amenities that create work and life balance. The Dulles site includes 4 modern facilities with 3 industrial buildings.  On site we have a fitness center plus a fun space with a pool table, foosball and video games. Additionally, employee appreciation lunches, bonus opportunities, and great benefits that include medical, dental, vision, 401K match, flexible work schedules, are just a few of the reasons people come to work at Intelligence, Information and Services (IIS)!If you have the technical knowledge in software engineering and system development (DevOps, Cloud, or Cybersecurity) and the desire to learn and grow in a company with over 60,000 global employees, then Intelligence, Information and Services (IIS) is worth the time to explore.  Intelligence, Information and Services (IIS) is currently seeking a Cyber Engineer that is a key contributor in the implementation of cyber engineering.  This engineer will be involved throughout the full lifecycle of the development program including CONOPs development, requirements development, architecture, design, integration, test, and certification of products.  Travel will be required to support certification at remote sites as well as various activities during the development phase.  This engineer will support the ongoing business process activities such as metrics collection and analysis, program tailoring, and process documentation updates and deployment.This position is eligible for a Sign on Bonus up to $40K for a candidate with a current TS/SCI that can be verified and hired at Intelligence, Information and Services (IIS).Required Skills: ExperienceActive TS/SCI clearance with CI Poly A minimum of  6 years of experience developing cyber security solutions, Security Authorization requirements, and security policy and emerging cyber security technologies for Department of Defense (DoD) or similar federal agency.Current IAM1 or greater cybersecurity certification per DoD 8570.01-ManualExperience implementing compliance with security requirements (i.e. Risk Management Framework, STIGs) Familiarity with systems engineering process, sprint SW process, and products developed for network systems Assessment of existing products to determine vulnerabilities and develop strategies for improving Strong computer, Windows Operating Systems, Linux, and TCP/IP network troubleshooting abilitiesProgram ExecutionExperience with systems engineering at all development levels of a complex system Capable of developing technical solutions following the assessment of complex customer needsMust have the ability to manage time and resources in order to meet assigned deadlines.CommunicationExperience in conducting technical reviews with customers (both internal and external)Excellent written and oral communication skills, including presentation skills and negotiation skills Desired Skills: Project skills including cost, schedule, supplier management, risk, and opportunity assessmentExperience with the usage of Public Key Infrastructure (PKI) in system developmentExperience and knowledge in develop systems and configuring security postures Experience performing Static and Dynamic Code Analysis DevOps/DevSecOpsAutomation (Puppet, Ansible, Chef) Education Requirements:  Bachelor’s degree in Mathematics, Engineering, Computer Science, Computer Networks and Security or another appropriate field and a minimum of 6 years of prior relevant experience.This position requires a U.S. Person who is eligible to obtain any required Export Authorization  153213
Business Unit Profile
                        
                        Intelligence, Information and Services delivers innovative technology to make the world a safer place. Our expertise in cyber, analytics and automation allow us to reach beyond what others think is possible to underpin national security and give our global customers unique solutions to solve the most pressing modern challenges -- from the cyber domain to automated operations, and from intelligent transportation and training solutions to creating clear insight from large volumes of data. IIS operates at nearly 550 sites in 80 countries, and is headquartered in Dulles, Virginia. The business area generated $6.2 billion in 2018 revenues. As a global business, our leaders must have the ability to understand, embrace and operate in a multicultural world -- in the marketplace and the workplace. We strive to hire people who reflect our communities and embrace diversity and inclusion to advance our culture, develop our employees, and grow our business.
Relocation Eligible 
                        
                        Yes
Clearance Type 
                        
                        TS/SCI with CI Poly - Current
Expertise 
                        

                                
                            Cloud ComputingComputer EngineeringComputer ScienceCyber JobsData NetworkingData ScienceEngineering TechnologyGeneral EngineeringIntegration & Test EngineeringTechnicalTest Engineering

Raytheon is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, age, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected Veteran status.

Back to Job Navigation (Success)


Quote



Felicia Jackson is regional vice president of RAYVETS, Raytheon's employee group for veterans and those who support them. After 24 years in the Air Force, she started a new career at Raytheon. "I wanted to go where people would support me," she told us.









Rewards




401(k) / Retirement Plans
Employer Matching, if you elect to enroll company matches up to 3%.



Work / Life Balance
Raytheon supports a variety of flexible work arrangements including compressed work weeks, flextime, job sharing, 9/80, reduced hours and telecommuting.



Career Development
At Raytheon, we foster an inclusive culture of professional development. We support a variety of developmental opportunities including: Mentoring programs, Skills Development, Leadership Development, Rotational job assignments, and Continuous Improvement, all of which contribute to advancement of our employee’s capabilities.



Paid Time Off
Accrue paid time off monthly. Receive 10-12 holidays per year with some locations shutting down the week between Christmas and New Year’s Day.



Relocation Assistance
Select technical positions are eligible for relocation packages. See specific job description for eligibility requirements.



Parental Leave
Raytheon offers all eligible employees up to three weeks paid parental leave for the birth or adoption of a child (separate from paid maternity leave or Family & Medical Leave Act).

Media Manager  (85183) - Goleta, CA - Inogen, Inc. Jobs
