Jobs




Media Manager  (85183) - Goleta, CA

Toggle navigation








Media Manager  (85183) 

JobsLogin 












 Marketing Goleta, CA, USA Full Time 



Email Me Similar Jobs Email Me This Job



ABOUT INOGEN Inogen was founded in 2001 to improve quality of life and increase freedom and independence for oxygen therapy users. Inogen is innovation in oxygen therapy. The Inogen mission is to improve freedom and independence for oxygen therapy patients through innovative products and services. Inogen is a manufacturer and Accredited Homecare Provider.
Inogen is a growing public company that is focused on quality care and continuous improvement. This is the drive behind our hiring and retaining passionate and dedicated professionals.
JOB DESCRIPTION The Media Manager will ensure the reliable supply of cost effective leads from a variety of sources in a manner that supports Inogen's branding and marketing objectives. The Media Manager will lead all facets of the marketing process from media source, to call center, to lead nurturing, until leads are transitioned to the sales team. 
 Key Competencies:
Manage a diverse media portfolio consisting of multiple media outlets from television, print, direct mail, email, online, social, event, etc. while constantly evaluating new opportunities
Manage and monitor the activities and day to day operations of marketing and media vendors and suppliers to ensure that they deliver consistent assignments adhering to Inogen's marketing guidelines
Manage Inogen's external call center to ensure calls are converted to leads at or above expectations per plan, Inogen is represented in a manner consistent with it's branding and marketing standards, and cost is minimized
Manage Inogen's lead nurturing efforts utilizing marketing automation technology, info kits, email, direct mail, and other efforts to maximize close ratios while minimizing cost.
Do you possess these abilities?
Prior experience managing a media portfolio, either from an agency or client
Strong organizational skills, entrepreneurial attitude, proactive business style, excellent communication skills, and effective marketing-related writing skills with the ability to craft necessary documentation with minimal supervision
Strong analytic skills and the ability to perform quantitative analysis from scratch to manage media results, department expense variances, and complex improvement projects.
Must have proven track record of successful team participation as well as ability to work indepently
Requirements:
BA required; Business, Marketing, or related area desirable
All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, pregnancy, marital status, national origin, citizenship status, disability, military status, genetic predisposition or carrier status or any other legally protected characteristic.
WHY INOGEN Inogen is a dynamic company that is not only focused on quality care of patients, but is also committed to being a top employer. Each of Inogen's offices has a casual culture that supports employees being responsible and developing professionals.
Inogen – Where we go to work hard to positively impact people's lives
See the Inogen team in action:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dKoTMeJf5J4#t=23
 
 
Inogen is an equal opportunity employer.  We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other legally protected characteristics. The EEO is the Law poster and its supplement are available here: http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/ofccpost.htm; http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/OFCCP_EEO_Supplement_Final_JRF_QA_508c.pdf.  The pay transparency policy is available here: http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/pdf/EO13665_PrescribedNondiscriminationPostingLanguage_JRFQA508c.pdf.
Inogen is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities.  If you need a reasonable accommodation because of a disability for any part of the employment process, please send an e-mail to recruiting@inogen.net or call (972) 616-5668 and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information.

Inogen, Inc.
https://inogen.applicantpro.com

If you’re ready to take on a fresh challenge, grow your career and contribute to making the world a safer place, Raytheon is ready to help you achieve your goals. Join our team and get the opportunity and support to find purpose, thrive and succeed.

Test Engineer
Colorado Springs, Colorado


Apply





Overview
Responsibilities
Success Profile
Rewards
Trending




Overview

What does it take to make the world a safer place? It takes delivering innovative technology and collaborating with some of the finest talent in the engineering field. Whether you’re a software engineer or a mechanical engineer, at Raytheon you’ll grow a varied and rewarding career. And you’ll be supported with a comprehensive and competitive benefits package that promotes work/life. If you’re ready to take on today’s big challenges, discover a world of opportunity at Raytheon.

America’s Best Large Employers by Forbes
Career & Development Opportunities
Full-time
Entry, Mid, Senior level




Back to Job Navigation (Overview)


Responsibilities


Would you like to work in a collaborative environment at an amazing company located in Colorado Springs, CO? Then join our Raytheon team of smart people solving problems that make the world a safer place and help to secure our great nation!  Come support those who provide us with all the freedoms we enjoy. Our company offers amenities that create work and life balance.   Enjoy employee appreciation lunches, bonus opportunities, and great benefits that include medical, dental, vision, 401K match, and flexible work schedules.  These are just a few of the reasons people come to work at Raytheon!Raytheon Intelligence, Information and Services (IIS) is currently seeking an experienced engineering professional for the role of Test Engineer in support of the North American Aerospace Defense Command (NORAD) Integrated Space Support Contract (NISSC) program. NISSC provides accurate, timely and unambiguous warning and attack assessment of Air, Missile and Space threats with daily visibility of National Command Authority leaders.  This position involves working in a team environment supporting all phases of Test Engineering development including concept development, test requirements, test set up implementation, test execution, and test reports.  The Test Engineer leverages multiple skill sets in areas such as Missile Defense, Radar and RF applications, embedded computing and networking.Clearance Requirements:  U.S. Citizen with a current Secret Level Security Clearance.Responsibilities and scope include:Perform test engineering activities which may include test planning and concept development, test requirements, test environment design, test procedure development, integration and test execution, and test reports Provide leadership and guidance to systems engineering teams in the performance of systems engineering activitiesMay work directly with customers Show compliance and gaps for system and subsystem requirementsProvide support to a cross-functional team throughout the lifecycle of a development programParticipate in both internal and customer design reviews representing test status and resultsCommunicate effectively with the cross-functional engineering team Perform responsibilities independently with limited directionRequired Skills:Direct experience authoring test plans, test cases, test requirements, test environment design, test procedure and test reportsExperience using Rational Quality Manager, DOORS Next Generation, Rational Team Concert JIRA, Bit Bucket or other test and requirements management toolsExperience applying technical standards, principles, theories, concepts and techniques to solve problemsExperience executing test plans, test cases, test proceduresDesired Skills:Familiarity with the existing Integrated Tactical Warning/Attack Assessment (ITW/AA) aerospace defense Systems, and their policies and proceduresExperience in development, integration, and test of large scale complex Mainframe systemsExperience with the current NCMC-ITW/AA Legacy Space maintained systems that includes CMP, DECON, SDS, and SPADOCExperience supporting programs who manage via program metrics: development, financial, performanceExperience ensuring program progress via formal risk & opportunity managementPrior customer facing experience with presentations for both internal and external stakeholdersExperience operating within an organization governed by company policies & proceduresExperience on teams who design, develop, integrate, and field systemsFamiliarity with Raytheon company policies & proceduresEducation Requirements: Bachelors Degree in Engineering, Technology, Science, Mathematics, or related STEM Degree with 2+ year relevant experienceMasters Degree in Engineering, Technology, Science, Mathematics, or related STEM Degree 152688
Business Unit Profile
                        
                        Intelligence, Information and Services delivers innovative technology to make the world a safer place. Our expertise in cyber, analytics and automation allow us to reach beyond what others think is possible to underpin national security and give our global customers unique solutions to solve the most pressing modern challenges -- from the cyber domain to automated operations, and from intelligent transportation and training solutions to creating clear insight from large volumes of data. IIS operates at nearly 550 sites in 80 countries, and is headquartered in Dulles, Virginia. The business area generated $6.2 billion in 2018 revenues. As a global business, our leaders must have the ability to understand, embrace and operate in a multicultural world -- in the marketplace and the workplace. We strive to hire people who reflect our communities and embrace diversity and inclusion to advance our culture, develop our employees, and grow our business.
Relocation Eligible 
                        
                        No
Clearance Type 
                        
                        Secret - Current
Expertise 
                        

                                
                            Aerospace/Aeronautical EngineeringCloud ComputingComputer EngineeringComputer ScienceData NetworkingData ScienceEngineering TechnologyGeneral EngineeringInformation and Knowledge SystemsSystems EngineeringTechnicalTest Engineering
                        
                        

Type Of Job 
                        
                        Full Time

Work Location 
                        
 
                            
                            CO - Colorado Springs

Felicia Jackson is regional vice president of RAYVETS, Raytheon's employee group for veterans and those who support them. After 24 years in the Air Force, she started a new career at Raytheon. "I wanted to go where people would support me," she told us.









Rewards




401(k) / Retirement Plans
Employer Matching, if you elect to enroll company matches up to 3%.



Work / Life Balance
Raytheon supports a variety of flexible work arrangements including compressed work weeks, flextime, job sharing, 9/80, reduced hours and telecommuting.



Career Development
At Raytheon, we foster an inclusive culture of professional development. We support a variety of developmental opportunities including: Mentoring programs, Skills Development, Leadership Development, Rotational job assignments, and Continuous Improvement, all of which contribute to advancement of our employee’s capabilities.



Paid Time Off
Accrue paid time off monthly. Receive 10-12 holidays per year with some locations shutting down the week between Christmas and New Year’s Day.



Relocation Assistance
Select technical positions are eligible for relocation packages. See specific job description for eligibility requirements.



Parental Leave
Raytheon offers all eligible employees up to three weeks paid parental leave for the birth or adoption of a child (separate from paid maternity leave or Family & Medical Leave Act).

Customer Service Representative- 2nd Shift  (90733) - Richardson, TX - Inogen, Inc. Jobs

Jobs




Customer Service Representative- 2nd Shift  (90733) - Richardson, TX

Toggle navigation








Customer Service Representative- 2nd Shift  (90733) 

JobsLogin 












 Customer Care Center Richardson, TX, USA Full Time 



Email Me Similar Jobs Email Me This Job



ABOUT INOGEN Inogen was founded in 2001 to improve quality of life and increase freedom and independence for oxygen therapy users. Inogen is innovation in oxygen therapy. The Inogen mission is to improve freedom and independence for oxygen therapy patients through innovative products and services. Inogen is a manufacturer and Accredited Homecare Provider.
Inogen is focused on quality care, continuous improvement, and outstanding customer satisfaction. We are a stable, USAbased company dedicated to providing an exciting and rewarding career to our employees. We completed a successful Initial Public Offering on the NASDAQ in 2014 and have demonstrated substantial growth over the last five years. Our work environment is casual yet highperforming, and we are looking for seriously talented, motivated, and fast-paced professionals to join our team.
JOB DESCRIPTION The Patient Technical Services Advocate provides support and service to our respiratory patients that have purchased products directly from Inogen or have enrolled in Inogen's home respiratory therapy services.  This position provides the highest level of customer service to internal/external customers and serves as the front line contact for incoming inquiries, customer questions and sales requests.
Key Competencies:
Troubleshoots and provides Account Overview with Patients
Acts as an information source for customers and intercompany in the area of product and service
Provide sales support for field sales representatives and DTP sales representatives
Maintains product knowledge to keep abreast of updates and changes by continued product training
Do you possess these abilities?
Excellent verbal and written communication skills required
Strong organization skills and attention to detail are required
Ability to take initiative and follow through on multiple open tasks
Must have proven track record of successful team participation, as well as ability to work independently and self-start
Requirements:
Associate's or Bachelor's degree preferred, or the equivalent combination of education, training, and experience that provides the required knowledge, skills, and abilities
3+ years related customer service preferred
 
WHY INOGEN Inogen is a dynamic company that is not only focused on quality care of patients, but is also committed to being a top employer. Each of Inogen's offices has a casual culture that supports employees being responsible and developing professionals.
Inogen – Where we go to work hard to positively impact people's lives
See the Inogen team in action:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dKoTMeJf5J4#t=23
 
Inogen is an equal opportunity employer.  We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other legally protected characteristics. The EEO is the Law poster and its supplement are available here: http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/ofccpost.htm; http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/OFCCP_EEO_Supplement_Final_JRF_QA_508c.pdf.  The pay transparency policy is available here: http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/pdf/EO13665_PrescribedNondiscriminationPostingLanguage_JRFQA508c.pdf. 
Inogen is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities.  If you need a reasonable accommodation because of a disability for any part of the employment process, please send an e-mail to recruiting@inogen.net or call (972) 616-5668 and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information.
 

Inogen, Inc.

Share it:








































Creative Producer

Department:
              Marketing
            
Location:
              Santa Barbara
            

Req#:
              5673
            

You're a natural collaborator, a fan of brand development, and a believer in healthy process. You admire quality creative and efficiency equally, and you’re a pro when it comes to advocating for good ideas while keeping projects running like clockwork. No project is too big or too small, you feel right at home in fluid dynamic environment. You’re a rare blend who artfully balances the creative and the business. You’re the Creative Producer we’re looking for, and we want you on our team.  As a Creative Producer at Sonos, you'll be working within our brand team alongside design, digital, marketing, communications, and media teams to expertly shepherd a steady flow of projects from conception to delivery. You'll also work cross-functionally with leadership and our regional teams to help evolve and implement new and stronger processes, keeping projects productive and healthy over time.




About You


More than a candidate that checks every box, we’re looking for people who are excited to work, learn, and grow at Sonos—no matter their background or how they identify. If that’s you, we hope you’ll apply for this role.
You want to be part of a team.
You come with new ideas and a unique point of view. You look forward to collaborating with a diverse team of individuals. You assume everyone’s best intentions, welcome a healthy debate, and embrace differing opinions. You eagerly seek and give help. Transparency tops your list of values, and you proactively contribute to a culture of respect and inclusion.
You enjoy a challenge.
Inquisitive and focused, you see every challenge as an opportunity. You’re ambitious and comfortable making mistakes because you learn from them and bounce back quickly. You would rather create the future than wait for it. You prioritize long-term value over short-term objectives.
You love to listen.
You approach every interaction with curiosity and a desire to understand. You want to make a positive impact in the world. You’re passionate about culture and know the power that music, film, podcasts, games, and stories have to bring people together.


What You’ll Do 

Create & maintain global marketing calendars + key creative delivery datesCommunicate any important shifts in schedules or delivery datesPartner with our creative operations lead to optimize our global production systems and asset management tools, and creative development processProcess and organize creative brief submissionsWork across internal teams and agencies to align on briefs, define project goals, and audit directives and toolkitsEstablishing agendas and running effective, informative creative operations project meetings.Developing timelines, managing deliverables, and ensuring milestones are met.Planning and securing appropriate resources throughout the project life-cycle.Raising changes to scope, budget, and timing and communicating the impact of those changes.Maintaining healthy client relationships and managing day-to-day client communications.Helping various teams scope new work

Skills You’ll Need

Basic Qualifications3-5 years years as a creative project manager, product manager, or producer, ideally within a branded consumer products environmentOur ideal candidate will have digital and multimedia experience, a background in production, a track record of creating best practices for creative and production teams and the ability to prioritize and problem solve on a daily basis.Strong organizational and time management skills with the ability to independently set priorities, multi-task, and meet deadlines.Preferred QualificationsAn unshakeable desire to keep things organized against all odds.Interest in various forms of media with a love of good creative.An easy, thoughtful manner.An eagerness to take on new challenges, grow, and learn.Ability to clearly articulate your ideas, both verbally and in written form.Team player with refined and assertive leadership skills.Able to positively influence change though inspirational design, solid rationale, data, and diplomacy.Absorb input from multiple stakeholders and autonomously adapt your plans.Ability to anticipate bottlenecks, escalate appropriately, successfully balance business needs with creative constraints

More About Sonos


Sonos is a sound experience company. We pioneered multiroom wireless audio, made it sound amazing, and changed the way people listen, making it effortless for them to enjoy what they want, where they want, how they want.
Today we continue empowering listeners by developing new technologies, thoughtfully designing products, expanding our software platform, and crafting brilliant sound experiences while participating in a culture that values respect, transparency, collaboration, and ownership.
Together we’re working to positively impact the world and inspire everyone to listen better—because listening brings people together, builds understanding, drives change, and makes us happier.
Notice to European Job Applicants: Information you submit as a part of your job application will be used in accordance with Sonos EU Job Applicant Privacy Notice.
Notice to U.S. Job Applicants: Sonos is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other legally protected characteristics.
Follow the links to review the EEO is the Law poster and its supplement. The pay transparency policy is available here. Sonos is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities. If you need a reasonable accommodation because of a disability for any part of the employment process, please send an e-mail to accommodations@sonos.com and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information.

            Help Desk Specialist



         Login to apply
    
















Help Desk Specialist
Long Island, NY 


As an IT Helpdesk Specialist you will be responsible for:

Responding to requests for technical assistance in person, via phone, or electronically
Installing software and updating hardware
Diagnosing and resolving technical hardware and software issues
Researching questions using available information resources
Advising users on appropriate actions
Following standard helpdesk procedures
Logging all helpdesk interactions
Administering helpdesk software
Re-directing problems to the appropriate resource

 
The ideal candidate will possess the following skills and abilities:

3-5 years  of experience
Proficiency in Windows 7, Windows 8 and Microsoft Office
Basic Network Troubleshooting skills
PC Imaging
Familiar with mobile device (phone/tablet) setup and use
Excellent customer service skills
Ability to work outside normal business hours if required to include evenings and weekends

By continuing to browse this site you agree to our use of cookies. You can find out more about which cookies we are using or switch them off in settings.
 

 
Accept

 


















 

 Privacy Overview


 Strictly Necessary Cookies


 3rd Party Cookies




 








Privacy Overview

This website uses cookies so that we can provide you with the best user experience possible. Cookie information is stored in your browser and performs functions such as recognising you when you return to our website and helping our team to understand which sections of the website you find most interesting and useful.
You can adjust all of your cookie settings by navigating the tabs on the left hand side.



 
Strictly Necessary Cookies

Strictly necessary cookies must be enabled at all times in order to login and apply to openings.



disable









If you disable this cookie, we will not be able to save your preferences and you will not be able to login to apply for openings. This means that every time you visit this website you will need to enable or disable cookies again.







3rd Party Cookies

This website uses Google Analytics to collect anonymous information such as the number of visitors to the site, and the most popular pages.
Keeping this cookie enabled helps us to improve our website.



disable









Please enable Strictly Necessary Cookies first so that we can save your preferences!












Enable All
Save Changes

DevOps Linux System Administrator

Overview

Raytheon delivers innovative technology to make the world a safer place. Our expertise in cyber, analytics and automation allow us to reach beyond what others think is possible to underpin national security and give our global customers unique solutions to solve the most pressing modern challenges -- from the cyber domain to automated operations, and from intelligent transportation solutions to creating clear insight from large volumes of data. Our leaders must have the ability to understand, embrace and operate in a multicultural world -- in the marketplace and the workplace. We strive to hire people who reflect our communities and embrace diversity and inclusion to advance our culture, develop our employees, and grow our business.

Full-time
Entry to Senior level

Glassdoor 2017 Best Places to Interview: Candidate's Choice

Rewards




401(k) / Retirement Plans
Employer Matching, if you elect to enroll company matches up to 3%.



Work / Life Balance
Raytheon appreciates work/life balance. Employees can work 9 hours a day every week and received every other Friday off, as long as departmental/manager approval is obtained. Accrued paid time off monthly and paid holiday time.



Career Development
At Raytheon, we foster an inclusive culture of professional development. We support a variety of developmental opportunities including: Mentoring programs, Skills Development, Leadership Development, Rotational job assignments, and Continuous Improvement, all of which contribute to advancement of our employee’s capabilities.



Paid Time Off
Accrue paid time off monthly. Receive 12 holidays per year including the week between Christmas and New Year’s Day.



Relocation Assistance
Select technical positions are eligible for relocation packages. See specific job description for eligibility requirements.



Parental Leave
Raytheon offers all eligible employees up to three weeks paid parental leave for the birth or adoption of a child (separate from paid maternity leave or Family & Medical Leave Act).



Back to Job Navigation (Rewards)



Responsibilities


DevOps Linux System AdministratorRaytheon is seeking a talented and passionate Linux System Administrator to join our DevOps Transformation team in a classified environment. As a System administrator, you will be responsible for supporting our team and programs in their journey to adopt DevOps and Agile methodologies as a new way of working. Using these methodologies you will be constantly optimizing systems and services for security, automation, and performance/availability, while ensuring solutions developed adhere and align to architecture standards. As the Systems Administrator, you will work closely in a DevOps environment with the program personnel to ensure smooth execution of development and continuous integration.This position requires US Citizenship with a current TS/SCI with CI Poly Government Security Clearance. Required Skills: Must be a US Citizen with a current TS-SCI clearance with CI poly. 6 years of experience directly related to Linux System Administration, including installation and maintenance of software and hardware.Experience administering Red Hat Linux based systems with minimal support, to include kickstart, patching (satellite servers), creating RPM packages, performance tuning, networking, user management, and security.Extensive experience with scripting, particularly in Bash and PythonExperienced using automation tools/frameworks such as Terraform, Ansible, and Chef.In-depth experience with the deployment and administration of systems in Amazon Web Services (AWS)/Commercial Cloud Services (C2S)Experience with recent versions of VMware (ESXi and vCenter)Hands-on experience working with developer tools including Git, Arifactory, Bitbucket, CI/CD tools, and JiraExperience with containerizationExperience using Agile/Scrum development methodology (SAFe, Scrum, Khanban)Must be able to lift up to 35 pounds in support of hardware installations.Must be able to travel up to 10% for installation supportMust be able to support occasional after hour maintenanceRequired to provide pager (on-call) supportMust have an active CompTIA Security+ or Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP) Certification.Desired Skills: NAS and SAN administration experienceExperience administering Windows based systemsProficiency with Enterprise level administration of common services such as DNS, sendmail, and LDAPStrong analytic and research skills - must be detail orientedLinux and Windows integration tools (Centrify, Samba, etc.)Web development (JavaScript, PHP, etc.)Installation and management of fiber channel switchesDemonstrated ability to work independently and troubleshoot problems with efficiencyRequires the ability to effectively interact with external personnel on significant technical matters often requiring coordination between organizations and vendorsCommunication and diplomatic skillsRequired Education:BS Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a similar technical related field, OR 8 years of experience in lieu of degree. 149225
                

                    
                 
                           Raytheon is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, age, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected Veteran status.

If you’re ready to take on a fresh challenge, grow your career and contribute to making the world a safer place, Raytheon is ready to help you achieve your goals. Join our team and get the opportunity and support to find purpose, thrive and succeed.





Notice: Please be aware of suspicious recruiting emails and text messages that attempt to collect your confidential information. Raytheon conducts all electronic correspondence using e-mail addresses that end in “Raytheon.com”, “Raytheon.co.uk”, “Raytheon.com.au” or “brassring.com”. To report fraud please go to: https://www.ic3.gov.











Systems Engineer I
Marlborough, Massachusetts


Apply





Overview
Responsibilities
Success Profile
Rewards
Trending




Overview

What does it take to make the world a safer place? It takes delivering innovative technology and collaborating with some of the finest talent in the engineering field. Whether you’re a software engineer or a mechanical engineer, at Raytheon you’ll grow a varied and rewarding career. And you’ll be supported with a comprehensive and competitive benefits package that promotes work/life. If you’re ready to take on today’s big challenges, discover a world of opportunity at Raytheon.

America’s Best Large Employers by Forbes
Career & Development Opportunities
Full-time
Entry, Mid, Senior level




Back to Job Navigation (Overview)


Responsibilities


Raytheon is a technology and innovation leader specializing in defense, security and civil markets throughout the world.  Our latest company video is about our people, our technology, our vision, and the values we hold dear at Raytheon.  Click here to view: https://youtu.be/qvbCgKpkEdsThis is a position for a System Engineer to join our team developing next generation air traffic systems.  Raytheon’s Air Traffic Systems (ATS) sub-mission area is a world leader in air traffic automation, surveillance and navigation, responsible for providing air traffic tools to air navigation service providers (ANSPs) around the world. This position is for the AutoTrac III (AT3) program.From proactive cyber threat hunting to GPS-guided precision landing to enhanced mid- and long-range weather planning, Raytheon continues to pave the way for the data-driven, dynamic future of air travel. Our unique portfolio of automation, surveillance, navigation and landing solutions —backed by extensive cyber, analytics and software expertise— is improving safety and efficiency across more than two-thirds of the world's air space.Primary responsibilities include requirements development, system integration, formal test planning, procedure development, customer witnessed testing and reporting. Secondary responsibilities include supporting software development with an emphasis on system level integration and test. Regular duties include participating in requirements and design discussions and reviews, producing test artifacts, regression testing, black box testing, scenario development and characterizing system performance. Flexibility and the ability to adapt to change will be a key skill in the fast paced, dynamic and evolving air-traffic control program environment.System Engineer will be responsible for:Systems engineering lifecycle and system level designDeveloping system and subsystem level requirements and designs for hardware and software implementationsPerforming system and/or subsystem level integration and testEffective communication skills, both oral and writtenSome understanding of UNIX or Linux operating systems, such as Oracle Solaris or Red Hat Enterprise LinuxThorough knowledge of Microsoft Office products (Word, Excel, Outlook, and PowerPoint)Occasional domestic travel in support of the programSolving complex problems in Weather or Air Traffic Control/Management SystemsUnderstanding of the operation of Weather or Air Traffic Management SystemsSystem integration, formal testing, and characterization of system performanceExperience managing data and performing analysis using Microsoft Excel, Matlab, or similarWorking in Agile lifecycle process including Scrum, Kanban, DevOps, Continuous Integration, and Test Driven Development MethodologiesWorking with Atlassian tool suite such as JIRA, Confluence, Bamboo, and BitbucketWorking with IBM DOORS or similar requirements management tooRequired Skills: Minimum BS in Science, Technology, Engineering, or Mathematics (STEM), or MS in STEM.Ability to obtain and maintain a security clearanceU.S. Citizenship is requiredDesired Skills: Experience solving complex problems in Weather or Air Traffic Control/Management SystemsExperience in the systems engineering, development and operation of Weather or Air Traffic Management SystemsExperience with system integration, formal testing, and characterization of system performanceWorking knowledge of DOORS and ClearCaseJava, XMLExperience in the systems engineering, development and test of Air Traffic Management SystemsFamiliarity with Agile lifecycle process including Scrum, Continuous Integration, and Test Driven Development MethodologiesEducation Requirements:Requires a degree in Science, Technology, Engineering or Mathematics (STEM)This position requires either a U.S. Person or a Non-U.S. Person who is eligible to obtain any required Export Authorization. 151094
Business Unit Profile
                        
                        Raytheon Intelligence, Information and Services delivers innovative technology to make the world a safer place. Our expertise in cyber, analytics and automation allow us to reach beyond what others think is possible to underpin national security and give our global customers unique solutions to solve the most pressing modern challenges -- from the cyber domain to automated operations, and from intelligent transportation and training solutions to creating clear insight from large volumes of data. IIS operates at nearly 550 sites in 80 countries, and is headquartered in Dulles, Virginia. The business area generated $6.2 billion in 2018 revenues. As a global business, our leaders must have the ability to understand, embrace and operate in a multicultural world -- in the marketplace and the workplace. We strive to hire people who reflect our communities and embrace diversity and inclusion to advance our culture, develop our employees, and grow our business.
Relocation Eligible 
                        
                        Yes
Clearance Type

Quote



Felicia Jackson is regional vice president of RAYVETS, Raytheon's employee group for veterans and those who support them. After 24 years in the Air Force, she started a new career at Raytheon. "I wanted to go where people would support me," she told us.









Rewards




401(k) / Retirement Plans
Employer Matching, if you elect to enroll company matches up to 3%.



Work / Life Balance
Raytheon supports a variety of flexible work arrangements including compressed work weeks, flextime, job sharing, 9/80, reduced hours and telecommuting.



Career Development
At Raytheon, we foster an inclusive culture of professional development. We support a variety of developmental opportunities including: Mentoring programs, Skills Development, Leadership Development, Rotational job assignments, and Continuous Improvement, all of which contribute to advancement of our employee’s capabilities.



Paid Time Off
Accrue paid time off monthly. Receive 10-12 holidays per year with some locations shutting down the week between Christmas and New Year’s Day.



Relocation Assistance
Select technical positions are eligible for relocation packages. See specific job description for eligibility requirements.



Parental Leave
Raytheon offers all eligible employees up to three weeks paid parental leave for the birth or adoption of a child (separate from paid maternity leave or Family & Medical Leave Act).

            Receptionist



         Login to apply
    
















Receptionist
Colorado Springs, CO 


The Receptionist is responsible for a wide variety of tasks ensuring the office is supplied, running efficiently, and visitors are taken care of and properly directed. Also meets the needs of other employees in the office, including covering reports, phone calls, and emails.  The role of the Receptionist is to support the business unit by performing all assigned tasks.  This person may also support some members of the local management team.
Responsibilities

Maintain a welcoming atmosphere for members and visitors.
Maintain strict code of confidentiality
Responsible for a wide variety of administrative duties; including ordering and maintenance of office supplies and maintaining office inventory
Directly responsible for maintaining files and records of all transactions with FedEx account and company card.
Sorting incoming and outgoing mail including UPS, DHL and FedEx deliveries.
Set up luncheons, meetings, and company parties on an as needed basis
Monitor office maintenance. 
Ability to sort and file confidential information
Create New Hire Packets
Coordinates Vendor Services

 
Requirements
 

High school diploma
Must be available M-F, with flexibility when needed
Minimum of 5 years’ experience as an Administrative Assistant in a fast paced environment, and must have previous experience supporting executive level management.
PC literate: MS Excel, Word, Power Point, and Outlook a must – Intermediate to Advanced  level experience
Voyager experience preferred
Proficient typing skills necessary
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Familiarity with accounting and billing principles required
First-rate problem-solving skills and diplomacy essential
Detailed oriented, precise and thorough
Excellent organizational skills yet able to successfully multi-task

*ad

Privacy Statement

By continuing to browse this site you agree to our use of cookies. You can find out more about which cookies we are using or switch them off in settings.
 

 
Accept

 


















 

 Privacy Overview


 Strictly Necessary Cookies


 3rd Party Cookies




 








Privacy Overview

This website uses cookies so that we can provide you with the best user experience possible. Cookie information is stored in your browser and performs functions such as recognising you when you return to our website and helping our team to understand which sections of the website you find most interesting and useful.
You can adjust all of your cookie settings by navigating the tabs on the left hand side.



 
Strictly Necessary Cookies

Strictly necessary cookies must be enabled at all times in order to login and apply to openings.



disable









If you disable this cookie, we will not be able to save your preferences and you will not be able to login to apply for openings. This means that every time you visit this website you will need to enable or disable cookies again.







3rd Party Cookies

This website uses Google Analytics to collect anonymous information such as the number of visitors to the site, and the most popular pages.
Keeping this cookie enabled helps us to improve our website.



disable









Please enable Strictly Necessary Cookies first so that we can save your preferences!












Enable All
Save Changes

If you’re ready to take on a fresh challenge, grow your career and contribute to making the world a safer place, Raytheon is ready to help you achieve your goals. Join our team and get the opportunity and support to find purpose, thrive and succeed.





Notice: Please be aware of suspicious recruiting emails and text messages that attempt to collect your confidential information. Case Administrator
Herndon, Virginia


Apply





Overview
Responsibilities
Success Profile
Rewards
Trending




Overview

What does it take to make the world a safer place? It takes delivering innovative technology and collaborating with some of the finest talent in the engineering field. Whether you’re a software engineer or a mechanical engineer, at Raytheon you’ll grow a varied and rewarding career. And you’ll be supported with a comprehensive and competitive benefits package that promotes work/life. If you’re ready to take on today’s big challenges, discover a world of opportunity at Raytheon.

America’s Best Large Employers by Forbes
Career & Development Opportunities
Full-time
Entry, Mid, Senior level




Back to Job Navigation (Overview)


Responsibilities


Raytheon Company is looking to fill a Case Administrator position located in the Herndon, VA area, in support of a dynamic fast paced business office on the KODIAK Program.  This position will focused on reducing the backlog of open cases for the program.  Communication and the ability to work across organizations with other components is critical in reducing the overall backlog.  The right candidate will perform a combination of Technician and Case Management tasks through their full lifecycle and must be able to work as an individual performer as well as in a team environment.   This position can be full time (40 hours) or part time (no less than 32 hours).Tasks to be performed include, but are not limited to:Oversee process of the declassification of documents related to Freedom of Information Act, Privacy Act, Mandatory Declassification requests cases, from beginning to end.Perform case management duties that include creating cases, creating and maintaining physical files, documenting all correspondence and coordinating with Sponsor components to identify equities as well as those of other government agencies.Responsible for supporting and working with the customer in setting up and maintaining a spreadsheet of open cases and determining case status in the workflow and subsequently reaching out to internal and external components or other government agencies to determine the status of pending document reviews with those offices/agencies.  Organize documents in preparation for declassification review and correctly assign these items to the proper equity holder.Act as a liaison for all other components as well as other government agencies involved in the process.Write response letters and other memorandums as requested by the Sponsor that explains the Sponsor's decisions and ensure responses are accurate and comply with federal statutes and Sponsor policies.Communicate both orally and in writing with internal and external stakeholders.Manage a high volume of cases varying in complexity.Conduct desktop research and analyze results to determine the relevance of a new search or whether the requested records have been previously declassified and/or released.Record decisions in the Sponsor's automated systems or on hardcopy forms as required.Coordinate intra and inter organizational referrals.Required SkillsMust have strong customer service skills.Must be proficient in computer utilization.Strong interpersonal skills to maintain effective working relationships with team members and customers. Excellent interpersonal skills to maintain effective working relationships with team members and customers as well as the ability to develop good rapport with outside liaisons.Strong oral and written communication skills sufficient to compose and deliver responses, presentations, etc. in a clear and concise manner.Well-developed critical thinking skills and an excellent focus on/to detail is a must have skills set.Ability to exercise discretion and pay close attention to detail. Ability to adapt to changing work requirements and manage multiple priorities in a deadline environment.Familiar with classified information levels and restrictionsAbility to work in a team environment and get along well with people at all levels.Must have Extensive knowledge in the use of MS Office, the Internet, and other internal applications necessary to complete routine and moderately complex tasks. Ability to apply a strong customer focus orientation to understand customer requirements.Desired ExperiencePrevious experience supporting public information release programs or prior experience working with the Sponsor.Qualifications/EducationBachelor degree from an accredited institution plus at least 2 years professional experience.Eight (8) years of experience (for a total of ten (10) or more years) may be substituted for a degree, with a high school diploma.Significant work experience with E.O. 12958, Freedom of Information Act and the Privacy Act, with a successful track record of showing initiative and the desire for professional growth, will be considered in lieu of a degree.Clearance RequirementsMust be a US Citizen and have a active TS/SCI clearance with a FS poly from day one of employment and be crossover eligible.This position requires a U.S. Person  who is eligible to obtain any required Export Authorization. 144370
Business Unit Profile
                        
                        Raytheon Intelligence, Information and Services delivers innovative technology to make the world a safer place. Our expertise in cyber, analytics and automation allow us to reach beyond what others think is possible to underpin national security and give our global customers unique solutions to solve the most pressing modern challenges -- from the cyber domain to automated operations, and from intelligent transportation solutions to creating clear insight from large volumes of data. IIS operates at nearly 550 sites in 80 countries, and is headquartered in Dulles, Virginia. The business area generated $6.1 billion in 2017 revenues. As a global business, our leaders must have the ability to understand, embrace and operate in a multicultural world -- in the marketplace and the workplace. We strive to hire people who reflect our communities and embrace diversity and inclusion to advance our culture, develop our employees, and grow our business.
Relocation Eligible 
                        
                        No
Clearance Type 
                        
                        TS/SCI with Full Scope Poly - Current
Expertise 
                        

                                
                            Administrative Services/SupportAerospace/Aeronautical EngineeringBusiness AdministrationComputer EngineeringComputer ScienceData ScienceGeneral Management
                        
                        

Type Of Job 
                        
                        Full Time

Work Location 
                        
 
                            
                            VA - Herndon
                        
Raytheon is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, age, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected Veteran status.

Quote



Felicia Jackson is regional vice president of RAYVETS, Raytheon's employee group for veterans and those who support them. After 24 years in the Air Force, she started a new career at Raytheon. "I wanted to go where people would support me," she told us.









Rewards




401(k) / Retirement Plans
Employer Matching, if you elect to enroll company matches up to 3%.



Work / Life Balance
Raytheon supports a variety of flexible work arrangements including compressed work weeks, flextime, job sharing, 9/80, reduced hours and telecommuting.



Career Development
At Raytheon, we foster an inclusive culture of professional development. We support a variety of developmental opportunities including: Mentoring programs, Skills Development, Leadership Development, Rotational job assignments, and Continuous Improvement, all of which contribute to advancement of our employee’s capabilities.



Paid Time Off
Accrue paid time off monthly. Receive 10-12 holidays per year with some locations shutting down the week between Christmas and New Year’s Day.



Relocation Assistance
Select technical positions are eligible for relocation packages. See specific job description for eligibility requirements.



Parental Leave
Raytheon offers all eligible employees up to three weeks paid parental leave for the birth or adoption of a child (separate from paid maternity leave or Family & Medical Leave Act).

            Application Security Engineer



         Login to apply
    
















Application Security Engineer
Santa Barbara, CA 


The Application Security Engineer is responsible for developing and strengthening web application security programs for Yardi software products by participating in static and dynamic code analysis, managing application penetration testing, developing automated integrations, and creation of application security training materials.
PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES 

Performs application and environment security testing, evaluation, and hardening.
Conducts automated static and dynamic code analysis with report creation and delivery.
Coordinates penetration testing and remediation efforts with application development and systems support teams.
Develops internal automation and integrations with implemented security services.
Collaborates with development teams to effectively maintain security in the SDLC and CI/CD pipelines following industry best practices
Develops internal compliance documentation.

EDUCATION/QUALITFICATIONS/EXPERIENCE

Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, or related field.
Three plus (3+) years of experience working in Information Security.
Two plus (2+) years of experience with static and/or dynamic code analysis and scanning tools.
Two plus (2+) years of experience with enterprise level software development, including secure coding practices and enterprise cloud architectures.
Relevant Information Security industry certifications.

 
REQUIRED SKILLS/ABILITIES

Understanding of enterprise web application design and API delivery methods.
Proficiency in at least one of the following: ASP.NET, Java, Mobile (IOS/Android).
Understanding of web application security principles and tools, including OWASP Top 10.
Understanding of penetration testing, common vulnerability analysis techniques and information security threat vectors.
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Strong teamwork and collaboration skills
Regular attendance is an essential function of this job

*sa

Privacy Overview

This website uses cookies so that we can provide you with the best user experience possible. Cookie information is stored in your browser and performs functions such as recognising you when you return to our website and helping our team to understand which sections of the website you find most interesting and useful.
You can adjust all of your cookie settings by navigating the tabs on the left hand side.



 
Strictly Necessary Cookies

Strictly necessary cookies must be enabled at all times in order to login and apply to openings.



disable









If you disable this cookie, we will not be able to save your preferences and you will not be able to login to apply for openings. This means that every time you visit this website you will need to enable or disable cookies again.







3rd Party Cookies

This website uses Google Analytics to collect anonymous information such as the number of visitors to the site, and the most popular pages.
Keeping this cookie enabled helps us to improve our website.



disable









Please enable Strictly Necessary Cookies first so that we can save your preferences!












Enable All
Save Changes

Principal Escalation Engineer (Boston/Santa Barbara/ Seattle)

Department:
              Customer Care
            
Location:
              Boston, Santa Barbara, Seattle
            

Req#:
              5653
            

The Principal Escalation Engineer owns product support readiness for Sonos Hardware and Software products for our Customer Experience support team. In this role you are a mentor for escalation engineers across the organization and lead product quality initiatives with a cross functional global product and support team to drive change. This position is highly visible to the executive level and will influence product and program direction. You'll train Escalation Support Engineers globally on advanced debugging techniques and tools. You will be engaged in the most critical support cases that require focus and resolution. The Principal Escalation Engineer delivers the right experience and the right quality of products to our customers and is the interface to the Product organization (Product Development, Quality Assurance and Product Management) to surface and resolve product level issues.




About You


More than a candidate that checks every box, we’re looking for people who are excited to work, learn, and grow at Sonos—no matter their background or how they identify. If that’s you, we hope you’ll apply for this role.
You want to be part of a team.
You come with new ideas and a unique point of view. You look forward to collaborating with a diverse team of individuals. You assume everyone’s best intentions, welcome a healthy debate, and embrace differing opinions. You eagerly seek and give help. Transparency tops your list of values, and you proactively contribute to a culture of respect and inclusion.
You enjoy a challenge.
Inquisitive and focused, you see every challenge as an opportunity. You’re ambitious and comfortable making mistakes because you learn from them and bounce back quickly. You would rather create the future than wait for it. You prioritize long-term value over short-term objectives.
You love to listen.
You approach every interaction with curiosity and a desire to understand. You want to make a positive impact in the world. You’re passionate about culture and know the power that music, film, podcasts, games, and stories have to bring people together.


What You’ll Do 

Lead supportability projects for new and existing products to ensure these products are supportable as an end product.Foster relationships cross functionally across the organization as a technical advocate for our customers and the Customer Experience organization as they relate to the Product Engineering team.As a technical leader, you will be engaged and will own tactical escalation response for the most critical escalations.You will mentor the current Escalation team members as a primary component of your daily work. Create training material for a larger support team audience related to troubleshooting process and best practices.

Skills You’ll Need

Basic Qualifications:Strong technical leader with 8+ years’ experience in 3rd level technical support escalation role.Technical Degree in Computer Science Engineering or Related Experience .Proficiency with debugging desktop and mobile (iOS, Android) environments.Expert level Network engineer highly skilled in debugging TCP/IP (IPv4/IPv6).Highly proficient with protocol level debugging with Wireshark, tcpdump or similar industry tools.You must have a passion for delivering the highest quality.Preferred Qualifications:Wireless technology troubleshooting experience preferred.Certifications and hands on experience working with Tableau, Kibana, MicroStrategies, Datadog or other related data visualization tools are strongly desired.Scripting experience (Python/Ruby/Go/Perl) preferred. Amazon Web Services or other Cloud technology experience desirable.Troubleshooting Tools such as Resource Monitor, Process monitor preferred.

More About Sonos


Sonos is a sound experience company. We pioneered multiroom wireless audio, made it sound amazing, and changed the way people listen, making it effortless for them to enjoy what they want, where they want, how they want.
Today we continue empowering listeners by developing new technologies, thoughtfully designing products, expanding our software platform, and crafting brilliant sound experiences while participating in a culture that values respect, transparency, collaboration, and ownership.
Together we’re working to positively impact the world and inspire everyone to listen better—because listening brings people together, builds understanding, drives change, and makes us happier.
Notice to European Job Applicants: Information you submit as a part of your job application will be used in accordance with Sonos EU Job Applicant Privacy Notice.
Notice to U.S. Job Applicants: Sonos is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other legally protected characteristics.
Follow the links to review the EEO is the Law poster and its supplement. The pay transparency policy is available here. Sonos is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities. If you need a reasonable accommodation because of a disability for any part of the employment process, please send an e-mail to accommodations@sonos.com and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information.

Operations Supervisor III   (94542) - Richardson, TX - Inogen, Inc. Jobs








 














Home
Jobs




Operations Supervisor III   (94542) - Richardson, TX

Toggle navigation








Operations Supervisor III   (94542) 

JobsLogin 












 Operations Richardson, TX, USA Full Time 



Email Me Similar Jobs Email Me This Job



ABOUT INOGEN Inogen was founded in 2001 to improve quality of life and increase freedom and independence for oxygen therapy users. Inogen is innovation in oxygen therapy. The Inogen mission is to improve freedom and independence for oxygen therapy patients through innovative products and services. Inogen is a manufacturer and Accredited Homecare Provider.
Inogen is focused on quality care, continuous improvement, and outstanding customer satisfaction. We are a stable, USA based company dedicated to providing an exciting and rewarding career to our employees. We completed a successful Initial Public Offering on the NASDAQ in 2014 and have demonstrated substantial growth over the last five years. Our work environment is casual yet high performing, and we are looking for seriously talented, motivated, and fast-paced professionals to join our team.
JOB DESCRIPTION 
The effective management of Inogen's manufacturing associates, processes and materials to produce the expected results in Quality and Output of FDA registered medical devices. Instill and maintain a sense of pride and ownership within the manufacturing organization that will continuously compel the team to produce and deliver high quality products on time and on budget. Drive continuous improvement efforts to identify and eliminate waste, reduce cost and improve quality. Establish and supervise procedures within the organization that comply with FDA, ISO and OSHA standards.
Key Competencies:
Direct the handling of materials from receipt thru shipment.
Accept responsibility for shipping only highly reliable product.
Adjust Manufacturing Associates' priorities and daily goals to meet changing demands.
Identify Manufacturing Associates' strengths and weaknesses and adjust responsibilities and training requirements appropriately.
Determine personnel performance, create requisitions for hiring, Performance Improvement Plans (PIPs) when necessary, promotion opportunities and be involved in the interviewing, hiring and if necessary, termination of Associates.
Approve and initiate changes to production, packaging and shipping procedures in accordance with ISO and FDA standards.
Review metrics as part of the continuous improvement program.
Administer and document regular training of production personnel.
Provide oversight to the production control and inventory control activities.
Work closely with Engineering, Materials and Quality to drive continuous improvement activities throughout manufacturing.
Work with the Materials group to identify and address material and supplier issues.
Responsible for all inventory accuracy, including R/I, MRB, FG, stockroom and WIP.
Responsible for ensuring production cells have materials required to meet production goals.
Communicates delivery and reorder trigger points to the Materials group.
Performs transactions moving materials from location to location or from location to accounts.
Performs and reconciles inventory cycle counts on a weekly basis.
Effectively manages floor stock, oversized and 2 bin system materials.
Supports kanban inventory procedures.
Assists in the material planning process.
Participates in the MRB process to keep material accurate and flowing through disposition.
Oversees inventory audits.
Works closely with Quality to ensure only release material is placed into inventory and delivered to the production floor
Maintain all production personnel training records and verify the training records contain all documentation needed to support the individual's qualifications of a given assembly or test station.
Maintain the Training Matrix used to track individual training progression and provide a snapshot of individual qualifications.
Work closely with Document Control to track and distribute deviations issued to the production floor as well as all Manufacturing Procedures and Quality Procedures. Confirm that only the most current procedures are released and on the floor.
Coordinate with Product Development to transfer new products/line extensions from the development stage to production release while assuring changes are designed properly for test and manufacturing.
Analyze improvements, revisions and implementation of new business processes or systems.
Maintain regular and punctual attendance.
Comply with all company policies and procedures.
Assist with any other duties as assigned.
Direct supervision for no more than 7 Leads. May be called upon to represent the Director of Manufacturing in company meetings.
 
Do you possess these abilities?
Excellent management skills, both of individuals as well as projects.
Must have strong work ethic.
Excellent oral and written communication skills required.
Understanding of inventor control.
Attention to detail is required.
Analytical & problem-solving skills & ability to multitask.
Solutions-oriented problem solver.
Excellent planning, communication and organizational skills.
Ability to effectively interface with different departments within the company.
 
Requirements:
Associates degree in Mechanical, Electrical, Systems Engineering, or related technical discipline, required.
5 years of experience in a manufacturing environment, required. Preferably in medical device manufacturing, required.
1-2 years' in a lead or supervisory role, required.
Intermediate knowledge/proficiency Microsoft Office and data base systems, required.
A combination of training, education and experience that is equivalent to the qualifications listed above and that provides the required knowledge, skills, and abilities.
 
WHY INOGEN Inogen is a dynamic company that is not only focused on quality care of patients, but is also committed to being a top employer.  Each of Inogen' s offices have a casual culture that supports employees being responsible and developing professionals.
We offer competitive salaries and a robust benefit package:
Employee Stock Purchase Plan 401 (K) plan available for all employees Health, dental, vision insurance Flexible spending accounts and wellness discount program Life Insurance Long Term Disability Robust paid time off and 8 paid holidays Employee Assistance Program
See the Inogen Team in action:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dKoTMeJf5J4
 
Inogen Where we go to work hard to positively impact people's lives
 
Inogen is an equal opportunity employer.  We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other legally protected characteristics. The EEO is the Law poster and its supplement are available here: http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/ofccpost.htm; http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/OFCCP_EEO_Supplement_Final_JRF_QA_508c.pdf.  The pay transparency policy is available here: http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/pdf/EO13665_PrescribedNondiscriminationPostingLanguage_JRFQA508c.pdf. 
Inogen is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities.  If you need a reasonable accommodation because of a disability for any part of the employment process, please send an e-mail to recruiting@inogen.net or call (972) 616-5668 and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information.

If you’re ready to take on a fresh challenge, grow your career and contribute to making the world a safer place, Raytheon is ready to help you achieve your goals. Join our team and get the opportunity and support to find purpose, thrive and succeed.





Notice: Please be aware of suspicious recruiting emails and text messages that attempt to collect your confidential information. Sr Systems Administrator I
Aurora, Colorado


Apply

Overview

Raytheon delivers innovative technology to make the world a safer place. Our expertise in cyber, analytics and automation allow us to reach beyond what others think is possible to underpin national security and give our global customers unique solutions to solve the most pressing modern challenges -- from the cyber domain to automated operations, and from intelligent transportation solutions to creating clear insight from large volumes of data. Our leaders must have the ability to understand, embrace and operate in a multicultural world -- in the marketplace and the workplace. We strive to hire people who reflect our communities and embrace diversity and inclusion to advance our culture, develop our employees, and grow our business.

Full-time
Entry to Senior level

Glassdoor 2017 Best Places to Interview: Candidate's Choice

Rewards




401(k) / Retirement Plans
Employer Matching, if you elect to enroll company matches up to 3%.



Work / Life Balance
Raytheon appreciates work/life balance. Employees can work 9 hours a day every week and received every other Friday off, as long as departmental/manager approval is obtained. Accrued paid time off monthly and paid holiday time.



Career Development
At Raytheon, we foster an inclusive culture of professional development. We support a variety of developmental opportunities including: Mentoring programs, Skills Development, Leadership Development, Rotational job assignments, and Continuous Improvement, all of which contribute to advancement of our employee’s capabilities.



Paid Time Off
Accrue paid time off monthly. Receive 12 holidays per year including the week between Christmas and New Year’s Day.



Relocation Assistance
Select technical positions are eligible for relocation packages. See specific job description for eligibility requirements.



Parental Leave
Raytheon offers all eligible employees up to three weeks paid parental leave for the birth or adoption of a child (separate from paid maternity leave or Family & Medical Leave Act).



Back to Job Navigation (Rewards)



Responsibilities


Raytheon is seeking a Windows System Administrator to join our team in operating and maintaining the Joint Polar Satellite System (JPSS) Common Ground System (CGS), a state-of-the-art ground station for the next generation of low earth orbiting environmental satellites. This system provides global coverage, monitor environmental conditions, collect, disseminate and process data about the Earth's weather, atmosphere, oceans, land and near-space environment.  The System Administrator is responsible for troubleshooting, maintaining and implementing solutions to optimize the infrastructure operations. Analyzes and identifies all or part of a company's existing or new computer (and/or server), peripheral, network, and telecommunications systems requirements, taking into consideration the special technology needs. Designs, implements, codes, tests, documents, and maintains systems integration solutions to total system or subsystems. Establishes functional and technical specifications, solves hardware/software interface problems, defines input/output parameters, and ensures integration of the entire system or subsystem.  Duties can include, but not limited to:Windows Systems AdministrationInstallation of workstations, installing licenses, and adding VMWare VMs.  Patch and Vulnerability evaluation, remediation, and work-off/closure of security findingsProvide expertise for operational management of SAN storage, monitoring, access management, disaster recovery, security compliance/auditing, networking,Reviewing and impact assessment of Engineering Change Requests (ECR)Set up administrator and service accounts, maintaining system documentation and troubleshootingQualified applicants must be a U.S. Citizen, will be subject to a security investigation, must be able to obtain a DOD Common Access Card (CAC) and pass a national agency check.Required Skills: 4+ years of relevant technical experience2+ years of experience with Windows systems administration. Experience with VMWareDemonstrated ability to work in a process driven environment Ability to establish and maintain good working relationship with all levels of an organization, including customers, engineering organizations, IPT members, supporting functional organizations. Excellent written and oral communication skills and negotiation skills.  Ability to quickly come up to speed on technical efforts Hardware/software trouble shooting skills. Desired Skills:  Linux Systems Administration experienceNetworking experienceExperience with NAS administrationExperience with security operations: system protection, system scanning and auditing, recurring security configuration checks and management, risk assessments, contingency/incident response, and security sustainment of a large ground system. Experience in action item management, requirement change management and overall development and progress metrics. Required Education (including Major):Must have a Bachelor’s degree, preferably in Science, Technology, Engineering or Mathematics, and 4 years of related work experience.Travel:Occasional travel in the Continental United States including Raytheon location in Riverdale, MD. Schedule:Normal work hours are between 8am and 5pm; however, various mission activities will require a flexible work schedule, occasional off-hours and weekends depending on mission needs. 150292
                

                    
                 
                           Raytheon is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, age, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected Veteran status.

If you’re ready to take on a fresh challenge, grow your career and contribute to making the world a safer place, Raytheon is ready to help you achieve your goals. Join our team and get the opportunity and support to find purpose, thrive and succeed.





Notice: Please be aware of suspicious recruiting emails and text messages that attempt to collect your confidential information. Raytheon conducts all electronic correspondence using e-mail addresses that end in “Raytheon.com”, “Raytheon.co.uk”, “Raytheon.com.au” or “brassring.com”. To report fraud please go to: https://www.ic3.gov.

Overview

What does it take to make the world a safer place? It takes delivering innovative technology and collaborating with some of the finest talent in the engineering field. Whether you’re a software engineer or a mechanical engineer, at Raytheon you’ll grow a varied and rewarding career. And you’ll be supported with a comprehensive and competitive benefits package that promotes work/life. If you’re ready to take on today’s big challenges, discover a world of opportunity at Raytheon.

America’s Best Large Employers by Forbes
Career & Development Opportunities
Full-time
Entry, Mid, Senior level




Back to Job Navigation (Overview)


Responsibilities


Are you looking for an engineering career that is challenging and satisfying? Then join our Raytheon team of engineers solving problems that make the world a safer place and help to secure our great nation! Come support those who provide us with all the freedoms we enjoy.We offer great benefits that include medical, dental, vision, 401K match, flexible work schedule - just to name a few.  Click here to view a brief video and learn more: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qvbCgKpkEdsRaytheon Intelligence, Information and Services (IIS) delivers innovative technology to make the world a safer place. Our expertise in cyber, analytics and automation allow us to reach beyond what others think is possible to underpin national security and give our global customers unique solutions to solve the most pressing modern challenges -- from the cyber domain to automated operations, and from intelligent transportation solutions to creating clear insight from large volumes of data. IIS operates at nearly 550 sites in 80 countries, including a large presence in Dulles, VA. As a global business, our leaders must have the ability to understand, embrace and operate in a multicultural world -- in the marketplace and the workplace. We strive to hire people who reflect our communities and embrace diversity and inclusion to advance our culture, develop our employees, and grow our business.Job Description:Raytheon Intelligence, Information and Services (IIS) has immediate openings for Sr. DevOps Engineers and Site Reliability Engineers (SRE). We've begun our journey into DevOps and we need your help to accelerate adoption! The qualified candidate will have a keen interest in DevOps philosophies and an extensive background in implementing systems utilizing DevOps practices. The position is hands-on; therefore, the successful candidate will have strong implementation, system diagnostic and leadership skills. There are multiple needs that span the spectrum of DevOps so apply today!Must be US Citizen with the ability to obtain and maintain a TS/SCI Security ClearanceThis position is eligible for a Sign on Bonus of up to $40k for a candidate with a current verifiable TS/SCI clearance that is hired by RaytheonRequirements include:10 years of work related experience is requiredLeadership in implementing and accelerating DevOps adoptionSOA Software developmentProgramming and scripting – Python, Java, Ruby, etc.Agile methodologies (including agile leadership and planning)Administration of traditional and cloud infrastructures (AWS is preferred)System deployment using automation frameworksBranching strategies that enable agile developmentContainer Orchestration technologies (Kubernetes, Mesos, DockerEE)Cloud Adoption StrategiesUnit and system test using test automation frameworks (design and implementation)Robust configuration managementAbility to communicate technical concepts both up and down the management chainAbility to obtain and maintain a TS/SCI Security Clearance and US Citizenship requiredDesired Skills:Ability to stay abreast of emerging system development trendsExposure to Information Assurance compliance to specified standards, e.g. ICD-503 or Risk Management FrameworkAbility to adapt in fast-paced and changing environmentEducation: Requires a degree in Science, Technology, Engineering or Mathematics (STEM) and 10 years of related work experience. Graduate degree preferred in Computer Science, Engineering, Math or Physics 150615
Business Unit Profile
                        
                        Raytheon Intelligence, Information and Services delivers innovative technology to make the world a safer place. Our expertise in cyber, analytics and automation allow us to reach beyond what others think is possible to underpin national security and give our global customers unique solutions to solve the most pressing modern challenges -- from the cyber domain to automated operations, and from intelligent transportation and training solutions to creating clear insight from large volumes of data. IIS operates at nearly 550 sites in 80 countries, and is headquartered in Dulles, Virginia. The business area generated $6.2 billion in 2018 revenues. As a global business, our leaders must have the ability to understand, embrace and operate in a multicultural world -- in the marketplace and the workplace. We strive to hire people who reflect our communities and embrace diversity and inclusion to advance our culture, develop our employees, and grow our business.
