Quote



Felicia Jackson is regional vice president of RAYVETS, Raytheon's employee group for veterans and those who support them. After 24 years in the Air Force, she started a new career at Raytheon. "I wanted to go where people would support me," she told us.









Rewards




401(k) / Retirement Plans
Employer Matching, if you elect to enroll company matches up to 3%.



Work / Life Balance
Raytheon supports a variety of flexible work arrangements including compressed work weeks, flextime, job sharing, 9/80, reduced hours and telecommuting.



Career Development
At Raytheon, we foster an inclusive culture of professional development. We support a variety of developmental opportunities including: Mentoring programs, Skills Development, Leadership Development, Rotational job assignments, and Continuous Improvement, all of which contribute to advancement of our employee’s capabilities.



Paid Time Off
Accrue paid time off monthly. Receive 10-12 holidays per year with some locations shutting down the week between Christmas and New Year’s Day.



Relocation Assistance
Select technical positions are eligible for relocation packages. See specific job description for eligibility requirements.



Parental Leave
Raytheon offers all eligible employees up to three weeks paid parental leave for the birth or adoption of a child (separate from paid maternity leave or Family & Medical Leave Act).

Client Support Specialist - (0105154) Location: Santa Barbara, CADo you want to work in a fun, smart, and energetic environment where you will be challenged, rewarded AND inspired? Come work with top performers at CJ Affiliate to make a real difference in how top brands run their businesses. We are the world’s leading affiliate marketing network - we transform digital marketing with the help of big data and business intelligence. We help advertisers drive more sales and expand their reach … and we want to hear from you!Client Support Specialists play a key role in supporting CJ’s advertisers and publishers. Client Support helps advertisers and publishers with a wide range of CJ account basics and troubleshooting, from the basics of affiliate, to day-to-day management requirements, to advanced topics like reporting. Additionally, Client Support works with our Publisher Development team to assist with high priority issues and identify clients with high management potential. Client Support Specialists are subject matter experts on CJ matters, providing best in class support for prioritized clients.Do these things interest you? You will:Become a subject matter expert in many things CJThe basics of the CJ user interfacesKey processes for day-to-day management and success for affiliate programsNew CJ product and documentation offerings to share with clientsProvide best in class support to managed clients through their account teams via internal support systems and to CJ’s advertiser and publisher bases through online and phone channels.Provide troubleshooting assistance for a variety of general and technical issues based on your subject matter expertise.Work on goals and projects that will enhance the client experience, such as automating team processes or enhancing documentation for clients.What we look for:Bachelor’s Degree from a four-year college or university.Strong customer service skills with at least 1-2 years of experience in a position that involves direct client interaction.Excellent phone, written, and interpersonal skills.Ability to collaborate on a teamStrong problem solving, analytical, and follow-through skills.  Why CJ Affiliate?CJ Affiliate is the leader in Affiliate Marketing.  We take pride in our innovative technology, comprehensive data solutions and our people.  We equip our teams with advanced tools, training and career development opportunities all to provide cutting edge solutions, strategies and support to deliver high quality results for our clients. We work in an energetic, results-oriented, collaborative, team environment that recognizes exceptional performance. As we evolve and grow as a business, so do you.         We offer comprehensive benefits including; competitive compensation, aggressive 401K match program, health and dental insurance, flexible time off, an Employee Stock purchase plan, fitness membership reimbursement, backup care program, flexible spending accounts, charitable donation matching and much, much more!  Our benefits are designed to care for you and your family – to keep you healthy - physically, emotionally, financially and socially. CJ Affiliate is a business unit within Conversant and Epsilon which is part of Alliance Data, a top performing Fortune 500 company also included in the S&P 500- NYSE: ADS. Conditions of EmploymentAll job offers are contingent upon successful completion of certain background checks which unless prohibited by applicable law may include criminal history checks, employment verification, education verification, drug screens, credit checks, DMV checks (for driving positions only) and fingerprinting. LI*DTReady to Work Hard, Play Hard and Make a difference? Apply now!Alliance Data is an Equal Employment Opportunity employerAlliance Data participates in E-Verify#support-operations Primary Location: USA - United States-3079 - California-50035 - Santa Barbara-K8-Santa BarbaraWork Locations: K8-Santa Barbara   Santa Barbara 93103Job: Account ManagementOrganization: EpsilonSchedule: RegularJob Type: Full-timeJob Posting: Nov 26, 2019, 3:53:39 PMDivision: CJ AffiliateRI: DT

If you’re ready to take on a fresh challenge, grow your career and contribute to making the world a safer place, Raytheon is ready to help you achieve your goals. Join our team and get the opportunity and support to find purpose, thrive and succeed.





Notice: Please be aware of suspicious recruiting emails and text messages that attempt to collect your confidential information. Digital Signal Processing (DSP) Engineers
Aurora, Colorado


Apply





Overview
Responsibilities
Success Profile
Rewards
Trending




Overview

What does it take to make the world a safer place? It takes delivering innovative technology and collaborating with some of the finest talent in the engineering field. Whether you’re a software engineer or a field engineer, at Raytheon you’ll grow a varied and rewarding career. And you’ll be supported with a comprehensive and competitive benefits package that promotes work/life. If you’re ready to take on today’s big challenges, discover a world of opportunity at Raytheon.

America’s Best Large Employers by Forbes
Career & Development Opportunities
Full-time
Entry, Mid, Senior level




Back to Job Navigation (Overview)


Responsibilities


Raytheon is seeking Digital Signal Processing Engineers  to join our M2C System Engineering team in Aurora, Colorado. Would you like to work in a collaborative environment at a state of the art facility in Colorado? Then join our Raytheon team of engineers solving problems that make the world a safer place and help to secure our great nation! Come support those who provide us with all the freedoms we enjoy.Our facility in Aurora, CO offers amenities that create work and life balance. On site we have a 24/7 fitness facility, health center, cafeteria, collaboration rooms and dynamic break areas for easy conversation and socialization. Additionally, employee appreciation lunches, bonus opportunities, and great benefits that include medical, dental, vision, 401K match, flexible work schedule - just to name a few.  Click here to view a brief video and learn more: https://youtu.be/YNuZN0vyzHgAs a Digital Signal Processing (DSP) Engineer,  you will be a team member of a dynamic and multidiscipline development team within the Advanced Mission Solutions (AMS) program area.  Responsibilities will span the development and fielding life cycle from initial concept definition through detailed design, development, and qualification testing and into fielding and customer support.  The team member will work on a small, tightly focused team to accomplish assigned tasking/milestones and work with the staff leadership to ensure adherence to budgets, plans, and schedules.  The ideal candidate will have experience with radio frequency (RF) communications links and systems, algorithm prototyping/modeling, waveform design, and software-defined radios.Clearance Requirement:  Must be a US Citizens with a current/active TS/SCI clearanceThis position is eligible for a Sign on Bonus up to 40k for a candidate with a current TS/SCI and that can be verified and hired at Raytheon. Required Experience, Knowledge and/or Skills: • Minimum 4+ years of related work experience• Experience/Knowledge with waveform design and application• Experience with signal modulation application• Familiar with communication links• Working knowledge using Matlab or X-MIDAS or related languages for algorithm prototyping and simulation• Working knowledge with software development in C/C++ or related languages• Understanding of software development processes and their application to programs• Must be a US Citizen and have an active TS/SCI              Desired Experience, Knowledge and/or Skills: • Working knowledge of spread spectrum communication signals and systems• Experience designing for and implementing algorithms on software-defined radios• Experience developing with Python and Java• Experience developing on Linux operating system• Experience developing with X-Midas• Experience developing with RedhawkEducation Requirements:B.S./M.S. in Engineering or Computer Science, Physics, Math, or related STEM degree CONETWORKIISSignalIISBonus#SignalProcessing#RF#cleared#DSP 149051
Business Unit Profile
                        
                        Raytheon Intelligence, Information and Services delivers innovative technology to make the world a safer place. Our expertise in cyber, analytics and automation allow us to reach beyond what others think is possible to underpin national security and give our global customers unique solutions to solve the most pressing modern challenges -- from the cyber domain to automated operations, and from intelligent transportation and training solutions to creating clear insight from large volumes of data. IIS operates at nearly 550 sites in 80 countries, and is headquartered in Dulles, Virginia. The business area generated $6.2 billion in 2018 revenues. As a global business, our leaders must have the ability to understand, embrace and operate in a multicultural world -- in the marketplace and the workplace. We strive to hire people who reflect our communities and embrace diversity and inclusion to advance our culture, develop our employees, and grow our business.
Relocation Eligible 
                        
                        Yes
Clearance Type 
                        
                        TS/SCI - Current
Expertise 
                        

                                
                            Aerospace/Aeronautical EngineeringAlgorithmsAtmospheric/Space ScienceComputer EngineeringComputer ScienceData ScienceElectrical EngineeringEngineering TechnologyGeneral EngineeringIntegration & Test EngineeringMathematicsSoftware EngineeringSystems EngineeringTest Engineering

                        Full Time

Travel 
                        
                        IISBONUS

Raytheon is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, age, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected Veteran status.

Back to Job Navigation (Success)


Quote



I joined Raytheon in 2016 and I’m proud to work here. My company makes some pretty amazing things, including missile defense, using data to predict the weather, and securing our GPS system. My company also works with artificial intelligence, machine learning and other innovative solutions. I’m proud to work for an organization that allows me the flexibility to be a STEM volunteer and help inspire our future generation.









Rewards




401(k) / Retirement Plans
Employer Matching, if you elect to enroll company matches up to 3%.



Work / Life Balance
Raytheon supports a variety of flexible work arrangements including compressed work weeks, flextime, job sharing, 9/80, reduced hours and telecommuting.



Career Development
At Raytheon, we foster an inclusive culture of professional development. We support a variety of developmental opportunities including: Mentoring programs, Skills Development, Leadership Development, Rotational job assignments, and Continuous Improvement, all of which contribute to advancement of our employee’s capabilities.



Paid Time Off
Accrue paid time off monthly. Receive 10-12 holidays per year with some locations shutting down the week between Christmas and New Year’s Day.



Relocation Assistance
Select technical positions are eligible for relocation packages. See specific job description for eligibility requirements.



Parental Leave
Raytheon offers all eligible employees up to three weeks paid parental leave for the birth or adoption of a child (separate from paid maternity leave or Family & Medical Leave Act).



Sign-On Bonus
Qualified cleared engineers can receive an up to $40K sign-on bonus when they join our Engineering Team!



Student Loan Repayment Contribution
Through the 401(k), called the Raytheon Savings and Investment Plan, the company will make a dollar for dollar contribution for amounts employees spend repaying their student loans, up to their maximum match percentage.

Sonos | Senior Industrial Designer Packaging Santa Barbara

Sr. Industrial Designer, Packaging (Experience & Visual Design)

Department:
              Design and Creative
            
Location:
              Santa Barbara
            

Req#:
              5455
            

Sonos is seeking a senior level Designer to join its high-performing, collaborative Packaging Experience & Visual Design team. The role of a Senior Designer in the Packaging Design team at Sonos requires balancing a deep sense of collaboration & communication, with an eye for design details, quality, and a desire to deliver the ‘right product’. Designers at Sonos are expected to embrace the design team behaviors of Trust, Debate, and Accountability. The ability to envision and shape Sonos design experiences for premium packaging for today and beyond is your mission. This approach requires attention to detail and craft that is fueled by deep curiosity, respecting the challenges of delivering a premium ‘out of box experience’ for iconic products.




About You


More than a candidate that checks every box, we’re looking for people who are excited to work, learn, and grow at Sonos—no matter their background or how they identify. If that’s you, we hope you’ll apply for this role.
You want to be part of a team.
You come with new ideas and a unique point of view. You look forward to collaborating with a diverse team of individuals. You assume everyone’s best intentions, welcome a healthy debate, and embrace differing opinions. You eagerly seek and give help. Transparency tops your list of values, and you proactively contribute to a culture of respect and inclusion.
You enjoy a challenge.
Inquisitive and focused, you see every challenge as an opportunity. You’re ambitious and comfortable making mistakes because you learn from them and bounce back quickly. You would rather create the future than wait for it. You prioritize long-term value over short-term objectives.
You love to listen.
You approach every interaction with curiosity and a desire to understand. You want to make a positive impact in the world. You’re passionate about culture and know the power that music, film, podcasts, games, and stories have to bring people together.


What You’ll Do 

As a designer in Packaging Design, you are expected to collaborate with design and engineering partners on programs to deliver premium, sustainable package designs. Your role fundamentally provides 2D and 3D expertise to help build, refine, and communicate great design solutions that uphold or improve the packaging experience. Your role is not limited to this -- you should also be ready to contribute to early concept exploration, visualization, and presentations to visually articulate the packaging design intent. Packaging Design is committed to delivering an easy, enjoyable opening experience for our customers.Key Responsibilities:Apply your 2D and 3D expertise and skills to help create, refine, and communicate superior structural design intent that uphold or improve the packaging experience platform.Create volume models, structural prototypes, dielines and renders to communicate Sonos’ point of view on unboxing experiences.Experience with various packaging substrates such as SBS, Corrugate, Rigid boxExperience with packaging manufacturing and print technologiesProvide clear, focused direction (i.e. design brief, sketches) to drive programs and initiatives Further develop our sustainable packaging exploration and initiatives to deliver on our Sustainability KPIsSuccess in this role requires: Aesthetic sensitivity: Ability to consistently deliver and innovate design concepts that express a strong eye towards form and function, attention to detail and conceptual clarity. Candidates must demonstrate the ability to draw upon contemporary trends in a way that results in aesthetic unboxing experiences for the holistic packaging system (exterior and interior). Creative thinking: Ability to think creatively and critically across a range of problem types while keeping sight of the “big picture” goals. Additionally, the right candidate will have a genuine interest in working across problems that touch upon industrial design, packaging, interaction design and brand in a manner that reinforces the Sonos design and brand promise. Organizational skills: Candidates should be detail-driven and seasoned in navigating packaging interaction and development processes for volume production: tracking schedules, program aims and manufacturing considerations while striving to deliver compelling packaging experiences that support premium products. 

Skills You’ll Need

Basic Qualifications:BA or BS in the field of Industrial Design, Packaging Engineering or other related Bachelor's Degree A minimum of 4-7+ years experience in designing premium retail packaging in a corporate or consulting team environmentExperience in delivering premium packaging solutions for worldwide markets with a focus in the areas of consumer electronics, domestic appliances, beauty, or other related CPG industriesProven ability to develop & resolve design concepts through sketches, mock-ups, & models; from 2D to full 3D prototypesProven ability in developing packaging structures for volume production and manufacturing Experience interacting and effectively communicating with internal partners & 3rd party vendors throughout the design development processProficiency with software such as Adobe CC, G-Suite or MS Office, Keyshot, Artios, Solidworks, Siemens NX, or similarAble to travel approximately 10-15% annually (nationally and internationally)Must have a portfolio available for viewing.Preferred Qualifications:Understanding of impacts of packaging materials and design solutions on Colors, Materials and Finish for productAbility to maintain aesthetic sensitivity from concept to manufacture without losing the spirit of the original packaging design intentAbility to multitask, work quickly, accurately, but take time for reflection and innovation Demonstrated ability to translate trends and culture into compelling products.Strong command of American-English is critical, a second spoken language is a plus

More About Sonos


Sonos is a sound experience company. We pioneered multiroom wireless audio, made it sound amazing, and changed the way people listen, making it effortless for them to enjoy what they want, where they want, how they want.
Today we continue empowering listeners by developing new technologies, thoughtfully designing products, expanding our software platform, and crafting brilliant sound experiences while participating in a culture that values respect, transparency, collaboration, and ownership.
Together we’re working to positively impact the world and inspire everyone to listen better—because listening brings people together, builds understanding, drives change, and makes us happier.
Notice to European Job Applicants: Information you submit as a part of your job application will be used in accordance with Sonos EU Job Applicant Privacy Notice.
Notice to U.S. Job Applicants: Sonos is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other legally protected characteristics.
Follow the links to review the EEO is the Law poster and its supplement. The pay transparency policy is available here. Sonos is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities. If you need a reasonable accommodation because of a disability for any part of the employment process, please send an e-mail to accommodations@sonos.com and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information.

If you’re ready to take on a fresh challenge, grow your career and contribute to making the world a safer place, Raytheon is ready to help you achieve your goals. Join our team and get the opportunity and support to find purpose, thrive and succeed.

Configuration Analyst Section Manager - Mechanical Engineering
Fullerton, California


Apply





Overview
Responsibilities
Success Profile
Rewards
Trending




Overview

What does it take to make the world a safer place? It takes delivering innovative technology and collaborating with some of the finest talent in the engineering field. Whether you’re a software engineer or a mechanical engineer, at Raytheon you’ll grow a varied and rewarding career. And you’ll be supported with a comprehensive and competitive benefits package that promotes work/life. If you’re ready to take on today’s big challenges, discover a world of opportunity at Raytheon.

America’s Best Large Employers by Forbes
Career & Development Opportunities
Full-time
Entry, Mid, Senior level




Back to Job Navigation (Overview)


Responsibilities


Job Description:IDS Engineering Product Integrity (EPI) Department is seeking an energetic and highly motivated leader to fill a Section Manager position for the Radar and Electronic Systems (RES) Configuration and Data Management Section. The section manager will report to the EPI Department Manager, part of the Mechanical Engineering Directorate, and will include responsibility for oversight and support in multiple IDS locations.The successful candidate will be responsible for leading a team of approximately 10 - 20 configuration and data management professionals, performing a range of support to IDS programs and products. Primary responsibilities include providing adequate resources to programs based on current and future business needs, ensuring execution is within cost/schedule and identified risks are being managed effectively. The Section Manager is also responsible for generating, reviewing, approving Hardware Engineering bids, participating in engineering program reviews and quarterly Estimate at Complete (EAC) reviews. Other responsibilities include participating in strategic planning sessions, staffing, goals setting, performance development, training, and employee recognition and career development. The candidate will oversee a section responsible for:Configuration and Data Management leadership on programs, including supplier and customer relationsCoordination and administration of assigned configuration management activities relative to identification, control, and accounting for systems and/or equipment in accordance with contractual requirementsReview and analysis of released engineering change data and coordination of changes with engineering, quality, support, manufacturing, and engineering data control activitiesManagement of data deliveries from suppliers and to customersU.S. Citizenship status is required as this position will need a U.S. Security Clearance within 1 year of start date. Required Skills: 8+ years of configuration management or related experienceExperience with standards and processes, such as described in EIA-649, Configuration Management StandardExperience with generating product configuration metrics and reportsExperience with estimating, proposing and managing configuration management cost and schedule on a program.Desired Skills: Knowledge of systems, hardware and processes on IDS ProgramsStrong business acumen including planning, forecasting, analytical skills, and ability to negotiate and influenceProven ability to coordinate & manage project issues, risks and changesStrong skills in interpersonal communications, relationship building, and in collaborating on cross-functional teams comprised of diverse personalities, skill sets, and levels of experienceExperienced in maintaining product structure and configuration management of data within Windchill Product Data Management Strong Microsoft Office skills (Word, PowerPoint, and Excel)Possess strong communication and presentation skills (verbal and written); Able to generate and deliver customer presentationsAbility to interpret scheduling and milestone requirementsWorking knowledge of Capability Maturity Model Integrated (CMMI)Can work in a team-based environment consisting of organizational and outside customer contacts to meet project goals.Sense of urgency; ability to meet challenging deadlines and attention to detailRequired Education (including Major): Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering, Business or related field or equivalent combination of related experience and education. 150981
Business Unit Profile
                        
                        Headquartered in Tewksbury, Massachusetts, IDS has 32 locations around the world. Its broad portfolio of weapons, sensors and integration systems supports its customer base across multiple mission areas, including air and missile defense systems; missile defense radars; early warning radars; naval ship operating systems; C5ITM products and services; and other advanced technologies. IDS provides affordable, integrated solutions to a broad international and domestic customer base, including the U.S. Missile Defense Agency, the U.S. Armed Forces and the Department of Homeland Security.
Relocation Eligible 
                        
                        Yes
Clearance Type

Quote



Felicia Jackson is regional vice president of RAYVETS, Raytheon's employee group for veterans and those who support them. After 24 years in the Air Force, she started a new career at Raytheon. "I wanted to go where people would support me," she told us.









Rewards




401(k) / Retirement Plans
Employer Matching, if you elect to enroll company matches up to 3%.



Work / Life Balance
Raytheon supports a variety of flexible work arrangements including compressed work weeks, flextime, job sharing, 9/80, reduced hours and telecommuting.



Career Development
At Raytheon, we foster an inclusive culture of professional development. We support a variety of developmental opportunities including: Mentoring programs, Skills Development, Leadership Development, Rotational job assignments, and Continuous Improvement, all of which contribute to advancement of our employee’s capabilities.



Paid Time Off
Accrue paid time off monthly. Receive 10-12 holidays per year with some locations shutting down the week between Christmas and New Year’s Day.



Relocation Assistance
Select technical positions are eligible for relocation packages. See specific job description for eligibility requirements.



Parental Leave
Raytheon offers all eligible employees up to three weeks paid parental leave for the birth or adoption of a child (separate from paid maternity leave or Family & Medical Leave Act).

            Account Executive



         Login to apply
    
















Account Executive
Santa Barbara, CA 


The Account Executive will be responsible for developing a regional territory and selling Yardi’s products and services to existing clients within the residential real estate property management industry.
Responsibilities

Managing and cultivating relationships with existing clients to support continued sales growth
Becoming familiar with all product solutions, the competitive climate, and promoting company products
Conducting online and onsite presentations to demonstrate Yardi’s product offerings
Developing and executing outbound call  and email campaigns
Participating and networking at industry events and tradeshows
Meeting or exceeding monthly, quarterly and annual revenue goals
Establishing a strong sales pipeline, sales forecasts and updating accounts to support revenue growth
Assisting with the development and implementation of marketing materials and programs

**This position will require up to 50% travel**
Requirement 

Bachelor’s degree of equivalent experience
3+ years of successful sales experience managing and developing a sales territory
Solid knowledge base in sales and ability to apply basic sales principles (i.e. lead generation, opportunity qualification, proposal development, account management and closure)
Ability to effectively execute sales strategies using a consultative approach and relationship building techniques
Ability to interface with all levels within the client organization to include individual properties, large portfolios and other senior leadership in large to mid-sized companies
Strong, engaging presentation skills and ability to demonstrate product value
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Ability to internally motivate, work interdependently, and also work effectively with a team
Ability to develop and maintain solid client relationships
Ability to understand and demonstrate technical products
Prior experience entering data into a CRM system to support up to date client contact and information
Proven track record of achieving or exceeding sales goals
Prior background in software sales, property management or accounting systems desirable

*eo

By continuing to browse this site you agree to our use of cookies. You can find out more about which cookies we are using or switch them off in settings.
 

 
Accept

 


















 

 Privacy Overview


 Strictly Necessary Cookies


 3rd Party Cookies




 








Privacy Overview

This website uses cookies so that we can provide you with the best user experience possible. Cookie information is stored in your browser and performs functions such as recognising you when you return to our website and helping our team to understand which sections of the website you find most interesting and useful.
You can adjust all of your cookie settings by navigating the tabs on the left hand side.



 
Strictly Necessary Cookies

Strictly necessary cookies must be enabled at all times in order to login and apply to openings.



disable









If you disable this cookie, we will not be able to save your preferences and you will not be able to login to apply for openings. This means that every time you visit this website you will need to enable or disable cookies again.







3rd Party Cookies

This website uses Google Analytics to collect anonymous information such as the number of visitors to the site, and the most popular pages.
Keeping this cookie enabled helps us to improve our website.



disable









Please enable Strictly Necessary Cookies first so that we can save your preferences!

            Cloud Support Specialist I



         Login to apply
    
















Cloud Support Specialist I
Raleigh, NC 


The Cloud Support Specialist will provide Level 1 & 2 environmental and technical support to Yardi Systems SaaS customers as part of the 24x7x365 Cloud Services team.  The Cloud Support specialist is responsible for supporting the Yardi Cloud and will work as part of a global team and liaise with customer contacts and relevant internal teams to ensure requests are actioned and technical issues are resolved in a timely fashion. 
Responsibilities 

Configuring, supporting, and troubleshooting Yardi Cloud environments.
Installing and configuring Yardi SaaS products.
Providing phone based Level 1 & 2 environmental support for Yardi customers.
Monitoring and responding to system alerts.
Maintaining and improving documentation.
Working on an international team and liaise with global counterparts as required.
Participating in an enterprise 24x7x365 support environment with weekend and on call work required.

 Requirements

Exposure to SaaS technologies; IIS, server virtualization, SQL, PowerShell.
A passion for technology and strong problem solving skills.
Ability to learn new software and troubleshoot processes quickly.
Good analytical, organizational skills and attention to detail.
Good written and spoken communication skills.
Strong sense of customer service.
Must enjoy being part of a team and enjoy dealing with people. 
Former IT experience and training. Experience with Windows Server, Internet Information Services (IIS) and SQL preferred but not essential.
Relevant IT qualifications preferred but not essential.
Proven customer service experience.
Dependable attendance record

*sa

            Event Specialist



         Login to apply
    
















Event Specialist
Santa Barbara, CA 


Under general supervision, the Event Specialist is responsible for the execution of multiple minor Yardi tradeshow events focused on increasing brand awareness, retention of existing clients, and supporting the sales team. The Event Specialist coordinates tradeshow logistics, sets up booth displays, organizes webinars, and manages the online event planning tool. The Event Specialist also secures speaking opportunities and gains company exposure through client events and sponsorships.
Responsibilities 

Plans trade event logistics, including staffing, event registration, securing hotel rooms, collateral, giveaways, and providing updates to Sales personnel.
Secures trade show speaking opportunities and executes strategic marketing campaigns
Manages the on-site Yardi merchandising store by reviewing and fulfilling orders, maintaining and tracking inventory, and ordering promotional items for conferences.
Sets up Yardi trade show display booths, including preshow configuration, graphics and equipment, and tear down at events.
Assists the design and execution of marketing special events including event invitations, distribution lists, and sourcing materials.
Coordinates webinar logistics by scheduling webinars, presenters, entering leads, and distributing follow-up surveys and reports.
Manages Traq-it online event planning tool for event attendees by tracking and reporting event details, setting up new accounts, and maintaining data.
Supports the marketing department by serving as a backup for shipping and display management, sales lead processing, and back-end entry of promotions for events.
Cross-references attendee lists with CRM data to support Sales staff.
Four plus (4+) years of experience in event planning.
Bachelor’s degree in Communications, Marketing, Hospitality, or related field.
Two plus (2+) years of experience in high-level hospitality
Familiarity with Yardi products and services

Requirements

Proficiency with MS Excel, MS PowerPoint, and MS Outlook
Strong organizational skills and high attention to detail.
People-oriented with strong interpersonal skills.
Strong written and verbal communication skills.
Ability to adapt to changing priorities.
Proficiency using CRM systems to manage data and generate sales leads
Knowledge of Robohead project management tool
Knowledge of Jira issue tracking software
Regular attendance and a regular work schedule are essential functions of this job.
National travel required up to 10% for meetings, events, forums, and site inspections.

Inside Medical Sales Representative - Richardson, TX  (93259) - Richardson, TX - Inogen, Inc. Jobs

Inside Medical Sales Representative - Richardson, TX  (93259) - Richardson, TX

Toggle navigation








Inside Medical Sales Representative - Richardson, TX  (93259) 

JobsLogin 












 Sales Richardson, TX, USA Full Time 



Email Me Similar Jobs Email Me This Job



JOB DESCRIPTION This base + commission inside sales role is for professionals with a proven and consistent level of achievement who possess the drive to make unlimited income.  Our sales team is committed to being the best and strives to achieve personal sales objectives while collaborating toward corporate success.  Our ideal candidate is a self-starter with high energy, a persuasive communication style, and excellent follow through.
WHY INOGEN Inogen is a dynamic company that is not only focused on quality care of patients, but is also committed to being a top employer. Each of Inogen's offices has a casual culture that supports employees being responsible and developing professionals.
We offer competitive salaries and a robust benefit package:
Base + Uncapped Commission
Employee Stock Purchase Plan
Comprehensive Training Program
Seasoned first year target at $70k and top earners will exceed $100k
Health, dental & vision insurance
Insurance begins first day of month after hire
17 days of Paid time off and 8 paid holidays per year
401(K) plan available for all employees
Flexible spending accounts for health & childcare expenses
Life Insurance
Long Term Disability
Employee Assistance Program
ABOUT INOGEN Inogen was founded in 2001 to improve quality of life and increase freedom and independence for oxygen therapy users. Inogen is innovation in oxygen therapy. The Inogen mission is to improve freedom and independence for oxygen therapy patients through innovative products and services. Inogen is a manufacturer and Accredited Homecare Provider.
Inogen is focused on quality care, continuous improvement, and outstanding customer satisfaction. We are a stable, USAbased company dedicated to providing an exciting and rewarding career to our employees. We completed a successful Initial Public Offering on the NASDAQ in 2014 and have demonstrated substantial growth over the last five years. Our work environment is casual yet highperforming, and we are looking for seriously talented, motivated, and fast-paced professionals to join our team.
 
See the Inogen Team in action:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dKoTMeJf5J4
Key Competencies:
Make outgoing sales calls. Transition leads through first point of contact to ultimate sale of Inogen's oxygen concentrator products. Create strategic call plans to support sales activities.
Collaborate with Inogen personnel to transition secondary leads to DME provider partners
Promote Inogen within clinical and patient communities
Enter sales orders, process credit card payments and facilitate execution of leasing documents and pricing approvals as needed.
Impeccable phone etiquette required
Sales experience with 65+ demographic a plus
Must self-motivate and deliver results with limited oversight
Must be motivated to achieve results based upon earnings opportunity
Primary Responsibilities:
Manage a high volume of inbound/outbound calls to/from warm leads.
Provide exemplary consultative selling.
Accomplish or surpass targeted performance objectives on a consistent basis.
Execute the administrative process which includes paperwork flow, physician contacts, payment processing, and record documentation in CRM.
Qualifications:
BA in Business, English, Communications or related area desirable
3-5 years Sales/Customer Service background or relevant work experience required
Inogen is an equal opportunity employer.  We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other legally protected characteristics. The EEO is the Law poster and its supplement are available here: http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/ofccpost.htm;http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/OFCCP_EEO_Supplement_Final_JRF_QA_508c.pdf.  The pay transparency policy is available here:http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/pdf/EO13665_PrescribedNondiscriminationPostingLanguage_JRFQA508c.pdf.
Inogen is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities.  If you need a reasonable accommodation because of a disability for any part of the employment process, please send an e-mail to recruiting@inogen.net or call (972) 616-5668 and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information.

Inogen, Inc.
https://inogen.applicantpro.com

            Account Manager, Vendor Shield



         Login to apply
    
















Account Manager, Vendor Shield
Waltham, MA 


The Account Manager for Vendor Compliance provides multiple aspects of account management and support to a portfolio of Vendor Compliance clients. The Account Manager drives the resolution of client reported issues, compiles account performance reviews and analysis, establishes and maintains high level corporate contacts, and works with clients to create policies, procedures and workflows. Additionally, the Account Manager works with Associate Account Managers in support of software implementation and end-user training.
 
Responsibilities

Acts as the customer’s primary point of contact for Vendor Compliance.
Actively monitors the performance of assigned accounts.
Collaboratively works with clients to create policies, procedures and workflows.
Performs system, business process, and other service reviews to identify more effective compliance practices/policies based upon clients’ current business needs.
Identifies when client issues need escalation and determines the appropriate support resources for problem resolution.
Coordinates meetings with client executives and other key partnership members as needed both on-site and via web meetings.
Attend Yardi conferences and on-sites as needed.
Accurately documents client specific activity and client outreach in CRM system.
Advises and institutes best practices relevant to clients within the application of Compliance products.
Works with clients to determine what service or functionality should be added to their Compliance system configuration.
Determines if any additional products or services would benefit their book of client accounts.
Coordinates with the Sales Team and clients to add additional services.
Collaborates internally with analysts, designers, programmers, sales, and marketing with a focus on meeting client needs and maintaining high-level customer service standards; performs special projects related to department training and client support; and performs other Yardi duties as assigned.

  
Requirements

Bachelor’s or equivalent experience
Two (2) to five (5) years of project or account management experience. Property management or vendor compliance experience is a plus.
Comfortable/Confident presenting in front of Executive Level clients
Ability to think analytically and effectively communicate analysis to clients
Big picture focus while displaying a keen attention to detail
CRM experience
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Ability to meet critical deadlines and prioritize multiple tasks in a fast-paced environment
Collegial, team-oriented disposition with the desire and ability to establish cooperative working relationships with employees at all levels within Yardi, outside of Yardi, and with clients
Client-centered commitment and focus
Independent decision making and problem solving skills
Basic competence in the following areas: Microsoft Office Suite of Products: Word, Excel, PowerPoint
Ability to travel up ~10%

*ad

            Customer Care Specialist



         Login to apply
    
















Customer Care Specialist
Austin, TX 


The Customer Care Specialist will be responsible for ensuring client satisfaction and providing a positive customer service experience. This individual will be responsible for communicating with our clients through phone and email and assisting them with their procurement needs. This individual will work with supplier partners and/or internal Yardi teams to resolve customer’s requests. Success in this role will be dependent upon the individual’s ability to build relationships with clients and their ability to multitask, organize and prioritize daily tasks in a fast paced environment. The Customer Service Specialist is an entry-level role with plenty of room for growth within the company.
Ideal candidate is outgoing and energetic with a “can do” attitude and a passion for delivering extraordinary customer service, has empathy for others, is a team player, can adapt to any situation and has a strong internal drive to grow within the company.
 
Responsibilities

Greet customers warmly and ascertain problem or reason for calling
Log all inbound calls, emails and status updates received into the CRM database tool.
Resolve product or service problems by clarifying the customer's complaint; determining the cause of the problem; selecting and explaining the best solution to solve the problem; following up to ensure resolution within the desired SLA by Issue Type.
Ensure a positive experience with every Yardi customer by exercising professionalism, resourcefulness, and excellent customer service soft skills at all times
Work cross-functionally with internal team members to resolve customer issues.
Follow-up on all outstanding yCRM cases daily to obtain status and strive for same-day resolution.
Troubleshoot technology issues with confidence and ability to communicate updates accurately and with sensitivity to end users
Work closely with Customer Service Team Lead to identify process improvements.
Follow communication procedures, guidelines and policies set forth by the Customer Service Team Lead.
Meet individual and department goals as assigned.

Requirements

College degree or a minimum of 2 years of relevant client support experience
Customer Service experience required
Customer centric/service mentality
Strong ability to complete tasks and projects independently and within short deadlines
Experience working in a team-oriented, collaborative environment
PC literacy including MS Office,  as well as Internet and Windows navigation skills
Familiarity with CRM systems and practices preferred
Excellent organizational skills
Strong ability to manage time effectively, multi-task, and prioritize
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Strong phone contact handling skills, active listening and problem solving skills
Extremely detail oriented with strong ability to adapt and work under pressure
Team oriented with a keen sense of customer loyalty and accountability
Ability to learn and adapt to new technologies and changing processes
Ability to take initiative and make decisions

*ft

If you’re ready to take on a fresh challenge, grow your career and contribute to making the world a safer place, Raytheon is ready to help you achieve your goals. Join our team and get the opportunity and support to find purpose, thrive and succeed.

Senior Cyber Research Engineer
Apply
Requisition ID 137539BR Date updated 04/08/2019
Raytheon BBN Technologies is seeking cyber research engineers with 2 to 10 years of experience for its government-funded cyber research practice in the central Maryland region.  These engineers will work on small teams charged with creating new and unique TCP/IP networking stacks in the enclave to enterprise-edge environment.  Candidates should be familiar with TCP/IP networking fundamentals, software reverse engineering, and the Linux operating system.  Strong software development skills are also required.Prerequisites:•BS (or higher) in Computer Science, Engineering, or other relevant field•2+ years of experience depending on degree•TS/SCI w/poly•Ability to work between Columbia, MD and College Park, MD sites• Software development proficiency in C/C++ required, Java/Python a plusRelevant Knowledge and Skills:•Linux including system-level development internals•TCP/IP and Internet security protocols (e.g. TLS/SSL)•TCP/IP network configuration fundamentals (e.g. iptables, firewalls)•TCP/IP network traffic analysis (e.g. tcpdump, wireshark, packet analysis)•Software reverse engineering (e.g. IDA Pro, Binary Ninja)•Dynamic program analysis (e.g. gdb, ptrace, strace)•VMs and virtual networking in a lab setting 137539
Business Unit Profile
Raytheon Space and Airborne Systems (SAS) builds radars and other sensors for aircraft, spacecraft and ships. The business also provides communications and electronic warfare solutions and performs research in areas ranging from linguistics to quantum computing. SAS is headquartered in McKinney, Texas USA. As a global business, our leaders must have the ability to understand, embrace and operate in a multicultural world -- in the marketplace and the workplace. We strive to hire people who reflect our communities and embrace diversity and inclusion to advance our culture, develop our employees, and grow our business.Raytheon is headquartered in Waltham, Massachusetts. Follow us on Twitter.

Relocation Eligible 
            Yes

            Senior Quality Assurance Specialist



         Login to apply
    
















Senior Quality Assurance Specialist
Waltham, MA 


The QA Specialist develops and executes software test plans as well as analyzes and writes test standards and procedures. The QA Specialist reviews test results to ensure correct functionality and recommends corrective action as well as consults with developers and subject matter experts in resolution of problems.
 
Responsibilities

Works on problems of moderate to complex scope where analysis of data requires evaluation and judgment.
Uses professional concepts; applies company policies and procedures to resolve a variety of issues.
Collaborates with various teams for product development and defect resolution.
Participates in all aspects of testing, including functional, regression, performance, and system testing.
Performs regression testing including developing and running automated test suites.
Defines test strategy based on the analysis of design document and requirements.
Creates, manages and execute test cases, log and assign defects and keep track of the defect status
Participates in systems and applications installations.
Functions as a Subject Matter Expert on Yardi Resident Screening applications.
Provides tier 3 production support.

 
Requirements

Bachelor’s degree in Quality Assurance, Computer Science, Information Systems, or related experience.
5+ years’ experience in Quality Assurance.  Property Management Systems QA is a plus.
Strong analytical and critical thinking skills as well as the ability to troubleshoot and resolve issues.
Ability to review and participate in project and technical design reviews.
Experience writing test plans and test case suites.
Good working knowledge of MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint and screen capture editing tools.
Experience with Linux, distributed systems architecture, web services and Java based applications.
Understanding of the product development lifecycle including design, development, testing, rollout, and support.
Good working knowledge of databases and SQL as well as Linux application log files.
Experience with commercial bug tracking systems.
Familiarity with using automated test tools.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills as well as being a team player.
Ability to excel in a fast-paced environment while meeting deadlines and executing responsibilities.

Privacy Overview

This website uses cookies so that we can provide you with the best user experience possible. Cookie information is stored in your browser and performs functions such as recognising you when you return to our website and helping our team to understand which sections of the website you find most interesting and useful.
You can adjust all of your cookie settings by navigating the tabs on the left hand side.



 
Strictly Necessary Cookies

Strictly necessary cookies must be enabled at all times in order to login and apply to openings.



disable

Keeping this cookie enabled helps us to improve our website.

            Associate Technical Account Manager



         Login to apply
    
















Associate Technical Account Manager
Atlanta, GA 


Associate Technical Account Managers at Yardi will provide consultative, implementation and technical support to a group of assigned Yardi clients in order to manage business operations and financial accounting functions in Yardi’s Voyager software.
Responsibilities

Implements the Yardi suite of software products by assisting clients with system implementation, training, and technical support
Researches, analyzes and resolves software issues
Supports software product customization based on client requirements
Performs data mapping and conversions
Performs system and business process reviews and other service reviews and makes recommendations on best practices
Works on a regular basis with Yardi internal resource teams to include: training, conversion, sales and development

Requirements

Bachelor’s degree in Economics, Business, Math, Statistics or Information Management preferred
Experience setting and managing client expectations
Superior verbal and written communication skills
Project Management, Accounting, or Property Management experience/background
Solid Proficiency in MS Office Suite and Outlook
Knowledge in three of the following areas: Property Management, Accounting, Microsoft Windows, Technical Support, SQL, HTML/ASP
Prior experience with property management software or real estate software highly desirable
Prior experience with Yardi software highly desirable
Regular attendance and a regular work schedule is an essential function of this job.

Senior Regulatory Affairs Specialist  (85569-a) - Richardson, TX - Inogen, Inc. Jobs








 














Home
Jobs




Senior Regulatory Affairs Specialist  (85569-a) - Richardson, TX

Toggle navigation








Senior Regulatory Affairs Specialist  (85569-a) 

JobsLogin 












 RA/QA Richardson, TX, USA Full Time 



Email Me Similar Jobs Email Me This Job



ABOUT INOGEN Inogen was founded in 2001 to improve quality of life and increase freedom and independence for oxygen therapy users. Inogen is innovation in oxygen therapy. The Inogen mission is to improve freedom and independence for oxygen therapy patients through innovative products and services. Inogen is a manufacturer and Accredited Homecare Provider.
Inogen is focused on quality care, continuous improvement, and outstanding customer satisfaction. We are a stable, USA based company dedicated to providing an exciting and rewarding career to our employees. We completed a successful Initial Public Offering on the NASDAQ in 2014 and have demonstrated substantial growth over the last five years. Our work environment is casual yet high performing, and we are looking for seriously talented, motivated, and fast-paced professionals to join our team.
JOB DESCRIPTION 
The Regulatory Affairs Specialist has responsibility for ensuring organizational compliance with quality and regulatory standards for both product and company operations. The position is responsible for supporting the Quality Management System and for ensuring product design efforts are in step with business objectives and applicable government directives.
Key Competencies:
Assist in compiling, submitting, and monitoring reports and responses to regulatory authorities. 
Support regulatory agency inspections and external audits.
Support Operations reporting and trending.
Support the Internal Audit Program as an internal auditor.
Support the Supplier Auditor Program as a supplier auditor, as required.
Provide support in company-wide Quality Management System training activities and provide regulatory expertise, as needed.
Support the Corrective and Preventive Action (CAPA) Program.
Support Kaizen initiatives to introduce improvements throughout the Quality Management System (QMS), as Regulatory Affairs department representative.
Participate in product development activities, including evaluating and advising personnel on regulatory impact throughout product lifecycle stages, ensuring that regulatory standards are understood, that a design control system is in place, that design validation activities are conducted, and that a Design History File (DHF) is maintained to support regulatory submissions.
Participate in transfer of approved product design to Manufacturing to meet market introduction and other key milestone target dates, ensuring that a Device Master Record is in place (specifications, bill of materials, drawings, material specifications, labeling, etc.). 
Participate in the development of manufacturing and inspection/ test procedures, including required validations for final product release.
Participate in change control activities, such as design changes, manufacturing improvements, new supplier introductions, cost reduction initiatives, etc., ensuring that regulatory standards are understood.
Support the external standards management process by ensuring changes to standards and new standards introduced are understood and integrated into device design proactively.
Support post market surveillance (PMS) activities, including customer complaints/ adverse medical event reporting systems, clinical evaluation reports, etc.
Support key business relationships by providing regulatory expertise specific to contract manufacturing, private labeling arrangements, etc.
Assist in obtaining all necessary domestic regulatory registrations, product clearances/ approvals, certifications and in maintaining documentation needed to support ISO, FDA, compliance, allowing for the sale of Inogen products in US, as determined by business objectives, as assigned.
Provide support to the Environmental Management System (ISO 14001).
Maintain regular and punctual attendance. 
Comply with all company policies and procedures. 
Assist with any other duties as assigned.
 
Do you possess these abilities?
Knowledge of ISO 13485, ISO 14971 and FDA regulations.
Knowledge of DMEPOS accreditation requirements.
Experience with DMEPOS/CMS.
Knowledge of ISO 14001.
Experience in Regulatory Affairs and at least one (1) of the following: product development, manufacturing engineering, quality assurance, or production management.
Ability to support external/ internal audits.
Attention to detail and process improvement capabilities.
Excellent skills with database systems and Excel with capability to compile data from various sources to produce useful reports for trending and verifying process improvements.
Familiarity with process improvement concepts (i.e. LEAN Six Sigma).
 
Requirements:
Able to execute at a task + project level independently, able to make decisions independently, and sign-off on in most instances on behalf of Regulatory/QMS function.
Minimal supervision required.
Able to provide Regulatory/QMS support on wide array of Regulatory/QMS related topics.
May be able to mentor/train junior staff members.
May supervise/manage direct reports, as assigned.
Able to lead 3rd party audits and represent Inogen during these audits.
Bachelor's in a Technical Discipline, required.
Master's in Technical Discipline, preferred.
5-7 years of experience, including 3-5 years' experience with class II medical devices, required.
ISO 13485:2016 Lead Auditor Certification and/or ASQ CQA, and/or ASQ CBA, required.
Knowledge of US medical device regulatory requirements. 
Regulatory Affairs Certificate (RAC), preferred. 
A combination of training, education and experience that is equivalent to the qualifications listed above and that provides the required knowledge, skills, and abilities.
WHY INOGEN Inogen is a dynamic company that is not only focused on quality care of patients, but is also committed to being a top employer.  Each of Inogen' s offices have a casual culture that supports employees being responsible and developing professionals.
We offer competitive salaries and a robust benefit package:
Employee Stock Purchase Plan 401 (K) plan available for all employees Health, dental, vision insurance Flexible spending accounts and wellness discount program Life Insurance Long Term Disability Robust paid time off and 8 paid holidays Employee Assistance Program
See the Inogen Team in action:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dKoTMeJf5J4
 
Inogen Where we go to work hard to positively impact people's lives
 
Inogen is an equal opportunity employer.  We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other legally protected characteristics. The EEO is the Law poster and its supplement are available here: http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/ofccpost.htm; http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/OFCCP_EEO_Supplement_Final_JRF_QA_508c.pdf.  The pay transparency policy is available here: http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/pdf/EO13665_PrescribedNondiscriminationPostingLanguage_JRFQA508c.pdf. 
Inogen is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities.  If you need a reasonable accommodation because of a disability for any part of the employment process, please send an e-mail to recruiting@inogen.net or call (972) 616-5668 and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information.
 
 

Inogen, Inc.

If you’re ready to take on a fresh challenge, grow your career and contribute to making the world a safer place, Raytheon is ready to help you achieve your goals. Join our team and get the opportunity and support to find purpose, thrive and succeed.

Software Integration and Test (SWIT) Lead
Silver Spring, Maryland


Apply





Overview
Responsibilities
Success Profile
Rewards
Trending




Overview

What does it take to make the world a safer place? It takes delivering innovative technology and collaborating with some of the finest talent in the engineering field. Whether you’re a software engineer or a mechanical engineer, at Raytheon you’ll grow a varied and rewarding career. And you’ll be supported with a comprehensive and competitive benefits package that promotes work/life. If you’re ready to take on today’s big challenges, discover a world of opportunity at Raytheon.

America’s Best Large Employers by Forbes
Career & Development Opportunities
Full-time
Entry, Mid, Senior level




Back to Job Navigation (Overview)


Responsibilities


The Advanced Weather Interactive Processing System (AWIPS) is central to the ability of the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration’s (NOAA) National Weather Service (NWS) to predict weather, water, and climate conditions. AWIPS provides NWS with the means to integrate meteorological and hydrological data into a single computer workstation. It draws data from an array of weather sensors, satellites, and numerical forecast guidance, processes and distributes the data to the 122 Weather Forecast Offices, 13 River Forecast Centers, and more than 20 environmental centers nationwide, and dispenses rapid, highly reliable warnings and forecasts of weather events that affect the United States, its territories, or adjacent waters.The Raytheon AWIPS Program is searching for a Software Integration and Test (SWIT) lead to support the program's System Development Life Cycle (SDLC) group performing Operations & Maintenance for the National Weather Service. Join a top performing and motivated team and help support one of the most important systems, which assists in the protection of life, property and the enhancement of the national economy.  As the successful candidate you will be responsible for leading SWIT activities on the program.  This includes the management and evolution of established testing policies and processes through retrospectives and/or lessons learned and to stay in alignment with current ISO 20001 certification.  You will lead a team of testers who are responsible for all aspects of testing software releases and patches before they reach production status.  You will work closely with the Release team to level resources across multiple parallel testing activities, provide inputs into daily scrums, develop test plans and maintain our test repository.  We will also look to you to drive innovation in our testing approach, constantly considering new tools and process around automation and test efficiency.   You will be responsible for customer facing communication on test status, plans and approach.Clearance Requirement: Ability to obtain a public trust clearance. Required Education: Degree in Science, Technology, Engineering or Mathematics (STEM) and minimum of 6 years of prior relevant professional experienceRequired Skills:At least 6 years of experience in testing within a multi-component enterprise system.  Experience acting in a lead role of a team of test engineers, specifically demonstrating the ability to own an area of responsibility, take initiative to drive team performance and process improvements and provide customer focused services in the area of integration and test. Experience in requirements management.Strong understanding of standard SDLC processes.Experience with test automation methodology and tools.Desired Skills:Software development experience is a plus.Strong written and verbal communication skills.Familiarity with one or more of the following tools:  Redmine, Test Rail, and QF Test.Experience working  within an rpm based Linux distribution (e.g. Red Hat, CentOS, Fedora)Experience maintaining and updating technical documentation.Knowledge of systems engineering and integration tools. SCRUM Master Certification or experience.  AWIPS knowledge or experience. Ability to troubleshoot issues encountered when running programs in a Linux environment.SCRUM Master Certification or experience.  AWIPS knowledge or experience. Ability to troubleshoot issues encountered when running programs in a Linux environment.Required Education:Degree in Science, Technology, Engineering or Mathematics (STEM) and minimum of 6 years of prior relevant experienceThis position requires either a U.S. Person or a Non-U.S. Person who is eligible to obtain any required Export Authorization. 147466
Business Unit Profile
                        
                        Raytheon Intelligence, Information and Services delivers innovative technology to make the world a safer place. Our expertise in cyber, analytics and automation allow us to reach beyond what others think is possible to underpin national security and give our global customers unique solutions to solve the most pressing modern challenges -- from the cyber domain to automated operations, and from intelligent transportation and training solutions to creating clear insight from large volumes of data. IIS operates at nearly 550 sites in 80 countries, and is headquartered in Dulles, Virginia. The business area generated $6.2 billion in 2018 revenues. As a global business, our leaders must have the ability to understand, embrace and operate in a multicultural world -- in the marketplace and the workplace. We strive to hire people who reflect our communities and embrace diversity and inclusion to advance our culture, develop our employees, and grow our business.
Relocation Eligible

Quote



Felicia Jackson is regional vice president of RAYVETS, Raytheon's employee group for veterans and those who support them. After 24 years in the Air Force, she started a new career at Raytheon. "I wanted to go where people would support me," she told us.









Rewards




401(k) / Retirement Plans
Employer Matching, if you elect to enroll company matches up to 3%.



Work / Life Balance
Raytheon supports a variety of flexible work arrangements including compressed work weeks, flextime, job sharing, 9/80, reduced hours and telecommuting.



Career Development
At Raytheon, we foster an inclusive culture of professional development. We support a variety of developmental opportunities including: Mentoring programs, Skills Development, Leadership Development, Rotational job assignments, and Continuous Improvement, all of which contribute to advancement of our employee’s capabilities.



Paid Time Off
Accrue paid time off monthly. Receive 10-12 holidays per year with some locations shutting down the week between Christmas and New Year’s Day.



Relocation Assistance
Select technical positions are eligible for relocation packages. See specific job description for eligibility requirements.



Parental Leave
Raytheon offers all eligible employees up to three weeks paid parental leave for the birth or adoption of a child (separate from paid maternity leave or Family & Medical Leave Act).

            Software Development Engineer I



         Login to apply
    
















Software Development Engineer I
Waltham, MA 


In response to continued demand for our services, Yardi Resident Screening is looking for a Software Development Engineer to join our team in Waltham, MA.  Reporting to the Director of Information Technology, you will be a core member of our software development team.   You will leverage your analytical problem solving skills to support and enhance our Linux and web based systems utilizing your solid Java programming skills, database skills and knowledge of open source tools. 
Responsibilities

Perform development tasks including programming, unit testing, and database design.
Contribute to integration and general system regression testing.
Participate on installs and provide on-going production support.

Requirements

BS or MS Degree in Computer Science, Systems Engineering or related field.
2+ years’ experience in Software Development.
Interest to contribute to systems architectural improvements.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills as well as being a team player.
1+ years of experience working on multi-tiered web application architecture.
1+ years supporting and developing production systems using Linux, Java, XML , JAXB, JSP, JavaScript, JQuery, Tomcat, web services.
Good relational databases skill using PostgreSQL or Oracle with JDBC, SQL, Hibernate.
Experience with Eclipse IDE and use of source repositories.
Experience with 3rd Party API Integration (web services,…)
Solid object oriented skills and conceptual understanding.
Understanding of the product development lifecycle through design, development, testing, rollout, and support.
Ability to understand and document business requirements.
Ability to work with multi-site and off-shore development teams.
Availability for occasional night, weekend, and holiday work assignments.

*sa        



         Login to apply

Privacy Overview

You can adjust all of your cookie settings by navigating the tabs on the left hand side.

If you’re ready to take on a fresh challenge, grow your career and contribute to making the world a safer place, Raytheon is ready to help you achieve your goals. Join our team and get the opportunity and support to find purpose, thrive and succeed.





Notice: Please be aware of suspicious recruiting emails and text messages that attempt to collect your confidential information. Raytheon conducts all electronic correspondence using e-mail addresses that end in “Raytheon.com”, “Raytheon.co.uk”, “Raytheon.com.au” or “brassring.com”. To report fraud please go to: https://www.ic3.gov.











Sr Software Integration Systems Engineer II
Aurora, Colorado

Overview

Raytheon delivers innovative technology to make the world a safer place. Our expertise in cyber, analytics and automation allow us to reach beyond what others think is possible to underpin national security and give our global customers unique solutions to solve the most pressing modern challenges -- from the cyber domain to automated operations, and from intelligent transportation solutions to creating clear insight from large volumes of data. Our leaders must have the ability to understand, embrace and operate in a multicultural world -- in the marketplace and the workplace. We strive to hire people who reflect our communities and embrace diversity and inclusion to advance our culture, develop our employees, and grow our business.

Full-time
Entry to Senior level

Glassdoor 2017 Best Places to Interview: Candidate's Choice

Rewards




401(k) / Retirement Plans
Employer Matching, if you elect to enroll company matches up to 3%.



Work / Life Balance
Raytheon appreciates work/life balance. Employees can work 9 hours a day every week and received every other Friday off, as long as departmental/manager approval is obtained. Accrued paid time off monthly and paid holiday time.



Career Development
At Raytheon, we foster an inclusive culture of professional development. We support a variety of developmental opportunities including: Mentoring programs, Skills Development, Leadership Development, Rotational job assignments, and Continuous Improvement, all of which contribute to advancement of our employee’s capabilities.



Paid Time Off
Accrue paid time off monthly. Receive 12 holidays per year including the week between Christmas and New Year’s Day.



Relocation Assistance
Select technical positions are eligible for relocation packages. See specific job description for eligibility requirements.



Parental Leave
Raytheon offers all eligible employees up to three weeks paid parental leave for the birth or adoption of a child (separate from paid maternity leave or Family & Medical Leave Act).



Back to Job Navigation (Rewards)



Responsibilities


Would you like to work in a collaborative environment at a state of the art facility in Colorado? Then join our Raytheon team of engineers solving problems that make the world a safer place and help to secure our great nation! Come support those who provide us with all the freedoms we enjoy.Our facility in Aurora, CO offers amenities that create work and life balance. On site we have a 24/7 fitness facility, health center, cafeteria, collaboration rooms and dynamic break areas for easy conversation and socialization. Additionally, employee appreciation lunches, bonus opportunities, and great benefits that include medical, dental, vision, 401K match, flexible work schedule - just to name a few.  Click here to view a brief video and learn more: https://youtu.be/YNuZN0vyzHgRaytheon is seeking a Software Integration Systems Engineer for programs in our C2, Space and Intelligence Solutions mission area in Aurora, Colorado.As a Software Integration Systems Engineer,your duties will include but not be limited to the following: Support the planning and conduct of integration activities; defining integration plans and sequences relative to complex software and hardware subsystems and resolve conflicting issues.  Participate in a complex integration program; establish methods and techniques, write integration procedures and reports, and conduct integration utilizing comprehensive knowledge of complex subsystems. Participate in integration and test readiness reviews, design reviews, and audits of integration and test programs and facilities. Utilize broad knowledge in integration engineering and apply understanding of principles of related engineering and software technology. Required Skills: Current SECRET clearance.6+ years demonstrated engineering experience with proven track record.Integration engineering experience on a software development contractExperience preparing and executing Integration proceduresExperience with test script or automation developmentEnthusiastic & energetic performer able to work in a dynamic, fast-paced, & high visibility environmentSelf-motivated and capable of performing tasks with minimal oversightExperience with systems engineering principles and activitiesDesired Skills: Current SSBI, or active TS/SCI security clearanceExperience working in a Satellite Ground System development or operations environmentExperience with ground station satellite domains (command and telemetry, flight dynamics or mission planning)Scripting (Python, Perl, CECIL)Experience in an Agile or DevOps development environment.Proficiency with Windows and Linux operating systemExperience with Java or C++Education Requirements: B.S./M.S./PhD in a STEM degree.  Aerospace Engineering, Systems Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, Mechanical Engineering, Physics, Math or other STEM degree.  This position requires either a U.S. Person or a Non-U.S. Person who is eligible to obtain any required Export Authorization. 148988
                

                    
                 
                           Raytheon is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, age, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected Veteran status.

Search Engine Marketing (SEM) Specialist  (85223) - Goleta, CA - Inogen, Inc. Jobs
