Jobs




Search Engine Marketing (SEM) Specialist  (85223) - Goleta, CA

Toggle navigation








Search Engine Marketing (SEM) Specialist  (85223) 

JobsLogin 












 Marketing Goleta, CA, USA Full Time 



Email Me Similar Jobs Email Me This Job



ABOUT INOGEN Inogen was founded in 2001 to improve quality of life and increase freedom and independence for oxygen therapy users. Inogen is innovation in oxygen therapy. The Inogen mission is to improve freedom and independence for oxygen therapy patients through innovative products and services. Inogen is a manufacturer and Accredited Homecare Provider.
Inogen is focused on quality care, continuous improvement, and outstanding customer satisfaction. We are a stable, USA based company dedicated to providing an exciting and rewarding career to our employees. We completed a successful Initial Public Offering on the NASDAQ in 2014 and have demonstrated substantial growth over the last five years. Our work environment is casual yet high performing, and we are looking for seriously talented, motivated, and fast-paced professionals to join our team.
JOB DESCRIPTION 
End-to-end management of Search Engine Marketing (SEM/PPC) programs for Inogen.com and other proprietary web properties. Charged with achieving lead targets on finite monthly/quarterly budgets and maximizing overall sales and revenue return and ROI of SEM programs. Accountable for management of budgets for SEM. Ongoing reporting and analysis of granular and macro-level events as they pertain to paid search or the digital marketing discipline in any way relevant to Inogen's ongoing consumer and business-to-business lines of business. 
Key Competencies:
Search Engine Marketing (SEM) program management and oversight
SEM reporting; report building, maintenance, expansion and delivery to senior marketing staff
Keyword analysis, keyword building, negative keyword additions
Ad copy writing, ad copy testing, partner/reseller/competitive landscape ad copy monitoring
Landing page wireframe design and testing. A/B/C testing, multivariate testing of copy and landing page combinations 
Overall SEM account maintenance and continuous improvement
Do you possess these abilities?
Quant background, analytically oriented
Spreadsheet aptitude, specifically MS Excel
MS SQL knowledge or training and/or applied experience
Solid understanding of digital marketing in general
Working knowledge and at a minimum intermediate level skill in Google Adwords, Bing Ads, Yahoo! Gemini paid search platforms
Exposure and working knowledge of Google Analytics
Requirements:
Bachelor Degree from an accredited 4-year institution in a related field (e.g. Business, Economics, Finance, Accounting, Marketing, Mathematics, etc.)
6 months to 2 years of experience managing or working on SEM campaigns
 
WHY INOGEN Inogen is a dynamic company that is not only focused on quality care of patients, but is also committed to being a top employer.  Each of Inogen' s offices have a casual culture that supports employees being responsible and developing professionals.
We offer competitive salaries and a robust benefit package:
Employee Stock Purchase Plan 401 (K) plan available for all employees Health, dental, vision insurance Flexible spending accounts and wellness discount program Life Insurance Long Term Disability Robust paid time off and 8 paid holidays Employee Assistance Program
See the Inogen Team in action:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dKoTMeJf5J4
 
Inogen Where we go to work hard to positively impact people's lives
 
Inogen is an equal opportunity employer.  We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other legally protected characteristics. The EEO is the Law poster and its supplement are available here: http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/ofccpost.htm; http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/OFCCP_EEO_Supplement_Final_JRF_QA_508c.pdf.  The pay transparency policy is available here: http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/pdf/EO13665_PrescribedNondiscriminationPostingLanguage_JRFQA508c.pdf. 
Inogen is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities.  If you need a reasonable accommodation because of a disability for any part of the employment process, please send an e-mail to recruiting@inogen.net or call (972) 616-5668 and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information.
 
 

Inogen, Inc.

            Account Executive



         Login to apply
    
















Account Executive
Austin, TX 


          We are looking for an Account Executive to create and nurture long-term relationships with Commercial Brokerages and Commercial Real Estate Industry Principals. You will identify, contact, and meet with key contacts in the Commercial Real Estate community to create awareness and sell Yardi Commercial Broker Products. You will drive adoption and promote Commercial Café and any corresponding commercial broker tools. You will discover and help resolve any issues that arise to ensure customers are satisfied with our services.
In this role, you should be an excellent communicator who is able to grasp customer needs and brainstorm ways to fulfill them. Your goal will be to help us build relationships with commercial brokers, safeguard our revenue, and retain our customers while introducing them to new Yardi Commercial Broker tools.
Responsibilities

Build relationships with key employees among customers
Identify new potential customers and schedule sales meetings
Advise clients on how to maximize use of Yardi Commercial tools
Schedule regular meetings with customers to ensure they are satisfied
Act as point of contact for complaints and escalate issues as appropriate
Help sales team up-sell or cross-sell services and products
Study competition to find new ways to retain customers
Collaborate with internal teams (e.g. sales, development, senior management) to address customers’ needs

Requirements

Proven track record of meeting and exceeding targets
2+ years of relevant sales experience; Commercial Brokerage industry knowledge is a plus
A customer-oriented attitude
Excellent communication and negotiation skills
Problem-solving aptitude
Ability to work well with a team
BS/BA in Business Administration, Marketing or a related field

*ft

By continuing to browse this site you agree to our use of cookies. You can find out more about which cookies we are using or switch them off in settings.
 

 
Accept

 


















 

 Privacy Overview


 Strictly Necessary Cookies


 3rd Party Cookies




 








Privacy Overview

This website uses cookies so that we can provide you with the best user experience possible. Cookie information is stored in your browser and performs functions such as recognising you when you return to our website and helping our team to understand which sections of the website you find most interesting and useful.
You can adjust all of your cookie settings by navigating the tabs on the left hand side.



 
Strictly Necessary Cookies

Strictly necessary cookies must be enabled at all times in order to login and apply to openings.



disable









If you disable this cookie, we will not be able to save your preferences and you will not be able to login to apply for openings. This means that every time you visit this website you will need to enable or disable cookies again.







3rd Party Cookies

This website uses Google Analytics to collect anonymous information such as the number of visitors to the site, and the most popular pages.
Keeping this cookie enabled helps us to improve our website.



disable









Please enable Strictly Necessary Cookies first so that we can save your preferences!












Enable All
Save Changes

If you’re ready to take on a fresh challenge, grow your career and contribute to making the world a safer place, Raytheon is ready to help you achieve your goals. Join our team and get the opportunity and support to find purpose, thrive and succeed.





Notice: Please be aware of suspicious recruiting emails and text messages that attempt to collect your confidential information. Raytheon conducts all electronic correspondence using e-mail addresses that end in “Raytheon.com”, “Raytheon.co.uk”, “Raytheon.com.au” or “brassring.com”. Software Engineer II - JAVA (with security clearance)
Apply
Requisition ID 136144BR Date updated 03/18/2019
U.S. Citizenship status is required as this position needs an active U.S. Security Clearance as of day one of employment.Raytheon BBN Technologies is one of Raytheon’s premier research and development centers. Our diverse research portfolio combines the best technologies to deliver innovative, custom solutions with real-world benefit.Located in Arlington, VA, our Information Exploitation group is seeking a Staff Scientist with software research interests.  Our world-class team works with a broad range of Government agencies to solve problems that are both technically challenging and have a real operational impact. The ideal candidate will have strong experience in Java development with some experience or interest in machine reasoning, semantic web technologies, data analytics, or artificial intelligence technologies.Our research work applies the above technologies to build both prototype and real operational systems.  You will be working on challenging problems including:• Producing sophisticated software in a fast-paced agile environment;• Developing mission-critical applications for deployment into global enterprise operations;• Optimizing software for knowledge representation, storage, and query systems for high performance.• Designing novel machine reasoning and learning algorithms and solutions to complex, open-ended intelligence problems.Required Education and Experience:• BS in Computer Science or equivalent discipline and 2 years of experience; or MS in Computer Science or equivalent discipline and 0 years of experience.• Proficiency in Java and the Java-based development ecosystem.• Current DoD or IC Top Secret security clearance with SSBI.  US citizenship is requiredDesired Skills and Education:• 2-3 years of related research experience in one of the technical areas mentioned above.• Experience with Web application development.• Familiarity with modern software configuration management tools such as Docker, Gradle, Ivy, etc.• TS/SCI is highly desired 136144
Business Unit Profile
Raytheon Space and Airborne Systems (SAS) builds radars and other sensors for aircraft, spacecraft and ships. The business also provides communications and electronic warfare solutions and performs research in areas ranging from linguistics to quantum computing. SAS is headquartered in McKinney, Texas USA. As a global business, our leaders must have the ability to understand, embrace and operate in a multicultural world -- in the marketplace and the workplace. We strive to hire people who reflect our communities and embrace diversity and inclusion to advance our culture, develop our employees, and grow our business.Raytheon is headquartered in Waltham, Massachusetts. Follow us on Twitter.

Relocation Eligible 
            Yes

Clearance Type 
            Top Secret - Current

Expertise 
 
              Artificial IntelligenceComputer ScienceData ScienceMachine LearningResearch & Development
                
            

Type Of Job 
            Full Time


Work Location 
 
              MN - St. Louis ParkVA - DullesVA - Rosslyn

Related Content




Work on interesting projects and enjoy plenty of recognition
Whether you’re just starting out on your career journey or a experienced professional, it’s important that you feel recognized and rewarded for your contributions.
Raytheon is proud to offer a comprehensive and competitive benefits package to you, your spouse and your eligible children. In addition to protecting you and your family's health and well-being, we offer important income and work/life benefits to meet your needs. Learn More





Turn unique thinking into one-of-a-kind solutions
Diversity. Every company likes to talk about it, but few have embraced it with quite the same commitment as we have here at Raytheon. As a result, diversity has become a competitive imperative and an integral part of our business model, particularly as we continue to grow internationally. Learn More








Work as one to make a difference to millions
Here at Raytheon, we innovate across all domains: from land and sea to air, space, and cyberspace.It’s innovation made possible by a strong internal culture and a vision that’s shared by Raytheon employees across the globe – a vision of one global team creating trusted, innovative solutions to make the world a safer place.             Associate Technical Account Manager



         Login to apply
    
















Associate Technical Account Manager
Santa Barbara, CA 


Associate Technical Account Managers at Yardi will provide consultative, implementation and technical support to a group of assigned Yardi clients in order to manage business operations and financial accounting functions in Yardi’s Voyager software.
Responsibilities

Implements the Yardi suite of software products by assisting clients with system implementation, training, and technical support
Researches, analyzes and resolves software issues
Supports software product customization based on client requirements
Performs data mapping and conversions
Performs system and business process reviews and other service reviews and makes recommendations on best practices
Works on a regular basis with Yardi internal resource teams to include: training, conversion, sales and development

Requirements

Bachelor’s degree in Economics, Business, Math, Statistics or Information Management preferred
Experience setting and managing client expectations
Superior verbal and written communication skills
Project Management, Accounting, or Property Management experience/background
Solid Proficiency in MS Office Suite and Outlook
Knowledge in three of the following areas: Property Management, Accounting, Microsoft Windows, Technical Support, SQL, HTML/ASP
Prior experience with property management software or real estate software highly desirable
Prior experience with Yardi software highly desirable
Regular attendance and a regular work schedule is an essential function of this job.

By continuing to browse this site you agree to our use of cookies. You can find out more about which cookies we are using or switch them off in settings.

 Privacy Overview


 Strictly Necessary Cookies


 3rd Party Cookies




 








Privacy Overview

This website uses cookies so that we can provide you with the best user experience possible. Cookie information is stored in your browser and performs functions such as recognising you when you return to our website and helping our team to understand which sections of the website you find most interesting and useful.
You can adjust all of your cookie settings by navigating the tabs on the left hand side.



 
Strictly Necessary Cookies

Strictly necessary cookies must be enabled at all times in order to login and apply to openings.



disable









If you disable this cookie, we will not be able to save your preferences and you will not be able to login to apply for openings. This means that every time you visit this website you will need to enable or disable cookies again.







3rd Party Cookies

This website uses Google Analytics to collect anonymous information such as the number of visitors to the site, and the most popular pages.
Keeping this cookie enabled helps us to improve our website.



disable









Please enable Strictly Necessary Cookies first so that we can save your preferences!

            Field Technician



         Login to apply
    
















Field Technician
Remote  


Yardi’s Energy business unit supports the energy initiatives of our real estate clients with solutions for utility billing, energy management and submeter data administration. The Field Technician will travel throughout Texas state, and possibly beyond, to perform maintenance and installation of water and gas meters, as well as automated meter reading systems, at various client properties throughout Texas. The Field Technician will ensure that projects are completed accurately and in a timely manner. This position will normally work independently, but with the support of an extensive network of resources and assistance, including an initial training period of 2-4 weeks.
Responsibilities 

Establish and ensure compliance with quality control standards for installation, maintenance, monitoring of remote dial-up systems, reading assessments, and meter reading.
Ensure compliance with OSHA regulations during installation/maintenance operations (i.e. ensure use of hard-hats and steel toed boots always while on new construction job sites, etc.).
Oversee and perform system installations and maintenance.
Keep job folder/files on each project with all the appropriate documentation.
Review installation and maintenance reports and documentation relevant to the project: scope of work, site plans, and meter health audits, work orders, etc.
Adhere to installations schedules pre-determined and set forth by your Coordinator, the client, and available resources (product and labor).
Ensure all devices are operating properly prior to leaving the job site.
Submit to your Coordinator complete and updated documentation corresponding to each maintenance and installation performed. All paperwork to be submitted at the end of each day on work completed.
Maintenance and installation documentation to include but not limited to: Building Installation Details (BID), Completed MWO, Inventory Logs, Placed in Service Notices (PISN), Time Record Sheet (TRS), AMR system programming files, etc.
Perform property surveys for new sales opportunities and/ or where installation was performed by a company other than Yardi Systems Inc.
Ensure all survey documentation is complete and submitted accordingly.
Prepare and submit recommendations and scope of work as applicable for site surveys performed. Assist in obtaining subcontractor quotes and permit fees information as applicable
Maintain accurate inventory records and submit documentation for inventory movements/activity
Comply with all company policies, procedures, and standardized processes.
Train peers as necessary or directed by Team Coordinator/Field Supervisor/Management
Participate in scheduled training activities and company meetings as directed.
Maintaining and completing weekly company expense report(s).
Perform all other tasks as assigned for the successful operation of the region.

Requirements 

High school Diploma or G.E.D. with a minimum of 3 years Technical/ trades experience
Knowledge of metering and experience with the various major AMR technologies preferred
PC literate (MS Office, Word, Excel).
Site Supervisor skills preferred.
Valid driver’s license and availability for extensive overnight travel within and outside account territory during normal work week.
Experience in plumbing or electrical work preferred
Must take all required safety courses as identified by the company.
Work up to 10 hours of overtime a week if necessary. Over time must be pre-approved by Supervisor.
The ability to work in a dynamic environment, with a flexible schedule with up to 100% travel
Ability to lift up to 50 Pounds

*ad        



         Login to apply

Parts Repair Technician I - 2nd Shift  (92605) - Richardson, TX - Inogen, Inc. Jobs








 














Home
Jobs




Parts Repair Technician I - 2nd Shift  (92605) - Richardson, TX

Toggle navigation








Parts Repair Technician I - 2nd Shift  (92605) 

JobsLogin 












 Operations Richardson, TX, USA Full Time 



Email Me Similar Jobs Email Me This Job



ABOUT INOGEN Inogen was founded in 2001 to improve quality of life and increase freedom and independence for oxygen therapy users. Inogen is innovation in oxygen therapy. The Inogen mission is to improve freedom and independence for oxygen therapy patients through innovative products and services. Inogen is a manufacturer and Accredited Homecare Provider.
Inogen is focused on quality care, continuous improvement, and outstanding customer satisfaction. We are a stable, USA based company dedicated to providing an exciting and rewarding career to our employees. We completed a successful Initial Public Offering on the NASDAQ in 2014 and have demonstrated substantial growth over the last five years. Our work environment is casual yet high performing, and we are looking for seriously talented, motivated, and fast-paced professionals to join our team.
 
JOB DESCRIPTION 
Performs one or more of the job duties associated with the testing, troubleshooting and failure analysis of oxygen concentrator products.
Key Competencies:
Performs mechanical part repairs or replacements from test procedures and engineering specifications.
Provides feedback on continuous improvement opportunities.
Maintains records on work performed, analyzes data collected and reports results (metrics).
Removes, replaces and assembles parts and/or assemblies as required.
Performs necessary touch up and cleaning of deliverable hardware.
Monitors consumables required to support test activities.
Maintains inventory of tooling and equipment.
Performs preventative maintenance on assembly and test equipment as necessary.
Takes repair instructions from both management and non-management personnel.
Assists in materials tracking.
Do you possess these abilities?
Knowledge of mechanical and electrical concepts (including familiarity with compressors, product interworking flow charts, basic electricity, and interaction of machine components).
Ability to read and understand written test procedures. 
Knowledge of ESD procedures (including proper care and handling of PC boards).
Strong computer skills (data entry and search skills in MS Word required and Oracle preferred).
Ability to take direction and work orders from senior employees.
ISO 9001 experience preferred.
Requirements:
1+ year mechanical and electrical experience.
Entry level repair position. 
Supervision is required in assisting error diagnosing and part replacement
Required to have basic knowledge of assembly and error diagnosing processes
Performs mechanical part repairs or replacements from test procedures and engineering specifications.
Provides feedback on continuous improvement opportunities.
Maintains records on work performed, analyzes data collected and reports results (metrics).
Removes, replaces and assembles parts and/or assemblies as required.
Performs necessary touch up and cleaning of deliverable hardware.
Monitors consumables required to support test activities.
Maintains inventory of tooling and equipment.
Performs preventative maintenance on assembly and test equipment as necessary.
Takes repair instructions from both management and non-management personnel.
Assists in materials tracking.
Focuses on learning to diagnose and repair one type of Inogen product
Ability to perform all transactions necessary for job and material tracking
Working Conditions:
The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. 
Manufacturing I Assembly Repair environment. The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate.
Some protective equipment may be required (if applicable).
Physical Demands:
The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
While performing the duties of this job, the employee will be sitting and working on a computer part of the time. The employee is frequently required to sit and talk and hear. The employee is occasionally required to walk; use hands to finger, handle, or feel objects, tools, or controls; and reach with hands and arms.
The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 35 pounds.
Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision and the ability to adjust focus.
WHY INOGEN Inogen is a dynamic company that is not only focused on quality care of patients but is also committed to being a top employer.  Each of Inogen' s offices have a casual culture that supports employees being responsible and developing professionals.
We offer competitive salaries and a robust benefit package:
Employee Stock Purchase Plan 401 (K) plan available for all employees Health, dental, vision insurance Flexible spending accounts and wellness discount program Life Insurance Long Term Disability Robust paid time off and 8 paid holidays Employee Assistance Program
See the Inogen Team in action:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dKoTMeJf5J4
 
Inogen Where we go to work hard to positively impact people's lives
 
Inogen is an equal opportunity employer.  We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other legally protected characteristics. The EEO is the Law poster and its supplement are available here: http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/ofccpost.htm; http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/OFCCP_EEO_Supplement_Final_JRF_QA_508c.pdf.  The pay transparency policy is available here: http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/pdf/EO13665_PrescribedNondiscriminationPostingLanguage_JRFQA508c.pdf. 
Inogen is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities.  If you need a reasonable accommodation because of a disability for any part of the employment process, please send an e-mail to recruiting@inogen.net or call (972) 616-5668 and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information.

If you’re ready to take on a fresh challenge, grow your career and contribute to making the world a safer place, Raytheon is ready to help you achieve your goals. Join our team and get the opportunity and support to find purpose, thrive and succeed.





Notice: Please be aware of suspicious recruiting emails and text messages that attempt to collect your confidential information. Raytheon conducts all electronic correspondence using e-mail addresses that end in “Raytheon.com”, “Raytheon.co.uk”, “Raytheon.com.au” or “brassring.com”. To report fraud please go to: https://www.ic3.gov.











Sr Network Engineer I
Dulles, Virginia


Apply





Overview
Responsibilities
Success Profile
Rewards
Trending




Overview

What does it take to make the world a safer place? It takes delivering innovative technology and collaborating with some of the finest talent in the engineering field. Whether you’re a software engineer or a mechanical engineer, at Raytheon you’ll grow a varied and rewarding career. And you’ll be supported with a comprehensive and competitive benefits package that promotes work/life. If you’re ready to take on today’s big challenges, discover a world of opportunity at Raytheon.

America’s Best Large Employers by Forbes
Career & Development Opportunities
Full-time
Entry, Mid, Senior level




Back to Job Navigation (Overview)


Responsibilities


Are you looking for an engineering career that is challenging and satisfying? Then join our Raytheon team of engineers solving problems that make the world a safer place and help to secure our great nation! Come support those who provide us with all the freedoms we enjoy.We offer great benefits that include medical, dental, vision, 401K match, flexible work schedule - just to name a few.  Click here to view a brief video and learn more: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qvbCgKpkEdsRaytheon Intelligence, Information and Services (IIS) delivers innovative technology to make the world a safer place. Our expertise in cyber, analytics and automation allow us to reach beyond what others think is possible to underpin national security and give our global customers unique solutions to solve the most pressing modern challenges -- from the cyber domain to automated operations, and from intelligent transportation solutions to creating clear insight from large volumes of data. IIS operates at nearly 550 sites in 80 countries, including a large presence in Dulles, VA. As a global business, our leaders must have the ability to understand, embrace and operate in a multicultural world -- in the marketplace and the workplace. We strive to hire people who reflect our communities and embrace diversity and inclusion to advance our culture, develop our employees, and grow our business.Job Description:The Raytheon IIS Hardware and Infrastructure Engineering (HW&I) team has a professional opening for a Network Engineer. This position will perform network and infrastructure engineering tasks pertaining to LAN/data center system design, development, implementation, integration, and troubleshooting activities. The qualified individual should possess knowledge and experience with network technologies, services, operations, and security. The ability to obtain a US Government TS/SCI security clearance is required for this position (US citizenship required).This position is eligible for a Sign on Bonus of up to $40k for a candidate with a current verifiable TS/SCI clearance that is hired by Raytheon Required Skills:A Network Engineer who actively designs and troubleshoots corporate or cloud networks and who feeds off the challenge of rolling up their sleeves to tackle meaningful problems each and every day, is a passionate and collaborative problem-solver who seeks and gives candid feedback, and values the chance to make an important impact.At least 4+ years of experience in network design, implementation and administrationUnderstanding of layer 2 technologies: VLAN segmentation, VLAN tagging, 802.1x authenticationUnderstanding of network routing (BGP, OSPF) and switching protocols, Cisco hardware routers and switches, hands on experience with Cisco Nexus switches.Knowledge of TCP/IP,  DNS, IPSec, GRE tunnels, multicasting and traffic balancing techniques.Knowledge of firewalls and client VPNsExperience in building/troubleshooting IPSec tunnels; understanding of IKEv1 vsIKEv2Strong communicator with the ability to work effectively across multiple business and engineering teamsAdjust quickly to changing priorities and make quick decisions with limited informationHigh level of motivation, self-starter, ability to demonstrate effective project management and completion of complex network tasks with little guidanceExcellent time management skillsHighly valued skill sets:Experience in Python/Shell scriptingExperience with cloud technologies like AWSFamiliarity with systems configuration management, orchestration, and infrastructure as code with tools such as Ansible and/or TerraformCisco Unified Call ManagerSolar Winds suite of management productsMulticast & QoS protocolsEducation: Requires a degree in Science, Technology, Engineering or Mathematics (STEM) and 4 years of related work experience. 150823
Business Unit Profile
                        
                        Raytheon Intelligence, Information and Services delivers innovative technology to make the world a safer place. Our expertise in cyber, analytics and automation allow us to reach beyond what others think is possible to underpin national security and give our global customers unique solutions to solve the most pressing modern challenges -- from the cyber domain to automated operations, and from intelligent transportation and training solutions to creating clear insight from large volumes of data. IIS operates at nearly 550 sites in 80 countries, and is headquartered in Dulles, Virginia. The business area generated $6.2 billion in 2018 revenues. As a global business, our leaders must have the ability to understand, embrace and operate in a multicultural world -- in the marketplace and the workplace. We strive to hire people who reflect our communities and embrace diversity and inclusion to advance our culture, develop our employees, and grow our business.
Relocation Eligible 
                        
                        Yes
Clearance Type 
                        
                        TS/SCI
Expertise 
                        

                                
                            AlgorithmsArtificial IntelligenceComputer EngineeringComputer ScienceComputer/Management Information SystemsCyber JobsData NetworkingData ScienceEngineering TechnologyGeneral EngineeringHardware EngineeringInformation and Knowledge SystemsNetwork Communications ResearchReliability EngineerSoftware EngineeringSystems EngineeringTechnicalTest Engineering

                            VA - Dulles
                        
Raytheon is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, age, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected Veteran status.

Back to Job Navigation (Success)


Quote



Felicia Jackson is regional vice president of RAYVETS, Raytheon's employee group for veterans and those who support them. After 24 years in the Air Force, she started a new career at Raytheon. "I wanted to go where people would support me," she told us.









Rewards




401(k) / Retirement Plans
Employer Matching, if you elect to enroll company matches up to 3%.



Work / Life Balance
Raytheon supports a variety of flexible work arrangements including compressed work weeks, flextime, job sharing, 9/80, reduced hours and telecommuting.



Career Development
At Raytheon, we foster an inclusive culture of professional development. We support a variety of developmental opportunities including: Mentoring programs, Skills Development, Leadership Development, Rotational job assignments, and Continuous Improvement, all of which contribute to advancement of our employee’s capabilities.



Paid Time Off
Accrue paid time off monthly. Receive 10-12 holidays per year with some locations shutting down the week between Christmas and New Year’s Day.



Relocation Assistance
Select technical positions are eligible for relocation packages. See specific job description for eligibility requirements.



Parental Leave
Raytheon offers all eligible employees up to three weeks paid parental leave for the birth or adoption of a child (separate from paid maternity leave or Family & Medical Leave Act).

If you’re ready to take on a fresh challenge, grow your career and contribute to making the world a safer place, Raytheon is ready to help you achieve your goals. Join our team and get the opportunity and support to find purpose, thrive and succeed.





Notice: Please be aware of suspicious recruiting emails and text messages that attempt to collect your confidential information. Raytheon conducts all electronic correspondence using e-mail addresses that end in “Raytheon.com”, “Raytheon.co.uk”, “Raytheon.com.au” or “brassring.com”. To report fraud please go to: https://www.ic3.gov.











Systems-Software Engineer – Cloud Design
State College, Pennsylvania


Apply





Overview
Responsibilities
Success Profile
Rewards
Trending




Overview

What does it take to make the world a safer place? It takes delivering innovative technology and collaborating with some of the finest talent in the engineering field. Whether you’re a software engineer or a mechanical engineer, at Raytheon you’ll grow a varied and rewarding career. And you’ll be supported with a comprehensive and competitive benefits package that promotes work/life. If you’re ready to take on today’s big challenges, discover a world of opportunity at Raytheon.

America’s Best Large Employers by Forbes
Career & Development Opportunities
Full-time
Entry, Mid, Senior level




Back to Job Navigation (Overview)


Responsibilities


National Defense, Cloud Technologies, Agile Development, DevOps, Big Data, Teamwork … Opportunities at Raytheon span the full product development lifecycle, including new capability development as well as sustainment and enhancement of existing deployed systems.Raytheon Intelligence, Information and Services (IIS) in State College, PA is seeking talented Systems-Software Engineers to support classified programs that develop and enhance integrated sensor, signal processing, complex analytics, and big data systems for Intelligence Community customers.  The successful candidate has excellent written and verbal communication skills, works effectively in a team environment, and is flexible & adaptable to respond to customer mission needs.  Come join Raytheon's team of engineers solving problems that make the world a safer place and help to secure our great nation!  Come support those who provide us with all the freedoms we enjoy.  Click here to view a brief video and learn more about Raytheon: https://youtu.be/8B-k34faFAE.About State College, PAState College is a college town, dominated economically and demographically by the presence of the University Park main campus of The Pennsylvania State University, one of the ten largest public universities in the United States. State College provides access to many cultural and athletic activities & events, and yet is only minutes away from rural Pennsylvania country-side. Many Raytheon State College employees enjoy a commute of 15 minutes or less! Click here to view a brief video and learn more about Raytheon State College:  https://youtu.be/f299m09q0FsCompensation & BenefitsWhile benefits may vary based on business unit, location and/or union status, Raytheon employees receive comprehensive benefits as part of a competitive compensation package. Health and wellness plans are available for you and your eligible children. Other benefits include insurance, education assistance, income protection, investment/retirement and work/life programs.Clearance RequirementsThis position requires eligibility to obtain a TS/SCI security clearance.  A current, active TS/SCI or DoD-TS security clearance is highly preferred, and includes a sign-on bonus.   U.S. citizenship is required.This position is eligible for a Sign on Bonus up to $40k for a candidate with a current TS/SCI that can be verified and hired at Raytheon. Required Skills: 6+ years of relevant work experienceFamiliarity with engineering processes and techniquesAbility to work effectively on multi-discipline engineering teamsStrong interpersonal, communications, organization, and planning skillsCommitment to quality customer service and on-schedule task completionsAbility to manage time and resources to meet deadlinesProficiency with Microsoft OfficeAbility to generate technical documentation (DoDAF, ICDs, Test Plans & Procedures, etc.)Experience conducting technical research, documenting and presenting resultsExperience with system-level requirements analysis, system design, trade studies, and/or system integration & verificationExperience with Amazon Web Services (AWS)Knowledge of monitoring, logging and management tools that integrate with AWSExperience with Agile Development and DevOpsFamiliarity with Continuous Integration and Deployment environmentsDesired Skills: Active TS/SCI or DoD-TS security clearanceExperience with software development on Linux platformsExperience with system-level requirements analysis, system design, trade studies, and/or system integration & verificationCoursework and/or experience in Systems Engineering, Software Engineering, Infrastructure Engineering and/or Security Engineering.CompTlA Security+ certificationEducation Requirements: This position requires a 4-year bachelor's degree in Science, Technology, Engineering or Mathematics (STEM).This position requires either a U.S. Person or a Non-U.S. Person who is eligible to obtain any required Export Authorization. 150439
Business Unit Profile
                        
                        Raytheon Intelligence, Information and Services delivers innovative technology to make the world a safer place. Our expertise in cyber, analytics and automation allow us to reach beyond what others think is possible to underpin national security and give our global customers unique solutions to solve the most pressing modern challenges -- from the cyber domain to automated operations, and from intelligent transportation and training solutions to creating clear insight from large volumes of data. IIS operates at nearly 550 sites in 80 countries, and is headquartered in Dulles, Virginia. The business area generated $6.2 billion in 2018 revenues. As a global business, our leaders must have the ability to understand, embrace and operate in a multicultural world -- in the marketplace and the workplace. We strive to hire people who reflect our communities and embrace diversity and inclusion to advance our culture, develop our employees, and grow our business.

Quote



Felicia Jackson is regional vice president of RAYVETS, Raytheon's employee group for veterans and those who support them. After 24 years in the Air Force, she started a new career at Raytheon. "I wanted to go where people would support me," she told us.









Rewards




401(k) / Retirement Plans
Employer Matching, if you elect to enroll company matches up to 3%.



Work / Life Balance
Raytheon supports a variety of flexible work arrangements including compressed work weeks, flextime, job sharing, 9/80, reduced hours and telecommuting.



Career Development
At Raytheon, we foster an inclusive culture of professional development. We support a variety of developmental opportunities including: Mentoring programs, Skills Development, Leadership Development, Rotational job assignments, and Continuous Improvement, all of which contribute to advancement of our employee’s capabilities.



Paid Time Off
Accrue paid time off monthly. Receive 10-12 holidays per year with some locations shutting down the week between Christmas and New Year’s Day.



Relocation Assistance
Select technical positions are eligible for relocation packages. See specific job description for eligibility requirements.



Parental Leave
Raytheon offers all eligible employees up to three weeks paid parental leave for the birth or adoption of a child (separate from paid maternity leave or Family & Medical Leave Act).

Deputy System Engineering Lead
Richardson, Texas


Apply





Overview
Responsibilities
Success Profile
Rewards
Trending




Overview

What does it take to make the world a safer place? It takes delivering innovative technology and collaborating with some of the finest talent in the engineering field. Whether you’re a software engineer or a field engineer, at Raytheon you’ll grow a varied and rewarding career. And you’ll be supported with a comprehensive and competitive benefits package that promotes work/life. If you’re ready to take on today’s big challenges, discover a world of opportunity at Raytheon.

America’s Best Large Employers by Forbes
Career & Development Opportunities
Full-time
Entry, Mid, Senior level




Back to Job Navigation (Overview)


Responsibilities


Would you like to work in a collaborative environment at a state of the art facility in Texas? Then join our Raytheon team of engineers solving problems that make the world a safer place and help to secure our great nation! Come support those who provide us with all the freedoms we enjoy.Our Cityline facility in Richardson, TX has been open a little over 2 years and has many amenities that create work and life balance. On site we have a 24/7 fitness facility, health center, massage therapist, relaxation rooms, cafeteria, learning center, collaboration rooms, fun space that includes foosball and pool tables, and dynamic break areas for easy conversation and socialization. Additionally, employee appreciation lunches, special events (Popcorn Thursdays, bonus opportunities), and great benefits that include: medical, dental, vision, 401K match, and flexible work schedules are just a few of the reasons people come to work at Cityline. Plus there are lots of trendy area restaurants and shopping within blocks of the site along with shuttle service to help you get there!If you have technical knowledge in software engineering and system development (DevOps, Cloud, or Cybersecurity) and the desire to learn and grow in a company with over 60,000 global employees, Raytheon is worth the time to explore.Raytheon Intelligence, Information and Services (IIS) C2 Space and Intelligence Systems (CSI) Business area is currently seeking a Deputy System Engineering Lead (SEL) for the Radiance Program.  The program is following the Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe) methodology for developing their products.  The Deputy SEL needs to be very familiar with agile development, and certification with SAFe is a plus.  They are responsible for leading the SE team to develop and groom the program backlog from customer and customer community inputs.  The Deputy SEL is also the Control Account Manager (CAM) for all system engineering scope on the Radiance Program, and will either be certified with Earned Value or able to become certified in 90 days.Clearance Requirements:Must be a US Citizen with an active TS/SCI clearanceA bonus of "up to" $40,000.00 is offered to hired applicants with Active TS/SCI, or higher, clearancesRequired Skills:• Demonstrated engineering/leadership experience with proven track record• Strong understanding of agile development approach• Strong interpersonal and communication skills• Ability to problem-solve complex situations• Experience working in a multi-discipline environment• Earned Value certification or ability to become certified in 90 days• Demonstrated ability to effectively work with and communicate with all levels of management and individual contributors on the program team• Experience with Microsoft Office suite of toolsDesired Skills:• Experience as Agile Scrum-master or Product Owner• Experience and certification with SAFe• Experienced Control Account Manager• Six sigma certified• Experience with Amazon Web Services (AWS)Required Education:8 years experience with a BS in Science, Technology, Engineering; or 6 years experience with a MS in Science, Technology, Engineering or MathIISBonus 148090
Business Unit Profile
Raytheon Intelligence, Information and Services delivers innovative technology to make the world a safer place. Our expertise in cyber, analytics and automation allow us to reach beyond what others think is possible to underpin national security and give our global customers unique solutions to solve the most pressing modern challenges -- from the cyber domain to automated operations, and from intelligent transportation and training solutions to creating clear insight from large volumes of data. IIS operates at nearly 550 sites in 80 countries, and is headquartered in Dulles, Virginia. The business area generated $6.2 billion in 2018 revenues. As a global business, our leaders must have the ability to understand, embrace and operate in a multicultural world -- in the marketplace and the workplace. We strive to hire people who reflect our communities and embrace diversity and inclusion to advance our culture, develop our employees, and grow our business.

Back to Job Navigation (Success)


Quote



I joined Raytheon in 2016 and I’m proud to work here. My company makes some pretty amazing things, including missile defense, using data to predict the weather, and securing our GPS system. My company also works with artificial intelligence, machine learning and other innovative solutions. I’m proud to work for an organization that allows me the flexibility to be a STEM volunteer and help inspire our future generation.









Rewards




401(k) / Retirement Plans
Employer Matching, if you elect to enroll company matches up to 3%.



Work / Life Balance
Raytheon supports a variety of flexible work arrangements including compressed work weeks, flextime, job sharing, 9/80, reduced hours and telecommuting.



Career Development
At Raytheon, we foster an inclusive culture of professional development. We support a variety of developmental opportunities including: Mentoring programs, Skills Development, Leadership Development, Rotational job assignments, and Continuous Improvement, all of which contribute to advancement of our employee’s capabilities.



Paid Time Off
Accrue paid time off monthly. Receive 10-12 holidays per year with some locations shutting down the week between Christmas and New Year’s Day.



Relocation Assistance
Select technical positions are eligible for relocation packages. See specific job description for eligibility requirements.



Parental Leave
Raytheon offers all eligible employees up to three weeks paid parental leave for the birth or adoption of a child (separate from paid maternity leave or Family & Medical Leave Act).



Sign-On Bonus
Qualified cleared engineers can receive an up to $40K sign-on bonus when they join our Engineering Team!



Student Loan Repayment Contribution
Through the 401(k), called the Raytheon Savings and Investment Plan, the company will make a dollar for dollar contribution for amounts employees spend repaying their student loans, up to their maximum match percentage.

If you’re ready to take on a fresh challenge, grow your career and contribute to making the world a safer place, Raytheon is ready to help you achieve your goals. Join our team and get the opportunity and support to find purpose, thrive and succeed.





Notice: Please be aware of suspicious recruiting emails and text messages that attempt to collect your confidential information. Raytheon conducts all electronic correspondence using e-mail addresses that end in “Raytheon.com”, “Raytheon.co.uk”, “Raytheon.com.au” or “brassring.com”. To report fraud please go to: https://www.ic3.gov.











Sr Principal Multi-Dis Eng - CPT Lead
Aurora, Colorado

Overview

Raytheon delivers innovative technology to make the world a safer place. Our expertise in cyber, analytics and automation allow us to reach beyond what others think is possible to underpin national security and give our global customers unique solutions to solve the most pressing modern challenges -- from the cyber domain to automated operations, and from intelligent transportation solutions to creating clear insight from large volumes of data. Our leaders must have the ability to understand, embrace and operate in a multicultural world -- in the marketplace and the workplace. We strive to hire people who reflect our communities and embrace diversity and inclusion to advance our culture, develop our employees, and grow our business.

Full-time
Entry to Senior level

Glassdoor 2017 Best Places to Interview: Candidate's Choice

Back to Job Navigation (Trending)


Rewards




401(k) / Retirement Plans
Employer Matching, if you elect to enroll company matches up to 3%.



Work / Life Balance
Raytheon appreciates work/life balance. Employees can work 9 hours a day every week and received every other Friday off, as long as departmental/manager approval is obtained. Accrued paid time off monthly and paid holiday time.



Career Development
At Raytheon, we foster an inclusive culture of professional development. We support a variety of developmental opportunities including: Mentoring programs, Skills Development, Leadership Development, Rotational job assignments, and Continuous Improvement, all of which contribute to advancement of our employee’s capabilities.



Paid Time Off
Accrue paid time off monthly. Receive 12 holidays per year including the week between Christmas and New Year’s Day.



Relocation Assistance
Select technical positions are eligible for relocation packages. See specific job description for eligibility requirements.



Parental Leave
Raytheon offers all eligible employees up to three weeks paid parental leave for the birth or adoption of a child (separate from paid maternity leave or Family & Medical Leave Act).



Back to Job Navigation (Rewards)



Responsibilities


Would you like to work in a collaborative environment at a state of the art facility in Colorado? Then join our Raytheon team of engineers solving problems that make the world a safer place and help to secure our great nation! Come support those who provide us with all the freedoms we enjoy.Our facility in Aurora, CO offers amenities that create work and life balance. On site we have a 24/7 fitness facility, health center, cafeteria, collaboration rooms and dynamic break areas for easy conversation and socialization. Additionally, we provide employee appreciation lunches, bonus opportunities, and great benefits that include medical, dental, vision, 401K match, flexible work schedule - just to name a few.  Click here to view a brief video and learn more: https://youtu.be/YNuZN0vyzHgJob Description:The candidate will join the Raytheon Hardware and Infrastructure Engineering (HW&I) team. The Raytheon IIS Hardware and Infrastructure Engineering (HW&I) team has a professional Design Engineering Cross Product Team (CPT) Lead opportunity available. Responsibilities include coordinating leaders and engineers across engineering disciplines of Hardware, Infrastructure (O/S, VMware, etc.) Systems Engineering, Formal Test, and Cyber security assisting the project in, designing solutions for the overall system infrastructure (network, storage, and compute service). This will involve coordinating and reconciling disparate schedules as well as preparing systems for acceptance into customer sites. The qualified individual should have experience and knowledge with the generation of detailed design artifacts including drawings using Computer Aided Design (CAD) systems to prepare design layouts, component modeling, detail and assembly drawings, electrical schematics, wiring diagrams, parts list and other related documentation in conformance to appropriate program and/or military specifications. Responsibilities also include supporting customer Technical Interface Meetings (TIMs) to discuss technical issues, supporting Program Reviews of designed program artifacts, mentoring, metrics reporting, program process development, and being a key technical stakeholder to program reviews (ECRs, ERBS, ARBs etc.).  US Citizenship is required due to the candidate needing to obtain and maintain a Secrete Security Clearance.Required Skills:Experience with Leading technical teams and tasking to program schedules.Experience with scheduling of numerous complex tasks to achieve project goals and milestones, including the ability to de-conflict and optimize schedules.Demonstrated written and oral communication skills, including presentation skillsKnowledge of Compute Infrastructure Engineering, including servers, networks, storage, and virtualizationExperience with establishing engineering drawing structuresKnowledge of Configuration Management principlesAbility to obtain DOD Secret Security Clearance and US Citizenship is requiredExperience developing Drawing Processes10+ years of related work experienceDesired Skills: Technical knowledge and engineering design experience with infrastructure systems (Compute, network, and storage) components.Experience in developing Interface Control Drawings, Cable Assembly Drawings, Wiring Diagrams, Installation Drawings, and Rack Elevation DrawingsExperience with Microsoft ProjectKnowledge of cyber security principlesExperience in drawing development utilizing AutoCAD and CREO SoftwareFamiliarity with ASME-Y14.100 Drawing StandardsBasic engineering principles as they apply to hardware assembliesKnowledge and experience with Earned Value Management SystemsGeneral knowledge of Manufacturing and Assembly PrinciplesMicrosoft Office products (Visio, PowerPoint, Excel, Word, etc.)Required Education (including Major):Requires a degree in Science, Technology, Engineering or Mathematics (STEM) and 10+ years of related work experience 148080
                

                    
                 
                           Raytheon is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, age, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected Veteran status.

Customer Care Representative  (80533) - Goleta, CA - Inogen, Inc. Jobs








 














Home
Jobs




Customer Care Representative  (80533) - Goleta, CA

Toggle navigation








Customer Care Representative  (80533) 

JobsLogin 












 Customer Care Center Goleta, CA, USA Full Time 



Email Me Similar Jobs Email Me This Job



ABOUT INOGEN Inogen was founded in 2001 to improve quality of life and increase freedom and independence for oxygen therapy users. Inogen is innovation in oxygen therapy. The Inogen mission is to improve freedom and independence for oxygen therapy patients through innovative products and services. Inogen is a manufacturer and Accredited Homecare Provider.
Inogen is focused on quality care, continuous improvement, and outstanding customer satisfaction. We are a stable, USAbased company dedicated to providing an exciting and rewarding career to our employees. We completed a successful Initial Public Offering on the NASDAQ in 2014 and have demonstrated substantial growth over the last five years. Our work environment is casual yet highperforming, and we are looking for seriously talented, motivated, and fast-paced professionals to join our team.
JOB DESCRIPTION The Patient Technical Services Advocate provides support and service to our respiratory patients that have purchased products directly from Inogen or have enrolled in Inogen's home respiratory therapy services.  This position provides the highest level of customer service to internal/external customers and serves as the front line contact for incoming inquiries, customer questions and sales requests.
Key Competencies:
Troubleshoots and provides Account Overview with Patients
Acts as an information source for customers and intercompany in the area of product and service
Provide sales support for field sales representatives and DTP sales representatives
Maintains product knowledge to keep abreast of updates and changes by continued product training
Do you possess these abilities?
Excellent verbal and written communication skills required
Strong organization skills and attention to detail are required
Ability to take initiative and follow through on multiple open tasks
Must have proven track record of successful team participation, as well as ability to work independently and self-start
Requirements:
Associate's or Bachelor's degree preferred, or the equivalent combination of education, training, and experience that provides the required knowledge, skills, and abilities
3+ years related customer service preferred
 
WHY INOGEN Inogen is a dynamic company that is not only focused on quality care of patients, but is also committed to being a top employer. Each of Inogen's offices has a casual culture that supports employees being responsible and developing professionals.
Inogen – Where we go to work hard to positively impact people's lives
See the Inogen team in action:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dKoTMeJf5J4#t=23
 
Inogen is an equal opportunity employer.  We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other legally protected characteristics. The EEO is the Law poster and its supplement are available here: http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/ofccpost.htm; http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/OFCCP_EEO_Supplement_Final_JRF_QA_508c.pdf.  The pay transparency policy is available here: http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/pdf/EO13665_PrescribedNondiscriminationPostingLanguage_JRFQA508c.pdf. 
Inogen is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities.  If you need a reasonable accommodation because of a disability for any part of the employment process, please send an e-mail to recruiting@inogen.net or call (972) 616-5668 and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information.
 

Inogen, Inc.
https://inogen.applicantpro.com

If you’re ready to take on a fresh challenge, grow your career and contribute to making the world a safer place, Raytheon is ready to help you achieve your goals. Join our team and get the opportunity and support to find purpose, thrive and succeed.





Notice: Please be aware of suspicious recruiting emails and text messages that attempt to collect your confidential information. Site Reliability Engineer
Boston, Massachusetts


Apply





Overview
Responsibilities
Success Profile
Rewards
Trending




Overview

What does it take to make the world a safer place? It takes delivering innovative technology and collaborating with some of the finest talent in the engineering field. Whether you’re a software engineer or a mechanical engineer, at Raytheon you’ll grow a varied and rewarding career. And you’ll be supported with a comprehensive and competitive benefits package that promotes work/life. If you’re ready to take on today’s big challenges, discover a world of opportunity at Raytheon.

America’s Best Large Employers by Forbes
Career & Development Opportunities
Full-time
Entry, Mid, Senior level




Back to Job Navigation (Overview)


Responsibilities


Are you looking for an engineering career that is challenging and satisfying? Then join our Raytheon team of engineers solving problems that make the world a safer place and help to secure our great nation! Come support those who provide us with all the freedoms we enjoy.We offer great benefits that include medical, dental, vision, 401K match, flexible work schedule - just to name a few.  Click here to view a brief video and learn more: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qvbCgKpkEdsRaytheon is the prime contractor for the Air Operations Center Weapon System Long -Term Modification and Sustainment (AOC WS LTM&S) Team providing the sustainment and transformation for the Air Force Weapon System.  At the AOC Kessel Run Experimental Lab (KREL) we are looking to strengthen and grow our Application Operations team by bringing on board talented SRE engineers to join our platform team that manages large scale physical and virtual server environments that underpins our global WS platform. In this role, you will be involved with and exposed to a wide variety of systems and technologies, but particularly focused on Pivotal Cloud Foundry. The Kessel Run team is aggressively moving towards an "Infrastructure as Code" model. These initiatives include development of end-to-end automation of system builds; platform scaling to support forecasted workload; standardization and improvement of systems/processes/services automation; and data center expansion and migration to the cloud.  We are looking for someone with an "automation" mindset to help us accomplish these transformations.What you’ll do:• Own Service Level Agreements (SLAs) for production systems• Drive faster MTTD/MTTR for critical systems• Independently troubleshoot Sev1/Sev2 incidents• Own/Manage/Support baseline Operating System image/templates• Support CI/CD release pipeline tools• Maintain and review Desired State Configuration (DSC) DevOps tools and support the provisioning infrastructure• Own and operate all package repos (python/java/rpm/etc.)• Drive efficiencies across the Kessel Run hybrid cloud• Invent innovative ways to drive production operational efficiency• Drive scalability and operability of supported systems/infrastructure• Own production systems scaling & throughput• Work with other teams to provide consultations in systems architecture support for new and existing production systems• Participate in on-call support rotation• Create and maintain detailed system documentationClearance Requirement:Must be a U.S. CITIZEN with the ability to obtain a Secret clearanceRequired Skills:• Minimum ten years systems administration/Site Reliability/Platform/DevOps background• Experience with infrastructure including but not limited to data center operations, server hardware, web servers (IIS, jboss, etc.), databases (MS SQL, mySQL, mongoDB), virtualization (VMware), networking, storage, monitoring, etc.• Experience with structured scripting languages (PowerShell, Python, etc.)• Experience with CI/CD tools such as Jenkins, Bamboo, Gitlab CI etc.• Understanding of Agile, ITIL, DevOps practices such as CI/CD, automated testing etc.• Experience with JVM tuning and optimal configuration• Ability to obtain and maintain a US Government Secret security clearanceDesired Skills:• Experience with .NET and RestAPIsEducation Required:10 years of related work experience with a BS degree in Science, Technology, Engineering or Mathematics (STEM); or a MS degree in Science, Technology, Engineering or Mathematics (STEM)IISAOC 143650
Business Unit Profile
                        
                        Raytheon Intelligence, Information and Services delivers innovative technology to make the world a safer place. Our expertise in cyber, analytics and automation allow us to reach beyond what others think is possible to underpin national security and give our global customers unique solutions to solve the most pressing modern challenges -- from the cyber domain to automated operations, and from intelligent transportation and training solutions to creating clear insight from large volumes of data. IIS operates at nearly 550 sites in 80 countries, and is headquartered in Dulles, Virginia. The business area generated $6.2 billion in 2018 revenues. As a global business, our leaders must have the ability to understand, embrace and operate in a multicultural world -- in the marketplace and the workplace. We strive to hire people who reflect our communities and embrace diversity and inclusion to advance our culture, develop our employees, and grow our business.
Relocation Eligible 
                        
                        Yes
Clearance Type 
                        
                        Secret
Expertise 
                        

                                
                            Artificial IntelligenceCloud ComputingComputer EngineeringComputer ScienceComputer/Management Information SystemsCyber JobsData NetworkingData ScienceEngineering TechnologyGeneral EngineeringHardware EngineeringReliability EngineerSoftware EngineeringSystems EngineeringTest Engineering
                        
                        

Type Of Job

Work Location 
                        
 
                            
                            MA - Boston
                        
Raytheon is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, age, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected Veteran status.

Success Profile

Adaptable

Quote



Felicia Jackson is regional vice president of RAYVETS, Raytheon's employee group for veterans and those who support them. After 24 years in the Air Force, she started a new career at Raytheon. "I wanted to go where people would support me," she told us.









Rewards




401(k) / Retirement Plans
Employer Matching, if you elect to enroll company matches up to 3%.



Work / Life Balance
Raytheon supports a variety of flexible work arrangements including compressed work weeks, flextime, job sharing, 9/80, reduced hours and telecommuting.



Career Development
At Raytheon, we foster an inclusive culture of professional development. We support a variety of developmental opportunities including: Mentoring programs, Skills Development, Leadership Development, Rotational job assignments, and Continuous Improvement, all of which contribute to advancement of our employee’s capabilities.



Paid Time Off
Accrue paid time off monthly. Receive 10-12 holidays per year with some locations shutting down the week between Christmas and New Year’s Day.



Relocation Assistance
Select technical positions are eligible for relocation packages. See specific job description for eligibility requirements.



Parental Leave
Raytheon offers all eligible employees up to three weeks paid parental leave for the birth or adoption of a child (separate from paid maternity leave or Family & Medical Leave Act).

If you’re ready to take on a fresh challenge, grow your career and contribute to making the world a safer place, Raytheon is ready to help you achieve your goals. Join our team and get the opportunity and support to find purpose, thrive and succeed.





Notice: Please be aware of suspicious recruiting emails and text messages that attempt to collect your confidential information. Raytheon conducts all electronic correspondence using e-mail addresses that end in “Raytheon.com”, “Raytheon.co.uk”, “Raytheon.com.au” or “brassring.com”. To report fraud please go to: https://www.ic3.gov.











Digital Signal Processing Engineers
Aurora, Colorado


Apply





Overview
Responsibilities
Success Profile
Rewards
Trending




Overview

What does it take to make the world a safer place? It takes delivering innovative technology and collaborating with some of the finest talent in the engineering field. Whether you’re a software engineer or a field engineer, at Raytheon you’ll grow a varied and rewarding career. And you’ll be supported with a comprehensive and competitive benefits package that promotes work/life. If you’re ready to take on today’s big challenges, discover a world of opportunity at Raytheon.

America’s Best Large Employers by Forbes
Career & Development Opportunities
Full-time
Entry, Mid, Senior level




Back to Job Navigation (Overview)


Responsibilities


Raytheon is seeking Signal Processing Engineers  to join our M2C System Engineering team in Aurora, Colorado. Would you like to work in a collaborative environment at a state of the art facility in Colorado? Then join our Raytheon team of engineers solving problems that make the world a safer place and help to secure our great nation! Come support those who provide us with all the freedoms we enjoy.Our facility in Aurora, CO offers amenities that create work and life balance. On site we have a 24/7 fitness facility, health center, cafeteria, collaboration rooms and dynamic break areas for easy conversation and socialization. Additionally, employee appreciation lunches, bonus opportunities, and great benefits that include medical, dental, vision, 401K match, flexible work schedule - just to name a few.  Click here to view a brief video and learn more: https://youtu.be/YNuZN0vyzHgAs a Digital Signal Processing (DSP) Engineer,  you will be a team member of a dynamic and multidiscipline development team within the Advanced Mission Solutions (AMS) program area.  Responsibilities will span the development and fielding life cycle from initial concept definition through detailed design, development, and qualification testing and into fielding and customer support.  The team member will work on a small, tightly focused team to accomplish assigned tasking/milestones and work with the staff leadership to ensure adherence to budgets, plans, and schedules.  The ideal candidate will have experience with radio frequency (RF) communications links and systems, algorithm prototyping/modeling, waveform design, and software-defined radios.Clearance Requirement:  Must be a US Citizens with a current/active TS/SCI clearanceThis position is eligible for a Sign on Bonus up to 40k for a candidate with a current TS/SCI and that can be verified and hired at Raytheon. Required Experience, Knowledge and/or Skills: • Minimum 6+ years of related work experience• Experience/Knowledge with waveform design and application• Experience with signal modulation application• Familiar with communication links• Working knowledge using Matlab or X-MIDAS or related languages for algorithm prototyping and simulation• Working knowledge with software development in C/C++ or related languages• Understanding of software development processes and their application to programs• Must be a US Citizen and have an active TS/SCI              Desired Experience, Knowledge and/or Skills: • Working knowledge of spread spectrum communication signals and systems• Experience designing for and implementing algorithms on software-defined radios• Experience developing with Python and Java• Experience developing on Linux operating system• Experience developing with X-Midas• Experience developing with RedhawkEducation Requirements:B.S./M.S. in Engineering or Computer Science, Physics, Math, or related STEM degree CONETWORKIISSignalIISBonus#SignalProcessing#RF#cleared#DSP 149050
Business Unit Profile
                        
                        Raytheon Intelligence, Information and Services delivers innovative technology to make the world a safer place. Our expertise in cyber, analytics and automation allow us to reach beyond what others think is possible to underpin national security and give our global customers unique solutions to solve the most pressing modern challenges -- from the cyber domain to automated operations, and from intelligent transportation and training solutions to creating clear insight from large volumes of data. IIS operates at nearly 550 sites in 80 countries, and is headquartered in Dulles, Virginia. The business area generated $6.2 billion in 2018 revenues. As a global business, our leaders must have the ability to understand, embrace and operate in a multicultural world -- in the marketplace and the workplace. We strive to hire people who reflect our communities and embrace diversity and inclusion to advance our culture, develop our employees, and grow our business.
Relocation Eligible 
                        
                        Yes

                        TS/SCI - Current

Quote



I joined Raytheon in 2016 and I’m proud to work here. My company makes some pretty amazing things, including missile defense, using data to predict the weather, and securing our GPS system. My company also works with artificial intelligence, machine learning and other innovative solutions. I’m proud to work for an organization that allows me the flexibility to be a STEM volunteer and help inspire our future generation.









Rewards




401(k) / Retirement Plans
Employer Matching, if you elect to enroll company matches up to 3%.



Work / Life Balance
Raytheon supports a variety of flexible work arrangements including compressed work weeks, flextime, job sharing, 9/80, reduced hours and telecommuting.



Career Development
At Raytheon, we foster an inclusive culture of professional development. We support a variety of developmental opportunities including: Mentoring programs, Skills Development, Leadership Development, Rotational job assignments, and Continuous Improvement, all of which contribute to advancement of our employee’s capabilities.



Paid Time Off
Accrue paid time off monthly. Receive 10-12 holidays per year with some locations shutting down the week between Christmas and New Year’s Day.



Relocation Assistance
Select technical positions are eligible for relocation packages. See specific job description for eligibility requirements.



Parental Leave
Raytheon offers all eligible employees up to three weeks paid parental leave for the birth or adoption of a child (separate from paid maternity leave or Family & Medical Leave Act).



Sign-On Bonus
Qualified cleared engineers can receive an up to $40K sign-on bonus when they join our Engineering Team!



Student Loan Repayment Contribution
Through the 401(k), called the Raytheon Savings and Investment Plan, the company will make a dollar for dollar contribution for amounts employees spend repaying their student loans, up to their maximum match percentage.

Raytheon delivers innovative technology to make the world a safer place. Our expertise in cyber, analytics and automation allow us to reach beyond what others think is possible to underpin national security and give our global customers unique solutions to solve the most pressing modern challenges -- from the cyber domain to automated operations, and from intelligent transportation solutions to creating clear insight from large volumes of data. Our leaders must have the ability to understand, embrace and operate in a multicultural world -- in the marketplace and the workplace. We strive to hire people who reflect our communities and embrace diversity and inclusion to advance our culture, develop our employees, and grow our business.
