Raytheon: Bright Future in Aurora







Raytheon Secures Every Side of Cyber




Back to Job Navigation (Trending)


Rewards




401(k) / Retirement Plans
Employer Matching, if you elect to enroll company matches up to 3%.



Work / Life Balance
Raytheon appreciates work/life balance. Employees can work 9 hours a day every week and received every other Friday off, as long as departmental/manager approval is obtained. Accrued paid time off monthly and paid holiday time.



Career Development
At Raytheon, we foster an inclusive culture of professional development. We support a variety of developmental opportunities including: Mentoring programs, Skills Development, Leadership Development, Rotational job assignments, and Continuous Improvement, all of which contribute to advancement of our employee’s capabilities.



Paid Time Off
Accrue paid time off monthly. Receive 12 holidays per year including the week between Christmas and New Year’s Day.



Relocation Assistance
Select technical positions are eligible for relocation packages. See specific job description for eligibility requirements.



Parental Leave
Raytheon offers all eligible employees up to three weeks paid parental leave for the birth or adoption of a child (separate from paid maternity leave or Family & Medical Leave Act).



Back to Job Navigation (Rewards)



Responsibilities


Would you like to work in a collaborative environment at a state of the art facility in Colorado? Then join our Raytheon team of engineers solving problems that make the world a safer place and help to secure our great nation! Come support those who provide us with all the freedoms we enjoy.Our facility in Aurora, CO offers amenities that create work and life balance. On site we have a 24/7 fitness facility, health center, cafeteria, collaboration rooms and dynamic break areas for easy conversation and socialization. Additionally, we provide employee appreciation lunches, bonus opportunities, and great benefits that include medical, dental, vision, 401K match, flexible work schedule - just to name a few.  Click here to view a brief video and learn more: https://youtu.be/YNuZN0vyzHgPosition Description:The Raytheon NMS team is responsible for full life cycle engineering on state-of-the-art environmental, commercial, and sensing systems for government and commercial applications. These projects include: Joint Polar Satellite Systems (JPSS), James Webb Space Telescope (JWST), Earth Observation Systems (EOS), GPS advanced operational control segment (GPS-OCX) and other exciting programs.The Raytheon Hardware and Infrastructure Engineering (HW&I) team has professional Infrastructure Engineer opportunities available to support platform baseline management activities on Raytheon’s JPSS programs. Tasking will include creating and maintaining Bill of Materials (BOM); creating and maintaining Basis of Estimates (BOE) and related proposal work support. Individual should possess some knowledge and experience with computer, network and storage technologies, services, operations, and associated security practices. Tasking will include Cost Account Management (CAM) using the Earned Value Management System (EVMS). This position will perform Basic Infrastructure design and implementation tasking including Compute, Network and storage engineering tasks; creating and maintain engineering design artifacts.Required Skills:Knowledge of designing, procuring, and integration of Windows Server (i.e. 2012, 2016)Knowledge of designing, procuring, and integration of Windows Desktop (i.e. Windows 7, Windows 10, Windows VDA)Knowledge of designing, procuring and integration of enterprise virtualization technologies (i.e. VMWare ESX/ESXi/vSphere/vCenter)Knowledge of designing, procuring, and integration of enterprise data storage architectures (i.e. NAS, SAN) including iSCSI and Fiber Channel technologiesKnowledge of common network services such as DNS, TCP/IP, DHCP and troubleshootingKnowledge of designing and administering backup infrastructure technologiesKnowledge of TCP, and secure protocolsExperience with Cost Account Management / Earned Value Management System (CAM/EVMS)Proven communicator with Leadership, Peers Must be able to communicate effectively both written and verballyDesired Skills: Understanding of computing and network technologies and associated services, management, and security practices/techniquesScripting skills (i.e. PowerShell, Python, Ruby, PERL, bash, etc.)Experience with Configuration Management Experience with automation tools such as Chef (preferred), Puppet, Ansible, SaltStack, Fabric or similar products for O/S builds, software installation and configurationRequired Education (including Major):Requires a degree in Science, Technology, Engineering or Mathematics (STEM) with emphasis in Information Systems, Information Technology, Management Information Systems, Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Computer Information Systems, Computer Systems Engineering and 4 years of related work experience  151022
                

                    
                 
                           Raytheon is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, age, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected Veteran status.

Global Accounts Payable Specialist

Department:
              Finance
            
Location:
              Hilversum, Santa Barbara
            

Req#:
              5735
            

The Accounts Payable Specialist is responsible for a variety of Accounts Payable duties such as matching and coding of invoices, approval verification, data entry, communication with vendors and internal company personnel.




About You


More than a candidate that checks every box, we’re looking for people who are excited to work, learn, and grow at Sonos—no matter their background or how they identify. If that’s you, we hope you’ll apply for this role.
You want to be part of a team.
You come with new ideas and a unique point of view. You look forward to collaborating with a diverse team of individuals. You assume everyone’s best intentions, welcome a healthy debate, and embrace differing opinions. You eagerly seek and give help. Transparency tops your list of values, and you proactively contribute to a culture of respect and inclusion.
You enjoy a challenge.
Inquisitive and focused, you see every challenge as an opportunity. You’re ambitious and comfortable making mistakes because you learn from them and bounce back quickly. You would rather create the future than wait for it. You prioritize long-term value over short-term objectives.
You love to listen.
You approach every interaction with curiosity and a desire to understand. You want to make a positive impact in the world. You’re passionate about culture and know the power that music, film, podcasts, games, and stories have to bring people together.


What You’ll Do 

Review all invoices for appropriate documentation and approval prior to payment Prepare, process and file payments Execute payment process Accurate coding of all transactions Follow up open invoices and educate the businessMatch invoices to respective purchase orders Audit and process out of Pocket and Credit card expense reports in Concur Understand European VAT and US Sales Tax and can apply those rules when processing transactionsReconcile vendor statements, research and correct discrepancies Maintain files and documentation thoroughly and accurately, in accordance with company policy and accepted accounting practicesAssist in month end closing Completes tasks or projects as assigned by the Manager Global Accounts Payable Special projects and additional duties in support of the accounting function as assigned from time to time

Skills You’ll Need

Basic QualificationsAbility to define and solve problems, collect pertinent data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusionsAbility to communicate with co-workers and outside contacts in a professional, discrete, and concise mannerAbility to work independently and with a team in a fast-paced and high volume environment with emphasis on accuracy and timelinessPreferred QualificationsBachelor's degree in Accounting or FinanceThorough knowledge of applicable accounts payable/general ledger systems and procedures, financial chart of accounts and corporate proceduresStrong work ethic, organized and a self-starter

More About Sonos


Sonos is a sound experience company. We pioneered multiroom wireless audio, made it sound amazing, and changed the way people listen, making it effortless for them to enjoy what they want, where they want, how they want.
Today we continue empowering listeners by developing new technologies, thoughtfully designing products, expanding our software platform, and crafting brilliant sound experiences while participating in a culture that values respect, transparency, collaboration, and ownership.
Together we’re working to positively impact the world and inspire everyone to listen better—because listening brings people together, builds understanding, drives change, and makes us happier.
Notice to European Job Applicants: Information you submit as a part of your job application will be used in accordance with Sonos EU Job Applicant Privacy Notice.
Notice to U.S. Job Applicants: Sonos is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other legally protected characteristics.
Follow the links to review the EEO is the Law poster and its supplement. The pay transparency policy is available here. Sonos is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities. If you need a reasonable accommodation because of a disability for any part of the employment process, please send an e-mail to accommodations@sonos.com and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information.

Regulatory Affairs Specialist  (98031) - Goleta, CA - Inogen, Inc. Jobs








 














Home
Jobs




Regulatory Affairs Specialist  (98031) - Goleta, CA

Toggle navigation








Regulatory Affairs Specialist  (98031) 

JobsLogin 












 RA/QA Goleta, CA, USA Full Time 



Email Me Similar Jobs Email Me This Job



ABOUT INOGEN Inogen was founded in 2001 to improve quality of life and increase freedom and independence for oxygen therapy users. Inogen is innovation in oxygen therapy. The Inogen mission is to improve freedom and independence for oxygen therapy patients through innovative products and services. Inogen is a manufacturer and Accredited Homecare Provider.
Inogen is focused on quality care, continuous improvement, and outstanding customer satisfaction. We are a stable, USA based company dedicated to providing an exciting and rewarding career to our employees. We completed a successful Initial Public Offering on the NASDAQ in 2014 and have demonstrated substantial growth over the last five years. Our work environment is casual yet high performing, and we are looking for seriously talented, motivated, and fast-paced professionals to join our team.
JOB DESCRIPTION 
The Regulatory Affairs Specialist is responsible for global product and operational compliance related to Class-2 (and accessory) medical device design, manufacture and sales; obtaining regulatory approvals; and establishing and maintaining quality and environmental management systems in keeping with business objectives.
Key Competencies:
Participate in product development activities, including evaluating and advising personnel on regulatory impact through product lifecycle stages, ensuring that regulatory standards are understood, that a design control system is in place, that design validation activities are conducted, and that a Design History File (DHF) is maintained to support regulatory submissions. 
Participate in the transfer of approved product design to Manufacturing to meet market introduction and other key milestone target dates, ensuring that a Device Master Record is in place (specifications, bill of materials, drawings, material specifications, labelling, etc.).
Participate in the development of manufacturing and inspection/ test procedures, including required validations for final product release.
Participate in change control activities, such as design changes, manufacturing improvements, new supplier introductions, cost reduction initiatives, etc., ensuring that regulatory standards are understood.
Assist in obtaining regulatory registrations, product clearances/ approvals, certifications and with maintaining documentation needed to support ISO, FDA, and other regulatory compliance, allowing for the sale of Inogen products. 
Support key business relationships by providing regulatory expertise specific to contract manufacturing, private label arrangements, due diligence for possible acquisitions, etc.
Assist in compiling, submitting, and monitoring reports and responses to regulatory authorities. 
Support regulatory agency inspections and audits.
Participate in the Internal Audit Program as an internal auditor. 
Support the Supplier Audit Program as an auditor.
Support the Corrective and Preventive Action (CAPA) Program.
Support post market surveillance (PMS) activities, including customer complaint handling and regulatory analysis efforts to determine reportability.
Support the external standards management process by ensuring changes to standards and new standards introduced are understood and integrated into device design proactively.
Participate in company-wide quality management system training and provide Regulatory expertise.
Support Lean and Kaizen initiatives to introduce improvements throughout the quality management system.
Support Operations reporting and trending.
Maintain regular and punctual attendance. 
Comply with all company policies and procedures. 
Assist with any other duties as assigned. 
Limited sign off for Regulatory.
Lead Corrective and Preventive Action (CAPA) program facilitation efforts.
Lead international product registration efforts. 
 
Do you possess these abilities?
Knowledge of ISO, MDD/ MDR and FDA regulations.
Knowledge of DMEPOS accreditation requirements.
Knowledge of DMEPOS accreditation requirements.
Experience with DMEPOS/ CMS.
Experience in medical device Regulatory Affairs and at least one (1) of the following: product development, manufacturing engineering, quality assurance, or production management.
Ability to support external/ internal audits.
Attention to detail and process improvement capabilities.
Excellent skills with database systems and Excel with capability to compile data from various sources to produce useful reports for trending and verifying process improvements.
Familiarity with process improvement concepts (i.e., LEAN Six Sigma).
Must have strong work ethic.
Excellent oral and written communication skills are required. 
Attention to detail is required. 
Must demonstrate effective conflict resolution. 
Analytical and problem-solving skills and ability to multitask are required. 
Must be solutions-oriented problem solver. 
Excellent planning, communication and organizational skills are required. 
Ability to effectively interface with different departments within the company is required. 
Requirements:
Bachelor's Degree in a technical discipline required.
2-5 years of medical device Regulatory Affairs experience required; 1 year of QMS internal auditing experience required.
Intermediate knowledge of/ proficiency in Microsoft Office required.
ISO 13485 (current edition) Lead Auditor Certification and/or ASQ CQA and/or ASQ CBA preferred.
Intermediate knowledge of ISO 13485 preferred.
Intermediate knowledge of ISO 14971 preferred.
A combination of training, education and experience that is equivalent to the qualifications listed above and that provides the required knowledge, skills, and abilities.
WHY INOGEN Inogen is a dynamic company that is not only focused on quality care of patients, but is also committed to being a top employer.  Each of Inogen' s offices have a casual culture that supports employees being responsible and developing professionals.
We offer competitive salaries and a robust benefit package:
Employee Stock Purchase Plan 401 (K) plan available for all employees Health, dental, vision insurance Flexible spending accounts and wellness discount program Life Insurance Long Term Disability Robust paid time off and 8 paid holidays Employee Assistance Program
See the Inogen Team in action:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dKoTMeJf5J4
 
Inogen Where we go to work hard to positively impact people's lives
 
Inogen is an equal opportunity employer.  We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other legally protected characteristics. The EEO is the Law poster and its supplement are available here: http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/ofccpost.htm; http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/OFCCP_EEO_Supplement_Final_JRF_QA_508c.pdf.  The pay transparency policy is available here: http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/pdf/EO13665_PrescribedNondiscriminationPostingLanguage_JRFQA508c.pdf. 
Inogen is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities.  If you need a reasonable accommodation because of a disability for any part of the employment process, please send an e-mail to recruiting@inogen.net or call (972) 616-5668 and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information.

            Senior Account Executive



         Login to apply
    
















Senior Account Executive
Toronto, ON 


The Senior Account Executive for Investment Management, will be responsible to grow Canadian market share and increase Canadian revenues through new product sales of  Yardi’s Investment Management Software Suite. The role also requires the management of existing client relationships and 50% travel.
 The Senior Account Executive for Investment Management will be responsible for the following duties and responsibilities:

 Create and execute an annual portfolio plan, aligned with corporate objectives.
Identifying and qualifying new sales opportunities within the Canadian Market
Ability to move an account through a complete sales cycle
Develop product expertise with Yardi’s Investment Management Suite of products.
Convene key decision makers to attend qualified client focused product demonstrations
Conduct dynamic on-line or in-person software presentations 
Ability to influence a client’s purchasing decision with sound business and value driven benefits.
Develop in-depth knowledge of the competitive landscape in order to position Yardi’s Product Strengths and value.
Participating and networking at industry events and tradeshows
Meeting or exceeding monthly, quarterly and annual sales goals
Maintaining accurate account information and forecasting details through a CRM system
Participating in regular sales meetings to report on the status of all opportunities in the sales pipeline and new acquisitions to the pipeline
At all times demonstrate professionalism in communications and business dealings with Yardi clients and Prospective Clients

 
This position will require the following background and experience:

Bachelor’s degree in Business, (Accounting or Finance preferred)
5+years of successful sales experience  managing and developing a sales portfolio
Prior background in the real estate investment industry is an asset
Solid knowledge base in sales and ability to apply basic sales principles (i.e. lead generation, opportunity qualification, proposal development, contract negotiation, closing and on-going account management)
Proven track record in meeting or exceeding sales goals.
Demonstrated ability to communicate and influence at all levels in a Tier 1 organization
Strong ,engaging presentation skills and ability to demonstrate product value
Ability to develop and maintain solid client relationships
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Ability to internally motivate, work interdependently, and also work effectively with a team
Ability to understand and demonstrate technical products
Strong work ethic

 Privacy Overview

 3rd Party Cookies




 








Privacy Overview

This website uses cookies so that we can provide you with the best user experience possible. Cookie information is stored in your browser and performs functions such as recognising you when you return to our website and helping our team to understand which sections of the website you find most interesting and useful.
You can adjust all of your cookie settings by navigating the tabs on the left hand side.



 
Strictly Necessary Cookies

Strictly necessary cookies must be enabled at all times in order to login and apply to openings.



disable









If you disable this cookie, we will not be able to save your preferences and you will not be able to login to apply for openings. This means that every time you visit this website you will need to enable or disable cookies again.







3rd Party Cookies

This website uses Google Analytics to collect anonymous information such as the number of visitors to the site, and the most popular pages.
Keeping this cookie enabled helps us to improve our website.



disable









Please enable Strictly Necessary Cookies first so that we can save your preferences!

            Associate Technical Account Manager



         Login to apply
    
















Associate Technical Account Manager
Denver, CO 


Associate Technical Account Managers at Yardi will provide consultative, implementation and technical support to a group of assigned Yardi clients in order to manage business operations and financial accounting functions in Yardi’s Voyager software.
Responsibilities

Implements the Yardi suite of software products by assisting clients with system implementation, training, and technical support
Researches, analyzes, and resolves software issues
Supports software product customization based on client requirements
Performs data mapping and conversions
Performs system and business process reviews and other service reviews and makes recommendations on best practices
Works on a regular basis with Yardi internal resource teams to include: training, conversion, sales and development

Requirements

Bachelor’s degree in Economics, Business, Math, Statistics, or Information Management preferred
Experience setting and managing client expectations
Superior verbal and written communication skills
Project Management, Accounting, or Property Management experience/background
Solid Proficiency in MS Office Suite and Outlook
Knowledge in three of the following areas: Property Management, Accounting, Microsoft Windows, Technical Support, SQL, HTML/ASP
Prior experience with property management software or real estate software highly desirable
Prior experience with Yardi software highly
Regular attendance and a regular work schedule is an essential function of this job

If you’re ready to take on a fresh challenge, grow your career and contribute to making the world a safer place, Raytheon is ready to help you achieve your goals. Join our team and get the opportunity and support to find purpose, thrive and succeed.





Notice: Please be aware of suspicious recruiting emails and text messages that attempt to collect your confidential information. Raytheon conducts all electronic correspondence using e-mail addresses that end in “Raytheon.com”, “Raytheon.co.uk”, “Raytheon.com.au” or “brassring.com”. To report fraud please go to: https://www.ic3.gov.











Sr Systems Engineer II
Dulles, Virginia


Apply





Overview
Responsibilities
Success Profile
Rewards
Trending




Overview

What does it take to make the world a safer place? It takes delivering innovative technology and collaborating with some of the finest talent in the engineering field. Whether you’re a software engineer or a mechanical engineer, at Raytheon you’ll grow a varied and rewarding career. And you’ll be supported with a comprehensive and competitive benefits package that promotes work/life. If you’re ready to take on today’s big challenges, discover a world of opportunity at Raytheon.

America’s Best Large Employers by Forbes
Career & Development Opportunities
Full-time
Entry, Mid, Senior level




Back to Job Navigation (Overview)


Responsibilities


Would you like to work in a collaborative environment at a state of the art facility in Dulles? Then join our Intelligence, Information and Services (IIS) team of smart people solving problems that make the world a safer place and help to secure our great nation! Come support those who provide us with all the freedoms we enjoy. Our facility in Dulles VA offers amenities that create work and life balance. The Dulles site includes 4 modern facilities with 3 industrial buildings.  On site we have a fitness center plus a fun space with a pool table, foosball and video games. Additionally, employee appreciation lunches, bonus opportunities, and great benefits that include medical, dental, vision, 401K match, flexible work schedules, are just a few of the reasons people come to work at IIS!   If you have the technical knowledge in software engineering and system development (DevOps, Cloud, or Cybersecurity) and the desire to learn and grow in a company with over 60,000 global employees, then IIS is worth the time to explore.  IIS is seeking a Sr/Principal Systems Engineer with expertise in satellite, communications, and networking systems.  The candidate will be working closely with satellite operators to maintain a current knowledge of their capabilities and offerings, hence, must have familiarity with telecommunications industry standards.  The candidate will work closely with team members to verify system design and operations meet the mission requirements.  The successful candidate will possess strong technical knowledge in the areas of digital communications systems, TCP/IP networks and protocols, routing, switching, and destination transport layer technologies and ability to analyze and optimize satellite link performance (RF link budget analysis) based on earth station criteria and satellite performance. REQUIRED SECURITY CLEARANCE:Active TS/SCI with CI Poly.  Must be US CitizenThis position is eligible for a Sign on Bonus up to $40K for a candidate with a current TS/SCI clearance that can be verified and hired at IIS.Required SkillsUS Citizen; Active TS/SCI with CI PolyMinimum of 6 years relevant experience in RF based communication systems engineeringExperience in VSAT operations, to include design architecture, link analysis, system configuration and test, and performance monitoringKnowledge in the design of VSAT signaling and access technologies, including SCPC, TDM/TDMA, and hybrid solutionsDemonstrated experience performing the installation, test, and troubleshooting of VSAT systemMust be able to independently perform VSAT system configuration with minimal assistanceAbility to test network systems and determine the root cause of errors through symptom analysis, then formulate a corrective action plan to return to operational serviceDemonstrated experience in the design and operations of LAN and WAN systems and protocolsAbility to train and mentor field operators on the installation and operation of RF communication systemsDemonstrated ability to work in dynamic team environment with competing priorities and challenges.  Must possess excellent communication skills, both oral and writtenDesired SkillsMaintains a working knowledge of communications technologies, including, but not limited to; digital microwave, two-way radio communications, satellite, networking equipment, cabling, DC power systems, fiber optic networks and the interconnection of these systemsVSAT proficiency (remote and hub), familiar with Ku, Ka, C, and L Band networks, Frontline Support, Hardware Troubleshooting, NetworkingAbility to deploy and manage iDirect Networks & ComtechMeasures, cuts and installs wires and cables and conducts performance tests of sameABET is the preferred, although not required, accreditation standardEducation Requirements:Degree in Science, Technology, Engineering or Mathematics (STEM) and minimum of 6+ years of relevant experience. 151869
Business Unit Profile
                        
                        Intelligence, Information and Services delivers innovative technology to make the world a safer place. Our expertise in cyber, analytics and automation allow us to reach beyond what others think is possible to underpin national security and give our global customers unique solutions to solve the most pressing modern challenges -- from the cyber domain to automated operations, and from intelligent transportation and training solutions to creating clear insight from large volumes of data. IIS operates at nearly 550 sites in 80 countries, and is headquartered in Dulles, Virginia. The business area generated $6.2 billion in 2018 revenues. As a global business, our leaders must have the ability to understand, embrace and operate in a multicultural world -- in the marketplace and the workplace. We strive to hire people who reflect our communities and embrace diversity and inclusion to advance our culture, develop our employees, and grow our business.
Relocation Eligible 
                        
                        Yes
Clearance Type 
                        
                        TS/SCI with CI Poly - Current
Expertise

Work / Life Balance

Career Development
At Raytheon, we foster an inclusive culture of professional development. We support a variety of developmental opportunities including: Mentoring programs, Skills Development, Leadership Development, Rotational job assignments, and Continuous Improvement, all of which contribute to advancement of our employee’s capabilities.



Paid Time Off

Relocation Assistance
Select technical positions are eligible for relocation packages. See specific job description for eligibility requirements.



Parental Leave
Raytheon offers all eligible employees up to three weeks paid parental leave for the birth or adoption of a child (separate from paid maternity leave or Family & Medical Leave Act).

IT Business Analyst – Sales & Marketing  (92817) - Richardson, TX - Inogen, Inc. Jobs








 














Home
Jobs




IT Business Analyst – Sales & Marketing  (92817) - Richardson, TX

Toggle navigation








IT Business Analyst – Sales & Marketing  (92817) 

JobsLogin 












 IT Richardson, TX, USA Full Time 



Email Me Similar Jobs Email Me This Job



ABOUT INOGEN Inogen was founded in 2001 to improve quality of life and increase freedom and independence for oxygen therapy users. Inogen is innovation in oxygen therapy. The Inogen mission is to improve freedom and independence for oxygen therapy patients through innovative products and services. Inogen is a manufacturer and Accredited Homecare Provider.
Inogen is focused on quality care, continuous improvement, and outstanding customer satisfaction. We are a stable, USA based company dedicated to providing an exciting and rewarding career to our employees. We completed a successful Initial Public Offering on the NASDAQ in 2014 and have demonstrated substantial growth over the last five years. Our work environment is casual yet high performing, and we are looking for seriously talented, motivated, and fast-paced professionals to join our team.
JOB DESCRIPTION 
The IT Business Analyst will be the technical resources supporting Inogen's Patient Services or Sales & Marketing teams. This position support business user interviews, lead discovery sessions, collect business requirements, create business system solutions, and provide ongoing business system functional support to assigned business area. The IT Business Analyst will apply functional knowledge in the implementation and administration of standard and custom Salesforce functionalities. This role will work closely with other members of the IT team and 3rd party vendor partners to analyze business processes, propose business process & system improvements. Lead project teams to implement technical solutions and provide ongoing management & support.
Key Competencies:
Participate in the full application life cycle from technical design to development, testing, and deployment of requirements.
Support multiple projects concurrently.
Prioritize and accomplish estimated project timelines with Project Manager and team manager. 
Partner with department business process owners and stakeholders to identify opportunities to use technology to improve business processes and operations in assigned business area
Produce and manage the functional and system requirement documentation of business processes and feature or functional training materials supporting business needs.
Manage the creation of IT project & change management lifecycle documents such as business requirements, solution designs, implementation schedules, data migration plans, test plans, training plans, and rollback plans.
Assist in the evaluation of AppExchange tools for feasibility and impact to the business.
Lead and participate in internal testing of Salesforce functionality.
Provide guidance to business users to facilitate their testing of Salesforce changes and enhancements.
Assist business stakeholders with Salesforce Reporting. 
Recommend workflow improvements what twill enable business unit to improve workflow processes.
Responsible for communication between business stakeholders, IT system analysts & development staff for Inogen business systems, including but not limited to: Salesforce, Oracle, Cloud CTI for Salesforce and other integrated application systems.
Reporting and Analysis- for the Sales and Marketing departments as related to sales and marketing results, key metrics, campaign tracking and ad hoc strategic analysis.
 
Do you possess these abilities?
Individual in this role is expected to work independently and be self-motivated in initiating and managing communication with varied level of.
Excellent oral and written communication skills. 
Familiarity with supporting functionality built with Salesforce.com proprietary technologies: Visual Force and Apex code
Demonstrate capability of problem solving, decision making, and conflict resolution 
Ability to work cross-functionally to engage and influence key business stakeholders to fulfill requirements impacting various systems in use.
Demonstrates an ability to perform under pressure and handle a demanding workload.
 
Requirements:
A Bachelor's degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Accounting, Finance, Business management or equivalent, required. 
5+ years' experience with CRM or similar enterprise level corporate business systems, required.
ECBA, CCBA or CBAP certified or 5+ years as an IT business analyst, required.
Oracle CRM and/or Salesforce.com certifications, preferred.
Advanced knowledge/proficiency in Microsoft Office, required. 
1-3 years' experience with business system implementation and enhancement projects adopted Hybrid or Agile methodologies, required. 
Salesforce SOQL and Salesforce reporting experience, required. 
A combination of training, education and experience that is equivalent to the qualifications listed above that provides the required knowledge, skills, and abilities.
Working Conditions:
The noise level in the work environment is usually moderately quiet.
Up to 100% of their time will be spent working on the computer, reading, typing, and training/meeting with others. 
This position requires the employee to work from within an Inogen facility. 
This position may require working hours outside 8AM-5PM and may also include hours on Saturday and/or Sunday.
WHY INOGEN Inogen is a dynamic company that is not only focused on quality care of patients, but is also committed to being a top employer.  Each of Inogen' s offices have a casual culture that supports employees being responsible and developing professionals.
We offer competitive salaries and a robust benefit package:
Employee Stock Purchase Plan 401 (K) plan available for all employees Health, dental, vision insurance Flexible spending accounts and wellness discount program Life Insurance Long Term Disability Robust paid time off and 8 paid holidays Employee Assistance Program
See the Inogen Team in action:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dKoTMeJf5J4
 
Inogen Where we go to work hard to positively impact people's lives
 
Inogen is an equal opportunity employer.  We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other legally protected characteristics. The EEO is the Law poster and its supplement are available here: http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/ofccpost.htm; http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/OFCCP_EEO_Supplement_Final_JRF_QA_508c.pdf.  The pay transparency policy is available here: http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/pdf/EO13665_PrescribedNondiscriminationPostingLanguage_JRFQA508c.pdf. 
Inogen is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities.  If you need a reasonable accommodation because of a disability for any part of the employment process, please send an e-mail to recruiting@inogen.net or call (972) 616-5668 and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information.
 
 

Inogen, Inc.

If you’re ready to take on a fresh challenge, grow your career and contribute to making the world a safer place, Raytheon is ready to help you achieve your goals. Join our team and get the opportunity and support to find purpose, thrive and succeed.





Notice: Please be aware of suspicious recruiting emails and text messages that attempt to collect your confidential information. Raytheon conducts all electronic correspondence using e-mail addresses that end in “Raytheon.com”, “Raytheon.co.uk”, “Raytheon.com.au” or “brassring.com”. To report fraud please go to: https://www.ic3.gov.











Software Systems Integration and Test Engineer
Dulles, Virginia


Apply





Overview
Responsibilities
Success Profile
Rewards
Trending




Overview

What does it take to make the world a safer place? It takes delivering innovative technology and collaborating with some of the finest talent in the engineering field. Whether you’re a software engineer or a mechanical engineer, at Raytheon you’ll grow a varied and rewarding career. And you’ll be supported with a comprehensive and competitive benefits package that promotes work/life. If you’re ready to take on today’s big challenges, discover a world of opportunity at Raytheon.

America’s Best Large Employers by Forbes
Career & Development Opportunities
Full-time
Entry, Mid, Senior level




Back to Job Navigation (Overview)


Responsibilities


Would you like to work in a collaborative environment at a state of the art facility in Dulles? Then join our Intelligence, Information and Services (IIS) team of smart people solving problems that make the world a safer place and help to secure our great nation! Come support those who provide us with all the freedoms we enjoy. Our facility in Dulles VA offers amenities that create work and life balance. The Dulles site includes 4 modern facilities with 3 industrial buildings. On site we have a fitness center plus a fun space with a pool table, foosball and video games. Additionally, employee appreciation lunches, bonus opportunities, and great benefits that include medical, dental, vision, 401K match, flexible work schedules, are just a few of the reasons people come to work at Intelligence, Information and Services (IIS)!We are a technology and innovation leader specializing in defense, security and civil markets throughout the world. Our latest company video is about our people, our technology, our vision, and the values we hold dear at Intelligence, Information and Services (IIS). Click here to view: https://youtu.be/qvbCgKpkEdsThe Intelligence, Information and Services (IIS) Systems Engineering and Integration Team (SEIT) is the central focus for concept development, trade studies, systems architecture development, and systems integration and test activities for customized engineering services and products. We develop solutions to solve customer needs as well as plan future capabilities and technology roadmaps.  The Intelligence Information and Services (IIS) C2, Space and Intelligence Solutions mission area is seeking a Systems Integration and Test Engineer for programs to modernize and maintain satellite ground segments.As a Software Systems Integration and Test Engineer your duties will include but not be limited to the following: Support the planning and conduct of Test activities; define test plans and sequences relative to complex software and hardware subsystems and resolves identified conflicting issues. Participate in a complex testing program; establish methods and techniques, plan tests, develop test requirements, write test procedures and reports, and conduct tests utilizing comprehensive knowledge of these complex subsystems. Participate in integration and test readiness reviews, design reviews, and audits of integration and test programs and facilities. Utilize broad knowledge in test engineering and apply understanding of principles of related engineering and software technology to ensure test validity and integrity.This position is eligible for a Sign on Bonus of up to 40k for a candidate with a current TS/SCI that can be verified and hired at Raytheon.Required Skills:Current/Active TS/SCI with CI Poly clearanceBachelor degree and at least 2+ years demonstrated engineering experience with proven track record.Integration and test engineering experience on a software development contractExperience preparing and executing Integration proceduresExperience with test script or automation developmentEnthusiastic & energetic performer able to work in a dynamic, fast-paced, & high visibility environmentSelf-motivated and capable of performing tasks with minimal oversightExperience with systems engineering principles and activitiesDesired Skills:Experience working in a Satellite Ground System development or operations environment Experience with ground station satellite domains (command and telemetry, or mission planning) Scripting (Python, Perl, Unix) Experience in an Agile or DevOps development environment. Proficiency with Windows and Linux operating system Experience with Java or C++Education Requirements: BS in Engineering, Science, or Mathematics, or equivalent education and 2+ years of related work experience. This position requires a U.S. Person who is eligible to obtain any required Export Authorization  152836
Business Unit Profile
                        
                        Intelligence, Information and Services delivers innovative technology to make the world a safer place. Our expertise in cyber, analytics and automation allow us to reach beyond what others think is possible to underpin national security and give our global customers unique solutions to solve the most pressing modern challenges -- from the cyber domain to automated operations, and from intelligent transportation and training solutions to creating clear insight from large volumes of data. IIS operates at nearly 550 sites in 80 countries, and is headquartered in Dulles, Virginia. The business area generated $6.2 billion in 2018 revenues. As a global business, our leaders must have the ability to understand, embrace and operate in a multicultural world -- in the marketplace and the workplace. We strive to hire people who reflect our communities and embrace diversity and inclusion to advance our culture, develop our employees, and grow our business.
Relocation Eligible 
                        
                        Yes
Clearance Type 
                        
                        TS/SCI with CI Poly - Current

            Customer Service Representative I



         Login to apply
    
















Customer Service Representative I
Waltham, MA 


As a Customer Service Representative I, you will be responsible for responding to inbound customer inquiries via telephone and email communications. You will be guiding customers through the resident screening process by providing administrative support (e.g., resetting passwords), explaining the dispute process, processing re-evaluations, resolving customer problems through research and troubleshooting, and documenting customer communications within the company’s CRM system. You will also respond to frequently requested customer inquiries, problems, and general questions.
 
ESSENTIAL RESPONSIBILITIES

Answer customer inquiries by clarifying desired information, researching, locating, and providing information.
Resolve customer problems by researching and exploring answers and alternative solutions, implementing solutions and escalating unresolved problems.
Document customer interactions with details of inquiries, as well as actions taken within the company’s CRM system.
Handle customer calls efficiently, effectively and professionally when responding to customers’ requests and challenging customer situations or responses.
Understand and comply with company resident screening practices, safeguards, policies and legal compliance regulations.
Meet company-established customer service standards for service (e.g., first call resolution).
Achieve productivity standards while maintaining the highest level of customer service (e.g., meets or exceeds all departmental goals).
Escalate unresolved customer questions, issues or complaints to appropriate individual(s) for quick resolution.
Use computer systems to track and gather information and/or troubleshoot customer issues.

 
EDUCATION/QUALIFICATIONS/EXPERIENCE
Required

Demonstrates excellent written and verbal communication skills
Professional phone demeanor skills
Proficiency in Microsoft Word and Excel
Ability to meet critical deadlines and prioritize multiple tasks in a fast-paced environment
High attention to detail and strong organizational skills
Excellent data entry skills with attention to speed and detail
Proven ability to maintain cooperative working relationships with other staff
Above average computer skills and aptitude for learning new applications
Ability to manage discreet and sensitive information
Proven ability to utilize training and job aids to quickly answer customer questions or resolve problems
Regular attendance and a regular work schedule is an essential function of this job

 
Preferred

2-year college degree or equivalent experience
2 years minimum customer support or customer facing experience
Experience using a customer service (“CRM”) system
 



         Login to apply

By continuing to browse this site you agree to our use of cookies. You can find out more about which cookies we are using or switch them off in settings.
 

 
Accept

 


















 

 Privacy Overview


 Strictly Necessary Cookies


 3rd Party Cookies




 








Privacy Overview

This website uses cookies so that we can provide you with the best user experience possible. Cookie information is stored in your browser and performs functions such as recognising you when you return to our website and helping our team to understand which sections of the website you find most interesting and useful.
You can adjust all of your cookie settings by navigating the tabs on the left hand side.



 
Strictly Necessary Cookies

Strictly necessary cookies must be enabled at all times in order to login and apply to openings.



disable









If you disable this cookie, we will not be able to save your preferences and you will not be able to login to apply for openings. This means that every time you visit this website you will need to enable or disable cookies again.







3rd Party Cookies

This website uses Google Analytics to collect anonymous information such as the number of visitors to the site, and the most popular pages.
Keeping this cookie enabled helps us to improve our website.



disable









Please enable Strictly Necessary Cookies first so that we can save your preferences!












Enable All
Save Changes

ABOUT INOGEN Inogen was founded in 2001 to improve quality of life and increase freedom and independence for oxygen therapy users. Inogen is innovation in oxygen therapy. The Inogen mission is to improve freedom and independence for oxygen therapy patients through innovative products and services. Inogen is a manufacturer and Accredited Homecare Provider.
Inogen is focused on quality care, continuous improvement, and outstanding customer satisfaction. We are a stable, USAbased company dedicated to providing an exciting and rewarding career to our employees. We completed a successful Initial Public Offering on the NASDAQ in 2014 and have demonstrated substantial growth over the last five years. Our work environment is casual yet highperforming, and we are looking for seriously talented, motivated, and fast-paced professionals to join our team.
JOB DESCRIPTION The role of a Reimbursement Denials Advocate is key to optimizing cash collection.  By diligently working claim denials, research, and submitting appeal packages with the highest level of accuracy, the successful candidate will achieve their goals as well as contribute to the team's goals.
Our Billing team is focused on continuous improvement so we welcome deep thinkers who analyze the root cause and recommend corrective action.
Are you a go-getter, energetic, and persuasive individual that enjoys problem solving?  Have you spent 1-3 years in the healthcare billing arena?  If that is you, let us know!
Key Competencies:
Detail-oriented with focus on accuracy.
Analytical and able to find root cause
Ability to multitask with software – manage multiple systems including CRM, Fastrack, Endeavor, MVP, Paypal and Call on Demand phone system in a fast-paced environment
Successful and timely submission of appeals and other insurance claims
Demonstrated ability to consulting with physicians and hospital referral sources is preferred

Qualifications:
1 year of billing experience required
3 years of Medicare and insurance billing preferred in Oxygen or HME/DME
1-3 years appeals experience a plus
A complete understanding of Medicare program rules is preferred
Experience with Fastrack, BrightTree, Oracle, and/or Excel preferred
Bachelor's degree preferred
All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, pregnancy, marital status, national origin, citizenship status, disability, military status, genetic predisposition or carrier status or any other legally protected characteristic.
 
WHY INOGEN Inogen is a dynamic company that is not only focused on quality care of patients, but is also committed to being a top employer.  Each of Inogen's offices has a casual culture that supports employees being responsible and developing professionals.
 
We offer competitive salaries and a robust benefit package:
• Employee Stock Purchase Plan • 401 (K) plan available for all employees • Health, dental, vision insurance • Flexible spending accounts and wellness discount program • Life Insurance • Long Term Disability • Robust paid time off and 8 paid holidays • Employee Assistance Program
 
Inogen – Where we go to work hard to positively impact people's lives
 
See the Inogen Team in action:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dKoTMeJf5J4#t=23
 
Inogen is an equal opportunity employer.  We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other legally protected characteristics. The EEO is the Law poster and its supplement are available here: http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/ofccpost.htm; http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/OFCCP_EEO_Supplement_Final_JRF_QA_508c.pdf.  The pay transparency policy is available here: http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/pdf/EO13665_PrescribedNondiscriminationPostingLanguage_JRFQA508c.pdf. 
Inogen is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities.  If you need a reasonable accommodation because of a disability for any part of the employment process, please send an e-mail to recruiting@inogen.net or call (972) 616-5668 and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information.

If you’re ready to take on a fresh challenge, grow your career and contribute to making the world a safer place, Raytheon is ready to help you achieve your goals. Join our team and get the opportunity and support to find purpose, thrive and succeed.





Notice: Please be aware of suspicious recruiting emails and text messages that attempt to collect your confidential information. Raytheon conducts all electronic correspondence using e-mail addresses that end in “Raytheon.com”, “Raytheon.co.uk”, “Raytheon.com.au” or “brassring.com”. To report fraud please go to: https://www.ic3.gov.











Network Engineer
Aurora, Colorado


Apply





Overview
Success Profile
Trending
Rewards
Responsibilities




Overview

Raytheon delivers innovative technology to make the world a safer place. Our expertise in cyber, analytics and automation allow us to reach beyond what others think is possible to underpin national security and give our global customers unique solutions to solve the most pressing modern challenges -- from the cyber domain to automated operations, and from intelligent transportation solutions to creating clear insight from large volumes of data. Our leaders must have the ability to understand, embrace and operate in a multicultural world -- in the marketplace and the workplace. We strive to hire people who reflect our communities and embrace diversity and inclusion to advance our culture, develop our employees, and grow our business.

Full-time
Entry to Senior level

Glassdoor 2017 Best Places to Interview: Candidate's Choice


Back to Job Navigation (Overview)

What does it take to be successful at Raytheon? Check out these traits to see if you have the right mix.

Raytheon: Bright Future in Aurora







Raytheon Secures Every Side of Cyber




Back to Job Navigation (Trending)


Rewards




401(k) / Retirement Plans
Employer Matching, if you elect to enroll company matches up to 3%.



Work / Life Balance
Raytheon appreciates work/life balance. Employees can work 9 hours a day every week and received every other Friday off, as long as departmental/manager approval is obtained. Accrued paid time off monthly and paid holiday time.



Career Development
At Raytheon, we foster an inclusive culture of professional development. We support a variety of developmental opportunities including: Mentoring programs, Skills Development, Leadership Development, Rotational job assignments, and Continuous Improvement, all of which contribute to advancement of our employee’s capabilities.



Paid Time Off
Accrue paid time off monthly. Receive 12 holidays per year including the week between Christmas and New Year’s Day.



Relocation Assistance
Select technical positions are eligible for relocation packages. See specific job description for eligibility requirements.



Parental Leave
Raytheon offers all eligible employees up to three weeks paid parental leave for the birth or adoption of a child (separate from paid maternity leave or Family & Medical Leave Act).



Back to Job Navigation (Rewards)



Responsibilities


Would you like to work in a collaborative environment at a state of the art facility in Colorado? Then join our team of engineers solving problems that make the world a safer place and help to secure our great nation! Come support those who provide us with all the freedoms we enjoy. Our facility in Aurora, CO offers amenities that create work and life balance. On site we have a 24/7 fitness facility, health center, cafeteria, collaboration rooms and dynamic break areas for easy conversation and socialization. Additionally, we provide employee appreciation lunches, bonus opportunities, and great benefits that include medical, dental, vision, 401K match, flexible work schedule - just to name a few.  Click here to view a brief video and learn more: https://youtu.be/YNuZN0vyzHgThe Intelligence, Information and Services (IIS) Raytheon Hardware and Infrastructure Engineering (HW&I) team has a professional Network Engineer opportunity available for the GPS OCX program. This position will perform network engineering tasks pertaining to detail design development, creating engineering design artifacts, hands on implementation and troubleshooting. Tasks include designing\\implementing switch, firewall, and router configurations. Individual should possess knowledge and experience with network technologies, services, operations, and associated security practices.DoD Secret Clearance is required.Required Skills:4+ years of relevant experience directly related to network engineering design In-depth understanding of network technologies and associated services, management, and security practices/techniquesProven communicator with Leadership, Peers and Subordinates Familiarity and ability to read, understand, and implement configurations of:Cisco ASA firewall experience with Contexts, filters, SSL VPNCisco ISR Router experience with GRE and IP Sec tunnels as well as ACLs, OSPF, NATs, HSRPCisco ACS RADIUS, RSA two-factor authenticationCisco LAN Core and Distribution switches, experience with ACL’s, routing, hardeningCisco Nexus experience with VPC Cognizant of network topologies as well as understand necessary configuration detailsFamiliar with TCP, and secure protocolsExperience with Data Center LAN design, Implementation, diagnostics, performance and management Must possess Secret DoD Security Clearance Desired Skills: Knowledge/experience with SAN implementations (iSCSI, Fiber Channel)Knowledge/experience with VMware implementationsKnowledge/experience with Security Technical Implementation Guides (STIGs) and Center for Internet Security (CIS) BenchmarksNetwork Certifications such as CCNP, CCNAExperience with Configuration ManagementRequired Education (including Major):Requires a degree in Science, Technology, Engineering or Mathematics (STEM) and 4 years of related work experience or an additional 14 years of related work experience in lieu of a degree 151563
                

                    
                 
                           Raytheon is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, age, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected Veteran status.

            Help Desk Representative



         Login to apply
    
















Help Desk Representative
Austin, TX 


The Helpdesk Representatives are responsible for real-time support of the day-to-day software operations for Yardi clients’ residential and commercial property sites.  As part of the Yardi Elevate team, the Helpdesk Representative will provide ongoing support to our clients during and after implementation of any Elevate product.  We are looking for entry level candidates that are driven, love solving problems, and are technically curious.  Yardi is an employee centered organization and offers a wonderful growth path from our Helpdesk roles to broader roles within our company.
 
RESPONSIBILITIES

Serve as an extension of the Yardi client’s helpdesk providing support to end users
Providing day-to-day support to client requests via direct chat, email or phone inquiries 
Responds to end user questions regarding Yardi’s Elevate suite of products.
Logs all calls and enters tickets into Yardi’s CRM tool for tracking and resolution
Guiding and training the clients on the use of the Elevate suite of products 
Researches, troubleshoots and resolves a variety of technical and data feed issues 
Providing quick and efficient responses to clients regarding multiple products 
Maintain an in-depth understanding of all Elevate products in a fast-paced environment 
Effectively communicating with clients, vendors, and other internal product teams 
Maintaining client confidence and protecting operations by keeping information confidential 

 
REQUIREMENTS

Bachelor’s degree, preferably in Math, Finance, Engineering, or related field 
Experience working in an inbound technical support center
Highly organized, with ability to manage multiple initiatives at once, prioritize the most    important initiatives, and communicate the reasoning as needed 
Ability to problem solve and enter documentation into a CRM tool
Ability to work collaboratively and constructively with others  
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Experience with Microsoft products – Word, PowerPoint, Excel, and Outlook 
Regular attendance and a regular work schedule are an essential function of this job 

 *ft

By continuing to browse this site you agree to our use of cookies. You can find out more about which cookies we are using or switch them off in settings.
 

 
Accept

 


















 

 Privacy Overview


 Strictly Necessary Cookies


 3rd Party Cookies




 








Privacy Overview

This website uses cookies so that we can provide you with the best user experience possible. Cookie information is stored in your browser and performs functions such as recognising you when you return to our website and helping our team to understand which sections of the website you find most interesting and useful.
You can adjust all of your cookie settings by navigating the tabs on the left hand side.



 
Strictly Necessary Cookies

Strictly necessary cookies must be enabled at all times in order to login and apply to openings.



disable









If you disable this cookie, we will not be able to save your preferences and you will not be able to login to apply for openings. This means that every time you visit this website you will need to enable or disable cookies again.







3rd Party Cookies

This website uses Google Analytics to collect anonymous information such as the number of visitors to the site, and the most popular pages.
Keeping this cookie enabled helps us to improve our website.



disable









Please enable Strictly Necessary Cookies first so that we can save your preferences!












Enable All
Save Changes

If you’re ready to take on a fresh challenge, grow your career and contribute to making the world a safer place, Raytheon is ready to help you achieve your goals. Join our team and get the opportunity and support to find purpose, thrive and succeed.

Sign-on Bonus up to $40K - Sr Software Engineer I
Aurora, Colorado


Apply





Overview
Responsibilities
Success Profile
Rewards
Trending




Overview

What does it take to make the world a safer place? It takes delivering innovative technology and collaborating with some of the finest talent in the engineering field. Whether you’re a software engineer or a field engineer, at Raytheon you’ll grow a varied and rewarding career. And you’ll be supported with a comprehensive and competitive benefits package that promotes work/life. If you’re ready to take on today’s big challenges, discover a world of opportunity at Raytheon.

America’s Best Large Employers by Forbes
Career & Development Opportunities
Full-time
Entry, Mid, Senior level




Back to Job Navigation (Overview)


Responsibilities


Would you like to work in a collaborative environment at a state of the art facility in Colorado? Then join our Raytheon team of engineers solving problems that make the world a safer place and help to secure our great nation! Come support those who provide us with all the freedoms we enjoy. Our facility in Aurora, CO offers amenities that create work and life balance. On site we have a 24/7 fitness facility, health center, cafeteria, collaboration rooms and dynamic break areas for easy conversation and socialization. Additionally, employee appreciation lunches, bonus opportunities, and great benefits that include medical, dental, vision, 401K match, flexible work schedule - just to name a few.  Click here to view a brief video and learn more: https://youtu.be/YNuZN0vyzHgThis position is eligible for a sign on bonus of up to $40k for a candidate with a current TS/SCI with Poly that can be verified and hired at Raytheon.The Apex program is looking for software engineers to support the ground-based mission planning and command and control software to accommodate the next-generation satellite capabilities, and implementation of new ground terminals. Our complex domain requires innovative solutions to meet evolving customer needs. On Apex you will work with teams of talented engineers to develop and improve advanced algorithms that handle large data sets with complex constraints. Apex software engineers will gain experience with the full software lifecycle including design, development, test, delivery, and maintenance. In addition to working with other software disciplines, our developers are exposed to various technologies including multi-tiered architectures, Camel, Spring, OSGi, and geospatial visualization tools. Our program is in the midst of transforming older software development practices into more modern development practices utilizing an agile framework - experience in this area is a plus. We provide robust and easy-to-use tools for reporting status and estimates to your agile team leadership - meaning more time for true problem solving. Our small development teams adapt to evolving problem sets, and engineers benefit from a flexible work environment where engineers can migrate between teams to contribute to new domains.This Software Engineer is responsible to:Develop code in compliance with requirements and defined architectureDevelop code in compliance with requirements and defined architectureSupport change request (CR) work-offSupport Test Engineering for integration and test activities and eventsParticipate in Change Request Review Board (CRRB), as neededOccasionally, provide support to operations (remotely and on-site), andOccasionally, provide input to cost estimation efforts for MCRs, ECPs, and proposals.Required Skills:Current/Active TS/SCI SSBI level clearance is required 4+ years of Software Development experience using object-oriented techniques4+ years of Java/C++ programming experienceProficiency in Windows, UNIX and/or LinuxKnowledge and understanding of software development life cyclesStrong oral and written communication skills; problem solving skillsDesired Skills: Familiarity with AgileFamiliarity with LinuxExperience with Software design tools such as Rational Rose, Rhapsody, ClearCase or comparable toolsExperience with requirements and use case analysisExperience with scripting (Ruby, Perl, Python, PHP, etc.)Experience with agile (Scrum, Kanban, Scrumban, SAFe, etc.)Experience and/or knowledge with DevOps and Continuous IntegrationExperience and/or knowledge with an Integrated Development Environment (IDE) like EclipseKnowledge and/or experience with mission management/scheduling/flight dynamics, to include: Satellite ground systemsMission Management systemsPlanning and Scheduling Command and Telemetry Flight Dynamics modelsDigital Signal Processing (FFTs, modulation/demodulation techniques)Knowledge of system integration and system testDemonstrated ability to effectively work with and communicate with all levels of management and individual contributors on the program teamProven written and oral communication skills, including presentation skillsExperience with Microsoft Office suite of toolsEngineering experience on a government software development contractExperience with complex satellite ground systems, particularly previous deployment of developed systems to ground station operationsExperience in architecture design/development of SW centric systemQualified Raytheon Six Sigma Specialist or equivalent. Education Requirements: Bachelor of Science, BS in Computer Science, Aerospace Engineering, Physics, Math.IISBONUS 149938
Business Unit Profile
                        
                        Raytheon Intelligence, Information and Services delivers innovative technology to make the world a safer place. Our expertise in cyber, analytics and automation allow us to reach beyond what others think is possible to underpin national security and give our global customers unique solutions to solve the most pressing modern challenges -- from the cyber domain to automated operations, and from intelligent transportation and training solutions to creating clear insight from large volumes of data. IIS operates at nearly 550 sites in 80 countries, and is headquartered in Dulles, Virginia. The business area generated $6.2 billion in 2018 revenues. As a global business, our leaders must have the ability to understand, embrace and operate in a multicultural world -- in the marketplace and the workplace. We strive to hire people who reflect our communities and embrace diversity and inclusion to advance our culture, develop our employees, and grow our business.

Quote



I joined Raytheon in 2016 and I’m proud to work here. My company makes some pretty amazing things, including missile defense, using data to predict the weather, and securing our GPS system. My company also works with artificial intelligence, machine learning and other innovative solutions. Rewards




401(k) / Retirement Plans
Employer Matching, if you elect to enroll company matches up to 3%.



Work / Life Balance
Raytheon supports a variety of flexible work arrangements including compressed work weeks, flextime, job sharing, 9/80, reduced hours and telecommuting.



Career Development
At Raytheon, we foster an inclusive culture of professional development. We support a variety of developmental opportunities including: Mentoring programs, Skills Development, Leadership Development, Rotational job assignments, and Continuous Improvement, all of which contribute to advancement of our employee’s capabilities.



Paid Time Off
Accrue paid time off monthly. Receive 10-12 holidays per year with some locations shutting down the week between Christmas and New Year’s Day.



Relocation Assistance
Select technical positions are eligible for relocation packages. See specific job description for eligibility requirements.



Parental Leave
Raytheon offers all eligible employees up to three weeks paid parental leave for the birth or adoption of a child (separate from paid maternity leave or Family & Medical Leave Act).



Sign-On Bonus
Qualified cleared engineers can receive an up to $40K sign-on bonus when they join our Engineering Team!



Student Loan Repayment Contribution
Through the 401(k), called the Raytheon Savings and Investment Plan, the company will make a dollar for dollar contribution for amounts employees spend repaying their student loans, up to their maximum match percentage.

Operations Manager (92618) - Richardson, TX - Inogen, Inc. Jobs








 














Home
Jobs




Operations Manager (92618) - Richardson, TX

Toggle navigation








Operations Manager (92618) 

JobsLogin 












 Operations Richardson, TX, USA Full Time 



Email Me Similar Jobs Email Me This Job



ABOUT INOGEN Inogen was founded in 2001 to improve quality of life and increase freedom and independence for oxygen therapy users. Inogen is innovation in oxygen therapy. The Inogen mission is to improve freedom and independence for oxygen therapy patients through innovative products and services. Inogen is a manufacturer and Accredited Homecare Provider.
Inogen is focused on quality care, continuous improvement, and outstanding customer satisfaction. We are a stable, USA based company dedicated to providing an exciting and rewarding career to our employees. We completed a successful Initial Public Offering on the NASDAQ in 2014 and have demonstrated substantial growth over the last five years. Our work environment is casual yet high performing, and we are looking for seriously talented, motivated, and fast-paced professionals to join our team.
JOB DESCRIPTION 
The Operations Manager manages the operations of all production areas to ensure that safety, quality, volume, and cost metrics are achieved. Plans and establishes work schedules, staffing requirements, and production sequences to maximize productivity. Provides production process analysis and makes recommendations on solutions to process improvements. Manages subordinate staff in the day-to-day performance of their jobs. 
Key Competencies:
Manage production facility and a team of supervisors in order to achieve production goals.
Estimate costs and prepare budget.
Propose, plan and execute cost reduction and productivity improvement projects.
Implement standard operating procedures and verify adherence.
Schedule work flow to maximize throughput reduce expenses and increase productivity.
Monitor quality standards.
Develop and mentor personnel in order to achieve performance goals.
Establish workflow policies and create training plans to cross train on critical skills. 
Root Cause analysis after quality issues are identified.
Operate within and verify adherence to FDA and ISO 13485 standards.
Maintain regular and punctual attendance. 
Comply with all company policies and procedures. 
Assist with any other duties as assigned. 
Do you possess these abilities?
Thorough knowledge of ISO, OSHA, and FDA standards.
Lean/Six Sigma experience.
Superior analytical abilities.
Excellent management skills, both of individuals as well as projects.
Must have strong work ethic.
Excellent oral and written communication skills required. 
Attention to detail is required. 
Effective conflict resolution. 
Analytical & problem-solving skills & ability to multi task. 
Solutions-oriented problem solver. 
Excellent planning, communication and organizational skills. 
Ability to effectively interface with different departments within the company. 
Requirements:
Bachelor's degree in Mechanical, Electrical, Systems Engineering, or related technical discipline, required.  
MBA or advanced degree in management or professional certification in manufacturing disciplines, preferred. 
7 years' experience in operations for a medical device manufacturing company, required. 
2 years management experience, with a minimum of five direct reports in a manufacturing environment, required. 
Six Sigma black belt, required.
Intermediate knowledge/proficiency in Microsoft Office, Oracle, Ultriva, required.
A combination of training, education and experience that is equivalent to the qualifications listed above and that provides the required knowledge, skills, and abilities.
WHY INOGEN Inogen is a dynamic company that is not only focused on quality care of patients, but is also committed to being a top employer.  Each of Inogen' s offices have a casual culture that supports employees being responsible and developing professionals.
We offer competitive salaries and a robust benefit package:
Employee Stock Purchase Plan 401 (K) plan available for all employees Health, dental, vision insurance Flexible spending accounts and wellness discount program Life Insurance Long Term Disability Robust paid time off and 8 paid holidays Employee Assistance Program
See the Inogen Team in action:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dKoTMeJf5J4
 
Inogen Where we go to work hard to positively impact people's lives
 
Inogen is an equal opportunity employer.  We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other legally protected characteristics. The EEO is the Law poster and its supplement are available here: http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/ofccpost.htm; http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/OFCCP_EEO_Supplement_Final_JRF_QA_508c.pdf.  The pay transparency policy is available here: http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/pdf/EO13665_PrescribedNondiscriminationPostingLanguage_JRFQA508c.pdf. 
Inogen is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities.  If you need a reasonable accommodation because of a disability for any part of the employment process, please send an e-mail to recruiting@inogen.net or call (972) 616-5668 and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information.
 
 

Inogen, Inc.

Sr Systems Engineer II
Marlborough, Massachusetts
