Overview

What does it take to make the world a safer place? It takes delivering innovative technology and collaborating with some of the finest talent in the engineering field. Whether you’re a software engineer or a mechanical engineer, at Raytheon you’ll grow a varied and rewarding career. And you’ll be supported with a comprehensive and competitive benefits package that promotes work/life. If you’re ready to take on today’s big challenges, discover a world of opportunity at Raytheon.

America’s Best Large Employers by Forbes
Career & Development Opportunities
Full-time
Entry, Mid, Senior level




Back to Job Navigation (Overview)


Responsibilities


Raytheon is a technology and innovation leader specializing in defense, security and civil markets throughout the world. Our latest company video is about our people, our technology, our vision, and the values we hold dear at Raytheon. Click here to view: https://youtu.be/qvbCgKpkEdsThis is a position for a System Engineer to join our team developing next generation air traffic systems.  Raytheon’s Air Traffic Systems (ATS) sub-mission area is a world leader in air traffic automation, surveillance and navigation, responsible for providing air traffic tools to air navigation service providers (ANSPs) around the world.  This position is for the AutoTrac III (AT3) program.From proactive cyber threat hunting to GPS-guided precision landing to enhanced mid- and long-range weather planning, Raytheon continues to pave the way for the data-driven, dynamic future of air travel. Our unique portfolio of automation, surveillance, navigation and landing solutions —backed by extensive cyber, analytics and software expertise— is improving safety and efficiency across more than two-thirds of the world's air space.Primary responsibilities include requirements development, system integration, formal test planning, procedure development, customer witnessed testing and reporting. Secondary responsibilities include supporting software development with an emphasis on system level integration and test. Regular duties include participating in requirements and design discussions and reviews, producing test artifacts, regression testing, black box testing, scenario development and characterizing system performance. Flexibility and the ability to adapt to change will be a key skill in the fast paced, dynamic and evolving air-traffic control program environment.Required Skills: Minimum of 6 years of applicable work experience and a BS in Science, Technology, Engineering, or Mathematics (STEM), or MS in STEM with 4 years of experience.Understanding of the systems engineering lifecycle and system level designExperience developing system and subsystem level requirements and designs for hardware and software implementations, performing system and/or subsystem level integration and test Effective communication skills, both oral and writtenExperience with UNIX or Linux operating systems, such as Oracle Solaris or Red Hat Enterprise LinuxThorough knowledge of Microsoft Office products (Word, Excel, Outlook, and PowerPoint)Able to travel, occasional travel in support of the programAbility to obtain and maintain a secret clearanceU.S. Citizenship is requiredDesired Skills: Experience solving complex problems in Weather or Air Traffic Control/Management SystemsExperience in the systems engineering, development and operation of Weather or Air Traffic Management SystemsExperience with system integration, formal testing, and characterization of system performanceWorking knowledge of DOORS and ClearCaseJava, XMLExperience in the systems engineering, development and test of Air Traffic Management SystemsFamiliarity with Agile lifecycle process including Scrum, Continuous Integration, and Test Driven Development MethodologiesEducation Requirements:Requires a degree in Science, Technology, Engineering or Mathematics (STEM) and minimum of 6 years of prior relevant experience This position requires either a U.S. Person or a Non-U.S. Person who is eligible to obtain any required Export Authorization. 151053
Business Unit Profile
                        
                        Raytheon Intelligence, Information and Services delivers innovative technology to make the world a safer place. Our expertise in cyber, analytics and automation allow us to reach beyond what others think is possible to underpin national security and give our global customers unique solutions to solve the most pressing modern challenges -- from the cyber domain to automated operations, and from intelligent transportation and training solutions to creating clear insight from large volumes of data. IIS operates at nearly 550 sites in 80 countries, and is headquartered in Dulles, Virginia. The business area generated $6.2 billion in 2018 revenues. As a global business, our leaders must have the ability to understand, embrace and operate in a multicultural world -- in the marketplace and the workplace. We strive to hire people who reflect our communities and embrace diversity and inclusion to advance our culture, develop our employees, and grow our business.

IT Business Analyst - Finance (84218 - B) - Richardson, TX - Inogen, Inc. Jobs








 














Home
Jobs




IT Business Analyst - Finance (84218 - B) - Richardson, TX

Toggle navigation








IT Business Analyst - Finance (84218 - B) 

JobsLogin 












 IT Richardson, TX, USA Full Time 



Email Me Similar Jobs Email Me This Job



ABOUT INOGEN Inogen was founded in 2001 to improve quality of life and increase freedom and independence for oxygen therapy users. Inogen is innovation in oxygen therapy. The Inogen mission is to improve freedom and independence for oxygen therapy patients through innovative products and services. Inogen is a manufacturer and Accredited Homecare Provider.
Inogen is focused on quality care, continuous improvement, and outstanding customer satisfaction. We are a stable, USA based company dedicated to providing an exciting and rewarding career to our employees. We completed a successful Initial Public Offering on the NASDAQ in 2014 and have demonstrated substantial growth over the last five years. Our work environment is casual yet high performing, and we are looking for seriously talented, motivated, and fast-paced professionals to join our team.
JOB DESCRIPTION 
As a member of the IT Business Analysis team, the IT Business Analyst will be a key finance functional resource supporting Inogen Oracle EBS system. Working under the direction of the Manager of Business Analysis, the Business Analyst will work closely with Business Stakeholders to develop business processes, collect business requirements, create technical designs, lead projects to implement the solutions and provide ongoing business system support.
Key Competencies:
Be the primary functional Analyst for the Inogen business systems, including: Oracle eBusiness Suite R12 and other enterprise-scale applications
Adept at determining requirements by interviewing business stakeholders, reviewing documentation and facilitating working sessions. 
Adept at creating business process models based on the requirements 
Adept at mapping industry trends and best practices to the Inogen's unique requirements and processes to determine applicable fit. 
Capable of defining, architecting and re-engineering business processes. 
Able to present proposed solutions to business stakeholders and management via whiteboard and PowerPoint. Translate Inogen business requirements into technical designs
Develop business reports, interfaces and module enhancements using Oracle & 3rd party development tools
Perform unit, integrated and functional tests and resolve issues found during testing
Troubleshoot and debug applications systems, reports and interfaces
Support & assist end users in the use of the Inogen business applications
Seek assistance from, and lead teams of application system vendor-partners to resolve support issues 
Work directly with Oracle Customer Support to resolve issues.
Do you possess these abilities?
Possess strong communication and training skills and be able to communicate technical information to non-technical users (Required)
Deep and broad working experience with using and configuring within Oracle eBusiness Suite R12.1.3, specifically in the following modules: 1. General Ledger including the Financial Statement Generator and Web ADI 2. Receivables 3. Payables 4. Fixed Assets 5. Cash Management 6. Advanced Collections 7. Asset tracking 8. Incentive Compensation 8) Purchasing (Required)
5 years of working Knowledge of corporate accounting best practices and processes and translating the processes into functional and technical system requirements (Required) 
Experience with configuring within Oracle eBusiness Suite R12.1.3, in the following modules: Depot Repair, Install base, Service Contracts, Asset Tracking, Inventory, Order Management, Advanced Pricing & Discrete Manufacturing.  (Desired)
5 years of experience with developing solution designs from business requirements (Required)
Excellent oral and written communication skills (Required)
Keen attention to detail (Required)
Outstanding teamwork skills (Required)
A great desire to learn new skills and technologies (Required)
5 years of experience leading project teams of in-house and vendor partner technical resources (Required)
Experience in medical device manufacturing business processes, specifically in asset tracking, inventory, and SKU management (Desired)
Knowledge in Business Intelligence, Oracle Reports, Discoverer, Master Data Management and EDI (Desired)
Requirements:
A Bachelor's degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Accounting, Finance or equivalent
5+ years finance functional support in design and test experience with Oracle eBusiness Suite, Reports, APIs and interfaces
 
WHY INOGEN Inogen is a dynamic company that is not only focused on quality care of patients, but is also committed to being a top employer.  Each of Inogen' s offices have a casual culture that supports employees being responsible and developing professionals.
We offer competitive salaries and a robust benefit package:
Employee Stock Purchase Plan 401 (K) plan available for all employees Health, dental, vision insurance Flexible spending accounts and wellness discount program Life Insurance Long Term Disability Robust paid time off and 8 paid holidays Employee Assistance Program
See the Inogen Team in action:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dKoTMeJf5J4
 
Inogen Where we go to work hard to positively impact people's lives
 
Inogen is an equal opportunity employer.  We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other legally protected characteristics. The EEO is the Law poster and its supplement are available here: http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/ofccpost.htm; http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/OFCCP_EEO_Supplement_Final_JRF_QA_508c.pdf.  The pay transparency policy is available here: http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/pdf/EO13665_PrescribedNondiscriminationPostingLanguage_JRFQA508c.pdf. 
Inogen is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities.  If you need a reasonable accommodation because of a disability for any part of the employment process, please send an e-mail to recruiting@inogen.net or call (972) 616-5668 and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information.

            Compliance Associate I



         Login to apply
    
















Compliance Associate I
Santa Barbara, CA 


The Compliance Associate will join Yardi’s “Know Your Client” or KYC team. This non-exempt position requires a regular weekday work schedule, reports to the legal department and works as part of a team that is responsible for:

On-boarding clients who license our property management software and tenant screening services to ensure we are meeting all federal and vendor regulatory requirements.
Monitoring and updating policies, procedures and best-practices to ensure the KYC process is effective, efficient and client-friendly.
Providing guidance to and interacting directly with Sales, other internal teams, and clients about the KYC process.
Learning and understanding KYC principles and trends and applying them as part of the collaborative KYC team.
Maintaining verifiable compliance records and responding to external and conducting periodic internal audits.
Providing general support to the company’s legal team as needed.

Requirements

Associates degree or equivalent work experience
Clear and concise verbal and written communication skills
High attention to detail
Strong organizational skills
Ability to multi-task
Ability to embrace and thrive in a process-driven environment
Excellent knowledge of Microsoft® Word, Outlook and Excel and willingness to learn and master proprietary software
Desire and ability to learn and develop regulatory compliance expertise
Friendly, collegial, team-oriented disposition!
Bachelor’s degree preferred
Regulatory or audit-related training or work experience, particularly in a regulated field such as financial services a plus
Basic contract interpretation and review experience preferred
Microsoft® OneNote and SharePoint experience a plus

*cl

By continuing to browse this site you agree to our use of cookies. You can find out more about which cookies we are using or switch them off in settings.
 

 
Accept

 


















 

 Privacy Overview


 Strictly Necessary Cookies


 3rd Party Cookies




 








Privacy Overview

This website uses cookies so that we can provide you with the best user experience possible. Cookie information is stored in your browser and performs functions such as recognising you when you return to our website and helping our team to understand which sections of the website you find most interesting and useful.
You can adjust all of your cookie settings by navigating the tabs on the left hand side.



 
Strictly Necessary Cookies

Strictly necessary cookies must be enabled at all times in order to login and apply to openings.



disable









If you disable this cookie, we will not be able to save your preferences and you will not be able to login to apply for openings. This means that every time you visit this website you will need to enable or disable cookies again.







3rd Party Cookies

This website uses Google Analytics to collect anonymous information such as the number of visitors to the site, and the most popular pages.
Keeping this cookie enabled helps us to improve our website.



disable









Please enable Strictly Necessary Cookies first so that we can save your preferences!












Enable All
Save Changes

If you’re ready to take on a fresh challenge, grow your career and contribute to making the world a safer place, Raytheon is ready to help you achieve your goals. Join our team and get the opportunity and support to find purpose, thrive and succeed.





Notice: Please be aware of suspicious recruiting emails and text messages that attempt to collect your confidential information. Raytheon conducts all electronic correspondence using e-mail addresses that end in “Raytheon.com”, “Raytheon.co.uk”, “Raytheon.com.au” or “brassring.com”. To report fraud please go to: https://www.ic3.gov.











Cyber Solution - Information Systems Security Engineer
Woburn, Massachusetts, Tewksbury, Massachusetts


Apply





Overview
Responsibilities
Success Profile
Rewards
Trending




Overview

What does it take to make the world a safer place? It takes delivering innovative technology and collaborating with some of the finest talent in the engineering field. Whether you’re a software engineer or a mechanical engineer, at Raytheon you’ll grow a varied and rewarding career. And you’ll be supported with a comprehensive and competitive benefits package that promotes work/life. If you’re ready to take on today’s big challenges, discover a world of opportunity at Raytheon.

America’s Best Large Employers by Forbes
Career & Development Opportunities
Full-time
Entry, Mid, Senior level




Back to Job Navigation (Overview)


Responsibilities


Cyber Solutions - Information Systems Security Engineer (ISSE) One global team creating trusted, innovative solutions to make the world a safer place…..Raytheon offers an innovative and inclusive culture; welcoming diversity and collaboration and providing numerous opportunities for career growth. The Systems Architecture Design and Integration Directorate (SADID) is the central focus for Mission Systems Integration activities within Raytheon’s Integrated Defense Systems (IDS). The more than 1,100 employees of SADID provide requirements definition and design at the system, subsystem and component level every day in a collaborative environment which is characterized by respect for the individual, problem solving in a team setting, consensus oriented solutions, and results based recognition. Supporting this mission are teams providing domain expertise and creative solutions in surveillance, naval and missile defense based radar system design, sonar and undersea sensor system design, integrated air and missile defense systems engineering, command and control/battle management system design, combat system and platform architecture design and integration, operational analysis and simulation modeling research and development, software intensive system engineering, cyber solutions and algorithm development for signal processing, tracking and discrimination systems. SADID welcomes you to join our tradition of achieving excellence through thought and team work while leveraging individual diversity conducive to a flexible work schedule and environment.Join this highly visible team and perform technically challenging assignments which will directly contribute to protecting our nation and our war fighters.Job Description:Are you interested in joining a dynamic, inclusive, and growing professional Cyber Security organization? Raytheon IDS created Cyber Solutions and Integration (CSI) to expand growth opportunities with a focus on system Anti-Tamper (AT) and Cyber Security architecture, requirements, design and implementation, as well as Cyber resiliency, threat awareness, and integration of Enterprise Cyber capabilities into IDS franchise solutions.  The CSI System Integrity Engineer will support programs, research efforts, and strategic initiatives in the areas of System Integrity, Cyber Technologies, and Information Assurance (IA).  Typical responsibilities will require providing technical expertise in a multitude of protection areas, leadership, consultation, guidance, and support on IDS technical initiatives, programs, and Business Development activities (to include solution development, compliance definition, threat and vulnerability determination).Required Skills:8+ years of Technical (hands-on) experience related to Information Assurance/Cyber Engineering requirements, determination, development, and implementationExperience in security systems engineering involving various computer hardware and software operating system and application solutions in both a stand-alone and in LAN/WAN configurationsExperience with security features and/or vulnerability of various operating systems as defined by NSA, NIST, DISA (STIGs) and USCYBERCOM. Experience with IA vulnerability testing and related network and system test tools; e.g., Retina, NMap, Nessus, Security Content Automation Protocol (SCAP)Experience with information security toolset including anti-virus, Vulnerability Assessment, HIDS/ NIDS  Active DoD Security Clearance (U.S. Citizenship status is required) or obtain within 1 year from start date.Desired Skills:Experience with network and system security administration, including operating system security configuration and account management best practices for UNIX (HP-UX & Solaris), MS Windows, Red Hat Enterprise Linux, and CISCO system. Understanding of Systems Engineering requirements, specifications, and Experience implementing DoD and Federal IA Certification and Accreditation Processes, IA controls and developing and maintaining associated certification and accreditation documentationDoDI 8570.01-M IAT Level-II Compliant CertificationAbility to organize, multi-task and prioritize tasks in a fast paced, deadline driven environment.Familiar with NIST Risk Management Framework as described in NIST Special Publication 800-37Familiar with Program Protection Plan (PPP) required by DoDI 5000.02 and DoDI 5200.39Security related Network (e.g., Cisco) and Operating Systems (e.g., Solaris) certification or trainingActive DoD Secret Clearance or greater Required Education:Bachelors of Science degree (BS) in Engineering, Mathematics, Computer Science, or other related field; advanced degree(s) preferredThis position requires the eligibility to obtain a security clearance. Except in rare circumstances, only U.S. citizens are eligible for a security clearance.What’s YOUR Mission?Here at Raytheon, we work together as one global team creating trusted, innovative solutions to make the world a safer place. Our innovation spans all domains: from land and sea to air, space and cyberspace. We’re inspired by a noble mission that’s shared by Raytheon employees around the globe and an inclusive culture that empowers employees and celebrates their contributions.What We Offer: Whether you’re just starting out on your career journey or are an experienced professional, Raytheon offers a robust total rewards package that goes above and beyond with compensation; healthcare, wellness, retirement and work/life benefits; career development and recognition programs. Some of the superior benefits Raytheon offers include paternal leave, flexible work schedules, achievement awards, educational assistance and child/adult backup care. Find out why Forbes ranks us among the top 500 of America’s Best Employers by visiting us online at www.raytheon.com .Stay Connected: Don’t miss out on what’s happening at Raytheon. Follow @Raytheon on Twitter Follow Raytheon on YouTubeFollow Raytheon on LinkedInFollow Raytheon Company on Instagram"Diversity is at the heart of all we do at Raytheon. We embrace diversity and diverse opinions; we treat people with dignity and respect to support our inclusive culture. This allows us to retain and attract the world-class talent and supplier base we need to develop the innovative solutions our global customers depend on. We view our diversity as a competitive advantage as a key enabler of our growth."- Thomas A. KennedyRaytheon Chairman and Chief Executive OfficerAll these job responsibilities are to be executed in harmony with Raytheon’s Code of Business Ethics and Conduct policy which sets the standard by which we operate and how we treat others.Raytheon is an equal opportunity employer and considers qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, creed, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, age, disability, or Vietnam era, or other eligible veteran status, or any other protected factor.This position requires either a U.S. Person or a Non-U.S. Person who is eligible to obtain any required Export Authorization. 148044
Business Unit Profile
                        
                        Raytheon Company, with 2015 sales of $23 billion and 61,000 employees, is a technology and innovation leader specializing in defense, civil government and cybersecurity solutions. With a history of innovation spanning 94 years, Raytheon provides state-of-the-art electronics, mission systems integration, C5ITM products and services, sensing, effects, and mission support for customers in more than 80 countries.

Quote



Felicia Jackson is regional vice president of RAYVETS, Raytheon's employee group for veterans and those who support them. After 24 years in the Air Force, she started a new career at Raytheon. "I wanted to go where people would support me," she told us.









Rewards




401(k) / Retirement Plans
Employer Matching, if you elect to enroll company matches up to 3%.



Work / Life Balance
Raytheon supports a variety of flexible work arrangements including compressed work weeks, flextime, job sharing, 9/80, reduced hours and telecommuting.



Career Development
At Raytheon, we foster an inclusive culture of professional development. We support a variety of developmental opportunities including: Mentoring programs, Skills Development, Leadership Development, Rotational job assignments, and Continuous Improvement, all of which contribute to advancement of our employee’s capabilities.



Paid Time Off
Accrue paid time off monthly. Receive 10-12 holidays per year with some locations shutting down the week between Christmas and New Year’s Day.



Relocation Assistance
Select technical positions are eligible for relocation packages. See specific job description for eligibility requirements.



Parental Leave
Raytheon offers all eligible employees up to three weeks paid parental leave for the birth or adoption of a child (separate from paid maternity leave or Family & Medical Leave Act).

Sr. Cyber Engineer II
Aurora, Colorado


Apply





Overview
Success Profile
Trending
Rewards
Responsibilities




Overview

Raytheon delivers innovative technology to make the world a safer place. Our expertise in cyber, analytics and automation allow us to reach beyond what others think is possible to underpin national security and give our global customers unique solutions to solve the most pressing modern challenges -- from the cyber domain to automated operations, and from intelligent transportation solutions to creating clear insight from large volumes of data. Our leaders must have the ability to understand, embrace and operate in a multicultural world -- in the marketplace and the workplace. We strive to hire people who reflect our communities and embrace diversity and inclusion to advance our culture, develop our employees, and grow our business.

Full-time
Entry to Senior level

Glassdoor 2017 Best Places to Interview: Candidate's Choice

Rewards




401(k) / Retirement Plans
Employer Matching, if you elect to enroll company matches up to 3%.



Work / Life Balance
Raytheon appreciates work/life balance. Employees can work 9 hours a day every week and received every other Friday off, as long as departmental/manager approval is obtained. Accrued paid time off monthly and paid holiday time.



Career Development
At Raytheon, we foster an inclusive culture of professional development. We support a variety of developmental opportunities including: Mentoring programs, Skills Development, Leadership Development, Rotational job assignments, and Continuous Improvement, all of which contribute to advancement of our employee’s capabilities.



Paid Time Off
Accrue paid time off monthly. Receive 12 holidays per year including the week between Christmas and New Year’s Day.



Relocation Assistance
Select technical positions are eligible for relocation packages. See specific job description for eligibility requirements.



Parental Leave
Raytheon offers all eligible employees up to three weeks paid parental leave for the birth or adoption of a child (separate from paid maternity leave or Family & Medical Leave Act).

Responsibilities


Are you ready to take on a fresh challenge, grow your career and contribute to making the world a safer place, Raytheon is ready to help you achieve your goals. Join our team and get the opportunity and support to find purpose, thrive and succeed.   Click here to view a brief video and learn more about our Aurora Campus: https://youtu.be/YNuZN0vyzHgRaytheon IIS is looking for an individual to join the Cyber Security Engineering team for a Cyber Security position in Information Assurance supporting the development/maintenance of custom solutions and Assessment & Authorization (A&A) activities.This position is located in Aurora, Colorado.Must be a U.S. CITIZEN with the ability to obtain a Top Secret/Sensitive Compartmented Information (TS/SCI) security clearance and agree to be subject to a Counter-Intelligence (CI) Polygraph examinationKey responsibilities include:Planning, scheduling, and executing Assessment & Authorization (A&A) activitiesSecurity compliance & vulnerability scanning/remediation across multiple platforms and networksPreparing for, supporting and/or leading Security Test & Evaluation activities for program sell-off of security related requirementsApplying knowledge of current IA policies as a contributor to the architecture and design of secure solutions to customer needs and requirementsPerforming hands-on technical implementation of security solutions comprised of COTS & FOSS as well as custom-developed productsPreparing for, writing, and presenting trade studies, cost benefit analyses, reports and briefings as requiredRequired Skills: Ability to obtain TS/SCI security clearance and agree to submit to a CI poly Six years of developing cyber security solutions, Security Authorization requirements, and security policy and emerging cyber security technologies for Department of Defense (DoD) or similar federal agencyExperience with cyber security engineering projects and programs for U.S. Government and/or commercial clientsStrong understanding of security design and architecture with ability to develop solutions to moderately complex IS compliance and security problemsExperience using security compliance/vulnerability assessment scanning toolHands-on technical experience as an individual contributor with documentation skills and experience in some of the following areas:Linux system administrationWindows system administrationNetwork component administrationVMware administrationOperating system hardeningAssessment and Authorization (NIST SP800-37, ICD 503)Developing System Security Plans (SSPs) and all supporting assessment and authorization documentationExperience performing vulnerability assessment/remediation including the coordination or performance of patch/configuration deployments across multiple platformsDemonstrated leadership experience with excellent interpersonal skillsExcellent written & oral communication skills, including presentation skillsSecurity Certification in accordance to DoD 8570.01 IAT-II or higher (e.g. Security+ CE, SSCP, etc.; CISSP is preferable)Desired Skills: Experience in systems engineering, life-cycle management, & engineering change proposal processesExperience planning, scheduling, and executing Assessment & Authorization (A&A) activities, including the development of System Security Plans (SSP) and other supporting documentation (SP800-37, ICD503 preferred)Experience and knowledge in onboarding, tuning and implementing enterprise security solutions (Tenable Security Center and Nessus, RSA NetWitness Security Analytics, and the DoD’s HBSS solution)COTS and FOSS patch management/deployment experienceExperience with highly ‘matrixed’ organizationsAbility to establish tasks and objectives with Lead Engineers and ensure the entire team understands and can work towards the vision and objectivesPrevious experience in Verification and Validation, and Assessment and AuthorizationExperience in proactively analyzing and resolving problems relating to operational considerations, engineering drawings and associated hardware in relation to repair activitiesEducation Requirements: Bachelor’s Degree in Science, Technology, Engineering, and/or Mathematics (STEM Degree) with 6 or more years of relevant experience - or Masters / PhD in Science, Technology, Engineering, and/or Mathematics (STEM Degree) with 4 or more years of relevant experienceThis position requires either a U.S. Person or a Non-U.S. Person who is eligible to obtain any required Export Authorization. 149038

            Associate Technical Account Manager



         Login to apply
    
















Associate Technical Account Manager
Salt Lake City, UT 


As an Associate Technical Account Manager for Breeze you will support Yardi clients via phone, email and live chat to provide support and client satisfaction.  Associate Technical Account Managers are organized, strong communicators who have a technical proficiency and have some knowledge of the Property Management industry and Yardi products.
Responsibilities

Implement Yardi Breeze by assisting clients with system setups, training and technical support
Research and troubleshoot escalated application issues
Maintain knowledge of Yardi products
Follow company policies to maintain SAAE16 and PCI compliance
Effectively communicate with the client, account management and other team members
Fulfill support inquiries requested by clients
Complete tasks in a timely in support of client expectations
Follow best practices for Yardi products and service support
As appropriate be available for clients during evenings, weekend and holidays

Requirements

Bachelor’s degree in Business or related degree or equivalent experience
Prior customer service support experience
Previous software of technical support experience desirable
Knowledge of generally accepted accounting principles desirable
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Ability to provide support via phone, email and live chat
Regular attendance and a regular work schedule is an essential function of the job

By continuing to browse this site you agree to our use of cookies. You can find out more about which cookies we are using or switch them off in settings.
 

 
Accept

 


















 

 Privacy Overview


 Strictly Necessary Cookies


 3rd Party Cookies




 








Privacy Overview

This website uses cookies so that we can provide you with the best user experience possible. Cookie information is stored in your browser and performs functions such as recognising you when you return to our website and helping our team to understand which sections of the website you find most interesting and useful.
You can adjust all of your cookie settings by navigating the tabs on the left hand side.



 
Strictly Necessary Cookies

Strictly necessary cookies must be enabled at all times in order to login and apply to openings.



disable









If you disable this cookie, we will not be able to save your preferences and you will not be able to login to apply for openings. This means that every time you visit this website you will need to enable or disable cookies again.







3rd Party Cookies

This website uses Google Analytics to collect anonymous information such as the number of visitors to the site, and the most popular pages.
Keeping this cookie enabled helps us to improve our website.



disable









Please enable Strictly Necessary Cookies first so that we can save your preferences!












Enable All
Save Changes

Manager, Brand Design

Department:
              Marketing
            
Location:
              Santa Barbara
            

Req#:
              5668
            

We are looking for a Manager, Brand Design to join our team. The ideal candidate is a passionate storyteller, strategic thinker, and skilled communicator who has a proven track record managing Brand Design, photography and film projects and delivering them across a global matrix.You are at once a Creative, Planner and Producer rolled into one.  A deep understanding of brand voice, tone, style and creative is essential, as you will be a shepherd of the Sonos brand voice.  You must demonstrate a clear ability to identify themes that require brand design attention and create long and short term plans to fill gaps in our identity. You will surface and share regional briefs with brand design leadership for QC.  You will partner closely with the planning and asset management team to insure directives result in quality regional work.   You will partner closely with internal comms to identify opportunities to strengthen the brand with employees.  You will lead NPI related creative projects.  An in-depth knowledge of music and entertainment culture, including how to manage talent in that world is a must, along with experience in producing photography and film content.




About You


More than a candidate that checks every box, we’re looking for people who are excited to work, learn, and grow at Sonos—no matter their background or how they identify. If that’s you, we hope you’ll apply for this role.
You want to be part of a team.
You come with new ideas and a unique point of view. You look forward to collaborating with a diverse team of individuals. You assume everyone’s best intentions, welcome a healthy debate, and embrace differing opinions. You eagerly seek and give help. Transparency tops your list of values, and you proactively contribute to a culture of respect and inclusion.
You enjoy a challenge.
Inquisitive and focused, you see every challenge as an opportunity. You’re ambitious and comfortable making mistakes because you learn from them and bounce back quickly. You would rather create the future than wait for it. You prioritize long-term value over short-term objectives.
You love to listen.
You approach every interaction with curiosity and a desire to understand. You want to make a positive impact in the world. You’re passionate about culture and know the power that music, film, podcasts, games, and stories have to bring people together.


What You’ll Do 

Builds and execute brand design strategies, managing brand development lifecycle both internally and externally.Identify and nurture key functions that require strong design directionWorks closely with Planning team to traffic information and communicate across regionsWork across Sonos teams to translate the company's strategy and business goals into themes that drive awareness and increase engagement and conversion.Ensure brand consistency across all channels and assets, maintaining high standards for qualityManage agency relationshipsPartner with internal comms to build the brand from the inside out.Lead all communication with international marketing leads on brand design priorities and best practices.Manage color palette, font and other licensed or revolving assets

Skills You’ll Need

Basic QualificationsBachelor’s Degree in Graphic Design, a related field or 5 years of relevant work experience in a creative production or marketing managementExtremely passionate and knowledgeable about graphic design, illustration, 3D design, marketing creative, asset management and social mediaAbility to successfully organize, prioritize and manage multiple projects under strict deadlines.Preferred QualificationsPassion, energy, and enthusiasm for brand building and consistency. Detailed knowledge and expertise around all formats (print, digital, motion, photo, copy) and social platforms.Excellent communication, collaboration, and planning skills with meticulous attention to detail.Expert in developing brand design strategies that are relevant to individual functions.Understand how updates are applied across various functions with diverse resources and timelines.You are at the cutting edge of the cultural zeitgeist; understanding how brands exist in culture and the minds of consumers.A passion for working in a fast-paced environment with high level of teamworkFlexibility to travel on short noticeDeep ability to collect, analyze and use data to affect change.

More About Sonos


Sonos is a sound experience company. We pioneered multiroom wireless audio, made it sound amazing, and changed the way people listen, making it effortless for them to enjoy what they want, where they want, how they want.
Today we continue empowering listeners by developing new technologies, thoughtfully designing products, expanding our software platform, and crafting brilliant sound experiences while participating in a culture that values respect, transparency, collaboration, and ownership.
Together we’re working to positively impact the world and inspire everyone to listen better—because listening brings people together, builds understanding, drives change, and makes us happier.
Notice to European Job Applicants: Information you submit as a part of your job application will be used in accordance with Sonos EU Job Applicant Privacy Notice.
Notice to U.S. Job Applicants: Sonos is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other legally protected characteristics.
Follow the links to review the EEO is the Law poster and its supplement. The pay transparency policy is available here. Sonos is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities. If you need a reasonable accommodation because of a disability for any part of the employment process, please send an e-mail to accommodations@sonos.com and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information.

Product Creation Leader

Department:
              Hardware
            
Location:
              Santa Barbara
            

Req#:
              5464
            

At Sonos, we're passionate about creating the ultimate listening experience for our customers. This experience is shaped by each of us: our ability to collaborate across different styles and skill sets, and our openness to new ideas. Each member of each team at Sonos offers different aspects of diversity that are embraced and celebrated, and we know that makes us stronger. We don’t just talk about building a diverse workforce - we are dedicated to making it a reality. We are looking for an inspiring technical leader to join us on this this journey in the role of Product Creation Leader. The Product Creation Leader (PCL) is a high-visibility role within Sonos.  Our PCL’s are responsible for leading a cross-functional product development team as they create the future of our smart speaker system.The PCL’s also serve as the representative of the technical development team to the rest of the company.  They guide and communicate team decisions, work through complex system trade-offs, manage risks, and drive technical issues to resolution.  They are the technical owners of a new product from conception to mass-production.




About You


More than a candidate that checks every box, we’re looking for people who are excited to work, learn, and grow at Sonos—no matter their background or how they identify. If that’s you, we hope you’ll apply for this role.
You want to be part of a team.
You come with new ideas and a unique point of view. You look forward to collaborating with a diverse team of individuals. You assume everyone’s best intentions, welcome a healthy debate, and embrace differing opinions. You eagerly seek and give help. Transparency tops your list of values, and you proactively contribute to a culture of respect and inclusion.
You enjoy a challenge.
Inquisitive and focused, you see every challenge as an opportunity. You’re ambitious and comfortable making mistakes because you learn from them and bounce back quickly. You would rather create the future than wait for it. You prioritize long-term value over short-term objectives.
You love to listen.
You approach every interaction with curiosity and a desire to understand. You want to make a positive impact in the world. You’re passionate about culture and know the power that music, film, podcasts, games, and stories have to bring people together.


What You’ll Do 

Partner with the Product Management team to help inform the vision and requirements for a new productAs a technical leader, you will be responsible for the product development team bringing a new product to market.You will inspire a high performing cross-functional team through charismatic and energetic leadership.You will keep the team on track, which means ensuring they are developing the right product within all the established program boundaries.You will communicate at many levels, to keep both your team aligned and senior Sonos leadership informed.

Skills You’ll Need

Qualifications:10+ years experience in consumer hardware product developmentDemonstrated success leading multi-disciplinary technical development teamsExperience driving products into high-volume mass productionPreferred Qualifications:Has a passion for creating great productsIncomparable drive, energy, and enthusiasmRelentless sense of ownership for the success of a project Strong knowledge of hardware development best practices in several of the following areas: Digital and analog electronics, radio and antenna design, mechanical engineering, transducer and acoustic system engineering, embedded firmware development, and industrial designKnows how to create and maintain good team chemistry to create high performing teamsUncompromising team work ethic. Able to travel within the US and Asia (sometimes with little notice)Strong verbal and written communication skillsExperience working with distributed teams

More About Sonos


Sonos is a sound experience company. We pioneered multiroom wireless audio, made it sound amazing, and changed the way people listen, making it effortless for them to enjoy what they want, where they want, how they want.
Today we continue empowering listeners by developing new technologies, thoughtfully designing products, expanding our software platform, and crafting brilliant sound experiences while participating in a culture that values respect, transparency, collaboration, and ownership.
Together we’re working to positively impact the world and inspire everyone to listen better—because listening brings people together, builds understanding, drives change, and makes us happier.
Notice to European Job Applicants: Information you submit as a part of your job application will be used in accordance with Sonos EU Job Applicant Privacy Notice.
Notice to U.S. Job Applicants: Sonos is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other legally protected characteristics.
Follow the links to review the EEO is the Law poster and its supplement. The pay transparency policy is available here. Sonos is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities. If you need a reasonable accommodation because of a disability for any part of the employment process, please send an e-mail to accommodations@sonos.com and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information.

If you’re ready to take on a fresh challenge, grow your career and contribute to making the world a safer place, Raytheon is ready to help you achieve your goals. Join our team and get the opportunity and support to find purpose, thrive and succeed.





Notice: Please be aware of suspicious recruiting emails and text messages that attempt to collect your confidential information. Raytheon conducts all electronic correspondence using e-mail addresses that end in “Raytheon.com”, “Raytheon.co.uk”, “Raytheon.com.au” or “brassring.com”. To report fraud please go to: https://www.ic3.gov.










Marketing Data Analyst – Communications
Apply
Requisition ID 151876BR Date updated 11/14/2019
.What's YOUR Mission?Here at Integrated Defense Systems (IDS), we work together as one global team creating trusted, innovative solutions to make the world a safer place. Our innovation spans all domains: from land and sea to air, space and cyberspace. We’re inspired by a noble mission that’s shared by IDS employees around the globe and an inclusive culture that empowers employees and celebrates their contributions.What We Offer: Whether you’re just starting out on your career journey or are an experienced professional, IDS offers a robust total rewards package that goes above and beyond with compensation; healthcare, wellness, retirement and work/life benefits; career development and recognition programs. Some of the superior benefits IDS offers include paternal leave, flexible work schedules, achievement awards, educational assistance and child/adult backup care.Job DescriptionAre you passionate about data? Do you enjoy working in collaborative and high energy environments? Are you the type of person that enjoys continuous learning and cross-functional collaboration? We seek an entrepreneurial data analyst to join our integrated communications team. Advising multiple internal and external campaign teams, you will provide analysis and insights that are instrumental to targeting audiences, developing and refining channel strategies and optimizing content. Leveraging a suite of analytics and reporting tools, you will help address the complex challenges of marketing effectiveness, ROI, audience behavior and campaign effectiveness while working closely with channel owners and campaign leads to monitor and analyze campaign outcomes. Additionally, you will serve on a cross-functional, cross-business, team of analysts charged with collaborating on the creation of new innovative solutions for your customers.Key Responsibilities will include: Data-Driven Counsel – provide data-driven counsel to improve effectiveness of employee engagement and external marketing campaigns.Audience Analysis – Create and maintain in-depth profiles on campaign audiences and their influencers.  Develop targeting recommendations based on audience research.Analytics Reporting – Develop standardized reporting to monitor and analyze channel effectiveness, audience sentiment and campaign return on investment (ROI).Channel Optimization – Collaborating with campaign channel leads, use data to refine channel strategies, test messaging and optimize marketing spend.Data & Reporting Tools Management – Lead department understanding, use and integration of data analysis, targeting and reporting tools.  Monitor data science trends, emerging tools and technologies to continually improve frameworks, processes and best practices. Competitive Research – Monitors competitor tactics and industry best practices to inform campaign strategies.Required Qualifications: Minimum 2 years of experience in data analysis or marketing research.Ability to create reports, templates and repeatable processes. Proficiency in Google Analytics, social media analytics, Excel and Microsoft Office suiteUS Citizenship status is required as this position may require the ability to access US only data systems.Desired SkillsExcellent communication skills, with ability to process and present complex information in a concise and compelling manner to non-technical audiences Ability and eagerness to learn, educate and mentor others Experience in diverse domains (marketing, communications, information technology, business development, human resources)Experience with Sprinklr, Datorama, Cision, BrightEdge and/or QuidMust be able to work both independently and as a member of a multi-functional team Defense industry experience a plusRequired Education:Bachelor’s degree in Statistics, Econometrics, Engineering, Computer Science, Finance, Mathematics or a quantitative degree in other social science or hard science fieldsThis position can be a Salary Grade G07 or Salary Grade G08 based on the candidate's qualifications as they relate to the skills, experience and responsibility requirements for the position. 151876
Business Unit Profile
            Headquartered in Tewksbury, Massachusetts, IDS has 32 locations around the world. Its broad portfolio of weapons, sensors and integration systems supports its customer base across multiple mission areas, including air and missile defense systems; missile defense radars; early warning radars; naval ship operating systems; C5ITM products and services; and other advanced technologies. IDS provides affordable, integrated solutions to a broad international and domestic customer base, including the U.S. Missile Defense Agency, the U.S. Armed Forces and the Department of Homeland Security.

Relocation Eligible 
            No

Clearance Type 
            None / Not Required

Expertise 
 
              Communications & Corporate AffairsData ScienceInformation and Knowledge SystemsMarketingPublic Relations
                
            

Type Of Job 
            Full Time


Work Location 
 
              MA - Tewksbury
            

Raytheon is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, age, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected Veteran status.

Work on interesting projects and enjoy plenty of recognition
Whether you’re just starting out on your career journey or a experienced professional, it’s important that you feel recognized and rewarded for your contributions.
Raytheon is proud to offer a comprehensive and competitive benefits package to you, your spouse and your eligible children. In addition to protecting you and your family's health and well-being, we offer important income and work/life benefits to meet your needs. Learn More





Turn unique thinking into one-of-a-kind solutions
Diversity. Every company likes to talk about it, but few have embraced it with quite the same commitment as we have here at Raytheon. As a result, diversity has become a competitive imperative and an integral part of our business model, particularly as we continue to grow internationally. Learn More








Work as one to make a difference to millions
Here at Raytheon, we innovate across all domains: from land and sea to air, space, and cyberspace.It’s innovation made possible by a strong internal culture and a vision that’s shared by Raytheon employees across the globe – a vision of one global team creating trusted, innovative solutions to make the world a safer place.             Associate Technical Account Manager



         Login to apply
    
















Associate Technical Account Manager
Atlanta, GA 


Associate Technical Account Managers at Yardi will provide consultative, implementation and technical support to a group of assigned Yardi clients in order to manage business operations and financial accounting functions in Yardi’s Voyager software.
Responsibilities

Implements the Yardi suite of software products by assisting clients with system implementation, training, and technical support
Researches, analyzes and resolves software issues
Supports software product customization based on client requirements
Performs data mapping and conversions
Performs system and business process reviews and other service reviews and makes recommendations on best practices
Works on a regular basis with Yardi internal resource teams to include: training, conversion, sales and development

Requirements

Bachelor’s degree in Economics, Business, Math, Statistics or Information Management preferred
Experience setting and managing client expectations
Superior verbal and written communication skills
Project Management, Accounting, or Property Management experience/background
Solid Proficiency in MS Office Suite and Outlook
Knowledge in three of the following areas: Property Management, Accounting, Microsoft Windows, Technical Support, SQL, HTML/ASP
Prior experience with property management software or real estate software highly desirable
Prior experience with Yardi software highly desirable
Regular attendance and a regular work schedule is an essential function of this job.

 
 *lw

By continuing to browse this site you agree to our use of cookies. You can find out more about which cookies we are using or switch them off in settings.
 

 
Accept

 


















 

 Privacy Overview


 Strictly Necessary Cookies


 3rd Party Cookies




 








Privacy Overview

This website uses cookies so that we can provide you with the best user experience possible. Cookie information is stored in your browser and performs functions such as recognising you when you return to our website and helping our team to understand which sections of the website you find most interesting and useful.
You can adjust all of your cookie settings by navigating the tabs on the left hand side.



 
Strictly Necessary Cookies

Strictly necessary cookies must be enabled at all times in order to login and apply to openings.



disable









If you disable this cookie, we will not be able to save your preferences and you will not be able to login to apply for openings. This means that every time you visit this website you will need to enable or disable cookies again.







3rd Party Cookies

This website uses Google Analytics to collect anonymous information such as the number of visitors to the site, and the most popular pages.
Keeping this cookie enabled helps us to improve our website.



disable









Please enable Strictly Necessary Cookies first so that we can save your preferences!












Enable All
Save Changes

Reimbursement Advocate  I (98084) - Richardson, TX - Inogen, Inc. Jobs








 














Home
Jobs




Reimbursement Advocate  I (98084) - Richardson, TX

Toggle navigation








Reimbursement Advocate  I (98084) 

JobsLogin 












 Billing Richardson, TX, USA Full Time 



Email Me Similar Jobs Email Me This Job



ABOUT INOGEN Inogen was founded in 2001 to improve quality of life and increase freedom and independence for oxygen therapy users. Inogen is innovation in oxygen therapy. The Inogen mission is to improve freedom and independence for oxygen therapy patients through innovative products and services. Inogen is a manufacturer and Accredited Homecare Provider.
Inogen is focused on quality care, continuous improvement, and outstanding customer satisfaction. We are a stable, USA based company dedicated to providing an exciting and rewarding career to our employees. We completed a successful Initial Public Offering on the NASDAQ in 2014 and have demonstrated substantial growth over the last five years. Our work environment is casual yet high performing, and we are looking for seriously talented, motivated, and fast-paced professionals to join our team.
JOB DESCRIPTION 
Reimbursement Advocate will work with Medicare, Medicaid, Commercial Insurance companies and customers to ensure medical claims are submitted timely, processed, and paid accurately. This includes working payor rejections and denials, obtaining qualifying documentation and authorizations, providing high level customer support, RUL's, updating patient file within all billing systems as required, and following all applicable compliance and regulatory processes, payor guidelines, and Inogen policies and procedures. 
Key Competencies:
Collect payments for outstanding open accounts receivable balances.
Works with Medicare, Medicaid, Commercial Insurance, and Private Pay to ensure medical claims are being processed timely and paid accurately. 
Must meet/exceed daily/weekly production & quality KPI standards.
Ensures all billing systems are updated timely with patient demographics, payer information, and notated appropriately. 
Analyzes payer claim rejections & denials to help determine root cause and prevention of future rejections & denials from reoccurring. 
Gathers, prepares, and submits required information and/or documentation to appeal claim denials.
Uses appropriate write off reason code(s) for writing off balances that are deemed uncollectable.
Responsible for assisting our patients, doctors, customers, and coworkers with billing inquiries at the highest-level support possible. This includes logging into phone queue and updating statuses appropriately. 
Ensures the billing of all claims via electronic or paper to Medicare, Medicaid, and Commercial Insurance payers are being submitted accurately and timely in accordance with Inogen's policy. 
Ensures RUL (Reasonable Usable Lifetime) patients exiting the monthly cap period are in a billable status. 
Responsible for working NME's (New Medicare Eligibility), Payor Changes, Pending Pick-ups, and Stop patients timely. Verifies and evaluates insurance benefits to determine the policy's compatibility with Inogen's services.
Ensures the timely procurement of all required documentation and obtain authorizations in order to prevent future denials.
Ensures that appropriate medical records are maintained according to HIPPA guidelines.
Ensures Inogen's compliance with all state and federal regulations.
Maintain regular and punctual attendance. 
Comply with all company policies and procedures. 
Assist with any other duties as assigned. 
Do you possess these abilities?
A comprehensive understanding of Medicare, Medicaid, and/or Commercial Insurance program rules as it pertains to DME billing.
Ability to take direction and communicate effectively with customers and employees at all level of organization.
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced and dynamically changing organization.
Must have strong work ethic.
Excellent oral and written communication skills required. 
Attention to detail is required. 
Effective conflict resolution. 
Ability to maintain confidentiality and exercise extreme discretion. 
Solutions-oriented problem solver. 
Excellent planning, communication and organizational skills. 
 
Requirements:
Operates at a task level.
Substantial supervision required.
High School diploma or equivalent, required 
0-2 years of Medicare, Medicaid and/or Commercial Insurance experience, required. 
1-year experience in oxygen or HME billing, preferred. 
Basic knowledge/proficiency in Microsoft Office, Oracle, Brightree, Salesforce and New Voice Media, preferred. 
A combination of training, education and experience that is equivalent to the qualifications listed above and that provides the required knowledge, skills, and abilities.
WHY INOGEN Inogen is a dynamic company that is not only focused on quality care of patients, but is also committed to being a top employer.  Each of Inogen' s offices have a casual culture that supports employees being responsible and developing professionals.
We offer competitive salaries and a robust benefit package:
Employee Stock Purchase Plan 401 (K) plan available for all employees Health, dental, vision insurance Flexible spending accounts and wellness discount program Life Insurance Long Term Disability Robust paid time off and 8 paid holidays Employee Assistance Program
See the Inogen Team in action:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dKoTMeJf5J4
 
Inogen Where we go to work hard to positively impact people's lives
 
Inogen is an equal opportunity employer.  We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other legally protected characteristics. The EEO is the Law poster and its supplement are available here: http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/ofccpost.htm; http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/OFCCP_EEO_Supplement_Final_JRF_QA_508c.pdf.  The pay transparency policy is available here: http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/pdf/EO13665_PrescribedNondiscriminationPostingLanguage_JRFQA508c.pdf. 
Inogen is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities.  If you need a reasonable accommodation because of a disability for any part of the employment process, please send an e-mail to recruiting@inogen.net or call (972) 616-5668 and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information.
 
 

Inogen, Inc.
https://inogen.applicantpro.com

If you’re ready to take on a fresh challenge, grow your career and contribute to making the world a safer place, Raytheon is ready to help you achieve your goals. Join our team and get the opportunity and support to find purpose, thrive and succeed.





Notice: Please be aware of suspicious recruiting emails and text messages that attempt to collect your confidential information. Raytheon conducts all electronic correspondence using e-mail addresses that end in “Raytheon.com”, “Raytheon.co.uk”, “Raytheon.com.au” or “brassring.com”. To report fraud please go to: https://www.ic3.gov.











Senior Systems Engineer (Linux/DevOps/Integration)
Herndon, Virginia


Apply





Overview
Responsibilities
Success Profile
Rewards
Trending




Overview

What does it take to make the world a safer place? It takes delivering innovative technology and collaborating with some of the finest talent in the engineering field. Whether you’re a software engineer or a mechanical engineer, at Raytheon you’ll grow a varied and rewarding career. And you’ll be supported with a comprehensive and competitive benefits package that promotes work/life. If you’re ready to take on today’s big challenges, discover a world of opportunity at Raytheon.

America’s Best Large Employers by Forbes
Career & Development Opportunities
Full-time
Entry, Mid, Senior level




Back to Job Navigation (Overview)


Responsibilities


Raytheon is a technology and innovation leader specializing in defense, homeland security, intelligence and other government markets throughout the world. With a history of innovation, Raytheon Intelligence, Information, & Services (IIS) provides state-of-the-art electronics, cyber capabilities, mission systems integration and other capabilities in the areas of sensing, effects, and command, control, communications & intelligence systems, as well as a broad range of mission support services.Raytheon Mission Technologies is seeking an experienced Linux Systems Integrator/Systems Engineer to join the engineering team supporting products and customer programs in the Herndon, VA corporate office. This exciting work involves the systems design, integration, and implementation of various infrastructure technologies across multiple platforms, products, and programs.  Raytheon Mission Technologies employs individuals who have a creative and forward thinking approach to product development and deployment.  If you enjoy helping customers solve their most challenging problems, are energized by a dynamic engineering environment that encourages technical curiosity, innovation, a readiness to learn and a desire to grow professionally, we would like to talk with you.This individual will be an integral member a small team of systems and software engineers who work closely together to devise creative solutions for challenging problems in a dynamic, collaborative environment.The position is located in Herndon, VA.Responsibilities will include, but are not limited to:Manage local and remote Linux/UNIX servers across multiple physical, virtual, IaaS cloud server environmentsDevelop and maintain highly available mission critical services through clustering, scaling, and load-balancing technologies Develop and maintain detailed backup, DR, and data resiliency strategiesDevelop and maintain real-time monitoring/alerting systems for system health statusTroubleshoot Tier 3/4 end user issues and system issuesProficient in full lifecycle management process and DevOps environmentsInterface with vendors and procurement teams to spec, purchase, and maintain hardware, licensing, and warranty information for systems hardware and softwarePerform system analysis to evaluate security levels, system utilization, and growth projections Research, test, and implement OS and application updates to maximize integrity and efficiency of the system Interface with other engineers and PMs in a dynamic integrated team environmentRaytheon Mission Technologies employs creative, technical thinkers. The ideal candidate will share these qualities.Required Qualifications:US CitizenActive Secret security clearance10+ years of professional, educational, or hands-on training experience in Linux systems administrationBachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or an IT-related fieldStrong skills in IT fundamentals including, but not limited to: server administration, networking, database support/administration, automation & scripting, system security, infrastructure support Proficiency in systems architecture, design, and implementationMust have experience working with the following: Server hardwareLinux-based operating systemsVirtualization technologiesStorage systemsNetworking (strong understanding of TCP/IP) COTS configuration & integration (including Web & Database services)System security (hardening & vulnerability analysis, RMF, SSPs)Proficiency in remote command-line administrationProficiency in at least one scripting/automation language (ex. Shell, Perl, Python)Must possess the ability to function in an environment with non-traditional implementations of standard COTS applications and hardwareExperience defining and developing requirements for technical projects Excellent interpersonal, time management, and organizational skills Excellent leadership skills and the ability to effectively interact and communicate with management, customers, and employees Must present a positive, professional attitude and demeanorMust demonstrate excellent communication skills, both written and verbalMust be willing and able to commute to local datacenter and customer locations as neededDesired Skills/Education:Active TS/SCI security clearanceTechnical certifications, especially in Linux, Network, & Security concentrationsExperience working with highly-available services and 24x7 operational environmentsExperience with virtualization technologies (hypervisor, paravirtualized, cloud, etc)Experience with Nagios or similar network monitoring tool suiteExperience with highly scalable paravirtualized IaaS cloud platform deployment technologies (ex. Docker, Kubernetes)Experience with hyperconverged hardware platforms (ex. Cisco UCS, Nutanix, etc)Experience with deploying secure web services (Reverse Proxies, TLS, CA certs, PKI, etc)Experience with hardware & software-defined networking (Cisco iOS, ACLs, Firewalls, SSL & IPSEC VPNs, routing)Experience with database constructs & queries (SQL, noSQL)Experience with Java, JavaScript, C/C++, and other OO & Procedural programming languagesExperience with RESTful API frameworks (DropWizard, Play!, Spark, SpringBoot)Experience with microservices frameworks & application developmentExperience with software development tools (Mercurial, Git, JDK, IntelliJ, PyCharm, Gradle)Experience and willingness to join off-hour technical support rotation 144145
Business Unit Profile
                        
                        Raytheon Intelligence, Information and Services delivers innovative technology to make the world a safer place. Our expertise in cyber, analytics and automation allow us to reach beyond what others think is possible to underpin national security and give our global customers unique solutions to solve the most pressing modern challenges -- from the cyber domain to automated operations, and from intelligent transportation and training solutions to creating clear insight from large volumes of data. IIS operates at nearly 550 sites in 80 countries, and is headquartered in Dulles, Virginia. The business area generated $6.2 billion in 2018 revenues. As a global business, our leaders must have the ability to understand, embrace and operate in a multicultural world -- in the marketplace and the workplace. We strive to hire people who reflect our communities and embrace diversity and inclusion to advance our culture, develop our employees, and grow our business.
Relocation Eligible 
                        
                        Yes
Clearance Type 
                        
                        Secret - Current
Expertise 
                        

                                
                            AlgorithmsCloud ComputingComputer EngineeringComputer ScienceComputer/Management Information SystemsData NetworkingData ScienceEngineering TechnologyGeneral ManagementInformation and Knowledge SystemsSoftware EngineeringSystems Engineering

Raytheon is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, age, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected Veteran status.

Back to Job Navigation (Success)


Quote



Felicia Jackson is regional vice president of RAYVETS, Raytheon's employee group for veterans and those who support them. After 24 years in the Air Force, she started a new career at Raytheon. "I wanted to go where people would support me," she told us.









Rewards




401(k) / Retirement Plans
Employer Matching, if you elect to enroll company matches up to 3%.



Work / Life Balance
Raytheon supports a variety of flexible work arrangements including compressed work weeks, flextime, job sharing, 9/80, reduced hours and telecommuting.



Career Development
At Raytheon, we foster an inclusive culture of professional development. We support a variety of developmental opportunities including: Mentoring programs, Skills Development, Leadership Development, Rotational job assignments, and Continuous Improvement, all of which contribute to advancement of our employee’s capabilities.



Paid Time Off
Accrue paid time off monthly. Receive 10-12 holidays per year with some locations shutting down the week between Christmas and New Year’s Day.



Relocation Assistance
Select technical positions are eligible for relocation packages. See specific job description for eligibility requirements.



Parental Leave
Raytheon offers all eligible employees up to three weeks paid parental leave for the birth or adoption of a child (separate from paid maternity leave or Family & Medical Leave Act).
