Global Category Planner

Department:
              Business Operations
            
Location:
              Santa Barbara
            

Req#:
              5672
            

Sonos is a fast growing global enterprise and an established brand that combines innovation with lifestyle, with huge momentum on its journey to a simple, but far reaching vision – to fill every home with music.  In line with this ambition and the resulting growth plans, there is a continuous need for Sonos to invest in its organization across the globe, thus growing the level of professionalism, talent and experience within the Company. At Sonos, the Global Operations team is responsible for all global Supply Chain, Customer Service and Business Operations activities required to serve to its global sales channels and end user customers within best in class product delivery and after sales service levels and against lowest possible levels of cost and inventory.Within Global Operations, the Global Planning team has responsibility for the End to End balancing of Consumer and Channel Partner Demand with Supply.    This includes the responsibility to secure product availability against agreed Service Levels, through the careful management of Product Supply plans, as well as through the maintenance of overall Sonos and Sales Channel Inventory levels against agreed business targets.  This position also includes responsibility for coordinating new product launch activities, end of life production plans and channel transitions.Aligned to its vision to listen better and its culture of continuous innovation, Sonos is investing significantly in the expansion of its product portfolio. This results in a continuous flow of new product introductions as well as product refresh, upgrade and transition projects. The need to manage these projects effectively and efficiently adds significant responsibility and complexity to the activities of the Global Planning team.Working closely with Sales, Product Marketing, Product Management, Customer Services and the Supply Chain Operations team, the Global Category Planner is the central point of coordination for the end to end planning of Demand, Supply and Inventory for a specific product category of the Sonos product portfolio.




About You


More than a candidate that checks every box, we’re looking for people who are excited to work, learn, and grow at Sonos—no matter their background or how they identify. If that’s you, we hope you’ll apply for this role.
You want to be part of a team.
You come with new ideas and a unique point of view. You look forward to collaborating with a diverse team of individuals. You assume everyone’s best intentions, welcome a healthy debate, and embrace differing opinions. You eagerly seek and give help. Transparency tops your list of values, and you proactively contribute to a culture of respect and inclusion.
You enjoy a challenge.
Inquisitive and focused, you see every challenge as an opportunity. You’re ambitious and comfortable making mistakes because you learn from them and bounce back quickly. You would rather create the future than wait for it. You prioritize long-term value over short-term objectives.
You love to listen.
You approach every interaction with curiosity and a desire to understand. You want to make a positive impact in the world. You’re passionate about culture and know the power that music, film, podcasts, games, and stories have to bring people together.


What You’ll Do 

Working closely with Product Marketing, Sales and the Supply Chain teams, the Global Category Planner is responsible to develop and maintain end to end product plans across the product lifecycles of his/her product category, containing long term sourcing and production capacity requirements, inventory and sales projections.Working closely together with the Regional Demand Planners as well as the Supply Planning team, the Category Planner actively supports the weekly & monthly Supply & Demand Balancing cycle and translation of Sales Forecasts into clear supply plans, material sourcing plans, inventory projections, product availability service levels and allocations, for his/her product category.The Category Planner has responsibility for managing the alignment of Demand and Supply, including projected finished goods inventory, and all analytics and reporting relevant to their product category in the Anaplan system.As member of the Integrated Business Planning organization and Global Planning team, the Global Category PlannerConducts various analysis both on own initiative and on request from the wider Global Operations organization to support decision making around product category related topics.Takes a leadership role in the development and implementation of a best in class planning infrastructure of business processes, operating practices and tools.Generates relevant business scenarios and risk mitigation plans for their assigned product category, and presents recommended supply/demand action plans to drive the monthly Sales & Operations Planning Decision cycle.Working in concert with the product development program teams, the Global Category Planner is responsible for managing the transition of New Products from the ramp phase to launch execution and sustaining mode. The Global Category Planner orchestrates End of Life planning activities, including EOP allocation setting, facilitating EOP decision process, EOP planning, managing inventory transition plans of both Components and Finished Good products across the Sonos Supply Chain and the global Sonos Sales channels.

Skills You’ll Need

QualificationsBSc degree in Business Management, Statistics, Logistics or Finance preferred.  5 – 7 years of experience in a complex Global Product Management, Business Operations Planning or Supply Chain Operations environment, in the High Tech, Consumer Electronics or Luxury Consumer Goods sector. Solid experience to conduct complex analysis and turn large data sets into meaningful business information .Experience in business process improvement projects as well as program and project management. Experienced in - as well as flexible to - working across regions, cultures and time zones.  Intelligent and ambitious personality with attention to detail and excellent analytic skills. Preferred QualificationsDevoted customer oriented attitude. Excellent team worker and communicator. Ability to turn complexity into simplicity. Stress resistant, independent and self starter. Advanced skills Microsoft Excel, Access and proficient in, Word, PowerPoint, Share Point; experience with Business Intelligence tools and ERP / Databases preferred. Anaplan experience preferred.

More About Sonos


Sonos is a sound experience company. We pioneered multiroom wireless audio, made it sound amazing, and changed the way people listen, making it effortless for them to enjoy what they want, where they want, how they want.
Today we continue empowering listeners by developing new technologies, thoughtfully designing products, expanding our software platform, and crafting brilliant sound experiences while participating in a culture that values respect, transparency, collaboration, and ownership.
Together we’re working to positively impact the world and inspire everyone to listen better—because listening brings people together, builds understanding, drives change, and makes us happier.
Notice to European Job Applicants: Information you submit as a part of your job application will be used in accordance with Sonos EU Job Applicant Privacy Notice.
Notice to U.S. Job Applicants: Sonos is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other legally protected characteristics.
Follow the links to review the EEO is the Law poster and its supplement. The pay transparency policy is available here. Sonos is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities. If you need a reasonable accommodation because of a disability for any part of the employment process, please send an e-mail to accommodations@sonos.com and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information.

            Category Manager



         Login to apply
    
















Category Manager
Austin, TX 


The Category Manager is responsible for the daily operations of assigned manufacturers and suppliers within the Office Product category.  This includes: account setup/maintenance, managing catalog data, resolving escalated order management issues, assisting in enhancing manufacturer/supplier relationships and identifying both positive and negative supplier performance trends.  The Manager will be required to pull, analyze and share data with manufacturer/vendor partners and Yardi team members.
 The category Manager is also required to be the resident expert in product knowledge for the Office Product category, but this knowledge can be developed internally.  The success of this role will be measured by the performance of: the Office Product category, suppliers and their corresponding metrics, overall customer satisfaction ratings of Yardi Marketplace, and finally the evaluation of Operations Team leadership.
 
Responsibilities

Act as the point person for Yardi Marketplace to manage the given suppliers and manufacturers
Proactively communicate with internal and external parties regarding escalated client/supplier issues
Recommend products for addition and deletion to the Yardi Marketplace catalog
Gather, consolidate, and maintain required product data for YMP catalog
Manage product substitutions, update catalog for discontinued products
Proactively work with vendors and distributors to enhance and update product presentation within Yardi Marketplace online catalog
Determine order status on errant or delayed orders
Identify systematically under-performing suppliers, document issues
Proactively manage logistics of large or otherwise complex orders
Complete product cross-matching
Develop strong product knowledge
Cross-match competitor and other product descriptions to correct Yardi Marketplace products
Leverage partners as necessary to assist with the same
Exercises independent judgment and decision making as it relates to affecting, interpret and implement operating policies
Carries out major assignments and special projects in conducting operations that affects said operations to a substantial degree
Provides consultation to management
Investigates and resolves matters of significance
Represents the company in handling complaints, arbitrating disputes or resolving grievances
Ad hoc data reporting and distribution

 
Requirements

2-3 years of category buying/pricing/operational experience or degree and years of experience equivalent
Ability to complete tasks and projects within short deadlines
Proven capability to execute on multiple projects simultaneously
Extremely detail oriented
Strong proficiency with MS Excel, intermediate proficiency with other MS Office applications.
High degree of comfort with using technology and systems to present to vendors, clients, and colleagues
Excellent verbal and written communication skills as well as being a team player
Good working knowledge of MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint and screen capture editing tools
Proven track record delivering company critical projects on time
Bachelor’s degree required
Office product experience preferred
Electronic Procurement system/integration experience desired
Pricing and/or operational experience preferred
A passion for technology and strong problem-solving skills preferred
Working on department level projects a plus
Excellent written and spoken communication skills desired
Strong sense of customer service with good analytical and organizational skills a plus
Regular attendance and a regular work schedule is an essential function of this job

*ft

Privacy Overview

This website uses cookies so that we can provide you with the best user experience possible. Cookie information is stored in your browser and performs functions such as recognising you when you return to our website and helping our team to understand which sections of the website you find most interesting and useful.
You can adjust all of your cookie settings by navigating the tabs on the left hand side.



 
Strictly Necessary Cookies

Strictly necessary cookies must be enabled at all times in order to login and apply to openings.



disable









If you disable this cookie, we will not be able to save your preferences and you will not be able to login to apply for openings. This means that every time you visit this website you will need to enable or disable cookies again.







3rd Party Cookies

This website uses Google Analytics to collect anonymous information such as the number of visitors to the site, and the most popular pages.
Keeping this cookie enabled helps us to improve our website.



disable









Please enable Strictly Necessary Cookies first so that we can save your preferences!

Reimbursement Advocate  I  (93405) - Richardson, TX - Inogen, Inc. Jobs








 














Home
Jobs




Reimbursement Advocate  I  (93405) - Richardson, TX

Toggle navigation








Reimbursement Advocate  I  (93405) 

JobsLogin 












 Billing Richardson, TX, USA Full Time 



Email Me Similar Jobs Email Me This Job



ABOUT INOGEN Inogen was founded in 2001 to improve quality of life and increase freedom and independence for oxygen therapy users. Inogen is innovation in oxygen therapy. The Inogen mission is to improve freedom and independence for oxygen therapy patients through innovative products and services. Inogen is a manufacturer and Accredited Homecare Provider.
Inogen is focused on quality care, continuous improvement, and outstanding customer satisfaction. We are a stable, USA based company dedicated to providing an exciting and rewarding career to our employees. We completed a successful Initial Public Offering on the NASDAQ in 2014 and have demonstrated substantial growth over the last five years. Our work environment is casual yet high performing, and we are looking for seriously talented, motivated, and fast-paced professionals to join our team.
JOB DESCRIPTION 
Reimbursement Advocate will work with Medicare, Medicaid, Commercial Insurance companies and customers to ensure medical claims are submitted timely, processed, and paid accurately. This includes working payor rejections and denials, obtaining qualifying documentation and authorizations, providing high level customer support, RUL's, updating patient file within all billing systems as required, and following all applicable compliance and regulatory processes, payor guidelines, and Inogen policies and procedures. 
Key Competencies:
Collect payments for outstanding open accounts receivable balances.
Works with Medicare, Medicaid, Commercial Insurance, and Private Pay to ensure medical claims are being processed timely and paid accurately. 
Must meet/exceed daily/weekly production & quality KPI standards.
Ensures all billing systems are updated timely with patient demographics, payer information, and notated appropriately. 
Analyzes payer claim rejections & denials to help determine root cause and prevention of future rejections & denials from reoccurring. 
Gathers, prepares, and submits required information and/or documentation to appeal claim denials.
Uses appropriate write off reason code(s) for writing off balances that are deemed uncollectable.
Responsible for assisting our patients, doctors, customers, and coworkers with billing inquiries at the highest-level support possible. This includes logging into phone queue and updating statuses appropriately. 
Ensures the billing of all claims via electronic or paper to Medicare, Medicaid, and Commercial Insurance payers are being submitted accurately and timely in accordance with Inogen's policy. 
Ensures RUL (Reasonable Usable Lifetime) patients exiting the monthly cap period are in a billable status. 
Responsible for working NME's (New Medicare Eligibility), Payor Changes, Pending Pick-ups, and Stop patients timely. Verifies and evaluates insurance benefits to determine the policy's compatibility with Inogen's services.
Ensures the timely procurement of all required documentation and obtain authorizations in order to prevent future denials.
Ensures that appropriate medical records are maintained according to HIPPA guidelines.
Ensures Inogen's compliance with all state and federal regulations.
Maintain regular and punctual attendance. 
Comply with all company policies and procedures. 
Assist with any other duties as assigned. 
Do you possess these abilities?
A comprehensive understanding of Medicare, Medicaid, and/or Commercial Insurance program rules as it pertains to DME billing.
Ability to take direction and communicate effectively with customers and employees at all level of organization.
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced and dynamically changing organization.
Must have strong work ethic.
Excellent oral and written communication skills required. 
Attention to detail is required. 
Effective conflict resolution. 
Ability to maintain confidentiality and exercise extreme discretion. 
Solutions-oriented problem solver. 
Excellent planning, communication and organizational skills. 
 
Requirements:
Operates at a task level.
Substantial supervision required.
High School diploma or equivalent, required 
0-2 years of Medicare, Medicaid and/or Commercial Insurance experience, required. 
1-year experience in oxygen or HME billing, preferred. 
Basic knowledge/proficiency in Microsoft Office, Oracle, Brightree, Salesforce and New Voice Media, preferred. 
A combination of training, education and experience that is equivalent to the qualifications listed above and that provides the required knowledge, skills, and abilities.
WHY INOGEN Inogen is a dynamic company that is not only focused on quality care of patients, but is also committed to being a top employer.  Each of Inogen' s offices have a casual culture that supports employees being responsible and developing professionals.
We offer competitive salaries and a robust benefit package:
Employee Stock Purchase Plan 401 (K) plan available for all employees Health, dental, vision insurance Flexible spending accounts and wellness discount program Life Insurance Long Term Disability Robust paid time off and 8 paid holidays Employee Assistance Program
See the Inogen Team in action:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dKoTMeJf5J4
 
Inogen Where we go to work hard to positively impact people's lives
 
Inogen is an equal opportunity employer.  We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other legally protected characteristics. The EEO is the Law poster and its supplement are available here: http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/ofccpost.htm; http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/OFCCP_EEO_Supplement_Final_JRF_QA_508c.pdf.  The pay transparency policy is available here: http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/pdf/EO13665_PrescribedNondiscriminationPostingLanguage_JRFQA508c.pdf. 
Inogen is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities.  If you need a reasonable accommodation because of a disability for any part of the employment process, please send an e-mail to recruiting@inogen.net or call (972) 616-5668 and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information.

If you’re ready to take on a fresh challenge, grow your career and contribute to making the world a safer place, Raytheon is ready to help you achieve your goals. Join our team and get the opportunity and support to find purpose, thrive and succeed.





Notice: Please be aware of suspicious recruiting emails and text messages that attempt to collect your confidential information. Raytheon conducts all electronic correspondence using e-mail addresses that end in “Raytheon.com”, “Raytheon.co.uk”, “Raytheon.com.au” or “brassring.com”. To report fraud please go to: https://www.ic3.gov.











Principal Systems Engineer
Marlborough, Massachusetts


Apply





Overview
Responsibilities
Success Profile
Rewards
Trending




Overview

What does it take to make the world a safer place? It takes delivering innovative technology and collaborating with some of the finest talent in the engineering field. Whether you’re a software engineer or a mechanical engineer, at Raytheon you’ll grow a varied and rewarding career. And you’ll be supported with a comprehensive and competitive benefits package that promotes work/life. If you’re ready to take on today’s big challenges, discover a world of opportunity at Raytheon.

America’s Best Large Employers by Forbes
Career & Development Opportunities
Full-time
Entry, Mid, Senior level




Back to Job Navigation (Overview)


Responsibilities


Are you ready to take on a fresh challenge, grow your career and contribute to making the world a safer place? Raytheon is ready to help you achieve your goals. Join our Raytheon Air Traffic Systems engineering team and get the opportunity and support to find purpose, thrive and succeed.  We provide bonus opportunities, award winning wellness program, access to walking trails, outdoor patio, and great benefits that include medical, dental, vision, 401k match, and a flexible work schedule - just to name a few.From proactive cyber threat hunting to GPS-guided precision landing to enhanced mid- and long-range weather planning, Raytheon continues to pave the way for the data-driven, dynamic future of air travel. Our unique portfolio of automation, surveillance, navigation and landing solutions —backed by extensive cyber, analytics and software expertise— is improving safety and efficiency across more than two-thirds of the world's air space.Raytheon’s Air Traffic Systems (ATS) sub-mission area is a world leader in air traffic automation, surveillance and navigation, responsible for providing air traffic tools to air navigation service providers (ANSPs) around the world. Raytheon Intelligence, Information, and Services (IIS) in Marlborough, MA, is seeking an experienced Systems Engineer to join our team developing next generation of air traffic systems. This position is for a Systems Engineer who will be part of an innovative team that performs system and subsystem requirements development, system level design, and system integration and test. Regular duties include participating in requirements and design discussions and reviews, producing requirements artifacts, characterizing system performance, integrating software and hardware, writing and conducting system level test procedures, coordinating with internal stakeholders, and communicating with customers. Experience or knowledge of en-route and/or terminal control systems is a plus. This position requires interaction with internal and external customers.Additionally, this candidate will leverage their experience to develop enhancements for Air Traffic Control systems. Experience or knowledge of en-route and/or terminal control systems, such as ARTS/CARTS, STARS, ERAM,SWIM, ITWS or ASDE is a plus, as is familiarity with customer communities, standards and future initiatives, such as: Euro control, ICAO, Single European Sky, Next-Gen ATMS and Weather Systems, and trajectory and flow management.This position requires interaction with internal and external customers.Required Skills: 8+ Systems engineering or software testing experience – to include requirements analysis and development, large system design, system level integration, system testing (hands on), system integration, trouble shooting and testing BS in Science, Technology, Engineering, or Mathematics (STEM), or MS in STEM with 6 years of experience.Understanding of the systems engineering lifecycle and system level design and the ability to develop system level requirements and design artifactsExperience developing system and subsystem level requirements and designs for hardware and software implementationsWorking knowledge of COTS workstations and networksExperience with UNIX or Linux operating systems, such as Oracle Solaris or Red Hat Enterprise LinuxEffective communication skills, both oral and written Thorough knowledge of Microsoft Office products (Word, Excel, Outlook, and PowerPoint)Able to travel, occasional domestic travel in support of the program; potential for international travelDesired Skills:Experience solving complex problems in Air Traffic Control/Management SystemsExperience in the systems engineering, development and operation of Weather or Air Traffic Management SystemsProven innovator of new and emerging technologiesExposure to Communications Systems or Parallel ProcessingWorking knowledge of COTS servers, workstations, and networksExperience with shells and scripting languages, such as BashExperience modifying and administering networked UNIX or Linux operating systems, such as JumpStart or KickstartFamiliarity with Agile lifecycle process including Scrum, Kanban, DevOps, Continuous Integration, and Test Driven Development MethodologiesExperience with Atlassian tool suite such as JIRA, Confluence, Bamboo, and BitbucketExperience with DOORS or similar requirements management toolEducation Requirements:Requires a degree in Science, Technology, Engineering or Mathematics and a minimum of 8 years of prior relevant experience.This position requires either a U.S. Person or a Non-U.S. Person who is eligible to obtain any required Export Authorization. 146272
Business Unit Profile
                        
                        Raytheon Intelligence, Information and Services delivers innovative technology to make the world a safer place. Our expertise in cyber, analytics and automation allow us to reach beyond what others think is possible to underpin national security and give our global customers unique solutions to solve the most pressing modern challenges -- from the cyber domain to automated operations, and from intelligent transportation and training solutions to creating clear insight from large volumes of data. IIS operates at nearly 550 sites in 80 countries, and is headquartered in Dulles, Virginia. The business area generated $6.2 billion in 2018 revenues. As a global business, our leaders must have the ability to understand, embrace and operate in a multicultural world -- in the marketplace and the workplace. We strive to hire people who reflect our communities and embrace diversity and inclusion to advance our culture, develop our employees, and grow our business.
Relocation Eligible 
                        
                        Yes
Clearance Type 
                        
                        None / Not Required

Raytheon is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, age, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected Veteran status.

Quote



Felicia Jackson is regional vice president of RAYVETS, Raytheon's employee group for veterans and those who support them. After 24 years in the Air Force, she started a new career at Raytheon. "I wanted to go where people would support me," she told us.









Rewards




401(k) / Retirement Plans
Employer Matching, if you elect to enroll company matches up to 3%.



Work / Life Balance
Raytheon supports a variety of flexible work arrangements including compressed work weeks, flextime, job sharing, 9/80, reduced hours and telecommuting.



Career Development
At Raytheon, we foster an inclusive culture of professional development. We support a variety of developmental opportunities including: Mentoring programs, Skills Development, Leadership Development, Rotational job assignments, and Continuous Improvement, all of which contribute to advancement of our employee’s capabilities.



Paid Time Off
Accrue paid time off monthly. Receive 10-12 holidays per year with some locations shutting down the week between Christmas and New Year’s Day.



Relocation Assistance
Select technical positions are eligible for relocation packages. See specific job description for eligibility requirements.



Parental Leave
Raytheon offers all eligible employees up to three weeks paid parental leave for the birth or adoption of a child (separate from paid maternity leave or Family & Medical Leave Act).

            Associate Technical Account Manager



         Login to apply
    
















Associate Technical Account Manager
Dallas, TX 


Associate Technical Account Managers at Yardi will provide consultative, implementation and technical support to a group of assigned Yardi clients in order to manage business operations and financial accounting functions in Yardi’s Voyager software.
Responsibilities

Implements the Yardi suite of software products by assisting clients with system implementation, training, and technical support
Researches, analyzes and resolves software issues
Supports software product customization based on client requirements
Performs data mapping and conversions
Performs system and business process reviews and other service reviews and makes recommendations on best practices
Works on a regular basis with Yardi internal resource teams to include: training, conversion, sales and development

Requirements

Bachelor’s degree in Economics, Business, Math, Statistics or Information Management preferred
Experience setting and managing client expectations
Superior verbal and written communication skills
Project Management, Accounting, or Property Management experience/background
Solid Proficiency in MS Office Suite and Outlook
Knowledge in three of the following areas: Property Management, Accounting, Microsoft Windows, Technical Support, SQL, HTML/ASP
Prior experience with property management software or real estate software highly desirable
Prior experience with Yardi software highly desirable
Regular attendance and a regular work schedule is an essential function of this job

*ft

Privacy Statement

By continuing to browse this site you agree to our use of cookies. You can find out more about which cookies we are using or switch them off in settings.
 

 
Accept

 


















 

 Privacy Overview


 Strictly Necessary Cookies


 3rd Party Cookies




 








Privacy Overview

This website uses cookies so that we can provide you with the best user experience possible. Cookie information is stored in your browser and performs functions such as recognising you when you return to our website and helping our team to understand which sections of the website you find most interesting and useful.
You can adjust all of your cookie settings by navigating the tabs on the left hand side.



 
Strictly Necessary Cookies

Strictly necessary cookies must be enabled at all times in order to login and apply to openings.



disable









If you disable this cookie, we will not be able to save your preferences and you will not be able to login to apply for openings. This means that every time you visit this website you will need to enable or disable cookies again.







3rd Party Cookies

This website uses Google Analytics to collect anonymous information such as the number of visitors to the site, and the most popular pages.
Keeping this cookie enabled helps us to improve our website.



disable









Please enable Strictly Necessary Cookies first so that we can save your preferences!












Enable All
Save Changes

If you’re ready to take on a fresh challenge, grow your career and contribute to making the world a safer place, Raytheon is ready to help you achieve your goals. Join our team and get the opportunity and support to find purpose, thrive and succeed.





Notice: Please be aware of suspicious recruiting emails and text messages that attempt to collect your confidential information. Raytheon conducts all electronic correspondence using e-mail addresses that end in “Raytheon.com”, “Raytheon.co.uk”, “Raytheon.com.au” or “brassring.com”. To report fraud please go to: https://www.ic3.gov.











Systems-Software Engineer – Test Automation
State College, Pennsylvania


Apply





Overview
Responsibilities
Success Profile
Rewards
Trending




Overview

What does it take to make the world a safer place? It takes delivering innovative technology and collaborating with some of the finest talent in the engineering field. Whether you’re a software engineer or a mechanical engineer, at Raytheon you’ll grow a varied and rewarding career. And you’ll be supported with a comprehensive and competitive benefits package that promotes work/life. If you’re ready to take on today’s big challenges, discover a world of opportunity at Raytheon.

America’s Best Large Employers by Forbes
Career & Development Opportunities
Full-time
Entry, Mid, Senior level




Back to Job Navigation (Overview)


Responsibilities


National Defense, Cloud Technologies, Agile Development, DevOps, Big Data, Teamwork … Opportunities at Raytheon span the full product development lifecycle, including new capability development as well as sustainment and enhancement of existing deployed systems. Raytheon Intelligence, Information and Services (IIS) in State College, PA is seeking talented Systems-Software Engineers to support classified programs that develop and enhance integrated sensor, signal processing, complex analytics, and big data systems for Intelligence Community customers.  The successful candidate has excellent written and verbal communication skills, works effectively in a team environment, and is flexible & adaptable to respond to customer mission needs.  Come join Raytheon's team of engineers solving problems that make the world a safer place and help to secure our great nation!  Come support those who provide us with all the freedoms we enjoy.  Click here to view a brief video and learn more about Raytheon: https://youtu.be/8B-k34faFAE.About State College, PAState College is a college town, dominated economically and demographically by the presence of the University Park main campus of The Pennsylvania State University, one of the ten largest public universities in the United States. State College provides access to many cultural and athletic activities & events, and yet is only minutes away from rural Pennsylvania country-side. Many Raytheon State College employees enjoy a commute of 15 minutes or less! Click here to view a brief video and learn more about Raytheon State College:  https://youtu.be/f299m09q0FsCompensation & BenefitsWhile benefits may vary based on business unit, location and/or union status, Raytheon employees receive comprehensive benefits as part of a competitive compensation package. Health and wellness plans are available for you and your eligible children. Other benefits include insurance, education assistance, income protection, investment/retirement and work/life programs.Clearance RequirementsThis position requires eligibility to obtain a TS/SCI security clearance.  A current, active TS/SCI or DoD-TS security clearance is highly preferred, and includes a sign-on bonus.   U.S. citizenship is required.This position is eligible for a Sign on Bonus up to $40k for a candidate with a current TS/SCI that can be verified and hired at Raytheon.                                                                                                                                          Required Skills: 4+ years of relevant work experienceFamiliarity with engineering processes and techniquesAbility to work effectively on multi-discipline engineering teamsStrong interpersonal, communications, organization, and planning skillsCommitment to quality customer service and on-schedule task completionsAbility to manage time and resources to meet deadlinesProficiency with Microsoft OfficeFamiliarity with DevOps and Continuous IntegrationAbility to generate technical documentation (DoDAF, ICDs, Test Plans & Procedures, etc.)Experience conducting technical research, documenting and presenting resultsPassion for quality software, testability & test automationTest Automation experience with Cucumber, Selenium, Gherkin, Perl, Python, etc.Desired Skills: Active TS/SCI or DoD-TS security clearanceExperience with Amazon Web Services (AWS)Knowledge of monitoring, logging and management tools that integrate with AWSExperience with software development on Linux platformsExperience with system-level requirements analysis, system design, trade studies, and/or system integration & verificationCoursework and/or experience in Systems Engineering, Software Engineering, Infrastructure Engineering and/or Security Engineering.CompTlA Security+ certificationEducation Requirements: This position requires a 4-year bachelor's degree in Science, Technology, Engineering or Mathematics (STEM).This position requires either a U.S. Person or a Non-U.S. Person who is eligible to obtain any required Export Authorization. 150423
Business Unit Profile
                        
                        Raytheon Intelligence, Information and Services delivers innovative technology to make the world a safer place. Our expertise in cyber, analytics and automation allow us to reach beyond what others think is possible to underpin national security and give our global customers unique solutions to solve the most pressing modern challenges -- from the cyber domain to automated operations, and from intelligent transportation and training solutions to creating clear insight from large volumes of data. IIS operates at nearly 550 sites in 80 countries, and is headquartered in Dulles, Virginia. The business area generated $6.2 billion in 2018 revenues. As a global business, our leaders must have the ability to understand, embrace and operate in a multicultural world -- in the marketplace and the workplace. We strive to hire people who reflect our communities and embrace diversity and inclusion to advance our culture, develop our employees, and grow our business.

Back to Job Navigation (Success)


Quote



Felicia Jackson is regional vice president of RAYVETS, Raytheon's employee group for veterans and those who support them. After 24 years in the Air Force, she started a new career at Raytheon. "I wanted to go where people would support me," she told us.









Rewards




401(k) / Retirement Plans
Employer Matching, if you elect to enroll company matches up to 3%.



Work / Life Balance
Raytheon supports a variety of flexible work arrangements including compressed work weeks, flextime, job sharing, 9/80, reduced hours and telecommuting.



Career Development
At Raytheon, we foster an inclusive culture of professional development. We support a variety of developmental opportunities including: Mentoring programs, Skills Development, Leadership Development, Rotational job assignments, and Continuous Improvement, all of which contribute to advancement of our employee’s capabilities.



Paid Time Off
Accrue paid time off monthly. Receive 10-12 holidays per year with some locations shutting down the week between Christmas and New Year’s Day.



Relocation Assistance
Select technical positions are eligible for relocation packages. See specific job description for eligibility requirements.



Parental Leave
Raytheon offers all eligible employees up to three weeks paid parental leave for the birth or adoption of a child (separate from paid maternity leave or Family & Medical Leave Act).

Associate Software Engineer - Do you Code for Fun?
Apply
Requisition ID 147054BR Date updated 09/23/2019
Who we are!Raytheon BBN Technologies (BBN) is the research company behind many revolutionary advances that we take for granted today. BBN is where email was invented and the first routers were implemented. Today, BBN's scientists and engineers are working to advance the state-of-the-art on topics ranging from machine language translation to quantum cryptography. BBN offers the opportunity to perform exciting and revolutionary research and engineering that solves important problems in a collaborative environment.  BBN fosters an exceptional work environment with knowledgeable co-workers and offers performance-based bonus incentives and retirement contributions.Located in Middletown, RI (Newport, RI), our Information Exploitation group is seeking talented software engineers and scientists interested in designing, prototyping, developing, and deploying advanced systems and algorithms using Data Science and Analytics, Semantic Web Technologies, and Machine Reasoning and Machine  Learning to solve challenging DoD and IC problems.  BBN fosters an exceptional work environment with knowledgeable co-workers, excellent performance-based bonus incentives, and generous retirement contributions.  Our ideal candidate will have experience in machine reasoning, semantic web technologies, data analytics, or artificial intelligence technologies and will have strong Java development experience.Our applied software research uses the above technologies to build both prototype and real operational systems.  You will solve challenging problems including:• Researching and publishing novel software algorithms and solutions to complex, open-ended problems.• Optimizing software for knowledge representation, storage, and query systems for high performance.• Applying machine reasoning and learning to develop solutions for complex intelligence problems;• Developing and analyzing complex data models and ontologies;• Designing and implementing REST-ful web services and web applications;• Designing algorithms to reason about causal networks in noisy, incomplete, multi-modal data;• Creating hypothesis reasoners that interactively generate competing hypotheses for user feedback;What will you need?• BS in Computer Science or equivalent discipline• Proficiency in Java and the Java-based development ecosystem• Position may require some amount of overnight travel.Additional Skills that would be AWESOME• 1-2 years of relevant software engineering experience or internships involving software engineering.• Experience with Web application development• Research or development experience with probabilistic reasoning, data representation, or machine learning• Research or development experience with Big Data, Semantic Graphs, or Graph Databases• Working knowledge and/or hands-on experience with Semantic Web technologies (RDF/OWL/SPARQL)• Experience with logic programing (Prolog, XSB, Flora-2), or other rule-based systems for knowledge representation and       reasoning is a desired• An active US Government security clearance is highly desired*This position requires the eligibility to obtain a security clearance.  Except in rare circumstances, only U.S. citizens are eligible for a security clearance. 147054
Business Unit Profile
            Raytheon Space and Airborne Systems (SAS) builds radars and other sensors for aircraft, spacecraft and ships. The business also provides communications and electronic warfare solutions and performs research in areas ranging from linguistics to quantum computing. SAS is headquartered in McKinney, Texas USA. As a global business, our leaders must have the ability to understand, embrace and operate in a multicultural world -- in the marketplace and the workplace. We strive to hire people who reflect our communities and embrace diversity and inclusion to advance our culture, develop our employees, and grow our business.Raytheon is headquartered in Waltham, Massachusetts. Follow us on Twitter.

Relocation Eligible 
            Yes

Clearance Type 
            None / Not Required

              Artificial IntelligenceComputer ScienceData ScienceResearch & DevelopmentSoftware Engineering

            Engineering & Sciences

              RI - MiddletownRI - Newport

Related Content




Work on interesting projects and enjoy plenty of recognition
Whether you’re just starting out on your career journey or a experienced professional, it’s important that you feel recognized and rewarded for your contributions.
Raytheon is proud to offer a comprehensive and competitive benefits package to you, your spouse and your eligible children. In addition to protecting you and your family's health and well-being, we offer important income and work/life benefits to meet your needs. Learn More





Turn unique thinking into one-of-a-kind solutions
Diversity. Every company likes to talk about it, but few have embraced it with quite the same commitment as we have here at Raytheon. As a result, diversity has become a competitive imperative and an integral part of our business model, particularly as we continue to grow internationally. Learn More








Work as one to make a difference to millions
Here at Raytheon, we innovate across all domains: from land and sea to air, space, and cyberspace.It’s innovation made possible by a strong internal culture and a vision that’s shared by Raytheon employees across the globe – a vision of one global team creating trusted, innovative solutions to make the world a safer place. Client Development Director- Point of Contact - (0104806) Locations: Atlanta, Chicago, Santa Barbara, Westborough, Westlake Village, Remote (With prior affiliate experience)CJ
offers a variety of managed services, one of which is the Point of Contact
service level. These advertiser clients partner with our CJ Point of Contact team
to develop their channel strategy, with the client then owning the execution
in-house.
 
The Point of Contact Client
Development Director is responsible leading the team of Client Development
Managers. You would play a key role in the hiring, development, and retention
of successful CDMs.  Additionally, you
are responsible for ensuring portfolio retention, growth and accurate financial
forecasting. The Point of Contact CDD also works collaboratively with our
Product, Client Services, Finance, Data Science, Publisher, Marketing and Sales
teams to drive initiatives critical to our advertiser client’s success.  
 
Do these things interest you? You
will:
Lead
and develop a high-performance team of 5-8 account strategists in a fast paced,
detail oriented team environment.Define
Point of Contact line of business objectives, in collaboration with the Group
Director of Client Development, that align with CJ’s overall goals.Develop
and execute strategic initiatives to enhance the competitiveness of CJ in the
marketplace amongst partner Agencies and our shared Advertiser clients.Ensure
Clients & CJ successfully meet client objectives.Guide
team on development and deployment of client facing strategic material.Set
quarterly MBOs for the team to accomplish.Serve
as an escalation point in handling Client objections and all complex issues
that cannot be solved independently by your team.Lead
pricing, contract renewals, value-selling of CJ benefits to partner business’,
adoption of CJ solutions. Forecast
and manage financial plans and meet financial expectations for your portfolio
of business.Influence
solution innovation, automation, and processes to enable teams to do more and
drive better results.
 
What we look for:Bachelor’s
Degree7 -
10 years of experience working in a traditional marketing role-ideally digital
performance (affiliate) marketing and partnering with or working for agencies.Ability
to develop annual and quarterly plans, and ensure successful execution of these
plans across multiple client teams, delivering high quality service and results
to clients while delivering against CJ financial expectations.Self-initiative
and development- you are results focused and eager to enhance your skills to
take your career to the next level.Proven
leadership, staff management and coaching skills.Critical
thinking and problem solver-you are able to influence/develop/negotiate account
strategies that incorporate affiliate attribution, consumer insights and
dynamic customer targeting.Strong
written and verbal communication skills.Proficient
knowledge of Microsoft suite of products, including Windows, Word, Excel, and
PowerPoint.
 
  

Why CJ Affiliate?
We’re a great place to work! CJ Affiliate offers ideal career development and growth opportunities where you will hone skills in strategic planning and execution, as well as enhance your negotiation and presentation skills. You will develop partnerships and motivate affiliates, learn technical skills applicable to digital marketing and nearly every other industry, and so much more. CJ Affiliate is a leader because our teams have advanced tools, present creative solutions, execute strategically, and drive high performance.Conditions
of EmploymentAll job offers are contingent upon
successful completion of certain background checks which unless prohibited by
applicable law may include criminal history checks, employment verification,
education verification, drug screens, credit checks, DMV checks (for driving
positions only) and fingerprinting. Great
People, Deserve Great BenefitsWe know that we have some of the
brightest and most talented associates in the world, and we believe in
rewarding them accordingly.  If you work
here, expect competitive pay, comprehensive health coverage, and endless
opportunities to advance your career.   About
UsEpsilon® is an all-encompassing global
marketing innovator. We provide unrivaled data intelligence and customer
insights, world-class technology including loyalty, email and CRM platforms and
data-driven creative, activation and execution. Epsilon’s digital media arm,
Conversant, is a leader in personalized digital advertising and insights
through its proprietary technology and trove of consumer marketing data,
delivering digital marketing with unprecedented scale, accuracy and reach
through personalized media programs. Together, we bring personalized marketing
to consumers across offline and online channels, at moments of interest that
help drive business growth for brands.  Epsilon employs over 8,000
associates in 70 offices worldwide. For more information, visit www.epsilon.com and follow us on Twitter @EpsilonMktg. Epsilon provides equal employment
opportunities without regard to race, color, religion, gender, age, national
origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status or any
other characteristic protected by law. Epsilon is an Equal Opportunity
Employer. Epsilon participates in E-Verify.Epsilon will provide accommodations to
applicants needing accommodations to complete the application process.Any applicant offered employment will be
required to establish that they are legally authorized to work in the United
States for Epsilon.Epsilon will consider for employment
qualified applicants with criminal and credit histories in a manner consistent
with the requirements of all applicable laws, including the City of Los
Angeles’ Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring Ordinance. For San Francisco Bay Area:Epsilon will consider for employment-qualified
applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements
of San Francisco Police Code Sections 4901 - 4919, commonly referred to as the
San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance
#advertiser-development
                                                          
#LI-AEApply now at CJ.com/careers

About The Advertiser Development Team

						Advertiser Development teams work closely with a portfolio of clients to understand their unique business objectives and maximize the effectiveness of their affiliate programs. Regular activities include creating and executing strategic growth plans, analyzing and applying data, recruiting new publishers and optimizing publisher relationships.

If you’re ready to take on a fresh challenge, grow your career and contribute to making the world a safer place, Raytheon is ready to help you achieve your goals. Join our team and get the opportunity and support to find purpose, thrive and succeed.





Notice: Please be aware of suspicious recruiting emails and text messages that attempt to collect your confidential information. Raytheon conducts all electronic correspondence using e-mail addresses that end in “Raytheon.com”, “Raytheon.co.uk”, “Raytheon.com.au” or “brassring.com”. To report fraud please go to: https://www.ic3.gov.











Systems-Software Engineer – Test Automation
State College, Pennsylvania


Apply





Overview
Responsibilities
Success Profile
Rewards
Trending




Overview

What does it take to make the world a safer place? It takes delivering innovative technology and collaborating with some of the finest talent in the engineering field. Whether you’re a software engineer or a mechanical engineer, at Raytheon you’ll grow a varied and rewarding career. And you’ll be supported with a comprehensive and competitive benefits package that promotes work/life. If you’re ready to take on today’s big challenges, discover a world of opportunity at Raytheon.

America’s Best Large Employers by Forbes
Career & Development Opportunities
Full-time
Entry, Mid, Senior level




Back to Job Navigation (Overview)


Responsibilities


National Defense, Cloud Technologies, Agile Development, DevOps, Big Data, Teamwork … Opportunities at Raytheon span the full product development lifecycle, including new capability development as well as sustainment and enhancement of existing deployed systems. Raytheon Intelligence, Information and Services (IIS) in State College, PA is seeking talented Systems-Software Engineers to support classified programs that develop and enhance integrated sensor, signal processing, complex analytics, and big data systems for Intelligence Community customers.  The successful candidate has excellent written and verbal communication skills, works effectively in a team environment, and is flexible & adaptable to respond to customer mission needs.  Come join Raytheon's team of engineers solving problems that make the world a safer place and help to secure our great nation! Come support those who provide us with all the freedoms we enjoy.  Click here to view a brief video and learn more about Raytheon: https://youtu.be/8B-k34faFAE.About State College, PAState College is a college town, dominated economically and demographically by the presence of the University Park main campus of The Pennsylvania State University, one of the ten largest public universities in the United States. State College provides access to many cultural and athletic activities & events, and yet is only minutes away from rural Pennsylvania country-side. Many Raytheon State College employees enjoy a commute of 15 minutes or less! Click here to view a brief video and learn more about Raytheon State College:  https://youtu.be/f299m09q0FsCompensation & BenefitsWhile benefits may vary based on business unit, location and/or union status, Raytheon employees receive comprehensive benefits as part of a competitive compensation package. Health and wellness plans are available for you and your eligible children. Other benefits include insurance, education assistance, income protection, investment/retirement and work/life programs.Clearance RequirementsThis position requires eligibility to obtain a TS/SCI security clearance.  A current, active TS/SCI or DoD-TS security clearance is highly preferred, and includes a sign-on bonus.   U.S. citizenship is required.This position is eligible for a Sign on Bonus up to $40k for a candidate with a current TS/SCI that can be verified and hired at Raytheon.Required Skills: 2+ years of relevant work experienceFamiliarity with engineering processes and techniquesStrong interpersonal, communications, organization, and planning skillsCommitment to quality customer service and on-schedule task completionsAbility to manage time and resources to meet deadlinesProficiency with Microsoft OfficeAbility to generate technical documentation (DoDAF, ICDs, Test Plans & Procedures, etc.)Passion for quality software, testability & test automationFamiliarity with DevOps and Continuous IntegrationDesired Skills: Active TS/SCI or DoD-TS security clearanceTest Automation experience Cucumber, Selenium, Gherkin, Perl, Python, etc.Experience with Amazon Web Services (AWS)Knowledge of monitoring, logging and management tools that integrate with AWSAbility to work effectively on multi-discipline engineering teamsFamiliarity with Continuous Integration and Deployment environmentsExperience with Agile DevelopmentExperience with software development on Linux platformsExperience with system-level requirements analysis, system design, trade studies, and/or system integration & verificationExperience conducting technical research, documenting and presenting resultsCoursework and/or experience in Systems Engineering, Software Engineering, Infrastructure Engineering and/or Security Engineering.CompTlA Security+ certificationEducation Requirements: Requires a degree in Science, Technology, Engineering or Mathematics (STEM) and minimum of 2+ years of prior relevant experience, unless prohibited by local laws/regulations. 150539
Business Unit Profile
                        
                        Raytheon Intelligence, Information and Services delivers innovative technology to make the world a safer place. Our expertise in cyber, analytics and automation allow us to reach beyond what others think is possible to underpin national security and give our global customers unique solutions to solve the most pressing modern challenges -- from the cyber domain to automated operations, and from intelligent transportation and training solutions to creating clear insight from large volumes of data. IIS operates at nearly 550 sites in 80 countries, and is headquartered in Dulles, Virginia. The business area generated $6.2 billion in 2018 revenues. As a global business, our leaders must have the ability to understand, embrace and operate in a multicultural world -- in the marketplace and the workplace. We strive to hire people who reflect our communities and embrace diversity and inclusion to advance our culture, develop our employees, and grow our business.
Relocation Eligible 
                        
                        Yes

Quote



Felicia Jackson is regional vice president of RAYVETS, Raytheon's employee group for veterans and those who support them. After 24 years in the Air Force, she started a new career at Raytheon. "I wanted to go where people would support me," she told us.









Rewards




401(k) / Retirement Plans
Employer Matching, if you elect to enroll company matches up to 3%.



Work / Life Balance
Raytheon supports a variety of flexible work arrangements including compressed work weeks, flextime, job sharing, 9/80, reduced hours and telecommuting.



Career Development
At Raytheon, we foster an inclusive culture of professional development. We support a variety of developmental opportunities including: Mentoring programs, Skills Development, Leadership Development, Rotational job assignments, and Continuous Improvement, all of which contribute to advancement of our employee’s capabilities.



Paid Time Off
Accrue paid time off monthly. Receive 10-12 holidays per year with some locations shutting down the week between Christmas and New Year’s Day.



Relocation Assistance
Select technical positions are eligible for relocation packages. See specific job description for eligibility requirements.



Parental Leave
Raytheon offers all eligible employees up to three weeks paid parental leave for the birth or adoption of a child (separate from paid maternity leave or Family & Medical Leave Act).

Order Intake Quality Advocate I  (92978) - Richardson, TX - Inogen, Inc. Jobs








 














Home
Jobs




Order Intake Quality Advocate I  (92978) - Richardson, TX

Toggle navigation








Order Intake Quality Advocate I  (92978) 

JobsLogin 












 Billing Richardson, TX, USA Full Time 



Email Me Similar Jobs Email Me This Job



ABOUT INOGEN Inogen was founded in 2001 to improve quality of life and increase freedom and independence for oxygen therapy users. Inogen is innovation in oxygen therapy. The Inogen mission is to improve freedom and independence for oxygen therapy patients through innovative products and services. Inogen is a manufacturer and Accredited Homecare Provider.
Inogen is focused on quality care, continuous improvement, and outstanding customer satisfaction. We are a stable, USA based company dedicated to providing an exciting and rewarding career to our employees. We completed a successful Initial Public Offering on the NASDAQ in 2014 and have demonstrated substantial growth over the last five years. Our work environment is casual yet high performing, and we are looking for seriously talented, motivated, and fast-paced professionals to join our team.
JOB DESCRIPTION 
The Order Intake Quality Advocate works within the Order Intake Business Unit and is the key individual responsible for reviewing orders submitted by the Sales department to ensure they follow all applicable accreditation, compliance/regulatory processes, Inogen policy, and Payor guidelines. This includes a review of the appropriate patient file within database systems, medical documentation, payment information, and patient supplied documents.
Key Competencies:
Conduct internal order reviews from various Inogen teams, or via online order requests, to ensure all documentation required for order type are attached, accurate, and acceptable per Inogen's policies and procedures.
Make recommendations to improve quality, workflow processes, policies and procedures to enhance the order review process by decreasing processing time and increasing quality.
Manage multiple work lists and responsibilities by monitoring volumes and aging, while collaborating with teammates to maintain required SLAs and performance metrics, with appropriate attention to detail and quality standards.
Provide constructive feedback for order rejections when files are found to be unacceptable.
Process requests for order corrections or reviews
Follows HIPAA and company standards while interacting with patients, doctors, and other staff by practicing the highest level of support. This may include inbound or outbound calls, as well as processing credit card payments.
Ensures Inogen's compliance with all state and federal regulations.
Ensures that appropriate medical records are maintained according to HIPAA guidelines.
Maintain regular and punctual attendance. 
Comply with all company policies and procedures. 
Assist with any other duties as assigned. 
 
Do you possess these abilities?
Excellent verbal and written communication skills required.
Must possess good time management skills, with the ability to prioritize and multi-task.
Must be detail-oriented and analytical to ensure documentation is being assessed properly. 
Experience with CRM platforms, preferably Salesforce, Oracle, and/or Brightree preferred.
Work experience or knowledge of the healthcare industry, preferably specific to Medicare or prescription guidelines.
 
Requirements:
High School diploma or equivalent, required. 
1-3 years of experience reviewing documentation for Medicare Oxygen/DME Billing, Insurance Billing, or prescription requirements, required. 
Experience working with Medical Sales personnel, preferred
Intermediate knowledge/proficiency in Microsoft Office, required. 
A combination of training, education and experience that is equivalent to the qualifications listed above and that provides the required knowledge, skills, and abilities.
WHY INOGEN Inogen is a dynamic company that is not only focused on quality care of patients, but is also committed to being a top employer.  Each of Inogen' s offices have a casual culture that supports employees being responsible and developing professionals.
We offer competitive salaries and a robust benefit package:
Employee Stock Purchase Plan 401 (K) plan available for all employees Health, dental, vision insurance Flexible spending accounts and wellness discount program Life Insurance Long Term Disability Robust paid time off and 8 paid holidays Employee Assistance Program
See the Inogen Team in action:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dKoTMeJf5J4
 
Inogen Where we go to work hard to positively impact people's lives
 
Inogen is an equal opportunity employer.  We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other legally protected characteristics. The EEO is the Law poster and its supplement are available here: http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/ofccpost.htm; http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/OFCCP_EEO_Supplement_Final_JRF_QA_508c.pdf.  The pay transparency policy is available here: http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/pdf/EO13665_PrescribedNondiscriminationPostingLanguage_JRFQA508c.pdf. 
Inogen is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities.  If you need a reasonable accommodation because of a disability for any part of the employment process, please send an e-mail to recruiting@inogen.net or call (972) 616-5668 and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information.
 
 

Inogen, Inc.

If you’re ready to take on a fresh challenge, grow your career and contribute to making the world a safer place, Raytheon is ready to help you achieve your goals. Join our team and get the opportunity and support to find purpose, thrive and succeed.





Notice: Please be aware of suspicious recruiting emails and text messages that attempt to collect your confidential information. Manager II Systems Engineer
Indianapolis, Indiana


Apply





Overview
Responsibilities
Success Profile
Rewards
Trending




Overview

What does it take to make the world a safer place? It takes delivering innovative technology and collaborating with some of the finest talent in the engineering field. Whether you’re a software engineer or a mechanical engineer, at Raytheon you’ll grow a varied and rewarding career. And you’ll be supported with a comprehensive and competitive benefits package that promotes work/life. If you’re ready to take on today’s big challenges, discover a world of opportunity at Raytheon.

America’s Best Large Employers by Forbes
Career & Development Opportunities
Full-time
Entry, Mid, Senior level




Back to Job Navigation (Overview)


Responsibilities


Would you like to work in a collaborative environment creating trusted, innovative solutions for the warfighter?Then join our Raytheon team of smart people solving problems that make the world a safer place and help to secure our great nation! Come support those who provide us with all the freedoms we enjoy. We offer amenities that create work-life balance, including employee appreciation lunches, bonus opportunities, great benefits that include medical, dental, vision, and 401K match, and flexible work schedules.  These are just some of the many reasons people come to work at Raytheon!Raytheon is a technology and innovation leader specializing in defense, security and civil markets throughout the world. Our latest company video is about our people, our technology, our vision, and the values we hold dear at Raytheon.  Click here to view: https://youtu.be/qvbCgKpkEdsRaytheon Intelligence, Information and Services (IIS) is currently seeking a systems engineering Section manager to lead a team of approximately 20+ systems engineers committed and passionate about creating innovative and cost-effective systems solutions. This position involves leading a team in all phases of Systems Engineering development including concept development, architecture development, requirements development and allocation, functional analysis, design reviews, implementation, test, verification and validation.  The Section Manager is expected to ensure work and work products assigned to their section are completed on time and on budget and continuously improve their ability to accomplish the assigned work.  The Section Manager is also expected to participate in proposals, roadmap development and growth of the systems and section.  The Section Manager must leverage multiple skill sets in areas such as Defense Avionics, Missile Systems, Radar and RF application, Structures, embedded computing and networking. Clearance Requirements:  Ability to obtain a Secret Level security clearance; an active Secret or higher clearance a plus.Responsibilities and scope include:Provide leadership, technical direction and guidance to ensure section is effectively executing work to deliver on-budget, on-time, correct, high-quality, complete work products, utilizing IPDS-based Engineering work packages and productivity measuresEnsure staff development to meet Indianapolis SEIT Department staffing, training and development plans through performance management, career development and resource allocationLead systems engineering activities which may include CONOPs development, requirements development and management, systems architecture, system design, interface definition and control, integration and test to include test planning and procedure development in support of assigned programsWork directly with customers and represent the engineering technical viewpoint Develop, maintain and ensure compliance for system and subsystem requirementsProvide leadership and guidance to a cross-functional team throughout the lifecycle of programsPrepare for and lead both internal and customer design reviewsProvide leadership and guidance to engineering team in the resolution of engineering systems issues as they work with external industry and government stakeholdersParticipate as a member of the Indianapolis SEIT Leadership Team, flowing communication between the program and engineering departmentMaintain a professional attitude, to serve as an example to the team, with team members, internal and external customersWork closely with the Indianapolis SEIT Department Manager in support of company goals and objectivesPerform responsibilities under only general directionRequired SkillsMinimum of 8 years in systems, software or computer engineering, providing demonstrable technical expertise & value to programs, commensurate with current grade and roleExperience in capture management: creating/reviewing RFPs, SOWs, BOEs, tech volumes, proposalsLeadership experience involving responsibility for technical, financial, and/or personnel resourcesExperience briefing effectively to all levels of the organization, from peers to senior managementExcellent written and oral communication skillsExperience operating within an organization governed by company policies & proceduresExperience working on product development and customer demonstration projectsExperience working on teams in a fast paced environment with aggressive deadlinesExperience developing technical baselines (requirements/architecture); leading development teams; and developing and reviewing Engineering Change Requests.Experience applying technical standards, principles, theories, concepts and techniques to solve problems.Experience leading technical Analysis of Alternatives (AoA) and/or Trade Studies, performing Risk and Opportunity analyses, and tracking and mitigating risks.Ability to manage work in an environment with ambiguity and changeDesired Skills: Experience in development, integration, and test of large scale complex systemsExperience with Agile or DevOps software development Experience managing programs via program metrics: development, financial, performanceExperience ensuring program progress via formal risk & opportunity managementTraining/certification and experience performing formal Control Account Management (CAM)Experience using DOORS, Rhapsody, MagicDraw, or other requirements management and system architecture toolsExperience mentoring engineers of all grade levelsFamiliarity with Raytheon company policies & proceduresActive Secret or higher clearanceEducation Requirements:Bachelor's in Science, Technology, Engineering, and/or Mathematics (Preferred Majors: Systems, Aerospace, Electrical, Mechanical) and 8+ years of relevant experience - or Master’s in Science, Technology, Engineering, and/or Mathematics (Preferred Majors: Systems, Aerospace, Electrical, Mechanical) and 6+ years of relevant experienceThis position requires either a U.S. Person or a Non-U.S. Person who is eligible to obtain any required Export Authorization. 151337
Business Unit Profile
                        
                        Raytheon Intelligence, Information and Services delivers innovative technology to make the world a safer place. Our expertise in cyber, analytics and automation allow us to reach beyond what others think is possible to underpin national security and give our global customers unique solutions to solve the most pressing modern challenges -- from the cyber domain to automated operations, and from intelligent transportation and training solutions to creating clear insight from large volumes of data. IIS operates at nearly 550 sites in 80 countries, and is headquartered in Dulles, Virginia. The business area generated $6.2 billion in 2018 revenues. As a global business, our leaders must have the ability to understand, embrace and operate in a multicultural world -- in the marketplace and the workplace. We strive to hire people who reflect our communities and embrace diversity and inclusion to advance our culture, develop our employees, and grow our business.

Quote



Felicia Jackson is regional vice president of RAYVETS, Raytheon's employee group for veterans and those who support them. After 24 years in the Air Force, she started a new career at Raytheon. "I wanted to go where people would support me," she told us.









Rewards




401(k) / Retirement Plans
Employer Matching, if you elect to enroll company matches up to 3%.



Work / Life Balance
Raytheon supports a variety of flexible work arrangements including compressed work weeks, flextime, job sharing, 9/80, reduced hours and telecommuting.



Career Development
At Raytheon, we foster an inclusive culture of professional development. We support a variety of developmental opportunities including: Mentoring programs, Skills Development, Leadership Development, Rotational job assignments, and Continuous Improvement, all of which contribute to advancement of our employee’s capabilities.



Paid Time Off
Accrue paid time off monthly. Receive 10-12 holidays per year with some locations shutting down the week between Christmas and New Year’s Day.



Relocation Assistance
Select technical positions are eligible for relocation packages. See specific job description for eligibility requirements.



Parental Leave
Raytheon offers all eligible employees up to three weeks paid parental leave for the birth or adoption of a child (separate from paid maternity leave or Family & Medical Leave Act).

            Associate Account Executive



         Login to apply
    
















Associate Account Executive
Oxnard, CA 


This entry level opportunity as an Associate Account Executive will work to effectively develop a multi-state territory through cold calling prospects, developing a solid sales pipeline and closing sales deals.
Responsibilities include:

Lead generation and qualification
Fielding, qualifying and closing inbound sale inquires
Prospecting and telephone marketing for new prospect clients
Creating, tracking, closing and reporting results of sales opportunities in yCRM
Learn and master company software product offerings
Conducting online presentations and product demonstrations
Communicating via phone and email correspondence with prospective clients
Nurturing sales opportunities through the entire sales cycle to close
Providing information and generating interest in conference participation and other related events
Managing weekly/monthly activity to support sales goals
Work effectively with other teams that support the sales process and client satisfaction

This position will require the following background and skills:

Bachelor’s degree
Ability to do high volume cold calls and develop leads
Ability to generate a sales pipeline and close sales
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Superior phone skills
Technical aptitude and the ability to successfully demonstrate software
Ability to show product features and benefits
High level of professionalism and ethics
Ability to manage multiple priorities in a fast paced environment
A background in software sales, web ads sales, accounting systems, or experience in the property management industry highly desirable but not required

By continuing to browse this site you agree to our use of cookies. You can find out more about which cookies we are using or switch them off in settings.

 Privacy Overview


 Strictly Necessary Cookies


 3rd Party Cookies




 








Privacy Overview

This website uses cookies so that we can provide you with the best user experience possible. Cookie information is stored in your browser and performs functions such as recognising you when you return to our website and helping our team to understand which sections of the website you find most interesting and useful.
You can adjust all of your cookie settings by navigating the tabs on the left hand side.



 
Strictly Necessary Cookies

Strictly necessary cookies must be enabled at all times in order to login and apply to openings.



disable









If you disable this cookie, we will not be able to save your preferences and you will not be able to login to apply for openings. This means that every time you visit this website you will need to enable or disable cookies again.







3rd Party Cookies

This website uses Google Analytics to collect anonymous information such as the number of visitors to the site, and the most popular pages.
Keeping this cookie enabled helps us to improve our website.



disable









Please enable Strictly Necessary Cookies first so that we can save your preferences!












Enable All

Sonos | Training Manager | Boston | Santa Barbara | Hilversum
