Share it:








































Training Manager Customer Experience

Department:
              Customer Care
            
Location:
              Boston, Hilversum, Santa Barbara
            

Req#:
              5755
            

Join a fast-growing band inside of an even faster growing company that is revolutionizing the in-home music listening experience.  If you have a relentless desire to drive process as well as motivate and lead a team of exceptionally driven, customer-obsessed technical support specialists while managing a game-changing, epic experience then we want to hear from you!We are looking for an experienced Training Manager to lead our learning and development strategy, manage its implementation and measure its impact. A successful candidate will be passionate about learning and excited about the prospect of leading by example.




About You


More than a candidate that checks every box, we’re looking for people who are excited to work, learn, and grow at Sonos—no matter their background or how they identify. If that’s you, we hope you’ll apply for this role.
You want to be part of a team.
You come with new ideas and a unique point of view. You look forward to collaborating with a diverse team of individuals. You assume everyone’s best intentions, welcome a healthy debate, and embrace differing opinions. You eagerly seek and give help. Transparency tops your list of values, and you proactively contribute to a culture of respect and inclusion.
You enjoy a challenge.
Inquisitive and focused, you see every challenge as an opportunity. You’re ambitious and comfortable making mistakes because you learn from them and bounce back quickly. You would rather create the future than wait for it. You prioritize long-term value over short-term objectives.
You love to listen.
You approach every interaction with curiosity and a desire to understand. You want to make a positive impact in the world. You’re passionate about culture and know the power that music, film, podcasts, games, and stories have to bring people together.


What You’ll Do 

Ensuring strategic alignment of the training department with business goals Evaluating individual and organizational performance to ensure training is meeting business needs and improving efficiencies Identifying training needs by consulting with stakeholders and using needs assessments Developing and delivering training solutions that meet business needs Optimizing training processes for efficiency and accountabilitySelecting and managing resources, including working with both internal employees and partner team members to develop and deliver training Managing the technologies and technical personnel required to develop, manage and deliver training 

Skills You’ll Need

Basic Qualifications:Knowledge of learning and development best practicesA proven track record of training program development and management Excellent leadership skills Excellent written and oral communication skills At least a bachelor’s degree in education, human resources or a related discipline Preferred Qualifications:Professional certification, such as CPTM, is preferred Expertise in modern training techniques and content creation toolsExperienced in designing engaging course content in eLearning standard formats (SCORM, Tin Can/xAPI)You have the ability and vision to address organizational training quality needs of a rapidly expanding global support team 

More About Sonos


Sonos is a sound experience company. We pioneered multiroom wireless audio, made it sound amazing, and changed the way people listen, making it effortless for them to enjoy what they want, where they want, how they want.
Today we continue empowering listeners by developing new technologies, thoughtfully designing products, expanding our software platform, and crafting brilliant sound experiences while participating in a culture that values respect, transparency, collaboration, and ownership.
Together we’re working to positively impact the world and inspire everyone to listen better—because listening brings people together, builds understanding, drives change, and makes us happier.
Notice to European Job Applicants: Information you submit as a part of your job application will be used in accordance with Sonos EU Job Applicant Privacy Notice.
Notice to U.S. Job Applicants: Sonos is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other legally protected characteristics.
Follow the links to review the EEO is the Law poster and its supplement. The pay transparency policy is available here. Sonos is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities. If you need a reasonable accommodation because of a disability for any part of the employment process, please send an e-mail to accommodations@sonos.com and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information.

Patient Intake Advocate Team Lead  (97089) - Richardson, TX - Inogen, Inc. Jobs








 














Home
Jobs




Patient Intake Advocate Team Lead  (97089) - Richardson, TX

Toggle navigation








Patient Intake Advocate Team Lead  (97089) 

JobsLogin 












 Patient Intake Richardson, TX, USA Full Time 



Email Me Similar Jobs Email Me This Job



ABOUT INOGEN Inogen was founded in 2001 to improve quality of life and increase freedom and independence for oxygen therapy users. Inogen is innovation in oxygen therapy. The Inogen mission is to improve freedom and independence for oxygen therapy patients through innovative products and services. Inogen is a manufacturer and Accredited Homecare Provider.
Inogen is focused on quality care, continuous improvement, and outstanding customer satisfaction. We are a stable, USA based company dedicated to providing an exciting and rewarding career to our employees. We completed a successful Initial Public Offering on the NASDAQ in 2014 and have demonstrated substantial growth over the last five years. Our work environment is casual yet high performing, and we are looking for seriously talented, motivated, and fast-paced professionals to join our team.
JOB DESCRIPTION 
The Patient Intake Advocate works within the Patient Intake Business Unit and is the key individual responsible for receiving and submitting orders, while ensuring they follow all applicable accreditation, compliance/regulatory processes, Inogen policy, and Payor guidelines. This includes a completion of the appropriate patient file within database systems, review of medical documentation, procuring payment information, and obtaining patient supplied documents.
Key Competencies:
Professionally handle high volume of incoming/outgoing calls for rental orders and insurance referrals from internal and external sources to gather information for the patient onboarding process 
Responsible for validating information gathered by Customer Development Representative - DTP and communicating or resolving any deficits to include but not limited to: patient demographics, insurance information, verification of benefits, and validation that patient meets Inogen patient onboarding guidelines
Have a basic understanding of payor specific guidelines in order to facilitate the patient onboarding of profitable new rental patients
Responsible for communicating expectations and timeframes to new patients 
Responsible for informing patient and /or referral source where it has been identified that the patient does not meet Inogen patient onboarding guidelines
Responsible for obtaining patient paperwork packet and auto-pay information for future process, as applicable, following all regulations and guidelines.
Ensures Inogen's compliance with all state and federal regulations.
Ensures that all patient documents are executed in accordance with HIPAA guidelines.
Maintain regular and punctual attendance. 
Comply with all company policies and procedures. 
Assist with any other duties as assigned.
Provide timely and professional follow up to patients, physician offices, and other referral sources to meet team service level expectations.
Manage multiple work lists and responsibilities by monitoring volumes and aging, while collaborating with teammates to maintain required SLAs and performance metrics, with appropriate attention to detail and quality standards.
Have a thorough knowledge and understanding of payor specific guidelines to ensure profitable patient onboarding of new rental patients. This includes but is not limited to: knowledge of all medical record, testing and CMN requirement for reimbursement at a payor specific level.
Stays up to date on payor guidelines. 
Gathers required payor specific information, including but not limited to: chart notes, testing, orders, CMN.
Responsible for review of all documents received to determine patient meets payor specific guidelines. 
Responsible for processing new rental orders to completion following Inogen and payor specific patient onboarding guidelines
Utilizes subject matter expertise to resolve complex technical and business processes and responsibilities.
Collaborates to develop and improve work instructions, workflows, and learning aids for continuous team growth.
Performs quality assurance reviews of team member's files and provides feedback as appropriate.
Assists in handling disputes, escalations, and complex issues in an appropriate and timely manner.
Participates in training new employees as well as recurrent training for existing employees.
Make recommendations to improve quality, workflow processes, policies and procedures to enhance the order review process by decreasing processing time and increasing quality.
Manages processing of requests for order corrections or reviews, including daily KPI and Metrics reporting.
Monitors call handling metrics and standards to ensure customer support and customer satisfaction.
Responsible for handling complex issues and de-escalating patient calls.
Ensures the team follows HIPAA and company standards while interacting with patients, doctors, and other staff by practicing the highest level of support. This may include inbound or outbound calls.
Responsible for daily/weekly reporting to track any non-booked orders, productivity, rejection trends, or other team function reporting.
Participates in high level projects and various assignments as required.
 
Do you possess these abilities?
Excellent verbal and written communication skills required.
Must possess good time management skills, with the ability to prioritize and multi-task.
Must be detail-oriented and analytical to ensure documentation is being assessed properly. 
Experience with CRM platforms, preferably Salesforce, Oracle, and/or Brightree preferred.
Work experience or knowledge of the healthcare industry, preferably specific to Medicare or prescription guidelines.
Requirements:
Associates degree in Communications, Healthcare Management or related field, preferred.
3+ years' of experience reviewing documentation for Medicare Oxygen/DME Billing, Insurance Billing, or prescription requirements, required, required
2+ years customer service experience, required. 
Intermediate knowledge/proficiency in Microsoft Office, required. 
2+ years de-escalation and quality assurance, preferred.
1+ years' experience working with Medical Sales personnel, preferred
A combination of training, education and experience that is equivalent to the qualifications listed above and that provides the required knowledge, skills, and abilities. 
 
 
WHY INOGEN Inogen is a dynamic company that is not only focused on quality care of patients, but is also committed to being a top employer.  Each of Inogen' s offices have a casual culture that supports employees being responsible and developing professionals.
We offer competitive salaries and a robust benefit package:
Employee Stock Purchase Plan 401 (K) plan available for all employees Health, dental, vision insurance Flexible spending accounts and wellness discount program Life Insurance Long Term Disability Robust paid time off and 8 paid holidays Employee Assistance Program
See the Inogen Team in action:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dKoTMeJf5J4
 
Inogen Where we go to work hard to positively impact people's lives
 
Inogen is an equal opportunity employer.  We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other legally protected characteristics. The EEO is the Law poster and its supplement are available here: http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/ofccpost.htm; http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/OFCCP_EEO_Supplement_Final_JRF_QA_508c.pdf.  The pay transparency policy is available here: http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/pdf/EO13665_PrescribedNondiscriminationPostingLanguage_JRFQA508c.pdf. 
Inogen is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities.  If you need a reasonable accommodation because of a disability for any part of the employment process, please send an e-mail to recruiting@inogen.net or call (972) 616-5668 and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information.

            Intern, Associate Technical Account Manager



         Login to apply
    
















Intern, Associate Technical Account Manager
Raleigh, NC 


The Client Service Department’s internship program provides students with an introduction to real-world business practices through challenging tasks and fun activities.
Interns will be responsible for learning and executing the following:

Test and reproduce program/database issues – understand, identify, reproduce client reported issues and propose resolution
Create and maintain issues logs – enter and update client issues logs and cases through resolution
Report Writing – edit and/or create SQL, Crystal, and SSRS reports
Financial Tie Outs – understand and identify client reported issues and propose resolution
Quality Assurance – participate in ad hoc testing sessions to identify and report program bugs
Training – provide program application training to clients
Documentation – document client issues, resolution steps, processes, and training materials

Requirements for this internship are as follows:

Junior or Senior level status
Minimum GPA of 3.0
Current major in Business, Economics with an Accounting focus, Mathematics, Statistics and Computer Science
Ability to work a minimum of 15 hours per week
Client-centered commitment and focus
Ability to meet critical deadlines and prioritize multiple tasks in a fast-paced environment
Collegial, team-oriented disposition with the desire and ability to establish cooperative working relationships with employees at all levels within Yardi, outside of Yardi, and with clients
Ability to learn new concepts and Yardi programs
Ability to focus and deliver on tasks and goals without distraction
Ability to communicate effectively, cooperatively and persuasively (written and verbal communication)
Ability to treat all employees and clients with respect and dignity

Privacy Overview

This website uses cookies so that we can provide you with the best user experience possible. Cookie information is stored in your browser and performs functions such as recognising you when you return to our website and helping our team to understand which sections of the website you find most interesting and useful.
You can adjust all of your cookie settings by navigating the tabs on the left hand side.



 
Strictly Necessary Cookies

Strictly necessary cookies must be enabled at all times in order to login and apply to openings.



disable









If you disable this cookie, we will not be able to save your preferences and you will not be able to login to apply for openings. This means that every time you visit this website you will need to enable or disable cookies again.







3rd Party Cookies

This website uses Google Analytics to collect anonymous information such as the number of visitors to the site, and the most popular pages.
Keeping this cookie enabled helps us to improve our website.



disable









Please enable Strictly Necessary Cookies first so that we can save your preferences!

If you’re ready to take on a fresh challenge, grow your career and contribute to making the world a safer place, Raytheon is ready to help you achieve your goals. Join our team and get the opportunity and support to find purpose, thrive and succeed.





Notice: Please be aware of suspicious recruiting emails and text messages that attempt to collect your confidential information. Raytheon conducts all electronic correspondence using e-mail addresses that end in “Raytheon.com”, “Raytheon.co.uk”, “Raytheon.com.au” or “brassring.com”. To report fraud please go to: https://www.ic3.gov.











Sr Principal Systems Engr
Indianapolis, Indiana


Apply





Overview
Responsibilities
Success Profile
Rewards
Trending




Overview

What does it take to make the world a safer place? It takes delivering innovative technology and collaborating with some of the finest talent in the engineering field. Whether you’re a software engineer or a mechanical engineer, at Raytheon you’ll grow a varied and rewarding career. And you’ll be supported with a comprehensive and competitive benefits package that promotes work/life. If you’re ready to take on today’s big challenges, discover a world of opportunity at Raytheon.

America’s Best Large Employers by Forbes
Career & Development Opportunities
Full-time
Entry, Mid, Senior level




Back to Job Navigation (Overview)


Responsibilities


Would you like to work in a collaborative environment at an amazing facility in Indianapolis?Then join our Raytheon team of smart people solving problems that make the world a safer place and help to secure our great nation! Come support those who provide us with all the freedoms we enjoy. Our facility in Indianapolis, IN offers amenities that create work and life balance. The Indianapolis site is a 973,000 square foot modernized facility that actually began building bombsights during WWII.  On site, we have a cafeteria plus a fun space with a pool table, foosball and ping-pong. Additionally, employee appreciation lunches, bonus opportunities, and great benefits that include medical, dental, vision, 401K match, flexible work schedules, are just a few of the reasons people come to work at Raytheon!Raytheon Intelligence, Information and Services (IIS) is currently seeking a Principal Systems Engineer in support of several Systems Engineering programs and efforts. This position involves working in a team environment with responsibilities in all phases of Systems Engineering development including concept development, requirements, functional analysis, design reviews, implementation, test, verification and validation.  The Principal Systems Engineer must leverage multiple skill sets in areas such as Defense Avionics, Missile Systems, Radar and RF applications, Structures, embedded computing and networking.Clearance Requirements:  Current TS-SCI Level security clearanceResponsibilities and scope include:Lead strategies, road maps and product development to move situational avionics products to the next generation Perform systems engineering activities which may include CONOPs development, requirements development and management, systems architecture, system design, interface definition and control, integration and test to include test planning and procedure development in support of assigned programsProvide leadership and guidance to systems engineering teams in the performance of systems engineering activitiesWork directly with customers and represent the engineering technical viewpoint Develop, maintain and ensure compliance for system and subsystem requirementsProvide leadership and guidance to a cross-functional team throughout the lifecycle of a development programPrepare for and lead both internal and customer design reviewsWork with external industry and government stakeholders in the resolution of engineering systems issuesCommunicate effectively with the cross-functional engineering team and with engineering and program managementPerform responsibilities under only general directionRequired SkillsExperience applying Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence to Intelligence DataLeadership experience involving responsibility for technical, financial, and/or personnel resourcesExperience briefing effectively to all levels of the organization, from peers to senior managementExcellent written and oral communication skillsExperience operating within an organization governed by company policies & proceduresExperience on teams who design, develop, integrate, and field systemsExperience developing technical baselines (requirements/architecture); leading development teams; and developing and reviewing Engineering Change Requests.Experience applying technical standards, principles, theories, concepts and techniques to solve problems.Experience leading technical Analysis of Alternatives (AoA) and/or Trade Studies, performing Risk and Opportunity analyses, and tracking and mitigating risks.Active TS-SCI clearanceDesired Skills: Experience in development, integration, and test of large scale complex systemsExperience managing programs via program metrics: development, financial, performanceExperience in capture management: creating/reviewing RFPs, SOWs, BOEs, tech volumes, proposalsExperience ensuring program progress via formal risk & opportunity managementTraining/certification and experience performing formal Control Account Management (CAM)Experience using DOORS, Rhapsody, MagicDraw, or other requirements management and system architecture toolsExperience mentoring engineers of all grade levelsFamiliarity with Raytheon company policies & proceduresEducation Requirements: Bachelor's in Science, Technology, Engineering, and/or Mathematics (Preferred Majors: Systems, Aerospace, Electrical, Mechanical) and 10+ years of relevant experience - or Master’s in Science, Technology, Engineering, and/or Mathematics (Preferred Majors: Systems, Aerospace, Electrical, Mechanical) and 8+ years of relevant experience 153174
Business Unit Profile
                        
                        Intelligence, Information and Services delivers innovative technology to make the world a safer place. Our expertise in cyber, analytics and automation allow us to reach beyond what others think is possible to underpin national security and give our global customers unique solutions to solve the most pressing modern challenges -- from the cyber domain to automated operations, and from intelligent transportation and training solutions to creating clear insight from large volumes of data. IIS operates at nearly 550 sites in 80 countries, and is headquartered in Dulles, Virginia. The business area generated $6.2 billion in 2018 revenues. As a global business, our leaders must have the ability to understand, embrace and operate in a multicultural world -- in the marketplace and the workplace. We strive to hire people who reflect our communities and embrace diversity and inclusion to advance our culture, develop our employees, and grow our business.

Quote



Felicia Jackson is regional vice president of RAYVETS, Raytheon's employee group for veterans and those who support them. After 24 years in the Air Force, she started a new career at Raytheon. "I wanted to go where people would support me," she told us.









Rewards




401(k) / Retirement Plans
Employer Matching, if you elect to enroll company matches up to 3%.



Work / Life Balance
Raytheon supports a variety of flexible work arrangements including compressed work weeks, flextime, job sharing, 9/80, reduced hours and telecommuting.



Career Development
At Raytheon, we foster an inclusive culture of professional development. We support a variety of developmental opportunities including: Mentoring programs, Skills Development, Leadership Development, Rotational job assignments, and Continuous Improvement, all of which contribute to advancement of our employee’s capabilities.



Paid Time Off
Accrue paid time off monthly. Receive 10-12 holidays per year with some locations shutting down the week between Christmas and New Year’s Day.



Relocation Assistance
Select technical positions are eligible for relocation packages. See specific job description for eligibility requirements.



Parental Leave
Raytheon offers all eligible employees up to three weeks paid parental leave for the birth or adoption of a child (separate from paid maternity leave or Family & Medical Leave Act).

Associate, Client Activation Manager - (0105255) Do you want to work in a smart, and energetic environment where you will be challenged, rewarded AND inspired? Come work with top performers at CJ Affiliate to make a real difference in how top brands run their businesses. We are the world’s leading affiliate marketing network - we transform digital marketing with the help of big data and business intelligence.  We help advertisers drive more sales and expand their reach… and we want to hear from you! About This Role The Associate
Client Activation Manager (ACAM) owns each new client onboarding and leads all
aspects of the launch with the client. They ensure workflow expectations and
timelines are met with outlined service level standards, based on account
tiers. The ACAM role partners with the Client to gain knowledge and understand
their business goals for a seamless, successful integration.
 Key Duties, Tasks and ResponsibilitiesUnderstand the client’s business at all
levels (local, country, region) to evaluate delivery requirementsPrinciple contact for operational &
tactical issues representing delivery of all products and services to the clientOwns customer operational relationship; delivers
excellent customer serviceManage multiple accounts and tasks without
error in deliveryAct as liaison between Sales, Client
Integration, and cross-teams as needed to support client onboardingProvides recommendations and best
practices to ensure that all advertiser accounts within area of responsibility
meet the maximum quality setup standards prior to launchHold Client and internal partners
accountable to tasks and timeline in accordance with launch planParticipates in Sales handoff/Launch
Kick-off call Knowledge, Skills & AbilitiesAbility to
build and manage strong client relationshipsStrong influencer and possesses negotiation skillsAbility to apply business management, financial concepts & contracts
knowledge to analyze business needs and develop recommendationsAbility to prepare clear, concise and persuasive communications for
multiple audiences, including demonstrating effective writing, presentation
skills, listening activelyAbility to understand/analyze an issue or problem and develop/implement
a corrective action planApplies appropriate knowledge and methods to resolve business issues Meet and adheres to Service Level Agreement standardsStrong Communication etiquette: calls/emailWork
across and foster team environment with Sales, Tech, Legal, Finance, and Client
DevelopmentEducation & ExperienceCollege degree in a related field
or 2+ years implementing, explaining and integrating technical programs for
non-technical users; including clearly explaining processes and concepts.
Preferred QualificationsExcellent
communication skillsCollaborative team player accustomed to working within and across groupsOrganized and detail-oriented with ability to manage own work as well as
track the activities of othersAbility to manage through competing/conflicting requests and obtain
consensusAbility to
overcome obstacles and develop resolutions to problems  Why CJ Affiliate?CJ Affiliate is the leader in Affiliate Marketing. We take pride in our innovative technology, comprehensive data solutions and our people. We equip our teams with advanced tools, training and career development opportunities all to provide cutting edge solutions, strategies and support to deliver high quality results for our clients. We work in an energetic, results-oriented, collaborative, team environment that recognizes exceptional performance. As we evolve and grow as a business, so do you.Great People, Deserve Great BenefitsWe know that we have some of the brightest and most talented associates in the world, and we believe in rewarding them accordingly. If you work here, expect competitive pay, comprehensive health coverage, and endless opportunities to advance your career.About UsEpsilon® is an all-encompassing global marketing innovator. We provide unrivaled data intelligence and customer insights, world-class technology including loyalty, email and CRM platforms and data-driven creative, activation and execution. Epsilon’s digital media arm, Conversant, is a leader in personalized digital advertising and insights through its proprietary technology and trove of consumer marketing data, delivering digital marketing with unprecedented scale, accuracy and reach through personalized media programs. Together, we bring personalized marketing to consumers across offline and online channels, at moments of interest that help drive business growth for brands. Epsilon employs over 8,000 associates in 70 offices worldwide. For more information, visit www.epsilon.com and follow us on Twitter @EpsilonMktg.Epsilon is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Epsilon’s policy is not to discriminate against any applicant or employee based on actual or perceived race, color creed, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, marital status, medical condition as defined by applicable state law, genetic information, disability, military service and veteran status, pregnancy, childbirth and related medical conditions, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state, or local laws and ordinances. Epsilon also prohibits harassment of applicants and employees based on any of these protected categories.Epsilon will provide accommodations to applicants needing accommodations to complete the application process.#enterprise-operations                                                         #LI-DTApply now at CJ.com/careers  Primary Location: USA - United States-3079 - California-50035 - Santa Barbara-K8-Santa BarbaraWork Locations: K8-Santa Barbara   Santa Barbara 93103Job: Account ManagementOrganization: EpsilonSchedule: RegularJob Type: Full-timeJob Posting: Dec 5, 2019, 2:39:07 PMDivision: CJ AffiliateRI: DT

Buyer/Planner III  (97081) - Richardson, TX - Inogen, Inc. Jobs








 














Home
Jobs




Buyer/Planner III  (97081) - Richardson, TX

Toggle navigation








Buyer/Planner III  (97081) 

JobsLogin 












 Operations Richardson, TX, USA Full Time 



Email Me Similar Jobs Email Me This Job



ABOUT INOGEN Inogen was founded in 2001 to improve quality of life and increase freedom and independence for oxygen therapy users. Inogen is innovation in oxygen therapy. The Inogen mission is to improve freedom and independence for oxygen therapy patients through innovative products and services. Inogen is a manufacturer and Accredited Homecare Provider.
Inogen is focused on quality care, continuous improvement, and outstanding customer satisfaction. We are a stable, USA based company dedicated to providing an exciting and rewarding career to our employees. We completed a successful Initial Public Offering on the NASDAQ in 2014 and have demonstrated substantial growth over the last five years. Our work environment is casual yet high performing, and we are looking for seriously talented, motivated, and fast-paced professionals to join our team.
JOB DESCRIPTION 
The Buyer/Planner is responsible for procuring raw material, expense items and equipment in support of manufacturing operations.  This includes establishing and maintaining the Kanban ordering process that triggers the need for raw material ordering.  In addition, they will release purchase orders with suppliers off of pre-existing blanket agreements and negotiate price with suppliers for lower-level/non-contract items.  They will expedite/delay raw material in accordance with manufacturing needs and track, research and improve line down part shortages.  Furthermore, they will set and manage to raw material inventory targets and turns improvement goals.  They will be a key part of the manufacturing team.
Key Competencies:
Calculate and maintain Kanban/Ultriva order quantities.
Order raw material using Kanban/Ultriva pull system.
Expedite or delay raw material deliveries based on manufacturing needs.
Resolve general problems with suppliers (i.e. - receiving errors, invoicing problems)
Proactively identify and escalate major supply issues in a timely manner
Monitor and improve line-down part shortages and supplier on-time delivery.
Establish and achieve inventory reduction goals for raw material through detailed inventory analysis and action plans.
Implement and sustain improvements in inventory 5s/visual management, including inventory accuracy.
Coordinates with Quality, Engineering, Operations, Regulatory and Accounting on approving new suppliers.
Responsible for training new suppliers on the use of Ultriva and emphasizing best practices.
Negotiates with vendors for all materials, supplies, equipment and services used by the Company, where contract pricing is not established by the strategic procurement team.
Coordinates with Supply Chain organization on integrating new suppliers.
Coordinate the smooth transition of raw material during the launch of new products and engineering change orders.
Coordinates 20 or less non-critical suppliers 
Maintain regular and punctual attendance. 
Comply with all company policies and procedures. 
Assist with any other duties as assigned.
Coordinates up to 5 critical suppliers and 40 or less non-critical suppliers 
 
Do you possess these abilities?
High sense-of-urgency, work ethic.
Strong analytical and planning ability.
Highly organized.
Attention to detail.
Effective conflict resolution and communication skills
Ability to problem-solve complex solutions both daily and long-term.
Lean manufacturing practitioner.
Ability to effectively interface with different departments within the company.
A willingness to spend significant time on the factory floor problem-solving and collaborating.
Ability to effectively interface with different departments within the company.
Solutions-oriented problem solver. 
Excellent planning, communication and organizational skills. 
Ability to effectively interface with different departments within the company.
Requirements:
Bachelors degree in Business Management, Supply Chain Management, Logistics, or related technical discipline, required.
5-7 years of experience in purchasing and inventory management, required; Preferably in medical device manufacturing.
Intermediate proficiency/knowledge in Microsoft Office included Excel, required.
MRP Systems experience, required. Preferable with Alliance and/or Great Plains. 
APICs certification Supply Chain Professional, preferred.
A combination of training, education and experience that is equivalent to the qualifications listed above and that provides the required knowledge, skills, and abilities.
 
WHY INOGEN Inogen is a dynamic company that is not only focused on quality care of patients, but is also committed to being a top employer.  Each of Inogen' s offices have a casual culture that supports employees being responsible and developing professionals.
We offer competitive salaries and a robust benefit package:
Employee Stock Purchase Plan 401 (K) plan available for all employees Health, dental, vision insurance Flexible spending accounts and wellness discount program Life Insurance Long Term Disability Robust paid time off and 8 paid holidays Employee Assistance Program
See the Inogen Team in action:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dKoTMeJf5J4
 
Inogen Where we go to work hard to positively impact people's lives
 
Inogen is an equal opportunity employer.  We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other legally protected characteristics. The EEO is the Law poster and its supplement are available here: http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/ofccpost.htm; http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/OFCCP_EEO_Supplement_Final_JRF_QA_508c.pdf.  The pay transparency policy is available here: http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/pdf/EO13665_PrescribedNondiscriminationPostingLanguage_JRFQA508c.pdf. 
Inogen is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities.  If you need a reasonable accommodation because of a disability for any part of the employment process, please send an e-mail to recruiting@inogen.net or call (972) 616-5668 and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information.
 
 

Inogen, Inc.
https://inogen.applicantpro.com

            Associate Technical Account Manager



         Login to apply
    
















Associate Technical Account Manager
Atlanta, GA 


Associate Technical Account Managers at Yardi will provide consultative, implementation and technical support to a group of assigned Yardi clients in order to manage business operations and financial accounting functions in Yardi’s Voyager software.
Responsibilities

Implements the Yardi suite of software products by assisting clients with system implementation, training, and technical support
Researches, analyzes and resolves software issues
Supports software product customization based on client requirements
Performs data mapping and conversions
Performs system and business process reviews and other service reviews and makes recommendations on best practices
Works on a regular basis with Yardi internal resource teams to include: training, conversion, sales and development

Requirements

Bachelor’s degree in Economics, Business, Math, Statistics or Information Management preferred
Experience setting and managing client expectations
Superior verbal and written communication skills
Project Management, Accounting, or Property Management experience/background
Solid Proficiency in MS Office Suite and Outlook
Knowledge in three of the following areas: Property Management, Accounting, Microsoft Windows, Technical Support, SQL, HTML/ASP
Prior experience with property management software or real estate software highly desirable
Prior experience with Yardi software highly desirable
Regular attendance and a regular work schedule is an essential function of this job.

 
 *lw

By continuing to browse this site you agree to our use of cookies. You can find out more about which cookies we are using or switch them off in settings.
 

 
Accept

 


















 

 Privacy Overview


 Strictly Necessary Cookies


 3rd Party Cookies




 








Privacy Overview

This website uses cookies so that we can provide you with the best user experience possible. Cookie information is stored in your browser and performs functions such as recognising you when you return to our website and helping our team to understand which sections of the website you find most interesting and useful.
You can adjust all of your cookie settings by navigating the tabs on the left hand side.



 
Strictly Necessary Cookies

Strictly necessary cookies must be enabled at all times in order to login and apply to openings.



disable









If you disable this cookie, we will not be able to save your preferences and you will not be able to login to apply for openings. This means that every time you visit this website you will need to enable or disable cookies again.







3rd Party Cookies

This website uses Google Analytics to collect anonymous information such as the number of visitors to the site, and the most popular pages.
Keeping this cookie enabled helps us to improve our website.



disable









Please enable Strictly Necessary Cookies first so that we can save your preferences!












Enable All
Save Changes

If you’re ready to take on a fresh challenge, grow your career and contribute to making the world a safer place, Raytheon is ready to help you achieve your goals. Join our team and get the opportunity and support to find purpose, thrive and succeed.





Notice: Please be aware of suspicious recruiting emails and text messages that attempt to collect your confidential information. Raytheon conducts all electronic correspondence using e-mail addresses that end in “Raytheon.com”, “Raytheon.co.uk”, “Raytheon.com.au” or “brassring.com”. To report fraud please go to: https://www.ic3.gov.











Sr Systems Engineer I
Colorado Springs, Colorado


Apply





Overview
Responsibilities
Success Profile
Rewards
Trending




Overview

What does it take to make the world a safer place? It takes delivering innovative technology and collaborating with some of the finest talent in the engineering field. Whether you’re a software engineer or a mechanical engineer, at Raytheon you’ll grow a varied and rewarding career. And you’ll be supported with a comprehensive and competitive benefits package that promotes work/life. If you’re ready to take on today’s big challenges, discover a world of opportunity at Raytheon.

America’s Best Large Employers by Forbes
Career & Development Opportunities
Full-time
Entry, Mid, Senior level




Back to Job Navigation (Overview)


Responsibilities


Would you like to work in a collaborative environment at an amazing company located in Colorado Springs, CO?Then join our Raytheon team of smart people solving problems that make the world a safer place and help to secure our great nation!  Come support those who provide us with all the freedoms we enjoy. Our company offers amenities that create work and life balance.   Enjoy employee appreciation lunches, bonus opportunities, and great benefits that include medical, dental, vision, 401K match, and flexible work schedules.  These are just a few of the reasons people come to work at Raytheon! Raytheon is a technology and innovation leader specializing in defense, security and civil markets throughout the world.  Our latest company video is about our people, our technology, our vision, and the values we hold dear at Raytheon.  Click here to view: https://youtu.be/qvbCgKpkEdsRaytheon Intelligence, Information and Services (IIS) is currently seeking an experienced engineering professional for the role of Test Engineer in support of the North American Aerospace Defense Command (NORAD) Integrated Space Support Contract (NISSC) program. NISSC provides accurate, timely and unambiguous warning and attack assessment of Air, Missile and Space threats with daily visibility of National Command Authority leaders.  This position involves working in a team environment supporting all phases of Test Engineering development including concept development, test requirements, test set up implementation, test execution, and test reports.  The Test Engineer leverages multiple skill sets in areas such as Missile Defense, Radar and RF applications, embedded computing and networking.Clearance Requirement:U.S. CITIZEN with an active Secret security clearanceResponsibilities and scope include:• Perform test engineering activities which may include test planning and concept development, test requirements, test environment design, test procedure development, integration and test execution, and test reports Provide leadership and guidance to systems engineering teams in the performance of systems engineering activities• May work directly with customers• Show compliance and gaps for system and subsystem requirements• Provide support to a cross-functional team throughout the lifecycle of a development program• Participate in both internal and customer design reviews representing test status and results• Communicate effectively with the cross-functional engineering team• Perform responsibilities independently with limited directionRequired Skills:• Experience in systems, software or hardware engineering, providing demonstrable technical expertise & value to programs, commensurate with current grade and role• Experience using DOORS, Rhapsody, MagicDraw, or other requirements management and system architecture tools• Good written and oral communication skills• Experience operating within an organization governed by company policies & procedures• Experience on teams who design, develop, integrate, and field systems• Experience applying technical standards, principles, theories, concepts and techniques to solve problems• Experience supporting technical Analysis of Alternatives (AoA) and/or Trade Studies, performing Risk and Opportunity analyses, and tracking and mitigating risksDesired Skills:• Familiarity with the existing Integrated Tactical Warning/Attack Assessment (ITW/AA) aerospace defense Systems, and their policies and procedures• Experience in development, integration, and test of large scale complex Mainframe systems• Experience with the current NCMC-ITW/AA Legacy Space maintained systems that includes CMP, DECON, SDS, and SPADOC• Experience supporting programs who manage via program metrics: development, financial, performance• Experience ensuring program progress via formal risk & opportunity management• Experience mentoring engineers of all grade levels• Familiarity with Raytheon company policies & proceduresEducation Requirements:4 years with a BS or BA in Engineering, Science, Mathematics or related STEM degree; or 4 years with a MS/MA in Engineering, Science, Mathematics or related STEM degree 150670
Business Unit Profile
Raytheon Intelligence, Information and Services delivers innovative technology to make the world a safer place. Our expertise in cyber, analytics and automation allow us to reach beyond what others think is possible to underpin national security and give our global customers unique solutions to solve the most pressing modern challenges -- from the cyber domain to automated operations, and from intelligent transportation and training solutions to creating clear insight from large volumes of data. IIS operates at nearly 550 sites in 80 countries, and is headquartered in Dulles, Virginia. The business area generated $6.2 billion in 2018 revenues. As a global business, our leaders must have the ability to understand, embrace and operate in a multicultural world -- in the marketplace and the workplace. We strive to hire people who reflect our communities and embrace diversity and inclusion to advance our culture, develop our employees, and grow our business.
Relocation Eligible 
                        
                        No

Quote



Felicia Jackson is regional vice president of RAYVETS, Raytheon's employee group for veterans and those who support them. After 24 years in the Air Force, she started a new career at Raytheon. "I wanted to go where people would support me," she told us.









Rewards




401(k) / Retirement Plans
Employer Matching, if you elect to enroll company matches up to 3%.



Work / Life Balance
Raytheon supports a variety of flexible work arrangements including compressed work weeks, flextime, job sharing, 9/80, reduced hours and telecommuting.



Career Development
At Raytheon, we foster an inclusive culture of professional development. We support a variety of developmental opportunities including: Mentoring programs, Skills Development, Leadership Development, Rotational job assignments, and Continuous Improvement, all of which contribute to advancement of our employee’s capabilities.



Paid Time Off
Accrue paid time off monthly. Receive 10-12 holidays per year with some locations shutting down the week between Christmas and New Year’s Day.



Relocation Assistance
Select technical positions are eligible for relocation packages. See specific job description for eligibility requirements.



Parental Leave
Raytheon offers all eligible employees up to three weeks paid parental leave for the birth or adoption of a child (separate from paid maternity leave or Family & Medical Leave Act).

Rewards




401(k) / Retirement Plans
Employer Matching, if you elect to enroll company matches up to 3%.



Work / Life Balance
Raytheon appreciates work/life balance. Employees can work 9 hours a day every week and received every other Friday off, as long as departmental/manager approval is obtained. Accrued paid time off monthly and paid holiday time.



Career Development
At Raytheon, we foster an inclusive culture of professional development. We support a variety of developmental opportunities including: Mentoring programs, Skills Development, Leadership Development, Rotational job assignments, and Continuous Improvement, all of which contribute to advancement of our employee’s capabilities.



Paid Time Off
Accrue paid time off monthly. Receive 12 holidays per year including the week between Christmas and New Year’s Day.



Relocation Assistance
Select technical positions are eligible for relocation packages. See specific job description for eligibility requirements.



Parental Leave
Raytheon offers all eligible employees up to three weeks paid parental leave for the birth or adoption of a child (separate from paid maternity leave or Family & Medical Leave Act).



Back to Job Navigation (Rewards)



Responsibilities


Would you like to work in a collaborative environment at a state of the art facility in Colorado? Then join our Raytheon team of engineers solving problems that make the world a safer place and help to secure our great nation! Come support those who provide us with all the freedoms we enjoy.Our facility in Aurora, CO offers amenities that create work and life balance. On site we have a 24/7 fitness facility, health center, cafeteria, collaboration rooms and dynamic break areas for easy conversation and socialization. Additionally, employee appreciation lunches, bonus opportunities, and great benefits that include medical, dental, vision, 401K match, flexible work schedule - just to name a few.  Click here to view a brief video and learn more: https://youtu.be/YNuZN0vyzHgRaytheon Intelligence, Information and Services (IIS) is currently seeking a Cyber Engineer professional to be a key contributor in the implementation of cyber engineering.  This engineer will be involved throughout the full lifecycle of the development program including CONOPs development, requirements development, architecture, design, integration, test, certification, and continuous monitoring of products.This position provides an engineer the opportunity to support ongoing business process activities, such as, metrics collection and analysis, program tailoring, and process documentation updates and deployment.Must be a U.S. CITIZEN with a current Top Secret/Sensitive Compartmented Information (TS/SCI) security clearance.Required Skills: Current TS/SCI clearance8+ years of experience developing cyber security solutions, Security Authorization requirements, and security policy and emerging cyber security technologies for Department of Defense (DoD) or similar federal agencyExperience implementing compliance with security requirements (i.e. Risk Management Framework, STIGs)Windows Operating System, Linux, or TCP/IP network troubleshooting abilitiesAbility to identify system design and operational vulnerabilities, and make recommendations to address deficient areas.Current IAT-II or greater cybersecurity certification per DoD 8570.01-Manual (Security+CE or CISSP is preferable)Ability to manage time and resources in order to meet assigned deadlineMust have hands-on technical experience as an individual contributor with documentation skills and experience in some of the following areas:Linux system administrationWindows system administrationNetwork component administrationVMware administrationOperating system hardeningAssessment and Authorization (NIST SP800-37, ICD 503)Developing System Security Plans (SSPs) and all supporting assessment and authorization documentationDesired Skills: Capable of developing technical solutions following the assessment of complex customer needsProject management skills including cost, schedule, supplier management, risk, and opportunity assessmentExperience assessing existing products to determine vulnerabilities and develop strategies for improvementExperience and knowledge in onboarding, tuning and implementing enterprise security solutions (Tenable Security Center and Nessus, RSA NetWitness Security Analytics, and the DoD’s HBSS solution)Experience conducting RMF security assessments and supporting programs achieving ATO under ICD 503 standardsExperience in developing and maintaining Continuous Monitoring (ConMon) Plans and ability to obtain data to support the development of Ongoing ConMon ReportsExperience developing and updating security artifacts such as:  CTP, SSP, Security CONOPS, GUG/PUG, POA&M, SRTM, etc.Experience analyzing audit log data and determine compliance with published standardsExperience with systems engineering at all development levels of a complex systemExperience with scripting languages (e.g. Perl, Python, VBA, Ruby) or programming languages (e.g. C/C++ or Java) to automate security testingExperience conducting technical reviews with customers (both internal and external)Education Requirements: Bachelors in Science, Technology, Engineering, and/or Mathematics (STEM Degree) with 8+ years of prior relevant experience orMasters / PhD in in Science, Technology, Engineering, and/or Mathematics (STEM Degree) with 6+ years of prior relevant experienceThis position requires either a U.S. Person or a Non-U.S. Person who is eligible to obtain any required Export Authorization. 148415
                

                    
                 
                           Raytheon is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, age, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected Veteran status.

            Help Desk Specialist



         Login to apply
    
















Help Desk Specialist
Irving, TX 


As an IT Helpdesk Specialist you will be responsible for:

Responding to requests for technical assistance in person, via phone, or electronically
Installing software and updating hardware
Diagnosing and resolving technical hardware and software issues
Researching questions using available information resources
Advising users on appropriate actions
Following standard helpdesk procedures
Logging all helpdesk interactions
Administering helpdesk software
Re-directing problems to the appropriate resource

 
The ideal candidate will possess the following skills and abilities:

3-5 years  of experience
Proficiency in Windows 7, Windows 8 and Microsoft Office
Basic Network Troubleshooting skills
PC Imaging
Familiar with mobile device (phone/tablet) setup and use
Excellent customer service skills
Ability to work outside normal business hours if required to include evenings and weekends

 *sa

Corporate Website
Privacy Statement

By continuing to browse this site you agree to our use of cookies. You can find out more about which cookies we are using or switch them off in settings.
 

 
Accept

 


















 

 Privacy Overview


 Strictly Necessary Cookies


 3rd Party Cookies




 








Privacy Overview

This website uses cookies so that we can provide you with the best user experience possible. Cookie information is stored in your browser and performs functions such as recognising you when you return to our website and helping our team to understand which sections of the website you find most interesting and useful.
You can adjust all of your cookie settings by navigating the tabs on the left hand side.



 
Strictly Necessary Cookies

Strictly necessary cookies must be enabled at all times in order to login and apply to openings.



disable









If you disable this cookie, we will not be able to save your preferences and you will not be able to login to apply for openings. This means that every time you visit this website you will need to enable or disable cookies again.







3rd Party Cookies

This website uses Google Analytics to collect anonymous information such as the number of visitors to the site, and the most popular pages.
Keeping this cookie enabled helps us to improve our website.



disable









Please enable Strictly Necessary Cookies first so that we can save your preferences!












Enable All
Save Changes

If you’re ready to take on a fresh challenge, grow your career and contribute to making the world a safer place, Raytheon is ready to help you achieve your goals. Join our team and get the opportunity and support to find purpose, thrive and succeed.





Notice: Please be aware of suspicious recruiting emails and text messages that attempt to collect your confidential information. Raytheon conducts all electronic correspondence using e-mail addresses that end in “Raytheon.com”, “Raytheon.co.uk”, “Raytheon.com.au” or “brassring.com”. To report fraud please go to: https://www.ic3.gov.










Sr Financial Data Analyst
Apply
Requisition ID 151811BR Date updated 11/13/2019
Description: GBS (Global Business Services) Accounts Payable is seeking a Financial Data Analyst to support the Accounts Payable organization to improve invoice processing efficiencies by managing process improvement projects identified through data analysis.  This role will be responsible for the design and development of Business Intelligence by collecting, analyzing and structuring financial data to deliver relevant, reliable information that is meaningful and actionable to improve business decisions.Must have strong verbal and written communication skills and the ability to communicate complex financial and technical data to all levels of management in a concise clear and accurate manner.  In addition, this individual will assist the AP team in managing projects and assist with the day to day operational activities.  The ability to be self-sufficient as well as operating in a team environment will be fundamental to success in this role and will help maximize the value to the organization.  The Financial Analyst position covers a wide set of requirements, so a successful candidate will need to show flexibility in job abilities and strong communication skills.Key Responsibilities: Provide subject matter expertise developing reports and dashboards utilizing Tableau, SQL and/or SAP LumiraEngage stakeholders to collect, analyze, document and get sign-off on project requirementsProduce project documents including Solution Definition and Detailed Technical Design DocumentsWill be the “Go to” person for all data analysis and dashboard creation and maintenanceProvide leadership in executing projects and working effectively with stakeholdersCollaborate with the Data Integration teams in developing data models to suit BI solutionsWillingness to work together with development team and assist in troubleshooting, debuggingServe as consultant to leadership and project owners to identify system involvement, data availability and design reporting solutions for the stated need(s)Look for gaps in existing reporting and proactively design solutionsAssist the AP team on day to day operational activities that may include research, issue corrections, and processing of invoicesMay include leading a teamRequired Experience: Experience and solid understanding of data warehousing including data architecture, analysis and design, ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) and Business Intelligence, plus the ability to bridge the gap between end-users and technical professionalsStrong experience in creating dashboards utilizing Tableau and SQL DatabasesExperience working with large data sets (Big Data) conducting complex analytics.  Hands on experience managing and leading projects from inception to completionMust have experience working on multiple projects in Tableau and SQL to build dashboards that are visually appealing, informative and provide actionable informationProactively research tools, best practices, and improve skills through self-learningSAP experience and modeling data with SAP Lumira is a plusExperience in financial analysisProficient in MS Office suiteRequired Education and Experience: Bachelor’s Degree required in Computer Science, Business,  Finance or related field and 4 or more  years of applicable Finance, Accounting , Business Administration and/or Business Intelligence experienceUS Citizenship Required: This position requires access to systems/tools that are restricted to individuals who possess US citizenship 151811
Business Unit Profile
Corporate provides innovative, enterprise-wide support and solutions to business and functional organizations across the Company.  Headquartered in Waltham, MA., Corporate has employee’s at major sites across the U.S..

Related Content




Work on interesting projects and enjoy plenty of recognition
Whether you’re just starting out on your career journey or a experienced professional, it’s important that you feel recognized and rewarded for your contributions.
Raytheon is proud to offer a comprehensive and competitive benefits package to you, your spouse and your eligible children. In addition to protecting you and your family's health and well-being, we offer important income and work/life benefits to meet your needs. Learn More





Turn unique thinking into one-of-a-kind solutions
Diversity. Every company likes to talk about it, but few have embraced it with quite the same commitment as we have here at Raytheon. As a result, diversity has become a competitive imperative and an integral part of our business model, particularly as we continue to grow internationally. Learn More








Work as one to make a difference to millions
Here at Raytheon, we innovate across all domains: from land and sea to air, space, and cyberspace.It’s innovation made possible by a strong internal culture and a vision that’s shared by Raytheon employees across the globe – a vision of one global team creating trusted, innovative solutions to make the world a safer place. Learn More

If you’re ready to take on a fresh challenge, grow your career and contribute to making the world a safer place, Raytheon is ready to help you achieve your goals. Join our team and get the opportunity and support to find purpose, thrive and succeed.





Notice: Please be aware of suspicious recruiting emails and text messages that attempt to collect your confidential information. Raytheon conducts all electronic correspondence using e-mail addresses that end in “Raytheon.com”, “Raytheon.co.uk”, “Raytheon.com.au” or “brassring.com”. To report fraud please go to: https://www.ic3.gov.











Principal Network Infrastructure Engineer
Dulles, Virginia


Apply





Overview
Responsibilities
Success Profile
Rewards
Trending




Overview

What does it take to make the world a safer place? It takes delivering innovative technology and collaborating with some of the finest talent in the engineering field. Whether you’re a software engineer or a mechanical engineer, at Raytheon you’ll grow a varied and rewarding career. And you’ll be supported with a comprehensive and competitive benefits package that promotes work/life. If you’re ready to take on today’s big challenges, discover a world of opportunity at Raytheon.

America’s Best Large Employers by Forbes
Career & Development Opportunities
Full-time
Entry, Mid, Senior level




Back to Job Navigation (Overview)


Responsibilities


Are you looking for an engineering career that is challenging and satisfying? Then join our Raytheon team of engineers solving problems that make the world a safer place and help to secure our great nation! Come support those who provide us with all the freedoms we enjoy.We offer great benefits that include medical, dental, vision, 401K match, flexible work schedule - just to name a few.  Click here to view a brief video and learn more: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qvbCgKpkEdsRaytheon Intelligence, Information and Services (IIS) delivers innovative technology to make the world a safer place. Our expertise in cyber, analytics and automation allow us to reach beyond what others think is possible to underpin national security and give our global customers unique solutions to solve the most pressing modern challenges -- from the cyber domain to automated operations, and from intelligent transportation solutions to creating clear insight from large volumes of data. IIS operates at nearly 550 sites in 80 countries, including a large presence in Dulles, VA. As a global business, our leaders must have the ability to understand, embrace and operate in a multicultural world -- in the marketplace and the workplace. We strive to hire people who reflect our communities and embrace diversity and inclusion to advance our culture, develop our employees, and grow our business.Job Description:The Raytheon IIS Hardware and Infrastructure Engineering (HW&I) team has a professional opening for a Principal Network Infrastructure Engineer.  This position will perform network and infrastructure engineering tasks pertaining to LAN/data center system design, development, implementation, integration, and troubleshooting activities.  The qualified individual should possess knowledge and experience with network technologies, services, operations, and security.  The ability to obtain a US Government TS/SCI security clearance is required for this position (US citizenship required). Candidates with a current TS/SCI security clearance or higher are eligible for a $20,000 sign on bonus if the clearance is confirmed and the candidate is hired by RaytheonRequired Skills:Strong understanding of network technologies, services, security, and managementExperience with data center LAN design, implementation, diagnostics, performance, and managementExperience with implementation and configuration of Cisco products (Catalyst, Nexus, and Firepower)Experience with fiber channel storage SAN configurationFamiliarity with private cloud virtualization and virtual networks in Vmware environmentsAbility to perform system administration tasks on Linux and Windows platformsSkills in creation of data center solution documentation, including artifacts done using Microsoft VisioAbility to provide technical direction to a team of junior personnelAbility to multi-task and adjust priorities on the flyExperience in a customer-facing roleWillingness to travel, including internationallyAbility to obtain and maintain a US Government TS/SCI security clearanceDesired Skills:Understanding of network management and monitoring toolsetsFamiliarity with HPE switches and storage arraysExperience hardening network elements to US Government IA compliance standardsExposure to OWL data diode hardwareExisting US Government TS/SCI security clearanceEducation Requirements:Requires a degree in Science, Technology, Engineering or Mathematics (STEM) and 8 years of related work experienceor 16 years of related work experience in lieu of a STEM degree 145781
Business Unit Profile
                        
                        Raytheon Intelligence, Information and Services delivers innovative technology to make the world a safer place. Our expertise in cyber, analytics and automation allow us to reach beyond what others think is possible to underpin national security and give our global customers unique solutions to solve the most pressing modern challenges -- from the cyber domain to automated operations, and from intelligent transportation and training solutions to creating clear insight from large volumes of data. IIS operates at nearly 550 sites in 80 countries, and is headquartered in Dulles, Virginia. The business area generated $6.2 billion in 2018 revenues. As a global business, our leaders must have the ability to understand, embrace and operate in a multicultural world -- in the marketplace and the workplace. We strive to hire people who reflect our communities and embrace diversity and inclusion to advance our culture, develop our employees, and grow our business.
Relocation Eligible 
                        
                        Yes
Clearance Type 
                        
                        TS/SCI
Expertise 
                        

                                
                            AlgorithmsArtificial IntelligenceCloud ComputingComputer EngineeringComputer ScienceComputer/Management Information SystemsCyber JobsData NetworkingData ScienceEngineering TechnologyGeneral EngineeringHardware EngineeringInformation and Knowledge SystemsIntegration & Test EngineeringIntelligence AnalystManufacturing EngineeringNetwork Communications ResearchReliability EngineerSoftware EngineeringSystems EngineeringTechnicalTest Engineering
                        
                        

Type Of Job 
                        
                        Full Time

Work Location 
                        
 
                            
                            VA - Dulles
                        
Raytheon is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, age, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected Veteran status.

Success Profile
What does it take to be successful at Raytheon? Check out these traits to see if you have the right mix.

Back to Job Navigation (Success)


Quote



Felicia Jackson is regional vice president of RAYVETS, Raytheon's employee group for veterans and those who support them. After 24 years in the Air Force, she started a new career at Raytheon. "I wanted to go where people would support me," she told us.









Rewards




401(k) / Retirement Plans
Employer Matching, if you elect to enroll company matches up to 3%.



Work / Life Balance
Raytheon supports a variety of flexible work arrangements including compressed work weeks, flextime, job sharing, 9/80, reduced hours and telecommuting.



Career Development
At Raytheon, we foster an inclusive culture of professional development. We support a variety of developmental opportunities including: Mentoring programs, Skills Development, Leadership Development, Rotational job assignments, and Continuous Improvement, all of which contribute to advancement of our employee’s capabilities.



Paid Time Off
Accrue paid time off monthly. Receive 10-12 holidays per year with some locations shutting down the week between Christmas and New Year’s Day.



Relocation Assistance
Select technical positions are eligible for relocation packages. See specific job description for eligibility requirements.



Parental Leave
Raytheon offers all eligible employees up to three weeks paid parental leave for the birth or adoption of a child (separate from paid maternity leave or Family & Medical Leave Act).

            Associate Technical Account Manager



         Login to apply
    
















Associate Technical Account Manager
Long Island, NY 


  As an Associate Technical Account Manager on the Investment Management team at Yardi, you will advise on best practice, guide through implementation, and provide technical support to a group of assigned Yardi clients in order to manage their investment portfolio, run business operations and complete financial accounting functions in Yardi's Voyager software.  Responsibilities •Performs system and business process reviews and other service reviews and makes recommendations on best practices •Implements the Yardi suite of software products by assisting clients with system implementation, training, and technical support •Researches, analyzes and resolves software issues •Supports software product customization based on client requirements •Performs data mapping and conversions •Works on a regular basis with Yardi internal resource teams to include: training, conversion, sales and development  Requirements •Bachelor's degree in Finance, Accounting, Economics, Business, Math, Statistics or Information Management •Experience setting and managing client expectations •Superior verbal and written communication skills •Project Management, Accounting, or Property Management experience/background •Solid Proficiency in MS Office Suite and Outlook •Knowledge in three of the following areas: Property Management, Accounting, Private Equity, Finance, Microsoft Windows, Technical Support, SQL, HTML/ASP •Prior experience with property management software or real estate software highly desirable •Prior experience with Yardi software highly desirable *bd

Privacy Overview

This website uses cookies so that we can provide you with the best user experience possible. Cookie information is stored in your browser and performs functions such as recognising you when you return to our website and helping our team to understand which sections of the website you find most interesting and useful.
You can adjust all of your cookie settings by navigating the tabs on the left hand side.



 
Strictly Necessary Cookies

Strictly necessary cookies must be enabled at all times in order to login and apply to openings.



disable









If you disable this cookie, we will not be able to save your preferences and you will not be able to login to apply for openings. This means that every time you visit this website you will need to enable or disable cookies again.







3rd Party Cookies

This website uses Google Analytics to collect anonymous information such as the number of visitors to the site, and the most popular pages.
Keeping this cookie enabled helps us to improve our website.



disable









Please enable Strictly Necessary Cookies first so that we can save your preferences!

Sr. Software Engineer - (0105268)  For more information and to contact us, please visit http://engineering.cj.com/joinDo you want to work in a fun, smart, and energetic environment where you will be challenged, rewarded AND inspired? Come work with top performers at CJ Affiliate to make a real difference in how top brands run their businesses. We are the world’s leading affiliate marketing network - we transform digital marketing with the help of big data.  We help advertisers and publishers connect, drive more sales and expand their reach … and we want to hear from you!  About This Role As a Sr. Software Engineer at CJ, you’ll have the benefit of working in a supportive, highly collaborative and entrepreneurial environment.  A culture of passion and respect and technical excellence and the ownership and accountability of working on a fully self-contained, cross-functional engineering team gives you the ability to grow, make an impact, and get things done.  It’s innovation, done sustainably and intelligently, at scale.Some example projects we have shipped:·         A real-time, high-volume streaming platform used by over 4000 clients[react-js, elastic search, kafka/kinesis, infrastructure-as-code, clojure, scala]·         A high-volume site page analysis tool for automated validation and inspection of publisher websites[node, scala, phantomjs, headless-chrome, kinesis, various-big-data-tech, reactjs]·         A high-volume, OAuth-protected, graphql-based commissioning & activity API[scala, sangria, GraphQL Schema Definition Language, sql, markdown] Professional Experience and Skills·         Accomplished engineer with 5+ years of progressive software design and development experience·         Commitment to automate everything:  build, test, deploy·         Interest in functional programming (Scala, Clojure, Haskell)·         Desire to do XP, full time TDD, your own QA·         SQL/NoSQL·         Experience with JavaScript, and ReactJS also preferred·         Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience  Interested?If you're ready to leverage your proven talent and join CJ Affiliate, we want to speak with you!  Apply now and let's build a world-class product together.   Find out more:engineering.cj.comOur stack: engineering.cj.com/radargithub.com/cjdev  Why CJ Affiliate?
We’re a great place to work! CJ Affiliate offers ideal career development and growth opportunities where you will hone skills in strategic planning aand execution, as well as enhance your negotiation and presentation skills. You will develop partnerships and motivate affiliates, learn technical skills applicable to digital marketing and nearly every other industry, and so much more. CJ Affiliate is a leader because our teams have advanced tools, present creative solutions, execute strategically, and drive high performance. 

Great People, Deserve Great BenefitsWe know that we have some of the brightest and
most talented associates in the world, and we believe in rewarding them
accordingly. If you work here, expect competitive pay, comprehensive health
coverage, and endless opportunities to advance your career.About UsEpsilon® is an all-encompassing global marketing
innovator. We provide unrivaled data intelligence and customer insights,
world-class technology including loyalty, email and CRM platforms and
data-driven creative, activation and execution. Epsilon’s digital media arm,
Conversant, is a leader in personalized digital advertising and insights
through its proprietary technology and trove of consumer marketing data,
delivering digital marketing with unprecedented scale, accuracy and reach
through personalized media programs. Together, we bring personalized marketing
to consumers across offline and online channels, at moments of interest that
help drive business growth for brands. Epsilon employs over 8,000 associates in
70 offices worldwide. For more information, visit www.epsilon.com and follow us on
Twitter @EpsilonMktg.Epsilon is
an Equal Opportunity Employer.  Epsilon’s policy is not to discriminate
against any applicant or employee based on actual or perceived race, color
creed, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender
expression, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, marital status,
medical condition as defined by applicable state law, genetic information,
disability, military service and veteran status, pregnancy, childbirth and
related medical conditions, or any other characteristic protected by applicable
federal, state, or local laws and ordinances.  Epsilon also prohibits
harassment of applicants and employees based on any of these protected
categories. Epsilon
will provide accommodations to applicants needing accommodations to complete
the application process.

About The Engineering Team

						The Engineering Team is organized into several small highly effective, self-organizing, cross functional teams, each with a clear pipeline of software development projects. The team produces rapid delivery of relevant and innovative customer-facing features and products. They are a Lean Software Development shop that practices (XP) Extreme Programming, (TDD) Test Driven Development, Agile/Lean Methodologies and (OOP) Object-oriented Programming.
