            Corporate Trainer



         Login to apply
    
















Corporate Trainer
Toronto, ON 


Yardi’s corporate training team offers high-quality education for new and transferring Yardi employees each year. Corporate trainers primarily focus on new employee onboarding, and continued education. In addition to offering hands-on training classroom trainings, our trainers manage the Yardi Training Services eLearning University and much of the content that is developed for employee onboarding.
When not in a classroom, they are actively involved in Yardi’s continuing education program (Yardi Professional Education otherwise known as YPE), supporting employees throughout their onboarding experience as peer coaches, and providing direct client training as needed. This traveling position is responsible for training throughout North America.
 
RESPONSIBILITIES
Employee Training – Provide hands on training to new and existing employees across all departments and disciplines on industry, accounting, Yardi program, and business processes. Responsible for staying up to date on new products, company direction, and the industry in general. Trainers must be able to quickly assess the strengths and needs of their trainees and adjust the training to accommodate the learner’s needs. Trainers need to speak to groups of employees and clients, speak interpersonally with individuals, report to management, and communicate with IT and HR representatives regularly. Shares technology, product, and industry knowledge; explains problem solving techniques; and provides guidance for communicating with clients.  
Employee Management – Trainers are expected to serve as the immediate supervisor of the trainees during the classroom training phase. They must be able to model positive behaviors, set expectations, motivate, counsel, and follow up with trainees when needed. Collaborates with management team and uses positive influence to effectively navigate employee concerns as well as diverse team and department needs. Uses judgement to recommend new employee placement.
Client Training and Support –Responsible for training and supporting clients onsite, at conferences, and via phone; researches, analyzes and resolves software functionality and reporting problems for clients. 
Instructional Design – Trainers are expected to research, test, compile, and consolidate information into a format from which trainees can learn. Whether it be an instructor-led presentation, a document, eLearning course, or video, the training they produce must be accurate and formatted in a way that trainees can develop knowledge and new software skills.  Advises and institutes best practices relevant to clients in the application of Yardi products.
 
EDUCATION/QUALIFICATIONS/EXPERIENCE

Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Finance, Math, or Computer/Engineering Sciences or equivalent experience in the property management industry
Five plus (5+) years of experience in software or business process consulting or equivalent.  Consulting experience interacting with customers.
Three (3) years of experience managing projects on accounting, business process, property management, or real estate software
Experience in ERP systems
Experience positively  influencing clients, peers and management
Experience independently managing and resolving a variety client issues

 
REQUIRED SKILLS/ABILITIES

Proven ability engage and transfer knowledge with long lasting results
Proven excellent written and verbal communication skills
Proven client-centered commitment and focus
Proven strong ability to meet critical deadlines and prioritize multiple tasks in a fast-paced environment
Collegial, team-oriented disposition with the desire and ability to establish cooperative working relationships with employees at all levels within Yardi, outside of Yardi, and with clients
In depth knowledge of property management industry and Yardi’s competitors

 
DESIRED SKILLS/ABILITIES

Yardi domain experience
Experience in corporate training or equivalent, instructional design and coaching
Industry expertise in property management and accounting principles


Although we review each application submitted for this position, due to the large number of applications we receive, only candidates under consideration will be contacted.
Yardi is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to inclusive, barrier-free recruitment and selection processes.  If contacted for an employment opportunity, please advise if you require accommodation at any stage of the recruitment process.
 
*cs

Privacy Overview

This website uses cookies so that we can provide you with the best user experience possible. Cookie information is stored in your browser and performs functions such as recognising you when you return to our website and helping our team to understand which sections of the website you find most interesting and useful.
You can adjust all of your cookie settings by navigating the tabs on the left hand side.



 
Strictly Necessary Cookies

Strictly necessary cookies must be enabled at all times in order to login and apply to openings.



disable









If you disable this cookie, we will not be able to save your preferences and you will not be able to login to apply for openings. This means that every time you visit this website you will need to enable or disable cookies again.







3rd Party Cookies

This website uses Google Analytics to collect anonymous information such as the number of visitors to the site, and the most popular pages.
Keeping this cookie enabled helps us to improve our website.



disable









Please enable Strictly Necessary Cookies first so that we can save your preferences!

Referral Development Manager  (92602) - Memphis, TN - Inogen, Inc. Jobs








 














Home
Jobs




Referral Development Manager  (92602) - Memphis, TN

Toggle navigation








Referral Development Manager  (92602) 

JobsLogin 












 RDM Sales Memphis, TN, USA Full Time 



Email Me Similar Jobs Email Me This Job



ABOUT INOGEN Inogen was founded in 2001 to improve quality of life and increase freedom and independence for oxygen therapy users. Inogen is innovation in oxygen therapy. The Inogen mission is to improve freedom and independence for oxygen therapy patients through innovative products and services. Inogen is a manufacturer and Accredited Homecare Provider.
Inogen is focused on quality care, continuous improvement, and outstanding customer satisfaction. We are a stable, USA based company dedicated to providing an exciting and rewarding career to our employees. We completed a successful Initial Public Offering on the NASDAQ in 2014 and have demonstrated substantial growth over the last five years. Our work environment is casual yet high performing, and we are looking for seriously talented, motivated, and fast-paced professionals to join our team.
JOB DESCRIPTION 
The Referral Development Manager (RDM) calls on physicians and discharge planners, winning patient referrals for Inogen. Works to increase marketplace adoption of Inogen products, while exceeding customer expectations and providing a consistently high level of service. The RDM is an Inogen product and clinical applications expert and operates in close collaboration with other Referral Development Managers and the National Sales Director to achieve corporate sales objectives.
Key Competencies:
Procure new oxygen patient referrals to meet/exceed sales targets.
Represent/promote Inogen product and services to referral community.
Meet/exceed monthly sales call targets.
Deliver/set up equipment when necessary.
Keep detailed records of all sales activities and customer interactions.
Provide/execute territory sales plan, including strategic and tactical approaches that will result in successful outcomes.
Maintain regular and punctual attendance. 
Comply with all company policies and procedures. 
Assist with any other duties as assigned.
Do you possess these abilities?
Excellent presentation skills required.
Oxygen referral experience with proven track record required.
Must be a self-starter and deliver results with limited oversight.
Experience working with the 65+ demographic a plus.
Proven track record of successful team participation is required.
Successful experience in identifying new referral opportunities desired.
Must have strong work ethic.
Excellent oral and written communication skills required. 
Attention to detail is required. 
Effective conflict resolution. 
Analytical & problem-solving skills & ability to multi task. 
Solutions-oriented problem solver. 
Excellent planning, communication and organizational skills.
Requirements:
Associate degree in Sales, Technical, Business, Clinical, or related field of study, preferred. 
Clinical background/licensure (RT, RN), preferred.
2-3 years medical referral sales experience, required. 
Basic knowledge/proficiency in Microsoft Office, required.
A combination of training, education and experience that is equivalent to the qualifications listed above and that provides the required knowledge, skills, and abilities.
 
WHY INOGEN Inogen is a dynamic company that is not only focused on quality care of patients, but is also committed to being a top employer.  Each of Inogen' s offices have a casual culture that supports employees being responsible and developing professionals.
We offer competitive salaries and a robust benefit package:
Employee Stock Purchase Plan 401 (K) plan available for all employees Health, dental, vision insurance Flexible spending accounts and wellness discount program Life Insurance Long Term Disability Robust paid time off and 8 paid holidays Employee Assistance Program
See the Inogen Team in action:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dKoTMeJf5J4
 
Inogen Where we go to work hard to positively impact people's lives
 
Inogen is an equal opportunity employer.  We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other legally protected characteristics. The EEO is the Law poster and its supplement are available here: http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/ofccpost.htm; http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/OFCCP_EEO_Supplement_Final_JRF_QA_508c.pdf.  The pay transparency policy is available here: http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/pdf/EO13665_PrescribedNondiscriminationPostingLanguage_JRFQA508c.pdf. 
Inogen is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities.  If you need a reasonable accommodation because of a disability for any part of the employment process, please send an e-mail to recruiting@inogen.net or call (972) 616-5668 and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information.
 
 

Inogen, Inc.

            Associate Account Executive



         Login to apply
    
















Associate Account Executive
Dallas, TX 


This entry level opportunity as an Associate Account Executive will work to effectively develop a multi-state territory through cold calling prospects, developing a solid sales pipeline and closing sales deals.
Responsibilities include:

Lead generation and qualification
Fielding, qualifying and closing inbound sale inquires
Prospecting and telephone marketing for new prospect clients
Creating, tracking, closing and reporting results of sales opportunities in yCRM
Learn and master company software product offerings
Conducting online presentations and product demonstrations
Communicating via phone and email correspondence with prospective clients
Nurturing sales opportunities through the entire sales cycle to close
Providing information and generating interest in conference participation and other related events
Managing weekly/monthly activity to support sales goals
Work effectively with other teams that support the sales process and client satisfaction 

This position will require the following background and skills: 

Bachelor’s degree
Ability to do high volume cold calls and develop leads
Ability to generate a sales pipeline and close sales
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Superior phone skills
Technical aptitude and the ability to successfully demonstrate software
Ability to show product features and benefits
High level of professionalism and ethics
Ability to manage multiple priorities in a fast paced environment
A background in software sales, web ads sales, accounting systems, or experience in the property management industry highly desirable but not required

At Riptide, we are a small team looking to make a big impact.




  





We are looking for individuals who love a start-up pace, can wear multiple hats and are self-starters. If you like seeing your hard work provide high value results for customers, join us at Riptide.






  





Open Positions


BMS Software Technician


What You’ll Do:
A BMS/BAS Software Technician works directly with the Riptide project team. Activities will include project configuration, programming, startup, troubleshooting, commissioning and service. Hands-on activity may involve minor wiring (low-voltage) and panel fabrication.
We are looking for individuals who love a start-up pace, can wear multiple hats and are self-starters. If you like seeing your hard work provide high value results for customers, join us at Riptide.
Functions and Responsibilities include the following:

Manage multiple projects and communicating status and/or risks to project team.
Building systems integration and configuration.
Commissioning, graphics, programming, test and startup.
First level support including investigating issues and implementing corrective action. 

Technical Skills:

Basic knowledge of BACnet and Modbus communication protocols.
Basic knowledge of control programming and graphics for control systems.
Basic knowledge of field wiring and terminations.
Basic knowledge of HVAC systems and temperature controls (DDC).

Qualifications:

Familiarity with the concepts of new construction, retrofit and service projects.
Knowledge of the principles of heating and air conditioning and major components.
Understanding of the basics of HVAC controls (DDC)
Strong troubleshooting skills.
Understanding of electricity and electrical principles.

Experience:

HVAC installation & service: 2 years (Required)
BMS/BAS/DDC controls programming: 1 year (Preferred)

Education: Associate (Preferred)
Job Type: Full-time
Location: Santa Barbara, CA (Required)


Sales Engineer West Coast, Central and East Coast


Responsibilities

Communicate with customers to solve sales, technical and application matters related to building controls, energy, HVAC and enterprise facility management
Anticipate and respond to customers to ensure overall customer satisfaction with Riptide’s product and service offerings
Build and foster relationships with strategic partners
Generate proposals from a range of work documents
Accompany sales team on technical visits to end-user and partner sites
Create technical sales and training presentations
Work with HVAC partners to develop controls strategies and KPI’s
Manage pilot projects for new customers, and refine the process as you go – creating a best practices guide for future pilots
Pilot project management includes working with the end-user to identify pilot locations; working with the end-user to determine success plan for pilots; working with internal services group to hire installation contractors; manage installation and start-up of the pilot project; training contractors and end-users; and periodically reporting the status of the installed project to the end-user as well as tracking project success

Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree in Mechanical Engineering (or equivalent) and preferably a minimum of 1-3 year experience in a similar role or 5+ year experience in building controls, HVAC
Proficiency with PowerPoint, Word, and Excel
IT savvy; networking experience a plus
Comfortable building documents using Visio or similar vector graphing tools
Ability to read blueprints and complete on-site surveys
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Ability to problem solve and succeed in unstructured environment
Fearless, self-reliant, and highly self-motivated personality with great time management skills and a focus on consistent execution



Interns


Looking for engineering or business-focused college students for internships based in Santa Barbara, CA. Depending on your skill set, you will help the executive and product team on projects that drive our growth.
Mechanical Engineering Majors: Students with HVAC courses complete and who have an interest in smart buildings. Best candidates have a background in sales engineering roles or ability to develop technical materials.
Marketing or Business Related Majors: Students with marketing, economics, and journalism who can help apply their skills in these areas: digital marketing, customer relationship management, financial forecasting and/or writing.
Gain experience working with a fast-paced startup, where you can see different functional areas of a business to help you find your area of interest in your future career. For rising seniors, this could lead to a full-time offer post graduation.

If you’re ready to take on a fresh challenge, grow your career and contribute to making the world a safer place, Raytheon is ready to help you achieve your goals. Join our team and get the opportunity and support to find purpose, thrive and succeed.





Notice: Please be aware of suspicious recruiting emails and text messages that attempt to collect your confidential information. Raytheon conducts all electronic correspondence using e-mail addresses that end in “Raytheon.com”, “Raytheon.co.uk”, “Raytheon.com.au” or “brassring.com”. Cloud Infrastructure Section Manager
Dulles, Virginia

Overview

What does it take to make the world a safer place? It takes delivering innovative technology and collaborating with some of the finest talent in the engineering field. Whether you’re a software engineer or a mechanical engineer, at Raytheon you’ll grow a varied and rewarding career. And you’ll be supported with a comprehensive and competitive benefits package that promotes work/life. If you’re ready to take on today’s big challenges, discover a world of opportunity at Raytheon.

America’s Best Large Employers by Forbes
Career & Development Opportunities
Full-time
Entry, Mid, Senior level




Back to Job Navigation (Overview)


Responsibilities


Would you like to work in a collaborative environment at a state of the art facility in Dulles? Then join our Intelligence, Information and Services (IIS) team of smart people solving problems that make the world a safer place and help to secure our great nation! Come support those who provide us with all the freedoms we enjoy. Our facility in Dulles VA offers amenities that create work and life balance. The Dulles site includes 4 modern facilities with 3 industrial buildings.  On site we have a fitness center plus a fun space with a pool table, foosball and video games. Additionally, employee appreciation lunches, bonus opportunities, and great benefits that include medical, dental, vision, 401K match, flexible work schedules, are just a few of the reasons people come to work at Raytheon!   The Intelligence, Information and Services (IIS) Hardware and Infrastructure (HW&I) Engineering team has an immediate professional opening for a Cloud Infrastructure Engineering Section Manager (SM). The individual is responsible for leading a team of 10-20 Electrical Engineers and work products through the systems lifecycle. The SM is expected to ensure work and work products assigned to their section are completed on time and on budget and continuously improve their ability to accomplish the assigned work. The SM is also expected to participate in proposals, roadmap development and growth of the products and section.This position is eligible for a Sign on Bonus of up to 40k for a candidate with a current TS/SCI that can be verified and hired at Raytheon.Other relevant responsibilities include:Demonstrate that the section is effectively executing work to deliver on-budget, on-time, correct, high-quality, complete work products, utilizing IPDS-based Engineering work packages and productivity measuresDemonstrate the development of staff to meet the needs of the Hardware and Infrastructure training planDemonstrate measurable Execution and Bidding productivity goals for every program on which the section has Engineering contentDirect line management activities for employees in the Section, including performance management, career development and resource allocationWork closely with program managers to ensure customer satisfaction Interface with customers and users to build relationships and develop roadmaps and product ideas for meeting their needsRapidly respond to customer RFIs and RFPs to shape customer acquisition strategiesParticipation in proposal processes to develop and review cost estimates/proposals packagesProvide leadership to integrated product teams (IPTs) with responsibility for the design development of one or more section products. Is a member of the next higher tier team which develops detailed program plans, statements of work (SOW), schedules, budgets, and Integrated Master Plans (IMP)/Integrated Master Schedules (IMS)Maintain a professional attitude, to serve as an example to the team, with team members, internal and external customersWork closely with the Department Manager in support of IIS goals/objectivesRequired Skills: Ability to provide technical direction to the HW&I team for design and implementation activities using COTS-based solutionsKnowledge of both traditional and private/public cloud infrastructure designsExperience adopting and implementing DevOps tools and processes (Infrastructure build automation, container orchestration, continuous integration pipelines)Skilled at leading and directing activities of direct report staffEVMS certificationProject management experienceExperience developing detailed infrastructure design artifactsAbility to obtain US Government TS/SCI Security Clearance and US Citizenship required (US citizenship required).Desired Skills: Very strong organizational and team development skillsExcellent oral and written communication skillsExperience developing and managing product line artifactsAn active DoD or federal agency TS/SCI clearanceEducation Requirements: Requires a degree in Science, Technology, Engineering or Mathematics (STEM) and 10 years of related work experienceThis position requires a U.S. Person who is eligible to obtain any required Export Authorization  152817
Business Unit Profile
                        
                        Intelligence, Information and Services delivers innovative technology to make the world a safer place. Our expertise in cyber, analytics and automation allow us to reach beyond what others think is possible to underpin national security and give our global customers unique solutions to solve the most pressing modern challenges -- from the cyber domain to automated operations, and from intelligent transportation and training solutions to creating clear insight from large volumes of data. IIS operates at nearly 550 sites in 80 countries, and is headquartered in Dulles, Virginia. The business area generated $6.2 billion in 2018 revenues. As a global business, our leaders must have the ability to understand, embrace and operate in a multicultural world -- in the marketplace and the workplace. We strive to hire people who reflect our communities and embrace diversity and inclusion to advance our culture, develop our employees, and grow our business.

Rewards




401(k) / Retirement Plans
Employer Matching, if you elect to enroll company matches up to 3%.



Work / Life Balance
Raytheon supports a variety of flexible work arrangements including compressed work weeks, flextime, job sharing, 9/80, reduced hours and telecommuting.



Career Development
At Raytheon, we foster an inclusive culture of professional development. We support a variety of developmental opportunities including: Mentoring programs, Skills Development, Leadership Development, Rotational job assignments, and Continuous Improvement, all of which contribute to advancement of our employee’s capabilities.



Paid Time Off
Accrue paid time off monthly. Receive 10-12 holidays per year with some locations shutting down the week between Christmas and New Year’s Day.



Relocation Assistance
Select technical positions are eligible for relocation packages. See specific job description for eligibility requirements.



Parental Leave
Raytheon offers all eligible employees up to three weeks paid parental leave for the birth or adoption of a child (separate from paid maternity leave or Family & Medical Leave Act).

Inside Medical Sales Representative - Cleveland, OH (93283) - Cleveland, OH - Inogen, Inc. Jobs

Inside Medical Sales Representative - Cleveland, OH (93283) - Cleveland, OH

Toggle navigation








Inside Medical Sales Representative - Cleveland, OH (93283) 

JobsLogin 












 Sales Cleveland, OH, USA Full Time 



Email Me Similar Jobs Email Me This Job



ABOUT INOGEN Inogen was founded in 2001 to improve quality of life and increase freedom and independence for oxygen therapy users. Inogen is innovation in oxygen therapy. The Inogen mission is to improve freedom and independence for oxygen therapy patients through innovative products and services. Inogen is a manufacturer and Accredited Homecare Provider.
Inogen is focused on quality care, continuous improvement, and outstanding customer satisfaction. We are a stable, USA based company dedicated to providing an exciting and rewarding career to our employees. We completed a successful Initial Public Offering on the NASDAQ in 2014 and have demonstrated substantial growth over the last five years. Our work environment is casual yet high performing, and we are looking for seriously talented, motivated, and fast-paced professionals to join our team.
JOB DESCRIPTION 
Provides inside sales of Inogen products to oxygen patients through outgoing and incoming phone and email contact.  Generates new business from incoming multi-media lead sources.  Fields technical product questions and assures that customer's needs are expeditiously addressed.  Operates in collaboration with other Customer Development Representatives to achieve corporate sales objectives. Works to increase marketplace adoption of Inogen products, while exceeding customer expectations and providing a consistently high level of service.
Key Competencies:
Receive, track and telemarket patient leads generated by television, print and internet channels.
Make outgoing sales calls.  Transition leads through first point of contact to ultimate sale of Inogen's oxygen concentrator products.  Create strategic call plans to support sales activities. 
Answer incoming customer calls, emails and requests for information.  
Collaborate with Inogen personnel to transition secondary leads to DME provider partners
Meet or exceed call volume quotas and sales targets
Promote Inogen within the clinical and patient communities
Perform CRM data population of customer contacts, leads, tasks and call information
Track performance metrics and generate sales reports, as requested
Enter sales orders, process credit card payments and facilitate execution of leasing docs and pricing approvals as needed
Log and document customer suggestions for product improvements.  Record resolutions in CRM  and build out knowledge base for future reference
Contribute to continuous improvement of service to customers
Assist in execution of customer and/or product surveys to improve service and products delivered to market
Maintain regular and punctual attendance. 
Comply with all company policies and procedures. 
Assist with any other duties as assigned. 
Do you possess these abilities?
Must have strong work ethic.
Excellent oral and written communication skills required. 
Attention to detail is required. 
Solutions-oriented problem solver. 
Impeccable phone etiquette 
Must have proven track record of successful team participation as well as ability to work independently and self-start
Must self-motivate and deliver results with limited oversight
Must be motivated to achieve results based upon earnings opportunity
Requirements:
Associate degree in Business, English, Communications, or related field of study, required.  
3-5 years sales/customer service experience, required. 
Intermediate knowledge/proficiency in Microsoft Office, required.
A combination of training, education and experience that is equivalent to the qualifications listed above and that provides the required knowledge, skills, and abilities.
 
WHY INOGEN Inogen is a dynamic company that is not only focused on quality care of patients, but is also committed to being a top employer.  Each of Inogen' s offices have a casual culture that supports employees being responsible and developing professionals.
We offer competitive salaries and a robust benefit package:
Employee Stock Purchase Plan 401 (K) plan available for all employees Health, dental, vision insurance Flexible spending accounts and wellness discount program Life Insurance Long Term Disability Robust paid time off and 8 paid holidays Employee Assistance Program
See the Inogen Team in action:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dKoTMeJf5J4
 
Inogen Where we go to work hard to positively impact people's lives
 
Inogen is an equal opportunity employer.  We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other legally protected characteristics. The EEO is the Law poster and its supplement are available here: http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/ofccpost.htm; http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/OFCCP_EEO_Supplement_Final_JRF_QA_508c.pdf.  The pay transparency policy is available here: http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/pdf/EO13665_PrescribedNondiscriminationPostingLanguage_JRFQA508c.pdf. 
Inogen is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities.  If you need a reasonable accommodation because of a disability for any part of the employment process, please send an e-mail to recruiting@inogen.net or call (972) 616-5668 and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information.

Sales Operations and Development Representative - (0104955) General Purpose of Job:Support the Business Development leadership and sales teams with tasks essential to fostering insight, analysis and generating new business demand for prospective CJ Affiliate advertiser and agency clients.  This is a highly visible position that entails multi-tasking in a fast-paced environment, working cross-functionally with CJ and sister Alliance Data companies, and provides critical support to CJ’s New Business Development group to continuously drive revenue and meet the needs of our business.Principle Duties and Responsibilities:Sales Operations      Compile and analyze data to recognize competitor trends and implement solutions to increase competitive landscape awarenessManage and maintain competitor details such as rates, discounts, rebates and other relevant informationProvide administrative and special project support to new business development leadership and salespersonsAssemble, consolidate and review weekly/monthly sales ops reporting prior to delivery to the Business Development leadership team (ie. BD activity, prospect communications and internal campaign trafficking)Additional sales operations and administration projects as they may ariseDemand GenerationThe Demand Generation is a critical part of the roll will focus on reaching out to new potential clients and gaining enough of their interest to continue working with our sales team. You’ll be well rewarded for your efforts and there is expectation that success will provide further opportunity to grow within the new business development team.  Successful candidates will be able to:Think and act strategically to find relevant potential clients and develop new sources for where to find themFind relevant contact information for leads via online resources including but not limited to LinkedInContinuously maintain and update Salesforce.com CRMIdentify, develop relationships, and schedule meetings with both named and unnamed prospect accounts in direct support of sales team membersPartner to create targeted marketing campaigns for the new business teamsStrategize with top-producing sales persons to target prospect accounts to fill pipeline and develop overall skillset for generating qualified meetingsCreate strategic emails to target prospect accountsPartner with marketing to create targeted demand generation campaigns for the sales teamSupport event marketing team to generate demand for CJ sponsored eventsSkills and ExperienceAmbitious, nimble, unselfish, tenacious and smartMust have strong verbal and written skills in combination with a strong consultative and professional business acumenCold-calling experience preferredDetail-oriented with strong attention to follow-through and comfortable with deadlinesA self-starter with a track record of successful, credible achievementsPrevious experience in sales development, operations, and/or direct sales (a plus but not required)Bachelor’s Degree Required0-5 years experience   Why CJ Affiliate?CJ Affiliate is the leader in Affiliate Marketing. We take pride in our
innovative technology, comprehensive data solutions and our people. We equip
our teams with advanced tools, training and career development opportunities
all to provide cutting edge solutions, strategies and support to deliver high
quality results for our clients. We work in an energetic, results-oriented,
collaborative, team environment that recognizes exceptional performance. As we
evolve and grow as a business, so do you. 
Great People, Deserve Great BenefitsWe know that we have some of the brightest and most talented associates in the
world, and we believe in rewarding them accordingly. If you work here, expect
competitive pay, comprehensive health coverage, and endless opportunities to
advance your career.About UsEpsilon® is an all-encompassing global marketing innovator. We provide
unrivaled data intelligence and customer insights, world-class technology
including loyalty, email and CRM platforms and data-driven creative, activation
and execution. Epsilon’s digital media arm, Conversant, is a leader in
personalized digital advertising and insights through its proprietary
technology and trove of consumer marketing data, delivering digital marketing
with unprecedented scale, accuracy and reach through personalized media
programs. Together, we bring personalized marketing to consumers across offline
and online channels, at moments of interest that help drive business growth for
brands. Epsilon employs over 8,000 associates in 70 offices worldwide. For more
information, visit www.epsilon.com and
follow us on Twitter @EpsilonMktg.Epsilon is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Epsilon’s policy is not to
discriminate against any applicant or employee based on actual or perceived
race, color creed, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender
identity, gender expression, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status,
marital status, medical condition as defined by applicable state law, genetic
information, disability, military service and veteran status, pregnancy,
childbirth and related medical conditions, or any other characteristic
protected by applicable federal, state, or local laws and ordinances. Epsilon
also prohibits harassment of applicants and employees based on any of these
protected categories.Epsilon will provide accommodations to applicants needing accommodations to
complete the application process.

            Software Development Engineer I



         Login to apply
    
















Software Development Engineer I
Santa Barbara, CA 


Under immediate supervision, the Software Development Engineer I analyzes, modifies and debugs existing applications.  Responsibilities also include testing, communicating and implementing defect resolutions.
ESSENTIAL RESPONSIBILITIES

Modifies, implements, and maintains an existing application to established standards, specifications and approved changes.  Performs maintenance programming for existing versions.  Uses corporate approved CRM systems to track cases, defects and resolutions.  Explains defect resolutions to the Team Leader.  Uses corporate approved integrated development environment (e.g., Visual Studios, Eclipse) to implement defect resolutions. 
Performs unit testing on his/her defect resolutions to ensure accuracy, integrity, interoperability and completeness to achieve desired results.  Analyzes and documents reasons for test failures, and revises/debugs assigned programs and/or procedures as necessary.
Learns and increases knowledge of a single domain and best practices.  Expands technical and industry expertise.     
Uses corporate approved sourced control applications (e.g., Microsoft Team Foundations) to maintain code changes. 
Adheres to Department policies, procedures and standards in the development and implementation of software.

EDUCATION/QUALIFICATIONS/EXPERIENCE DISTINCTIONS

Bachelor’s Degree in Computer/Engineering Science or equivalent experience 

REQUIRED SKILLS/ABILITIES

Independent problem solving and analysis skills
Clear, effective verbal and written communication skills
Good time management skills
Ability to meet critical deadlines and prioritize multiple tasks in a fast-paced environment
Collegial, team-oriented disposition with the desire and ability to establish cooperative working relationships with employees at all levels within Yardi, outside of Yardi, and with clients

 DESIRED SKILLS/ABILITIES (One or more of the following)

Familiarity with one of the following computer programming language (VB.NET, Java, Java Script, C#)
Experience with relationship databases (SQL Server, Oracle)
Experience with accounting systems
Experience with Web applications
Understanding of property management industry

 Privacy Overview

Privacy Overview

This website uses cookies so that we can provide you with the best user experience possible. Cookie information is stored in your browser and performs functions such as recognising you when you return to our website and helping our team to understand which sections of the website you find most interesting and useful.
You can adjust all of your cookie settings by navigating the tabs on the left hand side.



 
Strictly Necessary Cookies

Strictly necessary cookies must be enabled at all times in order to login and apply to openings.



disable









If you disable this cookie, we will not be able to save your preferences and you will not be able to login to apply for openings. This means that every time you visit this website you will need to enable or disable cookies again.







3rd Party Cookies

This website uses Google Analytics to collect anonymous information such as the number of visitors to the site, and the most popular pages.
Keeping this cookie enabled helps us to improve our website.



disable









Please enable Strictly Necessary Cookies first so that we can save your preferences!

Sonos I Sr ERP Implementation Program Manager I Santa Barbara

Sonos

                      Apply for this job online


Share it:








































Sr ERP Implementation Program Manager

Department:
              Business Operations
            
Location:
              Boston, Santa Barbara
            

Req#:
              5717
            

We are looking for an experienced and dynamic Sr ERP Implementation Program Manager to join the New Initiatives and Infrastructure team at Sonos.  As the ERP Program Leader, your goal is to change the trajectory of the business by leading a high performing program team across finance, operations, and supply chain to effectively and efficiently deliver our ERP implementation leveraging the right balance of experience, schedule and cost goals. You will have a bias to action, supported by critical thinking and personal skills that make you an exceptional role model and team member. In addition, the ideal candidate must have the ability to translate complex issues and program inter-dependencies into simple to understand and actionable plans that ensure execution excellence.  Track record of identifying and resolving project and program issues effectively. Must be comfortable working with a diverse group of Business Leads, Senior Executives, Project Managers, implementation partners and global teams. We’re looking for the best of the best to lead Sonos Infrastructure and Enterprise Transformation Programs – can you handle that responsibility? If you can, we’d love to hear from you!




About You


More than a candidate that checks every box, we’re looking for people who are excited to work, learn, and grow at Sonos—no matter their background or how they identify. If that’s you, we hope you’ll apply for this role.
You want to be part of a team.
You come with new ideas and a unique point of view. You look forward to collaborating with a diverse team of individuals. You assume everyone’s best intentions, welcome a healthy debate, and embrace differing opinions. You eagerly seek and give help. Transparency tops your list of values, and you proactively contribute to a culture of respect and inclusion.
You enjoy a challenge.
Inquisitive and focused, you see every challenge as an opportunity. You’re ambitious and comfortable making mistakes because you learn from them and bounce back quickly. You would rather create the future than wait for it. You prioritize long-term value over short-term objectives.
You love to listen.
You approach every interaction with curiosity and a desire to understand. You want to make a positive impact in the world. You’re passionate about culture and know the power that music, film, podcasts, games, and stories have to bring people together.


What You’ll Do 

Manage at a program level to drive all phases of the functional/technical implementation of the program from the planning to post go-live, ensuring the accomplishment of desired scope, timeline and quality.Strategic and tactical program communications.  Provide the necessary information to the right people at the right time.  Will own the overall approach to program level communications across in the internal Sonos team, senior Sonos leadership and key partners.Partner with workstream leads, business leaders and ERP technical leads to help develop program strategy, roadmap development, requirements management processes – including feature definition and estimation, technical delivery processes, testing and training. Influences ERP delivery roadmap by determining priorities, estimating work effort with project managers and the Engineering team, tracking progress against deliverables.Provide coaching and mentoring to ERP work stream leads and assist across planning scope, schedule, risk, stakeholder management, cross team collaboration and synchronization of effort to drive project outcomes.Good functional knowledge and ability to analyze the effectiveness of business operations and identify opportunities for improvement while evangelizing ERP best practices.Track performance of third-party vendors, to help ensure they provide the required level of resources, support, assist with the creation of SOW’s and ensure successful project execution. Lead meeting presentations with stakeholders to move forward key tasks and escalate significant process bottlenecks, anticipated delays and critical path analysis.  Plan and guide post-implementation activities such as post-live support and training.

Skills You’ll Need

Basic Qualifications:8+ years experience as a fully empowered program or product manager for complex enterprise programs, particularly ERP scale initiatives, and several years of experience in providing strategy, vision, and direction cross functionally.Strong track record of creating empowered, agile program teams with proper oversight and communication to enable fast decision making. Proven track record of coaching and developing people and teams - especially in globally diverse, fast-paced, dynamic, and demanding environments. Preferred Qualifications:Strong business process, technical orientation, or Engineering backgroundWorking knowledge of standard program management methodologies and tools preferred with a strong leaning towards AgileConsumer electronics and/or direct to consumer experienceStrong collaboration and experience communicating and influencing at the highest level of an organization

More About Sonos


Sonos is a sound experience company. We pioneered multiroom wireless audio, made it sound amazing, and changed the way people listen, making it effortless for them to enjoy what they want, where they want, how they want.
Today we continue empowering listeners by developing new technologies, thoughtfully designing products, expanding our software platform, and crafting brilliant sound experiences while participating in a culture that values respect, transparency, collaboration, and ownership.
Together we’re working to positively impact the world and inspire everyone to listen better—because listening brings people together, builds understanding, drives change, and makes us happier.
Notice to European Job Applicants: Information you submit as a part of your job application will be used in accordance with Sonos EU Job Applicant Privacy Notice.
Notice to U.S. Job Applicants: Sonos is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other legally protected characteristics.
Follow the links to review the EEO is the Law poster and its supplement. The pay transparency policy is available here. Sonos is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities. If you need a reasonable accommodation because of a disability for any part of the employment process, please send an e-mail to accommodations@sonos.com and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information.

Rewards





401(k) / Retirement Plans
Watch your financial wellness grow. Enrollment eligibility begins on your first day of work with an employer match up to 3%.




Performance Recognition
Be recognized and recognize others with our new employee awards program. At Raytheon, we appreciate notable and exceptional performance.




Work / Life Balance
Raytheon appreciates work/life balance. Employees can work 9 hours a day every week and receive every other Friday off*
* Requires departmental/manager approval; Interns/Co-ops in California may not be eligible to participate.





Student Loan Repayment Contribution
Through the 401(k), called the Raytheon Savings and Investment Plan, the company will make a dollar for dollar contribution for amounts employees spend repaying their student loans, up to their maximum match percentage.





Educational Assistance
Our educational assistance program provides reimbursement for approved courses and accredited certificate/degree programs relevant to your position. Full-time employees are eligible for up to $10,000 in assistance each year.





Paid Time Off
Accrue paid time off monthly. Receive 12 holidays per year including the week between Christmas and New Year’s Day.





Relocation Assistance
Select technical positions are eligible for relocation packages. See specific job description for eligibility requirements.





Parental Leave
Raytheon offers all eligible employees up to three weeks paid parental leave for the birth or adoption of a child (separate from paid maternity leave or Family & Medical Leave Act).




Back to Job Navigation (Rewards)



Responsibilities


National Defense, Cloud Technologies, Agile Development, DevOps, Big Data, Teamwork … Opportunities at Raytheon span the full product development lifecycle, including new capability development as well as sustainment and enhancement of existing deployed systems.Raytheon Intelligence, Information and Services (IIS) in State College, PA is seeking talented Systems-Software Engineers to support classified programs that develop and enhance integrated sensor, signal processing, complex analytics, and big data systems for Intelligence Community customers.  The successful candidate has excellent written and verbal communication skills, works effectively in a team environment, and is flexible & adaptable to respond to customer mission needs.  Come join Raytheon's team of engineers solving problems that make the world a safer place and help to secure our great nation!  Come support those who provide us with all the freedoms we enjoy.  Click here to view a brief video and learn more about Raytheon: https://youtu.be/8B-k34faFAE.About State College, PAState College is a college town, dominated economically and demographically by the presence of the University Park main campus of The Pennsylvania State University, one of the ten largest public universities in the United States. State College provides access to many cultural and athletic activities & events, and yet is only minutes away from rural Pennsylvania country-side. Many Raytheon State College employees enjoy a commute of 15 minutes or less! Click here to view a brief video and learn more about Raytheon State College:  https://youtu.be/f299m09q0FsCompensation & BenefitsWhile benefits may vary based on business unit, location and/or union status, Raytheon employees receive comprehensive benefits as part of a competitive compensation package. Health and wellness plans are available for you and your eligible children. Other benefits include insurance, education assistance, income protection, investment/retirement and work/life programs.Clearance RequirementsThis position requires eligibility to obtain a TS/SCI security clearance.  A current, active TS/SCI or DoD-TS security clearance is highly preferred, and includes a sign-on bonus.   U.S. citizenship is required.Required Skills: This is an entry-level systems-software engineering position.  Recent or upcoming college graduates are welcome to apply.Ability to work effectively on a team of software & systems engineersAbility to generate technical documentationAbility to conduct technical research, document and present resultsStrong interpersonal, communications, organizational, and planning skillsStrong commitment to quality customer service and on-schedule task completionsAbility to manage time and resources to meet deadlines Proficiency with Microsoft OfficeDesired Skills: Active TS/SCI or DoD-TS security clearanceCoursework or experience in systems engineeringCoursework or experience in software engineeringCoursework or experience with Agile Development & Continuous IntegrationCoursework or experience with cloud technologies, including Amazon Web Services (AWS)Direct experience in software development on Linux and/or Windows platformsPrevious internship experience Education Requirements: This position requires a 4-year bachelor's degree in Science, Technology, Engineering or Mathematics (STEM).This position requires either a U.S. Person or a Non-U.S. Person who is eligible to obtain any required Export Authorization. 151291
                    

                        
                     
                               Raytheon is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, age, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected Veteran status.

Senior Regulatory Affairs Specialist  (85569-b) - Goleta, CA - Inogen, Inc. Jobs








 














Home
Jobs




Senior Regulatory Affairs Specialist  (85569-b) - Goleta, CA

Toggle navigation








Senior Regulatory Affairs Specialist  (85569-b) 

JobsLogin 












 RA/QA Goleta, CA, USA Full Time 



Email Me Similar Jobs Email Me This Job



ABOUT INOGEN Inogen was founded in 2001 to improve quality of life and increase freedom and independence for oxygen therapy users. Inogen is innovation in oxygen therapy. The Inogen mission is to improve freedom and independence for oxygen therapy patients through innovative products and services. Inogen is a manufacturer and Accredited Homecare Provider.
Inogen is focused on quality care, continuous improvement, and outstanding customer satisfaction. We are a stable, USA based company dedicated to providing an exciting and rewarding career to our employees. We completed a successful Initial Public Offering on the NASDAQ in 2014 and have demonstrated substantial growth over the last five years. Our work environment is casual yet high performing, and we are looking for seriously talented, motivated, and fast-paced professionals to join our team.
JOB DESCRIPTION 
The Regulatory Affairs Specialist has responsibility for ensuring organizational compliance with quality and regulatory standards for both product and company operations. The position is responsible for supporting the Quality Management System and for ensuring product design efforts are in step with business objectives and applicable government directives.
Key Competencies:
Assist in compiling, submitting, and monitoring reports and responses to regulatory authorities. 
Support regulatory agency inspections and external audits.
Support Operations reporting and trending.
Support the Internal Audit Program as an internal auditor.
Support the Supplier Auditor Program as a supplier auditor, as required.
Provide support in company-wide Quality Management System training activities and provide regulatory expertise, as needed.
Support the Corrective and Preventive Action (CAPA) Program.
Support Kaizen initiatives to introduce improvements throughout the Quality Management System (QMS), as Regulatory Affairs department representative.
Participate in product development activities, including evaluating and advising personnel on regulatory impact throughout product lifecycle stages, ensuring that regulatory standards are understood, that a design control system is in place, that design validation activities are conducted, and that a Design History File (DHF) is maintained to support regulatory submissions.
Participate in transfer of approved product design to Manufacturing to meet market introduction and other key milestone target dates, ensuring that a Device Master Record is in place (specifications, bill of materials, drawings, material specifications, labeling, etc.). 
Participate in the development of manufacturing and inspection/ test procedures, including required validations for final product release.
Participate in change control activities, such as design changes, manufacturing improvements, new supplier introductions, cost reduction initiatives, etc., ensuring that regulatory standards are understood.
Support the external standards management process by ensuring changes to standards and new standards introduced are understood and integrated into device design proactively.
Support post market surveillance (PMS) activities, including customer complaints/ adverse medical event reporting systems, clinical evaluation reports, etc.
Support key business relationships by providing regulatory expertise specific to contract manufacturing, private labeling arrangements, etc.
Assist in obtaining all necessary domestic regulatory registrations, product clearances/ approvals, certifications and in maintaining documentation needed to support ISO, FDA, compliance, allowing for the sale of Inogen products in US, as determined by business objectives, as assigned.
Provide support to the Environmental Management System (ISO 14001).
Maintain regular and punctual attendance. 
Comply with all company policies and procedures. 
Assist with any other duties as assigned.
 
Do you possess these abilities?
Knowledge of ISO 13485, ISO 14971 and FDA regulations.
Knowledge of DMEPOS accreditation requirements.
Experience with DMEPOS/CMS.
Knowledge of ISO 14001.
Experience in Regulatory Affairs and at least one (1) of the following: product development, manufacturing engineering, quality assurance, or production management.
Ability to support external/ internal audits.
Attention to detail and process improvement capabilities.
Excellent skills with database systems and Excel with capability to compile data from various sources to produce useful reports for trending and verifying process improvements.
Familiarity with process improvement concepts (i.e. LEAN Six Sigma).
 
Requirements:
Able to execute at a task + project level independently, able to make decisions independently, and sign-off on in most instances on behalf of Regulatory/QMS function.
Minimal supervision required.
Able to provide Regulatory/QMS support on wide array of Regulatory/QMS related topics.
May be able to mentor/train junior staff members.
May supervise/manage direct reports, as assigned.
Able to lead 3rd party audits and represent Inogen during these audits.
Bachelor's in a Technical Discipline, required.
Master's in Technical Discipline, preferred.
5-7 years of experience, including 3-5 years' experience with class II medical devices, required.
ISO 13485:2016 Lead Auditor Certification and/or ASQ CQA, and/or ASQ CBA, required.
Knowledge of US medical device regulatory requirements. 
Regulatory Affairs Certificate (RAC), preferred. 
A combination of training, education and experience that is equivalent to the qualifications listed above and that provides the required knowledge, skills, and abilities.
WHY INOGEN Inogen is a dynamic company that is not only focused on quality care of patients, but is also committed to being a top employer.  Each of Inogen' s offices have a casual culture that supports employees being responsible and developing professionals.
We offer competitive salaries and a robust benefit package:
Employee Stock Purchase Plan 401 (K) plan available for all employees Health, dental, vision insurance Flexible spending accounts and wellness discount program Life Insurance Long Term Disability Robust paid time off and 8 paid holidays Employee Assistance Program
See the Inogen Team in action:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dKoTMeJf5J4
 
Inogen Where we go to work hard to positively impact people's lives
 
Inogen is an equal opportunity employer.  We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other legally protected characteristics. The EEO is the Law poster and its supplement are available here: http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/ofccpost.htm; http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/OFCCP_EEO_Supplement_Final_JRF_QA_508c.pdf.  The pay transparency policy is available here: http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/pdf/EO13665_PrescribedNondiscriminationPostingLanguage_JRFQA508c.pdf. 
Inogen is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities.  If you need a reasonable accommodation because of a disability for any part of the employment process, please send an e-mail to recruiting@inogen.net or call (972) 616-5668 and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information.
 
 

Inogen, Inc.
https://inogen.applicantpro.com

Sr Systems Engineer II
Dulles, Virginia


Apply





Overview
Responsibilities
Success Profile
Rewards
Trending




Overview

What does it take to make the world a safer place? It takes delivering innovative technology and collaborating with some of the finest talent in the engineering field. Whether you’re a software engineer or a mechanical engineer, at Raytheon you’ll grow a varied and rewarding career. And you’ll be supported with a comprehensive and competitive benefits package that promotes work/life. If you’re ready to take on today’s big challenges, discover a world of opportunity at Raytheon.

America’s Best Large Employers by Forbes
Career & Development Opportunities
Full-time
Entry, Mid, Senior level




Back to Job Navigation (Overview)


Responsibilities


Are you looking for an engineering career that is challenging and satisfying? Then join our Raytheon team of engineers solving problems that make the world a safer place and help to secure our great nation! Come support those who provide us with all the freedoms we enjoy.We offer great benefits that include medical, dental, vision, 401K match, flexible work schedule - just to name a few.  Click here to view a brief video and learn more: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qvbCgKpkEdsRaytheon Intelligence, Information and Services (IIS) delivers innovative technology to make the world a safer place. Our expertise in cyber, analytics and automation allow us to reach beyond what others think is possible to underpin national security and give our global customers unique solutions to solve the most pressing modern challenges -- from the cyber domain to automated operations, and from intelligent transportation solutions to creating clear insight from large volumes of data. IIS operates at nearly 550 sites in 80 countries, including a large presence in Dulles, VA. As a global business, our leaders must have the ability to understand, embrace and operate in a multicultural world -- in the marketplace and the workplace. We strive to hire people who reflect our communities and embrace diversity and inclusion to advance our culture, develop our employees, and grow our business.Job Description:The Raytheon IIS Hardware and Infrastructure Engineering (HW&I) team has a professional opening for a Senior Systems Engineer. This position will perform network and infrastructure engineering tasks pertaining to LAN/data center system design, development, implementation, integration, and troubleshooting activities. The qualified individual should possess knowledge and experience with network technologies, services, operations, and security. The ability to obtain a US Government TS/SCI security clearance is required for this position (US citizenship required).This position is eligible for a Sign on Bonus of up to $40k for a candidate with a current verifiable TS/SCI clearance that is hired by RaytheonRequired Skills:Raytheon is seeking a Senior Systems Engineer who feeds off the challenge of rolling up their sleeves to tackle meaningful problems each and every day, is a passionate and collaborative problem-solver who seeks and gives candid feedback, and values the chance to make an important impact.  6+ years of progressively responsible experience in design, implementation and administration for hardware and systems portfolios.Proficient at building, maintaining, managing and monitoring servers running LinuxWorking technical knowledge of Linux operating systems including RHEL and Ubuntu.Knowledge and experience  of Application and Security protocols, such as Solarwinds, HBSS, Certificates & Tokens, RSA, McAfee SIEM, McAfee SIEM, McAfee IPS/IDS, Rubrik Host Backup System, SAN storage, and Active DirectoryKnowledge and experience in the design, implementation and support of VMware’s product line, including vSphere, vCloud, Director,View and SRM.Experience in working with highly hardened/secure environmentsKnowledge of the concepts and techniques of server architectures, hardware, and software.Expert knowledge of TCP/IP,  DNS, IPSec, GRE tunnels, multicasting and traffic balancing techniques.Expert understanding of Internet routing, BGP, OSPF, Tunneling, Ethernet switching, Linux, and related networking technologiesStrong communicator with the ability to work effectively across multiple business and engineering teamsAdjust quickly to changing priorities and make quick decisions with limited informationHigh level of motivation, self-starter, ability to demonstrate effective project management and completion of complex network tasks with little guidanceExcellent time management skillsHighly valued skill sets:Proficient and self-reliant in at least one modern scripting or programming language such as Python, and Go.Familiarity with systems configuration management, orchestration, and infrastructure as code with tools such as Ansible and/or TerraformFamiliarity with networks Experience with VMWare or KVMExperience with public cloud offeringsExperience as a system administrator for a Splunk cluster, or similar SIEM platformInstall, configure, and maintain a SANInstall, configure, and maintain Active DirectoryEducation: Requires a degree in Science, Technology, Engineering or Mathematics (STEM) and 6 years of related work experience. 150831
Business Unit Profile
                        
                        Raytheon Intelligence, Information and Services delivers innovative technology to make the world a safer place. Our expertise in cyber, analytics and automation allow us to reach beyond what others think is possible to underpin national security and give our global customers unique solutions to solve the most pressing modern challenges -- from the cyber domain to automated operations, and from intelligent transportation and training solutions to creating clear insight from large volumes of data. IIS operates at nearly 550 sites in 80 countries, and is headquartered in Dulles, Virginia. The business area generated $6.2 billion in 2018 revenues. As a global business, our leaders must have the ability to understand, embrace and operate in a multicultural world -- in the marketplace and the workplace. We strive to hire people who reflect our communities and embrace diversity and inclusion to advance our culture, develop our employees, and grow our business.

Rewards




401(k) / Retirement Plans
Employer Matching, if you elect to enroll company matches up to 3%.



Work / Life Balance
Raytheon supports a variety of flexible work arrangements including compressed work weeks, flextime, job sharing, 9/80, reduced hours and telecommuting.



Career Development
At Raytheon, we foster an inclusive culture of professional development. We support a variety of developmental opportunities including: Mentoring programs, Skills Development, Leadership Development, Rotational job assignments, and Continuous Improvement, all of which contribute to advancement of our employee’s capabilities.



Paid Time Off
Accrue paid time off monthly. Receive 10-12 holidays per year with some locations shutting down the week between Christmas and New Year’s Day.



Relocation Assistance
Select technical positions are eligible for relocation packages. See specific job description for eligibility requirements.



Parental Leave
Raytheon offers all eligible employees up to three weeks paid parental leave for the birth or adoption of a child (separate from paid maternity leave or Family & Medical Leave Act).

Head of Global Retail Experience

Department:
              Retail, Sales and Commercial
            
Location:
              Boston, Santa Barbara, Seattle
            

Req#:
              5724
            

At Sonos, our mission is to become the World’s Leading Sound Experience company and partner retailers are a key part of our consumer journey.  The majority of our consumers interact with Sonos through partner retailers, both digitally and in physical stores, prior to purchase to see, listen, and interact with the product.  Making this experience consistent with our premium brand and educational to those new and existing households is a critical priority.In this role as Head of Global Retail Experience, you will be the primary and key interface for all Regional Retail Experience Leads across our 3 regions: The Americas, Europe and the Middle East (EMEA), and Asia-Pacific (APAC) as well as for external partners as it relates to retail strategy and execution.  You will be the point of contact to gather all initiatives across physical and digital retail, including retail displays and e-commerce assets.  You will be responsible for prioritizing those initiatives based on their business and brand impact.  Once prioritized, you will write the brief to give to Global Retail Design to create the solutions that have the maximum impact across markets.  Once the Global Retail Design team delivers the work, you will work with the regional teams on execution to ensure it shows up in market as planned and monitoring its impact as a source of future learning for future projects. Most importantly, in this role, you will be surrounded by a team of people that love to have fun and innovate every single day in a creative environment where your passion can make an impact to our company culture, our business, and our consumers experience. 




About You


More than a candidate that checks every box, we’re looking for people who are excited to work, learn, and grow at Sonos—no matter their background or how they identify. If that’s you, we hope you’ll apply for this role.
You want to be part of a team.
You come with new ideas and a unique point of view. You look forward to collaborating with a diverse team of individuals. You assume everyone’s best intentions, welcome a healthy debate, and embrace differing opinions. You eagerly seek and give help. Transparency tops your list of values, and you proactively contribute to a culture of respect and inclusion.
You enjoy a challenge.
Inquisitive and focused, you see every challenge as an opportunity. You’re ambitious and comfortable making mistakes because you learn from them and bounce back quickly. You would rather create the future than wait for it. You prioritize long-term value over short-term objectives.
You love to listen.
You approach every interaction with curiosity and a desire to understand. You want to make a positive impact in the world. You’re passionate about culture and know the power that music, film, podcasts, games, and stories have to bring people together.


What You’ll Do 

Be the point of contact for the Regional Experience Leads and gather the initiatives and needs across Markets as it relates to Sonos’ business in 3rd Party Retailers. These needs include:Physical Displays:  From Small (One off distribution opportunities) to Medium (Pop Up Retail executions) to large (full display refreshes that are executed every 3-5 yearsE-commerce: Market needs for marketing our brand, new products, and promotions onlineNew distribution: New channels or customers where Sonos is considering sellingPromotions: Gather promotional plans from across the globe, looking for opportunities to consolidate the number of promotions run for maximum effectPricing: Maintain and update an accurate global pricing grid across all market and productsBe the point of contact for global partners as it relates to Retail (Amazon, Google, IKEA etc.) and work in close collaboration with functional Partnership owners across MarketingWith input from a cross-functional team, prioritize those initiatives based on business & brand impact and the capacity of teams to executeWrite briefs for the prioritized initiatives that create plans to have the maximum impact across the globe, looking for common themes and opportunities across marketsPass those briefs to the Global Retail Design organization to be created and ensuring the work produced meets the specifications of the briefPass finished work from Global Retail Design back to the Regional Retail Experience Teams for execution, monitoring execution and impact as input to future briefs.

Skills You’ll Need

At least 8 years of experience in Physical & Digital MarketingA passion for putting the customer at the forefront of our thinking and plansAn ability to influence across the organization.  You communicate strategies and plans clearly and effectively, and show the impact to the Sonos brand and businessTrack record of success driving a business, innovating, and executingStrong interpersonal skills, comfortable working with external partners at all levelsAn understanding of the unique challenges and opportunities across Physical and Digital Retail. You are an expert in both field and familiar with the latest thinkingBachelor’s degree requiredTravel required.  You have stakeholders across the world and you need to be around themLocation based in one of our main US offices - Boston, Seattle, or Santa BarbaraThis position reports to the Vice President of Retail

More About Sonos


Sonos is a sound experience company. We pioneered multiroom wireless audio, made it sound amazing, and changed the way people listen, making it effortless for them to enjoy what they want, where they want, how they want.
Today we continue empowering listeners by developing new technologies, thoughtfully designing products, expanding our software platform, and crafting brilliant sound experiences while participating in a culture that values respect, transparency, collaboration, and ownership.
Together we’re working to positively impact the world and inspire everyone to listen better—because listening brings people together, builds understanding, drives change, and makes us happier.
Notice to European Job Applicants: Information you submit as a part of your job application will be used in accordance with Sonos EU Job Applicant Privacy Notice.
Notice to U.S. Job Applicants: Sonos is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other legally protected characteristics.
Follow the links to review the EEO is the Law poster and its supplement. The pay transparency policy is available here. Sonos is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities. If you need a reasonable accommodation because of a disability for any part of the employment process, please send an e-mail to accommodations@sonos.com and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information.
